reviews.review: Expensive & excellent, but noisy construction. Everything was good from the check in, massage, music, and our couples room atmosphere until the noise from outside construction ruined the whole relaxed experience. Hard to find with taxi, easier with walking from BTS.

Total rejuvenation.... Amazing rejuvenating once first step into Bhawa. Good location, few minutes walk from bts, calm and greenish.I was actively greeted and welcomed by a receptionist. Refreshing towel and drink was totally delicious. Pre treatment procedures are very detailed. My therapist shows her professionalism and caring.Bought a bottle of room diffuser, it's so nice indeed.Definitely will come back to Bhawa spa!

Excellent!. I enjoyed moment while staying at Bhawa.Very friendly, helpful and well-trained staff. Very tranquil and relaxing atmosphere in the heart of Bangkok.Five-star services provided. Price is a little high but worth for what they offer.I'll recommend to those looking for the real spa and hospitality in Bkk.

Spa heaven. Staff is very nice , atmosphere is very clean and harmony deco. We purchased Thai classic touch package and enjoying their sweet November promotion, it's very good deal. Message technic is perfect and they always check out how we feel

Unforgettable moment!. Was recommended from several friends whom already visited Bhawa. There was no doudt about it. Their hospitality was unforgettable from the fisrt entry through the farewell, very impressive!One of their staff come and greeted me at the very beginning of the entrance, leading me to the warm and homey atmosphere, cold towel and refreshing drink were served with beautiful thai orchid... brillion!The receptionist recommended the treatment with registered form, i liked their form which i could mark where i like to concentrate or avoid areas while having massage. Also i can choose my desire massage pressure! It's so detailed!Massage was went through so quick... the therapist was so professional, she did excellent job according to my request.At the end of session, fresh fruit and lemongrass tea was served. I was offered the cadh voucher to buy their products, I didn't buy any due to urgent.While walked back from Bhawa, they have drink, coffee & tea corner as for free! I have to visit them again once time permit.

Wonderful Spa adventure!. Visited the Bhawa Spa again during the August 2016 trip to Bangkok. The spa treatment and the wonderful massage provided by Chan was outstanding. Very relaxing experience with multiple massages, baths, tea, and fresh fruit. I hope to bring my wife to the Bhawa Spa on our next trip together to Bangkok.

Excellence every time. Ever since it has opened I have been visiting BHAWA SPA on a regular basis and I have never missed the opportunity of having a 3-4 hour session in this SPA while in Bangkok. I have never been disappointed. Reservations in advance are definitely recommended, as most of times they are sold out. The whole staff and management are extremely friendly and professional, with lots of attention to details. Over the years they have expanded and added rooms. Now also the annex is completed with a direct access. I would like to thank for the services rendered and I am already looking forward to my next visit.

서비스 최고. 우선 마시지도 굉장히 만족스러웠고 스파 내부의 분위기와 직원분들의 친절함이 좋았습니다. 그리고 스파끝나고 향이 너무 좋아서 바디로션을 샀는데 귀국후 써보니 펌프가 불량이었습니다. 이메일로 그냥 펌프가 불량이었다 라고 알려주었는데 친절하게 대응해 주셨습니다. 다음에는 4시간 짜리 시그니처 프로그램을 신청해보고 싶습니다.Deeply impressed by the hospitality. I bought a body lotion after spa but its pump was impaired. When I sent e-mail to the spa, they replied quickly and gave me satisfiable feedback. Highly recommend this spa for everyone.

Not the best but sure it is good. It is a beautiful place, located at a small alley aorund the corner of Hotel Indigo. Had 100mins aroma oil massage. Masseur's skills are well but her time management is not good, as spent more time at the back, my front is barely touch. Routines on feets are not even, one with a bit more touch on sole and skip the other one. None of toes, fingers or palm been touched. Finishing towel at my back is cold. I think they can do better. I heard from Bhawa investors are from Divana, Bhawa masseur's skills are slightly better but Divana seems to be more consistent

BEST spa in Bangkok that I have ever had in 13 years . Believe in me I love massage, I normally have massage once in two weeks. Every time I come to Bangkok I would go to a spa. This is the best. The atmosphere is very good. No mosquitos and the rooms were very clean. My hubby and I had body massage there. My therapist whose name is "Noo", she did an excellent job. She was very professional in giving me a nice experience. She really used her heart. You know what I mean? Try it! You would love it. While we were waiting I heard MANY people phoned in to book but the entire Saturday was full. So please book in advance.

Lovely Spa!. I did the couples thai massage and it was great, and very interesting. I never had a massage with clothes on and blindfolded with feet against my back- but I left feeling pretty good. It's very cheap and the employees are nice so I would definitely go back.
Back again!. Have been back again and have tried Mother To Be Spa, so far so good. Had get some oil products home during promotion, as well, really good value!
relax experience. after the treatment, feel so relax. alike in heaven. but full booking after. wish could go back again.

Pure Bliss!. My friends and I went here and our expectations were blown away! I had the All About Roses, All About Love treatment and I was not ready to leave. The entire experience was phenomenal and the staff was beyond friendly and accommodating. My therapist really got to work, while painful at times, she got out all the kinks and I left feeling so relaxed and invigorated. The beverages and food they provide are also very tasty. I would fly back to Bangkok just to visit this spa again. Well worth it!
Sit back and relax. Be pampered like royalty and come here to enjoy a higher end kind of relaxation than you'll find elsewhere here in Thailand that is worth every penny or baht if you will.

Relaxing moment. They severed welcome drink upon we arrival. The environment was very relaxing. We booked 3 hours Holy Thai Touch Spa treatment and I fall asleep after body Scrub. I requested they focus on my head and the shoulder. They did a good job. They served fruit and lemon glass tea at the End.

Absolute Indulgence. Great service!! Staff are very attentive. Came solo but they offer a spacious double room for the treatment. Location: PERFECT! at the heart of the city and right next to the hotel (indigo) i was staying; and treatment price are certainly more "friendly" than what Okura (another hotel next door) offers :)

Relax ambience spa in Bangkok. Since the first step you walk-in, a relaxing scent of amora hit in to your nose - feeling like you are in heaven. After sitting down, a herbal welcome drink is served to refresh your day. A smile from receptionists are greeting you, following by a nice massage and ending your day with a fruit's basket with hot herbal drink. Such a wonderful relaxing day that I definately come back again.

Honeymoon massage. We happen to walk in as we were near by and had a few hours to kill. They were so nice and accommodating and we booked the 2.5 hour couples Thai massage. They brought us into a very cute room where we could be together. We had time for a quick shower since it was so hot before putting on the Thai clothing. The Thai massage is no oil and a lot more stretching then a traditional Swedish massage. For me it was great after hours of long flights. Both therapists were wonderful and the price was about a total of $120 USD for both of us. What a great place. We would highly recommend.
Amazing experience. Great massage. Value for money. The hospitality and courtesy of the staff is amazing. It was a very good experience indeed.

Great massage and peaceful ambience . I tried various massage place in Bangkok including health land. Bhawa spa was located near to bts within walking distance. The ambience was quiet and the therapist I had was marvellous! I had the 130mins message. The muscle knots on my shoulders were released. The price range was slightly higher than market rate but it was worth it. I will go back to try out other longer time massage or spa.
Amazing massage!. Best massage of my life, not hat I am the most experienced in this area, but can really recommend. I did the sport heaven version strong, great!

Luxury . My wife and I had an afternoon free in Bangkok and found this massage parlour here on trip advisor. I've had many massages around the world and this might well be the best one I've had thus far. Lovely ambience, really skilled masseuses and an extremely reasonable pricing.Very relaxing, i just wish this was in my home town so i could visit it at least once a week.

A must when in Bangkok!. For me visiting Bhawa Spa is a must when having a stop-over in Bangkok either on the way in or out of Thailand. This spring I had for the third time a wonderful, 3 hours experience of self indulgence by strong and smooth hands. Higly recommended for either to prepare your body and mind for the upcoming vacation or for the return home to the everyday hazzel.They also have an excellent choice of Bhawa branded items for sale for you to bring home for own use or gifts.Bhawa Spa is centrally located and easy to find.Good luck!

Definitely will come back!!! . Conveniently located near Phloechit bts, this spa place is a hidden gem. Love the ambience and tranquility inside. Place is clean and staff are very nice and friendly. Can definitely spend half day there! Oh there are nice fruit/ snacks before, during and after the massage too!

Must Go!!!!!! . This Spa is absolutely beautiful !!!!!!!! We were greeted outside by the women. Inside we were given very delicious tea and a cold towel that smelled so good! This is the first spa I have been to in Thailand in the two weeks I have been here that asked for my health history, the type of pressure I would like to have and the area of my body I would like to avoid or focus more on. The Spa was very very very clean. I had the mediation program which offer a foot soak & scrub, aromatherapy massage and warm aroma bath (the smell made me want to live there forever). Everything was so perfect. I can honestly say after being in Thailand for two weeks, receiving massages just about every single day this was the BEST SPA ! I promise you won't be upset! After our massage they even had fruit and tea served while we waited for our uber in which the women walked us to our car and thank us again. We paid around 2700 baht and it was so worth it !!! I promise I am not hyping you up!

Heavenly.... I read some blogs and noticed that the ownee of this spa house is the (ex?) owner of "Divana spa house". And, certain amount of profit will be used for charity purpose. So, instead of going to "Divana" (I used to go there), I decided to give Bhawa a try.My experience was... "heavenly"! Love the environment, the scents, the services. The massage and body scrub were super nice... so comfortable and relaxing. Price was appropriate and I was happy to spend my time here.I bought bottles of shower gel, cans of body scrub and tubes of handcream backed home as souvenir to my friends. I especially like the scents of amber papaya, lemongrass and olive & earl grey. Will come back very soon.

Amazingggg massage!. My massage was 180 mins but it was so good... I wish it could be longer! I also love the fact that the place was relatively easy to get to (even with public transport). The service and quality of massage was impeccable and absolutely worth the price I am paying. I have nothing to complain about.

Best in Bangkok. How lucky we were to be staying down the street at Oriental Residence as Bhawa Spa is an easy 10 minute walk! From the moment you arrive you know that you have hit the jackpot of spas. Very Professional, gathering and reviewing information on you and their service......my husband and I both had 2 hrs aromatherapy massages with a facial added for me at the end....We avail ourselves to great massages wherever we travel and I can only say that this tops them all - A MUST when in Bangkok. Be sure to call to book early as they fill up - luckily we were there long enough for us to get our appointment a week in advance. I also purchased products at the end of my session. For sure we will return on our next visit! Might look expensive compared to other thai places but worth it!

High quality mother to be massage. I went to this spa given the good reviews on TA and also it's close to the hotel we stayed (Novotel Ploenchit). If you take BTS to Ploenchit you only need to walk around 5-7mins. I am pregnant and I can only do mother to be massage. Even though I can only have massage on the side but not face down, the quality of the massage is really good and relaxing. My husband did the Thai massage which was good too. We were given a nicely decorated private room.They offered a nice cold drink before the massage and also gave you foot bath. After the massage there was fresh fruits and drinks.I really like this quiet little spa house in the middle of this busy area. The price was a little higher than average but definitely worth it.

Excellent Aromatherapy Massage. Bhawa Spa is located just 2 blocks from the Oriental Residence where I was staying, and it is easily accessible by BTS.Cozy atmosphere for a really relaxing experience, I have booked separate sessions for me and my wife by e-mail 2 weeks in advance as recommended by others.My masseuse was professional and attentive to my requests.A little bit expensive but still highly recommended.

Best of thailands hospitality! . I enjoyed bhawa spa with my partner during my visit in january. We made a reservation for 2 with bhawa spa after reading good reviews on trip advisor, and true enough it did not dissapoint! Environment was so relaxing, receptionist was friendly, therapists were experienced and i drifted off into a deep sleep during my 90min session. By the time we got up, we agreed was one of the best massages we've ever had. Worth every penny! We returned again for one last massage before we headed off to the airport on our day of departure. Definately will be visiting again next trip!

Affordable luxury . Good ambiance, good service. Staff are polite. The quality of Thai massage/aromatherapy /herbal compress/hot stone massage (that's what we have tried) depends a lot on the particular masseuse you engage, that means pure luck. However, you won't get a real poor massage there. That means you won't see masseuses talking to each other during treatment or cutting short on the treatment time in Bhawa.Do make your reservation as early as possible. It may get booked up for weeks ahead.
Angelini.w. Visited bhawa spa because recommended by a friend of mine. absolutely impressed with their services, treatments and products. Advance booking is highly required. Will go back again soon.

Great Spa. I have tried their promo spa "Tom Yam" for 210 mins with hot stone. Very relax and advanced environment. Everyone was very polite, the massagist with excellent skill. The only little flaw was their Tom Yam soup was not tasty (only provide with Tom Yam spa), they are spa shop not restaurant indeed, what you expected!

Great experience at reasonable price. I tried to book online but was told the three days I'm in Bangkok were fully booked. However when I call them, they are able to find a three hour slot for us:) Bhawa locates near to the US embassy and Conrad hotel, which is quite convenient. The receptionist is very patient explaining the different type of packages as well as introducing the body scrubs and massage oils. My boy friend's therapist managed to concentrate on the areas he indicated on the information form which is quite professional. I didn't indicate any focus area but my therapist was able to identify my shoulder problem and focus accordingly (thanks Bam!)We had wonderful experience here. Having been to Oasis as well, I'm more impressed by Bhawa for its attending service and more reasonable price. Highly recommend!

Luxurious and serene a spa experience to remember. We tried to book one of their 4-hour signature spa treatments 2 - 3 weeks in advance, of our visit to Bangkok but found they couldn't accommodate us but offered a short treatment period on a different day. We settled for a 2 hour thai massage to shake off the plane seat and put us into the right frame of mind. Your surroundings are dark wood opulence, the dimly lit atmosphere is calm and serene.We had a couples room, but were able to have different varieties on our treatment - which were both essentially thai massages, we got to have our own twist.In summary, it's a luxurious experience, where every detail is well thought-through from the welcome to treatments. Highly recommended.
One of the best . 5 star hotel quality and environment at a reasonable price. Will definitely come back during next visit in Bangkok. Highly recommend!

Good service recovery . I booked aromatherapy oil massages with herbal compress for myself and my husband at Bhawa. The spa is popular so book in advance. We contacted them a week before my planned trip and my desired timeslot was already filled.The spa was tucked away in a small street opposite the U.S. Embassy and a short 5-10mins walk from BTS. Once we entered, we were greeted with a Pandan drink and cold towel which was nice. There were three other couples arriving for the same time slot and they were able to attend to us promptly.The massage room itself was spacious and nicely decorated. But the floor was sticky and oily, likely due to the constant oil treatment it gets which made it a tad icky to walk on especially after a shower. My massage lady was competent and she did refer to the preference form I filled in. But hubby's massage lady didn't seem to give enough emphasis to the problem area he indicated in his form. His massage lady also didn't give him the herbal compress massage which we had booked and paid for. When I highlighted that to the manager, she apologized for the miscomm and to our surprise, she waived the entire cost of both our treatments. I was expecting a discount for the lapse or at most waiver of his treatment. So, kudos for the service recovery!

among three, two had great experience, one had terrible one. i booked this spa for three persons, and I personally had the worst treatment. because a masseuse was bony, which was painful when she just grabbed my shoulder and her massage was very rough(it was the worst massage I have ever had, even street foot massage was 100 times better than this). But my mom and sister said they enjoyed the treatment a lot, actually better than one they had at intercontinental samui. what I can say is it depends on who you have.

Great Spa Experience at an affordable price. The spa is well hidden at a very quite area but right at the heart of Bangkok. Very convenient location right around the Phleon Chit BTS station The property outside and inside is beautiful. I did the Pampering package which includes a scrub/mud and oil massage. The whole experience has been nice. My therapist is really good. I picked "strong" for the pressure although it comes on a bit too harsh on me from time to time. I guess it really varies as I picked "strong as well the other day at Divana Divine and I was completely fine. I can't say I really enjoy the harsh bit which literally pains me quite a lot but I guess that's how they loosen you muscle up. The body mud smells nice and really smooth your skin a lot.One thing to improve is the staff especially the receptionist in general was not as attentive and note to the details as much as what I had experience the other day at Divana Divine. I was a bit surprised that the reception hasn't introduced all these different type of body oil and body mud at all and just ask me to pick what i like. But in general, the whole experience is good and I will recommend to friends who stay at the area.

Amazing! Loved it. Really impressed with this spa! Felt well taken care of from start to finish. I found my masseuse to be excellent. She had me feeling relaxed within minutes of starting the massage. Just the right amount of pressure and she worked a lot on the tension knots in my shoulders. She was very respectful and not once did I feel uncomfortable I immediately booked another session! one of the girls walked me down the dark driveway at the end! Lovely - well worth the money!

Always perfect. on a regular basis I return to Bhawa Spa. it is nice to see that over the years the quality, ambience and service has always been top and impeccable. there are even plans to expand. staff and owners are providing a high level of quality, service and also attention to details is given, my expectations are always met. the staff is always very friendly and attentif, needless to say that I am always warmly welcomed. the therapists are very considered and the massages excellent. people like the place and will return, therefore book in advance. in case you need a suggestion: go for the serene thai pampering.... but there is much more to experience

SPA DAY WITH THE HUBS. I scheduled the Thai experience I think it was called for both my husband and I. It came with a foot scrub, body scrub, Thai massage, and hot compresses. It was about 3 hours long and we booked separate rooms. I was expecting something similar to a Hamam scrub I have gotten in Turkey or Morocco, I should have asked some questions before booking because the scrub was nothing like I expected. It was more of a rub then a take off several layers of dead skin scrub that I am used to. It was pleasant but not fabulous. The Thai massage takes some getting used to for me. It's deep (or at least it feels deep) and I felt like I never really relaxed because I was bracing myself for painful pressure. I asked several times for the masseuse to lighten up but she never got it quite right for my comfort zone. What can I say, I am a novice and a wuss I guess. The hot compresses were really nice after the massage, I really relaxed during that treatment. The treatment room was very clean and stocked with all the necessary amenities down to a safe for valuables. My husband enjoyed his treatment but he's also a go along to get along kinda guy.

good oil massage and natural oil!. They have nice and various oil for oil massage.And the service there is nice, you will be relaxed after it.We choose different oil and all of them make us feel comfortable and relaxed.You can choose higher price set for different kinds of massage.They really have various of massages!

Beautiful spa & amazing massage. I'm a self proclaimed spa snob so my expectations are high. Bhawa Spa was wonderful! We didn't make reservations ahead but I think it's recommended. The beautiful woman took us in and accommodated us. Tea & cool towel upon arrival was a special touch that made you feel welcomed. Me & husband picked 'Meditation' massage and shared a beautiful room. Therapists had great touch. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone and if I'm ever back in Bangkok I'll book a full spa day here.

I got more than what I came for !. I am just like everybody else, try to select a nice spa for myself. Today I got more than what I came for - a kind heart in a beautiful women, my massage therapist. She never tried to "fawn over me" through few hours session, just simply being herself. She wrapped me up like a baby and double checked few times if I still feel cold after body scrub; She did not want me go into the shower until hot water coming out; She brought back the hot herb balls for my aching neck & back while she braided my hair because I told her earlier I really love her braided hairstyle even when my session was done (11pm). She just warmed my heart and I know I am not the only one.

Repeat offender :). Best spa in Bangkok!! Always my favorite spa, just the best spa in town. Nice location, great therapists, and soothing atmosphere. Very reasonable prices. You can see how strong their daily management is, everything runs so smoothly. A quiet little oasis in the hustle bustle of BKK!!

The Epitome of Luxury. I went to Bhawa Spa with a friend, with the sole intention of being pampered until I couldn't decipher between reality or fantasy and they really did deliver! 4 hours has never flown by so quickly! I loved the small touches, like a small snack of bananas and fruit juice halfway through the massage, the rose petals in the bathtub, and the facial treatment was probably my favourite part of the whole spa session. The meal after was a nice addition also, with fruit, juice and Pad Thai. The staff were so lovely also. Would recommend this place to anybody looking for a luxurious way to spend a day.

Amazing service & treatment. The raving reviews were all true. Spa manager Khun Tuti and her team really made a difference. From the reservation made via email to the actual treatment, I felt pampered, scrubbed, oiled, kneaded until i was drifting into a land of weightlessness. The fruits and tea after the treatment was a nice touch as well as the cool towel and tea upon arrival at the spa. Bhawa Spa is really an oasis in busy Bangkok and it is just a short walk from Phloen Chit BTS. Very easy to find and accessible.
Very kind. . Massage is great. And all of staff are kind. It rained but I don't have an umbrella. So I asked that I could buy one, but they gave it for free. Thanks.

The best spa ever. I regularly enjoy massage and spa, so that I have kind of high standards when it come to massage therapists. The massage therapist was one of the best! She was very professional and kind. It seemed she knows which parts of my body hurts, and need treatment. After the 100min service, I do not feel pain anymore.

Relaxing!. My wife and I had 4-hours spa package which was in promotion. The best out of three spas we had in Bangkok. Excellent service by the staffs. The therapists are professional and the environment is relaxing. Great value and will definitely revisit again. PS: Join the membership online for additional discount.

Superb Experience!. I learned the Bhawa spa via the hotel concierge so that I made a online reservation on the website and quickly got a prompt conformation from the staff. Though Bhawa spa located in a private mansion, it's easy to access in the embassy area. My treatment was a 4-hour White Pearl Jasmine spa. Starting with foot soak, then comes with a pearl jasmine body scrub covered with body mud, and then a truely blessing jasmine oil massage along with a facial treatment. Finally it ends with a warm jasmine bath and a healthy light meal. The scent is very elegant and lasting for quite a while. Highly recommend for people with exquisite taste

Elegant. I’ve visited the Spa based on tripadvisor nearby & ranking; the place is so elegant, comfortable & relaxing, they are so professional with a special care you will notice it starting from the receptionist until you finish & leave... They left a touch in my heart that this place is one of the important places that I have to revisit again.As they are so good most of the time they are fully book, therefore you have to book in advance, for my next visit to Bangkok, I will book at them when I buy my airline tickets

Pleasant environment. I had not made a reservation but was after a short wait told I could have a massage. The place is very pleasant, helpful staff, nice clean rooms, the therapist that In had was very professional and skilled.

Must go for spa lover. For the price and quality, Bhawa is simply the best - regular and tourists alike. It is hidden in the Witthayu 1 Alley just off Witthayu Rd (Wireless Rd), right next to Hotel Indigo. There are fewer than 10 rooms, so book in advance is a must.

Lovely spa experience!. We selected this spa to try this time as it is very close to our hotel at Renaissance. The services were very good. The spa room was spacious and comfortable. We selected the sense of Thai package which includes massage and body scrub. I would recommend to my friends and probably will go back next time.

Gracious and Relax. Bhawa spa is located at the city of Bangkok easy to get there by BTS. The atmosphere is so upscale. Quality of massage therapy with the reasonable price.100% sure I will visit again and recommend to the people who want to visit.

Best Massage! Highly recommend!. Service was excellent. The Holy Thai Touch treatment 180 min. was amazing. My therapist was by far one the best who has ever worked on me, true master of her profession. They made me feel welcomed before I even stepping into the reception area. Treatment rooms were immaculate, private, quiet, very well appointed and perfectly temperature controlled. I left there feeling Sabai Sabai!I highly recommend planning your Spa treatment well in advance as they can be fully booked 1-2 weeks. Thank you for recommending me to this amazing Spa K. Piaplook

Won't recommand. I made a reservation through website and tried to changed the reservation through the web site again. But very weird, every single day when i try to change was fully booked they said. I tried to make a reservation with 4 days but i failed to make it.(they said 4 days are fully booked). But I walked in to the spa, there is no one do a spa and I can do the program even I did not book it.I do not know wether someone cancel the book or this company does not want to have reservation but it was very unpleasant for me.

Just the best massage ever!. Bhawa Spa is such a wonderful place to get a great massage, in a very upscale environment, in a convenient location, but all of this at a reasonable price. I hate to pay super farang prices when I really don't need to. Be good to yourself...book a massage every week and enjoy both the quality and the cost. The Best!

Book early for this gem!. Only 5 minutes from Okura Prestige where we stayed, we decided to book via email beforehand one week early. They emailed back to tell us they were full for the 2 days we were available! Devastated, I asked to be on the waiting list. Within 2 days, they replied and said that one spot was available. My husband wasn't able to book a spot. Anyway, when I got there, I asked again for my husband and they told me they were fully booked. I asked to be put on the waiting list but unfortunately they said they just didn't have any capacity. The next day, I decided to ask Okura to call Bhawa Spa. Lo and behold, when Okura concierge called, Bhawa did have an opening! Bhawa is aesthetically beautiful with welcoming staff and the massage services were top notch. They have signs to direct you to their spa (see photo) so it's relatively easy to find. Book early if you want a spot!

Average Spa only. My hubby and I have just tried the Spa there and found that the spa was just average though the room and environment was real good. The spa we took was a 4-hour one, called Royal Jelly Spa Absolute Rejuvenation. Within this 4 hours spa, too much time was spent on body scrub. The massage lady left me uncover inside a cold air-conditioning room while she was getting some warm water/ oil for body scrub. This happened almost 10 times during body scrub. Besides, the oil massage time was too short. I doubt if there was one full hour for this. The massage woman kept on leaving me in and out. After massage the left leg, she left me few minutes for preparing the bath water, and then my right leg. The oil massage was interrupted many times, very annoying. They spent most time in preparing water instead of focusing on massage. I hope this situation can be improved. This never happens in other spa s that I have tried before.
One of the best experience I had in Bangkok. Everyone was so welcoming and kind. The massage was great too.definitely will cpme here the next time i'm in Bangkok!!!

Great SPA experience. Will definitely return!. 2nd time visiting this spa and still impressed! The fact they only have 6 rooms makes guests feel less commercial, unlikely some chain spa brands in BKK. Opted for a 2.5 hour package which consists of Scrub and full body oil massage. It was quite relaxing that I fell asleep half way. Yes the price is higher than average spa in BKK but it is worth to give yourself a treat once in a while. Will definitely return again. Caution: have to book in advance as it could be full easily in peak travel season

Recommendable Bhawa SPA in Bangkok. My second experience in Thiland, was excellent and better than pthe first message experience..Very kind staff and clean, calm rooms, was very much recommendable.태국에서는 두번째로 가본 마시지. 첫번째는 지난 1월 가족과의 여행중 페키지투어 때 가보았고... 마사지 강도는 처음보다 약했으나 섬세하고 부드러운 마사지였다. 다음 여행시에도 들러서 즐길생각이다.

Totally amazed!!!!. Talking about one of the best spa in Bangkok, I definitely recommended Bhawa Spa for all of my friends for sure. Great service & welcoming hospitality unlike others. I would return to Bhawa Spa again for sure.

Ended up at a hospital with a back contusion. Honest review - July 2015.. Aside from being consistently ranked within the top 10 of TripAdvisor's Spa & Wellness in Bangkok, Bhawa was recommended to my family by some friends. Having heard these wonderful things about Bhawa, we saved it for the last day of our trip to Bangkok, hoping to end on a high note.My mother and I picked the 4-hour royal jelly rejuvenation spa package. It started off fine in the first 2 hours with the scrub, the body mud and the milky bath with lime and flower petals etc. But then things went horribly wrong during the massage. I could tell that my masseuse was tired. She was applying uneven pressure upon each stroke, and worse still, it felt completely different on my left and right legs. So I tried my best to communicate with her. Eventually that failed and I asked for a change of masseuse. The second masseuse came along and perhaps she was told that I wanted more pressure, so she really went for it. I repeatedly told her to be "softer please" and that it was "painful". At one point I believe she climbed onto the massage bed, pressed her whole body weight onto the small of my back with her palm, and jumped down from the bed. As a result, there was a severe sharp pain in my lower back, so much that I had to stop immediately. I could still walk but the pain didn't go away, so I asked for help from the reception. The receptionist asked me to "calm down" and tried to send in yet another masseuse to do a "check-up" for me, but at that point, given the abruptness and intensity of my pain, it was best to seek medical attention. The receptionist then told me that the nearest English-speaking hospital is 1-hour away - an exaggeration which I do not appreciate. (They tried to explain that it was after taking the traffic into account. But when I asked how far it was from my hotel, the receptionist said "very far", which was not true. It seemed to me that she could have been trying to hush it up.) I insisted on calling my own hotel and was informed by hotel staff that there is a hospital 15 minutes away. The owner of Bhawa came and drove us to that hospital. I was diagnosed with a back contusion and muscle spasm as a result of massage, and was discharged with anti-inflammatory drugs and ice packs. Some bruising surfaced over my lower back the next day.In all fairness, Bhawa covered all my medical expenses and waived my spa costs (although not my mother's), and its owner could not have done more. Fortunately it was just a minor injury. But I have had spas and massages in Thailand many times before (at least over 20, I would say) and this was my first time ever to get injured during a massage. It was definitely a scary and terrible experience.Conclusion: Yes, the decor is great, the products that they use are good too, just like their sister brand Divana (even in the midst of the chaos, my mother fulfilled her duty and did some quick shopping for the friend who recommended us there), but it all depends on the masseuse that you get.The question is, are you willing to risk it here?I am writing this down because people should know about the risks of getting a spa massage - I didn't. Everything that is stated above is a true account of what happened to me.

Heaven hidden in a busy city. Went for the 3hr thai spa experiances package and was not disappointed except that i should had opt for the 4hrs package.Totally relaxing in nice ambience and wrap up with a healthy meal ( mango sticky rice ).

Awesome first time experience. It was my first experience with a spa & massage and this place did it right. They have a detail form which we need to fill up where we could specify areas we wish to focus on, and the whole massage experience was very relaxing!

Amazeballs. This place just set the bar so high, that I think I'm ruined for all other spas.. Choosing a package:To be honest, I think my friend and I just dropped in one night and in our touristy MC Hammer pants, they let us in and treated us like prized customers from the get-go.You sit on a couch and look at their 'menu' of packages. I can't remember which one we picked but it was about 3500BHT and included: body scrub, oil massage, foot scrub, and ends with milky bath with rose petals(!). Whole thing was 3 glorious hours long. You are served tea as they ask for your preference on the oils to use (you sniff bottles) and on a body outline, where are places to concentrate on and 'no-touch' places lol. You also choose the level of 'force' as they massage you.The Room:So after walking up this grand marble staircase, you are led behind this big wooden door and there are two beds with ample distance between one another and a pillow for your face/head. You get changed as the masseuse's wait outside patiently for you and KNEELING the whole time (we noticed this when we went to fetch them after we changed back into our clothes). That's some crazy dedication if you ask me!They also have a cube-storage unit off to the side wall for your personal belongings. The Main Event: Then for three hours they massage you, oil you down, and exfoliate you. At one point you sit down and the masseuses get down on the their knees and scrub your feet as you enjoy a small snack and drink. I fell asleep like twice during the massages because they were SO good - my friend said I even snored a little. The grand finale is a milky bath with rose petals in a classy wooden polished barrel container. You get to shower off but I suggest you don't because your skin feels so moisturized that it's a waste to wash it all off. You are then led back downstairs and you get more tea, some fruit snacks, and then you fill in a comment card.(We pretty much were given so much food throughout this entire experience that we just ate a meat skewer afterwards for dinner!)Location:This is the only downside to this place. It's kinda hidden on the end of a small street and asking for directions from locals was difficult. We ended up using a taxi to the main street. You then walk down this slightly sketchy-looking street (it was dark and abandoned looking), then hang a right and you"ll see it at the very back in all it's majestic glory. The building itself felt like a grand mansion!P.S. When we finished, a lady actually escorted us out and walked behind us (from afar) until we were at the end of their street! We'd turn back every while to actually see if she's still following us and she'd just smile and do a little head bow. It was cute :)So what are you waiting for? GO GO GO!

Extremely relaxing. Tried their promotion_ Royal Jelly Spa 240 min. The honey scrub and wrap were super relaxing. Did tried other spa over Thailand from top tier hotels and Bhawa is the best. The massage is stronge for me but still very comfortable. Enjoyed the light meals and a box of scrub and a bottle of massage oil.

Best massage ever!!. I've experimented many massages all around southern asia but this was by far the best massage I've ever had in my whole life :) The thai massage was strong (just as I wished it to) and really relaxing.Pros: -confortable and fancy infrastructure -awesome massage -kind crew -tasty free teaCons: -i wished to buy all the shop
Like it. Experiencing bhawa spa service recently. Really enjoyed their spa treatment and other services. People are friendly but professional. Will get back again soon

A little bit of Heaven. Although it is a very hot day, and quite a bit of walk from the BTS, it is well worth it. The massage and scrub were delightful. The quietness of the area and smiling faces of the staff are well worth it. Would highly recommend people to go there for a nice afternoon off from the crowd.
Nice. This was a nicely decorated but quite small spa. For the price we expected amazing massage service but actually was just average.

highly appreciate!. read many excellent review in Tripadvisor about bhawa. visited recently, never disappointed indeed! their services & hospitality are amazingly impressed. get back to bhawa again soon.
tranquil. The therepist is really good, and very good treatment and atmoshphere. very relaxing and good products.
So relaxing. It was just amazing, masseuse is professional and their treatments and atmosphere were all fantastic! Worth the price, would definitely go there again and again!

Relaxing. A great place to leave all your worries behind,esteems luxury, comfort and typical thai message. Treatment and athmosphere extremely satisfying. it's amazing! services & staff are friendly and professional.

brilliant!. read many excellent reviews in tripadvisor. I found it 'no doubt' impressive with their caring, kindness and professionalism.bought some homemade spa products, specially body scrub, body lotion are highly recommended.hope to return again soon

A place to relax and enjoy. It's always a pleasure to come back. My personal must while in Bangkok. I have been here many times and have never been disappointed. The service and the massages are great and everybody is very friendly, accommodating and corteous.

one of the must in Thailand. found bhawa in BIG/ BIH fair in Bkk recently. their spa products are so good quality, special & expertise in scent blending.had a chance to try bhawa spa services after fair. it's amazing! services, staff are friendly and professional. their treatments are special and so many choices... its location and atmosphere is outstanding, walkable from ploenchit bra sky train.this is the must for me when I'm in Bkk.

Good deal and good service . When I was walked in, their staff go out to the entrance met you with smily face. The sitting area was relaxing and cosy. They are professional enough to ask you fill in the questioners let them know the health condition & expectation about their treatment. The treatment room is huge, clean and nice decoration. One thing I think is not perfect was the treatment bed do not have a hole for put the face down. They use a towel and small pillow instead. My neck feeling not comfortable. Overall their treatment is good, my legs relaxed a lot. But I think still have room to improve their treatment bed and their towel had a very strange bad smell. After treatment, they served tea & fruits are tasty. I still recommend people to go coz of this spa is convenience.
Refreshing Oasis in a sea of buidlings. Down an ally amongst the embassies you will find a green green peaceful place to have a "spa" experience-- not just

Very relaxing. Just returned and had a wonderful experience. The staff is amazing, the treatments and the massage were very relaxing, definitely a great place to leave all your worries behind at.Definitely returning!

Relaxing escape. We had a great time at Bhawa Spa and would thoroughly recommend it. While pricier than many options in Bangkok, it is well worth the extra money for the ambience and overall experience. Our feedback about one element that made us uncomfortable was recieved well by the staff which is always a good sign. We look forward to visiting again on our next visit.

Balm for body and soul. After a taff business trip, Bhawa spa is the best place in Bangkok to relax. A friendly welcome with cold towel and tea at the stylished reception, clean and cosy rooms, relaxing massages from very polite and competent therapists are balm for your body and soul, possibility to get a shower bevor leaving, fresh fruits and hot tea as farwell. I recommend this beautiful place to everyone who esteems luxery, comfort and typical thai tradition.

paradise on earth!. I'm a spa user, I have tried many leading spas both hotel and day spa in Thailand. I found real heaven on earth at Bhawa! it is amazing; staff are truly friendly, kind and caring. location is a hidden gems in the hearth of BKK, it's very calm with peace even though it's just a few minutes walk from Ploenchit Sky train station!they so many programs in two big folders however receptionist recommended me the treatment that suited my need (I was so fatigue from stress) it was 4 hrs newly created treatment; power! I was served in the big and powerful design room (power room is in dark blue color and they put gems stone in the room too, I asked receptionist why gems stone has been placed in the room, it helps to encourage my strength of power, she told me) I felt very energetic after treatment! wow! homemade healthy meal was served after treatment, it's so delicious.bhawa is only choice for me in Thailand!

Just a Must!. On the verge of planning another trip to Bangkok, I realize it has been almost 3 months since my last visit to Bahwa! Knowing they now have opened even a New section, I can not wait to get back to try that out. After having visited this spa several times I find it's location and treatment and athmosphere extremely satisfying! The kind tuning down of an overload of stash experienced elsewhere and still keeping the ability to produce a true ambience of well-being and calmness is greatly appreciated. The possibilty also to book a double room has been greatly appreciated by my wife. No stay in Bangkok without at least one visit to Bahwa!
Amazing place to pamper yourself. We had a really relaxing time at the spa, friendly staffs and good quality of products. We will go back absolutely.

Good and bad experiences at Bhawa Spa. Having read all the great reviews and recommendations on TripAdvsior, my husby and I decided to choose Bhawa Spa for spa treatment as part of our wedding anniversary programme.While my therapist was excellent, the one for my husby was, unfortunately, not good and definitely not up to our expectation for Bhawa Spa. My husby did not find his massage relaxing, and worst of all, he felt hard to breath after the massage because the massage was too strong and hard and lacked technique. He still feels hard to breath occasionally even it's now a few days after the massage... I'm really worried that he has been hurt by the therapist!We had our treatment at their new building and the music in the room stopped to play soon after the treatment started, and that had greatly affected the ambience. The beds were also too hard and not the type tailored made for massage, which also affected the quality of experience.

Pampering Experience. I have been to Bhawa Spa many times already and their services were consistent for each visit. Price is a bargain for the massage as well as the environment. It is a relatively new shop and the ambiance is relaxing with fruits served after the treatment. I personally like strong massage and the masseuses are generally really good. The only imperfection I recalled was the shower, which was a little slow and not hot enough. I did provided feedback but did not get the chance to try it since the initial experience.

Amazing. It was an amazing spa experience . The staff so warm and friendly. All the oils scrubs smelled amazing. My therapist was excellent. They even given you yummy healthy snacks in between each session. The location was easy to find there were big signs from the Main Street leading you to the more quiets street where the spa was. The faculty was super clea. I would definitely come back. Definitely walkable from our hotel the Aetas.

How can such place have less than 5 stars?. Visiting spa's and massage places is always a challenge for me because of being very sensitive to tickling sensations. In Bhawa I don't know how they do it but the whole experience was amazing with only very minor tickling discomfort, which was absolutely bearable.This spa must be on the list of must go places besides all the temples. Definitely one of the best memories of Bangkok comes from Bhawa.The location is close to the monorail Nana station, in a clean, upscale area and fairly easy to find thanks to plenty of signs telling where to go. The spa itself have wonderful garden with a pool with stylish reception desk area.We took the four hours course and I truly wanted it to be even longer. The whole experience was so pleasant, we enjoyed every single minute of the massage, bath and just being there.Staff were incredibly polite, intelligent and welcoming, this spa is realy an oasis, worth the time and every single baht spent there.The welcome tea was awesome, the light meal after the procedures was delicious too. Definitely want to come again.

lived up to expectations!!. Went to this place based on the fantastic reviews, and also as very close to where i was staying... couldnt say i was in any way disappointed!easy to find, very nice atmosphere, very friendly and polite staff, who are attentive throughout. They fitted me in without a reservation, which I really appreciated.the treatment itself was excellent, and the pre- and post- care was second to none. Couldnt have been happier, highly recommended

Amazing spa experience, best we had in BKK. We booked a different spa every day for our trip to Bangkok. This was our first appointment and no other spas even came close to our experience at Bhawa. The ambience, the quality and variety of the treatments were fantastic. When we come back to BKK, we will only book at Bhawa. Thanks for a fantasic spa experience!

Absolutely Amazing. I loved this place! Had a 4-hour spa afternoon at the end of a month long trip in southeast Asia, and it was exactly what I needed. I came away rested, rejuvenated, and feeling fantastic. I've had spa treatments at home, and wish that they were as nice, and as reasonably priced, as Bhawa. I found Bhawa through TripAdvisor, and so glad I did! I will definitely be back next time I'm in Bangkok and definitely recommend it.

Reborn. I'm tired,fatigue from long distance drive. I just want to release stress and fatigue. I used Thai Touch program for 2 hour. Wowwww , I'm feel reborn and refresh. At Bhawa have very relaxing atmosphere , Staff very nice and handy , Therapist also very professional. I'm really enjoy. I will be back again to try difference program.

perfect bliss. Every time when visiting Bangkok I like to get pampered at Bhawa. An enjoyable place, with committed and friendly staff, great service and wonderful massages. Centrally located, classy & friendly ambience with an eye for the detail. Looking forward to my next visit next week... ;-)

Nice and wonderful spa. You never know what is the best untill you give it a try!!!It was an amazing experience, great treatment and lovely scent of aroma which is very unique. The treatment itself was excellent from the start till the end. If I have to suggest a spa in Bangkok, I would recommend Bhawa Spa for sure.

Absolutely awesome!. Being a Bangkok expat, I've had my share of spas, but this is without any doubt the best that I have experienced. Starting with the atmosphere: the spa is located in a beautifully renovated townhouse with a small pool on one side. I love that the treatment rooms are not your usual cubicles but spacious rooms, pretty much like a living room! The welcome was professional and incredibly friendly, good recommendations - and the treatment kept all promises that were made! Very often I find that even in Thailand the procedures are very technical, this one was simply beautiful, relaxing and so well done!If you want cheap, go some place else, if you want great, this is THE place!

Quality and professional!!!. Of course it's not the cheapest spa, but it's worth the money. Excellent design, friendly staff and high quality procedures.My wife and I booked a procedure for 4.5 hours and it was great.

Superb spa experience, highly recommended. We followed tripadvisor comments and we chose this spa and Boy was it good. As spa treatments are not cheap (cheaper than Canada but still not cheap), we decide to go with that month promotion which was the Emerald Gold Ayurveda and the tourmaline Supreme Detox at 4650 bahts for 240 minutes which includes a foot bath/exfoliation, a body scrub and wrap, a bath with rose petals, an oil massage, a facial and a lunch.Since we were not sure of which one would be the best, I indicated both in our reservation. The receptionist who's quite sharp understood that by herself and recommended the Tourmaline which was more age appropriate for us.The Bhawa spa is located in the embassies neighbourhood and easily accessible by BTS Ploen Chit, Exit 2, you then take Witthayu Road lumpini park direction. The street to the spa is past the Athenee Plaza Hotel but before the All Season Place. There's a cafe in a mall called the Verasu (you turn left right before you arrived at that cafe). if you're not sure turn backwards and you'll see the sign. You have to walk to the end of that street and then turn right, the spa is at the end of the Alley. The location is a big plus since you won't hear any traffic noise during your treatment,.A few words on the spa itself now, this is intended to be a high end experience and they really hit the curve. The spa is superbly decorated and has a wonderful garden/swimming pool next to it. No one seems to use it but it's just so pretty. When you arrive at the spa, they offer you a cold towel (artistically wrapped) and a refreshing beverage. You can visit the little boutique and enjoy the surroundings. They will ask you to fill out a questionnaire (see other reviewer picture) and smell the different scents to choose your oil massage (tray of little bottles). We chose the lime and lemon oil and it was divine, light, fruity and soothing. The personnel always seat down in the "traditional way I believe" when they talked to you (I think it's a form of thai politeness) and you feel extra special.We were then taken to our room (which is a new one), they seem to have rented/purchased some additional space. Personnel are all extra polite and they all say hello when they see you. We were introduced to our masseuses Nok and Poon who took care of us for the whole period of time. They both have super soft hands but you can feel that strength in they fingers and palms. even though we enjoyed the whole experience, the bath with the flower petals (the bathtub might be small for a man though) and the hot stone massage were the highlights of the whole experience. One word on the facial, I usually like my nose pores to be extracted which is not the way they do it here but I think that's the way they do it in Asia in general, you have to go to more a cosmetic treatment center to get those kind of facials.The whole thing took almost 4h30, I think they don't count the time you take your shower and dress up again. We were then walked back to the reception and served with a light lunch of spring roll, fried shrimp/surimi bites, ginger tea and fresh fruit. The masseuses tactfully stayed in the massage pavillon and we had to ask for them to show our gratitude and tip. The whole experience is 5******* and terrific value. Do try it, it will be great.PS. They don't have a locker, you just leave your items on a bench. I had jewelry on me and just left it in my handbag and I was not nervous at all about it but if you prefer, you might want to leave it in your hotel safe before you go to the spa.

Terrific value. I found this spa by doing an online search when I unexpectedly had a day to myself. It's an approx 20mins walk from Chitlom where I was staying and was easy to find. From stepping into the reception, the ambience was very relaxing, receptionists were welcoming and friendly, a refreshing fruity flavoured tea was served with a wet towel on a beautiful wooden plate. I booked Tourmaline Supreme Detox, which was a 4 hour treatment and on special. My room was in a separate annexe and high points for cleanliness, my masseuse was eager to please and what I especially liked, you complete a short form on your preferences and I ticked Medium - the strength throughout the treatment was maintained, which is not necessarily the case in other boutique spas. I was served drinks and fruit during the treatment and the light meal at the end was delicious - a refreshing soup with hints of lemongrass, juicy rice paper rolls, fried thin prawn (I think) sticks, fresh fruit. Although the pillows were uncomfortable no matter what height I placed my head, I opted for the rolled towels - the overall experience is on par with a spa in a five-star hotel and given the price, I highly recommend this hidden gem.

Awesome Spa . Amazing experience， my 2 friends and I went there at middle of Jan. Their location was near Conrad Hotel on Wireless Road. We joined their Emerald Gold Ayurveda treatment for almost 4hours in a great price due on promotion. They provided an excellent and professional service，inbetween they offered a snack during 4hours treatment, it was an attentive issue. My friends and I absolute will come back and looking forward to............already missed there
Excellent. Very clean, relaxing and professional spa in Bangkok, round the corner from the Conrad Hotel. Loved every minute of my 100 minute aromatherapy massage.
Nice place. This was a nice spa to visit for some relaxation as Bangkok is very tiring. The massage was ok but price quite high.

Cozy & Relaxing. I felt cozy and calm from the moment I step inside of Bhawa Spa. The spa is very nicely decorated in the quiet environment area. The receptionists were very helpful and friendly to help me to choice my treatment. I am provided with tea and wet towel upon arrival. The masseuse was excellent. After massage I was relaxing in the garden with tea and fruit. I felt so refreshed and regenerated. I will definately go back to Bhawa next time when I visit Bangkok. You should not miss it. Dana

in love <3 with Bhawa. I visited Bhawa Spa last december... and l promise.. it is one of the most beautiful gems in Bangkok's Spa scene.. a truely amazing place to visit and deffinitely never to be missed...an oasis where the spirit of Siam still lives... and where everybody gives you the feeling of how special and precious you are... all the holistic treatments are tailored to your needs and comfort.. and a highly skilled knowlegeable and respectful team of therapist awaits you and takes care of you... simply a beautiful place to rest your soul to heal and to rediscover your peaceful center within... I truely fell in love with Bhawa !!

Classy!. Bhawa Spa really is a hidden gem of Bangkok. The service, the ambience, the aroma and of course the massage - all superb! We stayed at Novotel Bangkok and Bhawa Spa was only a walking distance. My wife and I had booked a 130 minute Aromatherapy Body Retreat massage on the night we arrived in Bangkok and it was one of the best decisions we made (appointments can be made online). After a long flight, it was just perfect! We slept like babies that night and we had no effects of jetlag at all.We were provided with tea and wet towel (w great aroma) upon arrival and another tea with fruits after our massage. The service was excellent from the beginning to the end - very helpful front desk and, of course, the masseuses were highly skillful and professional.We returned a couple of days later to take advantage of the 4 hour spa special called Royal Jelly Spa (there was a discount during the month of November) and I can't even describe how good it was. After a long flight back home, I was wishing Bhawa Spa had a location here in the States. Sigh...I just want to add that after a 4 hour spa treatment, they served us light lunch - Pad Thai. Can I tell you - it was the best Pad Thai I ever had!!I miss you Bhawa Spa...

Beautiful!. Bhawa spa was so beautiful and serene, you forget that you are in the middle of Bangkok! We came in the evening and the candles and lights in the garden next to the pool made the first impression so enchanting. My husband and I had amazing treatments and relaxing baths at the end! If you have a few hours to spare, this spa is a must visit!

Best massage in bangkog. Despite the fact that the location is hard to spot, we had the best service and massage at the spa. The person at the spa was kind enough to give us the Internet discount even though the page didn't show properly. Thank you!My husband and I would very much want to visit again when in Bangkok.

Great massage. Perfect from start to end. We had an "Aromatherapy Body Retreat" of 100 minutes. We got drinks before and after, and the massage was simply perfect. Would definitely go there again. Thanks!!

Relaxing massage, serene ambience. We took up 4 hours package-royal jelly package and blue cavier package, both inclusive of scrub, facial , massage and bath.Pros1.professional masseues2. Availability of couple room3. Light snacks and fruits in between treatment and delicious phad thai at end of treatment4. Warm treatment bed5. Special promo on one of the package and free gifts including massage oil & scrubCons1. If only massues is able to explain procedures and type of ingredients used2. A bit straining on neck when faced down as they do not have the standard massage bed 3. The shower temperature is not consistentOverall, it's a great & relaxing experience. Would visit again.

Nice small gem. Went here because it was close to my hotel and had very good ratings on TA. What a find! It's amazing. They could accommodate me relatively short noticed and responded to my email quite promptly. You can book the treatments online. When I arrived I was a bit afraid that they might have forgotten my reservation, but everything was well in place. It's a bit tough to find, but they send you a map. (also on website)The spa is very nicely decorated and looks very clean. You are offered drinks before during and after the massage/treatment, as well as fruits afterwards. They are very friendly and I will definitely go back and recommend my colleagues.My Relaxing Thai Touch for 100minutes was 1100 THB.They do offer crew discount for airliners (20%).

Rwally nice. Its a smaller place with a really nice personal touch. The service was excellent as was the massage. Just beware, if you ask for "strong" pressure, thats what you'll get. It was right around the corner from my hotel, and half the price.

Can't type. I'm a blob of warm jello.. So awesome. Got the 100 minute Office Syndrome Body Soother. Incredibly relaxing. Relatively inexpensive too. (1400 baht which is around $43.00) After a two week marathon exhausting "adventure" vacation through Indochina, this was much needed therapy. Place is lovely and CLEAN and elegant. People were very nice. RESERVATIONS VERY STRONGLY RECOMMENDED. Either call them or email them 24 hours in advance. They accommodated us, but they had to scurry around to get a room available and get masseurs in.

Excellen Spa; great price. Came late September and did the special of the month "pure Jasmine" at 30% discount. A four hours spa package includes footwash, relaxing body scrub, a heated body mud/wrap, scented oil massage, and a jasmine floral milk bath. Total was under 4,000 baht. My spa therapist was Poon who was excellent. Albeit, the therapist here are much older than Banyan tree; the prices are much cheaper. Treatment room was very nice and large. The bath tub was too big (I had to sit up) otherwise I would of drowned. I did dislike the massage bed, it did not have a place to fit your face. So, my head was supported by pillows. Very uncomfortable facing down. Can't wait to go back in November to try the Royal Jelly special. They do have prepaid membership starting at 10,000 baht. Which gives you an additional 3,000 baht credit. So, it works out to be 23% discount) on regular priced treatments. Cannot double dip; using the membership credit on specials.

A Mindful Journey. I recently visited this spa and felt so moved by the environment and treatment - I had to include it on my blog, tashastraveltroves. Here is a short excerpt for you "A tray is then laid before me, show casing the ingredients that will be used on my overly polluted skin from this City. I choose the Royal Jelly Spa Package, a 3 hour indulgence which includes the following :coconut oil body rub | warm milky compress | royal jelly body scrub | white clay & tanaka body mud | moringa oil body massage | warm lotus bath | facial treatment | healthy light mealShe recites the benefits of all the ingredients outlined in the treatment and awaits patiently for me to take the last sip of my tea. There is no sense of haste. Her voice is low and her smile on an infinite time line. I am then greeted by another team member of this welcome affair, my masseuse. She is there to please and help me journey to that peaceful world that she so rightfully understands. I am guided into a private change room that also holds a massive wooden tub. Adjacent to this room is the bathroom with a long wooden bench, topped with numerous scatter cushions. Once ready in my kimono like gown, her gentle guidance continues, as I am lead to my seat against a wall and asked to place my feet into a large brass urn." Would I go here again - ABSOLUTELY! It's a little sanctuary for all spa lovers!

Nice place to have a SPA treatment, but the staff should be a bit more attentive to guest’s request. Overall it is a nice SPA. The place is quite small and cosy, and atmosphere is pleasant.I chose a scrub and oil massage for 2hours. Timing was fine. I was just a bit disappointed about the therapist. Although she was nice and kind, she was not listening to my requests to have a softer massage and she did it too strong for me. Usually, after one or two reminders to adapt the strength of the massage, it should be ok, but this time, I always need to tell her to be careful until the end. Thus it was difficult to be relax.Except that, I appreciated the efforts to manage lights, music, temperature of the shower, quality of the towels and overall cleanliness.The last body cleaning with warm wet towels to remove the extra of oil is a great pleasure.Although my complaints above, I recommend this SPA. I hope the staff can improve a bit and listen to clients a bit more.

Total relaxation. I had been looking forward to my 4 hour Royal Jelly Spa treatment from the moment I booked. Firstly, it took me a while to choose a treatment from their fantastic selection and on the day I was not disappointed at all. The spa is beautful and will immediately have you relaxed from the moment you step inside. My therapist (Pun Pun) was great from beginning to end. Products used were of a high quality and Pun Pun was great throughout...her massages are awesome! Bhawa is easy to locate. A short walk from the BTS station tucked away in a quiet street. I highly recommend treating yourself to a 4 hour appointment. You will also be well fed afterwards - I finished off my treatment with a beautiful soup, Pad thai and fresh fruit salad. There was also a light snack and fruit during the course of the 4 hours. I have been to quite a few 4 hour treatments (it's a must at the end of any holiday! :)) and Bhawa is right up the top of my list of "must do again's" Cost is extremely reasonable in comparison to what I would get back home and I think not too expensive for BKK. I bought home some of their products (beautful range avaible) as gifts too. In the end I walked out of Bhawa feeling refreshed, relaxed, zen and full from the delcious food! One must treat themselves and what a great place to go. Will definately return.

Simply the best!!. That's my first visit at bhawa spy which was recommended by friends as it's reasonable price and good services!As expected, great services starting from the you walk-in til you finish the spa and relaxing at the receptionist by offering some delicious fruits for free! Taxi was also arranged which I did not have any communication problem with taxi driver which I hate that the most in Bangkok!Location was good as it is just 10 minutes walk after you walk down the phleonchit BTS and access to okura building and follow the Bhawa's sign! No need to cross any road or anything!

Great spa. I tried the Organic Coco Spa at Bhawa and it was a great experience. I indicated strong massage pressure and a focus on my upper back, neck and head, and the masseuse carried out the massage pretty well. There was no drop in focus or pressure. Highly recommended!

Beautiful place in the heart of the city. Went to for the firstfirst after a long Bhawaflightstopovstopoverto kill akill hours hoursngkok. Although I've been in town for quitw a few times, never had a treatment before like they offered me at this place. I wasn't sure what to expect for the prices offered, but the quality more than beat my expectations. At home, prices would be fourfold, whilst not coming close to what I found here. Highly recommended!
A very nice SPA. We visit Bhawa SPA on June 12. Very nice SPA. Good location. They offer 30% for our first visit. I choose their Holy Touch 180 mins. The therapist are nice & professional.
Great Service. Greate Service and very professional Thai massage. The place is fantastic. They pay attention to every detail and are very kind.

Bhawa Spa is a good one!. Because they are newly opened they have offerings of 30procent discount for new costumers. They have all kinds off packages and they are not cheap but well worth it. The ambiance is great, service too, nice music and they treat you like a prince /princess.
Excellent . Good location, easy to find. Nice and warm welcome. Friendly staffs, specialist therapies Very good products for treatment
Awesome!. Located in the city center, not complicate to find. Nice ambience with a warm welcome. Lot of programs to choose. Specialist therapists and excellent products 👍

reborn!. just had the treatment once again at bhawa spa... I felt totally reborn; its location, unbelievable hideaway house in a heart of BKK... but just a few minutes walk from Sky train, premium hotel, shopping mall and park... treatment I had was 3 hours spa, they offered me free oxy facial deep cleansing... it's just amazing! service was so impressed their staff was so attentive and caring. that's why I felt like a new born againthank you bhawa.

wonderful experience. i had a wonderful experience in Bhawa Spa in the beginning in March. my friend and i went there in the evening and had a treatment about 3 hours. the spa environment was very relaxing and natural, and the receptionists were friendly and helping out our shopping bags (we did a lot of shoping before that), they asked what we want and what we need for spa, the strength of massage we want. they were so caring. as for the massage specialists were skillful and profressional. they healed my tiredness of a day. i felt reborn and refreshed, after treatment. i will definitely go again when i visit bangkok next time.

This is the best spa in the City of Spas!!!. After living in and loving Bangkok for four wonderful years and becoming addicted to weekly massages, I found myself living in Europe and deprived of affordable body care. I know Bangkok very, very well, and there always seems that there are two levels of spas: the really expensive ones and the really too-local ones. Bhawa is a new place that hits the sweet spot of luxury at an affordable price.The treatment specialists are highly trained and experienced (I recognized a few from one of the city's most expensive/overpriced spas!), they know their treatment techniques but also the many small things that separate a top shelf spa from one that is not. The managers have a keen eye to make sure your entire visit is a perfect balance of privacy and friendliness. The owners participate in the operation and, having visited Bhawa several months apart, are eager to constantly make improvements to what is already a wonderful experience.Bhawa is perfectly located on Wireless Road (Witthayu), near many western embassies (USA, Denmark, Vietnamese) and 5 star hotels (Conrad, etc). I can't wait to get back, and compress 6 months of weekly massages into one short holiday!

fabulous moment.... I just was in Bangkok recently. Like to share my amazing experience at Bhawa spa. I spent 4 hours spa treatment, staff was so attentive and caring in every details. Yammi scone was served in the treatment room after shower session as well as fresh fruit juice with snake during bath session. the facial oxygen treatment was amazing (it is included in the treatment)at the end, green curry with salad and steam rice was attentively served after treatment, it was so tasty...I'll come back for sure to Bhawa Spa, this is the hidden spa in the heart of Bangkok...

Great Spa in BKK. I had to do a lot of review before visiting one, because of the kind of massage parlours there are in BKK. But this one was an absolute beauty. They knew what they were doing. Excellent therapy, and gave some suggestions on what i could be doing for ongoing treatment as well. Definitely a must visit for anyone who is looking for a good spa treatment. The receptionist was very pleasant too!!

Best experience in Bangkok! . Went there with my friends for their signature face and body massage. Really good and relaxing massage with different techniques than traditional Thai massage. Was really relaxing and rejuvenating. Went again in Oct for facial and was impressed again with their service! Great facial!! Very experienced staff!! Loved the place..will come back again and again!!!

Serene environment, skilled staff. Cannot go past this wonderful spa experience in Bangkok. I am not usually one for massages but this has been a wonderful experience of a full body massage - so welcoming, peaceful, restful and refreshing. Now I make sure whenever I am in Bangkok I visit at least once - last visit went twice - such a treat! Family in Bangkok are regular visitors too!

Brilliant spa!! Fantastic massage!! A hidden gem . I used to use this spa all the time when I lived in BKK, on this visit I had to return and get another dose! I was so pleased that in three years the standard is still very high and they are all as lovely as usual. My boyfriend and I had the following;30 minute body scrub- amazing feeling and seriously leaves your skin soft for about 1.5 weeksSignature 1.5 hour treatment- This includes massage, hot stones and facial Love everything about this treatment and every time it has been amazing. I really won't advise anyone to treat themselves to this. 1500 baht (30 gbp) approx for 2 hours is a bargain for this quality of massages and treatment. Thank you to all the ladies there for making it specially for us

not for a facial . I came to check this place out after reading all the wonderful reviews.Tried the hour facial and felt that the facial itself was alittle rushed. But during the mask there came a really wonderful massage that relaxed my body.So if your in need of a serious facial then it would not be the place. Its more a place to have a massage and relax in this homely environment. Plus one hour is simply not enough, so pick a longer session.Its an easy walk from the bts and enjoyed the stroll over. Also when you call they might not pick up so just try again.

Very restful!. This home SPA is very close to where we live but never tried it out. Couple of friends recommended the place and I went last week with my daughter. I honestly don't know why I did not visit before!!! To think of all the restful massages and treatments I have deprived myself off!!This is a beautifully converted old house with lovely staff. I think the owner is also personally involved and takes bookings. The rooms are clean and smell very nice. The treatments are very different from regular treatments. I guess more along the Korean style but I am not an expert on that. We took the facial and massage package and it was just perfect!! My face has never felt so soft in ages - nothing intrusive or harsh was used! Anyway the entire experience was blissful!! I am definitely walking back again

Cool place with amazing treatments. We read about this place in the Malaysian Airlines magazine and thought we'd give it a try and were glad we did. My husband and I did a scrub package together (please note ladies - very romantic!) where we had a herbal steam and sat in a wood tub before getting scrubbed down with rough gloves. Ouch! but we loved it. My mom and dad had a massage (dad) and facial and massage (mom) and they said it was very good. They we also happy because the owner could speak Cantonese to them and took time to explain every treatment in detail. So nice!

Great Place for a Massage. First time my wife is visiting Bangkok and she wanted a massage. And not a place where women sit out front soliciting people. A friend suggested Su Esthetic and she was right. We booked our appointment and we were warmly greeted upon arrival. We were given a menu of services and I selected a 90 minute massage and my wife a massage & facial. Overall, the people were very helpful and pleasant. The facility is a house and a very relaxing environment. I would highly recommend Su Esthetic if you're seeking a spay with great service & value. Tip: The place is a little tricky to find and not to close to the BTS. Suggest you take a taxi instead of trying to find on your own.
Wonderful massage. Love this place, great full body massage with a facial, so relaxing and the staff very attentive, great value for money, would highly recommend

Great quality products . The staff are good with body massage and products used is of certain quality.I got a the package of facial and body massage for 1000 baht and top up another 500 body srcub which is divine. It's leave my skin super soft and smooth for a a few days. I won't hesitate to return if I ever return to Bangkok.

Must visit n fall in love with the feeling . Initially wondering what they are doing but soon u will love n want to do more n keep going n once u finish u start missing everything they doing n want to go back within a week fab: creme they use, oil, massage, price. Recommended to all my girlfriends n their family

A spa without pretensions or breaking the bank.. What a great time for travellers in Bangkok this season, if you want to treat yourself to a very high quality spa, a vast selection of treatments in an authentic location with a casual non pretentious atmosphere, excellent therapists, this is the place for you. One must book, so check out their menu online, I opted for a combination of treatments beginning with the Korean steam followed by a shower then the Japanese hot tub followed by the Korean scrub, after which I continued with their incredible organic coconut oil face and body massage. All I can say people is.... to die for.

Wow!!.
