Love this place. Me and my friend found this place near our apartment and thought we would give it a go. The owner Donavan is knowledgeable and answered all of our questions prior to floating. We had never heard of this and were surprised to learn of all of the benefits. At first it was a bit uncomfortable but after about 20 minutes I fell into a deep state of relaxation that I've never felt before. Afterwards there is a chill out room equipped with a massage chair to finish off the awesome experience. Hope to go again soon.

Freaking Awesome. Ive tried this in the uk and thought i would continue with floating in bangkok. So i discovered bangkok float center. The place is nicely laid out and clean as stated in other reviews. The tanks are dream pods and are perfect for sensory deprivation. I will continue floating here once a week. Highly recommend to anyone wanting to tru floatation on bangkok. -nut

truly relaxing experience. This is a truly relaxing spa I've ever experienced in my life. While floating in the modern capsule, i felt like I was floating in another totally tranquil world. It is so peaceful and relaxing. the ultimate cleanliness and state of the art facilities they provide you are worth your money. I will definitely go again.

Experience Yourself in Bangkok. What an amazing experience! This place was one of the major highlights, on my trip to Thailand. In my opinion this is by far the most relaxing place in Bangkok. This was my first time floating, and was blown away by the experience. I left here feeling relaxed, light, and energized. The ultimate, Mind, Body, and soul. If you're in Bangkok, you gotta make your way here!
Great plate to de-stress in Bangkok!. The ultimate place to relax in Eastern Bangkok (right off Bangna Highway). Clean, good facilities, and new technology provide a thoroughly restful experience.
Derrill. Great way to relax and unwind from the hustle and bustle of the city. Not your typical touristy Bangkok experience! Highly recommended!

Fantastic first experience. I wasn't quite sure what to expect, coming here for the first time. However, as soon as you walk in your feel calm and at peace. The decor, the gentle music playing, the lighting all made you feel at ease very quickly. The place is run by a guy called Donovan who is very helpful - especially since we got a bit lost in the taxi finding the place and since he is able to speak both English and Thai, we soon found it with his directions. Since coming a bit late, I was worried we wouldn't get to enjoy a full hour in the tanks but the whole atmosphere was very chilled and we didn't feel at all rushed by any of the staff. The float istelf was great, and everything was very clearly explained to us beforehand and all our questins answered. Afterwards, I felt like I was still floating and very serene. As others have said, it is hard to 'let go' fully at first which is why I will be going back for more sessions. Would definitely recommend this place for others to try.

Unique experience. I went for my first float last week. Being a bit claustrophobic I was scared whether I would be able to last the full 90 minutes but I did. Jack spent over 20 minutes with me before the session, explaining everything patiently, answering all my questions. The float itself was a very unique experience. You can see nothing, hear nothing (except your own heartbeat and breath), smell nothing and feel very little but the water around your body. I totally lost the sense of time and could not believe how quickly the 90 minutes passed. Unfortunately my thought processes did not slow down much - but Jack says that is common during the first float and it improves a great deal in the 2nd float and thereafter. Then the mental and spiritual benefits begin to kick in. But I had to leave Bangkok the next day so could not go back. I would recommend budgeting for 2 floats at least . Go at 930 am to avail of the 25% discount . The place is spotlessly neat and clean and well maintained as written in the previous reviews

Amazing first floating experience!. Had my first floating experience today. Didn't really know what to expect, but was great. Bangkok Float Center is incredibly clean and sanitary, professional, and great customer service. Any questions you may have are answered fully and your experience is catered to your requests/needs. Will definitely be back if I am ever in Bangkok again and would definitely recommend for anyone in the area!

Just what the doctor ordered. I'd been wanting to try this for a long time so it was great to get the chance in Bangkok. The place is professionally run and chilled out. I've never been to any similar places so have nothing to compare it to, but I can't imagine there's much else you need really. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town. Perfect for switching off the world.

My Very First Float Experience - Age 43. I finally did it! After 35 years of curiosity, I climbed into one of the state-of-the-art sensory deprivation pods at Bangkok Float Center … and it was 90 minutes of weightless blissfulness. Ever since I watched the cult classic film 'Altered States' as a 9-yr-old boy, the subject of sensory deprivation has fascinated me. Big shout out again to Donavan Suwanapal and Bangkok Float Center for bringing me to this profound state of relaxation I am in right now. I can not possibly give a higher level of recommendation; a truly amazing and memorable experience from start to finish. DO NOT HESITATE.

Perfect first-time experience. I read a few articles online about how floating can help you relax, both your mind and body and I have to admit that this is exactly what happened to me.I arrived that morning with strong back pains since I strained a muscle a few days back.After 1hr in the tank I could barely feel any pain anymore.On top of that the session (60mn) was very relaxing and Donovan the owner, a great host.The place is very clean and peaceful.I signed up for a package right after and will be back soon.

It's legit. I don't want to get into the details of the float because honestly it varies from person to person. Here are the facts. The place is clean, comfortable, with state of the art equipment. You come in and immediately feel welcome. Donovan (the owner) is professional and friendly. He takes the time to get to know you while explaining the process that is floating. It's mostly ex-pats that are all looking for the same thing. Whether it be relaxation, spiritual connection, problem solving or just a deeper understanding of themselves. It's one of those rare environments where you come to get better. It's a great experience from when you enter the door till you exit.As far as floating itself. Best advice is leave the expectations at the door and let go. Let go of all those thoughts and lose yourself in the experience. And stick with it! It seems like every time I go back, the float gets a little more personal and deeper.Only draw back is the location is a bit hard to find at first, but well worth finding.

Must Try!!. I was a first time floater and loved it! It allowed me to finally relax. I got a total mind reset which lasted into the next couple of days. I felt like I was floating the whole day after. I even had a IDGAF moment when in the taxi and normally I'm concerned about the taxis driving. Bangkok Float is new and so it is very clean and well kept. The owner and receptionist are very helpful in helping understand the process and making you comfortable during the float session.I’ve floated twice now and will continue to float once a week. This is my new happy and I love it! Thanks BKK Float!

OUTSTANDING!!!. There isn't any comparison to the float centers in the States. This place is amazing!!! I am sleeping better and the chronic pain I have has eased significantly. The owner, Donovan is extremely knowledgeable, the customer service is top notch!!!

Relaxing and Fun!. A very interesting, relaxing, and luxurious experience! The owner is very knowledgeable and friendly and makes you feel comfortable instantly. The center is very clean, nicely decorated with a lovely living area for relaxation after the float session. The owner explains the process very thoroughly and it is clear that the equipment is state of the art. The floating experience is definitely odd for the first minutes, but eventually deep relaxation sets in when your body lets go. I left feeling refreshed and energized!

An amazing experience at Bangkok Float Center!. I am currently in my last trimester of pregnancy and I have been experiencing back ache and circulation problems in my legs. Spending an hour floating at Bangkok Float Center felt fantastic! While in the tank I was completely relaxed and was able to meditate. I left feeling energized and my back was no longer sore and my skin felt very soft. The facility is lovely and very clean.It was my very first time floating and the owner of the float center made me feel very comfortable. He did a fantastic job giving me all the necessary information I needed to get the most out of my floating experience. He was also very helpful and was able to answer all of my questions. I look forward to floating again!

what a trip!. drug free magic carpet ride! I have heard about sensory deprivation being able to help "reboot" one's mind, and now that I have tried it for myself it really does seem to work. The first 30 minutes my mind went everywhere, but when it finally relaxed I seemed to go into "nothingness". I came out completely refreshed and it was like taking a power nap to the Nth degree.

Affordable Luxury!. From the minute you make contact with the owner you'll feel like the Float Center is open just for you... he's friendly, informative, calm and conscious. The space he's created is gorgeous, and very calming. There's no rush and no reason not to luxuriate on huge comfortable couches pre and post-float.And for the price? Amazing.

Excellent first-timer experience. My partner and I wanted to try out floating and immediately found Bangkok Float Center online. The pricing structure was very clear and affordable, so with short notice I contacted the operator via email to request more specific info. The owner, Donavan, was very helpful setting up our appointments just a couple of days before our arrival.Location and FacilityWe booked a hotel in the area, locating the center and access from the road or freeway was very easy. In this part of Bangkok taxis use the meter and are reasonably priced, so no bad experiences with transport or returning to our hotel or shopping. The building and facilities appear brand new. The reception and waiting areas are on par with mid- to high-end spas, with aquarium, sound system, refreshments, etc. the pods, toilets and private areas were cleaned after each use. No issues or complaints regarding hygiene and service.ConsultationWithou Donavan's "hand holding" through the process I don't know if my partner would have done three floats. He is the owner, yet also a very mellow and relaxed float consultant. I consider him a relaxation consultant as one feels better just being in his presence. He prepared the rooms and our expectations with absolutely no pressure to sell us on anything more than we requested. Float experienceThe float itself was a top notch experience. The pod was new and comfortable. As an experienced meditator, it was amazing. I found that I was able to reach stages of meditation usually accessible only after 45+ minutes of concentrated seated meditation. It was wonderful and my 90 minute floats flew by.Post-floatComing out of your first floats is a bit like returning to the boat after a great scuba dive, you are glowing and benefit from a transition period to fully digest the experience. Again, there was plenty of comfort and refreshments available in the center. We never felt pressure to leave immediately to make room for other clients as appointments are spaced adequately. Donavan provided a de-briefing to help us get the most out of our next floats. Again, a top notch experience without sales pressure or strangeness. ConclusionA terrific experience with great consulting and facilities. We travel through BKK fairly often and will use Bang Na as our base to float again. Thanks Donavan!

Great Time. I have tried floating at many places and this one is definitely one of the BEST! The owner is super friendly and showed us around the shop. I would recommend this to anyone needing some time away. Very happy to have this place near my apartment!

The Journey Inward. I've been floating on and off for the past 7 years, originally starting in NYC. In 2014 my family and I moved to Bangkok. I got the itch to start floating again and surprisingly enough Bangkok Float Center was only 15 minutes from my house. The LocationA few weeks passed before I went to check it out. As someone who has floated before I knew what to look for and what questions to ask. And Bangkok Float Center has it all and then some. There are two tanks, one on each floor. Each floor has a private bathroom and a lounge to relax in after your float. You can hang out and reflect back on your experience, draw pictures, read books, write, talk with the owner, or simply leave. The Tanks As opposed to the room-style tank I floated inside in NYC, the tanks at Bangkok Float Center are pod-style tanks. At first I was concerned that the experience would be different, but almost immediately upon entering the tank I was brought back to that familiar feeling of being weightless in the void, deprived of all sensory input. The tanks are also quite large. At 6'3'' I find the inside to have plenty of space for my broad frame. And after the initial ping-ponging stops I rarely touch the walls. On top of that the condensation level is very low. There is no dripping of water from the top of the tank. Hitting walls and being interrupted by dripping water is one sure way of being pulled out of a deep float. These tanks cause neither of these problems.The Experience Floating is a completely subjective experience. The tank will show you what you need to know, if you allow it to. It's not wise to go in with expectations so I won't talk about my personal experiences here. I will say this, if you're curious about the tank for the physical benefits, it's amazing on the body. Although I float more for the mental aspect, it does help my sciatica and herniated disk. And the salts work wonders on the body. SummaryLife--Bangkok especially--is filled with too much stimuli. Sometimes we need to unplug and listen to ourselves and figure things out with a truly free mind and detached mind. The tank is perfect for this. Whether you're passing though Bangkok as a tourist or living here full-time, I see no reason not to stop by Bangkok Float Center and give it a try.
Relaxing. I like to relax and NEED to relax sometimes so thought would try "floating". It was pleasant without being particularly special.

Gonna do this again!!. Well let me first start by saying I'm an experienced MeDiTaTeR so the float tank was something I've been meaning to try for years and after my experience I wish I hadn't waited as long as I did. Donovan the owner was so helpful and friendly which made it very easy for me to feel comfortable and he was also very knowledgeable of isolation tanks and how to get the best out of my first float. I've been looking for a place like this to become a regular at to help me with my life's journey. As for the location, it's super easy to find which is a big plus for Bangkok and probably the quietest place you'll ever find in Bangkok (the tank that is!).
Good time.... Clean...comfortable....and a good experience....hard to explain..but very relaxing....and a good way to reach into your mind...will be back

Very Relaxing,loved it :). I simply loved my first float at Bangkok Float Center and definitely want to do it more frequently !!! I felt deep sense of relaxation for my mind, body and soul. Its an excellent tool to completely decompress after my hectic work routines. As a first time floater was little scared but now hoping to have further better experiences in my following floats !

"....Amazingly Fascinating....". I was told by a friend about Bangkok Float Center, then decided to give a try! First stepped in ..very warm welcome from the owner,Donavan with very comfortable atmosphere. I was amazed at his scientific explanation about what a Sensory Deprivation Chamber can help people's health as I am a doctor I totally agree with him and also believe and understand that it has million medical benefits :* The pressure of gravity is taken off the joints and muscles and the body as a whole is put in to a high state of physical relaxation, with blood pressure and oxygen intake reduced but at the same time blood flow and the distribution of red blood cells increase. The combined effects are of particular benefit to athletes, speeding recovery from injury and assisting in the flushing of lactate, cortisone and adrenaline that may have built up either through training or performance.* Floatation has been shown to loosen the muscles and give athletes a greater degree of control over their nervous systems. This reduces the risk of injury during training or competition. * Floatation not only accelerates the recovery process, but releases vast quantities of endorphins, the body’s natural painkiller.* Floating resets the body’s chemical and metabolic balance, thus reducing the risk of over training.* Promotes total calm, peaceful relaxation, eliminates fatigue and jet lag, improves sleep, alleviates stress- mental and physical, energises, rejuvenates and revitalises.* Stimulates left/right brain synchronisation; shifts brain waves from Beta to lower frequency Alpha, Theta and even Delta, creates mental clarity, alertness, increases creativity, problem solving, heightens visualisation, deepens meditation, expands awareness, intensifies acuteness of all the senses, accelerates learning.* Enhances hypnotherapy and self-hypnosis; increases motivation, diminishes depression, anxiety and fear, facilitates freedom from habits, phobias and addictions.* Improves athletic performance and helps prevent sports injuries and speeds the healing process.* Decreases the production of Cortisol, ACTH, Lactic Acid and Adrenaline, Increases production of endorphins, quickens rehabilitation and recovery, relieves pain- arthritis, migraines, injuries etc., boosts immune function.* Improves circulation and distribution of oxygen and nutrients; reduces blood pressure, pulse, heart rate and oxygen consumption.Conclusion : It's amazingly fascinating!!!! <3 <3

Truely Heavenly Experience. I didnt know what expect at first.. i had watched the vice documentary on youtube.. with lifes distractions getting more complex its wonderful to finally find my true self.. floating naked with nothing to dazzle, persude or grab my attention. Inner feelings and thoughts seem to appear amd surface and its an experience i never never felt before.. having the all your senses taken away for a little while allows you to enjoy them to the fullest once you leave the tank. The owner Donavan is a wonderful, friendly and gentle guy who is very experienced and knowledgable.  This experience should be enjoyed by everyone as i believe it to be a natural high and if we all tried this the world would be a better place. I will make this a regular thing as i feel happier and more at peace than ever before.. Love it... Huw

You gotta check it out. I was curious about this place, after reading the reviews I decided to check this place out. The staff was friendly and I really enjoyed it. I definitely recommend this place. I will be going back.
Float-tastic. AMAZING....need I say more? From the appearance to the experience pure excellence. This was my first float and I am certain I will be back

Relaxing but expensive. Wanted to try after reading good reviews and it was quite nice and relaxing. But it was also really expensive and I don't think more relaxing than a massage. or just sleeping in normal bed.

First-time. When I first walked in to Bangkok Float Center, the first things I noticed were the elaborate characteristics of everything. For example, I noticed when I entered the building was the "spa like” feeling you get as soon as I walked through the door. There is a great amount of calmness aka "feng shui" (fung shway) from the designs of the wall paper color, the color of hardwood floors, the cool fish tank on the middle of the floor, the nice comfortable couches to sit on when signing the papers at the front desk, and lastly the smell. For me it had a good calming smell to it... I hope it will be the same for you.Next, the owner of the company, Donavon, stepped from around the corner and met us in the front lobby area and sat down next to us on the big chairs and started to make small talk with us. I had the intentions of wanting a great experience and already had several years of online research under my belt prior to this first float of mine, so I knew what I was getting myself into. So I had a positive vibe going in, and was not guarded or defensive to chat with Donavon. I would suggest having that type of feeling as well. Be open to chatting with Donavon about anything and everything. I would suggest not having plans to be anywhere after the float so you can take your time getting to know him and talking about any questions you may have prior to the float. That's what I did, and that's how I found out Donavon is a pretty cool guy.Another major part that I liked about Donavon, is his honesty. During one part of our conversation, he mentioned, “for you Ben, you might not have a good experience b/c you already did your research and watched hours of videos of people's floats, and are looking forward to having those type of experiences. So your expectation levels are set high. Now your girlfriend who doesn't know what a sensory deprivation tank is better suited b/c she has no idea what to expect, so she has an unbiased view... so for you Ben, if your first float isn't what you expect, the second float will have much greater results than the first.” I appreciated his honesty, he is a business man and needs to make money to keep his business open, but he said to me, “your expectations are high and you might not get what you are hoping for, but the second time will be much greater than the first.” His sincerity was so easy to read. Another part were his honesty shines through, he said, “For first time floaters, I don't make them pay before they float, because if I do, they will only purchase 1 float. So I wait until after they had the float, to decide if they want to purchase “package float sessions” because there's quite a bit of savings rather than buying single floats... plus first time floaters are now educated in what a float truly offers and I would hate to make them buy a single float before they float and then when they are done they can't take advantage of the package float sessions.” I appreciated his honesty, as I said before, he is a business man and needs to make money to keep his business open, but yet his sincerity about wanting customers to be truly educate was so easy to read in his body language and tone of voice when he said that. When was the last time you met the owner of a company who still cares about wanting to provide the best to his or her customers???After we finished talking, Donavon showed us the facilities. We walked upstairs to the second floor and there was another peaceful living-room(foyer) type area to relax in. Then he walked us into another room located off to the right. When we opened the door to this second room, there waiting before us was the top-of-the-line-tank that is available on the market. The names of these tanks are called 'Dream Pods'. When the lid is open on the pod, different colored neon lights randomly change colors while your waiting to 'get into' the pod and 'close the lid'.Now inside this room Donavon is explaining to you the correct way of enter the pod, and 'what to do while in the pod' and 'what not to do, while in the pod.' (this is very important to listen, b/c a mistake can cost you $1000 USD to replace)After he finishes explaining everything to you, he leaves the room and you can then secure the door to be closed. Then do what he says and enjoy your experience in the 'Dream Pod.'

Loved it !!!!. I was a first time floater and will definitely be back. The owner was awesome in explaining the entire process and letting you know what to expect. The facility was absolutely spotless. I felt rejuvenated and de-stressed when I left. Now I just need to find one close to where I live. Thanks again!!

An experienced floater's opinion.... I have been living and working in Bangkok for almost 5 months, and I was really missing floating--an experience I had come to enjoy very much in Canada. I was thrilled to learn that my new city offers the same service! I have floated a total of about 6-7 times before trying the Bangkok Float Center, so I have something to compare this place to. I was super impressed with the cleanliness and overall decor of the establishment. Everything is luxury-spa style. There are two rooms, each on its own floor, complete with a foyer, couch, books, refreshments, get-ready mirror and bathroom supplies like contact solution, hair dryer, etc. The tank itself is in its own room, with a private bathroom and shower. The rooms are huge, clean, and dark--a great environment for pre- and post-floating. The dream pod is state-of-the-art, with its body temperature water, soft blue light, and accompanying music--you can choose to have it throughout the duration of the float, at the beginning and end of the float, or not at all--your preference. The experience within the tank, for me, was relaxing and totally worth the trip. For anyone who has not floated, some of the benefits of the experience include: relaxation, decreased stress, help with joint pain, immunity boost, reset sleep cycle, meditative aspects, tranquility, and an overall sense of euphoria. I have even heard of athletes using their time in the tank to visualize plays or movement patterns to make them better players in their game. When it came to getting there: living in Bangkok didn't put me ahead of any travelers, insofar as knowing how to navigate the city. However, Donovan (the owner of Bangkok Float Center) was more than helpful! Over the course of 3 phone calls, while we were still in transit, he was able to direct me and my friend to his shop using his seemingly-photographic descriptions of the surrounding area. The cost of the float package was 3000 baht for 6 hours--a very good deal. Included in the price is a handsome black t-shirt, the float itself, and access to water/coffee/tea/refreshments. The only issue I had was that the credit card payment option was not yet set up (but luckily, I thought to bring cash with me as well!). For anyone who is interested in this service, I would wholeheartedly recommend it for you! Donovan will take good care of you while you visit his shop. You will not regret it!

Fabulous for jet lag - my first stop after dropping off my bags!. I live here and travel for work - floating helps me get over jet lag and get right to work! This is now a must on my list to rejeuvenate and refresh. The relaxing decor is fantastic and adds to the experience. Donovan is so helpful and super friendly to ensure the whole experience is relaxing! Thank you for the great way to de-stress.
Total Mind and Body Reset. Tried this. Loved it. Will be back for more!Everybody should try this at least once. The place is clean, modern and close to the bangkok BTS sky train. Highly Recommend!
Clean, cozy and friendly.. They just opened so the equipment is brand new. The place is about one hour away from downtown Bangkok by BTS + taxi so it is not noisy, good for the experience.

Book a float today!. Having heard about the amazing experience of floating for quite some time, I was so happy to see that a Float Center had opened in Bkk so that I could give it a try.It is an incredibly calling experience and a perfect fit for the sometimes overwhelming city of Bkk.Donovan has put together a fantastic space and is a great guide for those wanting to try for the fist time. I will be back every time I'm in the city for sure!Highly recommended.

You have to try this!. Very very relaxing. Takes a while for you to allow yourself to let go but once you do it's a very rewarding experience.The facility is modern, very clean and the customer service is exceptional!Will be back again for sure!

Fantastic experience. I floated for the first time today. I wasn't sure what to expect but Donavan walked me through the process and made me comfortable. After floating for what seemed like 20 minutes I got really relaxed and felt like I went to sleep. I'm really not sure if I was awake or not. But time went by very fast and when I got out of the pod, I felt very light and relaxed. I'm going to try again the next time I'm in Bangkok!

Amazingly relaxing. I went for my first float today, it was an amazing experience. It has a very serene and relaxing feel, a very similar feel i get after a great meditation session. I came out with a clear head and nimble and relaxed muscles. I highly reccommend this service.

John C. Lilly would be proud. Though Sensory Deprivation Tanks are not technically new and have begun to successfully integrate in the modern spa, relaxation experience, they are still somewhat shrouded in mystery and apprehension. In most places, the average dollar per mystery is pretty high and the enlightening experience that these tanks give is out of reach for the every day college student. In the United States it is rare to find a spa offering floats for a similar price and still receive the attention that this Float Center gives.Bangkok Float Center is located a nice distance from the distractions of busy downtown Bangkok but still close enough to a BTS station to be reachable.Without going into too much detail, the center is vibrant and modern with an air of simplicity and minimalism befitting a spa of its type. It caters to every want a person could ask for when "debriefing" from their float, offering free coffee, tea, snacks and various creature comforts. As the practice of floating is common with artists, writers and other creative minds, the "debriefing" room also has a writing pad to let the mind project.The owner, Donovan, is a fantastic guy who understands the ins and outs of the process of floating. If you have any questions, concerns or apprehensions he will happily help. For a first time float, I wouldn't choose any other place.

Out of the world. I have been to this place twice so far and each time was a different but good experience. Firstly, there was no trouble getting a parking space and the location is just superb in the way that it is away from the hectic part of the city. Entering the place, it has a calming vibe to it and it's just relaxing whether you're just sitting there waiting or floating in the pod. One of the really great thing is everything has been prepared for you from shower lotion and shampoo all the way to earplugs and contacts solutions. There was nothing I had to prepare which made the whole experience even more enjoyable.In terms of experience, I don't think there's a second place in Bangkok which offers such an option. Floatation had really help me relieve my stress and contributes to my improved sleep. I feel more calm after it as well. Would like to recommend everyone to try it at least once.Last but not the least, I have to mention that Mr. Donavan who manages the place is just extremely friendly and supportive. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience there as well as the support from him.

Blew. My. Mind.. I've wanted to try a sensory deprivation tank since watching 'Altered States' back in the '80's.This desire was reawakened a short while ago by Joe Rogan. I live in Hong Kong & was planning a birthday trip for my partner when I discovered this float centre in Bangkok. I had to try it & knew Tracey would enjoy the experience. I easily booked two 90 minute float sessions for us via the website & was asked to arrive 15 minutes early to be briefed. We were both first time floaters. We were about 10 minutes late but Donovan, the owner, explained that the client who'd booked to follow us had just called & cancelled, which meant that our session time wouldn't be shorter than planned. Donavan made us feel very welcome & gave us some helpful tips for our time in the pod. We have some meditation skills, which I knew would help us relax in the pods, as well as contribute to a more fulfilling experience. After showering I stepped into the pod & after a few clumsy minutes adjusting to the new sensation of being weightless in a pod of water, I closed the lid, & switched off the lights.I began to focus on my breathe & was rewarded with a new and mind-blowing experience. As I relaxed into my focus, I was amazed at how loud my own breathing sounded. I then became intently conscious of my heart beat & could feel the blood surge around my body enabling me to actually feel my own brain. I could feel it's shape & profile through the pulsing of my blood . . . ! It seemed to extend in size beyond the boundary of my skull & as I wondered at this I felt wave after wave of relaxation pulse over my body, from my brain to my toes. Just when I thought I couldn't possibly become more relaxed, another pulse flowed down my body releasing tension - I perforated a disc in my lower back in a wake-boarding incident 15 years ago & have always carried a lot of tension in my back since. So this was excellent. As I wondered how much more relaxed I could become, I must have then slept for I felt myself emerge into consciousness feeling more excited & energised than I have felt for a very long time. I remember thinking that I must have fallen asleep, & I recall Donavan stating that you'll know when your session is complete, the same way that you can awaken from sleep not knowing what time it is, but knowing you've had enough rest. I attempted to relax further but was far too stoked. I knew the session wasn't over but now I was just fidgeting around in the tank. So, I climbed out, had a shower, & went downstairs to establish how long I had been in the tank. I actually had to ask Donavan if I'd only been in for 15 minutes, or whether I had been in longer. He laughed stating that I had 8 minutes left of my 90 minute session . . . Mind. Blown!So, I sat on the couch, drank some water, & talked to Donavan about my experience while waiting for Tracey to emerge from her session, which she also thoroughly enjoyed. I felt calm, my body felt relaxed, & I slept very well that night. We're both very keen to float again . . . & again. At the earliest opportunity.From my research, I understand that each float session improves upon the last. I highly recommend floating to everyone. Thank you Donavan!

Fancy a float?. This is a must for anyone interested in meditation,yoga or who just wants to relax and unwind from a busy work schedule. A totally natural way to eliminate stress and reach deep levels of relaxation. I couldn't stop smiling the whole next day! Loved it! Totally delicious brownies on sale that help take your float to a whole another level:) Book your appointment today.
Epic. First time float..amazing..immediately booked a secondary float..this is my new favourite thing to do...recommend 100%

First Time Floater- Amazing Experience. I have always wanted to try a sensory deprivation pod, and when I found out there was a new one in Bangkok, I had to try it! Before my float, Donovan, the owner, spent some time giving me some helpful tips for when I was in the pod. He was able to answer all my questions, and he was very open in telling me about his own float experiences, which I appreciated. He also spend some time introducing me to the 'Dream Pod' which was very important for me; at first the idea of closing yourself into a pod/tank can be intimidating, but he explained exactly how it works, and I became confident that the pod would be very safe and easy to use. I have always enjoyed yoga and meditation, and I think having some experience with meditation made this an even more amazing experience for me. Being weightless was a new and incredible experience in itself. As I started to relax more, I felt my heart beat slow down, and I was able to let my mind go. I felt some spots of long-held tension in my shoulders start to release. The only thing I heard for the whole hour and a half was my own breathing, which made it even easier to connect to my own mind and body. This was a very unique, introspective, and gravity-defying experience.After the floating experience, your mind can take some time to adjust to the outside world again, so right outside the float rooms, there's a comfy couch where you can sit, read, draw, journal, enjoy some drinks and snacks, and process your float before going back into reality! After my float I felt very calm, and I slept great that night. In the following days, I had a lot of energy and my body felt great all around. I'd love to back again, as I hear that your float gets better and better each time. I'd recommend this to anyone!

I loved the experience!. The Bangkok Float Center is an amazing place, really enjoyable and affordable. If you ever wondered what an Isolation Tank feels like, you will definitely benefit by going to the center for a float. Besides, the manager (Donovan) is a very kind guy who even came to pick me up with his car when I got lost looking for the place. You will enjoy talking to him.During the float, I managed to concentrate more on my meditation than ever before and the feeling of relaxation that came afterwards was amazing. It is highly recommendable and if you try it once, you will definitely go back for a second or third float.In case you are locking for a unique experience, go visit the Bangkok Float Center, you will be glad you did ;) And tell Donovan I said hi

Value for money. After hearing about 'floating' from the Joe Rogan podcast I gave it ago at the Bangkok Float Center, compared to the price back home it's less than half price. The setup Donavan has is great and he spent around 20 minutes talking to me before my float on how best utilize my time in there. After coming out I felt totally refreshed like a new person. I had some cool floating experiences inside too which made it 100% better. If you are here on holiday or an expat living in Bangkok I would suggest everyone to try this at least once. I'm hooked after my first float and I will be going back for more.I would suggest going in for at least 1.5 hours.

Totally relaxing meditative pathway - float away. Being into meditation and experiencing the sensations of the inner worlds, I really looked forward to try the float tank - and I was not disappointed in any ways.I was met by the owner, a down to earth, calm and friendly guy who made the total experience just perfect. Very easy to relax around, giving a good picture of some of the distressing and calming benefits of floating, since he floats every day - If only I could do the same : )The facilities are simple, welcoming, clean and calm. I was taken through the process in a very understandable manner, and then left to take a shower before starting my 90min session.The first notice I took, lasted throughout the entire session - It's so relaxing, unlike anything else. After a while, the body started going into a dreamlike state whilst I was still alert and could enjoy the relaxation as well as feeling a widening of my consciousness - This in a kinda "non Efford mode", no stress from sounds, lights, back pains and general discomfort one may experience during a sitting meditation. I have spend a great deal of time meditating, which properly gave me a some advantages - but clear the float in itself will have a profound effect for people in early states of meditating practice or even for total novices. It "shows" you the way, as long as you give in to the water, relax totally and just concentrate on breathing.Even though my focus is on the inner experience, one could easily go for simply just having a total new and relaxing experience - it kinda resets the body, and shows the way to a less tense and more relaxed feel that your body will remember and call upon when needed.I hope to float more before leaving BKK, and in general : )

First floating experience!. I went yesterday with a friend and it was really cool. The owner was very friendly and the place had a very calm atmosphere, like a spa. Floating in the tank was unique, I've never experienced anything like it, the salt water keeps youcompletely floating. They play calm music and you could really lose yourself in there. I got so calm I actually fell asleep, which was too bad cause I missed quite a bit haha.I recommend you go there and check it out, floating is unlike anything we do in our day to day. Hope I'll go there again in a couple of weeks.

I had a great time, very relaxing and enjoyable experience. I went there today (first time ever trying this) with a friend and the owner was very kind and explained to us everything and was very kind. The float center is very clean and looks great, the float experience itself was very interesting for me as a first time user. I will be going back!

Not consistent. My first visit for a four hour full body massage scrub and Sasual was so amazing my husband and I went back the next day for a foot massage. When I had my foot massage the girl was not paying attention and really did not do a very good job. Luckily my husband had a seasoned professional Who did a great job and he really enjoyed himself. So my recommendation would be if you go there and find somebody you like, always request them. If you go there and didn't find someone you like, try for someone else next time. The four hour full body was definitely worth it and I would do that again

Full Spa package. I took my family from the USA to have a full spa for the first time. Normally I take the Thai massage or aroma, but the spa had a package so we treated ourselves to the full deal. All I can say after nearly 4 hours of relaxation we all came away feeling totally refreshed. The rooms were first class and the staff new how to make us comfortable and totally stress free.My sister and husband shared a room but for myself I liked to be totally switched off from the outside world. So if your in Bangkok give the spa a try, I don't think your regret it.

Relaxing and luxurious!. I had thai massage in the first day and booked a body scrub for the next day. Nice athmosphere, excellent customer service and services were reasonably priced but still the quality was high. Very good way of relaxing when having a jetlag.

Best massage in the world! . This place is not only very classy and extremely customer service oriented but also the place where I have experienced the best massage I have ever received in terms entire world! My masseuse knew exactly where my knots were and massaged them enough (heating up my muscles) to where it was a bit painful but stopped before it became too painful. After receiving this head shoulder and back massage I am free of tension and am so relaxed. I truly enjoyed this massage!

Excellent experience!. Clean and very nice place! Also very kind and professional staff. I did the 2.5 hours package scrub & massage and it was excellent! One of the best places for massage.Had the best time finishing there my trip in Thailand.

Very Reasonable Thai Massage. The serene setting of the Dahra spa was a welcome respite from the busy streets of Bangkok. It was peaceful, quiet and the staff were very friendly. While it was difficult to find (down the street from Pullman G Hotel) by tuk tuk, it was worth the hassle.The massage started with the typical washing of your feet and then we were escorted upstairs to the massage room. Once inside, we were asked to change clothes to a traditional top and matching Thai fisherman pants. Once dressed, we laid on a cushion on the floor. I previously asked for medium pressure, but quickly asked for strong pressure. The massage wasn't the type of Thai massage that I was accustomed to and I fell asleep several times.(Typically, I do not fall asleep during a Thai massage since it is full body engagement.) However, it was still nice to receive a two hour massage for only 720 baht per person.If you are in the area, I definitely think it is worth the visit.

Spa indulgence. Booking was a breeze and front desk service was excellent. However I really dislike the part when the masseur kept massaging and uncover my blossom area and I feel really embarrassed. Too much focus and massaging around these area and I don't enjoy it at all. Overrall massage at the back area and scrub is good. Minus the complaint I have as above, I will definitely be back again. Me and my husband opted for full spa package.
Nice technique & kind wellcome. Nice technique, kind wellcome and cozy rooms. Both reception staff and massages staff were kindfull.

Heaven in Earth!. If you only have a few hour in Bangkok, make you sure that you are able to visit this amazing place. Charming and caring staff, incredible massage cabinets and facilities (even you will be provided with a clean pajama to prevent that your clothes get dirty because of the massage oil) and a complete and satisfying experience of how a traditional thai massage is done. The price is much more than reasonable, we are paying almost ten times for a service like this in our country. Just to make yourself clear about how amazing is this place, we spent 3 days in Bangkok and we went twice. Trust me, for an authentic and valuable thai massage, visit Dahra.
Wonderful spa. It's a wonderful place to relax and unwind.Massages are great. The masseuses are friendly and you have a private room with shower which also is neat and clean.

Nice Spa shop. I live in Pullman hotel G, nearby the hotel have many spa and massage shop.
I choose Dahra beauty and spa because the staff is very friendly to introduce the package. After the spa and massage, my mother and me feel very relax. We went to Dahra only in this trip.

Amazing body scrub and facial! Elegant and classy SPA, very relaxing atmosphere. I found the SPA to be elegant designed with top taste. I would describe it as "minimalist classy". This made the atmosphere for the treatments/therapies I got very relaxing. I had a body scrub and a facial and a massage :-). All were great. The quality of the service and the kindness of the staff was irreproachable: they were excellent. I highly recommend the Dahra . Try the body scrub treatments.

Pretty good. Take the packages when they have offer. The massage was ok, the whole experience was okay. It was amazing, but the price is still consider quite good for tourists who wants a better experience. It could be slightly pricey for some people. I booked online which provides discount as well.

Amazing massage! Best way ever to recover from "Jet Lag"! Clean and Air conditioned.. The first day I had the s Swedish massage and oil massage and asked for hard pressure and I got it, it was the best massage I have ever had. My husband and 2 friends had the Traditional Thai combined with the Royal Thai massage and loved it too. Two hours of pure pleasure for all 4 of us. On Our second day we all did Reflexology and it was absolutely amazing. Its cheap too. The 2 hour Thai/Royal massage was 900 BAHT and we got 20% off for booking online. The Reflexology was only 400 BAHT and another 20%off. I would definitely visit this spa again. Easy to find on Siloam Road. 15 minute walk from the Mandarin Oriental near a lot of Tailors.

Massage at Dahra beauty and spa. My wife and I had a two hour massage at Dhara. We were at their Silom branch. We had an excellent time,starting with a foot massage to a full body,head,neck and shoulder massage for 720 bahtWe both felt totally relaxed and refreshed after the session.You need to call and book ahead or email your appointments as they are usually full.The place is clean and has a nice ambience. You finish off your massage with a nice refreshing tea.Highly recommend them!!

so relaxing . I stayed in Bangkok with my wife and whilst there we visited Dahra 4 times during our short stay. Upon arrival you are served tea, offered a large range of massages and slippers. What I loved was you could turn up here late after a night out and the staff are so friendly and would relax you. Of the places on Silom Road this was by far the cleanest most luxurious establishment. As with all such places in Bangkok, the prices were reasonable. Before you start the staff wash your feet and take you upstairs to start. As a couple we were given a massage at the same time in the same room.Definitely well worth a visit when in Bangkok.

Very good massage and service. Place is clean. Massage is of quality and staff is polite and helpful. In between massages, we were given an option of showering and once again after the aromatherapy massage. The thai massage was value for money. Definitely will come back again on next trip!

Nice relaxing massage. Great service and experience. The outlook is not the most impressive, but the interior rooms and washroom are clean and ambience is comforting. Very relaxing and the massage is great

First ever massage. Went with my girlfriend for a traditional Thai Massage while we stayed in Bangkok. Very professional and put me at ease straight away as I didn't particularly know what to expect. Got a Royal Thai Massage which seemed great value for money. Would recommend.
Fantastic experience in Bangkok. My husband and I wanted to receive a thai massage and the experience in Dahra was fantastic. The staff is very friendly and professional.
Great Spa. Service was outstanding and friendly. I visited 4 times in 10 days. I highly recommend Dahra for a relaxing and invigorating Spa!

Fantastic massage. Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic!
Nice environment, skilled Therapists, good selection of treatments available. Spa location easy to reach.
Staff are all very nice and polite! Will definitely come again when I'm here next time!
5 stars!. My wife and I had a PROFESSIONAL Thai massage. Next time we visit thailand we're going back! Also, the complimentary tea after the massage was amazing!

Excellent, the best massage!!. Awesome massage in Bangkok!! The best way to relax after hour flying, very good treatment and the best sevice that you can imagine. All this for a very good price! Hopefully we come back!!

Superb Massage. Had a 2-hour massage - Royal Thai plus Neck and Shoulder. My tensed muscles were clearly relaxed after the massage. Fab experience at a great value for money. Will certainly return again!

BEST MASSAGE!. My husband and I both got massages here and we both walked away saying it was our BEST massage we have ever gotten (we got the Swedish massage)! It was so good we booked one more before our departure back home. The place is luxurious, clean and has a great staff. If your looking for a day at the spa and don't mine paying a little more than true Bangkok prices look no further you won't regret it!

Janet. We had a great and relaxing time at the spa. We booked for a couples room but end up separated because no couples room were available..Overall experience was very relaxing, clean place, aircon was a bit cold and hubby end up with a flu.

No complaints!. Friendly staff, tranquil surroundings and great massages. We got the one hour Swedish massage and found it to be great value for money. Maybe a little pricier than some other places but worth it.

Just okay . I made a last minute reservation here on Friday. My boyfriend and I did a 1:5 hours 4 hands massage. Both of us realised the 2 masseur's are not aligned (one is strong and another one is average) and they chat and giggle when doing the massage, which is kind of annoying.

Great massage without any issues. . The massage was great, the staff was receptive, professional, courteous and the building itself was very clean and tranquil. The prices are very reasonable considering the quality of the massage, I'd love to come here again!

Great. We chose this spa because they also offered just a Thai massage and not a huge beauty and massage package for an affordable prize (just students) and our first impression was already really good, especially compared to the other offers of Thai massages at every corner. Staff is really nice and the Thai massage was really good :)

Tranquility in the Heart of Bangkok. Pleasant lobby, friendly greetings, attentive staff. Very quiet and relaxed ambience. We were greeted promptly during entry, and service was still excellent after the massage session. Massage was excellent. Temperature was just right, not too cold, not too warm.
Always my favourite spa. Here is good, my husband and I visited so many times. Never disappointed. Good location, it's close to BTS station, good price and excellent service.

One of The best I have ever tried. I was introduced by a collegue of mine who had been attending this Spa for long time and from that time on, I use to go there every time I am in Bangkok . First, it is really a serious place to go for a real massage. Catalogue is complete and you can choose among many solutions, The place is very clean and comfortable, service is kind and professional and The price are cheap if compared by quality. I strongly reccommend to stop here for relaxing and enjoy real thai hospitality
Really nice and relaxing traditional Thai massage. The venue was very clean and had a great ambiance. One of the best traditional Thai massages I had whilst on any of my 3 trips to Thailand.

Not so good. Went for Thai Herbal Massage which was honestly a little disappointing. There was no headrest, just a regular pillow. We asked for "medium" strength as I'm petite, but sometimes it feels like she was just holding my legs. The herbal compress was extremely hot. I did herbal compress in Batam and loved it. But this time round it was too hot! I was not relaxed at all, more like afraid of getting burnt. My mom did spa though and she enjoyed it. Staff was very nice and friendly, place is huge and clean too.

Best massage... Well worth the money paid. We both had a neck shoulder and head massage. What you pay for is a lot more than this. Initally you receive a foot bath then taken upstairs to start the massage. Pressure was great and they also do your back as well. Would definately recommend to anyone.

Perfect place to relax!. It was easy to make reservation online, and you can get a huge discount from online booking. I booked 3.5 hr package deal, and it was AMAZING! 1 hour body scrub, 1 hour facial, 1 hour massage, and 30 mins body wrap. The cost was 68USD!!! I was so relaxed after a 24 hour flight from the U.S. The spa was very clean and comfortable. My massage therapist was very good. It was quiet and calm in the spa. She offered hot tea after each treatment. There's a shower in the room, and you wash yourself after each treatment. I was in heaven! I highly recommend this spa. Worth the money and time!

Massage . Being in Bangkok we couldn't simply miss the massage... As there are many many places that are offering massage in there we couldn't really decide... Dahra Beauty & Spa is located near Furana Silom Hotel ( where we stayed in) and I must say- it's a great value for money and amazing massage. We had a foot massage and aromatherapy - omg!Strongly recommend!

Perfect Beaty and Spa massag by Dahra on Silom road. I went to Dahra Beauty & Spa for a Full Spa Treatment. It was wonderfull and they were so Nice to me. It was My frist time to do this, complete body Treatment, but I had a wonderfull experience. Normaly I take a oil massage. Everything was very clean in the Spa and the staf was very friendly. I can recommend this Spa on Silomroad.

Just relax!. I made a reservation via Internet 3 days before the treatment, confirmation was rcvd quite fast. I enjoyed a wonderful relaxing time with a 2hours massage- Royal Thai and Neck/Head/Shoulders in a nice athmosphere. The welcome was very warm. I could take a shower after the treatment. The price is unbeatable compared to german rates, I paid THB 720,- / rough EUR 18,-The place is easy to find right in the center of Silom, close to Patpong market on the main street.

One great, one not so great experience. I had a manicure and pedicure and can honestly say my nails were better before - over buffed and weakened & broken afterwards. Full body massage was great - therefore id recommend for massage not beauty treatments!

With plenty of choices this is still an excellent one to try. We found this place by accident, not sure how you would find anything in Bangkok with purpose – it’s too big and chaotic. So glad we did and also we were delighted that it rated highly on trip advisor. This place is spacious, modern , very western with a Thai touch. The girls all speak enough english to get by and understand and talk about treatments and the girls at the reception are professional and efficient. The whole place runs like a well-oiled machine, on time start and finish and great daily specials. So much better than many many places in Australia. The quality of the treatments was also first class, my husband had foot Massage and then back and shoulder treatments , I had a manicure and pedicure and she took all the time needed to make them look fantastic. Properly trained girls who know what they are doing. Highly recommended. There are hundreds of places to have these treatments done all around you, many have the girls sitting out in the heat looking depressed, Dahra looks like the place you would go to back at home and this counts for a lot. It is busy and that’s because its good.

"They very thinnnn and boneyyy". I didn't say that. It was the friendly Thai lady sitting on the corner of a nondescript street where our tuk tuk driver dropped us when we were on our way to Dahra. We were looking for the place and she was more than happy to point out that it wasn't the best place to go to. I asked why and that was what she said. Being skeptical tourists (there are pros and cons, of course), we were not sure if she was being honest or just trying to get us to another spa. She recommended another spa but when we asked her where the place is, she said, "It is very farr from there." Okay. Not so encouraging especially when it was rush hour.So we said bye to her (she had the nicest smile ever) and thought we should just give Dahra a try considering that we already made our booking. We went in, waited for a bit (minus points for that) and 1.5 hours later, came out agreeing 100% with the lady. Yes, the session was good and the price was right but would I go there again? Nope.

can put you to sleep. I have a 1-hour traditional Thai message. They let me took a shower first which is good. Also the room is quiet most of time. I almost falled into sleep at the last 10mins. It will be better only if they have a bigger receiption area.

Not so good. Unfortunately, I had high hopes for this place as it was recommended on TripAdvisor as being a great spa in the vicinity of where we were staying in Bangkok. My friend and i booked a Full Spa Treatment and were delighted to see that it was a 50% discount for booking online. On arrival the place was very busy with walk-ins and booking ready to be served. The receptionist was lovely and tried her best to pay attention to us as we waited patiently. The Full Spa Treatment includes a facial, wrap, scrub and massage. We started with a facial. My friend and I were placed in the same room, lucky, as her face started burning from the cream and I asked that instead of a facial she get a foot massage. My facial was average at its best and the lady left for extended periods of time for the hour. We ended up walking out after the facial and substitute massage due to lack of attention, bright lights and too much noise. We will not return. Too many other great options to even give this place a second chance.

Great experience . Went after getting a booking online to enjoy a whopping 50% discount on full spa treatment, welcoming staff , nice and clean environment. Go for a relaxing time and book via phone to avoid any inconvenience. Saw people returning back since they were fully booked. I'll recon Silom branch since it's more older and have more experienced staff.

Excellent, professional spa at good value. Highly recommended. I booked 2 appointments online (with 20% discount) prior to arrival in bangkok for my husband and me. All correspondence was dealt with efficiently and professionally. On the day of the first appointment, though, when checking my emails I realised that I had managed to book it for the day before! We quickly contacted the spa just 15 mins before the appointment to see if they could fit us in, and set off on our way as we thought that it would be a nice walk in any case even if we couldn't get the treatments. As soon as we arrived, the receptionist knew that it was us and welcomed us kindly. She had just had a call from the manager who saw my email, and they had managed to get ready for us (a one-hour foot massage for both of us) in the 15 mins! She didn't make me feel silly about my booking error either. The foot massage was amazing, and really relaxing after our day of shopping. We returned the day after for the combo treatment of back and neck massage followed by a thai all-body massage. Again this was set up as a couples massage, and was relaxing yet firm. The welcome drink and after treatment drink were both great, too. We were fully aware that we could get massages cheaper than at Dahra, but for a professional service, and a proper spa-feel, we thought that it was excellent value when booked online, and would highly recommend Dahra to anyone staying in the Silom area!

Amazing experience!. The friendliness and professionalism of the staff is awesome. The spa is very clean and there is a zen vibe everywhere which is essential for complete relaxation. The services offered are numerous and the prices are fair and very competitive. I will definitely return and strongly recommend it!

Highly recommended! . Was walking along Silom Road, trying to get somewhere just decent for a foot massage. Lots of those, with masseurs sitting at the entrance, looking almost like vultures preying for a customer. Felt so lucky to discover this amazing place at past 10pm. They accommodated my sis and me. Very beautifully decorated place, relaxing and quiet environment. The masseur never give any sore spots a chance. Hit on all of them! Good job! I'm already planning my next visit tomorrow!

Good value; excellent facial treatment. Been here twice in two years! An unassuming spa at a cursory glance but with great service and offerings once you step in. On my most recent visit, I checked their packages but settled on customizing my own combo and spent about 2,245 baht and an additional 10% tip for one chocolate body scrub, one Thai massage (no oil), and one facial treatment. Wonderful service. Cozy spot. Highly recommended.

Relax & revive. I've been here a number of times and it is always a good experience. Friendly reception and professional staff make this a top place to reinvigorate after a long flight etc. Highly recommended.

Amazing foot massage!!. Went here for the foot massage! If I remember correctly it was 45 minutes for 400 baht.The Spa is clean and has a calm atmosphere, the reception is welcoming and friendly :)The footmassage left my feet feeling so soft and it literally felt like walking on air for a few days.I would recommend to go here instead of the cheap massage places you can find further down the street.
Relaxing!. Excellent reception, professional staff and internet discount made this first day in Bangkok absolutely perfect!!

Promotion, Promotion, Promotion!. I recently booked the deluxe spa treatment on promotion and the overall value was excellent. The package included a body scrub, body wrap and aromatherapy massage. The room was clean and my attendant was very good and attentive to my problem areas. I would highly recommend, especially if you can take advantage of the promotion.

Spa package. Got good comments on this spa and good discount too. Lucky, one of the branch was near the hotel we stayed. We decided to book the 3hr 45 min spa package before we depart BKK. The whole processes were good though may not a good massage that we had tried. Environment and facilities were up to date.

Phenomenal couples massage experience. My wife and I went there and got a couples massage: head, neck, and shoulders. Phenomenal experience all around. A/C was comfortable. Even though the massage was titled head, neck, and shoulders, the first half hour was a standard Thai massage of full body, which we liked. Very reasonable price too!

real thai massage. i just entered the place, asked if there is anyone free and i got lady with amazing hands who literally killed all the bones in my body...i loved itprice was very good considering how nice place is and whole treatmenti could have booked over the web but decided just to check and i was lucky

Relax after the flight. Book on the net, you ll get a 50 percent discount on the full spa package. A great pampering deal after 11 hours of plane. Pro people, nice atmosphere, great products applied on the skin, including facials.

AWESOME. Best massage I ever had in Bkk. I took a 3hour 45min spa package at less than 2500thb (promotion) and really felt rejuvenated after. The service was so impeccable that I felt compelled to tip them! Also, this is cheaper than many bigger chains such as let's relax in Bkk. The service rendered is top notch. The staff were professional and very polite. Place was very clean and very relaxing. This will definitely be my go to place in Bkk from now on! I fully recommend.

Value for money. The staff were polite and considerate despite that I couldn't show up on time due to the flight delay. The receptionist were still so cheerful and show her understanding which made me feel really welcomed.

Best massage we had in Thailand. On our 3 weeks trip we tried a couple of massage places, this one was by far the best. You feel they are well prepared and know where to press and what to move. In other places it sometimes felt quite random. The atmosphere is also very nice, the building has various floors, all very nicely equipped, wooden floor etc. And all the staff is extremely friendly. W/ the 20% online discount a 1h Thai massage is 400BHT, a little more expensive than an average tourist place on the street, but it's definitively worth it!

Excellent place for massages. During our stay in Bangkok we have been there three times for massages. The traditional Thai is great. The staff is very friendly. The place is very clean and prices are fair. In order to get an massage it is helpful to book in advance. Next time I am in Bangkok I will go there again, for sure.

Best place for a Full Spa session.. Not new to Dahra Spa -- been coming here every single time I do trips to Bangkok. The best place to go for massage -- that's a definite. Though I do enjoy their full spa service. After long days of work/flight -- there's no harm pampering ourselves right? The staffs are very professional and they do know what they're doing. But please, make a reservation before coming because they're normally all booked up.

Very pleasant and relaxing. I am not really a massage person, but my wife wanted to go, so off we went. It is well about the usual 200 baht massage places you find, both in quality and experience. The staff really seemed to know what they were doing, and it was an all around pleasant place. Be advised that you might need to make a reservation, as the place books up quickly.
3hours package . 3hours package after 12hours of flight and it was just so nice full relax, clean and discount on the christmas period Thank you
Great Massage!. First class experience for a fraction of the price of similar massages in the US. It's worth paying a little bit more in Bangkok to get a clean, professional place like this.
soothe your tired body here. Ambience was good, service is good, and most importantly when we booked online, there was a 2 for the price of 1 promotion! Very value for money.

Smelly average massage place. PricingOkay. Quality lacking for pricing though ServiceThe masseuse are friendly but kinda lazy with the massages. The entire massage was with her elbows on my back. No palms or fingers massages. Elbows are easier to do as it doesn't need much energy. My husband kept on asking for more pressure and the masseuse kept on giggling. He wasnt joking. Do your job. SettingThe rooms were big and the temperature were adjusted based on treatment ie less cold when doing body scrubs versus more ac for body wraps. The shower is a whole other story. It smells like someone forgot to flush their toilet for a week. Awful smell. It was quite dirty as well. For the full spa package it required 3 showers. One at the start, one after the scrub and another after the wrap. OMG it stinks. Im not the first to comment. Why is this still a problem?

good couples massage. My wife and I had a one hour Royal Thai massage here. We just walked in off the street after walking past. We thought it looked good and gave it a try.It cost 400THB each, great value for money and the massage was good. My wife is going to return to get a body scrub and facial treatment. Normally that's my job.
The best. Very professional service, and excellent prices truly the best. Unforgettable experience definitely will recommend this place to anyone who visits Bangkok.
A day at the spa. We went here because of trip advisor. The service was to notch and the experience pleasurable but slightly over priced when comparing to others afterwards.

Can be better. I read good reviews and like that they have 50% off discount for full day massage and 20% off regular massage. I tried their aroma body massage. The shower had a bad mold smell so it feels dirty. The bed is not comfortable it was on the floor which should be used for thai massage, not aroma body massage.
Relaxing in Bangkok - Afternoon at the Beauty Salon!. Nice staff, clean and efficient, Peaceful. Good Value for money. Booked on line using there special 50% discount November deal.
Pampering . Great spa. Went for a Massage and pedicure. Enjoyed both. Going back soon if I can for a foot massage. Clean place. Everyone was attentive and nice. Friendly people! Good experience.

A great experience.. I received a full body massage and it was one of the best. The masseuse was very gentle and knowledgeable about how and when to apply pressure on the tired body. I really enjoy it and would go back anytime.
Great escape!. a bliss from start to finish! very welcoming & professional staff. I recommended to all my friends!The rooms are spacious and clean, save and the prices are appropriate.
Great Spa. I had a Thai und Feet Massage at this beautiful Spa.It is a very reliable and clean location and it was a pleasure to be there,10 points!

Excellent massage by any standard. This spa has more than skillful, attentive masseurs. It has all the box checked for what it takes to be a top notch spa. Superb ambience with spa music played in the background. Warm drinks & hot towels served at the beginning and end of massage. Staff working there is patient, attentive and polite. We tried the Thai Herbal Massage. One of the best massages I have ever tried. Will definitely go back to try other packages! Simply top notch!

Unbelievably Great. After several massages in the past, this was my first Thai massage and it was the best. I had a two hour "combination massage" with Ning, and now I don't want to leave Bangkok. I asked for it "strong" and several time during the massage I thought I may have to ask her to lighten-up, but I stuck it out, and glad I did. Ning was fantastic. Luckily my tour returns here in a week, so I'll get another opportunity for bliss. It felt like every muscle and tissue was being rearranged, which was exactly what I needed. If you don't like it strong, you can go either mild or medium.

3 hours of bliss. The location was a mere 2-3 mins from where we were staying - Pullman Bangkok hotel G. Read good reviews about it and decided to give it a try. No regrets on doing so. We got ourselves a couple room and did our respective spa treatment. The facilities and amenities provided were great. The masseuse was skillful and very friendly. No complains here and we enjoyed our awesome spa experience!

Excellent spa treatment.. My wife booked me a 3 hour spa package (chocolate themed) and it was excellent. I worked in the Resort and 4-5* hotel industry for a while and am used to high class spa treatments and surroundings. Dahra was definitely of the high standards others have been mentioning online. The spa room itself was so beautiful and relaxing and the lady working on me for three hours did great, a bit rough around my neck region, but otherwise outstanding. Friendly atmosphere and great products used. I will definitely come back again to try other treatments.

4 hours of bliss. Using their website, I booked a 4 hour special which included basically everything (massage, facial, body scrub, body mask etc). We stayed at pullman bangkok g which was a short walk from dahra. This was perfect after our long flight and I enjoyed every minute of it. The honey milk body mask was delicious. You are basically naked the whole time which was no big deal but some may not be comfortable with this as you are asked to shower between treatments which can be awkward going from shower to massage table again and again. Definitely will be back but might try couples massage or something

Good Spot recommended by hotel. Dahra was recommended to me by the Pullman G hotel. I got a head, neck and shoulder massage on day 1. It was good and very cheap, although they didn't ask me if I wanted to take off my bulky sweater before and I got a little bit hot during the massage. It was strange that they brought in multiple other people during my massage in the shared room, but fine since I paid less than $10 for a half hour.I went back the next day for a full body massage- the room was private (separated by curtains from other rooms) and the massage was good and professional. I love thai massage where they stretch you- it's like yoga without having to do any of the work! I think the hour long full body was around $12.I would definitely go back!

Brand new Sukhumvit branch. Enticed by the 50% off the Full Spa Treatment, we decided to give this place a chance!It's easy to locate - just a few mins walk from Holiday Inn and upon arrival, we were greeted by the friendly receptionist. The facility looks and feels very new, clean, and posh (check out the jacuzzi in the couples' room!)Now the service - I loved the scrub & the wrap, but I don't rate the facial and massage highly... There was an unpleasant sensation during the facial session (possibly due to the product used?), and I felt that the therapist wasn't exactly well-versed in giving facials. The massage wasn't "strong" enough for me and my partner (despite requesting for it), and my masseuse didn't ask me which area to focus on...It's not the best spa experience I've had in Bangkok, but considering the price I paid - it is quite a bargain.

Near Pullman Bangkok G. Just a 2 mins walk from Pullman Bangkok G is this gem of a spa. Great ambience and reasonable prices, with great service and a technically massage. My wife and I visited Dahra Spa twice in 2 days. We took the foot reflexology, facial treatment, Thai massage and back + head massage treatments. It was worth it. We were quite satisfied with our visit and recommend this spa to others.

Great spa. I have visited the Sukhumvit branch of Dahra Spa a few times in recent weeks. Friendly and professional service, great massages and treatments and a very relaxing atmosphere. Really love visiting this spa, the staff always make me feel very welcome. I will continue to visit!

Hidden Gem. I am hesitant to rate Dahra Spa because I don't want anyone to know about it ! I have been to the spa on 2 different trips to Bangkok and every time had a great experience. First time was with a group of friends and we booked out the whole spa, second time with my husband. The facilities are tasteful and clean, the personnel very very friendly and competent, online booking is no problem and for those who don't speak Thai English is a good standard. The value for money is just amazing! Can only wholeheartedly recommend.

Perfect. Excellent  My daughter and I got a footmassage. Allthough she was 7 at time it was a magnificent experience for her. The girls were very friendly and did their work carefully. Many respect for this place. Great!!!!

Exceptional. We were recommended this Spa at Silom Road before we travelled to Thailand, since our hotel was nearby. Booking and reception went all perfect. Specially their advice during the booking process before departing to Bangkok.I took aromatherapy massage and highly recommend it if you want to relieve tension. The therapist was very professional and would love to repeat next time I'm in Bangkok.Facilities are great, providing you a relaxing atmosphere and a magnificent massage experience.

Ultimate relaxation . This would be the second time that my wife and I have been to Dahra Spa. Great professional staff. It's a great way to spend a morning. One feels like a new person to the full treatment. Value for my money with the online discounts.

Nice spa when it offers a steep discount. This is a chain of spas around Bangkok. The one on Silom opened just recently and was offering a 50% discount on a four hour package which included a body scrub, body wrap, milk bath, massage and facial. This spa is calm and soothing and my therapist was excellent with all treatments. The only flaw is the lack of a bathroom on the second floor, where the treatment rooms are, and also a smell of mildew in the showers. Being a spa this could easily be covered up by the scent of a given massage oil. All in all if the sale is still going on, don’t hesitate to come here.

Excellent Spa and Massage in Bangkok. This Massage and Spa is really a nice and clean space in Bangkok Silom Road. Staff is very friendly and therapist know hot to massage and kill the pain in your back. It is a relaxing place and you can forget about the loud and stressful Bangkok streets when you are there. There was a discount for online booking of 20% but prices are fair anyway. More expensive than a common massage parlor but much cheaper than the Hotel spas but on same quality and cleanless level.

Dahra silom. Amazing experience at dahra! I was at bkk for 3 nights, and i visitied dahra twice! Once for massage and the other facial. It's reasonably priced and even better when you book online, additional 20% off! I really love the ambience in the spa, dim and cozy. Therapists were extremmely friiendlly as well! A must visit when in bkk!
Full body spa is Very nice. Friendly staff with warm welcome. I took full body spa and it was super amazing. Inlove with the natural spa products they used.
Wonderful Experience!!!. Calm and soothing atmosphere and well experienced staff. The One of the genuine massage centers in Bangkok.

Our favourite in Bangkok .
