If you are visiting Bangkok and wants a time of quality relax, you need to go there...My husband and I were in our honeymoon ( luckily staying at hotel Pullman near by ).Our first night we were tired after travelling and wanted to just to find a good massage place nearby... We have discovered this place and read good reviews about it, so we wenf and booked the Traditional Thai Massage... IT WAS AMAZING...We ended up going there every night to get a nice massage ( the foot massage is really good as well )....We can't forget about this amazing experience there... :)Many thanks for the workers there who were so nice and friendly...By the way, the tea that they offer after finishing is now my favorite ( a nice employee there wrote me the name of the tea on paper and explained to me how to prepare it )... I have it with me here back home and I enjoyed it from time to time... ;) Thanks agai

Simply amazing....... One of the best spa treatments I've had in Bangkok. A must-visit! I went with the Full Spa Treatment which included a body scrub, body wrap, aromatherapy massage, and a facial. You can choose from 5 different products to use with your body scrub and wrap depending on what results you'd like; I recommend the white sesame and yoghurt for the scrub and honey milk for the wrap. What I love most about is this place is the zen vibe and attentive staff who always checks if it's the right temperature for this, or are they being too rough on that. And when my legs became numb during the facial after hours of lying down and being pampered, the lady noticed and gave me a complimentary leg massage which made it disappear.So for only 2500 baht (as part of their promotional period), I received all of that and more, so prepare to give them a big tip because it's amazing value and they truly deserve it! :)

pain in the resort. This is a BEAUTIFUL venue. It was very high class with reasonable prices. I got a deal for a 2 hour massage. I was ill prepared for how painful a thai massage could be. I was unable to embrace the escape of the massage because I felt every second of it. It was also FREEZING. Although the humidity outside is unbearable, after about 15 minutes, it could get unbearably cold inside there. The hot tea made a difference and it smelled wonderful.

2nd visit in 2 years. Still provide the high standard at a reasonable price. Service is good and spa is nicely decorated and clean.Went for the full spa treatment and can't complain for the price I paid. It's pampering from head to toes. Highly recommended

Relaxing spa. Cozy spa and had my facial done - it was so relaxing that I felt asleep and when by the time I wake up my skin is all cleaned up and refreshed again. Staff was courteous and accommodating as I was late because the taxi driver got lost here earlier. Watch for discounts when booking online.
Aromatherapy. When I got to Bangkok, I made sure I checked this place out, as it was referred to by a friend from the States. Do their aromatherapy session, it is worth it!

Dahra, new team not as friendly. I live in Bangkok, and I've gone to Dahra massage several times each year. I went there today, and it had been maybe 6-months since my last visit. I was suprised that the entire staff had changed, and the massage ladies simply weren't as friendly as before.

Good Spa :). The Swedish massage was really good. The room was spacious and the entire massage was soooo good. The only thing is that I should have booked for 1.5 hours or more.:)The facial needs to be improved- there are no extractions or steam treatment. It is more of painting the face with creams and / or oils. Dahra Spa needs to improve its facials. Massages are great.The staff is good except for 1 portly female receptionist who does not really know the vicinity well and has no change of money. This is an area that needs to be improved.

Very relaxing Spa. It's my second visit to this spa and have never failed to give me a great experience. The staff are very courteous. Check out their website, they provide certain discounts when booked online. This is my spa of choice whenever I visit Bangkok.

Good and Soothing Massage. We tried Dahra Spa because it was located fairly close to our hotel (the Le Meridien), and were quite pleased with the quality of the massage as well as the overall spa environment (not very large, but clean and peaceful). Always useful to check out their discounted packages and book online before you go, as you would not only pay less but may also get recommendations on better deals. It's not the easiest to get here unless you're staying in one of the hotels nearby, as there's no BTS station in the vicinity.
Totally relax. The staffs there is friendly. The massage and spa skill is great. Walking distance to BTS station. Service is great! Value for price. I'm regular customer.
Full spa treatment. It was a perfect experience to Dahra Beauty And Spa. Staff were nice and police and service was good. Will definitely visit again!

inconsistent quality. in the past few times, the experiences have been fair. However, this time, the lady (a slightly heavier lady) who did the Thai massage for me was horrible. She started with very light strength until i asked her to be a bit heavier. Then she used a lot of strength but completely missed the right spots. She was pressing on all the wrong points with very bad skills. At the end, she poured me a cup of tea but it was all over the cup so the cup was sticky. Very bad services as if she was not properly trained before. As if they just pulled a lady out of the street to give me a massage. Very disappointing services. The price was good but i will never go back there. The quality has went down a lot....

Great way to end your vacation. We booked the full spa treatment before coming over to Bangkok, and planned for it the day before we left. A herbal treatment, scrub, wrap, aromatherapy massage and facial meant that by the time we left the spa we were fully refreshed after 3 days of walking around in the hot weather.The therapists were very good, firm yet gentle and very attentive to detail.Definitely worth coming back!

Soothing. Massage in Bangkok is nothing special, but if you are looking for an extreme relaxing and soothing experience, this is the place you don't want to miss. One of the best aroma SPA I had in my life.
Always great. This was our second visit and we will definitely return. A great way to get into holiday mode. Professional, clean and great value.
Great spa!. Had a coujples treatment. 2-4 was a little long for me. And the honey milk body scrub thingy smelled so godd that it made me crave desserts:)

Very relaxing, time for myself, very clean. I went to Dahra Spa a year ago when I came to Bangkok for holidays and had a great time. this time I came to Bangkok on a business trip and had some time to spent at Dahra Spa for a full body treatment - absolutely amazing, the staff is very friendly and very good, the products to chose from great and the overall atmosphere is very relaxing and very clean. A must go when in Bangkok!

Absolutely amazing. I don't know any other spa in Bangkok yet so I can't truly compare, but I highly recommend this one. Me and my boyfriend had a 2 hour combined treatment, that gived us a combination of a Royal Thai massage and a head-shoulder-neck massage. I was so relaxed that I could stay there for a more couple hours. The staff are really friendly and the atmosphere is so much pleasant. And it's not expensive. A must have in Bangkok.

Go at the end of the day. . My husband and I wanted to experience traditional Thai massage so we found this place on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. We booked two hour combos in adjoining rooms. The stretching was gentle and effective. Both of us were wet noodles when we left. We got a great deal- better than advertised.

PERFECT. First time for me here but not the last... Very nice place, the masseuses are very professionnal. I tried the body scrub coconut and body oil massage coconut.....whoaaaaaa. The masseuse was very good and funny, she wanted to made me lost 1kg with the body scrub. I will return here for a next trip in bangkok.:-) see you soon.

Nice...Nice...Nice.... This spa is definitely to recommend. Actually we're repeat guests. Our family must to visit here once we spend vacation in BBK. The staff is friendly and helpful. The environment is good. The therapist is professional. The treatment is great.Recommend the treatment package around 3.5hrs. It includes almost treatment from toe to head. Costs about THB 5300 [i am not sure the price...more or less].That's bloody worth it!

worth it!. I came here along with 2 dutch friends who tried the massage here before. The masseurs are very professional and there's a lot of different style of massage to choose from. And the price was worth for the duration and quality. And I got discount from it!!

A fantastic spa in the heart of Silom. A sole female travellerVisited - Sunday 1st MarchTreatment - Full body Salt wrap and pedicurePositives:Very friendly staff.Greeted on arrival for apponitment with a drink and cool flannel.Slippers provided.My lady was very polite and cheerful.Treatment room very clean, smelt nice. It has a shower inside to enable you to was before and after treatment.It was generally quiet outside my room, although some slight banging from another building.The treatment was done at a slow pace. All very relaxed (so much so I nodded off!)The treatment took maybe 40mins? Intermittantly the lady asked if I was ok. Very sweet.The treatment its3lf was great! The salt was excellent and made my skin feel amazing!Nice clean showers. Room was nice.Another.drink given on departure.I booked the treatment by walking in, but later found if you book online you get 20% off. I emailed Dahra before my appointment and they very kindly applied the discount.Negatives:The pedicure was done in a small room with others having a back massage..not so relaxing for them perhaps? Overall, an amazing treatment, great staff and reasonably priced. I highly recommend this place!

Highly recommended. We visited a lot of spa during our holidays, but this was one of the best. Close to Pullman G hotel, very clean, great atmosphere, massages done in separated rooms, not in front of the street like many others spa.Booking via email you can have a discount. Highly recommended.
Fantastic. We went there every 2nd day of the trip the staff and girls were fantastic and treated us extremely well. We look forward to seeing them again in the future.

So disappointed. I went here because of so many good reviews. I wish I had read the bad ones first.I purchased the 50% off full spa package.Firstly, my app was at 10, I got there at about 15 minutes early, and no one was there. I went in and sat on the couch and waiting till someone came in. She Told me I was too early and showed me the time on her phone and was so rude!Next, I find it very unprofessional and uncomfortable having someone massage my breasts and buttocks, even after I asked them not to. Also, the 'massage' was 90% rubbing my legs and the remaining 10% spread between back shoulders And breasts. Terrible massage. The lady spent the time telling me about her hard life as a factory worker prior to this job and how her husbands a tXi driver. I thought she was just being nice and making conversation until the end of the treatment when she said 'did u enjoy'? And I felt obliged to say yes. Then she said ok u give me til now. Not let me tell you, for the price I paid for this experience and the 'quality' that I was promised I found it extremely unprofessional to ask for money off me, let alone 500 baht! As soon as I got back to hotel I showered for an hour to try and get clean feeling again.So disappointed.The only good thing was that the girls at reception desk helped me get a taxi back to my hotel which was nice of them.The only good thing was that the

Just perfect. The perfect spa experience. Had it upon arrival to Bangkok, to get rid of the jetlag and sore muscles after sitting in a plane for 9 hours. Best decision ever!The place is well located, easy to find. Staff very welcoming, a large selection of treatments available. We reserved but you can even go without, they do their best to accommodate drop-ins. The premises are very clean, they even wash your feet before your massage starts. The massage itself was more than perfect! They ask you how strong you want it and then they truly adapt to your needs. It lasted one hour and afterwards we felt like we were floating, no traces of jetlag or plane tiredness. Had other massages while in Thailand but nothing came close to this.Prices are very reasonable! Not to be missed.
Excellent Spa. You will get excellent treatments in this clean, tidy ans very professional spa.Very welcoming staff.

clean and professional. I survived the two hours of pummeling and tortuous Thai massage and came out a better person. I wonder what my masseuse thought of all my tensing and cringing.Almost everything about the place was excellent. Their "very good" is the result of having to wait so long after I changed my clothes that I got worried and went looking for my young lady. Not cool.

Excellent massages. We had a Thai and a foot massages and it was a very good experience. The Spa is nice, clean and with a warm Thai modern decoration.The masseuses are very well skilled and always friendly and professionnal. The prices are cheaper than the hotels but quality is similar or better

Wonderful!. I have been on the road for 8 weeks now and was in the need for some r&r. I was backpacking in Aus and NZ and was waiting until I got to Thailand for a much needed massage since I knew it would be very cheap. I googled spas and Dahra spa came up. From booking online I scored an incredible deal of 50% off. I booked literally the day prior, received a response within hours, and I did not have to give them any credit card info up front. The spa was easily visible from the street and google maps was able to give me accurate information to walk to the spa. The interior was lovely and exactly what you would expect from a high class spa. Quite a change from the outside streets! From start to finish I had a lovely experience. I booked the full spa treatment which included a full body scrub, wrap, aromatherapy massage, facial and I think a few more treatments. It lasted 4 hours. The spa has several treatments and combinations to choose from. I have never indulged myself with such a thorough day at the spa before! The price for all these treatments would have easily cost $300-500 in the US and I paid less than the cost of one of these treatments on its own. Despite the low price the quality of my treatments and the ambiance was equal to any 5 star resort spa. I would recommend this spa to anyone looking for a Spa day in Bangkok. And please remember to bring extra bhat to tip your wonderful therapist.
Lovely. Went for full Spa package today. Was pampered for 4 hours. The rooms are very clean with own shower. Very professional. Massage was the best!

Wonderful!. After a few days walking around Bangkok in November, it was time for a massage. Booking was fairly easy online and they have the essentials at great prices (this is a mid-range spa). My husband booked a shoulder/head massage, and I booked the shoulder/head and Thai massage. They were very accommodating in terms of providing more private rooms (for couples, it's one room with a curtain divider). The facilities were clean and dimly lit for a very relaxed feel. From what I can remember, you cannot hear any street noise even though it's located on a busy street. The massage I received was excellent and a good medium deep pressure. Note that it can be a little hard to communicate with the masseuse as depending on who you get, their English can be very limited. But overall a wonderful experience, reasonable prices, great friendly customer service and great technique. After an hour of pulling, stretching, kneading... I was definitely relaxed. Bonus: Considering my medium/deep massage, no bruising afterwards! I would definitely return and try their other services!

Amazing massage. I enter there just because was appearing very nice from the window. Great location (in the middle between the hotel Pullman G where I was staying and the pangpong market) and nice staff. The therapist gave me the best and most professional Thai massage I ever had in Thailand. Also the price was a good deal as it had a discount from 500 to 400 baht for the month of December.

A nice evening of pampering on New Year's Day. I was looking for a spa close to the W hotel as we didn't want to venture too far out on New Year's day. Before the trip to Bangkok I did some research and found Dahra on Tripadvisor. Overall, the experience was very good. Email enquiries and bookings before our trip were responded to promptly and we were confirmed a couple's room. We booked the "Full Spa Treatment" which was 4900 Baht for two after 50% discount (+ 3% surcharge if paying by credit card), which consisted of a wrap, scrub, massage and facial. To put the price into perspective the W bliss spa was doing a "90 minute head to toe" promotion at 5000 Baht for two + 17% tax. The walk from the W was short since both the hotel and spa are close to BTS Chong Nonsi station.Of course, it is the treatments that mattered and I was more than satisfied by my choice of a coffee scrub and sesame wrap (there are a myriad of choices to choose from). Massage and facials were also very good and the therapists took our strength preferences into account. Our treatment started at 8pm and finished just after midnight. We were so relaxed that we decided to take the taxi home.Despite this I am hesitant to give it 5 stars as these kinds of spas are ubiquitous in Bangkok and there was not anything particular unique or special about Dahra that wowed us. They just did a very professional service at a very reasonable price. However, I would definitely recommend it for people who are staying in and around the Silom area.

A perfect treat!. Myself and my boyfriend visited Dahra whilst in Bangkok in November. Even though we had been recommended various day Spas by concierge at our hotel- we checked a couple out and went with our gut instinct in choosing Dahra. It was a very good decision. I had a package that was around 3 3/4 hours long and it was bliss. It included a mask, a honeymilk wrap, an exfoliating treatment, a full body massage and a facial. My boyfriend had a two hour massage and a facial. We both came away feeling wonderful and relaxed after these treatments. We didn't use the day spa facilities as such, only the treatments on offer but we both wholeheartedly recommend Dahra. Both of our ladies were so kind and professional and were polite in kindly speaking to us in English to make us feel welcome. For around £100 for all of these treatments- you would be crazy not to do it! We of course gave them a generous tip for their great work. It is easy to find and a gem of a place.

Top class.. I had booked a 1,5 hour Aroma therapy session and can only say good things about Dahra Spa. I was very well greeted by a friendly receptionist and soon I got a cold towel and a refreshing glass of water. The whole place have a warm and welcoming feeling about it, nice colors, furnitures and it smelled really good aswell. I went upstairs to the massage room and got a shower before my session. The room was nicely furnished and very tidy with a big shower. I told my massager that I have problem with my neck and shoulders from an old car accident and would like her to put some extra attention to that. It was very relaxing with some nice background music that was just perfect, I also liked the fact that the AC was quite and I felt very well taken care of. The quality of massage would was very good and she did some extra work on my shoulders and neck. 1,5 hours fly by and my time was up. After a nice cup of Tea it was time to pay. There was some promotion and I paid 1600 thb for what would have cost 2,5 times as much in one of the major hotel spas. Sometimes I go to one of the street massages for a footmassage, but I can certainly recommend Dahra for anyone that likes real quality at a fair price. I will comeback for sure.Fredrik Sweden

Clean. Pricey. Worth it.. You will pay more than many places here, but this spa is worth it. Very, very clean with the amenities you normally see in an American or Western style spa. Ask about promotions and you'll save a penny. The foot wash/massage is a given, but the Thai massage is what you want. Was a bit disappointed in the oil massage for the price. The thai massage was the best I've had in the city.

Nice End to the trip. I went to have a traditional Thai massage to end my trip. I went there at 3p and it was quiet and empty. The staff told me that the crowd usually comes in after 3p. The massage was just right and she was hitting the right spots to relief the aches accumulated in the body. Just what was expected. Perfect ending to the trip. Highly recommended.
Fantastic. My wife and I went along with another couple, it was a truly relaxing experience leaving me feeling calm, refreshed and rejuvenated.

Excellent Service - Good Location - Clean & Modern Facility. I enjoyed my manicure and pedicure treatment at Dahra Beauty & Spa. It's located on the corner of the busy intersection at Silom and Sathorn Road - a lot of vehicle, bus and motorbike traffic but there's a traffic light for pedrestrians. The location isn't close to a BTS sky-train station. So, it's a walk from the Chong Nasti BTS. Reception service was very polite, good English language. The facility is very clean and modern. My treatment was discounted (a promotion). Complimentary tea is served after your treatment. I'll be back.

A real cool experience. Pleasantly Surprised to find a spa that really had style and went out of its way to create a tranquil setting right in the heart of Bangkok.From the smiling and helpful receptionist to the female masseuse the two hour aromatherapy massage was superb....I wish it lasted longer!Well designed layout, luxurious fluffy towels and subdued lighting along with peaceful music adds to the experience. Well done!

Not what I was expecting, unless you want a happy ending. I had high exceptions for Dahra because of overall positive reviews here. Admittedly I didn't read all of them, but it was one of the better ones in the area. When I arrived the lobby was nice and everything was clean. I had a late flight and wanted to relax before spending all day on a plane. I deiced on an hour and a half massage and asked if they had showers that I could use after the massage as I had already checked out of my hotel and they said not an a problem.I was taken upstairs to a room towards the back. The room was again clean, it had a shower in room which I was pretty excited about. My massage got started and I was overall disappointed. The oil was nice, but the overall massage wasn't very relaxing. It was like someone was lightly touching my back. She spent a lot time on my legs and only a few minutes on my back. This wasn't what I was expecting considering the price was 3X what I paid in Bali and I had great experience there. After she had me flip over she continued with my legs. She then got a little touchy with her hands. I am not sure if I had indicated that I was looking for a happy ending, but that is what she was trying to do. After I had told her no a few times, I asked her to leave. She told me that I still had 20 minutes left. I showed and left. I didn't even get the full massage that I had paid for. I was very disappointed in the overall situation. I was sure that finding a higher end place I wasn't going to have this happen, however I was clearly wrong.If you are looking for a happy ending, there are cheaper options down the street.You'll know because the guys wont let you walk by without showing you pictures.

Affordable and good service. This spa is located near to BTS and is quite easy to find it. The spa is clean and nice. The staff are friendly. I tried the 2hrs Thai Traditional Massage and felt refreshing after the session. As i booked online, i was given 20% discount on the treatment. It is a place where one should give it a try.

Blissfull afternoon! Money well spent!. We walked past this spa several times having our hotel close by in Silom. We wanted to spend a day relaxing before our long flight back home and chose D based on reviews on Trip Advisor. It's great value for money if you end up availing their ongoing promotions. We were lucky to get a 50% discount that they are running this month on selected packages. Great ambiance, attention to detail and choice of services available. Professional staff in general tgiufh at times you woukdve expected a bit more consideration and time keeping. Nonetheless highly recommended if you are in Bangkok and staying around the area.

Amazing Spa and great value. This was a wonderful place to relax. I can't recommend these enough the welcome was great, the treatment spot on and the after care to die for. This was the best 2 hours of the holiday. It was so good we booked up a second treatment on the last day to get us ready for the flight home to the UK.

Excellent spa... Totally loved it!. We were looking for a spa in the Silom area and chose this spa based on trip advisor ratings. And wow we were amazed. Prices: They had a whopping 50% discount on the full spa treatment so it costed us 2450 baht per head.We got a full spa package for 2 people which consisted of a facial, Thai herbal packs, body scrub, body wrap and finally an aromatherapy massage. The prices are very affordable and in fact quite low given the excellent quality of treatment.The total therapy took about 4 hours and moment of that was simply amazing. Location: Located very conveniently on the Silom road. Accessible by the BTS, walkable distance from Sala Daeng station.Therapists: The therapists were very professional and suggested which facial, wrap and scrub would best suit our skin type and condition.Products: The products used were of very good quality. The milk and honey body wrap smelled so good I could almost eat it haa....haa Spa rooms: The rooms are very comfortable and luxurious. Therapy: The therapy felt like pure heaven. The facial was very effective. All the tan accumulated by lazing under the sun on poolside, snorkelling all day in the ocean in Koh Lanta and roaming all day in the heat of chatuchak market was totally gone! Like really gone.The scrub was quite good as well and so was the wrap. The massage put me to sleep within 5 mins.Overall: overall a 10 on 10Would definitely go back again next time I visit Thailand.Highly recommend this spa for everyone.

Best massage in Bangkok. This was our 1st massage in Bangkok and the best we had so far. The place was an easy walk from BTS station and located on a main street. We made a reservation online an hour before our desired appointment and got the confirmation right the way. You save 20% online!!Upon entering the spa, you can feel the nice cold air mixed with fresh scent. The receptionist was really friendly and directed us to sit down to enjoy some tea and cold towel. We originally came in for the 60 mins Thai massage but changed it to the 90 mins Thai massage + herbal. We then had our feet washed and led to the rooms on the 3rd floor to change into loose shirt/pants. The entire massage was really enjoyable. You don't hear anyone else chatting and the masseuses kept the conversation to minimal. After about an hour of massage, we had hot herbal stuff applied all over our bodies..and just when we thought it was over, there was more massage! They served tea again after the massage was over. They didn't rush us to leave and even reminded us of the 20% discount we were getting. What a wonderful place!!
Perfect. Perfect and with the discount on the web site the price is correct. Good staff and beautiful Spa!!! I recommend this place for a relax moment

Affordable and good ervice.. I went for a one-hour foot reflexology and one-hour Thai full body massage. The front desk staff was friendly and offered me a drink and wet towel. I waited for about three minutes before the masseur showed me to the foot reflexology room. I think I felt asleep and she did not wanted to cause me pain...but felt she was not using much strength.However, during the Thai massage, she was good! And she sensed that I was a bit cold from my breathing and adjusted the air-con temperature.When she left to wash her hands to continue massage for the head, she promptly told me so. I spent less than 750 baht (after discount) so I was happy!

Oasis of tranquility and wellbeing on Silom road. Situated in the middle of Silom road you will find on your left hand side when you come from Sala Daeng Sky train station.(10-15 min walk) very professional design and decoration; Staff very freindly and professional; We took a package deal with shower, jacuzzi, scrub, wrapping, massage and milk bath; What an experience, worth the money and very relaxing. worth the money; very clean and an experience for all senses;

Excellent day spa. This excellent day spa is located right next to the Pullman G Hotel on Silom Road. Staff are very professional. Treatments are awesome, of very high quality. The facilities are clean. We had a shower in our couple spa room. Only thing missing was a bathroom on the upper floor.
A professional and ethical service. The traditional Thai massage offered is excellent prompting me to visit daily during my recent visit to Bangkok

Good spa at reasonable price. The spa is considered more expensive than what you will find in Thailand, however the quality is good and service is excellent. Did a full spa package for around 2450 THB. Massage is professional.

Good service and great value for money. Great value for money when you take the 50% off promotion for a spa treatment package, as listed on their website. Would most likely not consider going to Dahra Beauty & Spa if it wasn't for this promotion - but let me tell you that it was all worth it!!!The package includes a body scrub and wrap, facial, massage and other inclusions, totaling up to 3 hours and 45 minutes of pure heaven and bliss, in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. With the 50%, the package ends up around 2400-2500 Baht - a steal given all the inclusions and quality of their services! Great location, within walking distance of a BTS Skytrain station, professional staff, friendly and very attentive, excellent value for your money! I will be back!

Amazing Spa for Bangkok money. This Spa is everything you want - not only in Bangkok but anywhere else! It just has your usual Bangkok prices! I've been going to this place for the last half year - you should too!!

ok...but can be better. Value. .I took the promotion package at 50% off my Spa treatment. Otherwise it would not be worth the value. Location. It's near to station of ching nonsi or could even walk from silom or sala dang station which is much further. The ambience is good with free wifi. The staff are all very nice and welcoming.On arrival they serve cold water. Other places they serve nice lemon grass drinks. After spa they serve you one cup of tea. I had a full treatment of scrub massage facial and wrap. What I like most is I could choose my massage oil. The funny thing is my facial is last and it was not done at the same room. I have to get dressed and go downstairs for the facial. I was also told to shower right after massage for the facial. Little puzzled as usually shower is not recommended within few hours. The wrap is not hot wrap. As it's hot season I have to ask for some water as I already felt dehydrated before the wrap. She didn't have a straw so I had to drink without hands which was tough since I was already in wrap. Will i return? Maybe. .. But it's not top of my list.

It could be Better. Located near the intersection of Silom Rd and Naradhiwas R. Rd.Most of the time, this spa is fully booked thus making a reservation is a good idea.My friends and I decided to avail the "Combined Massage" (Royal Thai Massage + Head-Shoulder-Neck). It's for 2hrs and costs 700 Baht (listed price 900 Baht). The session was okay. I kinda felt that the masseuse could do better. Also, some guests are loud but the staff didn't do anything about it and just let them chuckle and talk loudly. That really ruined the experience for me.The staff, especially the receptionist, is very courteous.
Must do in Bangkok. We had a full spa treament and it was great. The spa is beautiful and the staff very profesional plus the prices are moderate. We were so pleased!

Great massage at great price. We just concluded 3.45 hours of full spa treatment. I can only conclude that it was a bliss, the staff is nice and also the place so can only recommend. The fact that we paid a.very reasonable price didn't hurt either
Very good massage. Really nice place with friendly staff. I booked online and received 20% discount. An hour of Thai royal massage was exactly what I needed and it was very good.

Divine Relaxation in Bustling Bangkok. My husband and I spent Christmas afternoon at this delightful spa. We booked a promotional deal for the Oriental Spa Treatment, which included an herbal treatment, a cream milk treatment, and a scrub, wrap, and massage of our choice. The options were plentiful and varied, from detoxifying green tea to restoring liquorice root. I chose the coffee scrub and the white sesame wrap, both for detoxifying effects, and felt positive results.Unfortunately, we had to be in separate rooms, but hadn’t booked ahead and were happy they could take us. The rooms were clean and spacious, but rather cold. Both of us found the temperatures of not only the air, but also the showers to be uncomfortably cool (and we live in a cold climate). Luckily, we were served hot tea several times, which was wonderfully sweet and warming. The masseuses were extremely professional and friendly.We both felt refreshed and renewed after the three hour experience and would definitely return to this relaxing escape from busy Bangkok.

Love this place!. This was my second time to Dahra Beauty & Spa and I can't say enough about it! I took my partner along this time. He was a little daunted at first but absolutely loved it. I had the Deluxe Spa Treatment and Facial and my partner had a Thai massage and foot massage. I have to say that I had the best massage I've ever had this time round!! It is an oasis from the bustling city streets and far superior to any spa I've been to in Bangkok, but still represents outstanding value for money.Special thanks goes to Khun Kwan and Porn for their outstanding skills and service!We'll be back next time we visit Bangkok!

Great spa experience in Bangkok. We booked the full spa experience on our first night in Bangkok.Although we were a bit late at the appointment we were welcomed very warmly at the reception.There was no rush in letting us choose our treatments and taking us to the massage room.We enjoyed the 4 hour treatment and came out like different people.The rooms are very spacious, clean, they smell really nice, towels are very often changed in between different treatments and you are offered tea multiple times during the treatment.We can only be very positive about our experience here moreover you get more than you pay for!We paid only 2450 BHT for a treatment of 4 hours, deffinitely worth it!

A massage farm, churning out quantity, not quality.. We booked a 90 min Royal Thai massage at 8:00pm. We arrived at 7:40, had our feet washed and were changed and ready by 7:45. The massage began and the quality was subpar. The masseuse lingered on my shoulder like a rookie in their first game.Our massage was done anf the girls stepped out for us to change. It was 9:00pm. They short changed our massage by fifteen minutes!I think they figured they could squeeze another massage in at 9. Greedy!!I would seek another place for for your spa refuge.

I left cooler than kelvin..... ...at absolute zero, -273.15C. After 3 hours and 45 minutes and 4 treatments I was chilled. My wife and myself booked a promotional deal which only cost us 4900 Baht.The promotional offer said.....Enjoy the complete array of treatments including a full body herbal steam treatment, a cleansing and soothing body scrub and a facial and body massage. This blissful therapy induces the profound sense of peace and well-being, balances the emotions and calms the mind. It is an ideal treatment for headaches, anxiety , depressions and stress.It lived up to its billing. Clean spa, great staff. Thank you!

Excellent value for money. Place is nice, perfect if you are looking for a serious mid range massage place. My massage pressure was very strong, too much for me so my advice woulr be to tell them before what pressure you want in order to avoid bad surprise ad they don't ask you proactively. Overall 400 baht for 1h thai or back and shoulder massage is really cheap compared to the quality of the place and the atmosphere, far from many tourist-massage places where the price is almost the same but the ambience really not relaxed.Tip: book on their website and get 20% discount.

Very good experience with Nong. I booked the time of Ms Nong, 2 hours. She is very helpful and professional. And she make me very quiet in the noisy Bangkok using proficient skill. Than you, Nong.George

Wonderful spa in the midst of the bustling city. The staff was lovely and I especially loved the honey body wrap and tamarind scrub. I would recommend checking out their online specials to get discounts on full spa packages. A great experience. Only thing I would say is that the showers could be a bit nicer, but other than that, I really enjoyed my 4 hours there.

Great escape from busy Bangkok. The spa is great. It was a very pleasant and professional. It's a great escape from the busy and noisy streets, easy to find and very convenient to book online. My fiancé and I got a great package deal (full spa treatment) which was worth the money. English of the staff was excellent, facility is very clean and perfect for a relaxing day. If you want a relax evening (or day) we would definitely recommend it.

Escape the hustle of Bangkok. Two of us signed up for the full-day spa treatment based on other Trip Advisor reviews and loved it. We highly recommend checking out their website for the monthly specials, which is how we chose our treatments. The spa is located on a busy street but their website directions are spot-on and once you step inside, it's a peaceful, calm atmosphere. We each had our own, private treatment room (not totally common in Asia) including shower. The package we chose included scrub, wrap, massage and facial - all were wonderful. Would definitely return!

Good massage, nice setup. Went for a thai massage after our golf session before dinner. We have booked in advance but were late due to heavy traffic, it was past their closing hours but they were kind to wait for us. The masseur is professional and gave a good massage on the tired muscles.

Heavenly massage, and body scrub and wrap. After a four hour bike tour, four hours with Aum, my massage therapist at Dahra, were divine. She applied the perfect amount of pressure to relax and rejuvenate my body. She applied heat during the first massage, which was followed by a deliciously cleansing body scrub. Then she massaged me with coconut oil and wrapped me in a blanket. I was so relaxed I fell asleep! The final massage, which included a facial, was simply luxurious. The aroma, room, atmosphere, massage table, music and lighting were perfect. A shower is in the room so guests can take showers after the scrub and wrap, and at the end if desired. I left feeling like a new person! Highly recommended!
wonderful massage. Had a wonderful 2 hour massage. Quiet, professional, very relaxing. Atmosphere was one of the nicest we've been to. Definitely on my list for my next visit. Everyone was wonderful.

Great experience start to finish. If you want a Thai massage I can't imagine a better place.The atmosphere is relaxing just stepping in the door- with a nice glass of water and a fresh pair of sandals. The massage was especially refreshing. And on top of that, they took care of the kids while we were in session.I highly recommend booking yourself a 2 hour session.

Great massage!. A very relaxing atmosphere with well trained massage therapists with great hands. Through parts of the massage, I fell asleep. Also very reasonable prices. Would not hesistate going back there the next time I'm in Bangkok.

Excellent place for relaxation. Looking for a good massage and spa, this is the place to go. Nice friendly people that will give you a great relaxing massage. Went there two days in a row and had different kinds of package, both time very satisfied.

Best Spa in Thailand!. My wife and I each had a two hour combined traditional Thai massage! The cost was 720 bht which is about $24 for two hours. The spa is new, clean and very professional. Would definitely go back!!!

The only place to have a massage in Bangkok. The Dahra takes things to the level they need to be. Excellent service, excellent products, this place beats all others hands down. Tip: book online in advance, it guarantees you get in and you can also pick up significant discounts!

Good relax. I went with my friend to Dahra and we did not regret. Nice environment, wonderful 1:30 oil massage and we recovered from a long day. Not as cheap as other low-cost alternatives but great if you are looking for a professional massage

200% RECONMENDATION. My wife was booked in for a full spa treatment and after 4 hour I found a different girl waiting for me, she could not stop talking about the wonderful treatment and time she had there, She was like a new person. after the morningWe can highly recommend the professional and efficient treatment we receivedPatrick and Elizabeth from South Africa

Very clean and professional spa with excellent staff. We decided to book a Thai massage here after our first choice was booked up. The staff was very professional over the phone and easy to communicate with. They were able to get us in for appointments within a couple of hours.When we arrived at the spa we were given some water and our shoes were removed and feet cleaned. We were then escorted to the couple's massage room to change. Everything in the spa was very clean and the decor was very relaxing. Once we changed, the therapists came in and began our Thai massages. One of the therapists did not speak much English but the other did and was able to translate.The massages were very good and we liked our service so much, we actually booked services for the next day.I would definitely go back the next time I am in Bangkok. The prices were slightly higher than some other places, but the spa environment is much better and the quality of services matched the price. I also liked that there is no "happy ending" funny business going on here. Overall, this is a wonderful spa to come for professional services in a clean environment.

Great massage, very good value for money. Our guide in Bangkok recommended this place, so my husband and i went there on our last day in Thailand, to relax before taking the 14 hours flight back home. We had the combined massage, a 2 hours combination of thai massage and head-shoulder-neck massage. Original price was 900baht /person but we had 30% discount, which was really worth it.Massage was very good and left us all relaxed. Rooms are okay (see picture), service was excellent, i just wish it was more quiet, as we could hear people having facial treatments and foot massage talking behind the door.

Excellent and Discreet!. It is lovely place to relax and spend some time with your beloved one. My wife and I spent our honeymoon in Bangkok and we kept hearing many stuff about beauty palaces over there. We stayed at Silom road where Dahra Beauty and Spa is. There are many of them around but Dahra is very different. Services are great. The place is very professional and nobody can see you from the street, so it very discreet. There is no "Happy End" which makes it even more professional and romantic and the staff are well trained and they speak English. Overall it was a great experience. Someone can argue that it is a bit expensive in comparison to the other ones. But I believe that it is worth the money to try it. At the end they offer to everyone a nice cup of tea.

Great value, decent service. I wanted to spend a day at the spa but didn't want to blow the budget, so was looking for something mid-range, but with decent setting and service.I thought Dahra Spa was exactly that. I went for the full spa treatment at 50% discount - which was a bargain! - and had a scrub, a wrap, massage and facial. I must admit, I slept through most of it and only woke up to shower between each treatment. The scrub and wrap smelt lovely - good enough to eat! And the massage must have been relaxing, as I was out for the count. The facial was a little dubious, but I didn't break out in spots afterwards, so it was fine.The setting was nice - mood lighting, clean, with a shower in the room so all very handy.Of course, you can push the boat out and get 5-star service and setting at 5-star prices, but for a mid-range spa, this was great and I would certainly return.

Nice massage. The massage was very good with a seemingly professional therapist who spoke a bit English so that made it easy to explain how I like it. I wasn't amazed by the place though. I wouldn't really call it a "spa" more of a shop. The rooms were quite small and it wasn't cheap either.

Good but not great. I used them me and my wife,The place was clean but the massage was OK, we got 50% discount, the service was ok after discount but without it the price is really high for the services and easy to find better than this place.
Good value for money. Last week I had their spa package. A very nice relaxing experience. Easy to find location near the BTS. I will do it again.

Good quality spa, quality treatment and good service.. I had a manicure and pedicure when I visited the spa a few days ago. It was excellently carried out by Laa(excuse the spelling). She was very good at her job, very thorough, it is one of the best manacure and pedicure's I have had. Laa was friendly enough without disturbing the relaxation. The only gripe; receptionist could have been warmer and a welcome drink or offer of a drink would have been appreciated as I was in there a while, I did ask in the end as was in need of some rehydration! It's not the cheapest but I thought it was well worth it.

Relaxing and nice experience. My friends and I went to try one of their spa package treatments. We find the choices good and the scrubs quite unique especially that of tamarind ingredient. I find the place clean and neat and very comfortable and safe. The massage therapists who attended us were very courteous and attentive. All in all, I must say the experience was very good and worth the price.

Up there with the best of Thai Spas. On a recent 2 day stop-over in Bangkok, I didn't want to do any of the usual tourist stuff or go to crowded markets so I decided to indulge in a Massage at the Dahra Spa which a friend had recommended. I chose the 4 hands massage and it would have to be one of the most relaxing experiences of my life - it was heaven. The cost was not cheap, but it was reasonable for what you get.

Fantastic. Booked this online before leaving Brisbane and got 50% discount we had the full spa treatment which cost $75 ea for the wife and I , As we were staying at the Novotel at Siam square we jumped on the sky train for $1 a few stops then we had a 2-3 minute walk to Dahra spa , The girls were so nice and friendly we got a welcome drink while we picked our treatments and for the next 4 hrs we were in heaven , My masseuse Meoow ( i think ) was excellent , I must apologize to her I did not speak more than a few words as I was nearly asleep the whole time and she had to go before I had finished my final treatment , all in all a great place and will visit again next time we are in Bangkok

Overrated!. With such high rating on Tripadvisor, inevitably I would frequent the place with high expectation. What do I recall out of my very first Thai spa experience with them? I almost caught a cold after a 3-hour treatment. How could they set such low temperature in a spa room? My complaint was paid no heed.

Dahra Spa is heaven!. Before coming to Bangkok, I booked a promotion package at Dahra Spa after seeing them on a google map. For 2012, they have deals up to 50% off. I had the Full Spa package - 3 hours, 45 minutes of sheer top to toe heaven and even better at a cost of about AU$ 75. Unbelievable value. My lady, Oh, was sensational and so nice. The Spa is easy to find, just near Sofitel Silom. Highly recommended!

Not Impress and Not Satisfied. Honestly I tried out this spa after reading reviews on Tripadvisor during my last trip to Bangkok last week. My friend and I took the full spa treatment at 50% as we want to try out all the treatments. I was quite disappointed with the services. First, the facial, I was quite surprised that the therapist did the facial in a very very dim light. Furthermore, we placed our head on the therapist lap! I asked the therapist, can u see in the dark ... she just said "ok, ok".Secondly, while working on the body treatments like massage, scrub, wrap ... the therapist didn't take into consideration to at least protect the customer's modesty. The worst was during the the body wrap when the therapist just simply pour the honey milk potion onto my body and roughly/hastily spread it all over my body. I almost like telling her that my body is not a meat to be marinated. In fact when the therapist told me to shower after each body treatment, she just stood there when usually the therapist will leave to give customers some privacy!Last, the aromatherapy massage. I have to agree with some reviewers that you can get better massages at cheaper spas. To be honest, I was really looking forward to the massage as I was really a fan of Thai aromatherapy massage. But the therapist massage techniques was like so different when I thought that it has been standardised. Sorry, but I think this spa is overated!

Had better massage at a cheap spa. Not impressed. Me and boy friend booked a spa package with a 50 percent discount and we was not impressed at all. I have receive better massages in cheap places down the street. Not sure why some places decide that massaging my breast and buttocks is considered professional. I was not comfortable with it and i wasn't comfortable knowing my boyfriend was next to me having the same done by another woman. While in Phuket got a full body massage massage and not once was that towel moved from my breast area and it was only 350 bahts. The spa was nice and clean but maybe just good enough for a foot massage.

Relaxation plus. My husband and I visited Bangkok for the first time in February 2011. Beforehand, I looked up various Spa places in Bangkok (as neither of us wanted a 'suprise' type of massage) and found Dahra Spa to be located just up the road from the hotel we were staying at (Furama Xclusive). It was a ten minute walk and as soon as we entered we were greeted and sat down to choose which treatments and types of massage we wanted. We had booked one of their 50% specials and it was just incredible. I must say though, that we booked a couples room, and in between treatments you are asked to shower and you aren't left inthe room alone - its bare all type stuff! That took a bit of getting used to, but the therapists were lovely and we enjoyed our treatments. We are heading back to Thailand next month and have already booked at Dahra again for the same package! Cant wait :)

Thai massage in Bangkok - can't get better than this!. I was in Bangkok at a few massage places, Dahra in Silom 154 is the best! In Dec. 2010 I was there twice, just had to go back after the first visit. In Jan 2012 we had to have a massage there before going home. Dahra is a great place, nice, clean, friendly staff ... all you expect. The price is a bit higher than around the corner, but it is worth so spend the extra Bath. A hint: book a massage in the morning, there is a reduction of 20%.Getting there: BTS Skytrain to Chong Nonsi and walk 2-3 mins.Link: http://www.dahra-spa.com/

Good atmosphere with dim lightings for shy, first-time buffs. A peace of heaven away from the busy streets of Bangkok.. The atmosphere inside is of dim lighting and very relaxing to be. The receptionist was very polite and was happy to let me know their WiFi password to log in with. I really enjoyed my first ever full spa, served by an especially caring masseur, Meaw.My masseur Meaw, read as Mel, was very attentive to my every responses while she does her therapy, often checking with me if the room temperature and also the herbal hot water temperature is acceptable for me.I am a quiet person by nature and maybe I look a little stern when I'm not smiling, she was worried and often asked me if I was okay. I started to chat with her and although her English is not very good, she showed tremendous courage and willingness to learn. I thought that showed her very good positive attitude in doing her job.When encouraged by me to speak more English and thus improving it (I'm fine with chatting), she said that she likes to chit-chat with customers while doing her job too and repeatedly lets me know she feels very happy to be able to communicate with me while doing her job. She respects that some customers would rather just like to sleep though.A really happy-to-serve masseur in a nicely decorated interior with your choice of a relaxing scent (I chose Lavendar).. What more do you want? Oh yea, there's a good 50% discount if you book it online too! I'm a happy man. Would definitely go back in future and might make a special request to have a little catchup reunion with Meaw if possible!

A high price to pay for such low-end service. I arrived 10 minutes early, as requested on the spas site. I was rudely informed by the receptionist that I was early and would have to wait. Well, I waited and waited. I was finally taken to a very cold room at about 3:30 pm (my appointment was for 3pm). The room was dark and VERY cold. I showered and got ready and waited for the masseuse. She arrived and began the treatment. She told me absolutely nothing about the treatments or what she was doing.The scrub and wrap were just okay. The massage was TERRIBLE. She never asked about the amount of pressure I wanted or what areas I wanted her to work on. She spent about 10 minutes on my back and the rest was pretty much spent on my legs. I wouldn't even call it a massage; more like a rub. Totally, not relaxing.The facial was okay. Certainly better than the massage. I have no idea if I received the other two treatments listed in the package or not...the herbal food treatment and the cream milk treatment.Upon leaving I could not find the exit from the treatment area to the reception and ended up walking in on a naked man. I was beyond embarrassed. The masseuse was supposed to have waited for me, but instead she was sitting and chatting to the receptionist. The receptionist tried to charge me full price instead of the Internet special of 50% off. (She did offer 20% off of the regular price.) Finally she decided to honor the 50% discount plus an additional 10%.Very disappointed with this place, and I know that there are much better places in Bangkok for massage and spa treatments. The lobby is lovely, but beyond that nothing good worth mentioning.

Lisa from Belgium. I booked a 1.5 hours oil massage to relax after a full walking day through Bangkok. I have to say that I was welcome with lots of smile. I enjoyed a 1.5 hours with an oustanding therapist called Toon who was able to listen and adapt the massage to my needs and finally fix my back. I had the opportunity to try 2 other Spas in Bangkok and I have to say that Dahra is the best cost effective option.

Do not miss!!. It looks like nothing from the outside but as soon as you enter you feel far away from the craziness of Bangkok and in a very peaceful and relaxing place. If you book online you get a very good price for the full spa treatment which includes a scrub, a wrap, a body massage and a facial, almost 4 hours! The team is professional and the place is really clean.

Heavenly relaxing.. We booked a full spa treatment as this month they had a 50% discount promotion running.3h45m being spoiled :)We had the double room so we went through the treatment together. We suggest you to ask for that room if you are a couple.Body scrub, lovely.Body wrap, we slept through it.Body massage, nice and... A bit painful, as a Thai massage is supposed to be.Facial treatment, also very nice.Definitely recommended.Lovely staff.P.S. The little plastic bags with inside this black thing made of elastic fabric... It is underwear. And you are supposed to wear it. Just for you to avoid asking like we did...:)

Relaxing Spa Experience. Service was great, price was great.
Rooms were small though and no view.
Good value :)

Relaxing and rejuvinating experience!. Went to Dahra Spa with my boyfriend after searching around TripAdvisor and now I am back here to write a review! We booked the full spa treatment online which was about 3 hours and 45 minutes long, and received a discount of 50%. Good deal!Surprisingly, as it was a Saturday night, I thought that it would be crowded and all but no, we were the only ones there I guess. It was a clean, cozy and peaceful place to be, without any distracting noises. Friendly masseuses, the entire treatment was heavenly. They provided us with hot tea before, during and after treatment, which tasted so good!However, there is one thing I would like to suggest which is to provide eye makeup remover in the room. I had stubborn waterproof mascara and eyeliner throughout the entire treatment. Nevertheless, the facial treatment was great as the masseuse was really gentle with her hands. We would definitely come back again!

Do not miss if you are a Spa addict... Found this place via google search, and booked a four hand aromatherapy session for an hour. 2100 baht less 30% online discount -- so it sounded like a decent deal. I reserved via email and got a prompt response. It is 5 min walk from Chong Nonsi BTS station.. from outside, it looks like one of those zillion masage shops in Bangkok, on a busy road. but inside it is quite nicely done up.. not very fancy or five star, but nice. The therapists were something else. I had possibly the best aromatherapy massage of my life. Am going back again tomorrow :-) for a one-and-a-half hour session - 3000 baht less 30% :-)

Relaxing and rejuvinating experience, skilled therapists.. I've visited Dahra Spa more than a couple of times over the past few years, both in the old location and the new building. The place is very clean and cosy and typical Thai style. I love the fragrance of the herbal oils you smell as you enter the lobby. The receptionists are always welcoming and patient and provide a good help in making a choice between the various therapies and massages. The therapists are surely very sensitive, caring and skilled - Usually, I fall asleep halfway through the massage and wake up feeling fresh like a baby. (and probably looking like one!)Highly recommended if you want to experience a genuine healing experience.Oh yes, I loved the gentle music in the background.

No complaints at all and we would return. Visited the spa ‘en-famile’ and three of us enjoyed 3hrs 45 mins of treatments. We booked online with a special rate for an extensive package including body scrub, massage, facial and other bits and pieces. I fell asleep so I have forgotten what they were.The place is clean, peaceful and the staff friendly. The overall experience was quite divine and we left feeling rather calmed and stress free. I can’t tell you how good it is compared to all the other places in Bangkok but we would be quite happy to pay a return visit.
Exceptional!. Very nice place. Location easy to find. Kind and competent staff. Essential activity in Bangkok. Enjoy as I did.

A Valentines experience - which was almost perfect. I booked a 3,5 hour spa treatment for my girlfriend and myself in advance for valentines day and prepaid a deposit via paypal. Our tour went on a little longer than expected and thus we arrived 15 minutes late. I specifically asked for a double room - as it was Valentines and sharing this experience was the most important part of this part of the trip. Due to us coming late, the management had give the double room away, which was really anoying as we prepaid and all.That said, the therapist was so good and we really enjoyed the spa and massages. They were very attentive to our needs and did everything in their power to make us feel well, relaxed and comfortable. They even got hold of some food for us as we hadn't had time to eat. The food was great, but the gesture of doing this was even better. Would recommend my best of friends this spa - but be on time or loose your room ;)

Happy ending?. After a VERY busy weekend, my muscles were in desperate need of some relaxation.Dahra Spa was recommended to me by a colleague who had similar aches and pains.This is the new premises - just over Narathiwas Road near Silom Soi 12. It's easy to miss because it's quite a small frontage.However, inside it's deceptively spacious and well laid out. The decor is heavy wood and scented oils. The receptionist greeted me in very good English. She recommended a treatment for me - an aromatherapy session. I only had time for an hour, but probably 90 minutes would have been better.The room was spotlessly clean. The temperature was just right as opposed to some other places I've been. There was very quiet music playing in the background and no other distracting noise.The masseuse was very good - she was aware of any pain or twinges. She found the areas with the most knots and kneaded them out. She didn't feel the need to chat incessantly which I find annoying when I'm having a massage.After the treatment, I was given a glass of sweet hot tea, which was very tasty.And the 'happy ending'?There was an introductory discount as they have only just opened, of course.

Great place!. Both my husband and I went here for treatments in Feb 2010. I had a 4 hour package that cost me around $60 CDN ...pretty great deal they had a special for 50% off some of the packages. My husband had the aromatherapy massage and he loved it, I loved my treatments too (he doesn't always love spa's very much either). The girls were great, the rooms have showers in them for you to wash up before and after ...which is nice when you have been walking around BKK all day in the heat & humidty! The place is nicley decorated in Thai style and it's very clean. The whole staff made us feel very welcome ....some others make you feel like you are inconveniencing them...so it made for a really nice experience! We will go again on our next time through BKK ....go you wont regret it

Beauty & Wellness. A visit at the Dahra Spa is awesome...A nice welcome by the host and a drink before our relaxing "adventure" starts.I decided to have 1st the thai massage with hot herb towels the beginning is a bit rough but during the masage it becomes more and more relaxing and my body felt afterwards as brandnew, 2nd I had the body scrub with tamarinde and my skin was feeling as silk so smooth. I ended my adventure with a french manicure & pedicure the ladies are very professional and are focused from the beginning to the end. I have booked already for 2nd of January 2010 so I will start my holidays very relaxing :-)

I love Dahra Spa!. I was visiting Thailand for 17 days and a friend of mine recommended Dahra Spa in Bangkok. So after a long, warm day of walking I decided to visit Dahra Spa. The minute I came in I felt totally comfortable. Both receptionists were very nice to me and the Spa was beautiful and had a nice cool temperature. Then I met the managers Jorn and John who were also very nice and professional. The massage I chose was the Aromatherapy Massage. A very nice therapist took me to the massageroom where I could take a relaxing shower. Then the therapist came back and started the massage. Oh my God! I felt like I was in heaven! It was so nice, the therapist did it so well, she continually asked if I were ok and the oils smelled so nice! The next week I came back and had a Thai massage which was also very nice. When I’m back in Bangkok I’ll definitely visit Dahra Spa again! The people are so nice en the massages were the best I’ve ever had. I can recommend it to everyone!

Very clean, nice and professional place. On my last trip to Bangkok, I received a recommendation for Dahra Beauty & Spa. I went there, checked the menue and took a full body massage and a special back treatment. The place is very clean and equipped with a very welcoming reception area. The receptionist was very friendly and I was offered a nice space in the waiting area. Drinks were served and the various odors of body oil and perfume as well as the softly played music brings you into a relaxation mode before the actual treatment starts.The massage rooms and shower facilities are very clean also. The staff acted very friendly and professional. The treatment was awesome.The place is run by a European owner, which adds to the professionalism. Prices are not low but for the standard they are very reasonable.I can give full recommendation to an experience at Dahra Beauty & Spa to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Pretty much perfect. This spa was clean, comfortable, and relaxing. I was warmly welcomed in the beginning. My only complaint was that I was told that we had to wait a half hour (which ended up being 45 minutes) when I arrived, but that next time I should make a reservation beforehand.Regardless of that, I have only good things to say about the quality and atmosphere of this place. My husband and I both got aromatherapy treatments, and will return again after we make a reservation this time!!

Too cold and rude!. It was my honeymoon.I went to Dahra spa with big expectation. The receptionist was very nice and polite. My husband and i were politely asked to come back in 3 hours, which wasn't problem, then I carefully chose the course and decided to do 'Asian something', which is combined Thai massage and oil massage. The disaster started when i came back to have a massage and met the massage woman. I was put in a room with a shower room. I quickly took shower and waited for more than 5 minutes full-naked. I started to feel really cold in a full air-conditioned room, so i opened the door and see if the woman knows i was waiting. she told me to stay in a room so i did. After another 5 minutes, i felt freezing so i opened the door again. She shouted irritatedly saying ' just morment please!!' 2 minutes later, she came into the room with a mean look and so did I. I didn't understand why I was treated like this. I really wanted to leave. After i was sure she wasn't gonna hurt me, i let her continued the massage. However, I was so cold that i didn't feel anything. First time I told her I was cold, she stopped the air-con, but the room remained cold. Second time i asked her if there was any way to make the room warmer, she said no. She finally gave me a hot compress from next door after 3rd times i told her i was really cold, but there was only 10 minutes left before 90 minute massage ended.Although my husband agreed the room was quite cold, he enjoyed his Thai massage & Hot compress, so I thought it was my woman who didn't know much about hospitality. She told me she had been a massager for 1 year and half. How come one of the best spa in Bangkok hire a inexperienced massager??? My course was the most expensive. I waisted my precious 90 minutes and 2700TBH.She could have tried to make the room warmer in some way......

Good value for money. During my last trip to Bangkok, I had some free time to spare and decided to try out this small spa. They have some interesting promotions on their website and I decided to take the Full Spa Treatment. The moment I walked in I felt like a different person. The greeting was genuinely welcoming and the spa treatment was quite an experience. I particularly liked the body scrub and aroma therapy. Definitely worth a visit!

Beware, reviews don't add up. I consider myself a discerning traveller and went here based on reviews. I was disappointed in every respect. Dahra spa is not easy to get to and is in a very run down part of town. The spa is so dark and dimly lit I could not tell if it was clean but it did not feel clean. The young thai girl who did my foot massage was not well trained in massage and when she started pushing on my kneecap I had to politely ask her to stop. For the one and a half hours I was there in the afternoon the place was empty. Go with your gut when you walk in and turn around and walk out.

Great experience. During our stay in Bangkok we wanted to try one of the million spas in Bangkok and decided to go for the Dahra Spa (we heard about it from tripadvisor). It is close to Silom Road and easy to find. We had a 1,5 h-Oil-Massage there and it was wonderfull. Service was great and the athmosphere very relaxable. Everything was extremly clean and as described on there homepage.We will have another treatment at the Dahra next time when we`ll visit Bangkok again.

Too Expensive. I live in Bangkok and have had numerous massages. I went here with two friends. The consensus was: this place is totally average. Take into account the price, 500 baht, and it is possibly the worst place I have ever gone for a massage. I've never paid more than 250, for a massage. Where I live, massages are 150 baht and better than this place. Don't go. The massages aren't bad, but why pay double.Two things good about this place though is the customer service and it is a fairly nice facility.All these other reviews are misleading. O

If you haven't been to Dahra, You haven't been to Bangkok!. It is a total relaxing experience in a very serene, calming and restful environment in the middle of a complete chaotic city. The masseuses are friendly and properly trained to do the job and the rooms look very nice. The serenity starts as you enter the “lobby” and a friendly face welcomes you in. You can sit down and whilst enjoying a nice cold glass of water, the friendly young lady explains the choices at hand.So if you ever go to Bangkok, be sure to visit Dahra beauty and spa!Greetz, a very relaxed customer.

Great experience, went out of their way for me.. My younger brother and his girlfriend were travelling to Bangkok in early Jan for their first trip overseas, I've visited Thailand many times I know how wonderful a good Thai massage is, and thought that gifting them a massage would be a great intro to Thailand and south east asia for them, particularly after a long flight. I organised this through Dahra spa (prompted by some of the great reviews here on trip advisor) and although my request was rather unusual and not something they would normally offer they went totally out of their way to arrange things for me. My brother reported back to me after the massage and said it was "absolutely amazing" so I'm thrilled with the service and their experience. I'll have to go and get one myself next time I'm in Bangkok! many thanks to John and Dahra spa for a great experience and being so accommodating. Lorna.

An assured oasis of peace & serenity in bustling Bangkok. The other reviewers are absolutely right: Dahra Beauty & Spa is quite possibly Bangkok's best oasis of calm. From the moment we entered the Spa's door we were treated almost as old friends by the most lovely receptionists. It seemed, right from the moment we entered that we'd reached the right place to receive much needed relief from the urban madness which stretched out for miles around us. Nothing is rushed here and there is an extensive menu of treatments which you are free to browse at your own pace while savouring the thought of being thoroughly pampered just a few moments later. Thus my partner and I decided to escape the madness of midday Bangkok with what was simply described as a "Head and shoulders massage". And, we expected it to be good, given the Spa's most opulent ambience, attention to detail and most welcoming hospitality extolled to us on entry. But let's just say that our expectations weren't just exceeded as we were thoroughly satisfied on leaving. Don't miss spending at least an hour or two of your life at Dahra Beauty & Spa. Most highly recommended.

massage heaven. this is as important an attraction as the any other site i bangkok.i had only 4 days in bangkok and was on a mission to find a good massage place and Dahra was beyond expectations!!conveniently located just a short stroll away from Chong Nonsi BTS station and is a pleasant walk.as soon as u enter u are whisked away from the hustle and bustle that is bangkok. it is everything one expects from a professional massage house. and for the service the prices are very resonable.i tried the royal thai massage(750 bath for 90 mins) and its was a truly relaxing session. the messeuse is very professional and very attentive to make sure she is not using too much force. the next day i tried the aromatherapy oil massage(2500 bath for hours). and again it is pure bliss. the place is impecably clean, the aroma of herbs gently permeates thru the air lifting your stress away. i was lucky enough to meet the owner who despite being busy kindly spared a few moments for a pleasant chat.Dahra is a class above any of the other places i tried.i would recommend you try this place before any other massage house in bangkok.

A peaceful Oasis in the heart of BKK. I don't usually comment on these boards but i feel i must give a mention to the Dahra spa in BKK which i visited in August.I travel to Asia frequently on business but had never visited the spa on previous visits. Truthfully, i felt a little bit uncomfortable visiting a spa on my own but after a long flight from Europe a relaxing massage sounded very tempting. The spa was recommended by my concierge in the hotel and was within walking distance so i thought id give it a try.When i entered the spa i was surprised by the quality of the decorations, it was more like a luxury home and quite different than any spa i had visited before. The receptionist made me feel very comfortable and i selected the Aromatherapy Hot Oil massage. The masseuse didnt speak as much English as the receptionist but i didnt find that a problem. She was very friendly and performed the treatment in a very professional way. The standard of the room was very high and had a private shower (im not sure if all the rooms do). I am quite ticklish about my feet and have never really enjoyed having them massaged before. However, this lady managed to soothe my aches without making me feel uncomfortable at all. After i finished the treatment my whole body really felt relaxed and i was able to go back to the hotel for a good nights sleep.I visit BKK about once every 3 months. I will definitely be making another appointment next time im in town.

Our "Aha" Moment. I have had Spa experiences before in other countries, however I have never had a spa experience like the one I had at Dahra. My husband and I decided to have the "couples" aromatherapy massage. This was to be the first ever spa experience for my husband. We were made to feel comfortable from the very start. From the moment you walk into Dahra there is a wonderful warmth and ambiance there. Everyone is very professional, and from the moment you walk in the door the hustle and bustle of the cit y are gone. The rooms are exquisite, the staff extremely professional when providing services. After the "experience" with my husband for the first time, I can actually say our relationship had a definite "glow". I have not seen my hubby so relaxed..... Thanks Jorn and John for the best ("first") experience with my hubby. You have us for life customers! Lynne

My wow thai massage experience. One of the things you have to do when you were in Thailand is to experience thai massage, as we could see many places offer thai massage, but not so many places offer the "real" thai massage, when i was in Bangkok, i saw many sign boards that claimed as thai massage places, but for me personally those places more look like bars then a decent thai massage place.I found Dahra Beauty & Spa from a friend, cozy place, positive atmosphere, friendly and helpful staffs. I choose herbal thai massage, it was my first time having thai massage, and i was surprise with the massage technique, it's totally different technique thai massage than the ones that i saw in the beaches. Professional experienced therapist made me feel secure that i m in skillful hand and she really knows what she did, she lifted my arms, my legs, my head, press my back, she's all over the places, by the end of the massage i got my body massage with warm towels that has been steamed with herbal, it smells really good, the closest word that could describe the smell is clean smell, really relaxing, and makes you don't want to open your eyes after the massage session end.I totally can feel the different between before and after thai massage, my body is lighter, more energy and it keeps me in a better mood, and i'm glad to have my first thai massage experience in Dahra Beauty & Spa, otherwise i wouldn't know that there is a special technique of thai massage, not just rubbing and grabbing arms and legs.Well, if you want to experience the "real" thai massage, i highly recommend Dahra Beauty & Spa, with an excellent reasonable price and having the experience that could wow you, i think you would say the same things like what i just wrote.Enjoy your trip.

Great Spa in BKK. I had to do a lot of review before visiting one, because of the kind of massage parlours there are in BKK. But this one was an absolute beauty. They knew what they were doing. Excellent therapy, and gave some suggestions on what i could be doing for ongoing treatment as well. Definitely a must visit for anyone who is looking for a good spa treatment. The receptionist was very pleasant too!!

Best experience in Bangkok! . Went there with my friends for their signature face and body massage. Really good and relaxing massage with different techniques than traditional Thai massage. Was really relaxing and rejuvenating. Went again in Oct for facial and was impressed again with their service! Great facial!! Very experienced staff!! Loved the place..will come back again and again!!!

Serene environment, skilled staff. Cannot go past this wonderful spa experience in Bangkok. I am not usually one for massages but this has been a wonderful experience of a full body massage - so welcoming, peaceful, restful and refreshing. Now I make sure whenever I am in Bangkok I visit at least once - last visit went twice - such a treat! Family in Bangkok are regular visitors too!

Brilliant spa!! Fantastic massage!! A hidden gem . I used to use this spa all the time when I lived in BKK, on this visit I had to return and get another dose! I was so pleased that in three years the standard is still very high and they are all as lovely as usual.
