Best Spa experience. The owner is very friendly and went out of his way to help us pick the best massage. They were running promotions which were pocket-friendly. The place is clean and the therapist knew exactly what she was doing. I chose the hot stone massage for 2 hrs. It was so relaxing that I dozed off. Husband chose Thai massage and was totally refreshed by the end of it. After the massage they served yummy mangoes and water. I cant wait to go back and visit this place again.

Clean & relaxing!. Had nice touches like feet washing with soap, post-massage mango treat. Deco is more traditional.. overall clean. Feel is relaxing. Masseuse was gd.. relative to others elsewhere. Took a tuk tuk to the place..abt 15min fr central embassy. Recommended!

Worth travelling for. There are many good and many not so good massage places in Bangkok. Baan Sabai is definitely one of the good ones! everything is set up to ensure you have a relaxing experience, the owner Marco is very personable and the masseurs were all excellent.We went for a 2 hour massage with herbal compress to try to relieve back tension - it worked! We returned 2 weeks later and had a second great experience.Will definitely return next time we are in Bangkok

Nice Spa. I spent 2hours here with body scrub and body massage. The therapist was very nice and attentive, the place was clean and quiet. I was a bit disappointed at the beginning of the massage because she pressed the wrong points in my back, but the rest was good especially the foot massage. When i mentioned it with the manager he was very apologetic and gave me a small discount although i didn't complain at all. I appreciated that!

Looking forward to our next visit!. Very clean and professional spa with skilled masseuse. We booked a 4 hour combo of Thai oil massage, foot reflexology, head and shoulder and hand massages - super painful but definately glad we did. Go for the aromatic/oil massages for something more relaxing. The owner (Marco) is incredibly friendly and speaks perfect English - make sure to book in advance to avoid disappointment. Thank you for the matum!

Just perfect. Owner Marco is so kind and warmly welcomed when we arrived 40minutes behind the reserved time due to the heavy traffic. But Marco managed the rooms and massagers and we could enjoy the massage. Massagers are really good and it was my best massage. Even I got the massage in the couple room, massagers didn't chat and concentrate on us. Shop is clean and quite. Nice mood.Tip: please take motor cycle instead of taxi if you need to take any. You will imagine this spa would be fully booked if you see the reviews here. Please don't forget to make a reservation.

Amazing.. I would have to say this is the best spa I've been to across South East Asia. Very traditional place, very clean, and very skilled masseur. Owner speaks perfect english, so its good if you call ahead to make reservations to avoid a wasted trip out. We had the 90 mins Thai Massage, and will be back in the future to try other treatments.

Top massage, best price, clean, calm ^^. This spa is top 3 in bangkok.To me ,it is the best shop. As soon as you see this spa, you must make a reservation. I got thai massage for 2 hours. It is the best. 프롬퐁역 근처에 아니 방콕에 계신분들은 꼭 한번 받아보세요 트립어드바이저 스파 부분 3위가 그냥 3위가 아니라 정말 좋은 가게입니다! 바디~,헬스랜~등과는 차원이 틀려요^^강추입니다!
The most amazing spa. Amazing place, great service. We took the 2 and half hour treatment that was just perfect. Highly recommended
Great massage!. My husband and I had an amazing deep tissue massage at Baan Sabai Spa. Thanks for getting us loosened up for the long airplane ride home!

Amazing Massage. We had to go back for a second visit!. My hubby and I decided to book massages here after the great reviews on TA and the close proximity to our stay at the Marriott Executive Apartments. What a treat!We were greeted at the door with cold towels and a cool drink. Marco, the owner, could not have been more gracious. I decided on a 90 minute aromatherapy massage and my partner opted for the 90 minute Thai massage.The massage rooms are private and clean. I took a shower to wash off a day of Bangkok dust before the massage therapist began. My therapist was extremely professional and very talented. She made sure to ask if I was comfortable and to apply the right amount of pressure for me. It was extremely relaxing and a terrific experience.My partner said that it was one of the best massages he ever had, and he goes regularly and has a weekly package with the Massage Envy chain when we are home in Washington, DC. After the massage, we were served hot tea and fresh mango. Marco was truly concerned that we were satisfied with our experience. We enjoyed the massages so much, we booked again for our last full day in Bangkok. The experience was just as nice the second time.The price was very reasonable (1100 baht plus 100 baht tip) for the treatment. If this place was near my home, I would go every week! Just terrific!

Cozy little spa with great hospitality frm the manager.. I made an appointment the night before i visited the spa. The manager was really prompt in replying my emailed and scheduled an appointment for us in the afternoon and made suggestions on the treatment for the visit.We have not visited the spa before so we asked for directions frm the manager frm Emporioum mall which is about 15 min walk.The spa is located almost at the end of soi 26 and is just next to The Four Finger hotel. Along the walk you will pass by a lot of hotels and japanese restaurant. Also a lot of foreigners, expat or tourist walking by.Our apointment is at 3pm. We reach there around 2.30pm and was brought to our room to change and prep for the massage. There were some 30 min delay for them to attend to us. The therapist and manager came to apologize and explain.The spa was ok i did mention a few time for stronger massage. She took a few time to get use to it. We had the virgin coconut oil massage.I think their schedule is quite pack so she might be exhausted. As she is not that consistant during the ssession. We had a couple room the ambience was cozy and peaceful and compliment to them both as they did not talk during the session. Great job!Overall after the treatment the manager once again apologies for the delay. We were not able to use the credit card machine as line was down that day.Hope they resolve the problem as most ppl would rather pay card.Thanks again with the good hospitality and experience.

Recommended to book ahead. The place can be a bit far to reach from the BTS station, but we felt that it was worth the walk. The owner tried his best to accommodate any last minute changes when we were there. To avoid waiting, it's best to specify the package you intend to experience. The therapists were extremely professional, with just the right amount of pressure for our Thai massages.

EXCELLENT THERAPISTS, THAT'S WHAT YOU LOOK FOR.... People go to a spa, for various reasons.Some go to relax, others to try it for 1st time, then, there are those who look for something else-no reason to describe that here and of course there are all those , who want to enjoy a really good massage,in a proper spa bed or table and in a nice and relaxing ambiance. So environment,decoration, politeness are important factors, but most important thing, is the therapist. Baan Sabai Spa covers successfully all factors and as well , the most important thing, the quality of therapists. I went there 2 times together with my beloved one . First time , was immediately after her arrival in Bangkok, without even checking in the hotel we were going to stay.It was a fantastic experience from the beginning to the end. We've chosen different package, from promotional list and you know how important is to start your vacations without problems and fully satisfied. That, become a reality with our fantastic experience in Baan Sabai Spa. We've been welcomed and taken care as it must happen in a spa. They explained to us what comes next and we had the opportunity to choose aroma , for aromatherapy and type of of oil for oil massage. Then and after cold tea and refreshing towels - suits perfectly after experiencing the heatwave and humid conditions of Bangkok, coming together with the traffic jams to reach anyplace within the city- we were driven to spacious seperate rooms, for our treatments.I had aromatherapy massage compined with hot compress and she had oil massage and body scrub.Both were extremely rejuvenating and that was something discused between us, because we've visited a lot of high end spas arround the globe, as well as rather inexpensive ones.We are not impressed by candles, aroma sticks, music or beauty of therapists and decoration, but only by their quality and ability as therapists.I'm quite experienced on the subject for 3 reasons. One is that i suffer from rheumatoid arthritis , second i worked for a high end spa, in Athens , Greece, as a Media Counsellor and the last one is , that for 30 years i have massage of various type arround the globe.My therapist, Ms Mali, is the best i ever had and i suggest her 100%, as i suggest to you to try Baan Sabai Spa if ever in Bangkok.Owner Marco, a guy from Italy was very friendly, polite and helpful.For all above reasons we paid a second visit next day.I must mention as well, that you could see the happy and relaxed faces of others as they were coming out of their rooms after treatment

Great spa. Cold tea on arrival and mango at the end.Room was nicely decorated and spacious. Spa tables were clean. Shower available for use. We had the herbal compress and aromatherapy massage.Pricing was very reasonable. Owner Marco was friendly. Close to Indus so it was nice to have a delicious meal after the spa. My husband said he had the best massage in Thailand. We have been to about 14 spas in Thailand. My masseuse was okay. Poor pressure. I had asked 3 times for increased pressure during the massage. Never had to ask so many times before. She interpreted increased pressure as using her elbows and pounding my back rather than using her palms and fingers. So majority of my treatment is her touching me with oil and very minimal massaging. She wasnt very strong. Like any place some employees are skilled and some arent. Overall though they were friendly and the spa itself is nice and clean.

Amazing Experience. Husband and I had the best deep tissue massage of our lives at this place today, and we've had a lot of massages. These ladies are pretty petite, but do not underestimate them, they really know how to work out those deep knots. Staff was very welcoming, facilities were on point even though this place looks pretty unassuming from the outside and best of all reasonable priced compared to the other big name hotel spas. P.S. Support Small Businesses.

Amazing Massage, Facilities, and Service. I am so glad I ended my trip in Bangkok on a relaxed note by booking with Baan Sabai Spa. I received a combination (oil and pressure point) couples massage and we were both quite impressed with the facilities (jacuzzi tub, standing shower with great water pressure, comfortable massage beds, and more). The spa is also open late which was a total plus because I was so busy shopping for souvenirs all day. I definitely will be returning upon my next visit!

The Cure. My friends and I went twice in a short weekend trip every other day. I was lucky to have the same masseur to treat me twice. Her neck and shoulder massage and foot massage treated my pain instantly after a all day long of walk. Her finger can trace every nerve of my pain. Very professional!

Great As Been Recommended. Attracted to them from great reviews on their service and price.It was a nice environment and well received by Macro.We were there 2hrs ahead of our appointment, and appreciated Macro, who manage to make arrangement for us to start our session early.Indeed, they live to their name - 5 stars massage for low price which you wont be able to find it in other part of Bangkok. Our therapist can even tell us which part of our body has problem. The only small things which we like to feedback are increase aroma smell in lobby and room, as it will make guests feel more relax before starting their session, and do provide disposable underwear for hot herbal ball session as well.Hope to visit them again soon.

Mr. Well pleased with hospitality and service. Also, they seem to have promotions so it is better to check their website before heading... Or ask when you arrive. It is excellent spa and above all it is affordable... £$€ lol :)

Almost Perfect. I spent 3.5 hours at this serene and sophisticated spa. I booked their signature massage with a Thai Herbal massage and a 30 minute hot stone foot massage.i entered through a peaceful covered patio and garden located in a lovely area of Bangkok. The receptionist greeted me with an herbal cold tea.After being escorted to a treatment room and given disposable undies and cotton spa pajamas I was directed to start with a shower. The spa is a year old and all the fixtures are state of the art including the stone shower. The treatment was relaxing and the Thai herbal massage was a new experience, soft and relaxing. Unfortunately the room was needed for the sauna and half way between I was moved to a room with the massage mat on the floor. The move broke up the serenity but was quickly restored. The hot stone foot massage was more like a calf massage. Although it felt nice it wasn't a foot massage. I had expected something like reflexology but it didn't come close. I felt it was a waste..When finished I was given another cup of tea and sliced mango then a taxi was called for me to avoid the haste. This would have been a 5 star experience if I wasn't moved and I had a true foot massage.
Very nice staff and serene environment . Very good massage, kind, and professional. This place is away from the busy main street which is great. I highly recommend it.

Very good massage, minor points of improvement. We went here because of the wonderful reviews. The massages were faultless, and the value very good - much cheaper than what you would be paying for at a hotel. Marco the owner was very nice, and the therapists very attentive. The beds were very comfortable and the oils used lovely. The pricing was transparent and all taxes and fees were included. There were three things that made our experience fall short of 5 stars. The shower facilities were not the cleanest as it could be (shower mat looked like could use a wash) and felt slightly run down. There were mosquitoes in the room - the dim room made it hard to see them but we still saw quite a few. And to no fault of the spa, it's not too conveniently located. It is decorated in a more traditional Thai style (wood floors and cushioned seating) which we liked.

The best massage. I came to Baan Sabai Spa after my friend recommanded me.I was tired from my trip and i had a stong back pain.I decided to try aroma with herbal ball compress.Wow!i was fell asleep after just 10 minutes and at the end i was felt so good that i booked the second treatment the day after.The pleace is very clean and the staff very polite and very well trained.They welcome me with cold tea and fresh towel,after the massage they served me a fresh mango and hot tea.I strongly recommande this place.Thank you to all Baan Sabai staff to give me a very good time

The best spa in bangkok. I searched this spa from here and then made reservation by email. The owner confirmed my reservation quickly. He was nice and listened to our needs before the treatment. The therapists were professional and able to figure out our tiredness part. One of them could even speak good English and communicate with us. We felt relaxing in the spa and after the treatment. Our shoulder pain have been lessened afterwards. Thank you to macro and the therapist. We must visit the spa again.

Best spa in Bangkok!. I spent an incredible day at Baan Sabai last weekend. This spa definitely stands out because of the attention to detail - skilled and attentive masseuses, fresh mango served after treatments, refreshing teas served before and after, minimalistic decor and high-end equipment. Definitely worth it to book ahead of time. I emailed with Marco via the Baan Sabai website and was able to easily set-up my appointments. Really enjoyed the two-hour herbal ball massage, and liked the facial and body scrub, too. Highly recommended.

Great value!. Got a wee bit lost getting here. But Marco (the owner) literally walked out of his spa to look for us. We had a good massage at reasonable prices. Very relaxing and clean and highly recommended to anyone. Marco explains the various treatments patiently!
So good !. I love it, good service good place and clean ... more relax i need thanks for take good care see u again for sure ☺

Best Aroma Massage I ever had!. I booked one hour in advance the aroma massage.The Staff is awesome and the lady who was sitting at the front desk knew how to small talk while waiting for my room to be ready. The massage was the best and most professional one I ever got so far. The Aroma Massage I got was kind of a Thai Massage so it hurts a little bit but the feeling afterward is great. I got a tea and some mango after the massage. The atmosphere and the background music were very relaxing.I would definitely come back again whenever I visit Bangkok!

Phenomenal massage!. I absolutely loved this place and I highly recommend coming here. The decor is beautiful, the people were extremely friendly and my massage felt amazing. I got the 90 minute hot oil massage and loved it. If I'm ever in Bangkok again I will definitely be coming back.

Healed my knee pain.. This Spa has been open for less than a year but Its already one of most highly rated spas in bangkok!I went there everyday I lived in the area and spent 13 hours there trying out all the different types of massages. You can't go wrong with any type of massage, but the hot stone massage is absolutely heavenly!My favorite therapist was: BoShe was always my go to therapist. However, the 2 oldest therapists are also very good as well.The place is very relaxing, maybe too relaxing as I fell asleep a few times during my sessions. Make sure to book in advance as they can get very busy.If Marco the owner is around he will strike a conversation with you.I told him about my right knee pain and discomfort on one of my toes and after a few sessions it went away! Seriously... the best spa in Bangkok!

Best home style spa in BKK. 한국어로 적을께요 저는 방콕 도심여행을 상당히 좋아하는 사람입니다. 트립어드바이저에는 첫 리뷰지만 여러 사이트에서 멍원장이라는 이름으로 가끔 후기를 올리곤 합니다. 방콕 도심내에 특히 잘사는 지역과 외국인 거주 지역 중심으로 가정집을 개조한 호텔에 가까운 (당연히 호텔 스파가 더 좋습니다) 스파들이 많이 있습니다. 바와 / 1930 / 오아시스 같은 스파가 전통적인 고급 주택 기반 스파입니다. 가격대는 4성 호텔 스파에 육박할 만큼 비싸지만 어느 스파는 호텔보다 낫기도 합니다. 제가 반 사바이 스파를 찾은 이후에 좀 놀라왔던건.... 가격대가 한등급이 더 낮지만 바와나 1930보다 떨어지지 않은 모든 시설과 서비스 입니다. 특히 외국인인 주인 마르코는 다른 태국 오너 보다 서비스 정신이 좋아서 배려가 많고 심지어 손님들과 잦은 소통을 통해서 지속적으로 서비스를 개선하고 있습니다.이런 모습에 몇번 들리고 이런 저런 얘기를 나누다 보니 저는 마르코와 친구가 되었습니다 그래서 고민하다 오늘 가격대비 성능이 가장 좋은 방콕의 홈 스파인 Baan Sabai Spa를 추천합니다. 이미 다른 한국 사이트에는 몇번의 추천을 이미 했습니다. Hello Marco? ~ This is JEFF from Korea. See you soon~

Wonderful and relaxing spa treatment at Baan Sabai Spa in Bangkok. We really enjoyed our visit to Baan Sabai spa in Bangkok today. The owner, Marco, was very professional yet friendly, replied to all our emails very promptly. When we arrived for our 3 hour long couple's spa treatment and massage we were greeted warmly by Marco himself who provided great conversation while we waited for our treatment to start. The massage and body scrub felt amazing and the ladies were very professional. The lights in the room were dimmed the whole time and the atmosphere felt relaxing in general. We were treated to a special Thai tea and a mango at the end of our treatment. Would definitely recommend this spa if you are looking for a clean, professional AND relaxing environment.
Great service, amazing massage! . Very kind staff. The Thai massage was great, very relaxing, free tea and conversation. Pretty good English amongst the staff as well.

Best Massage Experience in Thailand . Found this via the really good reviews from Tripadvisor and I couldn't agree more.It is located at the quiet Japanese residence area and assessable with BTS (direction as below)Direction from the website: From Prom Pong BTS station (exit 4) walk to soi 26.Enter in soi 26 and walk straight for about 800 mt. until 7 eleven and Four Wings hotel.From here just walk 20 more mt.on the side of Four Wings hotel and you will see Baan Sabai Spa clearly.Upon arrival I was greeted by the owner, Marco who has been very helpful and informative. I took the 2hours aromatherapy and hot compress full body massage and I simply love every min of it. Chose the sweet dream massage oil which apparently is their signature! (Others include lemon grass and romantic which is really exclusive for Baan Sabai Spa only)The masseur is very respectful of privacy and all smiley. It is a very typical Thai massage kind (if you love the elbow massage aiming at the sore points). Although a lil bit painful but it helps as I have really stiff shoulder and the massage really help to loosen the knots :) I fell asleep during the hot compress massage part, maybe it is the sweet dream essential oil effect ;)Highly recommended if you are looking for a private less crowded and authentic Thai massage! Do book in advanced via their website (with super swift response) to avoid disappointment.Oh ya on the way to the spa there is this Thai local noodle place which looks really yummy (sort of like "wan tan mee") and also a lot of Japanese restaurants and cute little concept cafes if you would love to chill after a long day

Great massage experience. My husband and I paid 400 baht each for a Thai massage and got top class experience. Very professional set up - clean and good decor. Lovely cup of Thai tea and plate of mango afterwards. Owned by an Italian guy who has strict rules on the type of place he wants it to be - professional and well worth paying a bit more for a proper massage.

More technique no frills. Not very accessible as it is right at the end of Soi 26, you can hop onto one of those 10bht motorbikes and ride pillion but I rather walk as I value my life more. After the long walk in, I was quite disappointed with the spa, it looked old and dated outside and inside. The receptionist did not look very welcoming. They started the 90min aromatherapy massage right away, no questions asked about skin allergy or health condition, no cold towel or welcome drink. They also didnt ask if there is a specific area to focus on. Basically no frills. The therapist was good, she attacked all the usual problem areas of back and shoulder. There was a cup of tea provided at the end of the massage which cost 1100bht. While the therapist was good, I prefer a spa with more customer engagement and nice touches like cold towels and at least some questions to show they want to understand their customers better. The old, dated look is also not my thing so I think this will be my first and last visit. There are better spas elsewhere in Bangkok.
Brilliant!!!. Perfect experience ❤️❤️Experience, welcoming and helpful staff. A brilliant all round experience. Defintinitely recommend

Tranquil environment with outstanding customer service demonstrated. My family visited the spa when we were in Bangkok recently. I was first impressed when I scrolled through the reviews in Tripadvisor and saw that the owner Marco replied personally to every review received. It was a good start. I wrote in to make a reservation and the reply received was courteous, prompt and helpful. When we arrived at the spa, Marco was aware that my mother had some injuries with her leg and specially assigned his experienced masseuse to assist my mother with her treatment. Every single question that was asked was patiently answered and explained, we were so amazed by the level of patience exhibited. The treatment room was spacious, tranquil and had well controlled lightings. The accompanying music during the treatment was appropriate, it made the entire 3 hour session extremely soothing and relaxing. The thai massage that we had was professional, the masseuses did not chat during the treatment, which was something I was particular about. Well worth treatment at affordable prices, together with Marco's personal touch, this is a gem for massages and spa sessions in Bangkok. We will definitely be back to visit and will readily recommend this spa to anyone.

Best highlight of entire Bangkok trip!. Came to know of this spa from my sister in law whom travelled together with us. Owner of Baan Sabai came to pick us up personally from our hotel in the city area and drove us to his spa. He was very friendly and kind! Upon arriving at his spa, it was a sanctuary that was unlike the surrounding area of the spa location. He recommended and explained each treatment patiently to us and advised us which treatment to get. We were all very impressed by his knowledge of this trade. We chose our respective treatments and proceeded to the rooms. I chose the aroma massage and scrub package. My masseuse was very very skillful. From the start to the end of the 2 hrs long treatment, it was very comfortable and just the right strength and I fell asleep during the massage which I had never done before during massages. After the whole treatment, me and hubby enjoyed the hydrotherapy spa which was highly enjoyable too. We were all so relaxed after the whole session and really wished to come back the next day again. The whole experience at Baan sabai was so lovely and relaxing. No hassle and no fuss. You get more than what you pay for. That's the only thing I can say. Its prices are very reasonable for its standard and definitely something you won't regret. Do not think any further, this is the ONLY spa you have to visit in Bangkok. No regrets, only memories.

So good . I went to Baan Sabai Spa for deep tissue massage as my friend's recommend.The room was clean and good music let me felt so peaceful.The massage was wonderful.After 2 hours I felt so good that I promised my self to repeat it once a week.I'm very happy for the friendly way that they welcome me too.Perfect experience.Thanks
Aroma massage. One of the best aroma massage in town.I was very surprise about this massage.The quality was excellent.the spa is clean and the therapist very polite.I recommend this Spa

Excellent!. I come to this place after a busy day in bkk.I was very tired and the owner introduce me the new treatment with the vulanic stone.It was the best massage that i've never made.I felt asleep in just 10minutes.After 1 hour i ask to extend the massage for 1 more hour and they give me and additional foot hot stone pack.Excellent!I strongly recommend Baan Sabai at least one

Just what we needed!. My wife and I went for a couples massage along with a foot massage and body scrub. This is reasonably priced and was the best massage I've had. Just make sure to tell them what kind of pressure you would like, I told my lady I wanted more pressure and she was happy to accommodate. Booking was effortless and they communicated extremely well over email.

Great place to relax your day in bkk. . I thought it is very great place to get relax in the center of bangkok. I went here a few times already and i love here. Their staffs are professional. They have many kind of massage to choose whatever u want. Place's very nice, clean, quite and relax. Make me feel very good. They also have parking. Easy to reach for. If someone loves massage same me. Need to try. Lovely place

Amazing massage. After a long trip back to Thailand i was felt exhausted so i decided to have a massage.Our hotel recommend Baan Sabai Spa and i have to agree with that choise.The spa is very clean and they welcome me in very friendly way.Mr.Marco (the owner)after asked me some details recommend me the hot oil massage with deep tissue.It was fantastic!The best massage.perfect job!Here you feel that every one know what they have to do.Service was great,massage superb and price not bad.I'll be back for sure!I strogly recommend

3 Day stopover in Bangkok. After a few weeks of traveling arrived in Bangkok for 3 days... Really needed a deep tissue massage after a bit of searching online located "Baan Sabai Spa" excellent customer care and very professional therapist... Would highly recommend this spa. As I arrived at the spa the staff discussed what type of treatment that was required. The therapist was very pleasant and offered an excellent deep tissue massage. Which manage to resolve the jet lag of travelling. As you already aware Bangkok offers many spas and massage outfits. Customer care and the environment is a ++ for me which is what this spa offered. Highly recommend.

Awesome. Our last day in Bangkok was rainy and after all the sightseeing we'd done, we decided to go to a spa. Being rather close to our hotel and having good ratings on TripAdvisor we choose for Baan Sabai. I can surely recommend this place as it's the best massage I've had in Bangkok. The salon and its staff are very professional and my massage therapist was excellently skilled. Unlike some of the massages I've had when the masseuse just rushed through a routine, this masseuse really took her time and we had a wonderful experience.

Off the main roads but worth the effort. Off the main roads and a bit of a walk down soi 26. The inside is nicely decorated. They have a good selection of oils for you to choose from if you do an oil massage. They also have a skilled Thai massage person who delivers as strong a massage as you want. Rooms are both private singles and doubles if you have a spouse or friend. Front rooms are a bit noisy (traffic) and some plumbing needs to be repaired with drip drip from a adjoining shower room. Overall a good choice if you are in the area.

Best Spa in Bangkok!!!. This is one of the best spas in bangkok. The place was very clean with nice atmosphere. The masseuses we had were very good. We were just planning for a foot massage but ended up spending over two hours enjoying our aroma therapy massage instead ;). We will certainly go back there again and would recommend this spa to anyone.
Great massage. Great spa, great location, amazing massage and super friendly staff. Highly recommendable and next time back in Bangkok will book another massage.

Wonderful spa in Bangkok . I was first greated by Marco and had an amazing experience. The people there knew what they were doing. Therapeutic is the word I would describe. Price is reasonable and rooms are very clean.Payment was smooth and I would recommend to make an appointment in advance.Enjoy!

Amazing massage!!!. The place is outstanding for its decor, attention to detail and customer care. After a long flight it was simply amazing to land here and be taken care of by the nicest and most professional Thai lady. As many places for massages in Bangkok are rather "shady" I was extremely happy to find Baan Sabai and enjoy a REAL Thai massage. Not to be missed!!

Nothing Special. I live in Bangkok and get a massage about twice a month. I've tried all sorts of spas and thought I'd give this place a try. Sorry to say I was not impressed. The dissapointment starts at the door. The spa sits on the edge of a big bare construction site of broken cement, bright sun and dust. The manager (Arabic?) is a bit of a creepy guy with lots of hair. The massage itself was nothing special, the same as all the other 100 massage places in the city. So why the fuss? In the end I felt uncomfortable and wish I hand't come.

Perfect. I had the hot oil deep tissue sport massage. I do workout mostly everyday (cross-fit) and I had knotted muscle here and there, esp. neck and shoulder. Recommended by the owner, the massage was really great. I felt like all my cramped muscle got softened. In general, I am not a big fan of oil massage, but for this purpose oil massage was much better. I got it 2 days in row. Definitely, I will go back again when I visit Bangkok.

So relaxing. A bit far from BTS station, but 1st class spa. It would be better to have some sort of help in respect of transportation. In view of price, I was too smart to choose here XDI did think about taking my mum to Baan Sabai before 2015 year end, if there was not the explosion, hope everyone in Bangkok stays healthy and happy. I will definitely visit again later.

A little disappointed. Went there with high expectations after reading the ALL excellent reviews. It is a fair distance from the prompong BTS station situated next to Four Wings hotel. When we arrived, we were told that they only accept cash as the boss is not present.We booked the 2 hour aromatherapy massage. Usually when you enter the treatment room of a spa, you already start to relax with the scented candles and the soft spa music. There was none of that here. It was only during the last half hour of our massage did the spa music suddenly blasted through. Must have coincided with the owner arriving. So the preceding hour and a half was spent listening to the constant noise of traffic from the road outside and the occassional conversation between the therapists and the telephone ringing away at the reception desk. Hardly soothing nor relaxing. In the shower stall, the soap dispenser was totally empty and no one had bothered to check or refill it, so we ended up washing ourselves with the pink shampoo. The girls were good at what they did, but unfortunately the other negative aspects of this place means I cannot agree with the other reviewers and give it an excellent review. The owner had arrived by the time we finished and he informed us that it was perfectly alright to pay by credit card. I guess my expectations are a little high as this is the first time I have ever ventured out of the hotel spa environment. So perhaps if you are planning to go to this spa, it is advisable to check if the Italian owner is going to be present before you visit.

Excellent afternoon of relaxation. I arrived to Baan Sabai on an airport lay-over right off the plane. The facilities were clean and with a great atmosphere, the staff were lovely and I was really happy with the price for a 3.5 hour package! Would definitely recommend. Afternoon of bliss!

Great value!. We booked a couple massage in advance and were late for appointment because of traffic but owner Marco was very comforting. He accommodated us, made no fuss, suggested us good massage options. Massage room was decent. Masseuses were diligent, though were chatting and laughing with each other initially in Thai which was slightly disturbing but it was a job well done in a 2hr massage. They also made attempts to entertain our 3yr old daughter that was quite sweet. The service was very pleasant, welcome drink was nice and they helped us get a taxi back. A very relaxing and calm experience and very good value for money.

Relaxing in Bangkok . I had a wonderful relaxing body scrub and afterwards a oil massage. It was the best spa I have been to in Bangkok. After relaxing in the spa we took a taxi down soi 26 to k village and had a nice lunch

Luxurious Spa for the best price. It was just perfect here - i found this little gem because i searched for a nice afternoon in a really relaxing, clean and calming Spa not a rush-in-and-out one like there are so many in Bangkok.It was also important to me that the 'spa feeling' is here and to be treated as a special guest, but still not too expensive! Marco, the owner, welcomed me and gave me a few tipps how to choose the right treatments for me and how to save some money - (it ended up way cheaper than i expected!)The massage (i had a 2h thai massage) was just perfect - the older lady seemed to have a lot of experience, she was even able to say that i must be carrying a backpack, because of my hard spots in the back... At the end she also gave me a few tipps how to relieve the pain in the neck myself, i tried and she corrected me a few times until i did it right. I thought that was really nice!Oh, and on the way to the spa, i burnt my foot at the motorcycle, so she gave me some aloe vera cream for cooling it and when i left an plaster so it wouldn't get dirty on the streets - so nice. As the second treatment i had a facial - very nice, luxurious scrub, mask, cream,...Afterwards i got a yummy tea. The (single) rooms are very nice, clean and quiet.I will be definitely coming again and if you are thinking about going - do it! I'm sure you will like it, whether going alone, als a family, with your special other...

Amazing place. Friends of mine recommend me Baan Sabai Spa so I and my husband decided to booking 2 massages.We were welcome from mr.Marco and he was very friendly.After few talk we decided to take body scrub / aroma + jacuzzi bath for 2.5hours.Wow! Wonderful experience.All particular details was in the right way,from the towel to the petals of rose that they add in the milky soap bath.The massage in its self was perfect!The room and the atmosphere great.The place is very clean and the therapist professional and polite.Definitively I'll be back again!

Lived up to my expectations. Based on this spa´s ranking on TripAdvisor, my girlfriend and I decided to go to Baan Sabai for a massage on one of our last days in Bangkok. Based on the prices through their website, it really seemed affordable.When we first got in the door, the guy who met us (Marco) welcomed us in a very polite and humble manner. We got the menu, and were given advice on which massage to take, and how to combine the Thai massage with some neck and shoulder massage at the end. We decided on the 2 hour treatment, which would cost us only 700 baht per person! We were offered the ability to add some oils to the massage, but decided not to - with no bad feelings.This place really lived up to my expectations! We had to leave our shoes on the outside, and were borrowed a cozy pair of slippers. The waiting room, the hallway, the massage room and the restrooms were all perfectly clean. The atmosphere was delightful, with a hint of asian tones from a hidden stereo set. After the masseuses actually washed our feet, we were both handed a pair of neatly washed and cleaned trousers and a shirt that we would wear during the massage - and some privacy to change.Now the full body Thai massage really was something out of the ordinary! Both relaxing and painful in a good way. If you feel stiff, it really hits the right spots. The back massage also takes care of all those hidden and irritating knots. The 2 hours felt to me like 30 minutes! Really enjoyable. My girlfriend also enjoyed her massage very much, but hoped that it was going to be a little stronger. So if you want it a little strong, you better let them know.After the massage we were given a cup of tea, made from some exciting dried fruit. Thankfully there was no sugar added, and it really tasted marvelous. We were even able to buy a bag of these fruits for 70 baht. Worth every baht! When we were leaving, it had started to rain, and we had no umbrella. But Marco got one of the workers to run down the street to get us a taxi. Really fantastic service.If i am ever in Bangkok again, I am coming back there. This is the right place to go!

The definition of tranquil. After taking a tumble on one of Bangkok's infamous stairs during a rain storm, I visited two places the hospital and Baan Sabai...though the hospital was necessary I believe it was the hands of my massage therapist ( I am sorry that I have forgotten her name) and the wisdom of the spa owner, Marco that helped the mending process. I received three types of massage (Thai, hot oil, and medicine ball,) they all provided the desired effect. I strongly recommend this spa to all!
Perfect!. excellent place to get a good massage. Marco was very friendly and helpful. The massage was good and we've enjoyed it a lot. Keep up the good work and hopefully we''ll be there again!

Excellent Value. We took our chances with Baan Sabai as we did not made a reservation due to a previous bad experience with spa bookings. To our relieve the owner (Marco as I could gather from the other reviews) informed us he could accommodate us. He wanted to give us the couple room out the back of the property however he was aware there were construction work going on. Thus he gave us a choice of 2 single rooms as well as the couples room. We didn't had a problem with either choice but decided in the end to go with the couples room. Initially there were some construction noise but at best it only went for 30 minutes. And this was after being notified several times by Marco there might be noise so it wasn't a problem for us. We had the 2 hours Thai Massage. The massage itself was wonderful. Apparently according to the Mrs, I dozed off for a bit during the massage haha . . so that was how affective the massage was to relaxing me. The Mrs also enjoyed hers.After the massage, Marco invited us to have some warm tea as well as some durian chips. Both were delightful. From our short interactions with Marco, we felt very welcomed and appreciated as guest thus I definitely recommend Baan Sabai spa if you're in Bangkok.

Heaven on earth in the heart of Bangkok city . Baan. Sabai is the professional spa n massages with high standard both services and environment, strongly recommended to not only spa and massage lovers but for all Bangkok visitors.

Wonderful aroma massage. I went to Baan Sabai Spa with my husband after a busy day and we were looking for good massage and relax.After the racomandation of our friend we took à look in tripadvisor rating so we decided to visit this place.Mr.Marco welcome us and we felt quickly at home.we took 2 hours of aroma massage.Wow!it was our best massage in our life.Wonderful experience with professional staff and nice room.Everythink was clean,good smell and nice tea with durian chips at the end.We will definately come back!

Amazing: best massage ever. I am extremely impressed with Baan Sabai Spa! I did a combination of body scrub, aromatherapy 90 min massage, and a facial to finish it off. They were very professional, clean, and the massage was the best I've ever received---the massage was better than many spas in 5 star resort hotels. It's also great value for such a high quality! I will definitely return on my next visit to Bangkok.

Professional and most importantly CLEAN!. I am so impressed that the whole facility was very clean! I am a bit of a germaphobe and felt comfortable because I felt that the clothes that I was given to wear was clean, as well as the bed I was laying on. Marco (the owner I think) was incredibly friendly and thorough with explaining what sort of treatments they did. I did the traditional Thai massage, and I was properly wrung out like a pretzel. It is very affordable too! It may be a little more expensive than the places around it, but it is totally worth the money. Yeah, you can pay about $5 for a Thai massage in a huge hall with 20 other grunting people, or you can pay $13 for a private and clean room!

One word: wow!. My husband and I were extremely pleased with our experience at this spa. I had a body scrub and thai massage with oil; my husband had a body scrub and aromatherapy massage. The ladies were highly skilled, polite and professional. The owner was very friendly and accommodating. We really felt like important 'guests', rather than just another customer. Once we had finished our fantastic massages, the owner even kindly offered us both an additional snack and a cup of herbal tea. I highly recommend anyone looking for a massage in Bangkok to visit this superb spa.

Impressive spa and very warm customer service.. Was our last day in Bangkok, and my wife wanted to head for a spa and massage badly. We had a feeling that all the big players would be fully booked (on a Sunday) so we searched and decided try Baan Sabai, just by our gut feeling. My wife called and was attended by the owner, Marco himself. He immediately reserved for us his couple room (with x2 massage bed, jaccuzzi and shower) and had everything prepared for us within an hour. When we reached his spa, we were warmly greeted by him and his staff. He then went on to share his couple packages, but wasen't pushy and was even willing to customise the packages for us. We finally decided on 2.5 hrs package. Overall, it was an excellent experience as his staff were very experienced and professional.At the end of the session, we had light chat with Marco and even recommended us some dining options (as it was already dinner time) nearby! We were truly touched by his customer-oriented spirit. Will definitely visit again.

BEST THAI MASSAGE. My friend and I were there on the 19th June. We did an excellent 2 hrs Thai Massage.The massage is right to the point, it helps to relax our muscles. I'd surely visit again if i ever go back to BKK.

Excellent massage, going back again !!!. Visited bangkok many times.. tried massage but always disappointed. Read about this spa on TripAdvisor, At the spa, owner was very helpful. Told him problem area, he made recommendation but did not push for any expensive treatment. I chose 2 hrs Thai massage. He did some customization to have therapist spent time on my neck/shoulder. Therapist was experienced and gave a really good strong massage. Cracked some "bones"...and price is reasonable, felt really relax and rejuvenate...place is also nicely decorated with greens and very clean...Going back to try thai herbal oil massage with herbal compress..Definitely will recommend this place to my friends...

Been here to relax with Thai Massage. After a long day in Bangkok to shop, decide to have a thai massage.Looking for a good one, but with so many options available in Bangkok, need to be careful with the choices.Luckily we choose this Baan Sabai Spa after read some others reviewer. We took 90 minutes Thai Oil Massage.It's really relaxing and time passed so fast. Recommended!

expert !. following the reviews of tripadvisor, I visited this place. They are unknown in korea yet, I was in half in doubt. but reviews are all right! they are so kind and polite, and their massage skill was good. they seems like experienced masseuse. my sister and I are very satisfied. I've got promotion program for 2 hrs (aroma oil massage and herbal ball compress). they gave me herbal ball used on me. now herbal ball is kept in my freezer as he recommended. he said whenever they do herbal ball massage, they make the ball newly. I wanna get there soon again!

Wonderful experience in Baan Sabai Spa Bangkok in March 2015. I went to Bangkok for business reasons and I discovered the most wonderful and professional Spa I ever been in my all life;From the minute I went in the Spa from the welcoming staff to the moment I left the Baan Sabai Spa I felt the most happy and relaxed person on hearth.I experienced two hours massage suggested by the Owner of the place in the room with Jacuzzi and private shower. The Therapist who massaged me she was so professional she pressed all the points of my back with the Aroma Oil massage and afterwards my all body felt twenty years younger I'm not kidding:))) I would highly suggested to make a visit to this Spa it must be experienced if you go to Bangkok.I will definitely go back to experience once again.Thanks to the all Staff of Baan Sabai for making me so happy and a valued customer;;Regards.Basilio Sciacca.

Relax and dream. Amazing place. I come there to take an oil massage and I went out with a huge smile! Furthermore the service is excellent and the price are totally fair. I will advice it to a everybody that is looking for an experience of relax
Excellent. Excellent place. Highly professional masseurs. The best massage I had in Thailand so far. I will be making this my regular place from now on!!!

Lovely place!. Baan Sabai spa is located in Sukhumvit Soi just in the heart of BGK. The place is really cozy, new and refined. People are very friendly and massages are great. If I were you, I would not miss the opportunity to visit it

In love with this place!. What can I said...This place it's simply amazing.I come here regularly to take my body scrub and oil massage and I've never disappointed.many of my friends are them customers and we are all falling in love with them.therapists very professional and owner always careful in details.it's very clean and the price reasonable.I recommend this place to everyone who looking for a good massage and good relax.

Relax. Wonderful time at noon.I took 2hours of aroma massage and after just 10 minutes I was sleepy.very peaceful. The room is very beautiful and clean.it was the most relaxing time of my last 5year.I definitely back.I also LOVE the music that they choose in the massage.Staff very nice,friendly and polite.Thanks for the beautiful time
Relaxing Time. Very good Staff and a good atmosphere. The best massage and very good price.Gianmarco knows how to relax yourself!
Afternoon retreat! . Great place!! Great atmosphere. Friendly staff and very professional. Best experience in Bangkok, hands down! Definitely coming back here.

First class all the way!. This newly established spa is conveniently located on the quiet end of Sukhumvit Soi 26, not too far from the main Sukhumvit road and its about a 15 min walk from Phrom Phong BTS station, its also very close if you're coming in from Rama 4 side. Its a beautifully decorated spa, converted from an old house into a little oasis of serenity, you can really see that some thought has gone into the design and feel of the place. I was greeted personally by the owners, which i thought was a very nice touch, they even took the time to recommend a suitable massage package which was perfect for me and my pocket. The staff are super friendly and are very professional at their job, you can see that they only employ the best therapists.The rooms are very clean and are designed for comfort and relaxation, just the way it should be. For the locals, its also good to know that there is parking available on site. If you are looking for a top notch massage at affordable pricing, then you definitely need to visit Baan Sabai...you won't be disappointed.

Andrea. I have been living in Bangkok for roughly 2 decades and I must say this is the best spa I have ever tried. Fantastic location friendly but still luxurious atmosphere .the massage was gently and effective . I am planning to go again next week .at last but not least the price is reasonable . No way must try .

Perfect Spa experience. Just came back from a 2 hours massage at Baan Sabai Spa . I must say that I was impressed by this Spa as it seems to have all range of typical Thai massages and treatment plus some other traditional Indian massages and treatments . The masseuse was very experience and attentive to my instructions ( I do not like to have a long massage on my back since I need more time on my arms and on my legs but it is usually very difficult to convey this message since most people have problems with their back) , the spa was quiet and clean and uses good essential oils . I can honestly recommend it for an hour or 2 of pure relaxation.

Fantastic place and massage. A beautiful and luxurious place in the heart of Bangkok. Nice, clean with a very relaxing atmosphere and friendly staff.The massage let me feel so better and the therapist really care about.She gave me the best sensations.I will repeat often.

fabulous massage. I had the most wonderful massage at Baan Sabai Spa. It is very relaxing at this gorgeous spa and the therapists really care about you. It was a wonderful treat and one I will be repeating often. I cannot recommend this spa highly enough. Its so good I almost wanted to keep it a secret just for myself : )

Spa Superb. As locals on our way to our usual local shopping trip, we decided to stop at this spa and were positively surprised. Friendly staff and a good quality massage. Also a nice 10-15minute walk from BTS Phrom Phong down one of Bangkok's more pleasant roads, filled with huge trees and shadows and a walkway were u actually can walk on. Good central location and good price value massage. Recommendable for locals and tourists alike.

A Great Value for Money. Less than 10 minutes' walk from busy Sukhumvit Road, I ,by chance, found a cozy and luxurious spa Baan Sabai newly opened a few month back. I tried its services.They provided me the first class treatment with economy class tariff, a great value for mymoney..I definitely will be regular customer of Baan Sabai as far as I am in Bangkok.

massage in bangkok. Superb location in the heart of Bangkok.I went there with sky train(Prompong station,EMPORIUM shopping center).The spa is in sukhumvit soi 26,just 10 minutes by walk from the mean road.I took a motorbike-taxi for 10 bt and when i said to the driver Baan Sabai spa he knew exactly where it was.In the beginning of the soi 26 there are many massage place,but honestly they look very dirty (a lot of girls outside the entrance.they look more as a go-go bar than real massage place).Friends recommended me this spa and it's very different from other massage place in that area.I went there with my husband.Wonderful massage at very reasonable price.Very clean and welcoming staff.Definitely recommendable

Good place to while away time. Good place to while away time when you have checked out but not flying off immediately. For other spas, you need to leave after the treatment, here you can hang around, visit the onsen and cafe or laze at lobby, then go for massage and shower b4 heading off to airport. There is also a Jap restaurant at the entrance if you like Yakitori and other foods not sold at cafe. Price for entrance and massage is pretty good value.

Light night out. A cozy onsen in sukhumvit area. The place has several onsen tubs, spa, japanese food, bakery, a wide range of drinks (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic). Ideal for a light night out with friends and family.

Great Relaxing Soak. Visited the onsen on a very hot sunny day and it was a very relaxing experience. The different pools were all very comfortable and the instructions were informative for an onsen newbie like myself. Will be back when I'm in Bangkok.
Best spa in bkk. Had a great time at the onsen. Also booked a Thai massage which turned out to be the best one I've ever had.

Japanese spa with delightful massage. We have been there with 3 friends and it has been a great experience.The onsen, which separate men and women is quite an experience for newbie like me, but the outcome worth it. Several pools with hot, very hot and cold water, hamam, sauna, etc. Great quality of service and facilities are clean and very nice.To conclude the massage is a bit pricy for BKK but delightful.A must-go place.

Good massage, crowded onsen, botched reservation . Booked 2 months in advance , confirmed over 3 emails but was told at front desk they booked us at 430pm instead of 230pm. We had to sit around and wait. They offered onsen foc as compensation but we had to cut short the massage time as we needed to head to the airport. The cafe took over half hour to serve food , tea and coffee even with 50% capacity. Onsen had 6 steps but we had to wait around to get into each pool - some pools could only fit 4-6 pax. Obviously overcrowded noisy and not relaxing Massage was good. Overall it was cheap but I would recommend off peak . We went on Sunday afternoon.

Use to be awesome. Used to be a frequent customer! Used to be very good no complaints but every since September the customer service at this place is like non existent if you want to try go to pattaya instead and also got banned for something I got accuse of doing which is talk load and complain about their onsen bath water temperature but seriously it's not like we as a customer cannot advise or suggest for improvements since I'm a old customer why would I want to bad mouth this place!! Save yourself the embarrassment and go to Pattaya instead! The Japanese manger wow her manners would so rude! If the owner was there I would have spoken to him myself never again
Relaxing place. Extremely clean and comfortable onsen. The massages are great but book ahead as it can be busy and difficult to get in.

So relaxing!. This is hands down my favourite spa in bangkok. The relaxing setting makes the place feel like your not in busy bangkok, its the perfect place to have a few hours getaway. The onsen itself is very relaxing and ive found going during the day time during the week is perfect as its not that busy, it gets alot busier on the weekends. The massages are also great, i enjoy the thai massage right after the onsen. The facial is also good.The cafe located outside the onsen area also serves some delicious healthy food my favourites are the yunomori salad and the tomato salad, and the fresh lemon soda is not to be missed.

Tranquil and Relaxing Environment. Unbeatable service from online booking to reception to massage. Suggest you book a maximum of a week in advance. I made an online booking like a month before the booking date, I'd got no response, but confirmation was received the next morning when I rebooked a week prior to our booking date.They provided us a form like our request of strength, the parts that we wanted more or none, however, as they did two years ago, didn't find the masseurs had followed though the massage was fairly good.You have the choice to use the onsen or not.

Can't wait to go back!. A beautiful quiet oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Facilities were clean and dressing up in yukata made the whole experience very unique. Onsen had clear instructions for the uninitiated. Massage was relaxing and enjoyable.

Clean place but not as authentic as singapore outlet. The area is not quite big.. Onsen area quite small and you won't enjoy if the place is pack. Restaurant is not huge and no one cleans up the plates after meal. The lounge for sleeping has limited seats.. However the onsen area is quite clean. Its raining when we left and thank gif that they provife free tutu transport to bts.
Great onsen and spa experience in Bkk. Better than expected. The onsen was outstanding and the service at the spa is excellence. Would highly recommend people to spend 3-4 hours at this lovely space

Disguting and disappointed. We are very disappointed for the service of the Japanese manager at the receptionist as we went there to used the onsen but what we couldnt believe was my husband told me there was a guy master base at the outdoor jacuzzi . Once that we told the manager she said we had to go to take the wriste band locker number to inform the them . We are so disgusting wih this matter and it s creating the traumaticsm to my husband ,feel embarassing ,uncomfortable to go back there . We bought 1 pack of voucher and it seemed like we spent money for nothing as nobody take any action or the responsible at all

Frequent visitor here . Lovely ambience. Great place to go and relax in the city. Massages can be a bit hit or miss, but usually it's ok. Recommend to onsen first, massage and then soak again. Definitely one of my go to places.

Not bad for this price. Well, I had been coming to Yonomori for a few years. Friendliness remain the same. Just that now they actually demand that you take your belonging after your onsen for your Aroma Therapy. The reason they gave was there were inconsiderate customers who went for onsen after their aroma therapy and stained the pool with essential oil.Try getting a package if u go there in a group or often.....it's worth it.

Satisfied . AccessTake BTS to Phrom Phong, walk down Soi Sukhumvit 24 for 20min (passing Hilton Hotel and The Davis Hotel on the left), turn left when you see the signage 'A-Square', onsen is at the right side of a cluster of low rise buildings. OnsenThe women's side has both outdoor (2 hot tubs, 1 pool) and indoor (soda pool, onsen pool, jacuzzi pool and cool pool) baths at varying degrees, plus a sauna. Disposable underwear is provided for those who are shy. I have noticed that most wear them. It was not very crowded (<10) when I went on a weekday afternoon. CafeLimited menu but reasonably priced and delicious food. The milk (banana pudding and melon) tasted so good. Bill is charged to the wrist band assigned to you at checkin, hence no need to bring wallet. Bill is settled at checkout when the wrist band is returned at counter. Rest AreaThere is an aircon rest area with TV (silent mode) and around 10 lounges. Blanket provided. Outdoor lounges are available but quite warm in the afternoon. Tuk-TukFree tuk-tuk from Yunomori to Phrom Phong BTS at 30min interval. Check with counter on timings.Overall, I like it as it looks new, is clean and is a close resemblance to Japanese public onsens. You may wish to bring mosquito repellent if you are susceptible to insect bites (I was bitten twice in public areas).

A retreat in the busy city.. I just discovered this 'clean' onsen retreat and have been there twice this week. The booking process via email and phone were smooth. We took package 2 onsen+one hour Thai massage.Upon arriving, we were greeted by friendly staff though the reception area can be busy at times. The whole process were well thought off:Check in-pay for the services you book-collect flip flops-go to locker room-collect towels, disposable undergarments (women) & yukata (robe)-change and bring small towel only to spa area-shower-use the 5 baths and steam room-shower-wear yukata-go to lobby for massage.Come at least one and half hours before the massage booking time, if you really want experience the bath at your own pace. 10 minutes before your scheduled massage you need to be at the lobby in your yukata. The staff will give you a small form to fill to specify how strong and which part of the body to focus on and to avoid during the massage.Our massages were great. We were given a couple room and we really liked the privacy.After the massage we were given pandan tea, ushered to the lobby where we fill in a feedback form and commit a tip. So the process around the spa is cashless. Upon changing and paying our tips commitment, we were given a check out receipt to collect our shoes before leaving.So the whole process were very systematic and smooth. The spa is quite spacious and there is also a rest area and cafe. We did not try this. But it is quite peaceful despite the crowd.A must go in Thailand if you don't mind being naked/almost naked in a bath. Not for the shy but most relaxing if you dare explore something new.

Authentic Japanese onsen with Thai hospitality. The moment you step inside this place, the ambience of tranquility surrounds you. You can choose onsen only, massage only or a mix. At just 450 Baht (390 Baht if you take a 10 coupon package valid for 1 year) it's a good price. Massage prices are also reasonable. Different types of baths (men and women separated of course) - soda bath, mineral (onsen) bath, steam, sauna, teak bath, jet bath, garden pool, are located in a garden setting adding to the "mineral spring" atmosphere. You can enjoy the onsen for as long as you wish, unless you have a massage booked, then they will come and call you. If you wish to enjoy onsen its recommended to go 2 hours before the massage to get full benefit from the onsen because it is not allowed to use onsen after a massage. After using onsen, one can relax in the airconditioned lounge or on the sofa in the garden. To complete the japanese tradition, you can buy milk at the cafe for the after-onsen-milk-drink experience. Yunomori Onsen is indeed a bit of Japan in Bangkok. And when you combine the two (Japan and Thai) most polite cultures of Asia, what more could one expect then the utmost perfection?

Japanese style onsen experience. A good place for those who want to experience japanese onsen, conveniently in bangkok city. Yunomori has several bath types in the bathhouse, and a step guide for first timer. Quite well designed except that the area is rather compact and crowded during my visit. Despite it was stated that no clothes allowed to enter bath area, but almost all still wore the disposable undergarments provided. Perhaps a common practice here. Tried the thai massage as well, it was just passable. Service and ambience was fine but skills wise still can't beat the old school hard core Healthland. For the Jap restaurant adjoining with the Onsen, it was poor and tasted awful, a waste of my time and stomach, could had gone to many better ones nearby. Can forget about it. Will just come for the onsen in future.

Best massage ever. I dont know anymore in how many places and countries i had massages but i had hundreds for sure. This massage just blew me and my girlfriend away. She took the thai mssage and i the head and shoulder. Both were 60 min and in a private room for us both it cost 980 bath. Just great. Many many thanks.The only bad thing about it is that we will be even more disappointed by average massages in the future.

Worth money, good for health. Nice café. For onsen is only 450 thb and time limited. Also many package for onsen+ massage , all at a reasonable price and good service. I've came here with friends for many times mostly at night cos after onsen really feel a warm( hot) body to sleep good. Will come back again for sure. BTW,I like the small café after onsen, Annim To-fu is strongly recommended. P.S. On weekends massage really fully booked if you want massage+ onsen package should be booked in advance. But for onsen no need to book.

Good Onsen, serene atmosphere fair pricing. This is pretty close to a Japanese Onsen experience. Japanese owner and some Japanese staff too. Cleanliness is top, atmosphere serene, no talking in the Onsen area. Post Onsen relaxation space is clam and nice as well and little food station served excellent smoothies and a variety of Japanese dishes. Recommended.
Great massage. Excellent customer service and massage. Would visit again. Staff speaks good English. There is shuttle service to nearest bts

As close as it gets to the Japanese onsens. A local Thai friend introduced me to this onsen, and I was impressed! Everything in the onsen area was the same as what I experienced in Japan. You can spend as much time as you like in the onsen, and you're not allowed to wear anything inside, so just your birthday suit and a tiny 'hand' towel. There are different onsens laid out with different functions and benefits, and then there's the usual dry and wet saunas. I walked out feeling completely renewed. You can also combine this with a massage and spa session after the onsen. Note that you can't use the onsen after a massage for hygeine reasons. The prices are very reasonable and value for money, IMO. Promotion hours (e.g. weekday afternoons) give even greater value. There's a nice Japanese themed garden, faced by a small Japanese cafe if you need to fuel up after a few hours of relaxation.Totally recommended for all... except those who feel shy about waltzing around naked around other naked men.

will never go back. I booked a signature package at Baht $2,500 per person but was totally disappointed. This is one of the most expensive spas in Bangkok while started from stepping in, we received unaccepted rude and non professional treatment.There's no customer services provided at all, not to mention a 5-star service we expected from what we paid. Nobody told you what to do after you paid and mom and I behaved like an idiot and felt stressed instead of relaxing.The massagers stepped out from 5-15 mins few times during the 3.5 hour treatment and finished 5 mins before the ending time. Their massage technique is also so so. Unless you don't mind to pay a lot for nothing, otherwise think carefully before you gofor myself I definitely won't visit this spa again, There are heaps of cheaper and better spas everywhere in Bangkok, if you want to try onsen in Bangkok, it seems there are some others there as well.when I finished the questionnaire, the receptionist came to ask me why I was so dissatisfied, I told her nothing reached my expectation. I asked her to call a cab for me going back to the hotel and she said she couldn't and could only arrange a free tuk tuk for me. (I learned there are lots of robbing when travelling on tuk tuk in Bangkok!)this is the first and only time I felt totally stressed after a spa treatment, not to mention a quite expensive one. sorry no matter what, I sure won't come back

A experience for me. Although we went as couple but we spent the time apart. Even till our massage. Massage was top notch compared to the price we pay for the land of cheap massage. Worth going if you are sick and tired of crowd and shopping!
Relaxing part of the day after long working. I want to this place twice just after work and its changed rest of my day.Very relaxing and provide you the option to relax and enjoy Bangkok
Excellent Onsen!. Great Onsen facility, very clean, price effective! Surely recommended to spend a couple of hours for a relaxing experience.

Rejuvenating experience. It was my first onsen experience and it was a positive one. 450 baht for use of the onsen. I felt really rejuvenated and refreshed after trying out the various onsen tubs - each at various temperatures. There was signage provided at the onsen area to advise guests on which onsen tubs to use first, which proved to be helpful. There was a staff member to guide guests at the locker area. I was initially shy about getting nude in front of everyone else (with just a mini towel) but everyone observed basic onsen etiquette and generally kept to themselves, so I got used to all the nudity in no time. The place was really clean and shower gel, body soap were all provided for the shower. Hairdryers, additional towels, yukata are also provided. I also appreciate the cold water dispenser near the onsen area after spending some time in the hot onsen tub. Service staff at the reception etc were friendly and professional. I didn't try the massage so I cannot comment on that aspect. Location might prove to be a little inconvenient. Not complicated to find but it's a 15-20 min walk along the street from the nearest BTS station. I didn't mind walking. Taking a taxi might be a better option for those who do not want to walk under the scorching sun. Also tried out the cafe. Decent Japanese food at a reasonable price. The place was not crowded when I went on a weekday afternoon.

My number one spa and massage place. I am a frequent guest at Unomori onsen and spa very good reception they all helpful and warm-welcoming
Quality of treatment is above standard 8 out of 10 therapist is very skillful hardly find bad experience
And I also love their decoration Japanese minimal

pretty mindblowing. it's kinda inconvenient, moreover the tuktuk service was down during my visit. taxi would be a better choice. read the reviews and came 2 hours prior to my intended massage time... theres 50% off onsen prices for weekday (with massage service).the onsen is comparable to those in japan... and the massage... was the bonus of it all. onsen etiquette was observed, with staff around to guide... yet respect your privacy. what was mindblowing was the experience from a 39-40c tub into 16c tub.. oh man i was smokin' the massage therapist was professional as well, and i had a good solid 2 hours massage. felt like tofu when i left.

Amazing experience . A must do in Bangkok. Boys go in onsen comando( no boxers) just a small towel. Went with my wife. will surely visit again before we leave bangkok. Friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommended

Nice place but receptionists need better training. Probably one of the best oil massages I've ever had in Bangkok. Can choose your oil scent (rice, jasmine, eucalyp, and one more - I forget). Have had a massage here a couple of times and previous time was just as good. Onsen good as well, though can get busy after work hours (e.g. 7pm to closing). After having read previous comments about this place regarding not being allowed into onsen after oil massage (which makes perfect sense to me), I was taken aback when I was told that use of steam and sauna are also not allowed after oil massage. Now this does not make sense to me - as it's nice for the oil to "melt" off your skin in steam/sauna post-massage. And I wouldn't be as annoyed as long as customers were notified beforehand (which I wasn't - and there are NO SIGNS of this anywhere). Receptionists (I'll withhold names) also need to be consistent with their service - providing the same "high" standard to BOTH foreigners and locals. Shouting out "You, You! - and I do not exaggerate when using "shout" - to get a customer's attention is not acceptable wherever you are, whoever you are, and whatever nationality you are, even if the supposed customer is "your friend".

Good for relax !. This is a place that u can onsen and have aroma massage :) i choose package include scub and herbal compression too. Price is resonable . Place are clean . Not too crowded ( i go on weekday , so not sure about weekend) . Or you Can use onsen and stay here all day , there has a cafe too .

Onsen+ Thai massage + herbal compress. Staff are all helpful except for one guy who was in charge of distributing disposable undergarments. Masseur was slightly above average but wouldn't say it was fanstatic given that acupressure points were a mixture of hit and miss.

Great onsen and spa.. Great onsen and spa in Bangkok.Just a little walk from Phrom Phong BTS. About 1 km or so.Similar to traditional Japanese onsen (fully naked). But you can still cover yourselves with the given towels. Staff at counter will guide you if you are first-time visitor. Even suggest the best deal based on the combination of onsen use and Massage type/duration.Onsen has a big board of instructions in Thai and English. If in doubt, can ask the staff for the sequence for the different baths, steam room, sauna.Thai massage was upstairs and excellent.Didn't visit the cafe or restaurant because I was heading for a dinner appointment. Heard that the restaurant is nice.

It's great to have onsen and Thai massage in one place.. For men onsen, there are 4 pools with different styles and temperatures. There's also one Sauna room and one Steam room. I like to have a Thai massage first and then 30-45 mins in the pools. This place also offer foot massage, oil massage and Thai herbal massage but keep in mind that if you choose to have one of these 3 massages, you have to do the onsen first since you wouldn't allowed to come back to the onsen afterward. They said the oil or herbs left on your body will destroy the water in the polls.
Excellent service . I was there alone and they staffs showed a lot attention on me, especially Mr. M who works in lobby. I had a good time there. Thanks

Could spend the whole day here. Heard from somewhere that it was cheaper to buy tickets and fly to Bangkok just for this onsen than to go to the one in Singapore. So I decided to try and it was true.Not only was it cheaper, it was far bigger too. With both indoor and outdoor bathing areas, the Singapore outlet totally loses out.Reception was warm and spoke perfect English. Told them it was my first time here and she guided me all the way to the entrance of the changing area and slowly explaining how stuff works here. Onsen area will make you go wow when entering.Took a Thai massage, felt more like a yoga workout as my masseuse contorted our bodies. Made me hungry so had a gyudon and ice coffee at the cafe.Really like this place but location is abit off for tourists. Also no shuttle to BTS.

Great facilities BUT bad service by staffs in charge of Ladies onsen and yukata and undergarment counter staffs. Greated with smile by cashier counter and all the way till get slipper and lockers. But the counter staff in charge Yukata and undergarment unwilling to give us the yukata, just the undergarment. We got it after insist on it as part the package we paid.For ladies onsen, there are 6 different types of pool, nice and comfortable. A sauna room located beside and an outdoor onsen too. Plenty of lockers and sit in shower cubicles, but 3 to 4 dressing tables only.

Spa & Massage. This place seems inaccessible at first, but truly isn't that difficult to find. Take BTS to Phrom Phong, walk along Sukhumvit 24 till the end of the road (about 15-20 mins walking distance). You will walk pass Marriott Executive apartments. Turn left just before Esso petrol station, and walk right in. In about 150 metres, the spa is on your right hand side, facing an open space carpark. The spa is superbly furnished in authentic Japanese style. The reception area is spacious and inviting. The counter staff were very friendly, and able to explain the packages well in English.We selected the package on Onsen + Aromatherapy + Hot Compress. There are different treatment packages to suit your preference.Separate onsen for the 2 genders, you go on your birthday suit at the Onsen pool area. There is an Onsen Guide that guides you on the correct sequence on pool dipping. There are hot and cold water pools, with a steam room and a dry sauna. After about 45 mins, the attendant will write your locker number on a white board, to inform you ready for massage. You will change to a yukata (Japanese costume) and proceed for your massage. You get to choose which aroma oil you like, and fill in a simple form to indicate which area/s you would like the masseur to pay attention to for your massage. You may choose the massage strength you desire, ranging from soft, medium to firm. I had 1.5 hour body massage, and 30 mins hot compress. The masseur was attentive to details, and very professional. He often asks if I am okay, especially when he was working at those areas where I indicated concern. The hot compress was fantastic, it warmed every inch of my body, which I felt is was revitalising. Not many places offer this spa service, which personally I would highly recommend. After the whole session, we check out at the reception and were given a feedback form to complete. Overall, I am extremely pleased with my visit and I do strongly recommend visiting if you are looking for decent, quality and professional spa service.I paid B1,725 for my package, which I deem reasonable for the service and satisfaction level I received.

Fabulous place. Visited for a morning with our 2 year old son and we loved it. The place has a very authentic Japanese feel and is very relaxing. A beautiful setting. Take a book, enjoy the great coffee and food then have another dip in the baths. The baths themselves are immaculate and there are about 6 different baths. Only negatives were that people were smoking and the service was very slow for coffee and food.

Best massage I had so far. we travel to Bangkok twice a year and been to so many massage parlours including those chain, this is one of the best massage we had so far. We made a reservation for 2 at 9am in the morning, book a taxi but we got really lost taround the area. Despite that, the experience at this place is really good. We are greet by staff who can speak English well, next we had a piece of paper to find out which area of the body that we wish to focus on or to avoid. After that, we were brought to a couple with in room shower, the room is very clean and simple. The only thing is they do not play soothing music, maybe its a Japanese culture, I am not too sure. At the end of the session, we were given a feedback form on the service. Throughout the whole session, the masseurs did not talk among themselves or to the customers unnecessarily, they did not ask for tip like most places. The whole experience is great and professional. we will love to go back again on our next trip.
