Wish yourself good luck. I came with my wife because we wanted to try Onsen in Bangkok. I felt that there was not enough explanation about how things work at the bath room. There were also a lot of staff including cashiers, masseuses, and others. Some seemed professional, but it seemed it was random. Some were really casual or rude. After the Onsen, we had Thai massage. I had one of the best massage from a man, but my wife had a terrible experience. Her masseuse was not well- trained at all. So wish yourself good luck when visit Yunomori!

Great massage. location wise was not easy to find, taxi driver lost has way and drop up off somewhere. Went for the traditional Thai massage. Masseur was very skilful and the place is clean. They will ask you fill up a form which indicate your preference of the type of strength u prefer and which body parts you want to focus on. They placed towels on the pillow and will change the towel after use, cleanliness better than other Thai massage shops. Price wise is slightly more ex, but worth the price. After the massage, u will fill up a feedback form. Only complaint is that I cannot get through to the hotline to book appointment and can hear noises from other customers as we are only separated by curtains.
Wonderful Onsen experience!. The experience at Yunomori Onsen & Spa was excellent! The place was well designed and the environment provided a feel as if you are in Japan. The baths were good!

Relaxing cultural experience; loved it so much we went twice!. Traveling with my cousin, we were only in Bangkok for two nights but we went here on BOTH nights because we loved it so much. I have never been to Japan and appreciated the chance to "dip" into the culture a bit. This onsen has long hours so you can go late in the evening. It's immaculately clean, luxurious, friendly, with beautiful lighting and courtyard. It was really lovely at night. We had a massage on our second night, which was great. At the spa room for women, they provide robes, sandals, and little disposable underwear. There are five different pools of water at different temperatures, with cavernous wooden ceilings. There are even two spring-fed teak tubs in a courtyard. It was an amazing meditative experience and months later I can still recall the incredible sense of calm in all senses I felt while in the spa, and the renewal of the nice shower afterwards as I returned to the Bangkok night. I wouldn't miss this place!!

Awesome Mixed of Thai and Japanese Style of Spa & Massage. One of the best Japanese onsen and massage experience in Bangkok, Thailand. I have a great and wonderful Thai- Japanese concept of onsen experience in here. Another best highlight is their massage, all the masseur is well trained and skilful. Definitely will revisit again when I'm in Bangkok.

Great place to relax. During my 5 days stay in Bangkok, i visited Yunomori Onsen 3 times. Their services are simply excellent, from the receptionists, to the ground staff who look after the Onsen, to the masseurs, they treated me as if I am some special VIPs. All staff are well-trained to serve, even the junior masseurs possess good skills.Well done Yunomori, I'll definitely visit Yunomori again when I visit Bangkok.

Excellent experience . Atmosphere and service is superb, combining both Thai and Japanese style of customer service. Pretty far from Phrom Phong BTS but I believe that there is a shuttle service somewhere. Please don't bother calling them as I believe that they are focusing more on on-site services than phone calls or facebook. Overall experience:Customer Service: Very GoodAtmosphere: Very Good and Hygienic

A very special experience. For us, one of the reasons for travelling is to experience new things - this is the reason we decided to try the onsen, and way we highly recommend you try it to. The Yunomori Onsen is a really unique place, and though it is not cheap, you get a five star experience. Bathing in the hot pools was very special - it resembles a spa, but is different and has a more ceremonial feeling to it. It's also interesting to do as a couple, as you don't really get to do a lot of things separately in trips abroad, and the separate bathing gives you some time with yourself and a very interesting conversation with your spouse afterwards. After bathing in the onsen we had a couple's massage, and it was excellent. If you do go, here are two important recommendations: First, read online a bit about the onsen (as we said, it's pretty ceremonial, and there are a few things that are good to know before going). One thing you should know is that the onsen is enjoyed in the nude (men bath in the nude, women are offered a set of thin disposable underwear). Second, give yourself a bit more time - we got there an hour before our massage, and with all the process of paying, undressing and washing we only had about half an hour in the onsen before our treatment, when we could have easily enjoyed at least a full hour.

A little piece of Japan in Bangkok. A well designed Japanese styled onsen in Bangkok along Sukhumvit road, and a welcomed retreat from the hustle and bustle which is the insanity that is Bangkok traffic. Massages here are also very good.

Ban the smoking and this would be perfect. I arrived about 11am, and there was a deal for 50% off onsen entry if a massage was a booked. I booked a 2 hour Thai massage. My masseur was good, but the onsen itself was awesome. This is a traditional segregated onsen, and the facilities are many and varied.The onsen's restaurant was small but very, very busy. I only had an iced coffee, but it was well-presented and worth the price. Another commentator has mentioned the smoking which needs to be banned completely, but thankfully it only occurred in the outside dining area when I was there.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this onsen for a visit, and am only sorry that I discovered it on my last day in Bangkok, as I would return in a heartbeat.

Very clean and the staff were very welcoming. The spa was actually bigger than expected and the area was very clean and organised. However my mum's massage therapist was not very well trained as she didn't really know what she was doing in terms of an aroma therapy massage. The area around the spa is quiet and secluded from the noisy street down the road which was good. I suggest taking a taxi (45 Baht) from Phrom Phong BTS station and it will be a long walk. A lot of eating places near it though( Mainly Japanese and Korean food)

Shame about the smoking . . .. Once you get to grips with Onsen etiquette (look for the cartoon instructions though they are also in English and Thai) this is a grand place to relax before the full-scale assault on your senses Bangkok style recommences! Good selection of aromatherapy and Thai massages plus some discounts for arriving outwith peak periods. Astonishingly, in a place that promotes health and well-being, however, they allow smoking in at least one of their cafes, so points off for that. There is, apparently, a Yunomori tuk-tuk that runs from the Onsen back to the nearest BTS station but, a timetable, if such exists, seems to be a state secret.

A wonderful piece of Japan in Bangkok . This onsen made us feel like being in Japan for a day. They have a great variety of different baths, steam and dry sauna. Inbetween going into the baths you can get into a yukata and relax in the lie down area and enjoy a cold beer as well as typical Japanese food like cold noodles, curry rice and more. They also offer massage, but when we went it was so full that they had no more slots for the rest of the day. This place was very popular with both the locals and the Japanese living in Bangkok. We left very relaxed!

In deep neep of renovation. Although, at first sight, this looks like a nice place but Yunomori is really in need of a deep renovation. Within the onsen you’ll notice paint coming of the walls, broken toilets, wooden benches that are in need of some paint/lacquer, certain items kept together with tape, broken showerheads, etc.Although the massages are nice, the therapy rooms do offer similar problems as the onsen. Again, broken showerheads, walls in need of painting, towels full of threads as well we found the room very noisy with a clear hearing of the people passing by on the corridors.All in all, this good be a nice and attractive option for a Bangkok Spa but unfortunately let down by a very poor state of maintenance. Not recommendable therefore.

Relaxing Bath, Very Clean, Good Massage. The entire experience was great, from start to end. There are four different temperatures of baths, a steam room, and a sauna. There's a great outdoor space to relax and get some fresh air. And the food, which is outside the bathing area, is pretty good, although the options are limited.The massage itself was decent, and everything is reasonably priced. I've been several times, and I will continue to go.

Japan in Bangkok - fantastic . Yunomori Onsen is a terrific experience for those wishing to have a little bit of Japan in Thailand. Having vacationed in Japan and enjoyed wonderful onsens there, I can say that this Bangkok onsen experience was definitely on par with a very good Japanese onsen. The facility is extremely well-run, staff very courteous and efficient, exceptionally clean, and the spa area beautifully designed. The Thai body scrub and massage was also superior to many I've had in Bangkok. Highly recommended.

Onsen that definitely wont let you down. I did a lot of travel in bkk and Im not really like the massage there despite I've already tried a lot of massage places and Im not really got satisfied with the service. But this place was so recommended by many of my local friends there, so I was curious how good is that despite all my no-so-good experience before. And ya the whole experience was so amazing !! Best onsen ever outside japan IMO !! Huge place, comfy environment, superb service and spacy yet clean room including shower inside.

Good value, great massage. We booked this place for an afternoon massage and it was the best 1 and a half hour of massage during my stay. We had 1 hour of thai message. It was so good value for money!With Onsen before the massage section.... perfect!!!!
i like to go there. always go there for rest time love hot water enjoy japannese food near by onsen they have nice massage also

Nice onsen in BKK. On a weekday, a relaxing hour at the onsen : 5 baths and a sauna and a garden to relax. Nice and helpful staff (this was my first onsen).Men remove their clothes wash sitting down and enjoy cold to hot baths. My girlfriend told me women could wear special underwear.You are explained how to use the facilities. A bracelet opens your numbered closet.There is also a bigger garden at the entrance with a café and a jap. Restaurant.450thb/pers for the onsen. Pay extra for massages. I'll return if I come back to bkk.

Relaxing onsen must visit in Bangkok. A relaxing sanctuary in the city.Yunomori onsen is similar to the Japanese onsen and they have directions to all the different kinds of baths. If you are not sure you can always follow their easy to read directions that are well illustrated.Try the massage and book early if you like the aromatherapy massage as slots can fill up fast.A great onsen in Bangkok.A must visit place.

Massage...meh. Hot bath...great . We wanted to have a hot bath and we decided to go there due to a good rating. We also requested a Thai massage and it was...eh. It was painful even though I requested medium. A bruise on my leg appeared after the massage. However, the hot bath was good but kinda small. It had several different temperatures in baths such as hot, cold, lukewarm and warm. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would go there again for a nice, relaxing bath. Avoid massages. Go to green bamboo massage in Chiang Mai if you can!

Great bath but not massage... I checked a list the type of massages to be firm and It was not firm enough. It was done by a thai woman, maybe my body was too strong for her to give me a firm massage? It's kinda disappointing for me. Beside massage, men toilets were under construction and men had to use toilet in the main lobby. They had different types of baths such as warm, cold and hot. They included a Japanese style of bath, which had round wood tubs. The foods were not bad but reasonable price. It had good desserts. I would like to come back for bath but not massage..

Nice Facility Poor Massage. My son and his friend took my wife and I to Onsen. Thoroughly enjoyed the baths although they will soon need a face lift. After the baths we had massages and i had the worst massage I have ever had in Thailand. My wife was disappointed with her massage and my son and his friend were less disappointed than we were. I left before my massage was completed and won't go back. My son has had good massages at Onsen in the past and will go again.

Book in advance to avoid disappointment. Why I keep coming back to this place:- Perfect for a relaxing moment: no kid running around, awesome facilities with soft relaxing background music- Canteen: even have cold milk imported from Japan - I was blown up- Staffs: always smile genuinely- Massage: was above average, and 'clean' - no one ask you THAT funny question (you want MORE, sir?) so you can enjoy your massage with peaceful mindIf you visit during peak periods like me (Songkran, New Year), dont save your phone bill to call from your home country to book first, else you will be disappointed (it could be fully booked for 3 days in a row)

never expect this and will surely visit again on my next trip!. hangover because of parties in Bangkok? go to this hot bath and come out ready to club again!yup, that's what I and my friends did. It is so relax and refreshing. There is even a small cafe where you can have flavoured milk which is hard to find outside.No time limit, just soak as long as you want!

Detox after a wild NYE. If you've been to a jimjilbang in Korea this is fairly similar, only more expensive. It's clean which is obviously the #1 most important factor. Unlike in Korea, there are no little kids running around splashing each other, shouting, and causing a raucous which is excellent. Contrary to prior posts, there ARE directions for putting on the robe.. There is also a recommended order for the baths posted on the wall. Lastly, the food was great although service was slow. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and will be returning again soon.

First visit.. I recommend this place to everybody whether on tour or not. Its a great place to relax. The staffs are friendly and accomodating.. The facial was great as well. Will definitely come back when i'm off from work.. Thanks!

Relaxing afternoon. I visited this spa for the first time yesterday and it was also my first experience of a Japanese onsen. I found the whole experience very relaxing.The reception staff were extremely welcoming and I was then shown where to store my shoes and directed into the men's onsen. I was given a towel, a small towel and a yakata robe. The entrance fee was 450 baht. The locker rooms are stylish and clean. Having removed all my clothes I moved into the onsen area and first showered and soaped before trying out the various facilities.There is a useful instruction board on the wall for beginners like myself. It appears to be the norm to walk around with just the small towel covering your privates. The yakata robe is for use if you wish to leave the onsen area and go to the lobby, cafe or relaxation areas. Next time I visit I will try their aromatherapy massage and body scrub.

Relax with caring. As grown-up in Korea, naked-in-public bating was nothing new for me but a kind of home-feeling experience. Soaking my exhausted body in cold, warm or even hot pool was quite relaxing and rejuvenating. I made a reservation for massage after bath with some special conditions, which were all straightforwardly fulfilled. Massage itself can be done anywhere in BKK but their managing process and ambient was not comparable.cons: Men's toilet was under construction when I visit so I had to use another one in the lobby. It was quite busy during the weekend even though the place was well managed.

Relaxing Option Perfect Before A Long flight Home. We tried this spa after a long day walking around Bangkok and right before we were leaving on our flight back home. It was a little difficulte to find at night - it's tucked inside a large shopping center with a slightly hidden alleyway to enter the parking lot. We thought a relaxing hour steaming our and soaking would help us sleep well on the flight. This is the first time going to a Japanese style bath house so the experience was very eye-opening (we are used to Russian banyas). The staff was very helpful in instructing me through the whole process and it ended up being a really relaxing experience. It looked very clean and the staff were very professional - they even let us store our luggage in the front while we were there. It would be nice if they handed foreigners/first timers a card with instructions on how to properly do everything because I had to keep asking the attendant.

Beautiful place to relax ... A lot of new experiences .... This was my first time at an Onsen (last year I went to Japan but they wouldn't let me into any Onsen as I have tattoos). The whole staff was very kind and helpful, as there are so many new procedures to follow: Where to go (of course there is a seperate area for men and women), how to wear the Yukata (kind of kimono), which of the baths (mineral water, soda, cold, jet, garden) to take first and in what order to use the steam bath and sauna. Of course it all starts with cleaning your body. But there are no showers! Instead you sit down on a small chair and shower sitting down. And its not a private cabin, its all open. Anyway everybody is kind of naked. Inside the bathhouse you are only allowed "to wear" a very tiny towel, that you can hold infront of your private parts. After the bath (about 1.5 hours) I took an oli massage which I had to book in advance. That was Ok, but nothing too special. You can find better massages in Bangkok. But the atmosphere and the design are exceptionell. After all that I enjoyed a very nice snack at the cafe and a sublime homemade ginger lemonade. Try to come here early as it might get crowded after 5pm and bring enough time to enjoy.

Place where it used to be better !. Visit here from time to time for few years, always got a good experience. In present, I feel on zen spa was not the same standard ex. They do not have soda shower spa and it is not in good condition. Water is not hot enough( the jacuzzi and stream room! used to have higher temperature). Drinking water is too cold(before they have hot water provided). Shampoo and soap used to be better quality than these. Services are still great. Massage are also great. Price is acceptable. Lot of parking space with 2 hours free of charge.Recommend..Should have instruction how to wear yukata.The cafe has less menu and some food are empty too quick when we came for lunch.Definitely will come back but expect improvement.

Good Onsen experience in Bangkok. I was not sure about going to an Onsen in Bangkok but I was pleasantly surprised. It was quite an authentic Japanese Onsen experience. Nice way to relax after a busy day in frenetic Bangkok

a high- end japanese spa in Sukhumvit. I stayed 4 days in Bangkok and I wanted to get the chance to try few spas in the Sukhumvit area. Yunomori Onsen is a japanese spa wich offers also massage (usually it is not combined in Bangkok so I told myself it would be worth a try). The Staff was "professionally" friendly and very goog organized. I had a one hour massage and before that I was in the Onsen bath, since guests are not allowed to get in after the massage. Even after showering?! I like to go relax in the water and sauna after the massage but this was not possible but in Japan it actually is..The massage was good but I had better ones. Usually at the end of the massage, they give you a paper to rate your massage experience and this is where you could give your tipps. Unfortunately, I didn't know at all that it is common to tip after the massage. If only I knew before... I think the Onsen experience is a unique one. It was my first time at an Onsen so I cannot tell if this one is considered to be good or not but I can still remember that one bath was extremely hot, where I could barely stay more than 1 minute in it. All in all, nice good experience.

Like being back in Japan!. I lived Tokyo for 4 years as an ex-pat and really loved going to the onsen. This place has done a fantastic job replicating the Japanese onsen experience. There are six different type of baths, with varying water temperature, and includes both indoor/outdoor tubs. It's very clean, and the aesthetics were definitely made with intention. I did the onsen+oil massage+herbal compress combo, ate lunch and an early dinner, and relaxed on the comfy lobby chairs. It was the perfect way to spend my last day in Bangkok since my flight didn't leave til 9 pm, and I was all shopped out. Book ahead (call in the morning) instead of doing a walk-in for the spa treatment. This was a typical onsen that you would find in Japan-- as in, it's assumed you know what to do but there are instructions on a wall if you don't. Enjoy!!

Some parts are good....but some are..... I have to come caused of my friend and I have to relax on the free day...on arrival with very warm welcome with the very great promise was given such as the TUK TUK service....sure, yes ....but when the time....no no tuk tuk at all...just only one moment the tuk tuk will come...The drinks those are serving without any standard at all.

a perfect Japanese experience - a real onsen. Just the perfect place to distress and relax within the frantic energy of Bangkok. Well worth the walk from BTS. It is very clean, well maintained and friendly and the 'farangs' seem not to have discovered it - yet.Highly recommended - leave your inhibitions outside to enjoy what is probably a unique experience in Bangkok

Great place great massage BUT. We love this place, great design super clean and amazing massage. We have been here twice and though everything was absolutely axing twice we found the reception not super friendly. But the rest of the experience made up the not so friendly front desk staff. I would recommend taking a cab or urber as its not that easy to find. We both had a 90 min private room massage and was amazing and in my view very cheap 1200 bht we had a light snack after that. It Def a nice way to spend few hours they open everyday from 6am to midnight reservation totally needed

Relaxing and great experience. I found this place thru TripAdvisor while searching for places to go for massage. And not many places have Onsen + massage in Thailand. So I decided to give it a try. The price is acceptable. The environment is very well decorated and maintain. You will feel that you are in another world. As this is my first time, im a bit lost and the staff doesn't tell you what you need to do. They just show you where you are supposed to go. So after payment, you will get a electronic tag. They will lead you to change your shoe to the straw material shoe, and after that you will go to a counter after the shop where you can buy food, to get your yukata and towels. Change yourself into the black bra and panty before going in to shower. Read the instructions before going in the pool. I would say the massage is so-so, but for Onsen, I would return for sure.

good experience only to be ruin by 1 rude and ignorant staff. the massage staff and receptions were courteous. i had a good experience not until i went for the Onsen. the guy staff at Onsen was rude and immature to say the least. This is my first time here and i wanted to know how to use the locker and wear the yukata. there was no staff around exception for this chap, so i have no choice but to ask him, instead he give me a stare trying not to answer my question if he can. He give a impatient sigh and speak a few words. he looks like he is not interested to work there and is only there for the money. Manager of Yunomori, i hope u can read this, i have already written a complaint feedback and pass it to your staff. I don't know if the staff will pass it to you. But please don't hire young and immature staff to work in this place if you want good business. That guy is the tall and young staff at Onsen.  Really regreted going to your place as there are hundreds of other better massage place to go in this country. Like other customers we brave the walk from BTS to this place only to face your rude staff. Other customers do have bad experience also so i guess this company really don't care. I would appreciate if the manager can reply me.

Superb relaxing two thumbs up highly recommended for family to relax and pamper yourself . Yunomori is a Japanese spa, which is very nice comfy relaxing superb excellent and recomended to all, spa ambience is so relaxing they offer massage with onsen with a reasonable price, after or while waiting u may have snack and after msg theres available Japanese resto on the side spanwas near our hotel president park hotel which is free tuktuk transpo... We been here twice with my family including my 2 kidos 7 years and 9 mons old they also enjoy onsen spa while my husband relaxing pamper hisself definitely recommended and must try....

Nice onsen missing some touches. Its one of those things, when you are in a foreign place and there is an onsen, go for it. Yunomori is a modern sento styled japanese bath house. You get there through the main roads or convoluted streets. you arrive, pay for your package and go. you get the usual electronic tags and stuff. You head to get to your yukata, go into the change room and go get cleaned for a soak. Only one pool is natural hot spring water transported from another part of thailand. the south i remember. the rest are just the usual heated tap water. it was nice except the hot spring water was heated just too hot. there are the usual sauna there as well. everything was hot. maybe a good time to go is dec to feb when bangkok is cooler. after a soak, you head back to change, go through the modern interiors for a relaxation sit or to the cafe. One good thing, the milk there is nice. try the melon or original. they are hokkaido milk from umm.. thailand?the food is ok. its sad the restaurant does not open during lunch. you are then ushered for your massages if you have booked for it. it is a communal area for foot rubs and thai massage. they do have some form of privacy curtain. for more up market rubs, there are pte rooms.here in after lies the problem. everything is nice until now. after a good rub down, you want to go back to the hot spring and no, you can't if you had an oil rub. But we will wash, nope you can't. that is strange. so all that is left to do is sit in the cafe, wait at the relaxation room and the lobby. After all this is bangkok. same same but different from japan.You get a ride on their tuk tuk to sukhumvit station. but on the next day, you try it, the counter says, sorry the tuk tuk guy was not working that day. but its in the brochure, you protest, ah same same but different.And why can't you get a lift there from sukhumvit station, its, bangkok.For a tip, set your expectations right, its a nice place. the service level is still not that of japan but its decent for a break in tokyo.would i go back? yea, after all i am still a hot spring lover and its the only one there. wished they had high or taller seats in the bath area though.

Great massage place but got very popular of late - booking essential. Further from my last review, Yunomori got a whole lot busier, so much so that one day, I missed out on spa/massage purely because I didn't book in advance. There were no rooms and/or masseuses left. I left disappointed to say the least. So, one word of caution, since this place is gaining popularity, it is essential to phone in advance to make a booking. Walk-in's not guaranteed.

Authentic onsen with a nice Thai touch. Super clean and tidy. Super value esp during weekdays. We did the Thai massage with onsen and liked it very much. They also provide free drop at bts station nearby. Very thoughtful of them. Must try if you are in Bangkok.

Complete Relaxation . It was fabulous.the location is a bit difficult for tourists but its worthy to visit.Complete one stop service style spa with massage.Hygienically keep well maintenance and great customer service.I recommend to buy massage services together with bathing.
Great experience. Staffs were very customer oriented. The place is very posh & well maintained. Definitely a place I would patronise again in future!

Excellent place for relax & massage. Good Place for spa & massage experience. We come in 30mins later than our appointment time due to heavy rain & bad traffic on road, but the receptionist still reserve our time slot for us. Me & my sister having a great time & relaxing experience here.

Great place to relax. Great place to spend a few hours or even the whole day. While the locker room can be a bit hectic the remainder of the place is pretty chill. Get hungry or thirsty put on your robe and go either of two restaurants on the premises.

Great way to spend the afternoon . Popped in on a Thursday afternoon without reservations and managed to get a room and masseuse thankfully. Spent about an hour and a half at the onsen - there are 6 pools. There weren't many people so it was really comfortable. However the steam room did not look very clean - that didn't stop me. Thereafter dried up and went for a body scrub and 2h massage, no complaints at all. Came with my mom and she enjoyed herself too! Prices are clearly stated on the website. We will return!

Calm and peaceful. This place is really beautiful... It is also calm and peaceful. I like the idea of Japanese onsen and it allows people just to relax!!! There r also other service such as a TV theatre area, massage and also a Japanese restaurant!!

Must go for relaxation. Really comfortable, relaxing and professional spa. The staff is really helpful and experienced. Would definitely go there again if I was in the mood for a spa.Recommend squeezing in a few hours if you're intending to go for their packages.

One of the best value massage places to date in Bangkok. A really clean, excellent value spa in Bangkok. I have tried a few massage places and this one is one of the best valued one to date that I can find. A traditional Thai massage for 2 hours cost only about 700 Baht, together with 100 Baht tip to the masseuse, its only 800 Baht. This is cheaper than the chain massage parlours like Lets Relax, which has declined in my books in both value for money and attention to customers.Yunomori's masseuses are all great. Two I've tried and their names are Auy and Lomy are particularly good.If you've got time to try their Onsen/Spa package, you won't be disappointed.

The Best Thai Massage in Town. Yunomori is unique, there's no place like it in Bangkok. You can enjoy the Onsen (Japanese style hot tub) facilities and their massage and spa treatment is excellent. Price is very reasonable, skip the shop house spas and Health Land!! You'll be better off at Yunomori!!
This is the place. Great place great services. The best spa in Thailand. The combination of Japanese and Thai culture. The massage is perfect.

Very good Japanese onsen. This onsen was handy to my hotel (The Davis) although a bit hard to find and unknown to my hotel. But they googled it, and a staff member walked me around to it. Lots of pools, sauna, steam room as described by others. I didn't have a massage but used the supplied kimono to wear while having nice food at their little cafe, then relaxing on a big soft chair. Also available are beds. You are also given a big towel, plus a very little one which is all you are allowed to take into the pools. There are good lockers. Between getting very hot with lots of naked males there are only four plastic chairs to sit on which often was not enough for all those there. Very relaxing to spend quite a long time there, but leave your inhibitions at the door. Plenty of cold water available to drink.

Everytime a great experience. (+) great atmosphere
(+) relaxing spa
(+) good therapists
(+) extremely friendly and helpful staff
(+) good restaurant / cafe
I can't say anything bad about this place. Been here many times and will definitely come back again. It is a must do for me when I am in Bangkok.

Authentic onsen! . One of the best experiences of my life! The onsen is amazing: 6 differenti pools, sauna and humid room which makes u relax ad nothing else. Then, the massage: you give them al the indications for the perfect massage and they strictly execute what u ask.. U couldn't want anything more perfect!!

Good Soul!. We went here for a massage which was very good. As I was putting on my shoes and getting some change downstairs, my masseur brings me my ring! I had yet to realise that I had left it by the sink when I washed my hands a few minutes ago before leaving the massage room! His honesty is commendable! This is my first time here.

Highlight of my Bangkok trip. I visited yunomori onsen on 17th August Monday and it was my 3rd visit. The service of the receptionist and service crews was excellent and never fail to make my day.Our appointment was at 3pm but we reached at 245pm due the the heavy traffic. I requested to push back my massage appointment by 15 minutes and the receptionist was thoughtful to understand my request immediately and arranged for us so that we can enjoy the onsen longer.I can see that they have upgraded the locker to keyless system, I hope to see more good changes coming. The only negative part is that they require us to shift our belongings to the massage room when we leave the onsen for massage. We do not need to shift our belongings during our last 2 visits. I understand that the management wants to prevent people who went for aromatherapy to go back to the onsen (oil will damage the onsen mineral), but it would good if they allow us to go back to shower because we have activities after the massage.Other than that, everything was good. The therapist did a great job understanding my needs and possesses gd skills.Despite being located at a very inaccessible place, it never stop me from patronizing this place. I will definitely go back to yunomori onsen when I visit Bangkok.

good masseur, rigid receptionist. I have stayed in Bangkok for 2 weeks for training course. I have tried this shop twice. The receptionist were little bit rigid and not fluent in English, they can speak Japanese very well, maybe this is Japanese spa. The best way to choose spa item: read the details in web site or read the catalog which place on the reception and read by yourself, don't ask the receptionist.Need to aware that this shop may not easy to add or change some massage/onsen items due to the bad traffic jam and heavy rain in Bangkok. It's quite full, even we have requested 7 separate rooms for massage during the reservation. But when we go there again, she explains that they haven't enough rooms to entertain. When I paid 100 Baht to get a private room. I saw many private rooms were available. I think it maybe insufficient masseurs to provide massage service. The onsen and massage service were very good. I have tried twice in this spa. One was 2 hours aromatic oil massage without Onsen and add 45 mins body scrub item; Another was that I cannot add 45 mins body scrub and change 2 hours Thai massage to 2 hours Aroma massage with onsen. And I cannot have separate room even we have requested on the reservation. But I can get private room if I pay 100 baht. Finally, i have to pay 100 Baht to get private room. Not expensive. But I still cannot add 45 mins body scrub if I don't change the massage from 2 hours to 1 hour.

Authentic Jap spa in the heart of BKK . Spa sits in a nice flat mall call A-Square. Having been to onsens in Japan and Korea, Yunomori is as authentic as the ones there and even better due to the variety of onsens offered. There are six pools, one bath and one steam room. Instructions are clear, you can take your time to read them on the walls and not feel intimidated even though it may be your first time.Black disposable underwear are available for free, so it is up to the individual's discretion if you prefer to wear them or go in naked. The Yukatas (robes) are thick and comfortable. I saw guests wearing them and hanging around the cafe and the restaurant. There are lockers for each guest to keep your belongings and slippers provided as well.We had the Thai body massages before going for the onsen. Do note that you won't be allowed to enter the onsen after an aromatherapy massage session due to the residue oil on your body, so plan your schedule properly or ring the spa and ask for their advice.Jap restaurant offers good food and It was full on a Tuesday night. We had to wait a while for a table for four. Thereafter, we proceeded for a round of foot massage which was equally good. Masseuses are polite, helpful and offer good service so if you like their service, do bring some cash along to tip them.Would suggest setting aside about four hours to enjoy the facilities. You don't feel like you are in the city anymore. Good way to recharge from the shopping and market visits. I will definitely make it a point to visit again the next time I am in Bangkok!
Skillful Massage Services. Big bathroom is just like that in JP onsen. Good service. onsen pools are too hot in midst of hot weather in BKK.

Japanese Onsen in the heart of Bkk?. Hd no chance to visit onsen when in Tokyo last year. However Yunomori Onsen compensated wht i hv missed.Checked with htl receptionist for direction at the given addr. As per advised I took a motorbike taxi after I alighted at Phrom Pong stn n they send me right up to the bldg entrance in A Square. It costs me only 20bht. Free rtn shuttle svc by tuktuk bck to train stn.I was lucky to get an immediate appmnt as i did not make any prior bkgs. My pkg was 60min thai mssg + the use of onsen. After choosing the type of mssg i needed (I chose hard mssg), the therapist guided me to change n put my things in a locker thn brought me to a big rooms with mssg beds divided only by curtains.As requested, the mssg was truely hard beyond wht i expected. Being egoistic i just kept quiet n took the mssg as per se, ha ha. Overall i shd say it was one of the best thai mssg i've hd.Next the onsen - it's clean with diff types of pools n varied temperatures. Thrs an instructions on the wall telling u hw to use the various pools. Thrs also a sauna n steam room. Outside thrs another pool, deck chairs n a few tubs whr u can also soak ur body to relax.One negative points is tht the shower area is a bit slippery due to left overs of soap suds n shampoo used by bathers. I almost slip while walking thr. It shd be cleansed more often.Tht aside, its worth visiting. I'll definitely come bck again during my nxt visit to bkk.

Complication of the arrangement..... I have been visiting Yunomori Onsen quite often....but last week, I have seen the system changed, after finished onsen and then having the oil massage...I have to take all of my belongings to the massage room....oh my god...how terrible of the arrangement.....

Skillful Aromatherapy Massage. We had the 2 hr Aromatherapy Massage for 3 days. I had 3 different therapists on the 3 days and they were all very well trained and skillful. Well worth the money for good serious massage. It's a bit far from the BTS so would suggest taking a cab there. You can get direction from their website in thai for the taxi driver. The Japanese restaurant at Yunomori has nice bento sets which are very reasonably priced. The drinks and snacks corner serves wonderful mango, passion fruit & pineapple mixed smoothie!

A new experience; worth the trip. I've been to onsen in Tokyo and Korea, BKK is definitely a first!The reception area is pleasant and quiet. Some reviewers mentioned not to be late because they are very strict, that is true. We were late for 15 minutes and had to rescheduled our appointments to 2 hours later. Good thing there were a cozy restaurant and onsen we could dip into to while away the 2 hours. Their onsen is clean but small. Shower area similar to the scenes of those in Korea, except they do not provide toiletries. After our dip in the onsen, we were given traditional robes to wrap ourselves in and headed to gather at their cafe/restaurant. The food was good and a lot of thought has been put into presentation which I totally appreciate. Price range is very affordable at SGD5 for a plate of yummy curry chicken rice. Massage room is not very fantastic because it was quite bare. But thankfully our masseuse were good with their hands, thus overall a satisfying experience. Expect to spend about 2-3 hours there if you are going to experience the onsen and sit down for some food and beverage.

Great ambience and massage. As the other reviewers have mentioned, do make a booking online and they will acknowledge your booking with an email. They follow timings strictly; my friend and I were half an hour early and were told to wait. Good thing there was free wifi in the lobby.I reckon the best way to get there is to make use of their free tuktuk shuttle service. My friend and I couldn't get a cab, so we ended up walking for 20min from Phrom Pong BTS to Yunomori Spa in the sweltering Bangkok heat.Staff were friendly, although we were annoyed that the first receptionist we encountered refused to help us book a taxi to get back to our hotel, claiming that taxis usually don't come by the area. Our massage would end at 11pm and you expect two female tourists to walk out to the main road from the secluded area??? We approached a male staff (he appeared to be the Japanese boss) after our massage for help and he promptly got a cab for us in less than 5min.The massage itself was nothing short of wonderful. We had booked a 90min aromatherapy massage. The therapists would first ask you to fill in your particulars on a form and you can indicate which parts of the body you want him/her to concentrate on during the massage. We could choose the type of massage oil based on the samples they brought to us, as well as the intensity of pressure (soft/medium/hard).Overall it was a good experience, and I'd love to come back again for the onsen.

Vacations. Very very nice and clean sauna.Perfect in Bkk.Nothing to say, massages are great.A lot of tubs and bath and funny the way to take a shower.Nice bar, relaxing room very good.Salti room amazing.Only one little problem :There so many tubs , baths , hamman. But the pool outside the water is too warm.And also i think if there is a bath with temperature water or refreshing water outside.Too hot in Bkk for not to have a coll bath where coll down your body.Shame.The rest is fantastic.

Escape from the Chaos of Bangkok. I went to Yunomori twice during my stay in Bangkok. It is a little hard to find since it's located in a shopping plaza. I recommend that you print out or show a map to taxi drivers. For 450 baht, you have all day access to the onsen. When you check in, you swap your shoes for sandals and make your way to the changing rooms. You are given towels, a yukata, obi belt and mesh swimwear for modesty. Near the lockers are mirrors, hairdryers, combs/brushes and body lotion. Shampoo, conditioner, and soap are provided in the bathing area. I enjoyed the mineral and soda plunge pools, steam room, and mineral shower. I used the cold plunge pool frequently to prevent overheating. The onsen provides a water cooler to help stay hydrated. This is very important because I got very dizzy from dehydration during my first visit. I didn't get any massages, but remember that they require appointments for them. The facilities are clean and tastefully decorated. Staff are aplenty.There's nothing quite like Yunomori Onsen outside of Japan. Whether you live in Bangkok or just visiting, it's totally worth checking out. You won't be disappointed.

Nice place for a massage. Although the location is a bit had to find, it does pay off when you find the location. The staff working over the can speak english, the massage is very profession and better then those offer on the street. The onsen was quite ok. The price however is a bit expensive however the service they provide can justify the price that you pay.

Unique Onsen like spa in Bangkok city. Nice Onsen like spa in middle of Bangkok city. make sure that you book your massage 1 day in advance as on the day of arrival they only provided male therapist, we decided to book foot massage by female instead but first we used the Onsen for a good 2hr. You can see already that some maintenance needs to eb done on the wet area; ceiling broken but overall i would see the place is in a good condition and worth the price. There are enough baths although after 430pm it's start to become busy. Lockers available, enough places to sit and relax, to have a beer and snack. The foot massage was good and the rooms are clean. I can recommend this Onsen and will visit again.

A delightful and peaceful atmosphere.. A really good experience overall. Massages aren't great i had better Dr. Bear is still the best so far. A real sensation of public place where nudity is vividly present. If you are shy a towel is there for you service to hide your private. A nice system. I liked it. Not fully impressed yet but worth the try!

A Slice of Japan in Bangkok. A nice cooling environment to escape the heat in Bangkok. Please do book the appointment earlier. I walked in on a Monday afternoon, expecting not to wait for too long for a massage. Alas, I was told to wait for 1hr 45 mins for the next appointment. Used the Onsen, fell asleep in the garden and had a drink at cafe to kill time. The map given on the official site can be quite misleading. It is a long walk from the main road.Alight at Phrom Pong BTS. Look for the Naraya store at the corner of the street. Walk right in. All the way. You should walk past 24th Avenue. On your left hand side, you will see a big sign that says A Square. The sign also has names of the anchor tenants at A Square. Yunomori Spa is one of them. Yunomori Spa is on your right hand side. You may miss it, like me, if you do not look too carefully. The main entrance does not face the road you walk in.After the massage, ask for a free tuk tuk service back to Phrom Pong BTS. You may have to wait as the tuk tuk will try to take as many customers as possible to save cost of operation.

Excellent Massage . Yunomori located within Soi 26 Sukhumvit, is a good 15 mins walk if you enter from Soi 26. Inside A Square compound, Yunomori is right at the end of A Square.Good to call and make a booking before going over, so you will not make a wasted trip; their receptionist speaks fairly good English as well.The reception area is open and welcoming to start off our journey to relaxation.They have many types of treatments and are reasonably priced. I opted for one hour of foot massage and one and a half hour of aroma therapy, costing THB1290 which was fairly reasonable for my experience here.My massage experience was truly wonderful. The aroma therapy started with my bath then they commenced with my back, legs, chest, abdominals, arms and lastly head. At the abdominal it was quite interesting, there were like 5 very strong compressions from my chest to the belly button, that was something I haven't experienced before. And the foot massage was quite normal, nonetheless it was good as well.A wonderful experience!But I wished the receptionist would have told me to take a cab when I said I was walking over. Hahaha!!!

An Oasis in the Middle of Bangkok. YUNOMORI Onsen in an oasis in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Though I think it would be technically considered a supersento rather than an onsen, since it does not have a natural hot spring that does not diminish what an excellent facility it is.Beautifully maintained and very clean, it replicates a Japanese onsen experience with a variety of baths both indoors and out. The staff were also very polite and helpful and seemed to be multilingual. Guests included people of a large number of nationalities including many Japanese. I live in Tokyo and I was struck to see many people with tattoos since tattoos are banned at many bathing facilities in Japan. I was happy that they could bathe comfortably here,I enjoyed a 90 minute aromatherapy massage and the massage therapist was excellent. Guests fill out a form before the massage outlining any problem areas, and the therapist checked with me several times during the massage to make sure I was comfortable. My foot started to cramp at on point and before I could tell the therapist, he put a cushion under my foot. Very attentive.I look forward to visiting Yunomori Onsen again. It was a thoroughly enjoyable experience.They have a discount for people who check in before 3:00 and book a massage. Check their homepage for details.

Paradise in the city!. It is so lovely I found this place in Bangkok. It is all about beauty, wellness and rest, rest, rest. Nothing can compare with few hours spent in the onsen like this in Bkk. I enjoyed every minute of my visit. They are very much like the ones in Japan. But yes they bring this miniral water from abroad of course.

Happy to find a Onsen In BK. We have discovered a very good real Japanese Onsen in Bangkok , Ynomori is only less than 2 years open , located at the end of Soi 24 Sukhumvit on A Square. It is not just a regular public Spa and massage shop, this is a real typical Japanese kind of bath house, separate area for men & women with different kind of hot and cold tubs, inside & outdoors patio , sauna and steam room, showers, locker room, a relax area with healthy drinks ( & beer ) and snacks , at the second level nice treatment rooms for different kind of massage, it's all listed at reasonable prices and they have promotions also.It's a bit of a walk from Sukhumvit BTS station but when we entered the reception area we have been greeted with a warm welcome from the staff, we paid the entrance fee and booked already for a 1.5h massage afterwards, the professional staff members explain you very clearly how it all works and guide you every where, one can see that a foreign management is behind this business and for sure not run the Thai way. We received slippers; a towel and a kimono changed our clothes for less. Note that the wet area does not allows bikini or swimwear, it's all in your " natural Adam or Eve costume " as it is custom in Japan , so if you are shy don't go there. The massage afterwards was excellent and done by real professional masseuses. The whole place is very big and nicely decorated in wood Japanese style, very clean and run by friendly staff. They provide a return taxi ride by Tuk Tuk till the Sukhumvit road. Only one negative point is that they made a mistake on our consumption bill which was by mistake overcharged but we have seen it only when back in the hotel, I called them and explained the situation, the lady told me she would figure out what happen but never rang me back as promised. Yes the mosquitos love me but that's part of a wet area and the nature.My wife and I used to go to often to Onsen when travelling for business in Japan but must say that we have been very satisfied with this one at another part of Asia, for sure we will visit this Yunomori Onsen again next time when back in Bangkok.

Anniversary day . We celebrated our 6 years anniversary here.The onsen is just lovely with a variety of pools.The massage we booked (aromatherapy) was just wow! Really pleased with it.Tip- try to go before 3pm Monday to Friday which is their happy hour and prices are reduced.

Great escape, Relaxing experience. I've visited Yunomori last Tuesday with a friend, we didn't have much expectation but left convinced. The service was superb, very clean and a lot of staff to take care and guide you. Definitely a must do in Bangkok to relax after a working day or even after some visits for tourists. They also have a treatment/massage menu but I didnt have the chance yet to try it out.

Excellent Customer Service - they take their business seriously. This is the one of the must-go-place that when I visit Bangkok. The service of the place as usual was great. The Onsen and the receptionist service was excellent. However, I had a rather unsatisfactory massage which I went down to the reception to inform them of my feedback. They were very sorry for my displeasure and ensure me that they will look into the matter and would inform their manager about it. So I left the place and I was really sad having to come all the way here and not getting the much anticipated massage that I so long for. However, what happen next really makes me think this is one professional place and they really take care of their customers. In the evening, they actually called me and the GM ( I shall not disclose his name here - he is a japanese) spend a good part of the night finding out what actually happen and tried his very best with his limited english to answer my queries. I was touched with his professionalism and gesture. He then promise me to reply me in an email and update me the steps which the company would take towards the matter. Which my lord he really did in the next few days. He then proceed to explain to me that is not that the masseur is not doing his job rather is that he misunderstand my needs and what i specify. I am happy with his explanation and I will confidently recommend to any who wants to have a professional massage here. I will be going back again in February and would love to meet up with him as he did give me a complimentary massage as I didn't get to complete the 2 hours Thai massage that I have booked. so Verdict is .... Great Place, Great service, Great Management..PS. If I am not mistaken, they will be opening one in Singapore Soon .. look out for it

Great experience. I've been to this place twice now. Once last month and again 2 weeks back. I must say that this place has a very nice ambiance and is very clean. The entrance fee of THB450 is a really good deal and the staff are very friendly too. I've tried the massage there once and it was good. Yes, it's advisable to book in advance if you wish to have a massage there and go earlier to enjoy the onsen as you won't be allowed back after your (oil) massage as the water would get oily even after you have had a good bath.One reviewer mentioned that there is free tuk-tuk to and from Phrom Phong BTS station. As far as I know, they only provide the service one way from the onsen to the BTS station. And yes, it's a long but interesting walk from the BTS station to the onsen itself. Depending on your walking speed, it took me about 20min. A Square is located opposite K Village and it's right at the end after the car parking area.

The best place in town for relaxing from your hard working..... We have been to the place with very high expectation but we have been treated more than we expected. The Place is very the best for relaxing from your hard working. Keep the best as you have been done for us and for all customers those we have seen....

Consistently very good quality massage treatments . An oasis on Sukhumvit 26 at A Square in the heart of Bangkok opposite K Village and easily accessible by the Yunomori free Tuk Tuk to and from Phrom Phong BTS. Reasonably priced and consistently very good quality massage and treatments. Welcoming and helpful staff speaking a variety of languages including English. Thanks to Khun Kai and Khun Nan for their awesome massages. Best to book ahead for massage to avoid disappointment. The venue also includes two dining options with great food and the coldest Asahi.

Definitely, Give This A Try,,, A Great Experience,,,,. As a European, who has never been to a Japanese style Bathing, Hot Water Spa Resort before... Instruction was needed,,, Help was at hand, everyone of the staff were so helpful in showing the routine and etiquette. A Great Experience,,, the interior had different temperature pools, jacuzzi , steam room and sauna. The inner sanctum , sheer nakedness , apart from a small towel or larger towel. Garden , courtyard, Relax area ,robe to be worn. While relaxing having a chill time, you can have a snack or meal, have a soft drink or beer. Massage and treatment available. Would definitely go again..... Tip ,,, phrom phong MRT station, exit same side as Emporium ,,, look for soi 26, walk down Soi 26, long walk , but worth it, til spot BIG C superstore , opposite store , you will see a sign for A Square, at the far corner is the Yunomori Onsen ...

A Different Good. ~Our colleague highly recommended this as an experience and it was exactly that, WARNING if you're shy the Onsen part is not for you!~Once your taxi gets you to A-Square, you kinda gotta walk inside the parking lot to look for it, just spot the HUGE grey wall with the "Yunomori" sign, to the left of it is a door that leads into it~We booked ahead (you can even do it online-sorta), the reception folks speak English perfectly as does the manager handling the phone reservations~During our group check in we're given an instruction guide to the "Onsen Manner" before/during/after, not for the shy of body, guys gotta go nude (kids too)~You get a locker key to wear like a bracelet and drop off your shoes in a manned "shoe" (like cloak) room, this is for them to track if you've paid before collecting them to leave~You exchange your shoes for slippers and go into the Onsen changing rooms (separate for guys/gals), you get a Yukata/Sash & a small/large towel~After taking off everything you can only bring that small towel with you into the Onsen to take a sitting shower first before venturing into 5 zones of HOT/COLD soaking pleasure among men (or women)~Most men will hold the small towel between their crotch while inside the Onsen~Once I was done soaking I showered/wiped dry then put on the Yukata and waited outside in the reception area for the massage portion... you'd be called by number and asked to fill up the forms to indicate where to focus/defocus~Apparently only men massage men (& vice versa)~The Onsen certainly an eye opening experience and one I would rather not repeat (once is enough), the massage was average

My first Onsen experience, I found it fabulous. I've never been to an Onsen before so this was a treat for me, and perhaps there are better experiences, but so far this was great for me. I've been 3 times in total and can't get enough. It's super relaxing, extremely clean and wonderfully decorated. Being able to smoke, drink and eat a bit of a snack outside in between baths or massage sessions is a delight. The only downside is that you get eaten alive by mosquitos when outside. I recommend they put coils around, but still 5 stars.

Nice Thai Massage. it is the first authentic Japanese onsen in Bangkok, the decoration is super nice, it uses wood and natural materials to recreate the nature's sense. The service really impressed me as the staff will give you a body chart that you can choose the desired massage pressure and focus area before the treatment.

Authentic Japanese Onsen in the middle of Bangkok. My wife and I live in Thailand and come to Bangkok once or twice a month to go shopping and dining. My wife heard from a Japanese friend about this place, so we gave it a try. We did not regret that. I lived in Japan for many years, and my wife is Japanese, so we know onsens very well. This place did not disappoint. The service is great. They have staff that speak English and Japanese and the front desk is very organized and quick. I recommend getting the package deal for a bath and a massage. It is a pretty good value. You go soak in the different baths for about 1-2 hours. Then head up to a Massage room for 1 hour. Afterwards, you are floating on Cloud 9. You can even order a draft beer between sessions and you can pay when you check out. Amazing. I have been there twice already and I planning on returning soon.

A piece of Japan in Bangkok. Quite surprise to hear that there's actually an onsen in Bangkok. Place was quite popular with tourists and locals. You have a variety of 6 different onsens to choose from and there's even a Happy Hour promotion. Staff were all very friendly and the place was clean and well maintained. We took the signature package which includes a body scrub, aromatherapy massage & thai herbal compress. We paid about THB2,200 for the treatment. Affordable experience in Bangkok. Will consider coming back again. Only downside is they provide a one way shuttle from the onsen to the BTS station. You'll need to make your own way by cab to the onsen itself as it's quite a long walk from the nearest BTS station.

EXCELLENT!! Do NOT miss it!. As travelers to Japan and connoisseurs of Japanese culture we were thrilled to find an onsen in Thailand ( where we live! ) The concept of having a place like this to unwind and relax is one of the delights of living in Japan and we applaud the owners/ developers in their efforts to establish this in Bangkok. We have been to Yunomori Onsen three times within the past two weeks and intend to make it a regular stop when we are in the city. It is beautifully managed and maintained with friendly and knowledgeable staff. The entry "lobby" is a place I could spend all day. Elegantly but simply decorated with comfortable couches and even rocking chairs. In a word: homey. Massage is available of course, at rates higher than many places in Bangkok. . .but I will not write about massage in this review. I only had one and I dont want to base a review on a single experience. This was an oil massage and I will note it is awkward not to be able to return to the onsen area after an oil massage but I understand that it is difficult to remove all the oil from one's skin in one bathing and it "pollutes" the baths. Onsen need to be super clean of course. You can return to your locker in the onsen area to change. At 450 baht for entrance fee ( 250 for seniors) it is a real bargain! You can spend the day either in the various onsen baths, hot and cold, "Jacuzzi" sauna, teak tubs, steam room etc. Having visited many onsen in Japan, I would not describe it as small but rather as average compared to the ones we frequented in Osaka and Kyoto. Even with 40-50 men in there it never felt crowded. You get a yukata ( robe) to wear out to the little cafe where the food and beverage offerings were varied and the choices we made satisfying. The key number charging system makes it easy to order what you want and then pay as you leave. . There is also a relaxing room where you can take a nap.The only thing we missed was an actual outdoor area like we have seen in Japan where you can see the sky & the stars at night. The "outdoor" area here has a roof over it. . but of course it is in the middle of Bangkok and "outdoor" may just not be possible. All in all an experience not to be missed. . .especially if you have not been to Japan and experienced this incredibly civilized ( the Romans had the same idea) part of Japanese culture.

Average. This is my second time visiting the yunomori, but looks like it is getting more disappointing. The standard procedures were not well operated. During my first visit, i was asked to choose wither a male or female masseur, but this time they allocated one without asking me.I thought we can enter to the onsen more than once. While waiting for my turn for massage - 2 hours, I went into the onsen. However after my massage, i was informed that I was not allowed to use the onsen bath again. But I was allowed to do so last time in July? How ridiculous? There was a restaurant in the area, but selling limited foods and some of them were of order.

For us, a Bangkok tradition!. My husband and I love the Yunomori Onsen and try to visit every time we are in Bangkok. One hour in the Onsen followed by a body scrub and massage is absolute heaven! The facilities are clean and the services are professional. While a little expensive by Bangkok standards, it is still a real bargain when compared to spa prices back home. The whole experience is unique and so relaxing. Highly recommended!!

Nice and clean but a lil bit small. This place is quite and relaxing. The pool is smaller than that in Jpn BUT the people there is not as much also hence is sufficient. for people who mind the naked idea like in Jpn or Kr, here they gave off the disposable bra tube and undy for female. Bad is, met a mother that let the kids run around freely playing "washing towel" in each and every pool.

A little haven within the city. I was curious about the onsen experience, having never been to Japan, so decided to take the plunge and give this a try. It's more of a modern onsen, with different types of baths you can get in and out of. But one thing's the same and that's bathing in the nuddy - gender separated, in case you're wondering. The decor looked good, facilities were pretty clean, and staff were very helpful, showing me how to use the facilities on learning it was my first visit. It's not tiny, but not a large place either. During my visit on a week night, there were maybe 20 guys there without getting too crowded. I do imagine if it gets a bigger crowd, you'll need to be comfortable with the inevitable skin contact.There's a cafe in the building, along with a garden where you can have Asahi beer dressed in the yutaka they provide. A good way to end the experience after a nice, relaxing soak. Didn't have time to try the massage unfortunately. Maybe next time.

paradise in bangkok. We made a reservation to visit this spa after recommendation by a friend that it's paradise on earth! I concur - could not have been a better way to end a short trip to bangkok!Reservations and queries were promptly answered to. We visited on the last day after 2 days of shopping and walking around. After checking in, a staff promptly ushered us to get changed into slippers and into the onsen where I spent a good half hr. Could have been longer but we were a bit pressed for time. It was just so relaxing with the hot spring, cold spring and steam room! You can enjoy walking ard the spa with a yukata!The therapist was professional, attentive and her massage techniques were excellent. Did a 1 hr massage followed by 1/2 hr herbal press which is a MUST TRY if you have sore shoulders and back. Instant relief!The entire package costs me 1000 baht which is a pretty good deal and comparable to the other places you get around town.The atmosphere in the spa was calm and peaceful and very clean. After a spa, one can also relax by the cafe or the japanese restaurant. They serve excellent ginger tea there for 60 baht!It can be a bit difficult to get to this spa from Phrom POng station - I would advice you to cab it there all the way! Be sure to give some allowance for bad traffic! Taxis are also scarce around the area. However, iwth their excellent service, a girl went out to the main area to grab us a cab and they even called our hotel to inform them of late check out as we were running slightly late!Loved the experience so much - they;ve got themselves a loyal customer!

Imagine nails poking into your skin. Well the only thing I enjoy is wearing the kimono and taking a welfie. But that's about it. The onsen (450baht) experience is just bleh... the massage I took was the foot one, and the lady who was doing my massage, doesn't seem to know what's she's doing, plus she didn't really cut her nails, so half the time her nails are like jabbing into my skin. After 10 mins through the massage, which was supposed to be a 2 hour massage (500baht). I told her I wanted to stop at 1hr, and I was suffering for the 50mins. =.= with her trying to jab me more with her nails and her weird massages.Totally regretted it.

Paradise in a busy city. This place is really amazing. In a busy city like Bangkok, this is like an oasis which I love to come to at the end of a busy day to relax and chill. The massage is top notch and everyone should try the onsen. Guys be prepared to go full Monty though!

Amazingly relaxing, don't bother with massage anywhere else. Recommended by a Thai friend, amazingly relaxing. I did the baths (450bht), 1 hour Thai massage (300bht), 90 mins aromatherapy massage. Had a great experience and feel rejuvenated from the busy Bangkok hustle. Don't bother going to any other massage place. Loads of good beauticians in A Square and K village.Really professional and couldn't fault. Best massage I have had in Bangkok

My new second home in Bangkok.. I stayed in Bangkok for a total of 9 nights and went here 3 times. This place is PHENOMENAL and I'm so glad I found it. I had a 4 hour treatment at a day spa when I landed in Bangkok and found it somewhat lacking. The treatment itself was good, but the ambience was a little empty. Not to mention that I think I deserve better than those 300 baht massages in cramped, creepy establishments with very little privacy where your nothing more than a lump of flesh to be poked and prodded. So, I arrived at the reception in Yunomori already impressed by the very quiet, peaceful, Zen-like atmosphere and top-quality customer service. I recommend that you book your Onsen and treatment before you get there as bookings fill up fast in the evenings. The staff take care of you from the moment you walk in. You're given a locker key for your belongings and taken to a room where you take off your shoes and are given slippers. You're then directed to your treatment room (if you choose to have one). Afterwards, you're shown to the Onsen (a guide on how to use it is in the reception and change room so you won't miss a beat).The Onsen and locker room areas are kept clean, quiet and tranquil. The patrons also keep to the spa etiquette and remain quiet and well-behaved. No loud, annoying tourists here. The facilities in the women's change rooms are thoughtful. They provide a high powered hair dryer, lotions, shampoo, conditioner and other toiletries for you to freshen yourself up. I don't know what it was in that water, but this place made me the most relaxed than I've ever been. Value for money is quite excellent. I paid 1190 baht for a 90 minute aromatherapy massage and Onsen. They have an array of packages or a la carte treatments. I'll definitely be returning on an almost daily basis during my future trips to Bangkok.The cafe serves great bites and drinks. The garden and outdoor area was fabulous. A true oasis in the heart of Bangkok.

Very responsible price but facilities a bit out-dated. First time patronize this spa. The facilities is huge with several spa pool. The price is at a reasonsable price. Baht2200 you can enjoy 75 minutes of body scrub, 120 mintues of oil massage and 30 minutes of herb therpy. However, the masseur need more training in order to improve their skill. The private room need some re-decoration as it is look too simple. Not much of a spa taste.

Nice and Good Value For Money. 500 Baht for 1.5 hours Thai massage. Quiet, attentive, good massage. Peaceful and tranquil ambiance. Managed by Japanese and provide Onsen. A very good match after an exhaustive session at the Flow House.Can send you to the BTS with their own tuk tuk.

Japanese style day spa. What in the world I found a traditional Japanese style onsen-spa facility in the heart of Bangkok!There are 5 or 6 different hot baths with 2 different sauna rooms for men. Size of each tub is different yet it has a plenty of room for at least 5 or 6 people. They provide Yukata-bath robe, so relax and chill in lounge after taking a nice cozy bath.Despite steamy hot Bangkok weather, this is a quite nice treat especially if you are coming back from your long trip.

a WONDERFUL ONSEN in the heart of Bangkok. A simple place to relax and let loose. This is the third time that I visited Yunomori, I would have to say the services and the standard has really maintained.The Onsen was great but you cant stay in the premises for more then an hour. Therefore, I would usually booked the massage and time it after my session in the hotspring. There is only one little flaw in my last visit which I find some of the items in the onsen lacks a little maintainance. I would sincerely hope the management can take more effort to upkeep the place..The other area which I felt is not as good as before, is the maintainance of the garden. It is always nice to be supported by greenery and sad to say the cafe that is attached has already close down. So cant have a great cup of cuppa after an hour in the onsen.I think the main highlight of the place is the massage..... OH MY GOD, is so so so good. My masseur (Ple : not sure if it is the name but his tag number is 44) was a very attentive man. working patiently on the areas which I need more attention to. I was so eased after the whole 2 hour session. A good massage is hard to come by and A great one is like a blessing. However, I did apologise to him that his massage was so good that I practically doze off a few times in the course of massage that he has to wake me up to massage my other region... haha... talk about really relaxing life.The price I pay for the two person including onsen and 2 hours of traditional Thai Massage is 1650Baht. That to me is super reasonable and the time I spend there is so well worthThank Ple and Kai, will definitely pop by again for the wonderful massage in our next visit to BKK and Yunomori will always be on the list.Keep up the good workVisited August 2014did a same review on my other account

Bad service. Booked online for 2 pax and received email confirmation. Email asked for massage/spa package we wanted and ended by saying they looked forward to seeing us. Replied to indicate options. Turned up at spa after braving the rain and BKK traffic jams and were told they dont have our reservation. Showed them the email and all they could say was that they dont check their emails everyday and the staff that sent us the email was not working. They said we can wait 2 hours for the next available slot but that aside, didnt offer very much by way of apologies or incentives. Maybe it was because they looked very crowded, so it wasnt a big deal to them. Wasted 1.5 hours of my time. Note: Dont try to walk to this place from the BTS station - its a 20 minute brisk walk and the traffic jams around the area can get very bad.

one of the reasons why I want to go back to Bangkok for a short getaway. I enjoyed the massage and the onsen at Yunomori Onsen so much during the last trip that I visited there almost daily during my last trip.The thai massage and oil massage was one of the best I have ever experienced. it cost more than most other massage places in BKK but I can be sure that I will not waste my time there on some lousy massage.The various pools in the onsen made me felt rejuvenated and cleansed. took a bit of getting used to walking around naked in true Japanese onsen style but got used to it after a few visits.No doubt that it will be on my daily things to do when I go to BKK in Oct.

A simple gem in the heart of Bangkok City. A simple place to relax and let loose. This is the third time that I visited Yunomori, I would have to say the services and the standard has really maintained. The Onsen was great but you cant stay in the premises for more then an hour. Therefore, I would usually booked the massage and time it after my session in the hotspring. There is only one little flaw in my last visit which I find some of the items in the onsen lacks a little maintainance. I would sincerely hope the management can take more effort to upkeep the place.. The other area which I felt is not as good as before, is the maintainance of the garden. It is always nice to be supported by greenery and sad to say the cafe that is attached has already close down. So cant have a great cup of cuppa after an hour in the onsen. I think the main highlight of the place is the massage..... OH MY GOD, is so so so good. My masseur (Ple : not sure if it is the name but his tag number is 44) was a very attentive man. working patiently on the areas which I need more attention to. I was so eased after the whole 2 hour session. A good massage is hard to come by and A great one is like a blessing. However, I did apologise to him that his massage was so good that I practically doze off a few times in the course of massage that he has to wake me up to massage my other region... haha... talk about really relaxing life. The price I pay for the two person including onsen and 2 hours of traditional Thai Massage is 1650Baht. That to me is super reasonable and the time I spend there is so well worthThank Ple and Kai, will definitely pop by again for the wonderful massage in our next visit to BKK and Yunomori will always be on the list. Keep up the good work

Interesting Impressive Surprising. Yet ...Somebody recommended me going to this unusual spa. First of all, a Japanese-style onsen/spa in the capital of Thailand. Interesting. And the prices on its webpage are remarkably cheap. And, I think that, if such a price, no loss even if not good. We then booked a 2-hr aroma oil massage.The spa is an isolate building by itself, i.e., not in the middle of a multi-storey building. Impressive. The deco is impressive: bamboo on the outside, wooden materials inside. Jap paintings etc hanged on walls. We arrived at noon and the lobby was a bit noisy - a lack of serenity, which is something we appreciate in spa. But not a big flaw. Staff could not be friendlier. Love it. The core topic: the massage. The two masseurs performed well. We were asked of the details: which parts of our bodies should be focused, the intensity of the massage, a choice of 3 oils to choose from. We were later led to the private room on the 2nd level. The room appears to be spotlessly clean. Appreciated. Then, I saw the nice surprise on the wall ----- please see the attached pic here and test your eyesight. I do not have a cockroach-phobia. I am not complaining. Very unexpected to find a small companion during our massage. But ... it's Japanese-standard cleanliness, right?I think the Jap owner may die of shame. Ha ha ha ...

Depends on the masseur you get!. An average place that is not too easy to find (our cab driver had to make many rounds in the area before he found it despite the instructions from our hotel and the full address of the spa). It is a huge place, very clean and polite service. But I think it lacks ambience. For example, I do not see any plant/ floral arrangement nor hear any music. It was just awfully quiet with only mutters and whispers from the people at the spa.The onsen was ok, they had 1 jacuzzi pool and 3 hot tubs of varying temperatures. The massage room was clean and basic. But my masseur was very good. We opted for a 90 min massage and 30 min herbal compress. She was consistent throughout and very skillful. I feel rested and relaxed after the session.That said, the treatment was quite expensive considering that it is Bangkok. We paid 1,800 THB. each. But if u get a good masseur that it's worth the price tag. May revisit again.

Affordable onsen in Bangkok. A beautiful place to go with great onsen experience. Staff are very polite and look after me well while I was there. I enjoyed onsen and foot massage so much. Price is a bit high for local but for traveller, I have to say that you would not get anything like this. Place is nice and clean and great relaxation.
