I love it and will tell all my friends who are coming for holiday.

Treat yourself with affordable decadence. Everything about this place is luxurious and although it may not be considered "cheap" for Thai standards, as an Australian I would never be able to experience this kind of pampering at home so I am really glad I spoiled myself a little here. You begin by choosing what you would like off the menu (I went the whole hog and got the scrub, massage and herbal compress) I was directed to the spa room to wash, receive my locker and kimono gown and to spend some time in the mineral pools. All of the facilities were of a fantastic standard and I felt like a roman princess. My therapist was divine and although English was hard for her she was welcoming and friendly and very professional. During the treatment I thought I almost could take any more pleasure, it was so enjoyable. Once finished there is an area where you can prepare yourself for the outside world again, with hairdryers, mirrors, hair ties etc. Such a delicious experience.

Very relaxing place in a busy city. We've been a couple of times and it's always a great place to go for a break from the buzz of Bangkok. Many families there - people with their children or elderly parents. Men and women have totally separate facilities and the staff will give you a lesson in onsen etiquette. (no swimsuits). Towels are provided.They also have ice cold Asahi! The baths are hot - you will likely only be an hour max in the onset itself.The massages are fantastic - but busy. Book ahead. The place is very large but popular.

Blissful oasis in traffic heavy bkk. was recommended by a friend and was beating myself over why I didn't discover this gem of a place before that. I am a spa junkie esp in bkk where choices are abundant and prices insanely affordable. Tried almost everything at yunomori. the entire ambience, décor, mood, cleanliness, services were top notch. Not much of an onsen person but gave it a try just to immerse myself with the full experience. Most impt thing would be hygiene and cleanliness as most authentic onsen requires one to go in in full monty glory and yunomori managed to keep it clean with cleaners constantly wiping away water on wet floor. that was a plus. cute kimonos were handled out to wear as you lounge around the spa before your massage. the space looks huge, yet, easy enough to navigate and familiarize yourself. Did a 3 hours aroma massage with herbal compress. therapists were courteous and skills were good except that I asked for "firm" which supposed to be the strongest comparing to ":medium" and "soft" but it felt like medium to me. No problem on that as I kinda pitied the masseur who have to knead me for 3 straight hours. The Japanese restaurant within the spa was excellent. Very fresh tasting and the yakitori dishes were comparable to those I had in japan. overall, it was a gem and I went there with friends twice within 2 days. Highly recommend if you want to restore some peace and looking for a quiet place to unwind and untie those knots. we all did. AWESOME.

find your balance.. .. after a few days of having lower back pain, i decided to visit Yunomori Onsen and Spa. yes, i have been here before many times. the entrance fee is not that cheap (450.00 baht for onsen), but it is worthwhile definitely. you'll be greeted by lovely and attentive receptionists. then you can choose your spa treatments (i recommend my favorite, the 90 minutes aromatic oil massage with khun Tony!!) or just pay for the onsen fee. after changing your shoes, you will be given one Yukata and two towels. the locker is clean and doesn't smell!! inside you can really relax in variety of hot/cold tubs (filled with mineral spring water!!) both indoor and outdoor, steam sauna and dry sauna. try to avoid the busy hours (like on Sunday around four PM onward - a bit too crowded). personally, i enjoy coming here on weekday before noon when there is not too many people so that you can really enjoy the most from their facility.. and as for me, no more back pain!!! thanks guys.

Came twice in a week!. +service was top notch all around (reception, service staff, therapists)massage was clean and very professionalmassage rooms were well-decorated, clean, quiet and conducive (air-con, lighting and music)authentic onsen experience (with 5 pools of different temperatures)reasonable prices (with a few packages to choose from)-onsen could be better maintained (chipped tiles, cracking wood)gastronomy cafe was closed

Unique and spectacular. A well appointed and clean Japanese spa with a variety of pools of different temperature, style and both steam room and Sauna - no time limit, helpful staff. Enjoy a great massage at a discount when you finish the spa. Budget time - my trip was four hours including the great massage. My favorite experience in Bangkok,

a gem in the heart of bangkok!. had such a great massage at yunomori we actually went back the following day even though it was a little far away from our hotel. place is tastefully designed, huge, and masseurs were professional and awesome. would def go back whenever i go to bangkok.

a good experience. it's located somewhere far from sukhumvit main road and BTS Phrom Pong, it will take about 20-30mins walking. The web site stated there will be a tuk tuk to pick you up but in fact, there's none. they will send you to BTS from Yunomori only. Suggest to get a taxi at soi26 when you get down from BTS. Tell taxi driver A Square if they don't know Yunomori. Yunomori is within A Square. For men, you gotta get naked in onsen, but don't be shy. that's the way to enjoy onsen and everyone is the same. i took Set 3 (onsen + body scrub + aroma massage) for only thb1900. i think it's kind of worth it and i like every single treatment. Very good experience and it could be better if lesser people there. will definitely go again.

Nice environment and reasonable charges. The onsen and spa is located quite far from Phrom Phrong BTS station, maybe 20 - 30 minutes walk. Would be better to catch a taxi from Phrom Phong. The place is nicely decorated and there are a number of pools with varying temperature. The one nearest to the bathing area is the least hot and should be the first pool you hop into to get yourself warmed up. There is also a pool with jacuzzi jets and a cold pool just outside the steam room. There is a mini garden area where the sauna rooms and another warm pool is located.We booked a massage so entry to the onsen was at a discounted rate. I did the thai massage while my friend did the aromatherapy massage. The massage was done in a nice and clean massage room and the standard is quite good. You can check the charges from their website.Overall it was a nice experience. They offer a free shuttle from the spa to the BTS but you have to ask them.

Heaven in Bangkok. I had wanted to come here a couple of times on previous trips but as it is out of my way I never went. The last trip it was my mission to find the place and go. I committed by making a reservation on the internet. To walk from the BTS is about 30 minutes. Best option, depending on the time of day, is a taxi. The facility is located near K Village. I opted for the ONSEN and a 90 minute oil massage on the three occasions I went. The checking in process was efficient. They take your shoes, provide you will slippers and then guide you to the Onsen. Robes of all sizes are available, I am on the larger end of the spectrum. Instructions are very clear, if this is your first time do not hesitate to ask them questions or read the documentation. In the female side you are offered some netting for modesty, this was unlike the experiences I have had in Japan so I appreciated this additional touch. The change rooms were adequate and have drinking water for hydration. Shampoo, conditioner and body wash are provided as well. Then there are six steps of the ONSEN that you can partake of. It was great. Plunging from the hot into the cold water was wonderful. If you have a massage booked after the ONSEN they will come and remind you that your appointment is soon. My 90 minute massage was heaven after the baths. I felt every knot was worked on and I walked out feeling like I was walking on air. And when you consider the price, it is worth every single dollar. I believe I paid B1200 for the two. There are many other options, with foot massage, no oil etc. They also have a beauty therapist on hand, restaurant, café etc. If it was not so out of the way of where I stay, I would go there daily.

Love this place!. I went with my cousin and grandma to this place, and both grandma and I felt that this place has the best massage for the whole trip. Grandma didn't go into the spa area, just a foot massage, but my cousin and I had a fun time in the spa. They do try to take care of the non Japanese customers, providing us with disposable bras and undies to wear (normally people get naked), and posting instructions on what to do, how to wear the yukata, etc. I love soaking myself in the little wooden barrel in the outside area. Earlier reviews of this place mentioned a pool with tom yum spices and coconut in it but I didn't see it, to my disappointment. Even if you don't use the spa, I'd highly recommend coming to this place just for a massage. At 350 Baht a hour, it's an excellent value. Not to mention that the masseurs are top notch. They know how to work out the knots without pushing too hard. It's not always the harder the better when it comes to massage and sadly not all masseurs know that. These guys did an excellent job. Also, while we were late for the appointment (we thought they would come into the spa area to call us) they did not cut back our time. All the staff is very friendly and courteous, the place is very clean and tranquil. I just wish this place is not half the world the away from me!

Great place to chill out after a stressful day!. I heard about Yunomori Onsen and Spa by accident about 6 months ago and have been there virtually once or twice every week since. The pride themselves as fusing the Japanese Onsen experience with the Thai tradition of massage. I have only used the Onsen and think it is absolutely brilliant (provided you're not shy about being in the buff). The venue is clean, the staff friendly and there are no hassles at all. I tend to go late in the evenings when there is a smaller crowd, that way I can enjoy all the "pools", the cold,hot,soda and bubbling jacuzzi. Like me, many just use the dry sauna and ump into the really cold bath, then repeat. You will leave refreshed, clean and completely relaxed. Definitely helps me get a good night sleep too!. For THB 450 a time, it's a bargain!

Will be back for another visit soon!. We called to make a booking the day before. When we arrived, I think they had a problem with our booking - somehow it was not noted down but it was all sorted out quickly. Staffs are attentive. As we came with our luggage, they were quick to keep our bags away and made us to fill up a form for our choice of essential oils and strength of massage. We chose the Aroma Massage which costs 900 baht for 90 mins. Maaaan, it was one of the best massages I had in Bangkok. Her strokes were consistent throughout. I thought good masseuse were extinct! We traveled to Bangkok often and it's been difficult to find a good masseuse lately and one who doesn't insist on a tip. I'm all fine with giving tips but it's such a put off when they openly ask for it. The whole place looks like a Japanese traditional onsen with wooden structure. Nice and clean. Will be back for another visit soon (if the price remains)! Direction: We took a cab from Phrom Pong BTS. Most taxi drivers will know where K Village is (A-square is opposite) or print out a map from their website. I called for a tuk-tuk service and they didn't offer it that day.

The trip was worth it. This new spa is huge and my first impression walking in, was that it was really clean and looked very professional. The staff were on hand to show us to the waiting area, kept our bags away and passed us each a form to fill up. The form indicates the strength of massage we preferred and the areas to focus on. My partner and I were shown to the couple room where we'd be having our massage. We had chosen the Aroma Massage which costs 900 baht for 90 mins. The bed was not as soft and comfortable as I'd hoped. The music was a tad too loud. The masseuse however, was amazing. Her strokes were firm and strong and I must say, I was very impressed. It was really good and not painful even though my whole body was aching from all the walking the past 2 days. And unlike Healthland, the masseuse did not ask for a tip. I am definitely coming back here on my next visit.

American with Body Issues Goes to Japanese Spa. So, I'll admit: I didn't know what an Onsen was. I met a guy earlier that day at lunch who was super cool and talked to me about this place that was down the street from my hotel. I was in Bangkok in Jan 2014 during the protests, and this night was a particularly bad one where it was ill-advised to go to places like Silom and Lumpini. So I stuck around Sukhumvit. My friend texted me and told me to arrive at 8pm at the Onsen. First, it's NOT where Google Maps says it is. It's in a larger shopping center to the south of the intersection marked on Google Maps. But once I found it, the results were both hilarious and relaxing. I felt like the Accidental Tourist, entering and paying and yet still having no idea what to do/where to go/customs to follow. Eventually I ended up in the men's locker room (good thing), where nakedness was simply a state of being. Being an American from the relatively uptight Northeast, it was a bit unnerving; but what is travel supposed to do but take you out of your comfort zone? I shirked my robes and proceeded to the actual bath-house, where I must admit - it was incredibly relaxing. The different pools and steam rooms really do help soak the stress away; and the social aspect (which, admittedly, is still a bit weird when everyone's "hanging" out), was enjoyable too. I'd totally do it again, but probably only in Asia where there are less hangups about naked bodies. I could totally see doing this in Japan (where I've never been), but not so much in Washington, DC (where I currently live). But if you have an empty night - or need a chill night - in Bangkok, certainly check this place out.

Don't hesitate. Just go!. The onsen experience is unlike any spa-like activity I've done. I'm now making a habit of going once a week or every other. I used the opportunity to take time to reflect and cleanse my mind, body and spirit while bathing in the my natural state. At first, I was worried about being completely nude but after a few minutes, you remember what it was like not to care about being nude in front of others. I feel very safe when at the Onsen. You will see many Japanese business men and some with children. I didn't realize how normal it was. It renews my faith in humanity. You can tell the Japanese guys because they like to chat and they are very comfortable in their bodies of all shapes and sizes. If you don't have six pack abs, you won't be alone. For the experience, the price is worth every Satang. You can take a break in the shaded common area where you can drink an Asahi beer, read the papers provided, have a coffee or snack, smoke, or call your friend and tell them to join you next time. There is also a free tuk tuk service to and from BTS Phrom Pong in front of Emporium shopping center turnabout driveway on the West side of the building.

Relaxing. I really enjoyed soaking in the soda spa. This place has the usual Japanese style Onsen facilities providing something a little different for those that are looking for a change to the standard Thai relaxing spa.450 bht for the visit.Food and beer are available for purchase.Staff are excellent. Recommended but only if you are comfortable with communal bathing, if your not go and learn how to be.

Japanese Style Hot Spa in Bangkok. Couldn't believe doing this in Thailand, as visiting an onsen (hot spa) is usually done in colder Asian countries like Japan and Korea. It's quite relaxing if you don't mind walking around butt naked. They have separate male and female sections so if you go with a friend of the opposite sex, you expect some time apart. The restaurant and lounge areas are common for both sexes, though.
relax time. This is a perfect place and clean and quite good.Onsen and Aroma massage are the best and servicewas excellent.

Almost Great...Almost...but well above Average and best in town. This review is based on 4 visits to the Men's Onsen.Visits were between 14:00 and 18:00 using only the Onsen related facilities, I did not have a massage or treatment but may do so going forward.It is notable that Yunomori Onsen is getting popular, almost too crowded, particularly after 17:00.Almost Great...why?.... (See wish list at the end pls)Well I watched as the project was built and had (and still have) great expectations.It is very nice, very clean and the best facility of its kind in the city today, as far as I can tell.I am a big fan of Japanese design, Onsen, as well as steam and sauna culture. I have visited many Onsen in Japan and Taiwan as well as many hot springs in Thailand and Asia and am a regular at the better local ‘hamams’ in Bangkok, the local equivalent of Yunomori Onsen at about ½ the price...The reception is busy, but efficient as I only wanted to use the Onsen.I paid under 500 THB, was issued a locker key and shown on to the 'check-in’ shoe/slipper area, an experience that is clumsy and awkward, but not too bad.On entry to the locker and wet areas, one is given 1 large and 1 small towel (more on this later) and a yukata, you also check your slippers here…they are not used in the locker and wet areas. From here onward, there were only Phillipino staff.The locker area is well designed, finished, appointed, staffed (more later) and ventilated with abundant natural light. It is a bit crowded when busy.NOTE: They have begun spraying ‘air freshener’ in the locker room AND on the towels in the locker. I think this cheapens the entire experience big time.You remove your clothes and enter the sit-down-shower/wet area with the Small Towel Only.Yup, for those shy folks to note, it is a small towel, too small to wrap around even the thinnest waist to conceal the smallest of equipment.You enter the ‘wet’ area featuring traditional Japanese ‘sit down’ shower area, the various Onsen pools, steam, and outdoor sauna area.One is supposed to shower, and be properly clean before entering a bath, steam or sauna, so this is the first thing you should do…The wet area has high ceilings, natural light and generally well designed facilities although there is little room to move around when it is busy.(Note- It is a pity that the interior contractor never fixed the finishing details like the paint, few places with blue PVC pipe etc....I hope you get to that Management)) There is an open air, covered and enclosed garden with Sauna, terrazzo onsen and 2 one-man teak soaking tubs and about 5 plastic garden chairs (ugh yuck).Here is the biggest let down...there is no place to sit, relax and cool down/sweat...such an important part of a good Onsen/Sauna experience but...... ...something that owners and designers always omit, ....for what ever reason...The Onsen claims to use trucked-in spring water in addition to the 'engineered' water in one particular bath.However, I have never seen a water truck and presume there is a filtration process and water quality test?? Smelled chlorine last time i was there...There is a water jet bath with about 8 seats, a long hot still pool for up to 15, the engineered soda bath for about 8 and a small cold dip bath in the indoor area as well as the steam room and a standing shower.The steam is well designed with a glass wall, hone finished terrazzo benches and hot. Overall good, but incorporation of thai herbs in the Steam would be a great plus.The engineered bath is interesting and feels effervescent, the cold dip pool was nicely cold and the others were well designed with good seats and hot.Outdoor area is nice with light, plants and moving water. The sauna was hot, spacious but smelled of air freshener, yuck, thus i didnt use it for long -The outdoor onsen was very nice and the one man teak buckets were pleasant.My Wish List-Get rid of the air freshener! (from the locker/towels and sauna)- Cool Down Relaxation Area with generous seating - ie more garden area please!- Expand or control numbers of people in the wet area- Provide drinking water inside the wet areas, current single location is really bad!-Use Thai Herbs in the Steam and Eucalyptus in the Sauna - - Open another location in my neighborhood-and...not to be called 'sir' so oftenConclusion -I will be back and hope at least the air freshener thisng has ceased.Compared to say, Silom Sauna on Soi 22, (THB 180, similar facilities, not as clean, free herb drinks, fruit and deserts), Yumomori is still worth it if it dosent get too crowded or w/ too many 'cruiser' types,,,ugh, pls go to babalyon

Relaxing!. This is a great place to unwind after a busy week. 450BHT for all the time you want to relax is a great deal. And for the modest ladies they do have throw away panties and bra that they will give you if you don't want to onsen in your birthday suit. I love all of the different tubs, the soda shower was my favorite.

Great place to unwind, recommended !. Since opening I frequently visit this Japanese Onsen and Spa alone and with my wife. There are separate sections for males and females and the experience inside the onsen is very relaxing and rejuvenating. Very clean and very good value for money, only 450 baht for the onsen experience and you can stay as long as you want. They also offer massages for extra. Very popular with locals and expats. The steam room in both sections have been broken for a few weeks but they should be fixed later this month. Another plus is they serve the coldest Asahi beer in town for only 75 baht a glass.

Quiet little bubble in busy Bangkok. Peaceful.... That is it. Yunomori went beyond all my expectations. The place is spotless, the lobby confortable (with giant armchairs) and the best is the bath. When you arrive, you are given a beautiful yukata, fresh towels and bright smiles from the staff. Boys and girls are not in the same place since everyone goes naked in the onsen (if you are too shy, they can give you some disposable underwear). And then, it is paradise. Long shower, soaking in different bath (all different temperatures) and soda shower.... Perfect combo for relaxing. Will come back for sure!

Most affordable way to relax in Bangkok!. At only 450 baht entry, you can experience authentic Japanese onsen (with added typically excellent Thai service). It's tip top on professionalism, tranquility, cleanliness and value for money. Can't ask for more. We had the whole day to kill in Bangkok and this is THE best way to do it without spending too much.

an oasis in the bustling city of smiles. was recommended by a thai friend, took awhile to get to the location as not many taxi drivers are aware of A Square. (by the way it's just located behind A Square after the carpark area)arrived at a very quaint and tranquil looking building, almost reminiscent of rural japan if u blink an eye and not notice the tall buildings behind.booked the aromatherapy for 2hrs at 1100baht (very very reasonable given the ambience of the place) skill of masseur was very good, targeting pressure points and problem areas (you fill out a questionnaire before commencing the session highlighting to the masseur the areas you want focused on and areas u prefer to be left alone) after paying for the session you're immediately whisked away to the 2nd level where the private therapy rooms are located, you're given time to take a quick rinse and the therapy session will begin immediately. (the 2hrs is not inclusive of your shower which some other massage joints do, so you get the gist? :)I drifted off to sleep many times during the session because it was simply relaxing and good! the pressure points I wanted focused on were attended to by a professional.the session ended with a hot compress which was very uplifting.I didn't get to try the onsen as I didn't set aside time for that but I guess I'm gonna visit it again for sure and will definitely try the onsen. overall a very very good experience at this place and I have nothing else to add but do your tired back and aching shoulders a favor and visit it! :D

Truly Japanese style. We mark this as one of the must visit when we found out of such place. Furthermore, it vaguely remind us on the trip we had in Osaka last year. An authentic Japanese onsen indeed. Value for money, a place to relax your mind and body not only with the onsen facilities. But also through a variety of massage service that you could get with some extra charges. Worth for a visit.

Japan most sought after onsen is now invading thailand due to its influx of Japanese culture (tourism). its not surprising to see the malls in bangkok come with manyJapanese restaurants when an onsen is installed in the country. the onsen attracts many young people as compared to those I have visited in Japan and Taiwan. The "system" is consistent - you walk in butt naked, shower and dip in. you will also see both hot/ steam sauna within its premises. Interestingly, it seems to be rather crowded even during week day office hours. one highlight, it comes with optional massage services at an additional cost to its entrance fee. Admittedly, the layout seems pleasantly calming (designed by Japanese). Overall it did reminds me of Japan - perhaps, its time I should revisit Japan.

Don't understand what book means !!!. The place is nice and clean, the therapist quite good but 30% of the time I book they don't book . So I arrive there, always on time, and they start to say "sorry 10 minutes late" but after 30 minutes that I wait you understand that they don't care about you 2 times: the first one because they don't keep your reservation, the second one because they keep you wait and they lie to you about how much you have to wait.If this happen only one time no problem but instead quite often in the last 2 month at least for times.I continue to go only because I like one therapist that work there but as soon as she stop I stop to go there too.

Worth a try.. But more suited for same gender bonding. This is a place that attempt to replicate a Japanese hot bath concept, which did a ok job honestly. The place is spacious and has hot bath of various temperature and a cold one. There is a cafe, jap beer (asahi) draft and massage. Price wise is decent. Many food/pub options nearby. Now for cons, the location is no way convenient. The spa claims to have shuttle service every half hour back and prat pong bts, but when we asked for a trip back to bts, they said "driver". So no driver today or no driver ever, I cannot be sure. Be prepared for traffic jam to and from the place as the roads are narrow and only one lane each way. We had better luck walking there (30minutes) than in a cab as the traffic was jam packed. As for the hot bath, it's is separated between male and female. So couple going there can forget about soaking in hot bath together. Chances are you will be soaking with other males/stranger naked. Yes, naked, as in the authentic Japanese style. They only allow you to enter the hot bath with only a handkerchief sized towel to cover up or wash with. Hence, it is good to hang out with your buds or girlfriend. massage is forgettable and food wise, go for other places, there are tons of options nearby.

Best massage in Bangkok!. The best place for most relaxing spa. Onsen and aromatherapy massage are the best combination ever as the onsen will dry your skin. The therapists are all good, the only place that i dont need to wish that i'll get someone good.

Relaxing, Authentic, Wonderful. I lived in South Korea for a few years and I missed going to Asian bath-houses. After spending a few days on the southern islands of Thailand, I was ready for some relaxation and I was thrilled when I found out about Yunomori. Yunomori really is an authentic Onsen. The whole building is beautifully decorated. There are cute outdoor gardens, where you can drink coffee, Asahi, whatever you like. The bathtubs that are inside are hot, cold, soda water a variety of others. The staff is very friendly and doesn’t rush you to leave. The bathhouse is VERY clean and well maintained. They have some great specials going on now, and I got a massage included with my Onsen. It was one of the best massages I’ve gotten in Thailand, although this may be because I was already relaxed from sitting in hot baths before. We also ate at the restaurant on site, which was fabulous. I can’t wait to return to Yunomori the next time I’m in Bangkok!

Are you kidding? This places is ohhh so ahhhhh. We were blown away by this brand new jewel in the city. Forget over priced, pretentious, froo froo spas. The first Japanese Onsen just brought it's special bliss to Thailand. Pay 450 baht and you can soak in the divine hot, cold, and bubbly tubs all day long. Steamroom, 2 restaurants on site, and spotless serenity. $350 baht gives you an incredible Thai massage (they've got the full gammet of services) by incredibly trained staff. Natty (therapist #25) blew me away with her massage and hot compress treatment. I own a Pilates studio in the US and am often disappointed with the quality of massage out and about. Natty rocks! After several hours of soaking, lounging, and a great massage, I was almost convinced that I could fly. RUN to this establishment, they are doing it right.

Excellent deep tissue massage. . Saw the reviews and travelled 5km from my hotel for this. It was definitely worth it, a very clean place with a great dark relaxing room. Attentive masseuses made sure me and my girlfriend felt comfortable at all times.
Great massage place in Bangkok. Not a luxurious place but nice, clean and amazing Thai massage. If considering going there try to book a traditional Thai massage with Mr. Krit; he is quite amazing.

Superb skills. Without a doubt, this was one of the best massage experiences of my life (and I have had hundreds). Pinpoint accuracy and intuitive massage technique, highly skilled, polite and kind people, immaculately clean premises. I left after 90 minutes feeling like a million dollars. Leave any lingering doubts behind and definitely choose this place whenever you are in Bangkok.

Kind of disappointed . Saw all the rave reviews and was really looking forward to have massage at this place. I even went down twice because it was fully booked and it's quite a distant from my hotel. Really want to like the place but was really disappointed. The massage was too weak and I have to tell her 3 times to make it harder. She was like not that happy about it. Slowly when back to the weaker state and I give up telling her. To make matter worse she pressed on my knee joint quite a few times. Lastly the leg rest is all cracked which really make one uncomfortable when your leg is on it.Well the only good thing and the reason it's not one star is the recepition is friendly and the place is pretty clean. The recepition did apologize for it and that's it. Maybe it's just my luck for getting the wrong person.My advice, don't expect much from the place and if you really want a massage here ask for someone stronger or just let them know beforehand what kind of pressure you look for.

Something Unique!. Love Thai massage, totally addicted and discovered this very unusual place where the masseurs are blind - hence the clever name, Perception!. They are very skilled and sensitive, depending purely on touch to find just the right spots. The venue is 5 mins walk from a BTS stop and you enter through a very discreet private passage and up some stairs. The decor is sophisticated, in shades of grey and you can choose to have music playing if you want. As well as enjoying a very relaxing and therapeutic massage, you can know that you are contributing to the care of the blind, who are dependent on such support, there being no other care for them in Thailand. So a good deed and healing combined!
Amazinggggg. One of the most exquisite massage i've experienced. MUST TRY. The blinds don't deceive. Good in quality infact i tipped them

Great experience. This is a tiny massage studio in a back alley. The masseuses are blind and part of the money you pay goes to supporting blind people.The atmosphere is quiet and relaxed. We booked just a few hours in advance and it was no problem. When arriving we were greeted by the lovely receptionist with some cold tea. The massage was super nice and attentive. (before the massage you have to fill out a form of how would you like your massage). After finishing, we received some hot tea which was lovely.Just a note: There is no music in this studio :) It is super clean as well.I can highly recommend this place and most likely we will return soon.

Great choice!. I left this place relaxed and inspired! I gained more than what I paid for. I had a great conversation with the girl who massaged me, She spoke English well. She was also good in doing her job.

A unique experience! . We found Perception Blind Massage via trip advisor and after reading the reviews decided that this is a MUST whilst in Bangkok. The website location directions are easy to follow and we found the location without any issues. We didn't book an appointment and decided to see if we could be seen as a walk-in. Luckily we were able to have 2 head, neck and back massages. We were lead upstairs by the receptionist and asked to change into the fishermen shorts and cotton top, we then waiting until our massahe therapists to arrive. I can only describe the next 60 minutes as pleasure and pain. We did ask for a firm massage as we had aches and pains from travelling around Malaysia and Thailand. Upon writing this review a good few hours have past and we are both feeling less tense, more relaxed and definitely with less aches and pains than we did prior to the massage. It cost 450 baht each for 60 minutes and is worth every penny. We also tipped our massage therapists as they did a good job. We'd recommend them to friends and family and will be going back as and when we return to Bangkok.

One of the best massages I've ever tried . I went there based on TripAdvisor recommendation and was very happy with my choice. Once I'd entered, I could immediately feel the wonderful atmosphere. And, my experience only got improved from there. The receptionist is very patient and helpful. Everybody has to fill a form to personalise the massage. And then, the massage itself is amazing. The masseur knows exactly what he is doing and the pressure and technique he put on respective muscles are just perfect. My mom and me both felt sooooo good that we went there twice during our 5 days in Bangkok. Highly recommended.

Best Thai massage. A colleague of mine told me about this place and it definitely lived up to the hype. Upon climbing the stairs to the parlor, you're struck with inspiring words and reminders that what's most essential to the heart cannot be seen with the eyes. I didn't make an appointment, but was seen right away. The service was impeccable and maybe because it was early, I had an entire room to myself. My massage therapist worked hard on my knots - after a 24 hour flight - it was well needed. For 550 baht for 90 minutes - it was well worth it. Would definitely suggest it.

What an Amazing Experience!!!!!. Once upon a time, I was wandering around the streets of Phnom Penh, by myself, when I started talking to a local gentleman, in the central market. He asked me what I was looking for, and I said a massage (not that kind of massage, silly!). He very exuberantly recommended blind massage, which was a brand new concept to me. Sadly, I didn't have time to indulge while in Cambodia. Upon returning to Bangkok, however, a quick google search informed me that I should go to Perception Blind Massage, and check this out! Getting there was fun - a mix of metro exploration, followed by wandering through some residential areas of Bangkok. Cool! Upon arrival, I ascended the stairs, and was greeted by inspirational passages like "The eyes are useless, when the mind is blind." I love this place already. I naturally didn't have an appointment, and was told it would be about an hour and a half wait, and if I was interested, I could come back, or wait downstairs, in the cafe. The cafe was lovely. The coffee drinks were absolutely amazing, the people were friendly, and there was wi-fi. No problem! When it was my time, I went upstairs and met with my masseuse and went to my massage bed. The massage was fantastic. Parts were a bit different from any massage I'd had before, but everything was professional and of the highest quality. I felt well looked after, well massaged, and well relaxed by the time I left. I have a great appreciation for my experience at Perception. I would recommend this place to anyone traveling to Bangkok, who loves massage (and if you love massage, Thailand is the place to go)!

My Perception of Perception. The receptionist is friendly and welcoming and despite Perception preferring appointments, she was able to get me in for a 1 hour Thai massage on the spot.The combination of the lighting, design and pleasant aromas make for a tranquil and relaxing atmosphere and experience.I was given a cool beverage and asked to complete a form while I waited allowing the massage style to be tailored to my liking. It asked questions about pressure, preferred and disliked massage areas and health conditions.Being my first time ever trying a blind massage, I was unsure as to what I should expect. However by the end of the session all my muscle tension and doubts were eliminated by what was one of the best massages I’ve ever had.My masseuse was friendly and could even speak basic English. She massaged in a manner that was skilled and methodical but not mundane.Based on my first experience of this place, I will definitely be going back.

What is your perspective? . My fiancé and I totally enjoyed our experience with Perception Blind massage again! It was great to see them again! Every step you take to go up to the room is a perspective! The truth begins when you start your massage! They do not have the sight to see but the vision in their hearts to serve! Your perspective will change with ever step you take! We were totally in awe by them using their hearts to see! They were so skillful and so polite! We can feel the excitement they have to see their customers enjoying themselves! To end off the massage with a meal just below Perception Blind Massage, is Dexter Cafe & Bar! You wouldn't want to miss this and regret what you didn't see and try! (: We will defintely be back again! Thank you very much!

The best massage in skill, experience and service. Hands down the most phenomenal massage I have had.A massage is a multi sensory experience, one blended of art and science. We had the one hour Thai massage and wished we had stayed longer. My masseuse was skillful in technique and discerning, asked me consistently if I was ok with the pressure, encouraged me through the inevitable pain and was gentle and firm in her application. She cracked a joke that the massage was spicy when I was groaning in pain with sounds of "ahhhh and orhhhh". Although she was visually impaired, she had a great sense of the different positions and there was a comforting flow of pressure points. I have never felt happier in pain, ironically put. A MUST GO!!! I'm coming back for repeated visits. :)

Excellent experience . I visited the Perception Blind massage based on reviews and close proximity to my hotel. While the street infront is not the best one, the place is very clean and offers a great relaxing atmosphere. They are very kind and accommodating, they managed to squeeze me in almost right away, although I went without an appointment.The massage experience was amazing. The lady, totally blind, had a fine way of reading my body and applying the proper pressure. I had a cramp on my calf the other day (still hurting a bit) and without mentioning she healed it right away. Overall splendid experience, would definitely recommend

Amazing!. My husband and I came here because of the trip advisor reviews. This place is awesome! 60 min Thai massage for 400 baht, about $12 USD each. The ladies were so great! They can feel what needs extra attention and work out all your kinks. I wish I could have spent more time here. Thank you!

Pretty good. . I have also been to BodyTune and paid more there, but I was more satisfied with this massage shop.They just know where to press in a sensitive way. A staff comes in one time during the massage to ask if the pressure is alright. For shoulders and some parts, it hurt a bit, but other than that, it was all good :) Oh and the room. It was very cold!

If looking to try the skill of a blind massage, this is a clean/qualified/ professional spot!. Being regular patrons to massage and foot massage for most of our adult life, my husband and I had always wanted to try a blind masseuse. We were both aware that with lack of sight, a good blind masseuse would be able to be in tune with muscles in a way that a seeing person cannot. We always said we would enjoy this experience, but really had never had the opportunity to try until our recent trip to Bangkok because a qualified blind masseuse is not easy to find. We had a great experience and would recommend Perception to anyone seeking a similar experience. Not only did we have a thorough, extensive, complete, detailed two hour Thai style massage for two hours (for only $700 each) by staff that is fully trained and certified to be providing such services, we had a great experience inside the facility. Perception is clean, professional, welcoming and comfortable. Perception has a good website to answer any questions I had prior to arrival and they were also quick to follow up when I booked our appointments a week in advance over e-mail. Do book in advance, for although walk-ins would be welcomed, I am thinking available spots to a walk in might be limited. When you arrive, you will be welcomed in a small reception area and then escorted to your area/massage bed and provided house slippers. You select soft, medium or firm massage levels and indicate any problem areas on a client form. This information is then shared to blind or sight impaired masseuse assigned to you via the "seeing" receptionist.For Thai massage, you will be provided a tasteful pair of fine linen loose pants and a shirt that you will wear during your massage. On a side note, I like that this professional, clean establishment is a professional, honest career for a masseuse that happens to be blind. This place is full of good karma!

Need a Break?. Easily reachable by BTS and taxi / car with limited free parking available opposite the building. Friendly receptionist gives a warm welcome and professional advises about available massages. The place is very clean, tidy and well maintained. Massagers are friendly and very careful. Good massages! Recommended!

Absolutely rejuvenating . We had a long layover in Bangkok before traveling onwards. Went directly there from the airport - a fantastic decision after a long flight. Myself and my husband got side-by-side treatments by true professionals. We each got a 2hr Thai full body massage for 30$ (total!) We were able to specify which areas of the body to focus on and not etc. Spent quite a long time on our lower halves (feet, calves, thighs) and proceeded to upper and lower back, stomach and head. Nothing short of amazing. I've been to many massage parlors all over Asia (and many different types -5 star hotels to little alley places) & one of the things that separated this place was before the massage we got a write up/bio of our masseuses & their blindness - related history & general personal interests & total experience level. Was so individualized both to us as the customer and them as the practitioner. One thing - when you get there, the entrance looks dingy & like the back of a bar. . But once you get up to the lobby you're transported immediately. Very comfortable, quiet & were served tea @ the beginning and end.
Once is not enough 💜💙💚💛❤️. Beyond impressive. Would it be nice if relaxation and generosity are together? Let's experience! Warm your heart and soul here.

Not another foot rub. First impression of this place was great. It's located near to Chong Nonsi station. I love the entrance and the overall ambiance of the place. The receptionist welcome you warmly, serves you tea and provide you a card to fill out basic details and most importantly how strong would you like your massage to be.. I immediately ticked on the deep pressure. Unfortunately all i got is foot rub. While I really want to like this place for the opportunity it provide for the visually impaired, paying 450 baht for someone to basically apply lotion on your feet is just too much. That said, your experience could be a hit or miss based on the massage therapist assigned to you.
Should be the place for foreigners. Not so much fancy, but the massage by blind person was so nice, relax, and good to support binds in their businesses by tourists.

Worst foot massage ever. Clearly the massage therapist did not know what he was doing. He rubbed my feet with lotion and did not know what massage is all about. The hostess are sweet and nice but definitively not a place to get a massage. Waste of time and money.

Get Away!. Absolutely, get away from this facility. The thing they perform, is not massaging. A blind man so-called massaged me and i had to quit after 10 mins. It is not a professional decent spa center.
WoW! . My partner and I went Together with our Son of ten. In the past 20 years i have recieved many massages. This is in my top 10. Wonderful service. Amazing place and great care.

best massage in Thailand. I can not say enough good things about this place. The people really know what they are doing. I went here 3x in seven days. Best massage I got and I did lots of massages both in bangkok and phuket. The staff is polite, professional, and does an amazing job. I would recommend calling for an appointment, they can get busy. But if they are busy, they will do their best to accomodate you.

Expected more based on the reviews . Great atmosphere but the masseuse I had was ill & if your profession involves working in close proximity to people, when ill they should be given time off to recover & also so as not to pass it on to who ever is getting a massage from them. I asked for 'Medium' pressure & was in pain while legs were being worked on (I hate to think what hard pressure would have been!). The lovely receptionist came to check one time if pressure was ok & unfortunately I said yes it's fine as didn't want to upset the masseause & thought I'd be able to bare it as it had to be nearly time to move into back. Had a minor limp for a couple of minutes after massage had finished (felt like cramp) but that went after had walked a couple of blocks. Had high hopes but wouldn't go back based on experience I had, high score given for ambiance & idea but not the actual massage unfortunately. Sorry, have to be honest.

For you to do yourself a favor to get a real pampering.. (A) AppointmentWe called to this place in the morning to confirm on the availability. We had the appointment set at 12pm. While we were on the BTS, the receptionist called to inform us that, there will be a 20 minutes delay due to some unforeseen circumstances, which was not an issue at all.(B) Getting ThereWe stayed at Eastin Grand Hotel Sathorn, just one BTS station away from Surasak - Chong Nonsi. Follow exit 3 & look for Standard Chartered Building. Once you are approaching the building, look for Soi 8. It's quite easy to spot Dexter Cafe. Perception Blind Massage is located on the 2nd floor. Take the narrow staircase, you will see the inspiring wording that worth a few photographs.(C) EnvironmentThe receptionist was very kind, pleasant & spoke perfect English. The air-conditioning was cool & such a saviour in the afternoon. The restroom was clean & well-maintained. While we enjoyed the drinks, we filled the questionnaire on what we wanted for the Thai Massage. We opted for a private room, which has 2 beds at the extra cost 100 baht. The room was equipped with air-conditioning as well. (D) 2 Hour Thai MassageThere were clean shirt & trouser provided. We get a massuer & masseuse. Both of them were professional & very polite. We requested deep tissue massage & their exceptional technique delivered perfectly with their strong hands. The massage was covered in such a great detail. It was the best massage that we ever get. They had some kind of alarm which buzz 2-3 times during massage, which might serve as time interval. But that's really not something to complaint about. Our phones getting a lot more buzzing from the disastrous-incoming-messages-flood!(E) ConclusionComing to this place is not for you to show the sympathy about how unfortunate they are for being partially/fully vision-impaired. In fact, it is for you to do yourself a favor to get a real pampering. I was hoping I could squeeze some time for a 2nd massage, which I didn't. But, I believe such a great place will be in business for a long time & it's just the matter if I could get an appointment the next time.
Enjoyed every moment of it. Tried the Thai body massage, receptionist was polite and welcoming. My masseur could even tell my backache problems without a hint. Thank you, it was wonderful.

Wonderfully healing experience. I visited Perception on my trip to BKK. It was a great experience! I had been experiencing some lower back pain and my friend suggested this place. I went and was able to get a massage right away. The space is lovely, quiet, serene and welcoming. The receptionist gave me a cool drink and a biographical card about my Masseure...which was a really nice touch...to know a little background about your masseur. The massage was excellent and healing...my masseur zeroed in on my lower back pain and melted the pain with his well trained touch. The receptionist even came in half way to make sure all was well and if I needed anything.I would highly recommend this wonderful and healing experience to anyone needing or wanting a top notch massage and experience.

Best massage in Thailand. What can I say that has not already been said? Wonderful venue with a great story, but above all else the Thai massage I had was fantastic and easily the best I had during my travels in Thailand. It is well worth a visit and is very reasonably priced. I will make a point of returning here when I am next in Bangkok!

Very helpful staff, cool experience!. I had many massages while traveling in Thailand and had an especially good experience here. It's an interesting experience with a blind masseuse and the whole staff were very helpful in understanding your needs and making you feel welcome and relaxed. Must try this place!

What an Amazing place. This massage parlour is amazing. I loved every minute of it. My husband and I booked ourselves in for a 60 minute Thai Massage and we had a great time. The receptionist was very professional. They take really good care of your the moment you step through the doors. And the fact that our massage therapists were blind made it even more special for us because we appreciated every minute of our massage. They have got great strong hands and was very polite. I would definitely recommend this place over and over again. And if we ever get the chance to come to Bangkok again I'd got there with a drop of a hat.

It's a place that worth to go. . The place is clean, new, stylish and comfortable. The receptionists are very kind. They did come to check if I'm ok while I'm doing the massage. The massage was great as well.

A great massage at a well run place. My partner & I booked 90 minute massages yesterday. After some initial problems with the tuk tuk driver finding the address we entered thru the ground floor coffee shop to the 1st floor reception.A glass of water then filled in a questionnaire on what we wanted and past issues. We were given a card giving details of our massagers. A nice touch. The massage was on the next level up where we had a private room for us including attached toilet & shower.We both thought we had a good massage and there was plenty of questions to us if the pressure was too strong and how we were liking the massage.After the massage we returned to the 1st floor reception for a cup of tea & to pay the most reasonable bill.Recommended.
Perfect. I tried oil.massage, a blind staff, kind, and gentle, perfect,with reasonable price, a staff towash my feet, also friendly and atmosphete really relax, i.spent 4.5 hr a day there,

Good service, very attentive staff. Although the massage experience was not perfect for me (Great for my friend tho), the reception staff really did their very best to solve the problem. Thanks ladies for your kindness and understanding. Your boss is lucky to have you as a part of his team who treat his business seriously.

Personalised & great massage, great employment!. The welcome area is nice and professional with a perfect English speaker & a short question / picture chart to peraonalise your massage.Price is very reasonable for the level of advice provided & giving employment to blind people who can struggle a lot for good employment.

Really good massage. I have been comming to Bangkok for the last 16 yearsand among the many massage places...i only got a few really good ones. Try Perception Massage, Sathorn Soi 8 (first floor). Blind people are giving you masaage, they know what they are doing... Their hands are finding the way on your body...it feels great.Underneath Perception Massage you find Dexter Café. They serve very good european food too. Treat yourself at both places :-)
great massage. Perception Blind Massage is the one massage that i know. I'll come back again for sure. and all staff are so nice.

Great Massage. I went the first time with my friend and it was awesome. I got the real Thai massage in the very peacful atmosphere. moreover, I can help supporting the blind! I go back this place several times later.

Fantastic place in BKK - should give a visit. I had been here with my boss couple days ago for massage treatment to relieve stress. The staffs were so kind & gave us a warm welcome. The massage was so nice as well! Should give a visit while you're in BKK.

Great massage. Great massage and even better service. The price was very reasonable for the service and the staff was accommodating. We came without a reservation and they were booked but changed one of their massages to two 30 minute massages to accommodate us. Certainly want to go back if I have more time.

One of the best massages we've ever had!. My husband and I opted for a 2 hour full body Thai massage, and we both agreed it was one of the best massages we have ever had! It was our first experiences with a Thai massage. We went first thing after arriving in Bangkok from Chicago. Needless to say, we were stiff and sore from airplane travel. The massage was just what we needed to start off our vacation! We would say it is combines aspects of a sports massage and deep tissue/pressure point massage. Honestly, it spoiled us for any other type of massage. Our masseuses were incredible and able to seek out our trouble areas. We are active/athletic and have issues with tight muscles/joints as a result. Our therapists were able to work away a lot of these issues in just one session! The price is very reasonable. The location is not fancy; however, it is modern, neat, clean, and peaceful. The staff is also very welcoming.

AWFUL. One of the worst massage ever. I tried this based on other reviews and maybe i was just unlucky but I cannot recommend this at all. Most of the hour was spent rearranging the towels. A minute was spent on leg then covered up again. Moved onto a new area for literally a minute again - totally not enough to feel any benefit. And the blindness was totally overplayed with constantly spending time tapping the table all along the edge (slowly) to find how to get from top to bottom. Complete disappointment! No one even asked me afterwards how was the massage - maybe they knew!

Worth the visit. Not so fancy location but very good massage. Lady at the reception is very accommodating ( as She help us get a taxi and ensure that we get to Chinatown safely fro shopping) and massage ladies knows what they're doing. I was surprised that I have a sore collarbone when she gave it a good amount of pressure. Felt a lot better after 1.5hrs of massage. I will definitely comeback with my DJ. Price is very reasonable so it is worth giving a tip to the ladies.downstairs is a restaurant. I love the pasta with mushroom sauce. Clean and reasonable price too :)I highly recommend both places.
Fantastic. Great location right next to Bangkok cbd, lovely environment and atmosphere. Reasonable price and great therapist. Strongly recommended.

Friendly, great experience. The location is convenient in a tastefully decorated building, with friendly and welcoming reception. The experience overall was relaxing and professional. The masseuse was knowledgeable and experienced. Highly recommended.

Amazing, amazing, amazing!. From the moment you enter you are kindly greeted with excellent service. Your service is personalised and you receive a card all about your massage therapist. Both of our massage therapists were amazing, they really know what they are doing and take time to sort out any problems in your trouble areas. Highly recommend. All the way through they have awesome quotes.
Very special experience!. Had 1.5 hour Thai massage by blind lady. The place has really cool relaxing design. Very good and precise massage.Better to book a day before.

Unique Experience . Recently visited here and had a two hour Thai massage for 600 baht. Very reasonable. The masseuse found all my knots and did an excellent job. Thai massage uses pressure points, so it is not just like a rubdown. Having a blind practitioner was a unique experience, and the setting was quiet and peaceful. Upon registration, you are asked about problem areas and what needs special attention. I chose medium level of pressure. I will include photos of the location and entrance since others have had difficulty finding it. It seemed easy to find and only a block from a skytrain station, Soi 8. Maybe 100 meters from Sathorn road north, upstairs in the same building as Dexter's.

Very recommended. It was our first Thai massage and I will remember it forever. The place was not difficult to find: we gave the number of place to our taxi driver and he spoke with girl. The place is very nice, cozy and new, modern style, very clean and the receptionist was very nice and welcoming. About massage I chose Thai light level, you can choose medium or intense but light was already intense enough for me. During the massage I had mixed feelings but this morning I could feel the result: full of energy, feeling very light and flexible. The masseurs were very good, professional and friendly. During the procedure you get a set of shirt and shorts. Everything is very clean and nice. At the end you get a cup of tea. The final feeling is that of a very complete experience. Enjoy your massage! I already want to go back.

Traditional Thai Massage. Firstly because this is in Bangkok, I should say that this is a proper massage establishment, and not an "adult entertainment" type place. The business is staffed by the blind and they offer excellent service. I went in with neck & back pain, and within an hour of leaving the pain had completely gone. They really do know what they are doing!

Wonderful . A little piece of heaven tucked away upstairs from Dexters in the Sathorn district of Bangkok. The staff welcome you and make you feel comfortable. After deciding your treatment you are then given information on your masseus then either taken upstairs or into a couples room. The masseus seems to just know where there a knots and tightness. I highly recommend the traditional Thai massage. Reasonably priced and beautifully presented.

Be proud of who you are, and not ashamed of how someone else "SEE" you! . My girlfriend and I were proud of these masseuses. They were not ashamed of how others "see" them. They all have a dream. They did not give in to their disabilities but use their abilities to Perception Blind Massage. We enjoyed their skills and their perspectives. It was a unique and memorable experience for the both of us. We felt so relaxed and comfortable with them as we tried out their aromatherapy massage. The cheerful smile on their faces, I guess that's what you mean by a photo speaks a thousand word. But when we were there, it's an experience speaks a million word. (: Thank you for that million word, Perception Blind Massage and the staff. **salute** I'm looking forward to the next experience visit again. (:
Good experience "MUST TRY". This was the was the first time I've had a blind massage. It was amazing. Me and my husband loved it! Really recommend.
Must try! Best blind massage in bangkok. No wonder how great they are. Tried the aromatherapy massage for an hour. Very relaxing and great experience there.

Unique experience. Never thought about ever having a blind massage. Didnt know it existed. Geez im glad i did. What an experience ill never forget. Totally immaculate. Funky and as soon as you walk in the door its pure bliss. Highly recommended

Peace and Respectful Massage Place. Just before you enter this place ... you just cant stop but having to take photo of the stair and words on yhe walls.... just going through them you can possibly know who are your massuer!!! ...Yes they are the blind one ... but as from my experience ... they are the best ... they really know what they are doing.The massage room is quiet and peaceful unlike other massage place that is quite noisy from customer or massuer talking over the curtain!!!Will definitely come back again

Great blind massage. I always take an hour Massage before enjoyed the night downstairs at Dexter. And you wouldn't believe that the blind massage actually cure your back pain and it worth for money ever!

AWESOME massage, BEST in Bangkok! Must Visit!. My boyfriend and I really needed a massage from days of hard walking and we chose the herbal ball massage as we like the smell of herbs. The herbal massage was simply perfect with the right pressure, the soothing herbal scent, and the friendly service of the masseuses. We felt right at home and would definitely make Perception our go to place the next time we are back!

Definitely a MUST in Bangkok . I had an excellent massage and the place is very clean and soothing atmosphere. The messages on the wall make you reflect, I would come back when in Bangkok. Very nice experience.

great place, and best massage. I have been to many blind message places in Thailand, and this is the best in terms of cleanliness, atmosphere and service. The masseuses told me that they receive guaranteed 300 baht/ day (a legal minimum wage in Thailand, even though they receive wages in percent (100 baht out of every 1 hour)

Just perfect. It was the first time experience of thai massage for us that turned to be one of the most fantastic and pleasant feelings in the world. We felt like a new born after 90 minutes of the massage. Can definetely recommend it to everyone staying in Bangkok including those who failed to try thai massage before. Perception, thank you!

Our visit make an encouragement for them. Their skill are good and we should encourage them by showing our visiting. I tried 2 hour Thai body massage and feeling relax especially to my stiff shoulder.

The best massage ever. This is my very first time trying blind massage, and it turned out to be the best massage I've ever had! The receptionist is very helpful and informative. The masseurs are very professional. It was very comfortable and relaxing. I was there alone the first time, then went back with some friends. They all love it! Highly recommended.

Ahhh-mazing Massage!. This is truly one of the best massages I have had in the world. The therapists are incredible, the price is excellent, and the cause is very worthy. How wonderful to train blind in a family sustaining career! This is a MUST GO if you are in Bangkok, and should be on everyone's list of top things to do.

Excellent Traditional Thai Body Massage. Our family of four booked a 2-h (priced at 600 baht per pax) Thai body massage via Facebook messenger a day before we arrived at Bangkok. The response to our enquiries and booking confirmation were informative and fast.Directions to the place were given and that really facilitated our smooth cab journey there during the late afternoon peak hours.The office was at the second floor. We were warmly welcomed and asked to complete a simple 1-page survey on details like physical conditions and to highlight on areas that require specific attention by the masseuse. Upon choosing the masseuse, we we're led to level 3 where the massage began on time as scheduled.The masseuse did a very thorough job according to the level of pressure we had indicated on the survey. They we're meticulous and gave the body massage in sequence, part by part and at times with repeated actions on the focused areas.We, inclusive of our teenage children agreed that it was a worthwhile and rejuvenating trip to Perception Blind Massage even it is situated at Sathorn. We felt great and body aches left us literally after the good rubbing till now. Highly recommend to all who are looking for a beneficial traditional massage in Bangkok! We will definitely be back again on our next Bangkok holidays. Thank you!

Comfortable environment and friendly therapist . Comfortable and clean place, skilled therapist and nice staff. Make a reservation in advance in case they're overbooked. You can get info about your therapist in the beginning.

A good massage by blind therapists . Decided to give this place a try after seeing the ranking in tripadvisor #5 of 305 spas in Bangkok. We stayed at Metropolitan Hotel in Sathorn road so it was within walking distance. The only problem was there was no visible signage from afar - The parlour is actually on the 1st floor of the shophouse and the ground floor is a cafe/bar called Dexter (very visible sign from the main road). As for the parlour itself - it projects a calm and hip feeling. The masseurs are visually impaired so don't be surprised if you sometimes have a second person in the room with you to assist them in passing the oil or herbal balls. I chose the 90 mins thai massage, focusing on the shoulder blades and lower back. My masseuse did a fantastic job although I had to ask her to put a little less pressure. All in all, I enjoyed my first blind massage. Recommended for those looking for a different experience

Thai massage - but with a slight twist.. Thai massage - but with a slight twist. Nice clean place, lovely staff. Very relaxing. 90min Thai massage 500 baht. Worth also going to dexters afterwards for some food/drink. I had a really tasty berry banana smoothie after my massage.

It was so brilliant!. I've been there few times and always received the best service from here. Last time, I brought my Australian friend to get massage here for the first time. He did say this is the best Thai massage hes ever had so far after visiting Thailand for the 5th time. Surely recommend this to my other friends though.

Great experience. This was my first Thai massage. Upon visiting my husband and I were given a drink,asked to fill out a form about our preferences, and given information about our massage therapist. We changed into the Thai fisherman pants and a top and then our massage therapists were led in and began their work. It was a really cool experience and felt great after sightseeing in the heat the past few days. Afterwards we were given tea and a thank you in braille and able to sit until we were ready to go. I like what this business is offering. We did make an appointment (via email) before visiting.

Excellent massage by blind therapist. I had a 1 hour Thai massage at Perception, which was recommended by a friend who lives in Bangkok for many years. It is located near Chong Nonsi station and just above Dexter Bar and Cafe which is also a great place. Warm welcome by the English speaking receptionist, she served me some water and handed me a one page background sheet about the blind therapist who was going to do my massage. The massage area is very nicely arranged, peaceful and comfortable. The massage was excellent, covered the whole body in 1 hour and left me feeling totally relaxed. Afterwards the receptionist offered me tea. I would definitely go again. Very affordable price, great massage and service.
First Thai Massage. I just had my first blind foot massage. The massage therapist massage my foot n toes with great comfort n pressure that I slept through the session in the last half an hour. :-)

Amazing no frills massage. I went for the 2 hour aromatherapy massage, and my masseuse was wonderful! She really managed to help ease all my sore spots and paid attention to my problem areas. They have interesting massage oil options as well. The receptionist spoke good English, and they very graciously allowed us to delay our appointment as we were running late. The location is a little obscure, on a small dusty road opposite an empty plot of land. Upon arrival, we got some water and a form on our problem areas or areas to avoid. I also appreciated that they let you take a quick shower before the massage, as we were tired and sweaty after walking over. Since it's a blind massage just be prepared for things like arranging the towel on your own when you turn over and having the masseuse occasionally stop to listen to the recording which directs them on your problem areas. Overall was a great experience!

Great reception but not for the massage. My sister and I went for 1h foot massage & 2h Thai massage. The foot massage was the worst we ever had in our lives. My body thai massage, thought it went well, felt the acu-points were well covered. But I'm not sure why my body felt worse the next day. Was very tired and couldn't turn my neck properly. My sis masseur was not to standard. She kept on pinching her whole body instead of using various techniques. We did not experience the usual Thai massage where they stretched your body here & there, cracking some joints. Was disappointed especially it was highly ranked in trip advisor.

First blind massage . Me and fella read good reviews on trip advisor so thought we would try it out. I had medium Thai massage and yes it was little painful but good. Having a blind person doing it was different but all staff were all professional. My fella had the deep tissue and at times biting the pillow but felt amazing afterwards.

First blind massage 😊. My husband and I went for a massage at Perception Blind Massage, where visually impaired therapists offer spa treatments. We didn't really know what to expect but felt strongly about supporting the therapists in their unique career in the spa industry. So we agreed to give it a try. We were greeted very warmly at the reception by a blind therapist who then also performed the massage for us. The treatment room was perfectly scentenced and very comfortable to enjoy the massage. We had a really relaxing massage and were very impressed with the quality of the treatment. There is certainly some magic to the special touch of massage by a blind person and the experience left some lasting memories to both of us. We will certainly go back and recommend it everyone.

Didn't experience that heightened sense of touch at all and alarm kept on going off in the midst of massage.. Great, friendly and accomodating receptionist but the massage itself was not what I was expecting. I didn't experience that heightened sense of touch I was hoping to experience. I'm actually quite disapppointed. The room felt chilly. I asked the receptionist to turn it down and she did but even then, it was still too cold for me as the AC was right there facing the bed, blowing directly at you. The massage was just so-so. In the midst of the massage, the alarm clock kept on going off with this robotic voice 'low battery, please recharge' in English and in a few other languages. It went on for a while every 30 seconds or so and I was waiting for the massage therapist to do something about it, like calling in the receptionist in to fix it. She didn't. Since she didn't speak English, right after the alarm went off, I would make comments and say 'Off please' and she just laughed it off. This happens like 2 or 3 times. I was like 'Are you serious?!' I had enough and got up and called the receptionist myself. Receptionist turned it off right away and she was apologetic but the experience was already ruined for me. The lady gave me 100 THB discount at the end. And I appreciate her making the effort in pleasing her customer. Thus the 2 star review.I'm sticking with Healthland.

Really satisfied, definitely recommend . The location is close to BTS Chong Nonsi Station, Exit 2, which is quite convenient. The atmosphere of the place is great, with meaningful decorations, massage room even with candle lights. Started with very good impression when the receptionist handed us a form to fill in with graphics to indicate if there are specific parts of the body that we would like to be taken care of. My mum's back was hurting a lot, the receptionist who speaks English well told the therapist to focus on my mum's back and it was helpful. I had a Thai massage and it was great, really authentic Thai massage, I can feel that the therapist really knew what he was doing. Felt so refreshed after the massage. My mum also felt better in her back after her aromatic oil massage. Definitely recommend. Plan to come again next time in Bangkok. The café downstairs is also good, got discount in the café after the massage.

Excellent traditional Thai massage. We went 2 days in a row. It was that good. Located upstairs above a cafe, you reach the facilities by going down a narrow hall and up stairs: once inside it is attractive and spotlessly clean. The manager is a lovely, friendly young women who made us feel very welcome. The therapists are indeed blind which heightens their sense of touch. They are well trained and professional. The cost is very reasonable, We both had a great experience and would highly recommend! Can't wait to go again on our next visit to Bangkok.

A genuine Thai Massage. If you're one to prefer a massage that is a little more challenging then this is for you. I'm not one to like relaxing massages as much as ones that concentrate on getting the knots out 100%. The location is very easy off Chong Nonsi BTS and the service was so refreshing!It was amazing to see the team work such respectable jobs and love what they do. Because the therapists are either partially or fully blind they seem to know where all your knots and places to concentrate on. I've had Thai Massages for many years and this has topped my list. I left feeling like jelly, such a great find!

Awesome Experience. I am writing this while getting a foot massage. It is my first time trying and it is very good. Although the masseur is blind, she knows what she is doing, and despite her lack of sight, her sense of touch is spot on. I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a valued massage in a unique experience!

Top massage by experienced therapists. Set in the Sathorn area above a trendy cafe (Dexter), Perception is a lovely oasis in the bustle of Bangkok. The warm and friendly receptionist speaks English well, and the professionalism is evident in the clean and contemporary surrounds, taking of your medical history and introduction to your therapist. The all important massage is tailored to suit your own requirements (mine was medium with attention to shoulders), and this is the first massage I have ever had where the therapist listens and then actually attends to your specific issues. The massage is as firm or gentle as you want & very comprehensive. My therapist gleaned that I spoke a little Thai, so we had a great little conversation as she went about the massage with her coaching me along with some of the words that I missed, lol. I could not lie down due to sinus congestion, so she was happy for me to sit up and do the massage kneeling on the bed behind me - very accommodating. Highly recommended!

Good service at Bkk. It was funny that we decided to go to Perception Blind Massage just because we read elsewhere that some others are suspicious. We didn't want to take risk and just needed a real massage. And this one satisfied us well. The location is a little bit hard to find, but if you have your phone and Internet, it won't be a matter. The receptionist was so friendly and sweet :) Pre massage service was good as well, with a form for you to fill in, asking how much hard you want, which parts you might want to be focused, etc... The massage itself was good, done by blind therapists with longtime working experiences.

Sweet and professional massage. The service is really sweet from the staff, the place smells nicely, the price was only 350B for a 1 hour massage, and yes.. the sweet blind ladies hit every single spot everytime.. the place has less than a year so is not so popular and crowded yet.. all the best to them.. will def go back when in Bkk.
Exceptional . Very friend staff, very relaxing atmosphere, the massage therapist works very hard. Will definitely come back again.

Great Concept and also Great service. I really love this idea about blind massage.This shop not only have just good idea
but they also provide a really good service. friendly staff
I have tried many Thai massage shops in Bangkok and I found that Perception
is really good in Thai massage
highly recommended

Worth the visit. From climbing the stairs you know you are entering a special place. The ambience is relaxing and welcoming and the staff capable. Their English is very good and you feel immediately at ease. The blind masseuses are very good...there is some pain with the pleasure as they find all those sneaky pressure points! I've visited twice and may come again before my trip here ends...great massage, fantastic business concept and of course there is Dexter next door for either pre or post coffee/food, which is also highly recommended.

Great service and environment. we came here as we found lot of good reviews from TA. their service is great and the environment is pretty good. it is a bit hard to find so make sure you have a map and TA app with you. my masseur is but skill is ok but not outstanding. will recommend this place

First Thai massage. This was my first thai massage. I was a bit reluctant to get a massage as they are a dime a dozen here. It was recommended to me, I took up the chance to try it. I also was quite fond of the ownerships business strategies in helping the blind. I have to admit, I am very pleased with the experience and again I'll get another one on my next trip here, same place but longer next time

Excellent service, massage and concept!. I visited the place because of the reviews I read here.
