From the time of making my reservation to leaving, the service provided was professional and the place was clean. The concept gives these blind people a chance to stand on their own feet with a respectable means of earning a living and being a part of society. The foot reflexology itself was great and they are sensitive to your particular needs. Make a difference - visit Perception!

Great concept, good massage. We went there this week during our stay in Bangkok. We can absolutely recommend this place. Not only the massage was very good also the concept of Perception is very good. Blind people can have a fully accepted job, keep their dignity and be a part of society. Everything is managed very professional. Beforehand you get a "set card" of your personal therapist that explains his background and gives you some personal information. The staff asks, if you have any injuries etc the therapist should know about and lets them know. After the massage you get a cold tea. All in all a very good experience. Do something good for you and for the others, go to Perception.
Good place!! great massage!!. Superb service. So much different from normal massage. I felt comfortable after all cracking, squeezing, pressuring.

Great massage . Amazing experience at Perception. The place is clean and soothing. The reception was very nice and took the effort to speak with me in order to select the right therapist.After getting a lot of massages in Thailand I would say this is the best. The therapist is trained on the body and how it interconnects.Must go! Not only for great massages by trained professionals but also to support the blind. It is an honorable job for them and allows them to be a contributing part of society.

Best massage ever!. I just went for a massage because I wanted to end my thailand holiday in a relaxed way. I opted for the aromatherapy massage and foot massage. My therapist is blind and certainly knows what she does! It's the best massage i experienced in thailand. Although it's a bit more expensive than other places it is definitely worth the money! Just go there to find out yourself.
This place is awesome. I strongly recommend this place! This is so goood. They are so kind n the massage is so good. I am sure i will visit here again!!

Relax, Let me walk long again. 泰式全身按摩，按的到穴道酸酸的，用撥鬆筋的方式慢慢按，遇到撥不開的時候，會重點加強多按幾次，按完非常放鬆腳步輕盈。
points at which a person is supposed to be lethally vulnerable.

Service was good!Highly recommended!. Just got back from Perception and I must say it's really good. The place is very clean and the receiptionist is friendly & speak English. Room&bathroom is really clean with simple but elegance decoration.The lady who massaged me really know what she is doing and very passionate. I had aromatherapy massage for an hour and a half and came back with a happy feeling!
Support the blind therapist. I highly recommend it to everyone who wants to try blind massage in clean and cool ambience. Cant complain about anything and very good value for money :)

A great massage. I have just returned from a 2 hour massage at Perception. It was a good massage, much more pressure than I had expected and I ticked the medium box. If you want to shower beforehand they charge 200 baht which seems a bit steep. After all we wanted to shower as we were a bit hot getting there! It was great apart from the music was on a loop and a very short one at that. It is also the music HSBC use when they put you on hold! Good price at 600 baht...

Total package. Greet you with a cool drink and a foot bath. Had a 1 hour foot massage and 1 hour full body massage. Have had 3 blind massages (2 in Thailand and 1 in Kuala Lumpur) and this was by far the best. They give you cotton top and pants to wear for the massage. Deep massage which included my stomach. Lady did a great job. My feet felt wonderful after she used her hands and a stick to work my feet over. Lighting is dark and shear type curtains separate you from others. Could see my husband in the next area but could not see another person they brought up later. Gave you a cup of tea after. Thoughful writings on stairs and walls about perceptions.

Great Place for Massage. Its a place that gives back to the community. A very well designed and harmonious place for a good no nonsence thai massage by the Blind. If you are looking for authentic Thai massage with a masterful touch this is the place. Its a little hard to find. Advice, call the centre directly. The receptionist speaks fluent English and will be able to direct you there. Its only a 5 min walk from Chong Nonsi BTS but beware as its a huge station with multiple exits.

It's all in the name "Perception". My husband and I wanted to have a couples massage. We were recommended to go to Perception. We walked in and was immediately greeted by friendly staff asking us what type of massage we wanted. She explained all in detail and asked us to fill out a health questionnaire about what pains and aches we might have. This was so helpful because the staff can explain to the massage therapist exactly what we want or need attention to whereas we only speaking English might find that a challenge. My massage therapist was incredible. Everything and more then you would expect. Each movement was controlled, thought out and delivered with perfection. She knew what she was doing and delivered an incredible experience. As my massage theorist was completed blind my husbands was partially sighted. As this is ok it is just good to know that blind includes partially sighted as well.If you want a great, legitimate massage treatment, I encourage you to go to Perception. My only warning would be is, you will find it so fantastic you will come back again and again.Go and enjoy!

To understand what is a thai massage, you should visit this place. I visited many massage places in Bangkok, Kho Samui and Chiang Mai, but first time I hadn't only a simple massage technique (like in many similar places), but I had individual approach and focus on my personal problems of body. There is very peaceful atmosphere and friendly staff. The place has good location, only 5 min from BTS Chong Nonsi. I highly recommend to visit this place.

Great experience. It was one of the best massage experiences we has. Very good and quiet atmosphere. Highly recommended, both because of the massage and because of this business using all people skills.

Tranquility awaits you. I was recommended to go to Perception by a friend. You can tell by the name "Perception" that thought has been put into this establishment. Upon entering the doors, you are greeted by very friendly staff. The attention to details is everywhere around you. Nothing was overlooked ( no pun intended). The massage itself was amazing. Imagine yourself closing your eyes and giving someone a message. All of your other senses awaken as every move you make is deliberate and well thought out. So close your eyes and allow yourself to be taken to a level of massage that is unlike any other. I applaud the idea, vision and passion for this business. Kudos to,all involved.

Lovely blind massage in Bangkok. One of the best Thai massage in Bangkok.
Once step inside, I got the good impressions of feeling calm, cool and immaculately clean.
The price are very reasonable and good value for money. Specially, staffs were freindly and polite.
Highly recommended for those who look for new massage experience.

My favorite. It was my 1st time taking blind massage. I didnt't know what to expect, just love the idea of helping blind ppl. But it was one of the best massage I've had, especially for my office syndrome. Blind massager can feel and touch better. The overall experience was totally relaxing. I'll definitely come again.

It depends..... .... as in many establishments, the quality of the massage depends on the person that gives it.We were here today as the last customers of the day and had a very different experience.To start with the good:- Warm welcome- water and questionnaire (personal information, problem zones, zone to concentrate on)- atmosphere- Massage my wife got was superbThe downside:- my massage didn't deserve the name. I had many (also Thai) massages before and this was the worst I ever had.I stopped after a good hour with still 30 mins to go, because my massagist just didn't know what he was doing, almost fell asleep during the job and did not concentrate on my upper back as I had requested.I got almost one hour of leg thumb pressing and gently feet touching, before he even started on other parts.- the receptionist just said sorry and offered me 100 THB discount. A farce.I'm feeling not good to say this, but both guys moved around quite freely after the massage (before the massage they gave us the impression of being heavily visually impaired)I'm sorry and I don't know how to say this, but I went out with the feeling of being betrayed in multiple ways.The offer of coming back the next day or so, would have been nice. Still, my wife was very happy with her massage. So it was only half a disaster.
Great for sore feet. Had my first Thai foot massage. $400 for an hour. My feet were so sore from all the walking in the 40 degree heat. Very relaxed after. Worth a visit.

As great as it can get. Just came back from an amazing hour massage and really enjoyed it. Don't be afraid of the outside look, and it doesn't do any justice. Just walk inside, go up the stair and be ready to enjoy one of the best massage in Thailand.Warm welcoming , very clean, and has air conditioning, shower.. etc...I am here for a month and I will go back there every other day for sur.

Unique Thai massage. Great place and experience !. This is my first time for having Thai massage with a blind staff. It was such a great experience to try. The pain on my shoulder was released a lot. The place is decorated very nice. I love this place. The price is reasonable. Can't wait for the next Thai massage here. ;)

I'm kinda massage lover and this is the best one i ever had :). I have heard about blind massage before but never had a chance to try it. This is kinda excited to me and i'm not disappointed at all. They are very professional and the place is nice and clean. If you have office syndrome or just looking for the place to relax. This is the one that you are looking for.
Excellent !!. On the second floor of DEXTER, You'll find the this location with best Thai massage and Keep you get the new idea, relax

One of the best massage I have ever had. Upstairs from Dexter Cafe and Bar (a very nice place) on Soi Sathorn 8 you will find Perception, I went there today and had a 2 hours traditional Thai massage and I must say it's one of the best massage I have had ever (I get a massage every 3 weeks so I know what I am talking about).All the employees give massage are blind, they have to rely on their hand and touch.This is the first time I have been massaged by a blind person but I'll tell you it is definitely not the last. The place is nice, relaxed and very clean. You should try it you will not be disappointed.I will most definitely get a massage there again before I go back to Europe.

Best foot massage ever!. I had foot massage here twice in a week. It dramatically relaxed my tired legs and undo tension in my ankles. The place is very new and clean. The blind therapist's skill is superb, especially if u love strong massage.

Great atmosphere & value for money. I was back in Bkk in March-2015 and was recommended by friend to come to Perception. It has a very relex atmosphere and the masseeuse is very profession. They are well trained and I walked out with a new "perception" of thai massage. And most importantly ... It wasn't expensive at all.

Fantastic massage!. A great place for the best massage!! I came here twice in two days. The first day for a 1 hour foot massage, and the next day for 1 hour foot and 1 hour thai massage which were amazing! The Thai massage was the best one I've ever had. A great atmosphere, very comfortable and the masseuse is very professional and well trained. The is a 'must do' massage venue.

Excellent, you are simply just to feel it. After a long working day and a hustle through busyness in Bangkok, stop here for a relaxing massage is just the best way to cool yourself down. Only few steps from Chongnonsi BTS station. This massage place has a very cool concept.

Wonderful massage. I recently visited PERCEPTION twice ! On the same day as it was soooo good ! The room is beautiful with music and candles My lady masseur was kind and wonderfully relaxing as I asked for a soft oil massage And was suspended in two hours of bliss ! During the day there is also a 25 %?price reduction Perception is very near chong nonsi sky train easily in walking distance Try it out you will be very happy with the sereen service from the blind masseurs Robert walker
Clean & cool decor massage place. Had foot massage here, I love their comfy sofa and the blind therapist's skill is great. Highly recommend for everyone who wants to have massage with good cause.

Great massage!. The nicest and the most relaxing massage we had in Bangkok. Located on the 2nd floor above Dexter caffe&restaurant, the place is really worth visiting. And you can have a nice lunch or dinner after

Cool Concept, Excellent Massage!. I'm picky about my massage venues, especially in Bangkok. I'm always a bit cautious to try new places. I was happy that I decided to try Perception, because I can confidently say it was one of the best massages that I've had. I had heard great things about blind massages, and my first experience was an outstanding one. The price is reasonable, even more so because this business promotes social good.

Glad to see this superb massage place concept in Bangkok!. It is located above Dexter Café and Bar, look out for a small entrance nearby. I like the idea that I can have good massage and support blind people to make a decent living. I like the way Perception Blind Massage pays attention to what customer needs based on a pre-massage form which is explained to blind therapist before the session.

Recommended!. Well, The place is clean and serene. The blind therapist was a professionally trained and providing a specialized service using “seeing hands”. As expected in 1 hour body massage, I was quickly relieved for tired, stressed bodies. I will definitely be back!Happy body means happy mind :)

Glad I found this place!. It is on the 2nd floor of Dexter, restuarant in Satorn Soi 8 on the left hand side from Sathorn. It is not easy find. I got very nice foot massage from the blind. The place is nice and clean.

RECOMMENDED!. Such a nice place to visit once you come to Bangkok especially those who love massage. I found the cozy and modern interior inside as well as friendly staff. You'll definitely relax before stepping out.

Great massage by blind therapist.. This place just opens for few months so it’s very new and clean.I had one hour aromatherapy massage here, it was very good. Highly recommend if you live or work in Sathorn area, you may call them for booking first.

Clean and cool place hidden in Sathorn soi 8. Like the concept that I can support blind people while having good massage here. The therapist’s skill is great. Their sofa for foot massage are very comfortable, you’ll like it.

Great massage! - unique ambience and concept. Had really good massages 4 times already and will be coming back. I don't know whether it's because therapists are blind, but either way I also like it that they they have a job they can do very well. Everyone's real nice and the furniture and decor is quite cool.

I was in 7th heavan, relaxing and theraputic.. We made the arrangement through our our tour guidew whil visiting the Wat Pho temple. The ladies came to our hotel room and brought some covering material and towels. The seaaion lasted two hours. Thai massage seems to focus on the meridian points. After a 14 hour flight, this was exactly what I needed. The price is about 30% of what I am paying in California, very reasonable in my opinion. If you are into massage, this is highly recommended.

Disappointing choice. Used to go to the head branch nearby the Grand Palace but not this time due to the King's event and many ceremonies there. After the visit to the Sukhumvit branch, I told myself to stick with the head branch only. Go to No.2 listed at the business card shown. Price is 420 vs 250 Thai baht per hour but you will not regret to pay more.
where it all began. this is the initial massage school in Bangkok. We tried it out of course and had a great experience. Definitely recommendable while you are there.

Well worth a stop. Located in what feels to be the back of Wat Pho, it feels tucked away and is a welcome brief break from the Wat tours. We did a half hour massage - in spite of the location reasonably priced. As it's the school it was a quite good Thai massage. Would recommend!
A must visit. If in Thailand, get a Thai massage. And this is the best spot for it! No frills, just massage. Sometimes there are wait times, but longest I waited was 30 minutes before my turn.

An excellent place for a foot massage. Rather crowded and had to wait our turn. The young man who gave me the massage was a student and learning for his massage degree. Not very experienced and hardly spoke any English. But the cost was not too high.
Great massage. I got a 2 hour massage session. It was excellent and the price was also very reasonable. Good place to get a good massage.

Mind Blowing Traditional Thai Massage at One of the Old Prestige School of Massage. This is a must do activity for visitors of any age. It relaxes you completely and uses very old techniques of massage and which is done in very closed area but you are literally sleeping next to few hundred people and so many massage therapist doing massage to so many people. Its...Mind Blowing. Very reasonable Cost.
Good Massage!!!. If you go to Wat Pho and have times,I highly recommend to try the Thai Massage in Wat Pho,the price is a bit expensive but it's very good!

Relaxing way to end the temple visit. The school is located at the far end of the complex, so prepare to walk. The reception area is a bit small, and due to the popularity of the school, the seating area can be a bit crowded. There are a few benches outside, where you can also wait.The school offers full body massage and foot massage. No need to undress or shower. The massage will be dry (no oil or lotion). There is a small cubbyhole for each customer to put their belongings in.A packed cold tea drink will be offered after the massage. There is also a restroom nearby, should you need to freshen up.
Excelent school of traditional Thai massage. I only had the foot/calf massage and I wished I had done a full traditional massage. Excellent pressure. Busy but serene.

Awesome. We went there by our visit from the Wat Pho and were surprised how excellent the feeling was during and after the massage. It's more sensitive than on the weekend markets and there is no ache after it in your body. Of course its more expensive but still cheaper than in Europe. I would do it again.

Relaxing but expensive for Thai. That's a very good massage, specially after walking at Wat Pho for hours. I took the half hour full body and the girl got have and her hands. Butttt it's a little expensive for Thailand: 260 half hour. It worth the money, and to be better the place should be more silent.

nice temple. The temples worth to have a look but the massage place has been turned in a mass factory, it was 10 years ago more individual. The massage staff is trained- so you have some kind of guarantee not to get hurt like in most of private massage shops in town

Much needed massage after Wat Arun, Grand Palace and Wat Pho. I heard that this place is where Thai Massage originated. After hours long walk from visiting temples and the Palace, it is a much needed massage. The place is always full so I recommend to book first before you tour Wat Pho. They provide a very good massage, one of the best I have in Bangkok. It is a little bit more expensive than others (typical one hour foot massage is around 250-300 Baht. Their price is 450) but it's worth the price. The massage area is not private so you can't get an ambience of a spa. Overall, it was an excellent massage.

You are in safe hands. We chose the this as it is a medical school which practices traditional Thai massage - so we knew we were in safe hands. Thai massage can involve a bit of bone cracking so you really need to know that the masseuse is experienced. The place is always full and you have to wait approx 30 mins. But the plus side is that you can book and then continue touring the beautiful Wat Pho as it is inside the complex. We chose the 30 min traditional full body Thai massage. This is no magic to your ailments but does a good job of getting you relaxed after a long holiday. The beds are not private, and you are kind of crammed between 2-3 other beds. Although this doesn't restrict you from getting a great massage. The only thing missing is the ambiance of a spa. The masseuse kept talking during the massage which was distracting. We also felt sort of rushed as they had a long queue.

"Relaxing". Had a good massage after a long day walking at the temple. Traditional massage was awesome , so relaxing and stress-free i would definitely will go back and wanted to learn about their technic of doing it.
get relaxed and rejuvinated. I have done it thrice.it includes stretching and it is very relaxing. Not to miss it if you are planning to go Thailand

Good massage. My partner and I decided to get into thais massages in this centre.We totally recommend it and also the prices are quite low so def. if you're visiting Wat Pho make sure you get a massage in here

nice but a bit expensive. we love to go to get a thai massage every chance we get.we have been here a couple of times.it is very nice but sometimes you have to wait 20-30 minutes.the price is a bit higher then other places in town.but you need to visit the birth ground of the thai massage!

Excellent. The massage centre is situated inside the wat pho (temple of reclining Buddha) complex. It offers various types of foot and body massages for prices ranging from 150-600 baht. I had tried the traditional Thai body massage of one hour and it was excellent.

Professional, clean & affordable. What a wonderful discovery. A professional, clean & affordable traditional school. I had a fantastic foot massage after a week of hiking. It made me literally fall asleep for several minutes. Thats how much it relaxed me. In a city with uncountable bad massages on offer; this one is a germ.

A must try experience. After a tiring visit to Grand Palace and Wat Pho, we went for Thai Massage for 30 Min (260 TBH). It was Awassssssom. The massage released all the pain and refreshed us just like we woke up from the good night sleep. Can't explain much, you need to experience it.
Very relaxing. While checking out the reclining Buddha we decided to take a rest from the heat and get a massage. I had a leg massage. It was reasonably priced and in air conditioned comfort.

Must try if you are visiting the Reclining Buddha temple. We went to visit the Wat Pho (The temple of the Reclining Buddha) late in the day, so around 5.15 pm, we decided to get a massage. It was a bit difficult to find the Massage school, but it's all the way in the back inside the grounds of the temple. At that time, the wait was about 20 min. I think the last booking is at 6pm. My husband and I went as a couple, so we did the massage next to each other. We had the massage with the oil (the oil smells like Tiger balm, really good), and it cost ~600 BTH. This is a bargain if you live in the Western world, but it might be pricey compared to other Thai massage places outside. My husband had massages in Chiang Mai, Ko Samui, and at this massage school, and he said that it was far the best massage he got. It was deep massage, and well worth the money. My masseuse was a lady instructor at the school who has been massaging for 30 years and she gave me a deep massage, I felt amazing afterwards. My muscles were a bit sore next day, but in a good way. So, after reading other reviews, I think it depends on who you get. We were lucky to get masseurs that were experienced. I would definitely give it a try if I were there at the end of the day. The place was communal, but clean and the wait was not too long.

An excellent break from all the walking. This is the homeplace of the traditional Thai massage. It is in the same compound as the Reclining Buddha temple, although you must hunt for it. Very reasonably priced, you can choose from a whole body massage or a foot massage. Both are very relaxing! Prepare to wait for about 30 mins to get your turn. Absolutely worth your while.

Worth every penny. My muscles were particularly tight from training so getting a good massage to open out the muscles was great. She really got in there and wasnt afraid to use pressure (elbows and feet!) and kept asking if i was ok. I also have a tight lower back so she concentrated on stretching it out and it seems to have worked a treat. The balm they use is amazing, it warms the area they are working on. It cost 420 bhat (£10) for an hour so compared to uk prices youre getting a bargain but compared to the street prices you may think they are expensive but its worth paying for a proffesional Will visit next time i am in Bangkok for sure!
Overrated. There are better massages to be found in BKK even though this is thought to be the premier training facility for traditional Thai Massage
Great Experience.. Great Experience. Must do it either you like massage or not. Lots of things to learn about your body and mind.

Quite commercial now!. They do have good massages, however, the place is very commercial! It's the Thai street food version of massage where you tell them what you want, take a number and get your order (i.e. massage)! You are then placed is a crowded room with plenty of other customers, like canned sardines, while the therapist works on you.

Interesting activity. We did the half hour massage because we had been told these massages might be too strong. It was an interesting experience, with our masseuses taking care mostly of our back but not only (heads, legs, arms had their massage too). However, my back felt sore after a long flight and I must say I didn't feel any particular relief after the massage. All in all, for me it was more of a touristy thing to do than a real massage with therapeutical value.

Just the best for (non fancy) massage in Bangkok. we went, and returned and returned again. true massage the way it is supposed to be. We trued foot, then thai and then thai oil massge and loved them all!

A must do activity. Massage was 420 baht or around 13 dollars for an hour. Pretty deep work from skilled massage folks - they have a two hundred year track record to they have it down. Now air conditioned too!

2 hour massage awesome!. Best massage I have had in a very long time, even felt like I stood up straighter. Our tour guide organized for 2 students to come to our hotel room. I was worried I wouldn't be able to find the school so it was awesome for them to come to us.
Must do!. Everyone goes to Thailand to experience the traditional Thai massage and this is the best place to get it :)
Invigorating Thai massage. I love going to Wat Po when I am in Bangkok for a traditional Thai massage. They are always good as it is where many people train to do massage.

Overrated. weak massage. Just a tourist attraction. We were looking forward to trying a massage here, but our therapists gave us half-hearted, weak massages, and seemed to just be going through the motions. It almost seemed like all they cared about was looking like they were massaging, but didn't want to put in the actual effort.It's pretty cool to be massaged at a famous massage school / temple, but I'm afraid it's more of a tourist attraction than massage clinic.Tip: if you're planning to look around the temple as well as get a massage, go and get a number from the massage office first, as you may need to wait a couple of hours after collecting the number. We went on a relatively quiet day, and needed to wait about an hour.
Hit and miss . This is a school so everyone is learning - so don't expect perfection. Can be very painful so be warned - but worth the experience

Good Techniques. After lots of walking around the Wat Pho, stop by for a foot massage that will instantly relief your feet from tiredness. The price is also reasonable with 240 bath for an hour of foot massage that also gives you a 10 minutes shoulder and head massage right and you are good to go.

Simply Magnificent and Inexpensive. Of course one doesn't enjoy the total Thai experience without a Thai Massage, very convenient as the place stays open quite late and the price is phenomenal; it actually costs more to get a manicure than a massage

Luuuuush. Went this morning with my significant other. Chose the 1 hour aromatherapy oil massage. B730(We had done a Thai massage at another place and wanted to be treated gently this time.) we chose our oil scent and were taken to a private room with two massage tables and a shower. After showering, we dried off and lay on the massage table, covered with towels and the two masseuses came in , one male and one female. We got a full body massage in a lightly air conditioned room, of which was turned off after my partner said it was a little chilly. They only spoke to confirm pressure strength or anything feeling painful. Very attentive and very relaxing massage. We were Botha causally a bit rough and cranky after a long journey and upset stomachs. This put the smile back on our faces.

Temple Visit. Nice Place to Visit,Friendly people I have been 3 times Before,and also attended Wat Pho as a Student and graduated from the School But I feel it is becoming too commercial like most places in Thailand unfortunately after the$But still is a great and Peaceful place so Please still go for a Visit

Wat Pho Massage School Must Do. Comparatively, the massage at the Wat Pho temple is of highest standards. We had 60 minute massage and could have well enjoyed the 90 minute. 30 minutes is too short, so plan your time accordingly. Despite the affluence of visitors at the temple, my friend and I could book ourselves a massage without wait.

Thai Traditional Massage at Reasonable Price. This is one of the famous Thai temples that you should not miss. They are actually a school for authentic Thai massage. You can go there and enroll in a class and get a certificate...or simply go there to try the Thai massage...the prices are reasonable.

Bangkok's best central park!. So I lived in Bangkok for 4.5 years, and was located just 500 meters from Lumpini Park. It was my place for exercise, especially when the temperature used to get a little cooler. You'll want to check if there are any events happening at the park. For instance, a lot can happen over Thailand's public holidays, and the park can take on a real festival atmosphere. The park also includes a number of standard events like Music in the Park that are worth looking out for. There's nothing nicer than spending an evening in lawn chairs listening to classical music, jazz or Thai music around the park venue. Generally speaking, Lumpini is a park like Central Park in New York. It is fully crafted and maintained. All the water features include fountains to oxygenate the water for the fish, birds and animals that inhabit the park. Keep a look out for the many large monitor lizards as well as birds, which flock to Lumpini Park as one of Bangkok's few locations that has a concentration of trees. Lumpini is also famous as a location for outdoor activities. There are free-to-enter exercise groups around the park, mostly after 5pm. Bangkok's fitness folk are always there jogging the track or taking advantage of the outdoor gym equipment. And of course at times of tension, Lumpini has also played host to protest groups on various sides of Thailand's political divides. In those cases, you may wish to steer clear. Suffice it to say though that there hasn't been any large-scale political demonstrations in Lumpini for a few years now.

Professional Thai Massage - no happy endings. This is not like so many other massage places, adverting massage but selling other, less noble services. These masseurs are not pretty showgirls but professional practitioners who know what they're doing.This is the real deal, traditional Thai Massage. Firm hands which tenderize those tired muscles, ideal for the jet lagged weary traveler. 1 hr for around $5 US just turn up and they will kit you out with some massage kit and go to work. Literally just 3 minutes from Prom Pong BTS station in the heart of Bangkok. Do yourself a favor and experience the a traditional massage, safe in the knowledge you are in good hands. No hidden costs, family friendly

awesome the Real Thai Traditional massage. You cant missed it Is the real thingIts the real traditional thai massageIt can be awesome the ladies are expert professional thai traditinal wat pho is the real thing
Exciting. we were very excited when we arrived here and we spent halfday to walked around and second around we don't want to leave

Slightly expensive, crowded, noisy but you get the real traditional massage!. There is always long queue for the massage, waiting time is around 30 mins to an hour. The place is crowded and noisy, but you get the real traditional massage! Spend an hour for foot massage, it was great aside the ambiance and the annoying by people keep walking beside you.

Great break. A fully clothed massage on a sea of beds can be quite relaxing and a terrific way to break up a day of sight seeing. They gave me some one size fits all pants to put on under my skirt. It was a bit odd to have so many people around in the beginning but it didn't take long to relax and enjoy the experience.

Go anywhere else... it will be better. Any massage shop around the area have people who were trained here and have been working for years in the business.
Expensive, crowded and no so professional. Just look for a nice, clean, quite place and the massage not only will be better: you will enjoy more the whole experience.

Humiliating and awful experience. Decided to stop by after visiting Wat Pho while on my honeymoon. My masseuse throughout the massage ridiculed my weight during the entire massage. He made my wife cry by his disgusting and humiliating remarks about my weight. After I took my shirt off he immediately pointed at my stomach and laughed at me. It was an awful experience and told me that I had to cut down from 98 kilos to 75 kilos. It was disgusting and a humiliating experience during a time I wanted to relax on a special occasion with my wife. This is my first ever review on any forum and this experience was so upsetting I had to make a review.

This is the life. If I could have one thing in life, it would be Thai massages everyday :) And the massages at the Wat Pho Traditional Massage school are amazingly good (I was so relaxed that I even fell asleep as my feet were getting massaged!)Great experience, highly recommend it :)

THE REAL THAI UNIVERSITY OF THE PAST, PRESENT, AND FUTURE. WAT PO has taught THAI MASSAGE to the Blind and Deaf; and still do! The also teach Thai Massage in classes to international clients and Thai nationals who can hear and speak!THAI MASSAGE has become the BEST Massage in many hotels all over the world - - - a technique that is the most qualified and professional, useful and needed.I lived in Bangkok for over a 11 years and often went to WAT PO to experience the BEST MASSAGE from the BEST STAFF and the results were always exceptional. It is located near the GRANDE PALACE and is a blessed experience to have from this historical and unique location. GO NOW and I am sure you will return again and again. And if you can, take their classes and enjoy your future.

the place to learn how to massage. This is not only a massage place but also a school that teaches you the massage trade.if you feel like learning how to massage or just for the fun of giving your partner a good massage or perhaps getting one yourself this is the place to go
Traditional Thai massage. This is a school in the Wat Arun complex area. DO NOT ask for it hard! Unless you like pain and are prepared for bruising and lumps in your muscles for a week.

Relatively cheap and good. The masseurs and masseuse are mainly students learning the art of Thai massage. The massage can be painful if they apply pressure too much, so just tell them to go easy on you. If possible, try the herbal massage - a bit more pricey, but the steamed herbs that are dabbed on your body would do you much good. Only remember that if you go for this herbal massage, don't wear white shirt or blouse, as the liquid from the herbs which was dabbed on your body will stain your apparel.

The place to get a massage in Bangkok. If you want to get a massage in Thailand but are worried about the legitimacy or cleanliness, this is the place for you. Reasonably priced at around $6 per half hour, with options up to an hour. The massage area is a large room with low tables and the bedding is changed after each visitor. If you are wearing a skirt (like me), you get to wear these really hilarious baggy pants for modesty. The masseuses are very responsive to what you like or do not like, and will provide a massage ranging from soft-hard, depending on what you request. Some are more chatty than others, but I was content to sit in silence and enjoy the air-conditioning. You receive an iced tea when the ordeal is over and will be sad to head back into the blazing sun.

Needed after touring the Grand Palace!. We enjoyed a foot reflexology (half an hour) and a traditional Thai massage (half an hour). They will adjust to your liking - I like medium pressure and they were accommodating. Better than the shops along the street and prices were good!

It's pamper time!. After a long day of walking around, our last stop for the day is the Wat Pho Traditional Massage. What to expect:-Expect to wait. You can not just go in and be served right away. They only have a few masseuse.-A little bit pricey on the services. But its worth every penny.-The place is relaxing. Though it may get a little noisy, the smell of the oils they use is in the air making it more zen.-The masseuse (at least the one who attended me and my friend) are really good and friendly. -A free drink. They usually give it after the massage. Though I only had a sip, it tasted like an infused water. (not really sure what kind of drink was it) My foot massage experience was surely worth every penny. It was totally relaxing and relieving after a tiring day. It's a thumbs up!

Meh. It's like a massage sweat shop. I didn't like the laughing and talking between the therapists as it made it hard to relax. Also, it's communal. You will lay on a bed next to two other people... and across the way are another three. So there are multiple rows of 6 people. Save the time and money and do a massage closer to your hotel.
top massage. Top massage, very friendly staff. We were doubting to do it because of the waiting line (30 minutes), but it was really worth it. Our feet felt re-born!

Wish I had time to visit again! . After a long morning exploring the temples and Grand Palace nearby, we came to Wat Pho for our first Thai massage - and we're not disappointed! We had no wait, were given pants to change into and taken to 2 beds next to one another (massages are given in a communal room). We received a very personalized experience, firm but not painful and adapted to each of us. Wish I had time to visit again! Clean, kind, great value.

Best Foot Massage. After a hot afternoon of walking around the temples and park, this was divine! I didn't have a long wait, maybe 20 minutes. They gave me a bottle of water. Masseuse was very professional and caring. It was worth the short wait and very cheap.

Relaxing and professional. This would have to be one of the best Thai massages I've had throughout my many experiences in Thailand. It was a very professional and relaxing massage. I left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated. The rooms are fresh and clean, linen is replaced after each customer, and fans and air-conditioners keep the room cool and comfortable. Definitely recommends a visit!

Good quality and attentive.. We went it around 5 when they start to take last orders.It is very comfortable and great after walking around for so long in temples.It is inexpensive and the 30 minutes treatment felt like an hour (in a good way). It is very relaxing.

Most Authentic Massage experience. Bangkok is crawling with massage parlors in every nook and corner but a friend recommended the massage from the Thai traditional massage school at Wat Pho. It is very organized here. I was given tokens for the massage and had to wait for 15 minutes at least since the school is often booked. i opted for ( 30 minute foot and 30 minute body massage since i was in a hurry ) which i enjoyed very much . Not as painful as i was lead to believe. Definitely try this activity if u do have time to spare.
Awesome and inexpensive. Awesome for whole family. Our teenagers loved it too, and cheap. 30 mins for 260 baht. Definitely a must go if you are at the temple
I wanted to get a massage... but this school was closed by the time I got here..it is located inside the temple grounds..I wanted to ask when it was open but there was not anyone at the ticket gate..

culture history and traditional massage. The Wat is spectacular and complemented by a Thai massage school where students practice their skills. For the uninitiated this can be rather painful. Women must wear respectful clothes to gain entry.

First School of Thai massage. Wat Pho, first Thai traditional school. where to learn about human body, muscle, nerve system and how to massage to make our body relax, relief pains. you can have a class or get massage service.

Fantastic Massage for Weary Travelers. My husband and I stopped by the school near closing time and treated ourselves to a traditional Thai Massage. This was the first of many during our visit to Thailand.They did the massage over a simple wrap that they provided for us and we were in a large room with lots of other people.They provide a private dressing room and then you lie on a mat where the therapist either sit next to you or on you to perform the massage. It was a great way to start off our vacation.

Take a Break and Relax. It is located in the southern part of the complex and you can only reach it once inside Wat Pho. In other words, if you, by chance, quit the temple after sightseeing, you'll have to pay another entrance fee in case you want to return just for the massage.Surely it is the perfect place to give a break to yourself. This is the school where Thai massage where taught, as its name remarks. So they take it seriously and do not hesitate to ask for soft touch.During peak times, it is advisable to book a session to avoid waiting up to 1 hour for your turn. Go straight to reception, get your number and continue sightseeing.Do not miss it!

Very professional . Very nice massagem center Inside wat pho. Its is a serious space with trained staff. The prices for half an hour are around 7usd. At the end pf the massagem they offered us a cold tea.I recomendado that you schedulle your massage before visiting one of the small temples só you dont have to wait. Waiting time for us was about 10 min.
Nice break from the heat. Delightful 30 minute foot massage from someone in training. Gave us time to cool off and be refreshed. Worth it. Oh, and it was less than $20 for two people.

you get what you pay for. very cheap, communal massage. They lay you in one of probably 50 beds right next to each other, without changing the linens between customers. I do have to say that their AC was on point!

An experience to remember : a relaxing moment. If you want to experience a real Thai massage this a great experience .Do not expect too much but good to compare.It is a training but professional place. I did enjoy

Good massage . Get your massage during your visit to Wat Pho or you will have to pay the 100 bht entrance fee again (we made this mistake). The massage school is where all Thai masseuses study. It was a very cool experience and very different from a western massage (you remain clothes and are in a large room with close to 50 beds). Like everywhere is Thailand it is very inexpensive but we felt like there was great quality.

Hands Down Best Thai Massage. My husband, 4 year old, and I had a short lay-over in Bangkok en route to Cambodia and our only goal was to get as many massages as possible. I suggested we do something cultural while fulfilling our massage mission which could be done with a visit to Wat Pho. I remember coming here a decade ago and thinking it was well worth the lack of privacy and paying a bit more because of its ultra touristy location. This time was no different. We were one of the first to arrive and we kept our son busy with his iPad while my husband got a foot massage and I got a body one. My only regret was not going for a 1 or 1+ hour massage as this was hands down the best massage we got this visit.

A must-visit!. Find this place near temple Wat Pho and treat yourself to the cheapest massage in the world as students get their hours up. There is nothing like Thai massage. It's the most wonderful form of massage ever.

Great experience. Been to a few of the best spas in Bangkok and they can't beat this place for technique. Don't expect a spa environment as its a communal area. But it's better than expected. Beds are clean as they change the sheets for every customer. Only thing that i dislike is that they is no way to wash your feet before the massage. And they start massaging from the feet up to your head and face so imagine the dirt down there gets to your head and face.

Good staff. I did my first massage there and i liked so much that experience, Thai massage is great even if it was very different of what i expected but still one of great experiences ever that i will remember for long time

Avoid Wat Pho School. If you are lucky you have good massage but in my case it was terrible.We been in the school of Wat Pho around 1 pm. and we had massage. For me was ok but for my husband was terrible. We use to have massage and we know how does it works. Unfortunately the people who made massage to us they did not eat rice at time and to my husband he made very painfull massage and touching the bones of the legs. I so sorry to say this but if we go there is because is little professional.

Not a bad idea after a long day walk. It's located at the end of the Wat Pho which u could easily missed, it's a good idea to have some massage after a long day tiring walk under the hot sun, however the charges is comparatively more expensive than outside.
Quiet and relaxing. Best place to go for thai massage after long walk in the city and in the stunning Wat Pho. I got a delicious green tea after the massage, I had a really great time in there.
It was unexpected wonderful.... After some hours walking to the Wat Pho we decided to have a great Thai message in the school!Lot people but so professional work!Good experience and very cheap!!!!!
First time. Think they were gentle with me as it wasn't as sore as I imagined. Really good introduction to thai massage and great to spend 1/2 hour out the heat.

A definite Stop while seeing Wat Pho. If nothing else you will spend 30 minutes or more in air conditioned comfort!Kidding aside, it is an experience that shouldn't be missed while visiting Wat Pho. I found the receptionists to be a little gruff, but all other staff were wonderful. I opted for a 1 hour Thai massage, no oil, soft pressure. I have read some adverse reviews here about the professionalism or experience of the masseur/masseuse, but I found my masseuse to be very good. And, you have to remember that these are students and you are getting a very good massage for at least 50% off the price on the street. There is also no privacy, but you are getting a massage with your clothes on so that is not a problem. So, with expectations set not to high, head into this with the idea that you are helping a student, saving money, and you're getting a good massage in an awesome environment and are experiencing something that most of your friends will never experience. I loved it. Besides, as I say, after touring the wonderful temples and buildings of Wat Pho the break from the heat is much appreciated. Make sure to put a visit to this school on your list.

Thai Massage (with clothes on),. Whilst visiting Wat Pho, take advantage of an original Thai Massage, where it all started. It can take a while to get in, so go there first and put your name in. You can spend some time looking around while waiting your turn.You can get a Back/Body massage and/or Foot/Leg massage, both of which are very good.

Inexpensive and amazing massage. My mother and I received foot massages at this school after a long day of exploring the temples. The massage was an hour and I think it was only $10! It was very relaxing and all the foot pain from the days adventures was gone by the time they were done. They don't just focus on your feet but the entire leg up to the knee. Very relaxing experience!
Perfect Break durning a day of Sightseeing. Stop in for a massage from the source! Really enjoyed my 30 minute massage as a break in the middle of a packed day of sightseeing.

Traditional Massage School with high standards.. If you are in reasonable health, and perhaps without any orthopedic surgeries, this type of massage can be very effective in loosening tight muscles and improving your flexibility. It is like assisted yoga, and with a few 1 1/2 to 2 hour sessions, you will likely improve your mobility. It is a long tradition in the country, but may be too much for some. Best timing is mornings on weekdays.

Average Traditional Massage. The massage is Wat Pho Thai Traditional massage. It is OK, but you may be able to get better 'folk' massage in Bangkok for a cheaper price, or a more pampered massage at a higher price.

So relaaaaaaxing!. My husband and I visited here due to the recommendation in one of the Bangkok travel guides on trip advisor and written by Kirsty. Its relatively easy to find. We got the river ferry to pier 8 then walked about 20 mins. The staff are all very gentle and not pushy like most you find in the Khao San area. We both opted for the 30 min Thai massage and were taken into a quiet side room for the massage. It was 30 mins of pure relaxation and we left feeling refreshed and invigorated. If I lived in Bangkok I would be visiting this gem of a place every week!

Excellent massage. Very impressed with the massage one rarely gets as good anywhere I initially had a half hour foot but immediately I could tell this was going to be good so I had a one hour foot and then a one and a half hour oil body massage. Very glad I did clean, private, professional and very reasonable.

great massage. wat po is famous and the best place to get a real thai massage. but it is not a soft massage. experts are working there and it is not seldom that you hear someone scream. but you will feel better after 2 days ;o)
Best massage. Had the best massage here. People are pretty good at it. Not a very tourist attractive place but a good place.

Excellent massage for super cheap. This is NOT the massage school inside the tourist area. It is on a side street a couple blocks up the road. Make sure you get the right address before you put it in your map app.Service was fast and the massage was good. I opted for the the Thai massage with herbal compress. You get a decent thai massage and for the last couple minutes they use a bag (which you can buy from the front desk if you want) that is moist and warm and rub it all over. Lots of lemon grass in it so you end up with a resin that dries on your skin, so make sure you have water to rinse off, but you'll smell great.I would stop by during your temple visits to get a relaxing time from the heat and crowds. Great value for the price.

Great thai massage, but my masseuse chatted too much. Very conveniently located in Wat Pho. It's easy to get an appointment. Prices are a bit more expensive than in other seedier places around Bangkok or in Chiang Mai, but these guys know what they're doing! The only problem I had was that my guy kept chatting with other masseuse while performing my massage. It wasn't as soothing as I'd like.

Noisy. I got a foot massage 1 hour, massage skills was very good, but masseurs talking to each other too much, I was not really relaxing. And especially the reception area too noisy located right next to the foot massage room. There are too many people laughing out loud in need of a relaxing atmosphere place.

Relaxing massage noisy atmosphere. Getting the traditional thai massage at Wat Po was a very interesting experience. First of all, it took us forever to reach the place because no one could give us the exact location. Then, the massage room itself was quite strange with a lot of people getting a massage at the same time and everyone speaking to everyone else, something one gets used to in Thailand. They give you a robe to change into and there is only one tiny 'changing room' made of curtains. The massage itself was very good and very different from the oily ayurvedic massages that I was used to at home. But the masseuse was very talkative like everyone else in the room which took away from the relaxing experience. I'd still highly recommend this place for the sheer experience!

Thai Massage is Meditational Yoga Relaxing Massage ..People have ... Original Thai Massage lessons can be seen on woods of Wat Phao.U should have a good guide to show .In front of Budhha with pose.It has rare bakul trees giving realaxing smell .This is Traditional school and if any one wishes can have real Massage with points stimulating

Good massage. I was unsure about getting a massage in Bangkok. Anytime I asked I would get laughs and jokes. I just wanted a really good massage...and this place delivered. I just walked in told them what I wanted and they gave me the massage...I would have paid more to stay longer but I was running late as is. This place may be one of the cheapest and best massages in town and recommend anyone to go.

Best massage. One of the best message place in all over Thailand. The massage place is pretty crowded and there is token system for waiting.But its worth the wait. The temple is also beautiful.with amazing structures

This is the place to learn Thai massage. This is the place to learn Thai massage,my brother and I went there to see the temple and he started to learn massage,he took the full course,I did not,he loved it and was suprised,how much there is to learn.It is not an easy course and you can fail if you do not study.But this has to be the only place to learn Thai massage the correct way.If you want to really learn Thai massage this is the place,if you want to do the full course you should book in advance
the original - the school !. When visiting the Wat Pho temples, do stop for an hour massage at this school and it will show you what thai massage is really about. then you get addicted !

One of the best massage. Came here after more than 2 hours walking under the sun around Grand Palace and Wat Pho, and it's truly amazing place for rest. A woman looks like my grandmother serves me with her best massage. No hurts. No pain. Very pleasurable. One hour was like just few minutes.But you have to patiently waiting for your turn, because they have many fans waiting.
Best Massage in Thailand. Really you can't beat the massage here and I've had many in Thailand. It may sound pretty expensive but it's worth coming out like a new person

Great Experience but... Before the trip, we had heard about the massage in the temple, professionals, the best massage so we reaised our expectations to the sky. Dont get me wrong everything is great.. but.. We arrived in the temple, we booked our appointment, and got back in an hour for the massage. The whole process was great, as expected, professional, great enviroment, clean, relaxing, and they even offered us a cold tea at the end. The only reason i am not rating more, is because i was expecting to me eamazed and i was not! Despite that and great experience, and a bonus story, to tell back home, "massaged at what pho, the best school, in teh temple.. etc.. :P
Best massages in Thailand. it is a must to have a massage here. The queues can be long as the prices are very cheep but you can book a time slot of sit in the air-conned reception

BEST massage in the 2 weeks i spent in thailand. Don't waste your money elsewhere in Bangkok.. Worth coming. Great service. no regrets. going back tomorrow for one last time before flying back to california.
Traditional. Traditional, no frills, but a credit to their art, will invigorate you, leaving you feeling relaxed.

AHHHH.... Enjoyed 2 massages here during our trip. The facility was clean, loose clothing was provided and the massage was perfect. Lots of stretching and deep tissue work. This was new experience for me and wishing for more.
Disappointing . It's too commercial and feel like you're having massage in a market place. For 400THB an hour, you can get a massage in a more peaceful place. Quality is disappointing too.

The ONLY place for a proper Thai massage!. I have been visiting the Wat Pho Massage School for many years, in fact I have never been to Thailand and not visited - at least once! The massages the teachers are simply superb. Proper Thai massages are deep tissue designed to break up knots in muscle tissue, as a result and if done properly they do hurt a bit. Afterwards you feel amazing, re-energized, more flexible and spiritually uplifted. Love this place!

AUTHENTIC. This massage centre is located within the wat pho temple and can be missed if one does not kep an eye out for it. Located behind the temple close to the exit they offer authentic thai massage . leg massage etc at quite economical rates. All the massages are done under the supervision of experts hence no question of injuries etc. There may be a waiting period but when we went it was relatively free so we got it straightaway. We did have massages in other places in bangkok but would say this was authentic.
EVERY BANGLADESHI SHOULD TRY THIS ... 1. All the people here are the masters2. Authentic by the professionals3. Reliable for foreigners4. Cost effective for bangladeshi people

Family Visit to Wat Pho. Really enjoyed this Wat. It was much less crowded than I expected, but it made for easy exploration of the the grounds. I would recommend visiting the Wat to anyone visiting Bangkok.

Thoroughly invigorating massage. After walking around the many sights and Grand Palace in Bangkok, feet and legs aching, having one of their massages, completely revitalised me, and took away all my aches and pains. I would highly recommend this type of massage, and intend to find someone in the uk to continue with this type of therapy.

Good Massage Center Inside Watpho Temple Complex. By the time we reached the Wat pho massage center we were very tired after visiting Grand Palace and Wat pho temple in the scorching bangkok heat so we wanted to take break and also try both the massages offered here so we took 30 minutes each and were given tokens and had to wait for 15 minutes.Both were very relaxing and we were very happy for taking both the massages.Me and my friends massages took the exact same time and we were offered a drink which wasn't tasty at all.Will definitely go back next time and try the full 60 minutes massages.

get a good massage elsewhere. it is tempting, after a hot visit to the temple, to enter the 'massage school' of the wat pho. This is no school, these are no students. this is a big busness and it is not even well run. the masseurs and masseuses are constantly, permanently distracted by what goes on in the big massage hall. to the point that they keep inflicting wrong, distracted gestures on you, pressing on throat and neck for example. I saw no instructors, no teachers, no corrections.....

Expected more.. Given that this is a massage school we went with high expectations. Sadly we were left disappointed. We travel a great deal in Asia and so have had many massages and this left us under whelmed.Furthermore, while not expensive by Western standards it was almost double the price of another massage place we tried which was MUCH better.

Life Changing Massage Experience. My wife and I got massages at the Wat Pho School inside the Wat Pho complex. We had visited the reclining Buddha the day before and made arrangements to come back for a massage. We arrived at 10am and walked in with no line (vs the first day when we stopped in during the afternoon and the waiting area was packed). Definitely go early, 10am seemed perfect, but 11am might work too. Pricing was around US$15/hour. We each had a 1 hour foot massage and 1 hour total body massage. It was an amazing 2 hours. You are given lose knee length pants to change into when you arrive. You don’t change your shirt. The massage is conducted clothed. I was a little nervous because friends of mine had said that Thai massages were painful, but not mine. Maybe they were just being gentle since we were western, but no pain at all. They gently twisted, pulled, stretched, and massaged just perfectly. I felt like a boneless chicken when I was done (in the best way possible). Getting the massage at Wat Pho was also part of the experience. I was able to look out the window during the massage at the beautiful ornate temples which capped off this excellent Thai experience perfectly. I would highly recommend this to a friend (in fact, I might move to Thailand just to get a massage here every week).

Highly Recommended!. I read about the rave reviews about this Massage and place, so i did not miss it this time on my trip. And they where right! I had a great massage!They give a mean massage, especially on places where you hurt, usually i expect it to be painful the next day, but none. And the spine stretching was just awesome! I will definitely come back here.

Relaxing Massage. A definitely must do! Book your slot vas soon as you enter the temple complex. The use the waiting time to explore the grounds. The massage area is airconditioned. They have a queue system which seems chaotic but it still works. The staff is well trained and discreet. This was one of the best massages we had in Thailand though I wish it had been quieter. Great way to unwind and ease the fatigue after walking around the various temples and palaces in Bangkok.

Wat Pho the massage university. Wap Pho or by its full name Wat phra Chetuphon, is the shrine of the reclining Buddha. Inside the main hall is the statue of giant Buddha in an almost full rest position. The statue is 46 Meter long and 15 meter high and it shows Lord Buddha in almost the final rest position, one of 108 positions. Inside the campus of the shrine is located the highest school of the art of body massage. Its graduates are welcome in any massage parlour and are regarded as highly professional. Visitors can attend massage session conducted by the students under the supervision of the masters. Wat pho is adjacent to the Grand Palace and is open daily from 08:30 to 15:30
Is crazy!!. I think this place is over rated.The massage is not good and even cost more then those outside massage places that charge cheaper.

Heaven in Bangkok. We first had a Thai massage at Wat Pho Massage school over 20 years ago and every time we return without fail we come here. Although in recent years we have stopped going to the Temple where they have two Salas and instead go to the school HQ in a Soi leading to the river on the opposite side of the road to Wat Pho. We find waiting is less likely here and unless you want to visit the Temple paying the 100Baht entry fee is unnecessary. In all the massages I have had here I have never been disappointed.

Very relaxing.. After enjoying the Wat Pho complex visit this traditional Thai massage is almost a must ;-) Call to reserve if you don't want to wait in the line since this place is quite popular for tourists.

Authentic Thai Massage. If you are in the Sukhumvit area near Emporium and EmQuartier, the Sukhumvit branch of Wat Po is a great place to get Thai massages. They have reasonable rates and even more reasonable packages combining two to three massages.

Real Thai Massage. I was looking for a good foot and leg massage and a local friend recommended the school as the clinic in the temple had a line of people waiting. The ladies here are trained well and the massage was one of the best I have had in Thailand.

Effective. Great foot massage after long hours of temple tour.
The discomfort feeling on my ankle which i had at least for a year is gone after the foot massage, my only regret is not go for the thai massage.

massage from the masters. a must in wat poh where started the traditional maasage from the best school at the moment ,
be patient to get your turn try to avoid sunday

Love it!. Located in a side street close to Wat Gho , we found this massage school. We went early in the morning and there was no wait. After changing into massage clothes and given a basket for belongings, we entered the room. Several massages taking place in the same room. My husband and I were assigned students and off we went for an hour of bliss. We really enjoyed our experience and recommend it highly.

great first thai massage experience. I was bit nervous about having a massage because of my knee problems.... I though if they do something wrong it was get even worse but after the massage I understood the situation was absolutely the opposite... after flying over 10 hours my knee was in a terrible shape and I did not even have to tell this. I am very satisfied with their services. the price is beyond reasonable.the place even makes is more special.I recommend having a massage after seeing the whole temple.

New knowledge. The WatPo Massage School is a good place to have a kick-start at what massage is!Problems are that they do not accept massage-certificates from other schools... so, if you want to do an advance course, you'll have to start first with the basic course and then go up to what you really want to do.Prices are a bit steep.The teachers do not speak much english, so do not go there hoping to be able to question and gather very deep knowledge of anatomy and other arcane informations!
Good massage in a fantastic place. Very good and professional massage, very welcome after a few days of visiting Bangkok. The location makes it extra special.

high quality massage in holy atmosphere. i went to wat pho traditional massage school the first time. i come to thailand than more than 25 years. so i had in the past realy a lot of massages, because when i am in thailand i go every two days.at first i was happy about treatment parts i already knew from other massages in the past and i was estonished about all the other treatment parts i didn´t know.there are so many mixed up massage-styles practizied in thailand and every style has some parts of the wat pho method. but without question the wat pho method is the most effective. also the grade of power is more intensive as in other massage establissements. the people who do the massage know exactly what they do and the result is feelable. after more than one hour i was completely relaxed on the one hand...and the pain in my right sgoulder was gone on the other hand.i can recomment wat pho massage school very much. when i am back in bangkok next year i will go there again...daily!
Thai Massage. It is very beautiful old temple with the big sleeping Bhuddha cover with gold and in this temple has the best school for massage

Will definitely go back. We only had a chance to do half hour thai massage because of the lack of time. Be careful on the fixers outside the temple. Some bystander told us that the Thai massage school was closed during lunch time and then they will offer some tour that will last for 1 hour or two. When we checked the Thai masssage school, it was open during lunch time.

Experience the real thing. A visit to Wa tPho is not complete until you try the traditional massage.You can change into something comfortable before you start. This is not a private experience but you find yourself in a room with plenty of other people. It does not take long before you forget about the others because the stretching and pressure is quite intense.There is usually a long waiting list so it is best to walk to the massage school first and book before strolling around the temple complex.

The profesional massage. I did 1h full body Thai massage and it was excellent. The man was really professional. They give you clothes to wear and they stays 1 full hour with you. He found the places where I needed the most and focus on those. I got a little bit hurt in some places but just because I had a few contracture he fixed. I waited for an hour, at 16:00. But when I came out all relax the temple had empty and we had the whole temple pretty much for ourselves and managed to see a beautiful sunset there. Price: 100b entrance to temple + 420 1h full body. Worth the price, now I know what to expect when I get a massage. They also have courses available.

Disgrace. I've previously raved about this place and did have an awesome foot massage back in January at the start of our trip, however today I had also worst reflexology experience of my life, some sadistic individual has bruised the tendons on my right ankle and thought it funny!! Luckily he's in Thailand as where I come from his behaviour would warrant a thick ear. They need to sort the wheat from the chaff as most of the masseuse are very good.

Temple of the Ordinary and the school of the Yogi for Thai Massage. Next to the Grand Palace for the King, this Temple is for the Ordinary - so they are not Gold but Cement and Concrete but still have their own Charm. Thai Massage School is originated here and still teaching the old way.

First Thai Massage. We enjoyed a 1/2 hour Thai massage on our visit to Wat Pho. We arrived around midday and expected to have to wait a long time, but because we choose the 1/2 hour massage the waiting period was only 15 minutes. I found the massage, although a full body, helped my neck and back and I left feeling that I had benefited from it.
The best massage we got. In a city with many massage parlors - we like this one the best. It was clean and we had an excellent massage by the students. It was 260 bat for a 30 minute massage.

A Real Massage!. I can't tell you how many times I've gotten a massage there, but it's the first thing I do after getting my hotel room and the last thing I do before flying out. I've read other reviews that negatively rate and comment about the massage, saying that it hurts and that it doesn't feel good. Well, if it doesn't hurt, it's not doing you any good! If it hurts too much, just tell the masseuse to take it just a little easier. If you want a touchy freely massage, get one at your hotel or spa. Next time I'm gonna go to the massage school and save several bucks.

Best massage ever!. If you like pain and than this is the best massage place you would ever visit. Yes you would suffer some pain, but after what ever issues you had are all gone. I think a visit there would be a great idea when you are in Bangkok. They are very experienced and kind. This is also a school for massage where many Thai and foreign people go there to take the course so that they could open their own massage parlors in their countries. Worth every penny spent.
Wow.. The best foot massage in Bangkok. Worth the walk. Have not tried the Traditional massage, but we certainly had "happy feet".

Dont miss this wonderful break from sightseeing!. Once in a lifetime experience, when else could you get a massage on the grounds of an ancient temple? Its easy to find, follow the signs, it was sort of in the corner of the temple grounds. Very reasonable prices and good massages. Make sure to tip your masseuse and you might get a free mulberry tea!

Great relief from the heat and walking. This massage school in Wat Pho is a god-send. After an early start, the heat was catching up to me. The massage here is for 30 minutes done by students. One of the best massages I got in Thailand !!

Good experience. One of the clean massages in Thailand, the therapists are all very professional. Enjoyed the session but have had better massages else where. However still a good experience to pay homage to the origins of Thai Massage.

Affordable and Effective. Based on a recommendation from a friend we tried this place. It was super-affordable. I think I paid about $25 for all three of us for a 30 minute session. Clothes stay on and you are in a dormitory type room with a few dozen beds however, the massage was excellent. Great mid-day stress reliever. Can't say enough about this place. Imagine $25 for 3 people? Great deal and no tipping required. Very nice people.

They can fix you!. Had a mere 30 minutes Thai massage by some very talented students. Husband went in with a frozen shoulder. 3 people consulted on his condition and he left well on the road to recovery. This is theraputic massage, rather than just relaxing. You can't beat the price of the experience. Let them work on you for an hour, if you have time.Don't forget to leave a tip. That's all the students will receive for their work.

Serene setting. Because Wat Pho is the home of traditional Thai massage, I was eager to include one in my temple visit. After locating the school on the far perimeter, I asked for the one hour traditional Thai massage, I think 440 baht.  After a very brief wait, I was led to the next building and changed into the traditional fisherman pants.  Thai massage involves pressure points, so this was new to me. The practitioner was quite proficient and I felt rejuvenated in the midst of an otherwise hot and hectic day. Well worth it, and a memorable experience.

Thai Traditional coupled with a bit of traditional medical massage. Most of the certified masseurs get their certification from Wat Pho, but if you really have an injury (sprained ankle, toe, etc) you should head to Wat Pho and get the monks there to massage you, it's painful but after that, you can walk normally again.
Best Thai Massage. In this place, I get best Thai and foot massage, with very cheep price, the masseur is very professional

Nice massage after a long walk. The Massage School is located inside the Wat Pho (Temple of Reclining Buddha) territory. They have 30 min or 1 hr massage, foot or Thai full body. You can come earlier, get a number and if there is a line (which is a frequent case) they will tell you when to return.
Ease away aches and strains. Decided to try a traditional thai massage whilst visiting the temples. Lovely and relaxing although did not like the beds being so close to others having their massages.

Perfect stop for a professional massage after visiting Wat Pho. This is well worth the find. Thai massages are great, but this place is a notch above the rest. It is professional and methodical. About 400 baht per hour ($12 USD) I would highly recommend going here for a thai massage. Especially if this is your first traditional thai massage. There are massage parlors everywhere and not all of them are as professionally training or as nice as this one.

Therapeutic, Heavenly. I'm not ashamed to share that my main intention at times to travel to Bangkok, is for the massage provided by the Wat Pho Thai Traditional Massage.No gimmicks, uniformity in services provided. Therapeutic, and most importantly refreshing and spiritually feel light every time you're done with each massage session.If you're in Bangkok, and you feel the need to choose one, among the hundreds you see on the streets, go here. A must go. A must try.

A must do!. Nice break especially after a tour around the temple in a super hot day. The masseuse was great, the massage was even more amazing. had the 1 hour foot massage, my legs were rejuvenated and felt light after the session. Slightly more expensive than the massage you can find on the streets, but for sure also a better experience.
this is the real thing... you havent been thai massaged unless you havent done here.its located at the end of the temple. if you like it; do choose the one hour.

Nothing spectacular. Wish I could honestly say that I had the best massage ever and that I came out transformed .But unfortunately nothing of the sort happened.The massage school is located at the back of the temple .There is usually a wait.But the waiting area is pleasent and has the all important AIR CONDITIONING .The massage area is communal with beds laid out in dorm style,three in a row.I tried the half an hour general body massage.The massage is followed by a cup of herbal tea.The therapist most of them don't speak english .One suggestion,learn the thai word for "gently please',or you are likely to be stuck in an awkward position trying to mime pain.Any way to each his own .Massage is a personal experience...Its on the expensive side too.I had a one hour foot massage for half the price at a massage parlour outside our hotel and it was pure bliss.

Massage. We found Wat Pho temple very interesting but the massage experience as the place for massage doesnt really have a nice relaxing atmosphere (but massage was cheap and masseuse are strong, which we like).
must do when visiting WAT PHO. highly recommend taking a break from the heat with a cheap massage from students... the AC is an added perk.

A wonderful place to visit. Filled with history and beautiful architecture. This was an easy place to get to. The Thai massage was an unexpected pleasure. Very clean and friendly atmosphere. Great for the whole family.
Might as well..... good enough where you wont complain. here is your change to get a thai massage without being scared.
Great for whole family. Clean, professional, expert. You can feel entirely comfortable that this is the real deal. Our kids loved the experience with a 30 minute massage for a treat.

This is the mother of all thai massage. The massage school is world famous and where the Thai massage has its origin. The massage is very professional, as expected. You change to a pyjama" for the massage, which is made in a big room with up to 50 customers at the same time. They are now also offering oil massage. Tip: get one of the masseurs to come to your hotel. It is cheap and convenient.'
Good for the Body. They can teach you how they do the massage, but I decided to try it immediately since I was very tired of walking in the area... A must Try!

wonderful oasis. While the prices have gone up over the years, this remains a wonderful spot in the hustle and bustle of Wat Pho and the temple complex. My 5 year old daughter and I both stopped in for massages, waiting just maybe 20 minute for an open spot. It was perfect for both of us, and the no-nonsense ladies were all sweetness and smiles with my little one. The hour flew by way too fast. Absolutely recommended.

Blissful!!!!. Without doubt the best massage I have ever had in Thailand. We went early (8am) knowing that there are no bookings and it's first-come-first served. Walked straight in and was in massage heaven for the next hour. I like firm massages so this suited me perfectly.
