Thai massage is a cross between shiatsu pressure point) massage and stretching and at the end of my hour I felt like I was walking on clouds. Everything felt loose and relaxed. Highly recommended and worth the visit.

Single best/most painful massage of my life!. I am a big guy. I like a strong massage. So, when I asked for a strong massage and found myself assigned a 4'10", ~80lb old lady I was a little worried. And then she started on my body. Although she was a tiny she knew how to get leverage on my limbs and torso. My body was contorted into what must have been a pretzel. I am exaggerating, but I swear she smiled the most when tears were welling up in my eyes from the pain. After all the pain, I stood back up and my body felt better than ever before. It was as though she shaved 10 years of aging off my body. I have no idea what the name of my masseuse was. But if you are looking for the best Thai massage of your life, do go here!

The name Wat Pho is synonymous to its world renown traditional Thai Mssg school. Visited BKK many times but this time to hv a Thai Mssg at Wat Pho is my top priority. Took a Chao phraya exp boat at central pier (near saphan Thaksin stn) to Wat Pho. Without much ado head direct to the Mssg centre. Upon reaching thr saw a small crowd waiting at the entrance apparently waiting to be served. Fortunately I don't hv to wait too long for my turn. The price is more expensive as compared to downtown cntrs. The much acclaimed treatment by most reviewers at the school I find it very mediocre. I had a better mssg at Yunomori spa (in my opinion), near sukhumvit (I will gv a review separately).However it's a good experience for me .
Painfully reviving Thai massage. We stopped for a 30 minute Thai massage where the masseur presses on certain pressure points on the body. Quite painful at times, but afterwards you will feel great.

Worth Every Baht. Thai massages are unique. I compare them to yoga, because the masseuses always seem to be pulling and positioning you into typical Hatha yoga poses. Which is fine by me but if you are not a 'nimble individual', then this may be really uncomfortable for you. However, the masseuses here at the massage school at Wat Pho are next level! You will be in incredible hands and feel blissfully rejuvenated after the experience. And although there can often be a wait (30 minutes to 1 hour), it's easy to kill time in a beautiful temple.

The gold standard of Thai massage. If you are coming here on holiday get your first massage at the massage school. Don't expect to relax and nod off though Thai massage is about skilled manipulation. After getting a massage here you then have a gold standard to hold up any further massages to. Highly recommended you'll feel amazing afterwards and the setting of Wat Pho only helps with that.

Therapeutic traditional Thai massage. If you need a good, strong, therapeutic traditional Thai massage, this the place to go to in Bangkok. More expensive than the numerous 300 baht places in the city, but you are guaranteed to get a well trained masseuse. I had a cough and congestion, so I went for the one hour Thai Herbal massage for 550 baht. The masseuse applied a hot herbal compress to my neck, throat, shoulders, chest, and back, and loosened out a large amount of mucous from my chest! Also good for general aches and pains, if you are not adverse to a bit of pressure on your tight muscles.

Great massage. We had already seen Wat Pho but came back to find out if this traditional massage school was worth the hype. It really was! We opted for an hour of thai massage and it was phenomenal. The massage was methodical, slow, and particular to the stress in my body. Highly recommended.There might be a queue, but even though the waiting area was full we only had to wait 30 minutes. Also, the price was a bit higher than average for Bangkok, but it was worth the money.

Must-do Massage location. Come take a break from it all by getting a massage from a student at one of thailand most famous traditional massage school.
Located inside of Wat Pho - you can take a break if the crowds overwhelm you.

1 hour Massage Not to be Missed. Thailand's oldest form of medicine is massage and it is viewed as a spiritual process closely linked with Buddhism. Historically, Thai massage was practiced at temples and one of Thailand's oldest massage universities is at the Wat Pho temple. The tradition and symbolism combined with the excellent technique made us glad we did not miss this treasure. It is located at the Wat Pho temple, so after visiting the reclining Buddha we had about a 20 minute wait after putting our names on the list for a 1 hour massage. It was a rigorous workover including stretching, pending and pressure points performed very professionally over your street clothes. It is a tranquil location, you will feel awesome afterward and it cost about $10 US! Tipping is not necessary but I felt guilty getting such a great massage for $10, so even a 25% tip did not seem like enough. A visit to Bangkok would not be complete without a massage at the Wat Pho Thai Massage School. You will be glad you took the time to experience the tradition at this location and probably want to go back again the next day!

Great traditional Thai massage. This is a great traditional Thai massage from the place where Thai massage originated. It is located within the Wat Pho complex, so you need to pay 100 Baht for entry first. I recommend you go straight to the school and register to book your slot and collect the token number. You can then see the temple while you wait your turn.There are options for 30 min and 1 Hour body and foot massages.

Great job professional staff. I've been an LMT for 25 years but not thai massage. It was a pleasure to walk into a clinic, school that is professional and clean . NUK I think is her name is absolutely great, look for her . I came back 3 times
fantastic. A visit to the Wat Pho should always include a 60 min slot to fit a massage in this center. Really top notch.

The thai massage . So my friend and I get massages often and probably had 2 a day while in bangkok. . 1 thai and 1 foot at the end of our excursions. ... this place is the standard that is measured against the 300 baht places!!This is a little more expensive than most places. .. 420 baht but worth it. .. this original school of thai massage was the best place. ... if you love firm massages. .. it is a little noisy people come in and out of a communal room. ... they give women pants to wear so they can easily manipulate your body. ....If you have a low pain threshold probably not the place for you. They use their body weight and different parts of their body to massage you. (Feet, knees, elbows, thumbs, etc)Women I would not wear a low cut tank chances are there are others laying next to you. .. Go early. . They open at 830 a and there will be a line later in the day since it's in the wat pho (reclining budda) temples. I believe is closed at 630pm
best and cheap. traditional thai message ..healings for cheap and best rate .its better and real thai healing massage.

Sorting out our aches. My husband and I had 30 min body massages as part of exploring Wat Pho. It was a long wait but worth it. Clean beds, very capable masseuses who managed to find all the sore bits, and relaxing location in the temple grounds.There were plenty of seats outside to wait, but limited seating inside in the air conditioning. It may be easier to go to the massage place forts to get your number, then visit some of the temples rather than sitting and waiting.

Very Good. Actually, I have never taken the classes here, but I have several friends who have and they all say it was a great learning experiance. The school is located within the grounds of the very famous Wat Pho (Temple of the Reclining Buddha) which is a "must see" for any Bangkok visit.
So Beautiful. It's so beautiful and I think that people should come and see it. Seeing is believing :) The you can go to see overview by board near here.

Well worth a visit. I really enjoyed my visit for a massage. Place came highly recommended from a passenger on flight to Bangkok. Definitely well worth a visit. Heaps of options to choose.
Tip : pays to ring and book, suggest ask for options and times

A great massage in calm surroundings.. A traditional massage done by qualified masseuses in the calmness of the temple. Very reasonable priced,expect a wait,take water and hat or sun brolly and some reading material. A 'must do 'whilst in Bangkok.
Best Place. The best place to have the Thai traditional massage. Excellent you shouldn't miss this place. located in Wat Po

Don't miss it! . On our last day we decided to de stress before a long flight back home so we had a 30min foot massage and a 30min Thai massage. At first glance it didn't seem like the idol place but once they start the massage the magic begins. It's best to go early in the morning before the crowd, we went around 9ish and luckily got a spot right away. The Thai massage was my favorite, the foot massage wasn't very special. It is recommended to visit on the same day with the grand palace and r cloning budha as they are all in the same area. Don't miss it!

Authenticly relaxed; cant be missed. Me and me wife went for a massage on our final day of the trip. We went for 30 mins foot massage and 30 mins thai massage. The foot massage was convenient and very good. Thai massage was really above all expectations; the masseuse almost massaged every muscle and pressured on pressure points like never before. Although its not a fancy place like the ones you find in 5 stars hotel yet massaging over there is far better by all means. We didn't know that it is placed inside wat pho temple "reclining buddha", yet if i am planning my day, i would go early start with massage, then visit reclining buddha, then head to the grand palace and emerald buddha. Just know that wat pho opens at 8 and closes at 6; wat pho temple closes at 6 and grand palace closes at 3.30. The later you go, the more crowded it is. Overall its a must go destination.

The Best Ever. We had heard about this place as one of the best schools in the world. We were not disappointed. Many floor mattresses next to each other but very clean and sanitary. Best of all, we both thought our massages were fantastic. We highly recommended.

Best Thai Massage. We had several massages but this was by far the best. If visiting the Royal Palace and Wat Pho definitely allow time to drop in for a massage. No appointment needed but if busy you may have to wait 30 mins or an hour or so.

Good for a massage.. Wat Pho has the well-known name for the massage skills. If you pass by Tha Tien pier, why not take a break here? Cheap and good service. Around 6-8$ per hour of Thai massage, up to promotion period.

Worth the wait, massage was excellent!. There was at least an hour wait by 3pm, but my foot massage was one of the best I had in Bangkok. The pressure was just right and although there were a lot of other people getting massages, it was still relaxing and not too hectic. I wish I had the time to stay for the full hour!

not as good as we expected. Wat Po massage school has a worldwide reputation for excellence but we were shocked to find that this reputation was sadly unjustified when we visited. As other reviewers have said, it is a like a factory conveyor belt for tourists' massages.In particular my companion, who needs regular massage and therefore has considerable experience of (both good and bad) massage, was disappointed. Her masseuse seemed to be simply going through the motions or clocking up the necessary hours to get her certificate. She left a bruise on my companion's leg which took some days to heal. For some considerable time I also saw her sending texts from her mobile phone! You can see how much interest she was taking in giving a good massage.No, there are better places in Bangkok for a good Thai massage.

GET MASSAGED!! Is the best place with no doubt! By professionals and apprenctices.. Great place to get massaged. Cleand and performed by skillfull masters of the real Thai massage as it was done by the ancesters.

Excellent option to end your day. After your long day of visiting the old city of Bangkok, go to this place last to receive a massage. They have options of whole body massage and foot massage and hot compress massage. I'd recommended a hot compress massage first then follow by body massage. Great relaxation!
Great. Amazing, great little shop to buy some oils and things if you like therapies, students are lovely, u get a ticket and when shouted you co an have a treatment.

Def worth spending 30 minutes . You will be astonished at the way the large number of customers are quickly turned around . In busy times, it might take around 15-20 minutes to get a booking , so better to have it booked while you are touring rather than wait till your complete tour is over . The massage is def good and you are assured of the quality

New Experience. We were always so curious about Thai Massage. When you enter the massage area, expect to see plenty of beds where people got the massage.The massage itself might look very aggressive, but it actually felt really refreshing. When my therapist takes me to my bed, I can see other people being flipped and stretched, which makes me cringe a little.For those who didnt know, Thai massage doesnt use any oil. It focuses more into body stretching.

The best massage. When you visit Wat Po, first make a reservation. They will attent to you in about 1 hour or 1 hour and a half. While you wait, visit the temples. After that you will have the best massage in the world,
Best in Thailand. While it is very busy and confusing when you arrive you get taken quickly. The massage is excellent and well priced.

Wat Pho Thai Traditional Massage School. Famous school for Thai massage and Thai style yoga (Ruesi Dat Ton). I earned my certificates here and found the teaching to be thorough, with teachers who also make the learning fun. rices are affordable with shorter classes leading to certificates as well.

An oasis of peace and rest directly at the temple. You will share an enormous bed (believe me) and have, though, an expertise massage for rather nothing. You'll probably have to que, but it is worth every minute. The best? Foot massage!

A good massage but. I thought it would be better as it is supposed to be the best and authentic. But it felt like a factory, processing tourists. You have to pay 100 bah (about £2) to get into the temple - which is well worth it and you also get a bottle of cold water included. A foot or Thai body massage (no oil) is 420 baht - so alms double what you would pay elsewhere (I paid as little as 200 baht an hour). It was a beautifully cool way to relax after hours of walking and I felt better for it afterwards.
Alireza. The best massage ever at got in all over Thailand! It is the massage therapy, not only a simple massage. They can find your muscles problems and fix them!

Get a massage from the people training to be the best. The Wat Pho school is located at the far end of the temple complex from the reclining Buddha and is definitely worth stopping by. It's a very different experience from many of the massages you may experience in Thailand. For starters, it's a little more expensive, but these people are learning to be the best. That said, the atmosphere is a little more functional, or school-like, than necessarily relaxing. Also, these massages are stronger than the other massages you're likely to have. They're more forceful than the average and the foot massage I had left me feeling sore more than rejuvenated. That said, still a worthwhile experience if you're looking to experience as much of Thailand as a tourist as possible.

Relaxing. I made the thai massage 30minutes. I was sorry not to have asked for a hour. The massage was very good and relaxing, especially after a long day walking under intense sun.There were many people waiting for their turn but the wait time was short.However, I think there should be more privacy, there are a lot of people get massages at the same time in the same place ...

Not for thin skinned. My husband doesn't like rough massages, so he didn't enjoy it as much as I did, but I thought it was wonderful. We went to the location that was inside Wat Pho, but they had a 45 minute wait. They told us we could walk 5 minutes down the street to a place with no wait. One of their ladies led us there and it was wonderful. You're in an open room with other people (clothed), so if that makes you uncomfortable think twice about this one.

Be a student, not a client !. We had some time to kill in BKK so signed up for the 5 day foot massage training course. Not a tourist gig but a serious training course with an exam and certification at the end. Our tutor, Krumtip, was a tough cookie who warmed to us as the week went on. Morning and afternoon sessions with an hour for lunch in the market area surrounding the school. My feet were sore as the students practiced on each other and one foot massage a day is enough for me! Great camaraderie amongst the students of all ages from Italy, Sweden, India, Germany, Thailand and the UK. After we did he course we used our new skill when working in ski chalets in the Alps to earn extra money from the guests. Great fun and not expensive - try it !

True Traditional Thai Massage. We headed here on our first day in Bangkok. It is actually sited in Wat Pho grounds to which you pay 100 Baht to enter. I can highly recommend - it is firm and you are pulled this way and that but you feel great afterwards. The cost is about £10 for an hours massage exceptional value. You are clothed throughout.

Professionals!. This place trains massage therapists and they are more professional than the massage we tried elsewhere. No big chatting or short of time. I told my masseuse about my neck aches and she adapted to focus much on my back. It's inside the Wat Pho temple (100 B entrance fee). It's 260B for 30-min thai massage and 420 B for 1 hour. After you pay the bill, they will lead you to a different lobby and ask you to change pants to theirs. After the massage you will also be given an herb drink. We came out like octopuses hehe

Good massage! Cheap. Has to relocate. . We had seen great reviews for this massage school so had very high expectations! We finally arrived at Wat pho and had to pay the 100 baht to get in. When we arrived at the school they didn't have room so took us to a different location. This was about a 5-10 min walk and out of Wat pho! This was fine but it meant we paid unnecessary fee. My mum loved the massage however my masseuse was quite unfriendly and surly. She was also quite rough. It was good but I have had better. That being said, mum loved hers so it may be dependent on who you get. They also talked all the way through which impaired relaxation.It cost 420 baht each for one hour massage. We have had cheaper at 300 or 350 for just as good and more professional. However, it is worth checking out!

Skillful Masseuse!! . I decided to give this place a try because many people raved about it and I wasn't disappointed at all! If a poor masseur were to tell me that he graduated from this institution I will call him a LIAR because the masseuse who attended to me is skillful and attentive.If you expect total privacy then there's none but who cares? It's not like you are required to strip naked. Massage can be painful but it definitely won't kill you. I came out feeling refreshed and comfortable than ever!
air conditioned comfort. lovely way to get a break from the heat and the walking. it was our first massage of the trip. We loved it!

First Massage Ever - Set the Bar High. My husband and I did our massages at the Wat Pho Traditional Massage School at 9:30 am. There was no line and it wasn't busy yet. We each had a 60 minute full body massage. It was my first massage ever and I was worried about it being painful, but I told my masseuse "first time" and had no pain at all. It was very relaxing and rejuvenating. My husband had a different but equally positive experience. He has big muscles so I think his masseuse thought he was tough and pushed really hard with his whole body weight. He says it still was a great massage and he felt great afterward, but it wasn't relaxing. Do this massage. It's inexpensive and authentic.

Wonderful Thai massage ever!. They're always crowded! Because they have cheap and awesome service! Our first massage is it, and i think it's the most unforgetable one.You can give them some tip for their service. This is the most you can't miss spot!

A quick on-the-go massage!!. Was taken by surprise!! Get a quick 10 minute massage while u pray. I was standing outside and the students of the Wat Pho Massage school stand by ready to give u a quick head and shoulder massage. Had a great time.A nice and fun surprise!! Obviously...for a quick buck! but well worth it.

Superb Tradditonal Thai Massage. While in KL for work and getting totally bored during the weekend, I flew to BKK on Saturday morning, took a river taxi to the Wat Pho Traditional Massage close and lay down for 2 hours of relaxation. You can choose a teacher or pupil, the latter being cheaper, but I always go for the expert teacher. Some stretching and lots of deep tissue work left me slightly bruised but feeling totally relaxed. Every time I go to Bangkok I visit this place, highly recommended.

Excellent value for money massage. Wat Pho is the most famous Thai traditional massage school. The "students" offer great massage at very reasonable prices. The system is well organized and we actually arrived in the middle of the day and had no wait at all. The massages are in a very large room alongside many others but the atmosphere is serene, quiet and feels like you are one on one with your masseuse.

30minute wait, but worth it. For a traditional 30 minute Thai massage it cost 260baht, me and the boyfriend both waited and had one, and we both really enjoyed it- it's not exactly a relaxing massage, but it certainly feels good afterwards as they really do relieve the tension. Expect bones to be cracked as part of it :-)

Just go. Just go here if u want to soothe yourself and treat yourself to some great massage and relaxing atmosphere. cannot get enough of the place and want to go back to Bangkok only to repeat this experience again and again
They have the knowledge !. Don't hesitate to give a try to a Thai traditionnal massage at this place. They have a deep knowledge on human body and if it hurts a little it's for you to feel better !!

Thai massage originated from here, but.... You need to ask for a soft treatment, as Thai massage can be hard on you. It is like a type of yoga with a lot of stretching. Avoid if you have tendency to varicosis in legs.

Do not miss this. As a local, I can tell you that you will not find a much better massage than this anywhere in Thailand (and possibly the world).Each massage therapist is an expert in their craft. You can request specific treatment for niggling problems. Also, be sure to tell them your preferred strength! The default strength is a bit painful. I will definitely be visiting again and urge everyone to try at least once!

Fabulous Thai Massage. The spirtual birthplace of Thai massage. I have been there several times now and the massage is alway fantastic. All the staff are very well trained and do a great job. It is a bit pricey compared to many in the tourist areas, but so much better it is worth it. Better to go early to avoid the crowds though.

Must try if u visit Baangkok. Had a foot massage at Wat Pho. it was ok. not great. Actually the team there are all senior and well experienced. but its over crowded. so in many case personal attention we may not get. So satisfaction level for me was below average.
Yup! Do it!... especially after walking around for hours!. It is a bit pricey but those gals (or guys) know what they are doing! and boy does it do you good after walking around for hours upon hours!

good place to relax the body. After long walking around the Grand Palace under hot weather in Bangkok. This is a good reason to set your body free! Wat Pho traditional massage school is the best choice to check in the list. After 1 hour foot massage, recovery the energy and begin the next destination!
Original of Thai Massage. Really safe here to get the real massage. No happy ending haha! Sometime seems like very hurtful but really good for your body. If you can handle painful you'll enjoy it

Excellent safe massage. If you are visiting all the nearby tourist attraction and are really tired this is a must visit place.
Check for massage timings and there can be a queue so be prepared to wait for a while as there will be crowd waiting for their turns.
loved my massage. Stopped by for the usual massage, when visiting . Had a great 1/2 hour (should have gotten a full hour)...very nice, clean, and enjoyed it very much.
Excellence for Thai traditional Massage. Once in a life time to visit this Thai Traditional Massage and try to have a full body massage to rejuvenate yourself.

An excellent massage. A traditional Thai massage is a learned skill, the associated experiences,such as the religious,emotional are tied into Thai culture & administered by the monks. The blind community also offer excellent massage services all over Thailand. They like most Wats give value for money & help the Thai community as well. The millions of Massage shops offer mostly unskilled services at high prices.

Cleanliness and friendliness. A unique traditional Thai massage with many shades fair price and by the host, you have to have patience and wait for the board to book massage and visit the temple before

Excellent Thai massage. I only went here once. The only other place I can compare to is the Asoke branch of Healthland to which I went twice. I got worked over by an old lady with a grip of iron. I'm a muscular and tight westerner, she had no trouble at all going after my knots.

Be prepared. From the outside the building which houses this school of traditional Thai massage belies what goes on inside and the only way to fully understand and appreciate the knowledge and skill of the Masters and their apprentices, is to submit yourself to their manipulations.A million miles away from the infamous 'massage parlours' and purveyors of sex, this school teaches, practices and ensures the continuity of traditional massage is perpetual.Thirty minutes under the manipulative hands and fingers of the establishment's experts and you will be very conscious of muscles you didn't know you had.This massage is not for the faint hearted, while it is being administered your brain may well trigger an urge to say 'stop' but when it ends and you are gently helped from the horizontal to the standing position, you will feel very different indeed (for the better I might add).

Great massage. One of the few places in Bangkok where one can receive a true therapeutic traditional Thai massage. And if you want to learn how, the level of instruction is superior, practically private instruction. They hold classes 7 days a week, so if you have the time and the money they can fit you into their program easily.

Real Thai Massage. This is the most traditional and real massage I got on my trip to Thailand. I read about it in my trip book and as it is also in the same place as reclining Buddha figured it was worth the visit. A tad bit more expensive than your other massage stops in thailand, worth the money. My partner and I both did an hour long full body, and I actually got another 30 min foot massage. Highly reccommend after a long day of walking.

An absolutely amazing massage. What can I say, each time we come to Bangkok, we religiously visit Wat Pho Massage for our massages. The masseurs are highly skilled, and can detect the slightest imperfection in our body and work to resolve it - leaving you refreshed at the end of the session. It is not an upmarket spa / massage place, but then if you are seeking a good massage rather than a scenic environment, then this is the place. You are massaged in an open room (many mattresses alongside each other), but this you will forget very quickly once the massage begins. It does get quite busy from midday onwards, and hence suggest that you get there early.

Fantastic. My third visit in three trips. So affordable - if I could buy quality Thai massage and home at this price, I'd go at least once a week. Excellent massage and service, although a bit of a wait for a masseur to be free.

Excellent. Look there are hundreds of places where you can all sorts of massages in Thailand. We used a sudden downpour of rain as an excuse to duck in here, I had a half hour body massage, my wife a similar foot massage, both came away feeling well manipulated by professionals.

traditional and real thai massage.. one of the oldest medical school in Thailand, this is a real place for massage as well as for serious massage lover who want to learn the technique as well as who want to experience the legendary wat po massage .

Trustworthy place for traditional Thai massage. Trustworthy place for traditional Thai massage. Fully trained people will be doing Thai massage in a traditional way with affordable prices. Purely professional...don't expect any other kind of a massage ;)

Feel good and even better later. Plan ahead or book ahead if you can. Don't be shy it's all very demure and proper with the massage performed by very well trained staff, they fixed an old injury problem. So now my left hand works really well...all the time!

It's a School, so YMMV. "Your mileage may vary" at this place. Keep in mind this is a school. Some students are good, others like to chat up their classmates during the massage. The masseuses are learning the art, so they're inexperienced at best. Thai massage will not put you to sleep, as they dig in deep. The relaxing comes after they're finished. I've never had a bad experience here.

No Pain, No Gain. We visited after touring Wat Pho (the reclining buddha) and it was great. Got the traditional thai massage and the foot massage. At times it was a bit painful, as they were really getting deep and applying pressure but I felt so good afterwards.Had a few of the massages on our journey and this was one of the best.Cost: 30 min traditional thai massage = 260 baht (about 7 dollars)30 min food massage = 280 baht (about 8 dollars)
Excellent way to experience Thai Massage. great way to get a rest and cool down a little in the middle of the day after visiting the Grand Palace and Wat Pho

Terrible experience!. This review is for the second place of the Wat Pho Thai Traditional Massage School - 392/33-34 Maharatch rd., Prabarommaharajawang, Pranakorn, BangkokThe worst Thai massage experience ever! The therapists were so rude. They keep talking loud and laughing (probably of us) during the massage. The massage itself was not good at all. They never asked us how do we feel about the massage. I really regret I did not stopped it in the middle. Do not even get close to this place. Probably this place has a great PR, but it is not better in anything than any other thai massage. We tried "Let's Relax" on our first day and it was superb for the same price.

Excellent, enjoyable training. The courses for "Falang" foreigners were 30-hrs in 1-week, M-F 0900-1200, 1300-1600. It was great fun, with a nice mix of international massage pros and others just interested in doing something different. Interesting explanations of why the process is the way they do it. There is a test but even I passed. Thais do this class plus 165-hrs of practicum to get certified. Cost around 9,000 THB, so call to check schedule and current cost. Worth every Baht.

You can get much better service by this price elsewhere. The skill might be good, but first you should have luck. My friend's experience was fine, but my masseur somehow seemed like she didn't even wanna pay attention to her job, kept chatting with her colleague with so many gestures that the massage had been disrupted all the time. At last, she didn't even do those basic stretch. I have had many massage with much greater service and respect for price much lower than 420 baht/hr, so I guess I wouldn't visit here again for massage.
The best Thai massage. Get there early if you can! It gets busy. If you have the time, go for a double session. You'll leave like you are walking on air.

worth trying for the cost. cheap place, massage was OKAY. I think it depends on who you are with as they are all students, you might end up with one that has less technic than others.. which was my case. I would recommend to try anyway, the cost is so low..
One of the best Thai massage places. I love Thai massages and this school is good and very organised. A must when visiting, good price and very eager to please masseuses

is more a tourist attraction that a real meaning Geligeous temple. Wat Po has become over the years more like tourist attraction and although it is still used by the upper classes for funerals and cremations. It has turned over the years into a total tourist attraction, with may stalls selling everything and anything, that has nothing to do with a temple.

Not to be missed. This is the most amazing place, went first for a foot massage which was wonderful, next was full Thai a bit of a shock quite painful at times but well worth it. Girls are very well trained and professional.It is usual to trip your masseur we gave 200Bart and they seemed very pleased with that.

Good massage. There are 2 places for a massage; one is located within the temple grounds whilst the other is outside but a short walk away. Recommended for those who do a lot of walking whilst in BKK and the legs just feel relieved after a few twist and kneads. Haha Place is air-conditioned and prices are reasonable. Good "aunt' masseurs who are definitely skilled!

Get ready to be twisted that way and that..ouch. This is not a relaxing slow massage !! this is a traditional thai massage, which the aim is to strech your muscles. If taken regular it makes you more supple. However, be ready to be pulled, twisted, trodden and knelled on. I came out and could hardly bloody walk..lol....its an experiance !!!

Painful and yet relaxing. This is a must for all visitors to Bangkok. A very traditional massage fully clothed great for couples and friends, definitely worth the pain for the comfort and relaxation later

Very disappointing. We got there and we expected an amazing atmosphere and an awesome massage as requested from a place like this. Instead we got a market atmosphere because the receiptision is in the same place with the treatments,the guy that gave me the massage was buzy checking the people entering the place, especially the women and pass comments . never stopped talking with his friends . There seemed to be no kind of supervion. the sanctity of the place ,spared them.
Wat Pho massage. You can try Thai massage here, massage do very well, left your exhausted, I think the best massage place in Bangkok, you can try it.

Thai Massage - You need to try it at least once!. This is an interesting place. I have been 3 times on different trips to BKK. Traditional Thai massage is very different that massage in USA. You were a pajama similar to surgeon scrubs. There is lots of pulling and pushing and rubbing. A little too intense for me, but worth have the experience. I did also try the massage that is more like relaxing or like Swedish and liked it better than any massage I have ever had in the USA!

Amazing foot massage. After a couple hours of visiting the temples, do stop at this massage school to have a foot massage, it will feel so great!! We came out of there so light! I usually suffer a lot during foot massages but this one was really perfect! The place is crowded so it's better to go there for foot massage.You have to pay the entrance to the temple before you can reach, and prices are not cheap: 280 bahts for 30min foot massage

Great place to go after a long day of touring Bangkok. I was surprised to find a massage school so close to Wat Pho but it turned out to be one of the best massages I received in Thailand. The hours aren't great, but the massage is worth the wait.

The best massage I could ask for.. What an unbelievable experience. My Therapist Dio knew the perfect way to get my body out of pain. Upon returning, I went back for 2 hours.... and then did it again! Though there are many people seeking service, the work area was peaceful.

Great massage. This is the best place to get a traditional Thai massage, yes it's students massaging you but only advanced students, so don't worry you won't get someone on their first day. The only drawback is your getting a massage right next to someone, no privacy.

THAI MASSAGE UNIVERSITY !. This is a must vist place in Thailand if one is interested in traditional Thai massage & fitness freak. Here one comes to know the importance & the benefits of Thai massage.
World famous. Professional massage, compared to those all over the place massage parlours, thai massage style is an active experience

Get uncomfortable to get comfortable. There's a wait, it's not the most peaceful experience but they guys know how to use their hands. After my 75 minute massage I floated out of there with a warm tea in hand. Great experience if you're looking for a legit massage.
Amazing. I did not visit to attend the school, but did get a traditional Thai massage here. One of the best I have ever had!!

Healing Hands. Most affordable and little to no wait is a foot massage. Even the shortest time will revitalize you from your walking day and you will experience the authentic technique. Consider doing this at the end of your Wat Po/ Reclining Buddha visit.
Regenerating. After visiting the royal palace and the complex of Wat Pho, the first Thai massage of my life made me reborn from all points of view.

Not as good as it used to be. Since going there in 2008 we noticed this time the place was crowded and quite noisy, not the relaxing experience we'd had last time. The cost of a reflexology for half an hour was what we'd been paying elsewhere for an hour and it did not include any shoulder or head massage to finish with. We also paid the entrance fee to get into the temple to reach the massage rooms. The therapists we had were good but I'm not sure I'd bother going there again as it seems to have become another tourist attraction.

Quality at the budget. Lots of places offer massage in Bangkok, but to a degree you never know if any of those so called professionals actually would not hurt you by accident; this one at least you know they are trained professionals. A quick stop over on the discovery of the city journey; do not expect any fancy stuff, luxury or fluffiness, down to earth, down to your bones and muscles. Rejuvenated, and ready for more adventures afterwards ;-)

Best thing after a long flight. The first thing we do in Bangkok is go here for a massage. It's great after a long plane journey. It seems to get busier every time though - this time there was a 45 minute wait or if we walked 5 minutes to the school just outside of the temple, we could have massages straight away. We chose this option and had a guide take us through the back passages of the temple, which was quite interesting. Massage was great!
The real Thai massage. If you want to experience the real Thai massage than you must go to Wat Pho Thai Traditional Massage School inside the Wat Pho. But a warning - it can be very painful!

Only name, no skills. I went there for a massage but ended up having acute body pain after the massage. Before the massage I was all good but after the massage, my body was aching terribly. Dont go there for massage.
I love massage and I go for at least one massage every week. This one was the worst I have ever had.

Simply not the best. This Massage centre has a huge reputation, but in my opinion it does not deserve it.To start Thai pay 260 Bhart for1 hour Traditional Thai Massage whereas foreigners pay 420 Bhart.Told wait is 30 minutes, then after deciding to leave told we can walk to the headquarters, OK 10 minute walk, arrive and pay for Massage, shown to large room with 10 Massage tables, brought shorts to where which clearly could not fit, eventually get changed and ready for massage to start.No foot washNo warm upStraight into the Massage, not asked how strong you want.Therapists talk to each other throughout the Massage, therapist clearly distracted I watched the younge man who was massaging my wife pick his nose in the middle of the Massage!!!So I would suggest you avoid the production line Massage approach and go somewhere else cheaper

great tradiional massage.....can be relaxing!!!. Room with 20 beds or so for great massage. They are quite firm, so specify if you don't want to be massaged too hard. The masseuses may be tiny but they are strong!!! You need to enter the Grand Palace and wander around behind the Temple to find the massage school...but worth the effort.

Very Thai, not very American. This is the world famous schoo. They take VISA which is very important to travelers. It is crowded and busy. I did receive very good massage, but the therapist was distracted.

Excellent massage. The massage school gives great foot and traditional Thai massages in an air conditioned room - great way to beat the heat! I paid a little over 500 baht for 2 half hour massages so a little more expensive than other spots in Bangkok, but it was one of the better ones I've had.

Ohhh my back!. It was really great. Actually, it hurt a little bit when they bend my back. Anyway, after the massage is finished, the pain that stick to my shoulder for a long time is better, less pain.
best traditional thia massage. every street corner appears to have a massage parlour but we where advised to go to wat pho all the masseurs are fully trained

feeling great!!!!. It was a little awkward to start with but after a moment I was very glad I had waited almost an hour for this treatment and four weeks later my back and neck are still feeling fabulous
Wah Massage. you realise that massage is not just about sensuality , it has a lot of science behind it if required to be practised to perfection and healing
Massage with view. Great massage with view on the Wat Pho temple. On low season (e.g.August) you dont need to book. Just rock up and chose the massage. Enjoy!

Professional and Priced Right!. Located in the very back from the reclining Buddha exhibit is the Thai Massage school. It was a 30 minute wait around 1pm that day. Thai massage is very different from a Swedish massage. I ordered the foot massage and the body massage since it was really cheap. Thai massage is a lot of deep pressure with their thumbs, elbows and knees, for a second I thought we were wrestling on the mat. Overall, I felt like a wet noodle after I was worked over. I have really bad plantar fascia and the student was able to kneed out all the kinks in my hamstrings and calves. I can honestly say my foot pain was gone for several days. It is priced very cheap compared to receiving a massage at a resort. I definitely recommend coming here for a cheap and professional Thai massage.

authentic Thai Massage. it's inside of the Wat Pho so you have to pay for the ticket to enter no matter if you just go for a massage. Lots of people so I suggest you to go to the massage school first to take a number before you start the visit in Wat Pho. The masseurs were professional. I really felt light after getting the massage. It's nothing luxury in the place but professional and the price is inexpensive.
Original Thai Massage. The real / original Thai massage is only here.Plenty of choices are offered with very reasonable price.

Excellent & worth the wait. Had to wait for 40-50 due to it being very busy, however it was entirely worth the wait. This was the best foot massage I had in Thailand and would go back in a heartbeat. Cheap enough - I think it was about B280. Really enjoyed it
Thai massage. Great value. What they call students most would call masters of the traditional Thai style of massage.

THE EXPERIENCE IS WELL WORTH IT. The school's masseuse may not have the most experienced and the environment the most calming, but the fact of being located in Wat Pho is remarkable. The long tradition of culture and massage schooling creates a unique experience and environment of a ancestral and relative quiet communal massage experience. Well worth it.
Best massage in town. Best massage in town, you should not miss. My wife went there for some lessions and now I can enjoy at my home. Students are international, from all continents.

Nothing special .... This was my second visit after three years when I really enjoyed. This time the masseuse was talking to the nearest masseuse almost all the time and also talking on the phone, so I really could not enjoyed. It should be a traditional massage, so this kind of treatment was really inappropriate. Wat Pho the temple is a great escape from thousand of people in Grand Palace and if it's too hot it's also a great idea to go for a massage, but don't agree with such a treatment.
Samadhi!. Traditional Thai massage- after a long day of touristing stop in for a foot massage- 1 hour for about 6$- oh boy! On the grounds of the Reclining Buddha Temple- clean and comfy!
Best ever. Forget the Thai massage elsewhere! This is the real McCoy. Experienced amazing techniques never seen before in all my other spa sessions. Woke up feeling energised and alive!

How to beat the heat in BKK. I am a HUGE fan of thai massage so why not go direct to the thai traditional massage school. It feels more like a pilgrimage then a visit to a massage studio. The smell of oils permeate the air as you enter the air-conditioned room. Opt for the complete body massage, lay next to a stranger and be pummelled for an hour, the perfect way to beat the heat in BKK.
Not a relaxing message. It is an experience to live if you visit the temple and you have time enough: 30 min or 1 hour massage plus waiting time. But it is NOT a relax ing one, IT HURTS
a great place to get a massage. Pros: great massage, good, fair prices.Cons: it is a bit crowded so you may have to wait a few minutes to get a massage. However it is worth the wait.

Highly recommend . A friend took me who had thus before. Strong pressure point/ twist and pull massage. Fully dressed. Amazing bi felt sore but great. Walked many hours. Went again after 3 weeks on trip home bound. You can buy a variety of massages. Or combine them. Very lovely people.
Real Traditional. If you want to experience the traditional Thai massage you must experience it here. And they also have a short training with certificate for people interested to learn Thai massage.

Read this if you interested to come !. I've been to this place many times for the Thai full body massage. The place has very good smell with thai aroma herb perfume, they welcome you with thai herb drink.Bed is excellent with the locker you can put value things inside, nobody gonna touch it. Have Sarong to change your shorts or pants makes the staff works easier.I would not recommend to who don't like hardly massage or having some painful after working out. It will get worst, trust me ! or just tell the master that please be gentle or softly, that would be fine.However, every staffs are well-trained and they can do perfection ! I just want to warn everyone so if you have read my warning. Go and experience it.P.s.- The queue is always long as its famous. - Wat Pho Entrance fee is 100 Baht for tourist, so cheap.

Completely cured my back pain!. I've never had a thai massage until I came to this place and let me say it was quite an experience. They really use every part of their body to massage you which is an art in itself. Before my trip I had injured my back playing volleyball and this thai massage completely cured me. They do a great job with massaging every part of your body and really stretching you out. It was a little painful so for people who have a low pain tolerance I wouldn't recommend a full body massage but for those that like a harder massage I would highly recommend it!

Great Massage - Unique Massage Experience. Had a 60 minute traditional Thai massage. We waited approximately 30 minutes on a Monday afternoon. Be prepared while the supposed "school for traditional Thai" massages the environment is sort of like a mass production. Pales are arranged CLOSE together. While the overall atmosphere is quiet and subdued, there are a LOT of people receiving massages. Not at all like any quiet, private room style massage you may have encountered before.The staff do know what they are doing. I received an excellent massage. Enjoyed myself immensely!
Worth a visit. Beautiful temple grounds - and amazing to see the drawings of anatomy from so many years ago for scholars to come and self teach themselves massage. Very interesting.
Foot massage done right. this is sort of a massage wholesale market but they seem to know how to give a good massage, an experience you must not miss.

Relaxing oasis in beautiful temple. We toured the Wat and then, like many tourists, stopped at the massage school. I had an hour-long foot massage and my friend had a Thai body massage. They were wonderfully relaxing. The facility is very clean and the staff are very friendly. The little shops sells various products and souvenirs. This is great way to spend an afternoon after you have been walking through the temple, which is also beautiful.

My message about a massage.. Brilliant place to be / and thing to do on a steaming hot day in Bangkok. The students practice there skills on you and you get a cheap massage. All of this in the temple complex which is a fantastic experience too.
impressive. This was worth the visit - its size is impressive. The statue is beautiful and the atmosphere is calm. Nice to hear monks chanting in the background. Worth a visit!
good foot massage. There were a lot of tourists. It needs to wait long time for body massage. So, we choose foot massage. But it was good. Comfortable and cheap.

I had 10 massages! This was the best!. I traveled from Bangkok to kohsamui, kohtao, and koh phangan. Had different massages on all 3 islands at different locations i.e. on the beach facing the ocean. With that said the best massage I got was here. It is not your typical massage nor venue as it is a medical school. However it is cheap and well worth the money you can spend at a 5 star hotel spa. My wife and I got a one hour massage and a half hour foot massage. If we could go back everyday we would have but were on a tight schedule. Please please don't neglect this place in bangkok. It is quite the experience and best value in all of thailand imo

Best massage in Bangkok?. Fourteen days in Thailand. Fourteen massages. Okay maybe thirteen. But this was the best one. Pity they're that once in a lifetime thing, and I had to settle for the massage parlour at Robinsons for the rest of my stay.

Really Good Traditional Thai Massage. I had to wait about 20 minutes for my massage but it was well worth it. It was one of the best Thai massages I have ever had. It's a bit busy and loud, but I've never had a quite Thai massage. Expect to spend a bit more than you would on others. It was 420 Baht which is quite a bit more than you can get a massage for at some places, but it was worth the few extra dollars in my opinion.

Great massage at a reasonable price. By Bangkok standards, this massage is a bit pricy, though it will be a fraction of what you'll pay in your hotel's spa or back home. Wonderful massage in a communal (read: authentic) setting. These people are the masters of Thai massage, enjoy!

Great foot massage. I had a 30 minutes foot massage at the end of my visit to wat Pho. Felt completely revived after 30 in the air conditioned room, a great massage and a cup of tea. Highly recommend and well worth the 280 baht.
Revived feet. worth a wait for this 'proper' massage. Often a queue for the full massage but rarely one for the foot massage. Perfect after a day's sigthseeing

Tired. Too busy, to touristed, to much noisy with many many tourist groups from China. Some time you need to leak yourself in the crowd to move on.
Dont like to travel in that way at all.
Definitely call in whilst at Wat po. More pricey than other massage spots but with trained staff and high reputation, it's worth paying the price. Free refreshments too.

The perfect rest from sightseeing . After a trip to the Grand Palace and a walk to Wat Pho, finding out there was a massage centre was heaven! We had foot massages and they were amazing - really did the job and acted as the perfect rest from sightseeing. I'd highly recommend paying a trip to the massage centre if you're near by for a little peace and calm :)
Really Traditional. If one really want to know what traditional massage is, please visit this place. This place is inside Wat Pho only.

It's supposed to be the best massage training school in Thailand.. It is a little over priced for what you get. No air conditioning. But the staff very friendly. Very popular with the tourists situated in the grounds of Emerald Bhudda.

Don't thumb wrestle these Thai!. It is very affordable, clean, very great service. My therapist was excellent. There was not a problem with me not knowing the Thai language to any extent. I will return here when I go back to Bangkok in a couple of years for a wedding I anticipate.

Amazing!. I did a 30 min foot and 30 min Thai massage. It was one of the best massages I have ever had. The young man was so kind and professional, and my feet never felt so good. I think I paid about $15 USD. Definitely a must do after so much walking.
nice Place. Nice to see where the Art is learned. next to the place is the temple. beware to wear full clothes otherwise you have to rent it..

great ambiance. When you enter the massage hall you immediately smell the massage oil and creams used every day.It is quite big and all mattresses are aligned nicely. Lots of people are working there mostly woman in there 40 up.While being massaged you can hear the outside quirking with people, it is quite an experience.The massage is good, you can tell the girls if it is too hard for you, tell them “bao bao” meaning softer.They appreciate a tip very much, give them a 50 Baht note, they happy.
One of the best massage in Thailand.. In Wat pho you find a hall where you can het one off the best massage in Thailand. Wat Pho you find near the Kings Palace and Chinatown.
A Relief?. Sounded like the real deal but it wasn't. The Thai massage was fine but don't go for the foot reflexology. On the whole, a very expensive affair.

oh so good. Went to Wat Pho (Reclining Buddha) mostly as a tourist attraction and cultural experience but also because I knew there is a Massage School there. I think you are supposed to have an appointment, but we walked in and had a short wait. Here you get a traditional Thai massage (deep tissue). You are in a communal room and keep your clothes on. Very relaxed when you are finished. By US standards, very very inexpensive.

Perfect way to end the day!. After a day of walking around the sites this was an amazing way to finish the day. My foot masseuse was very gentle and I floated off in no time even though I only chose the half an hour option. The facilities were clean and well organized so highly recommend.

Wat Pho massage. My wife had a massage here. She selected a Thai massageBusy place with various types of massage. My wife is slim and i think the masseur pressed a wee bit too hard around her back bone area and she left in a bit pain.

beautiful. not the best massage I had but definitely the most beautiful setting. You're in the middle of the dang temple complex. Surreal. Staff was nice, wait was not long 30-45 minutes and about 15 USD for 1 hour while 15USD seems to get you a 2 hour massage everywhere else (asoke health land specifically)

Just to experience how good Wat Pho thai traditional mssg is. Heard n read alot from generous reviews n comments abt Wat Pho traditional mssg sch n fr pple who visited n tried the mssg, I decided to experience it myself. Fr Silom, fr whr i stayed, I took BTS to Taksin stn n fr thr took a chao phraya tourist boat to pier stn 8 heading to Wat Pho. As my main intention is to visit the mssg sch i spent only a few mins to tour the temple site before heading the school to hv a mssg. Whilst thr, thrs a small crowd waiting but I nd nt waited long whn they ask me to pay up. I pd TB260 for a 30min thai trad mssg. I shd say a bit more expensive thn hvg a mssg around downtown bkk tht cost only tb200 for 60min mssg. Its ok if the money goes to the school fund.They brought me to a hall whr they hv rows n rows of mssg bed n its thr tht i hd my mssg. While hvg the mssg the therapist was busy talking with the one beside me so thrs a lack of concentration when he performed the mssg. The mssg is nt as good as I expected. I can get a better mssg in Silom or the best thai traditional mssg tht i hv hd so far in "yunomri onsen" spa in sukhumvit.But however its a good experienced.

Relief for your tired body or feet. During your trip to Wat Pho, you will most likely need some relief for all your walking. Stop at the Massage school and let them give your feet some well deserved relief.

Murder, but in a good way!. I went with friends, though I'd been before years ago. They opted for 2 hours of strong Thai massage, with male masseuse, to which I too chose. Well it was the real thing, real therapy, not your soothing , gentle spa rub, but an aggressive, muscle work out, very painful at times . I'd not had a deep massage for a long time, so there was a lot to work out. The massage staff are well trained and seem to sense what you need, and I needed a lot. Very recommended, but suggest a 1 hr. massage to start.

learning Intensive Thai massage. it was the right place and ambiance to learn Traditional Thai massage with Thai Guru. I was very impressive with the technique they taught me. I will enrol the course again next trip when I have more time over there.

Feels Good!. The massage school is swell, they do a fine job for a good price. Location is everything! Wat Po is my favorite temple in Bangkok and to get a good rub-down in the shadow of the Reclining Buddha is a major plus. The site is right on the river and next door to the Grand Palace … so can spend the entire day in one neighborhood. Get there early!!! Tons of wonderful photo opportunities. It gets pretty crowded so stay cool and you'll get your shots.

Thai massage in Bangkok. This place was recommended by a tour guide, it's a massage school inside a temple, it's a very safe and proper place to get Thai massage, offer both 30 min and 60 min, if tines allow I recommend to 60 min
Good lesson. Easy to learn and more understanding is a real massage not a happy ending one i suppose and i prefer those

It's okay. This was great after walking around the temple a lot but it was not luxurious nor did it feel clean. You get a ticket for your turn with all the other tourist and get massaged right next to a stranger/strangers in a large room. It felt kinda icky to me because, I kept wondering if they washed their hands before they started on me. My masseuse massaged me from my body to my feet and then to my head without cleaning her hands after massaging my feet. That felt nasty to me and influenced how I felt about the whole massage. It is also luck of the draw, in which masseuse you get and their level of experience. I would not do it again.

Great massage, great location, great price. For a traditional thai massage be sure to stop here after seeing Wat Pho. The massages are on cot-like beds in one large room. Definitely felt great after all the walking around the temples!

Great therapeutic massage. This is one of my favorited massage place when I need a healing massage with strong pressure after long hour of working. The place is clean with affordable price. No private room available, all the staff here have a great massage techniques. During my last visit the guy who massaged me finished Thai Massage 15mins prior schedule time . Possible he had another customer coming and don't want customer to wait so long. The location is a bit far from my place and it close to The Grand Palace. Sometimes was not convenience for me to go there 'cause the traffic always jam with many event around that place. Definitely come back but need to plan a good date and route.
Professional massage at a reasonable price.. Professional massage carried out in a clean air conditioned environment.Reasonable rates and friendly staff.
Must visit !!!. Free water come with entrance free. You need to get password for free wifi. The massage there is good! If go wat poh, can also arrange trip to meseum of siam which nearby..
massage is great but too touristy. I love the massage but sometimes the mass tourism can be overwhelming. The price for the quality of the massage was acceptable.

Fantastic and cheap. Really atmospheric place! Located in traditional district near temples, and the massage was really inexpensive, nice and professional. Much nicier than some of the pricey places in bkk. I stayed in hotel and paid triple but this massage was great, will recommend to anyone coming to bangkok

Divine Experience. A visit to Thailand is incomplete without a traditional thai massage. The therapist, literally relaxes all the muscles in your body and you truly feel rejuvenated. Go for the 1 hour massage as 30 mins is too short to experiene this blissful experience.

The BEST Traditional Thai massage you should try!. This is a painful type of massage where the therapist will use every part of your body as a tool to massage you. It is traditional and it kills pain. Like an eye for an eye - this one is a pain for a pain :) If you are an amateur, you can definitely tell your therapist to make it soft by saying "bao-bao-na-krab" if you are male and "bao-bao-na-ka" if you are female. (The word "krab" or "ka" at the end of each Thai sentence is simply to show your politeness and respect towards the person you are talking to.
Massage is relaxing. Be sure to say what sought of massage your interested in there is so many,but great to learn,I liked the atmosphere especially
This is how it all started. Thai massage ihas many conotations - here you realize how it started . A very pleasant and refreshing experience !! Do not miss it while in the Temple
great massage. just a great place to relax, very professional staff, and they receive you and treat you so nice. for sure will go back there again.
Very professional . A very professional massage institution that took care of us. I got the impression that the masseuse giving me my Thai massage really knew what she was doing.

Well worth a visit and a massage. The massage school is located within the temple area. The masseurs are well trained. My masseur actually asked me if there were any places that hurt more and paid special attention to those areas really doing wonders!

Premier Thai massage. This facility is on the grounds of Wat Pho (the reclining Buddha), a short walk from the Grand Palace. It is my understanding that this is the best massage school in Thailand. It is extremely popular and you should arrive early. Even still, you may have an hour or so wait for your turn. Nonetheless, the delay is very worthwhile. Highly recommended as the finest example of traditional Thai massage

The Best back massage ever. I liked this a lot and was so wrapped up in what the guide was saying, that I did not notice the thai person behind me rubbing my back, and then asking if I would like her to come to my hotel to give me another back rub after the tensions of the day, but I declined.
Great massage at reasonable price. Great traditional thai massage at very reasonable prices! Located inside, Wat Pho, it's a great break from exploring the sights.
Great Massage. Good place to get a real Thai Massage and a reasonable cost. Also if you have the time you can enrol for one of the many courses on offer.

Wow. I missed this the first time I was in Bangkok so I made sure I visited on this trip. Wow. I enjoyed this so much and it's a steal at $13 for an hour. It's not super relaxing during the massage, but I felt so relaxed after like all my travel kinks had been worked out. Next time I'm in Bangkok, I'll definitely be back.

Make time for this awesome experience. For about $20, indulge yourself with an hour-long foot or full-body (fully-clothed) massage. Not the "oh, I am so relaxed" but the "wow, I just got some serious healing" kind of massage...pressure points, stretching, manipulations, etc. all leading to a sense that the body is just a bit healthier...that this was truly massage therapy.
Very Interesting. We saw the temple at night and it was beautifully lit. The massage diagrams for teaching are all over the walls.The gardens inside the temple were beautiful to.

Money making attraction. A money making attraction waste of money had a foot massage which i think was a waste of money go to local shop which are better value n defintly better massages n value for money

Not so good. It's a school, but the massage cost was fairly high.We got 30 min each and the students giving us massage were not so friendly. They did not listen to us and what we wanted.Still, go if you are there, it's kind of cool getting a massage at the school.
Amazing massage. . This was my first day in Bangkok. This massage will definitely get you relaxed from all of that stressful traveling. A must do with wat pho.

Great relief after a long day!. It provides a basic ambiance with a great thai massage to relief my tired body. I found the 1hour massage sufficient and was much better than others I tried in Bangkok.

Basic and advanced course. There are 2 schools in Bangkok. Wat Pho and extension school in Soi 39. I studied basic and advanced course at the latter. Teachers speaks English, Japanese and ??? and most students are foreigners. They are very kind and friendly, but final test is strict. Its course fee is a little bit higher than the branch. You can also enjoy the Thai Traditional massage at their first floor with reasonable price.
Massage survice. nice massage school and service for tourist. It is oldset one. However, price is over expensive than other massage place.

Many a wonderful masseuse has come through there.. The Wat itself is remarkable the massage school is a very nice addition that many locals learn a decent trade. Not only have I been here numerous times but I have had massages from students in almost every corner of Thailand. It is an epicenter of massage learning.

Someone has to learn....and we have to enjoy..... Go there to help the the trainees learn....and the master are around...don't worry.....best massage ever......and it is clean...and the best place to go for a massage in Bangkok.....

The Standard in Thailand. this is THE school! if you are looking for a formation about thai massage and some more heroes the place for you within 5 days of intensive training done by the best you will be able to give an effective massage to anyone.price aren't cheap but you pay for quality and the most recognized certificate for thai traditional massage.

An unique experience. We already visited the massage centre a few years ago and we want back almost exclusively to get a massage. The price of 420 Thb for one hour is basically unbeatable and the quality of the massage really good. An excellent experience, with the added bonus of taking place in an interesting place, which you can visit - preferably before the massage, so that the massage will soothe your tired limbs.

Escape from the heat and have a great massage!. After seeing Wat Pho,we decided to have a traditional Thai massage. The place is air conditioned so it's really good after the temperature outside. It also smells minty from the massage oils they use. It's a clean place; they change the sheets and pillow cases after each customer. Massage was really good and relaxing,you end up falling asleep whilst having it. After the massage they give a cool refreshing juice to the customers. Everyone should have a traditional massage experience when in Thailand!
Great massage. Totally recommended! We had 3 massages in 3 different places in Thailand, but this one was by far the best. It is a little bit more expensive as the others, but it worths!

Hard but Good!!. I have a good time here. Very interesting to learn technic of massage from lovely teachers. Its just depends on whice partner and group you will have. Some group is fun ofcouse and it will your course here more funny.

What Po Thai Massage. What Po Thai massage school is where you go to in Bangkok to receive authentic Thai massage. The therapists really know their trade. I had a two hour massage which really sorted out my shoulder restrictions. The treatments can be fairly painful but the end result is worth it. My only gripe is that the school is now heavily visited by groups of Chinese tourists who insist on using their smart phones while being treated which is annoying. Hopefully the management will ensure that this practice stops. For those who have been before, the old location has closed and they have moved to new premises two shops away in the same street.
great massage for those aching feet. We heard that the massage therapists were good...and we were not disappointed. It was very busy when we went.

very good massage. I had some wondeful massages at What Pho. They are serious and respect the customer. It's very good especially if you like strong massage and not so much stretching. Worth going as it is also full of thailand's traditional treasure elements.

Yes, do it!. Not crowded, not expensive, very good quality of massage, especially if you have been walking for few hours. Few different options, from foot massage to Thai traditional massage. You will feel like a bird after 30 minutes! :)

Trainees but good. Located in the grounds of the reclining Buddha the school is a big dorm type of place with many people being massaged at the same time, so totally safe. The cost is sub £4 and worth much more - no fills (do not expect Lotus leaves etc) but a good way to recover from a day walking around.
The original Thai massage. If you are in to health treatments then this is a must visit the original world famous Thai massage. I find the queue is too long to wait for a massage.

30 minutes of bliss. The massages are really good. Like... really really good. If you're looking for a spa vibe, this is not the place for you, but if you're looking for a great quality massage from an amazingly strong practitioner, go here!

simple massage , Silom Shops better than. simple massage. not about traditional massage school. you have have better massage in silom area for 250฿(7usd) /hour. around have a lot of taxi and tuktuk driver. their annoying for cache the costumer.
Relaxing place after a busy tour. Good massages but you must make sure to book ahead. The staff were well trained but it felt a bit commercial. As they has timers on for the massages.

Such a great break from touring. We stopped here for a 30 minute foot massage. It was so relaxing!!! I enjoyed it so much that afterwards I convinced my husband that we should both get the 30 minute traditional Thai massage. That was also wonderful. The massage school is clean, efficient and the massages are excellent. I would definitely recommend stopping here to take a break from all the walking and touring temples.
Wat Pho massage. We did not enjoy this massage, it was expensive and they pushed and rubbed so hard my body actually hurt afterwards.
ok not exceptional. Waited around 30 minutes for a 30 min thai massage. Ok but no privacy, beds lined up adjoining. Have had better.

Don't forget the massage!. This is a beautiful temple with nice guides (300bt) who make this temple come alive. At the end of the temple is a massage parlour which looks a bit weird and busy but it is definitely worth it. For about 560bt you get an hour of the best massage, even with your clothes on.
Great way to de-stress. After a long day of walking, it was a welcome reprieve to get a thai body or foot massage from their well-trained staff.

Massage School. I was hooked to their massages. Almost every day I would visit these places for a little comfort for my fatigued body in the evening. The Wat Pho Thai massge school is one of the best. The massusues were experts in their job -gentle and yet very effective, they have different styles of massages and I found all of them very helpful in getting undisturbed deep sleep getting you ready for your next day adventure visiting worthwhile sites to be visited and enjoyed.

It works. A very inexpensive and professional massage service employing skills learnt over hundreds of years as an element of traditional Thai medicine.I wholeheartedly recommend a visit to this school.It is a very relaxing, invigorating service and a great aid for aching, holiday limbs and joints lacking in suppleness
The best foot massage in Bangkok. Although it's more expensive than other massage stores, the massage skills there is definitely much better!

Standard price - Good massage - Noisy place. Do not expect relaxing time when you come to this place. The whole place is noisy with chatting from the staffs and the waiting guests. It is non air-con with massage beds right next to each other.The price is standard in Thailand and the quality is good for that. I will just come for once and not revisit it.

Excellent massage. If you want to get a real good Thai massage this is the right place to go. There was a little cue but worse to wait, you get a stunning good service. Very professional and relaxing.

Wat Po. If your looking for traditional Thai Massage. look no further than wat po. Ive been here before some years ago and still remember the painful massage. dont be a chicken......ask for the 2 hour herbal massage.
When in Thailand, get a massage !. Massage is so prevalent in Thailand, but I wanted to get one from "the source". It was well worth it - quite an experience.
best massage. one of my first massages, definitely liked it, told masseur it was my first one, so he did a gentle but nice one. would go again if i come back to bangkok anytime. short waiting only.

Authentic Thai Massage - great price!. My husband and I were seeing the temple at Wat Pho and noticed the sign for massage as we were roaming the grounds. We had to wait about 45 minutes (the place was packed!), but got a 1-hour body massage for about 220 baht. It's a little rough compared to American massage, but a nice experience. Their massage school is renowned, so you know you're getting the real thing too!
A great way to unwind. Take a break from walking through the temples and get a whole body massage. Not the best, but good enough for the inexpensive price you pay.

Hit and miss. Despite long waiting periods, looks like this place is a hit and miss. We waited 3 hours for a massage, good thing we had the whole temple to explore.. My massage was amazing but my husband's not so much.. Only annoying this for me was the constant talking with each other while massaging us.....Lady told us later to come in first thing in the morning being the quietest time.. Next time :)
Massage. You can check on this school while you are looking at the temples. I know many people who have been trained here. Why not stop for a massage?

Great Thai massage. We were there early in the morning (by 9:30). There were no lines and we in fact were the only 4 people in the large room. The massage is deep, but we all LOVED it! The price can't be beat!

too popular, too much waiting for a, basically, an average massage. too famous that it probably got spoiled. too much waiting, stress, fuss, too many people, all in one room... no peace and quiet. it's more an idea (if that's relevant at all) that is inside of a temple facility than and actual holistic experience at all. price is way higher than an average thai massage but massage itself is just average. I find Health Land much much better choice, actually the best in Bangkok.

The best foot massage!!!. After a tiring day of visiting the Grand Palace and other temples, we reached here in the evening. Though there was a 20 minute wait to get our foot massage, it was by far the best I have ever gotten. My feet felt so light and wonderful, I would say that paying more than elsewhere in the city for a massage here is totally worth it.

Worth Doing!. It's $8 for 30 min, or $12 for an hour. One of the best massages I got during my time in Thailand. You'll be in a large open room, so it's not a spa experience at all, it's a therapeutic one. They have big fans and maybe A/C so the room is comfortable even on a hot day. The waits can be long, but you can call for reservation, or go put your name down then wander around the beautiful Wat Pho complex.
Try the herbs pack. The massage was very good. Pay a little more for the hot herbs pack. Also don't forget to tip the masseur.

Worth doing if you're at wat pho. Massage was a nice air conditioned break from the heat of March. No privacy as they really pack people in here tightly side by side. But it was a cool experience for our first Thai massage.
Very professional. We went to the Sukhamvit branch and had a brilliant massage. Extremely professional. Relaxing it isn't, but these masseurs/masseuses really work at those knots.

Fantastic authentic thai maddage. An amazing 1hr full body massage for less than 500bht!
Both of us loved the hour spent here and left feeling fantastic!
We arrived around midday and there was no waiting time, just straight on to the massage beds.

Bangkok Temples and Canals Tour with Bangkok Day Tours. Once again our guide Ken provided us with the story behind the walls. The School includes sculpture of massage positions and a near overload of temples. Well worth the time.

Easy way to try Thai massage. We was there aoround ten am and we went in to see if there was a long time to wait. We waitet for abaut 3 to 4 minutes so that was really qiuck. My first thai massage and it felt good. Try it.

First Thai massage. Price is 260baht for 30 minutes of Thai massage, a little expensive but we thought we'd try it. Not as painful as we imagined, pretty relaxing actually. It's like a whole body massage with some stretching. But be sure to stop by here after you see the reclining Buddha, that way while you are waiting, you go see the other small Buddhas. We were told 30 minutes but ended up waiting about 1 hour and 10 minutes. They hand you numbers and call them out when ready.
Excellent. I go once a week. When I'm in Bangkok.Worth the travel to get there.Traditional Thai massage. Make sure u tell them soft or hard.You might walk out with bruses if u don't.
Ok. It was a nice massage, but it is expensive and I had better massages in Bangkok. This is place for people who like a "softer" massage than usual Thai style.

Hundred Years Effort for Well Being. The 5 days General Thai Massage course gives a wholly different cognition to the human body. It introduces massage lines on limbs, back, shoulder, neck, hip and head above the muscles or beneath the bones. It also teaches various techniques to stretch upper/lower leg and waist and back. The classroom is clean, air-conditioned & having a really good view toward the temple. Teachers at the school are fully experience & very friendly.
