They help to massage & relief the pains during the class.Price for this course is 9500B, reasonable considering they usually assign one senior masseur for every two student.

Must visit. The massage school offers good massage techniques for a reasonable price. Had to wait for 1 - 1.5 hours on queue. I visited the school during Chinese New Year, but it was worth waiting. Would recommend it to everyone!

Stop and enjoy. If you're looking for an authentic Thai massage, of even if you're just visiting the temple and feel a bit tired, take half an hour off and enjoy the massage at the school. It's on the temple's grounds, and you'll feel pretty good afterwards, ready for another go at the city.

best place to spent time after arrive. it was suprise, grate one, made by my hosts - after 1,5 h i was ready to explore BKK more than after 8 h sleeping! grate massage, i would love to repeat it do not forgot to prepare some tips for masseur, 200 - 300 bath will be really welcome and it is worth much much morePain during thai massage is just normal, relax!

Excellent Massage. Wonderful massage with an amazing view! The massage was an hour long, my massage therapist knew exactly where my aches and pains were, and when you're lying on your side, you can stare out at the beautiful temple buildings. One of the best parts of my visit to Bangkok.

Authentic Thai massage. absolutely safe... if you are wondering where to have a traditional thai massage in Bangkok..this is one such place.Take this massage after you complete going around the palace, wat poh and all other places and come to this place around evening time.. you will go back fresh as they remove all the tiredness by a traditional thai massage. this is actually a massage school where they have trained therapists and you can expect a professional and relaxing massage. the rates are pretty standard menu card type, so, you dont have to worry if you are overpaying..

?. Actually it came highly recommended, but I was not able to experience it. This place is part of the Wat Pho temple complex, and a majority of the people visiting the temple head for the massage centre, creating long waiting times. The place is now airconditioned and the prices lower than hotel spas but higher than other places in Bangkok.
Best massage. A bit more pricey but the massage was worth it. My husband was especially impressed. Very busy so book if you can or you tusk not getting a space.

Not for the faint of heart. I'm not at pro in massages - I don't get many, so maybe that's why I found this one quite painful (though I usually prefer higher pressure). They definitely seemed to know what they were doing and I'd say it was a unique massage - they massaged me in ways I've never been massaged (using their hands / arms differently, bending, etc). My friend absolutely LOVED it (though she has more massage experience so she's probably used to it), but for me the pain made me a bit tense. Another important thing is the ambience. It's all in one room with about 30 people being massaged at the same time, so there's little to no privacy and it can be a bit loud (not a din, but when you're in a room with that many people, and people are going in and out, it's far from quiet).Overall, good for the experience of an authentic Thai massage, but wasn't superb.

No-hassle experience, great foot massage. Easy to stop in and get the massage of your choice - every other kind of massage was going on while I got mine and it was fun to watch others getting the full treatment and shoulder/head massages. The facilities are relaxing and calm despite all of the people in the building and things run very smoothly. The young man who did mine did a really nice job and was very kind.

Addictive!!. They are really good. Really. No doubt. I've been to plenty of massage parlours and consistency in the services is hard to comeby but this place is truly a gem. ♡Definitely a place you must visit and experience their skills!!

Normal Massage with higher rate. Read some reviews about the Wat pho Thai Traditional Massage and decided to give it a try. It was just so crowded at the place and we were there around 1pm. We need to wait for about one hour and the person in charge there were really not friendly at all. i dislike their attitude, they were just showing their ego face because they are famous and many people is queing for the massage. Well, honestly, the massage was just so so, nothing special about it. For those who haven't try before, you can give a try if you have lots of patience and tolerance. =D For me, i definitely won't come back again.

Must try in Wat Pho. I love massage so I will try to get them as much as I can. I read about the Massage School in Wat Pho, so I told my friends that I have to try their massage. It was really good and worth every baht of my money!

Authentic thai massage - excellent !. Very reliefing, I cannot compare it with any other massage I ve got before. Young students practicing the technique. They know where to touch and how to put pressure so the relaxing effect is immediate and obvious. Congratulations for this massage centre inside Wat Pho. It costs 420 baht (13-14 USD) for an hour plus 100 baht the entrance fee to the temple. I also tried another place (healthland), but this one (Wat Pho traditional thai massage centre) is by far the best.

Very Good. This is one of the better Thai massages I have had and I will be going back again. This fits in just right if you fit in a couple of sites then head here to relieve the muscles that will appreciate it

I'm hooked!. I've had several different types of massages and this is the best I've had without the painful deep tissue. They use their body to stretch your mussels. It really helped my aches and pains especially after many days of walking around the city. Plus it is only $12.US! Sweet deal. My husband loved it too. He never complimented a massage he's received.

Excellent Massage. I wished all massage therapists in Thailand would be trained from this Wat Pho Massage school. In the last 25 years I kept coming back to Thailand many times and tried numerous Thai massages. There has been so far NOTHING that got even close to the excellent massages I received in Wat Pho.This is how a Thai massage has to be done !!

Authentic & amazing. It was very nice to relax after touring the Temple of the Reclining Buddah and Royal Palace. After checking-in we had a short wait before my husband and I were called over to be escorted to the massage pavillion by our massuse. There are changing rooms for you to use to put on the designated robes, and then you rejoin your massuse and are led to a bed within a large room of beds - perhaps 4 rows of 5 beds with a separation aisle between beds 3 and 4 of each column. My husband and I were in adjoining "beds" with a stranger to his other side. The massage was very relaxing and the massuse were deft in following their traditional methods. It is a bit similar to a deep tissue massage, but more aggressive and the massuse will use their feet, knees, and elbows to "really get in there."

great massage. We stumbled upon this school tour Wat Pho...it was a great massage if you do not mind deep pressure. I had an hour foot massage for 12 dollars. It was a great break from touring and had the a/c on strong

Great way to spend an hour. We only had to wait about 15 minutes for our massage. They provide a cover up for you and your belongings stay with you. The massage was so relaxing. It was also a great way to get out of the heat for a while since there is air conditioning.
Nice Massage. Had a nice massage. Real, authentic Thai! After walking around touring all those nice buildings, temples.

Great Thai massage. Price 420 baht per hour which is only slightly more expensive than in other places, but worth it. A professional massage, very pleasant experience, everything was clean and linen shorts were provided. Though my husband wasn't so happy about his, his masseur was quite hard on him, using his knees and elbows quite a lot. But even this was done with skill and the results were good :)

Hard massage. After 2 weeks of vacation, I couldn't wait for a traditional thai massage. It was very affordable and the massage was very deep (I was sore for a few days). Everyone is in a large open room with no privacy but it was still great!

Best massage we have had in Thailand!. This was such a great experience. We had to wait about 45 minutes to have an hour massage but it was fun to have a massage in a temple. You have to tell the ladies if it is too hard because they are pretty intense - like little tigers! We have had more than half a dozen massages - some pretty bad so we were grateful for a good experience.

Well should go every day. Here is a place where every massage I have had is relaxing and peacefull The place where u actuall get a massage without having to worry or think about inexperience.The place not modern or is it easy to find but worth it once u experience a 2 hour massage and sleep through half off it. I know u might say why go there but this what I like.
Ouch. Visited on the recommendation of a friend. Very busy - a 40 minute wait but well worth it. Came out sore but relaxed.

Be brave .... This was our first experience of Thai massage and we were not disappointed! A rather hectic reception desk but the massage itself was excellent. We came back few days later to have another session. This place needs a better shop area so one can get better information about balms and their use. Bring some water with you, particularly when booking full hour sessions. For whatever reason, the massage makes you very thirsty and a glass of water offered to all at the end of the session is not enough!

make time for a massage here. The students at this massage school are very, very good. My husband and I went here the first day after we arrived in BKK. After the massage we felt relaxed and energized at the same time. Great way to start a trip.
A World Famous School.. This School does an enormous service by teaching the Traditional Massages of Thailand. This place is located near the Famous Wat Pho temple.Well worth a visit.
The best, and cheapest place to have massages. Bangkok provides massage every where, but Wat Pho is the place, where you can have it, and learn to give it… Just wonderful
Cool but.... Good experience, but not the best massage I had in Thailand. It is a very busy place, and that is not a good thing when trying to relax.

"Ahh" Relaxing follow-up to lots of Palace walking. This is located down a side-street near the frenetic Royal Palace area and after fending off the persistent tuk tuk and taxi driver's offers to "help" get me there I finally found the place. The school is air-conditioned (required in BKK) and despite the jack hammer drilling outside the whole time it was comfortable and relaxing. b Began with me the only person in the room but filled with others as the massage progressed. She began at my feet (hence the "Ahh"). Thai massage is very strong using pressure points...about as much as I could take but I enjoyed it. 420 baht (about $13) well spent for a weary tourist following the Palace visit frenetic pace of getting there!
Traditional massage school. As it is located at Wat Pho which is a major tourist attraction it is more expensive than what you would pay elsewhere. It is also extremely busy!
First stop!. Run, don't walk to the home of Thai massage. They worked muscles and bits that I didn't even know existed before. Deep, subtle work. Masterful really.

Take the time out from touring and relax. We are not young travellers but fairly active ones and this was a good deal and we both felt great afterwards. We both had half hour massage and they were both great.
For Cdn $9 each it was well worth it.

Stay away!... Run!. Went in for a foot massage and came out soar! They really didn't speak English and gave us a body massage. Not enjoyable at all. You lay down in a room with many beds and people grunting and talking.

Most painful hour of my life. I had the 1-hour Thai massage and asked the guy to be gentle because a part of my back hurts. Well, not only did he crush my thighs and back muscles, but he insisted on trying to heal my sore back. I'm a very patient guy and I went through the hour thinking it'll be over soon, but the regular customer would have tapped out. Almost half of the pressure points were full-on torture. I understand that a Thai massage is supposed to be physical, but this time (my third Thai massage) was just unbearable. I think it depends a lot on the masseur you get. Also, the hygiene was so-so and I didn't like the ear pulling and the fingers in the ears at the end.

nice and a little different. You are massaged fully clothed, and on pads side by side with your neighbors. They really know how to work you over, and after walking through the Wat Pho maize, and bending your neck to see this wonderful temple complex, the massage really hits the spot and relatively inexpensive.

Foot Massage after Sightseeing. At the temple of Wat Pho in a separate building is the Wat Pho Massage School. After a day of sightseeing and walking it was a welcomed relief to have a traditional foot massage by a highly trained masseuse. What a pleasure.

Love it! A must for tired feet and body!. The best Thai foot massages! We had several. Bliss! A must do when in Bangkok. Foot massage ends with a neck and shoulder massage. Bliss after having carried a rucksack around all day. The Massage school is set in the lovely compound of the Wat Pho. Great place to relax after a hectic sightseeing day. Feet and mind refresh at same time. Highly recommended.
Good massage, not the best, handy location.. Had the full-body thai massage here, wasn't the best but definitely not the worst I've had. Good location near Phrom Phong BTS.
Best massage in Thailand. This was the best message we had in Thailand. Make this a pitstop half way through your day to re-energise your feet. Highly recommended!

Don't Pass This Up!. After getting 30 minute foot massages at a small massage parlor near our hotel every day for three days, my friends and I decided to experience what our guide said was the real deal (monks train all the masseuses) at the Thai Massage school on the grounds of Wat Po. Despite the sign at the entrance that asks for quiet, it was a hubbub of activity. Clients receiving full body massages lie on beds lined up in dimly lit areas. Everyone is given loose fitting pants to wear. You keep your clothes on, although many men had their shirts off. The foot massage chairs are lined up 6 in a row. I managed to stay focused on the skilled touch of the masseuse. For 420 Baht, or about $15, it's a great deal.

Just do it!. Let's keep this review real simple. What Pho is the epicenter of Traditional Thai Massage and Medicine. They teach people from all over the world in this incredible massage tool. I've been visiting this serene sanctuary for over 20 years and I cannot tell you enough about this experience. Try all their massages while you're in Bangkok. It'll be the greatest investment you make in recovering from jet lag and slowing down after your journey to the Kingdom of Thailand. Finish your visit off with a tour of the temple and perhaps a little audience with a monk. Can't wait to go back.
Always nice. I go every year and I always stop at Wat Po. This year I decided to try the massage at the school. You pay a little more but it was worth it. Cost it 100 bahts but free for locals.

A proud student carrying the torch for the healing arts.. I have owed my entire massage career starting with this magical place. After my certification 15 years ago by Grandmaster (founder) Lamyong Naksorn with 40 years of experience, I have always go back and visites each and every time whenever I am in Bangkok. She even gave me a treatment 3 days ago and remembered me well. This is the Grandmaster of all Thai Massage School as the oldest and largest in the world. A must in your visit.

Feel like new. Great service with great results. Staff was competent with a decent level of English. After one day, the majority of my back pain that I had for years was gone. Definitely will be back when I come to bangkok.

A massage worth going to Thailand for.. It took me a long time to find this gem tucked away from the bustle that overwhelms the famous Wat Pho temples and the reclining buddha. I asked a bunch of students in a nearby school who were more than happy to point me in the right direction. I eventually find the place and pay my fees. I have been told that the place is expensive for a Thai massage, but at a reasonable cost of the equivalent to US$10 for an hour, I was more than willing. I am usually tense but this was the first time in a long time I felt loose. All the stretching and popping left me relaxed and with the ability to move freely again. I am going back specifically for this again later this year. Not to be missed!
Great experience . I think it's the best massage I've ever had. In my life. So far.Just do it!It's a great value for your money and you will be most definitely well looked after.A must-do in Bangkok.

Be patient. The massage was of quality, and good if you have tired of walking around the area, and can't wait. I wasn't tired, just very anxious to get a Thai massage in Thailand. I stopped here after touring the temples & Royal Grand Palace. The wait was not long, and they offer you free drinks. However, I found that massages elsewhere in the city were generally half the price for twice the time you get at the massage school. So if you can wait, you can indulge a bit more.
Very nice place. I like the park with the temple, i like so much the big budda, i dislike the bother people that want to plan my day..

A must see when in Bangkok.. Visiting the reclining Buddha is something quite special. However be careful of scammers outside. Between the souvenir vendors and the taxi's it is easy to get ripped off. Don't be afraid to haggle or walk away. Also be warned that it can get very hot inside and it may be difficult on children.

Far and away the best massage I had in Thailand. Aside from the novelty of being able to get a massage at the same time as visiting a temple, if you're looking to get a massage while in Thailand, this is the place - I had a number of massages while on a recent trip to Thailand, and this was far and away the best. During my one hour massage, the masseur managed to find every tense point in my back and work systematically through them, in a way that was effective but not painful, and I felt great afterwards.Be aware that Thai massage works with pressure points, and is nothing like the gentle massage strokes that are more common in the West. It's absolutely worth trying, but also worth choosing well because a less expert back massage can make you feel worse than when you started. This establishment is a great choice for quality, convenience (you're likely to be visiting the temple anyway) and very reasonably priced.

The Best Massage Ever. The best massage I have ever had.They say that Thai massage is the lazy man's yoga. The therapist applies pressure along the muscular and nervous system. Every single important spot on my body was worked on and I left rejuvenated.Some reviewers mentioned the lack of privacy. You do lay next to another dude. There were approximately 40 guests in the room. I may have gotten one of the better therapists, because at one point of the massage I stopped hearing the chit chat and I forgot how many people were around me. It was a spiritual experience.

A massage like you've never experienced. This was incredible. They worked muscles I didn't even know I had and put their whole body into massaging and getting kinks out of mine. It's about $13 for an hour massage. I would get one every single day if I could!

You have to stop by. There was only one thing that I had to do before I left Bangkok, and that was get a traditional Thai massage. What better place than where the Thai massage originated. The massage school is located on the same site as the Reclining Buddha. We first visited the gigantic laying statue where the building was over crowded and hot. Afterwards we really needed a massage to unwind. When we walked in there were a lot of people inside, but we were seated right away. If you're expecting privacy you will be disappointed. There was a large group of people being massaged the same time we were but everyone had their own bed to lay on. I really really enjoyed the massage and it was well worth the $8 for a half hour treatment. Highly recommend.

Must go to Wat Pho!. This must be the best-priced activity in Bangkok! Having visited the temple complex at Wat Pho, I found my way to the back where the massage school is. There's a blissfully air-conditioned waiting room... I arrived around 2pm and there was a 40 minute wait. I paid 260 baht (for a half hour of Thai massage) and was given a numbered ticket. When my number was called, I was taken into the hall next door full of clean, wide yellow beds, with a lovely medicinal scent. There was a safe place at the end of the bed for my ruck-sack, so no need to worry about belongings. This was the massage I've been looking for all my life! No messy oils, no getting half-naked, no rainforest music, no awkward conversations with the masseuse... on the contrary, you keep all your clothes on and are kneaded like dough by very firm hands that know EXACTLY what they're doing. The practitioners are terrifically strong (particularly their thumbs!), and the only sound in the room is the occasional gentle chatter between them as they get on with their routine. I had anticipated aching a little after visiting, but not at all. I felt transformed - rested, relaxed and fantastic, wishing I had had an hour instead of 30 minutes! As I left I was given a cold drink of water and a straw. If I lived in Bangkok I'd visit here frequently, and I'll definitely be looking for Thai massage places at home now that I've tried it.
massage!. i have one thai massage there for half hour. But i just feel it is moderate only, not really relaxing enough.

Its an exhilarating experience. The Wat Pho massage school is at the back end of Wat Pho or the sleeping Buddha temple. Just the fragrance on entering the place will stay with you for a long while. The place is slightly crowded and there is not much privacy there but the massage is really good. Much better than the other places you get massages. It is more traditional and it rejuvenates the whole body.

Thai Massage. Went to Wat Pho for Thai Massage - I think it's an old temple and popular for its thai massage school. I think I went there with too high of expectation and thought it would be the best thai massage I would defintely have.But, no- the massage was so so and it was just too much hassle taking a cab and trying to reach the massage schoolUnfortunately, Wat Pho is not easy to go - i don't remember there is a BTS nearby. And most of the cab drivers can't communicate in english. And I can't speak thai. So just taking a cab there for so so massage was not worth it :(

Fantastic massage. Spending a slow day at wat pho, it was wonderful to have a massage here at the school in the middle. Having had countless Thai massages (and ability to compare), this one was excellent. It added to a bit of the culture and history of the temple for sure.

No 'nonsense' massage. Here, at the traditional Thai massage school you get simply the real McCoy - full stop.The school is a big hall divided into sections of about 8 beds each and clients are lined up on the beds for their massages.There's no music, smell of incense and all the usual hotel spa stuff.It is airconditioned and you'll appreciate this when you go in from the blistering heat outside. Entrance to the Wat Poh temple premises is 100 baht for foreigners and free for locals.A full body massage costs 450 baht for 60 minutes. Same for a foot massage and then there are all the other variants.Sheets and cuscion covers are immediately changed after each massage - they are quite clean and the masseuse all wear clean socks (sometimes the massage involves the use of their feet too). You get a cool drink at the end.We really loved this - as I mentioned it is a 'no nonsense' really really good massage. It is the school where massage is taught after all. At 11 am in the morning the younger massage students (all adolescents) are allowed to do the foot massages!

Ouchies... Me and my friends decided to go here on our first day to escape the heat and relax. It was anything but relaxing. It was ridiculously painful (although I am told that is what Thai Massages are meant to be so who knows...) and they click every part of your body... parts you didn't even know clicked. It was an interesting experience to say the least. Ow. Despite the pain I get regular back problems and for my entire trip (5 weeks) was not bothered at all by it!

Interesting and affordable experience. Receiving an authentic Thai massage at Wat Pho was a great start to my day of sight-seeing in the area. The price was 420 Baht for a 60-minute full body massage, in addition to the Wat Pho entrance fee itself. The massages are performed in a large open room with capacity for I would guess about 30-40 people. Nobody in my group had to wait, but the place seemed pretty busy. Upon payment, I was asked to change into looser-fitting pants provided by the venue. The masseuses and masseurs were friendly and receptive to comments. Following the massage (which was good) we were given some tea and explored more of Wat Pho.

True Thai Bliss. .. There is something very Thai and truly special about having your Thai Yoga massage inside this particular temple (Wat Pho). All treatments are provided inside a large Sala (Buddhist pavillion) with bright red ceiling - but without any private rooms. There are just a few treatments to choose from, but all of them are authentic Wat Pho traditional massage with certified therapists. You will be given ticket number in case there are a lot of clients (I usually waited around ten minutes). My one hour foot massage costs 420.00 baht which is so reasonable. Try not to compare this place to the ambience you might get from a normal spa though. But, do cherish the therapeutic and relaxing experience that you'll get from this amazing Thais Wisdom. Don't miss it!!!

Great way to relax after seeing the temple!. My neighbor recommended to stop by and get a Thai massage after visiting Wat Pho. It was just what I needed after a long hot day. My husband who never had a massage before even agreed to do it because it was affordable. We didn't make a reservation before hand and we waited just about 5 minutes to get in. The place was air conditioned and quiet. There are many other people in the room with you but they all want to relax just like you. I can't tell you how good my body felt after an hour long massage. Afterwards we didn't want to do much because we were both so relaxed. Definitely stop by this place if you have the chance.

This is the real deal. My husband (after a bit of prodding) and I had a 30 minute full body massage. The $8 price tag was great. It was a professionally run operation that is clean. The staff was also friendly and made our son and friend feel welcome and comfortable while my husband and I were treated to a massage.This is not your average, strip down, grease up, rub down that you see in the US. You are fully clothed. In fact I was given loose trousers to wear to protect my modesty while wearing a skirt. The therapist use deep pressure at vet specific pressure point. The best way I can describe it was pleasurable tension. They will go deeper or softer on request and seemed to respond to me without verbal communication. It is slightly uncomfortable for a moment, and when that pressure point is released it is incredible. If you have ever had ART for a sports injury it is a similar feeling. My husband and I had side by side massages and the two therapists were working almost in unison, moving along the body in a very specific and focused pattern. Both of us wished that we had allowed time for a full hour and I would have lived the opportunity for a foot massage, too.I enjoy an American massage, but this was far more refreshing. My husband generally doesn't like to be touched and only went along with the massage because I pulled, "You came all this way and you may never have the chance to do this again."card on him. Even my grumpy, keep your grubby paws off of me husband enjoyed the experience.
Okay for me.... +traditional Wat Pho style massageauthenticdecentprofessional-no frillsno privacyno ambiencelocated inside Wat Pho temple (admission fees required)

Real massage. At Wat Pho you are sure to get a real Thai Massage.. this is a real difference when compared with the street massages you can get all around the touristic parts in Bangkok. The place is very clean and the students are professional. They will ask you what level of pressure you would like to go for (the massage can be strong but you will feel so revived afterwards!).Visit to the temple is also a must- I found it more authentic (even though less restored and less tidy than others).Definitely a must-visit when in Bangkok!

birthpalce of thai massage ..try it!. wat pho is the birthpalce of thai massage and they really know how to do it!.It is more accupuncture and it will certainly worth it!...can be hard sometimes..there would be a long queue and needs prior booking and waiting time of an hour or two. very pricey for the fame but very professional and worth the experience. Something you cant miss being in thaliand! thai is known for this!

deserves the reputaion. I could not come to Thailand to learn thai massage and not take a glimpse from the famous Wat Pho School while i was in Bangkok. It is a very professional and organized course and i was glad i took it. It certainly maintains the reputaion. Thank you.

very good. Very good massage School. Thank you for your time and attention. It is more accupuncture and i love the atmosphere. A little bit pricy but i guess you are paying for the name. Recomended to people who want to study.

Expert hands and an affordable price. Wat Pho temple is the home of the enormous Reclining Buddha as well as the birthplace of the traditional Thai massage. After an amazing visit to pay respect to and be totally overwhelmed by the tantalising Reclining Buddha what could be more called for than an authentic Thai massage. Just a few minutes walk from the pavilion housing the Reclining Buddha you'll find the two other buildings where you can experience either a full body massage or just a foot massage. Along the way you'll notice several stone sculptures of figures representing various postures of Thai massage. These figures represent the teaching of Thai massage. Of the many massages that I experienced in Thailand, I would say that this is one of the best places to experience expert hands that are focused on solely massage. And the price is unbeatable. You may choose a half-hour or full hour session depending on your time (and budget). There can be a wait, usually not too long, so you might want to check in when you first enter the temple complex.Once again, expert hands and very affordable!

Excellent massage . Really nice to get after an afternoon of visit under the sun. We got one foot massage and one Thai massage, both were really good. Clean and very professional staff. High value for money.

Excellent Value For Money!. A great experience after a long afternoon in the sun. We both had a 30 minute massage for just under £10. We both felt so much better afterwards. Since coming back to Bristol we looked up Thai Massage Practitioners who are charging 10 times the price!

great. we love massage and we love good massage, especially my wife. The place is popular but it was recommended by a friend who lives in Thailand. The place look poor in decoration and beauty and we had to wait more 30 minutes. was hot and we thought to leave and forget the massage but at the end we decided to wait. Was a good idea. The massage was great, bit pailful but the masseur knew the job very well. My wife also was very satisfied. it's cheap. I recommend 2 hours massage, because in my experience they can work well the whole body in just 1 hours. Great place. Wish there was one in Paris!!!!

Welcome the Thais?. FYI. I am a Thai and had used the massage services at Wat Pho in Sukhumwit 39 for a few years before quitting. Everything there was perfect, except for the communication manner of the lady at the reception counter. She received the Japanese customers politely, but not me and my other Thai friends. I felt uncomfortable every time she responded to my call an appointment making. We tried to limit our communication with her to save our inner peacefulness. I wish she knows that the Thais pay the same and tip generously just like her Japanese customers. I wish she realizes that my Thai friends and I have the rights to expect her to be as polite to us as to her Japanese customers. She is doing her business in Thailand, yet my Thai friends and I felt being humiliated whenever she received us.

a perfect massage. after roaming around the temple. this is the best thing to have. a full body massage would really make you feel relax. despite of the intense heat of the sun during the tour around the temple, a perfect massage is the best thing to have.

Best massage and deal in town. I don't get many massages, so if you're like me, read on. I didn't know what to expect, and I always find that they hurt a bit since I"m not used to them. But this guy I had was a miracle worker. I don't find thai massages particularly relaxing during, but after, boy did I feel loose and great. I was worried about the lack of privacy, but you forget within 2 minutes, and you can keep your clothes on if you want (women do and some men keep their shirts on) as thai massage is about pressure points. You won't get a more professional massage at a better price. I'm happy that I saw these reviews beforehand! It's right behind the reclining buddha, steps away from the grand palace, so there's no reason not to go.

must see in BKK. One of the most visited temples in BKK with hundreds and hundreds of buddha statues inckluding the famous reclining buddha, which will literally take your breath away when you see it for the firt time. If you have time to take in the whole complex its probably worth paying one of the guides a couple of quid to walk you round, just make sure its one of the official guides that are situated inside the temple complex.

Give your body a Thai treat. After pounding the temples in the heat of the Bangkok sun, this was the perfect place to switch off and give something back to my tired body. Tucked away at the back of Wat Pho, the centre may be not what some people see as a peaceful massage parlour. However, if you are able to switch off, and ignore the other people around you, then bingo! I felt if I was floating once my masseur and finished with me, a Thai massage at its best and at a good price too!
Thai Massage. After see the reclining Budha, then you can experience Thai Massage. You have to queue before it, and it's a long queue. Try 1 hour service.

The Classic. Wat Pho is the home of Thai massage. There are murals, unintelligible to me, describing the principles behind it. It's a bit pricier, quite a bit actually, than other massage places, but they have high standards and it's well worth the $15 or so for the experience. Foot massages too for those who don't like having strangers' hands all over your body (which personally I quite like) .

Ahhhhh....I feel like buttah!. Great traditional Thai massage during our trip to the reclining buddah. You pay first (I think it was 400 baht/ea or a 60 min full-body session) and then you are led to the next door building where you change into massage outfits (similar to US version of nurse scubs but larger) and lie down on mats.My husband had a male masseuse, I had a female. We both agreed the massages were among the best we'd ever had.We had a massage almost every day of our ten day tour of Thailand. Super inexpensive and sooooo good!
massage is good!. For about 300baht, enjoy a good 30min Thai massage that can relieve all the stress in your muscles after a full trip of shopping and temple visiting.

Excellent massage. Since it's a real massage school, probably the most famous in Bangkok, it's a unique place to get a great body and foot massage.
Don't hesitate to tell your masseur where your body hurts, or if you'd prefer he/she spent more time on such part ...

The most enjoyable footmassage. After a long day of long walks,is this the most relaxing moment of the day.
I enjoyed it so much that I went back for a second time. It felt like I was walking on clouds.
This one is a must Do!!!

best massage EVER.... 2 hours of pure bliss! It was cheap and amazing!
It will make every massage I have from this day forward sub-par.
Sensational. Must do Bangkok. Wonderful, wonderful massage. It is busy but that is not a problem. Totally recommend.

Best Traditional Thai Massage. It is located within the Wat Pho temple... its a must do .. Post 1 Hour full body massage ... i felt very nice and relaxed ... and its absolutely worth the money ... very cheap ...

Best Massage in Bangkok. This is where you should go for a good Thai traditional massage, we always go there when we visit
Bangkok. After the 1 hour massage you feel like a new person, all pains and aching joints gone.
It is very cheap considering how much you will pay in London.

Best traditional massage in Bangkok, but getting expensive. 3rd visit here in separate trips.
Very good quality traditional Thai massage.
Previously non-Aircon & significantly cheaper. Now Air-conditioned, cleaner & more comfortable.
Not a refuge cos masseur or masseuse chats incessantly. Mixed gender treatment areas. No privacy.
No regrets. Will return.

My feet were very happy. After a long day of walking in Bangkok we were very grateful to see the massage school at the back of Wat Pho. I had been there 10 years and still remember the marvelous massage. My friend and I were both very relaxed and were able to see a few more sights after our feet were rejuvenated

Fun to experience and your muscles will thank you. We got a lot of massages in Bangkok but this was our favorite find. After a few hours of waking around the grand palace it was wonderful to see the impressive reclining Buddha at Wat Pho and finish the day of sightseeing at the on-site massage school for a foot massage and Thai massage. The atmosphere does feel school like - and clients arrive in droves ... It's somewhat hectic getting signed up and started. But once the massage begins, it's relaxing and wonderful. The massage was high quality. While painful at points, I have not felt sore since and have been feeling loose and great days later! I highly recommend this as a tourist stop and massage stop.

Unforgettable massage!. An absolutely must try. This is an excellent massage place where they teach and practise traditoonal thai massage. Should try atleast once. Do the complete package dont go cheap on this one.

Wat Pho Must See. This is a great temple complex. The Reclining Buddha is a must see and since this is a massage school, the massages are fabulous and a great value. Beautiful grounds and once you get away from the tourist groups, its very quiet and peacful.

Give it a shot, and decide on re-visits... I personally like visiting Wat Pho and have been returning yearly. It is quite an experience in appreciating the grand Reclining Buddha as well as the surrounding area. Sometimes you get to see school kids learning / reciting; some days on company visits.There is a counter for coins exchange where you get to fill up the 108 bowls along the insides of the temple. It is for good luck and sometimes people make wishes or just think good thoughts. 20 baht each.I tried the foot massage and it was very relaxing. For ladies wearing skirts, they have fisherman's pants for you to wear to cover up. Slightly more expensive than massage parlours on the street, but quality is great.Of course the question has always been, why would visitors get charged for visiting a temple.My take - just give it a shot, and if it is nothing special / you don't connect with it, then at least you wouldn't question "what if" :) Entrance fee is 100Baht, and you get a bottle of drinking water.

Good experience but has an assembly line feel. I've been coming to the Wat Po massage school for years, and insisted on bringing my husband over a weekend stay. While I have been very impressed with the quality of the massages provided in the past (foot, Thai, and Thai herbal), I was somewhat less impressed on this visit. With so many people being served out in the open, I felt like I was part of an assembly line. The quality of the massage I had was also not as good as the massages I had at other places in Bangkok and ones I had received on previous visits. Husband was not impressed at all and thought he had been ripped off.
Worth seeing. Not our favorite Temple, this one has the well-worn feel of being used in daily life ~ which it is. The home of the Traditional Thai Massage School, definitely worth seeing.

The mother ship of Bangkok temples. This is the mothership of Bangkok Temples. Not only the oldest and largest,it has a lively lived-in,faded grandeur where it is used as the foremost center for public education. It is of-course, the magnet for every tourist in the land due to the Reclining buddha.  But its fame is because of its Traditional Medicine School including the Institute of massage. Look out for the stone plaques embedded in the inner walls of the paviliion,showing massage points. To book a rub, plan a head of your visit. Ask your hotel to organize this.

Spend the money and get a real massage!. My wife and I got thai massages here 2 weeks ago and are both still in pain. I have a shoulder injury and told the massage student that my shoulder was injured and that he needed to be careful. He was not paying attention during the massage (he was chatting with a colleague), put his foot in my armpit and proceeded to pull my arm--which separated my shoulder. While he was very apologetic, I am now on the verge of needing surgical repair. The rest of the massage was very painful and despite my repeated pleas to soften up, it never got more gentle. My wife had the exact same experience. We each walked out it pain (we are young, fit people) swearing we had just made a big mistake,It's also a bit weird because it is cramped and everyone is laid out next to strangers. So, you're getting a massage right next to a complete stranger, often times on your side looking right at a stranger looking back at you.

Best Massage in Bangkok. Very pricy compared to other Massage opportunities around town but it is worth the price for sure! If you are searching for a Happy Ending you should go to Khaosan Road but if you want to find a professional and traditional Massage go to Wat Pho! Go around the temple and as soon as the sun gets to hot for you and your feet start to hurt, relax during a 1 hour long massage.

worth it, worth it, worth it!. It's great to visit after you've toured the Grand Palace and Wat Pho. Just follow the signs inside Wat Pho and these will lead you to the building. We appreciated the air-conditioned massage pavilion, the orderly numbering system and the friendly staff. we decided to get a 1-hr Thai Body massage (420 baht) and a 30 min Foot massage (280 baht). Separate numbers were given for these services. We waited around 30 mins for our turn, which was no hardship since we were able to secure seats inside the pavilion, which was fully air-conditioned. When we were called for the body massage, they noted that we were also in line for the foot massage so they just instructed the masseuse to combine them, which was better and more efficient. There are around 10-14 beds available for the body massage and around 5 chairs for the foot massage. No, you do not have to be in your underwear for the body massage (which is a good thing because privacy is nonexistent). They just asked us to change our pants into a generic, one-size-fits-all loose trousers and led us to the beds. And proceeded to give us one of the best massages ever. EVER. when the 1 hour was done, we were seriously contemplating extending our time! they then led us to comfortable arm chairs, gave us sweetened water to drink and then got on with our foot massage. Wow. If feet can smile, ours would be grinning. It was just what we needed after a long day of walking. My masseuse even gave me blanket to use when she noted that i was shivering (yes, it was that cool inside - welcome break from Bangkok's humidity). Still, all good things must come to an end. We changed back into our street clothes, put our shoes back on and gave our masseuses big tips :)So, to anyone looking for a great Thai massage - this is the place to go. There is usually a long queue, and you will be told that it's a 40 minute wait. Please know that it is worth the wait and it usually doesn't take 40 minutes. I will definitely make it a point to come back!

Worth travelling to. We visited the temple primarily because of the massage school, and it was justified. At the time we didn't know much about thai massages, but we had lots of thai massages after this one during our 4 week stay in Thailand, and this was definitely top three.The outdoor setting is unbeatable, but indoors it was quite average and quite small, when the place is busy you can feel it. You won't have a hard time finding cheaper places, but at least here you know they either already are top professionals, or are learning to be. A lot of other places they didn't seem to care about mastering the techniques, and you could feel them fumbling around to just get through the routine quickly. Here they cared about placing you correctly before continuing, which was much more pleasant.

Excellent skills for Thai Massage. We went there after reading so manu good reviews. Although the fee is higher than outside market rate, ThaiB420 for an hour thai massage which is worth every pennies! Me and my friends had thai body massage. Their pillow have traditional herbs essences, the women gave me pressure points massage rather than oil massage. I was so comfortable after the session. If you would like to find the unit. It was not far from Wat Pho (reclining buddha temple) walking towards the main road and see 7-11 before it, turn right an alley and walk towards the riverbank. It is on the left handside terraced unit.Enjoy !!

Epitome of Thai massage. We stumbled upon the Wat Pho Thai traditional massage centre during our visit to Wat Pho and absolutely no regrets! Staff were professional and skillful applying just the right amount of pressure to sore spots that had suffered through the day of exploring the city. Will go back for a no frills cheap massage the next time we visit!

My First Thai Massage. I was under the impression that Thai Massages was a lot of stretching and massaging in between the areas that they stretch out. The Thai Massage here seemed like regular massages except they cracked my fingers and toes.. weird. The masseurs didn't seem very professional, they were taking calls and talking to each other a lot. But it's a nice escape from the heat when you've been walking around all day. Nothing special I would say. I paid 420 baht for 60 mins.

Seems a bit over rated. The massage is pretty good but the waiting time is really long. The cost is high as well and a similarly good massage can be had in most of the better parlours around Bangkok with more private setting. However, just for the experience of having had a Thai massage at the place where it all started, one could make arguments for it.

excellent place. First I would like to say that I only had a look around the wat and didn't have a massage, so please read other reviews if you are interested into that.I really enjoyed wandering around the wat and seeing all these awesome building. There are lot's of shady places where you can relax and cool down a bit. The huge buddah is just great and I went in there twice. With the entry you get a free water and anyway I spent there about an hour and really enjoyed it.

Delightful. I enjoyed a much needed foot massage here after visiting the Grand Palace and the Reclining Buddha. My masseur was student of the Massage School and she gave a superb massage. The massage starts off with a cup of hot herbal tea while the masseur prays. It was busy when I went at noon. The prices are reasonable.

good school. If you are interested in traditional Thaimassage or even in taking classes for it, that would be a good place for you! The school is located across the Street from the famous Wat Pho and right on the Riverside. Great teachers, very openhearted and funny ! its worth your time and money!
Wat Pho Temple Massage behind the temple. I went in the middle of summer. This is the perfect tonic for a traveller enjoying the bangkok exploration.

The best of thailand right here. Great decision to spent an hour or so here enjoying the massages. Very nicely done and authentic. Friendly atmosphere all round and well worth a visit. Do visit if you want a piece of Thailand to go home with.

Beautiful Thai Temple, full of tradition and the Best Thai Massage. This temple has it all !! Declining Buddha is very stunning. Beautiful Thai architect all around. Best Thai massage I have ever had. Best thing to go early in the morning. It is located along the Chaopraya river. I would say plan for a day trip, start off with Wat Pho, get an hour massage (This way you can beat the crowd and it is not too hot) followed by short river cruise, Amulet market and if time is still left add in China town. Don't need a tour guide for this, you can get away with some basic Thai words. All of these attractions are with in walking distance. If you are familiar, you can ask people around. Thais are very friendly and likes to help foreigners. Beware of Pickpockets (which can be non-thai people). There are also some scammers around, but if you already plan your trip ahead of time, should be a really great day in Bangkok
A great massage. Had a lovely massage here - definitely worth a stop if you get the chance! Had a foot massage and it was the perfect detox on a busy day in Bangkok

Aaahh. The massage quality was excellent (and we had a lot of massages on the streets to compare this one to) and beautifully presented with top masseurs and of course in the grounds of the stunning Wat Pho temple. Best advice - get there ahead of the masses, this place gets ridiculously busy. So it is nice to be greeted by fresh ready to inflict massive massage treatment on you

Overrated. Place is clean and staffs are friendly. Thai massage - pressing and stretching. You can choose between medium/ hard (toughness). Recommended time would be after visiting grand palace and wat po. After 1 hour of Thai massage, I dint feel anything :( Given a choice I will not try again.

Excellent, excellent massage..... For those unsure what the real traditional Thai is about, an hour at the Wat Pho Massage School should give you a fairly good idea. The massage is conducted in an open concept with aircon with the your masseur in uniform. You don't get to choose your masseur but from what I can see...the man gets male or female masseur while the females get strictly female masseur (for obvious reason). There are storage cabinet at the head of each of mattress for you to store belonging and a little corner where you change into the attire provided. I would recommend minimally the 1 hour package....lie down and enjoy the massage..do be prepare for some spells of pain when vital points are pressed and knead...but after the massage, you will feel rejuvenated and refreshed. A cup of watered-down cooled tea will be served after the session...A great introduction to the amazing art that so many around the world are enamored of ...
Hmmmmmm!. Don't miss out on that! It is just wonderful. I recommend the Thai massage more than the foot massage - nervertheless both are really great and it is definitely worth going there.

The real deal. I had heard a lot ( a real lot) about this place from all sorts of people. My wife has been to BKK numerous times and when it was time for me to go there, she first made me try the fancy expensive massages in upscale massage places in the city (which were OK) and then finally she took me to this divine place. Its always booked, so make sure you book a massage before you roam around Wat Pho (this is inside the Wat Pho complex) and in the end visit this place. Its a basis arrangement wherein you book a massage of ur choice (try Full body thai massage) and the best trained traditional hands relax ur body,mind and soul.Dont expect the glamour as this is the authentic one...

The best thai og foot massage ever. I should not be writing this, becouse a very positive review means even bigger queue, but anyhow - this is always top of my visit to Bangkok. Very professional and definitely the best thai and food massage in whole Asia. Very simple, but clean place, you can be sure to always get a clean sheet. Not as the usual 'spas', where the girls often are only half educated and do only 'half' job.Make sure you order both thai and foot massage at once, so you do not need to wait twice.The only minus is that you have to pay entrance fee to Wat Pho in order to get to the massage school. And place is terribly crowded.

Great value but you might have to queue.. Inside the Wat, we were lucky as we didn't have to queue, only about 20 mins and it was our first experience of Thai massage. Superb. It gave us the inspiration to get other Thai massages whenever we could fit one in. The masseurs in this one are being watched and taught as they massage you but it doesn't affect their performance. We went for the traditional thai as there were big queues for the foot massage.
nice place. I have been there twice and both times this is my favorite place at Bangkok - so calm and spiritual!

Hit the spot!. Easy to find on the Wat Pho 'complex'. Quiet, relaxing and VERY good! A little more expensive than other places, but still cheap and of course, they are very well trained. The massage was excellent, could quite easily have stayed there all day!

Great massage to rejunivate you. While there are plenty of places to get traditional Thai massages, this place provides the real ‘Thai’ style. All the masseurs are well trained and have a good knowledge of how to get rid of different stresses – you just need to tell them – and this is where the differences in between the masseurs at Wat Pho and other places. The only thing I didn't like is that this place could be a bit cleaner, as it looks a bit old (don't get me wrong, this place is hygenic). Going early in the day is good as it kinds of gets crowded in the late afternoons (especially those finishing their trip from Wat Pho).

Expensive - Good Alternative is nearby!. I visited the massage school for Thai body massage but I found the prices a bit expensive and on recommendation of a local, I went to another massage center nearby where you can have a massage (oil, Thai and foot) at economical rates. I was pleasantly surprised to learn that all masseur s performing massage in that massage center are trained and certified from Wat Pho massage school! I was also told and I personally experienced that the quality of massage is the same as in Wat Pho massage school. Clean environment with no happy ending etc. I really enjoyed the massage and recommend the place! The massage centre is located near the entrance of Wat Pho pier (on your left side while entering the pier).

worth a visit after tiring day for the temples!. I got the Foot massage 280 baht/30 minutes, 1 free Thai tea afterwards. it was a little bit painful for me but when you tell them to be more gentle, I'm sure it'll be one of the best and most stress release massage I've ever had. the masseurs are all nice and professional! will come back next time if I visit Wat Po!
Still Great !!. Went there again but couldn't get more than 30min massage as reached there at 6pm which is there closing time. Been there before and the place is still on top of the list

Wat Pho Thai Traditional Massage School. If you visit Wat Pho try the traditional massage at the school thereThere may be a wait during busy periods but well worth itIf you are spending some time in Bangkok you are able to do a course

Best Thai Massage in Bangkok. The masseurs at the Wat Pho Thai Massage School are well trained - they provide the most authentic Thai massage in Bangkok (I tried about 6 well rated massage places). All 3 masseurs I had had a good knowledge of anatomy & were able to get deep into muscle tissue. Great stress relief.The prices are very reasonable & the masseurs are lovely; they don't push for a tip like at other massage places but you will WANT to give them a generous tip.If you're looking for an aromatherapy massage, this is not the place to go. They specialise only in traditional Thai massage & foot massage (also very good).I can't wait to have a Thail massage next time i'm in Thailand!

A little overrated but still worth visiting. I have seen many good reviews about this place and decided to give it a try during my latest trip to BKK. Honestly, I felt a little disappointed. Don't get me wrong. The masseurs were very professional and good with what they were doing. I just felt that it was quite similar to what I have received at other massage centres in BKK and I was expecting for more. Furthermore, the location is rather far from the city, and you will have hard time looking for taxi drivers willing to on their meter due to the heavy jam during weekends. Pricing wise was still decent, approximately 420 baht for an hour (about the same as the massage centres in shopping malls). Due to the overwhelming number of customers, you may need to wait up till an hour for your turn. So during this time, you may take a walkabout in Wat Pho.
Best Massage ever. The technique of their massage is awesome. You cannot find it anywhere else. Before you got a massage at the massage center, ask where the masseuse learned to massage

A great massage!. I had a 60 minute massage and it was wonderful!! You are fully clothed and its a little awkward because you're lying on a bed right next to someone else getting a massage...but once the massage started I completely forgot about it. It was great!

massage. It is not happy ending massage school, good place, it is in the Wat Pho area, near the temple. you have to wait a short que. you can take Thai massage or foot massage, keep in mind original Thai massage done with clothes, there is no oil or something else. 45 minutes Thai massage is 260 Baht (approximately 6€)

Great temples in a large space.. Many beautiful temples in a rather large space. Free water to anyone paying the 100 baht to get in. Only takes about an hour to see everything. The school is in the back for all the enjoy a massage.
However, if you want to go the toilet, you must pay 2 baht for toilet paper.

A tough massage - great relief for those tight knotts !!. I try - with each visit to Bangkok - to always go there for a no nonsense massage, This is an age-old Thai traditional massage school - where the "students"practice the skills they learnt, though somehave years of experience.This is a place to go if you are "into " massage. There is no hanky panky. The " patients " lay fully- clothed on rows of individual mattresses in an open sheltered and covered "room " - and depending on what time-frame you choose - an hour or longer - are kneeded, thumped, stretched and pulled by expert hands. You can ask for soft. medium or hard treatment. Altogether an exhilarating experience - at very reasonable prices - if you are used to this kind of massage style.
Just wow!. Best professional massage ever. That bad we have to pay entry fee to Wat Po, otherwise I will go often.

AMAZINGGGGGGGGGG.. This a must visit after Grand Palace and Wat Pho. The charges are very reasonable and nothing in comparison to value you get. Their are many massage options but one thing common among all of them is that you feel totally rejuvenated. Place is well kept and clean considering the no. of visitors.

Pleasant, authentic, traditional. This place is an icon and you just cannot miss it.After a long sweaty morning of walking in Wat Aruna nd Wat Pho, your body is just ready for this massage. And you will not be disappointed. In the cool comfort of a large communal hall (very clean) your masseuse will find kinks and knots that you never knes existed in your body. However I believe they have diluted the 'real Thai massage' experience by making it milder, perhaps because most firangs are not used to the hard pummellinga nd twisting of the traditional massage. Nonetheless, you come out with a smile on your face and totally relaxed. At 420 bahts for an hour it is a very good deal.

Most professional Ever. I have to say that we went to the Wat pho temple purposely for the Massage.We had know how famous the massage in Wat Pho is before we go , so after seeing the Grand Palace, we walked about 10 minutes and come to the Wat Pho,the lying Budda just like how amazing it should be , massive and exquisitely made, intricated patterns on its feet tells many stories about buddism.We paid 20Baht to buy the small coin and throw it to the bowls beside the lying budda, the sweet sound makes you feel that you are doing something for the good of life. Then we keep going to see the other architechture and budda, and hard to find where is the massage house, and it was in a back courtyard, full of people, we had to wait their for half hour for our turn, but while we wait , it starts raining, and so nice to be indoors. Finally its our turn, and the massage is so different from Chinese massage , they use their body like feet and legs, put presssure on you , but this pressure is evenly and just alright for you relax. the stecthes makes me feel that I can't do this acrobatic thing, but God, I did, And it is amazing. They use great oil, they massage gently but not too gently. All in All you feel they are very professional and in good skill. Never regrect of coming here.Would be regrect if I didn't come.

very affordable massage. Never had a massage quite like this. It hurt like blazes while it was happening and immediately after it I was not quite sure there was nothing broken but the next day. I (almost) could not even feel my usual arthritic aches and pains. And I ended up giving less than the price of a meal back home for it

While at Wat Pho, get a massage!. I got two thirty-minute massages at the Wat Pho Thai Traditional Massage School. Both were relaxing, but I especially enjoyed the foot massage. Be sure to go sign up for your massage as soon as your arrive since the wait was about an hour long. Massages are more expensive at this massage school, but I still recommend the experience.

I'm a convert to traditional Thai massage. After visiting Wat Pho, I went to the Wat Pho Thai Traditional Massage School, which is a modest place between the east side of the temple and the Chao Phraya River. Had a 2-hour massage in a large room with floor mats for multiple customers (One wears pajamas provided, so no modesty issues). My masseur stretched and twisted and poked me vigorously. Some of it hurt, but for the first time in many months, my back pain was gone. Well worth the $23 charge for 2 hours.
the place to call. they will come to your room and twisted you around like a prezel. the price was only 1000 bats about $33
So Professional and inexpensive. not easy to find, on the same grounds as reclining Buddha. Hardly anyone knows it is there. the massage is very professional very inexpensive

Initially I thought good, after other massages just ok. I got a 30 minute foot massage in an assembly line manner. It was my first traditional thai foot massage and I thought it was professional and good. Not as vigorous as I might have liked but ok. When compared to my massages in chaing mai this massage was average and triple the cost. If you are coming north save your time and money and get longer better massages there.
Oldest Massage School in Thailand. In the grounds of Wat Pho - go for a 5:30 half hour and then had a quiet sun set stroll round the beautiful Wat Pho temple

We wont be back now that we have fallen ill after our visit... I definitely found the massage different to other places around Bangkok, there did seem to be more technique, however....The massage therapist i had for my 1 hour Thai massage, coughed and sniffed all the way through my massage, so it was not relaxing as i was worried i was going to catch what she had. Well now just over a week later both myself and my partner have flown home with pretty bad head colds, 2 days before we have to start work for 2013. Please send your sick staff home so diseases are not passed on.This has put me off messages at Wat Po which should be a step above them all being part of the Thai massage training school, not a good example to set!!

Wat Pho. Wat Pho was located behind the Grand Palace, which features the most beautiful Reclining Buddha image in Thailand(46 meters long-15 meters high) it made of brick and mortar supported with lock and chain on the top plated with real gold leaf 24 carat, was build by King Rama 3 age nearly 200 years ago.***** If you want to take the good photos for Reclining Buddha Image at the bottom close of the foot.And the another special foot print made of mother of pearl in laid-108 auspicious signs of the Buddha. Around the gallery of the chapel has 394 Buddha Images that all antiques. Near the building of the Reclining Buddha has 4 stupas of the kings that all was decorated with chiness pottery, small 71 stupas and stupas on groups.Wat pho is the center for the “Thai Tradition Massage” this temple open every day 8 am.- 5 pm. Admission fee 100 Baht only.The best value of your money.

must go in bkk. had to walk in the midday heat to find the entrance. Was surprised that we had to pay the temple entrance fee even though we were go in only for the massage. But it was all worth it. It is the best Thai massage I ever had. Totally relaxed and at ease after 90min!

Really great massage, though pricey. The massage is pricier than I expected - I got a 1/2 hr foot massage and 1/2 hr Thai massage for 540 baht (plus the 100 baht entrance fee to the Wat) - but it was wonderful. I received 2 foot massages and 3 Thai massages while in Thailand, and this was definitely my favorite foot massage and second favorite massage. Definitely worth a visit, though go early in the morning before they get booked up.

ouch. The best place to learn the art of thai massage - especially if one has a blind masseur (they work off touch alone and are revered throughout Thailand for their skills). Very reasonable prices too - although a one hour session is too short really to get full benefit so do try and have a 90 minute or 2 hour if you can. Your body will thank you!

Cheap and relax. For those first timer to bangkok and loves massage, this is the place you should not miss. This is because this is one of the places where you get to experience the real thai traditional massage.

Average. Here is the problem; I was under the impression this would be the best Thai Traditional message I ever would enjoy. In fact, it was barely average. It was far inferior to the message which anyone can find in Chinatown. Even some shops in the On Nuch area are as good at only 100 Thai baht per hour!

Best massage ever!. After all the walking around the sites in Bangkok this is a nice ending to your day.A Thai massage is usually done with your clothes on. The deep tissue and pulling of limps is not for everyone. They work with the muscle to work out stress or pains. It does hurt so if you cannot handle a bit of pain or have a medical condition it is not for you.After the massage you are sore but you feel loose. The stress of the day is lifted. The next day you will feel amazing.Only problem is communication. English is not spoken to much or well. So if you wanted to ask them to stop or work on a certain area it can be tough.If you are part of a group, you can arrange with the local guide to have the massage in your hotel room. Of course the guide will have to let hotel security know.Overall it is so worth it and will do it again. Remember to tip!

Go early to beat crowds - 11 a.m. is perfect. Get an early start at the sights and then head here before or close to lunch. We stumbled about the entire school hanging out and waiting for customers. Around 1 pm people were lined up. Excellent foot massage for me. Spouse had Thai massage and liked it too. Highly recommend if in the area.

Best massage ever!. If you visit Wat Pho you must try the massage - sooooooooooooo good. We went for the 30 minute body massage and it was well worth the very reasonable cost. Very relaxing and gave us renewed energy for the next stop - The grand Palace.

Great experience. We walked around wot pho and had been walking all day. We initially went in for a foot massage but then decided to do an hour foot and hour Thai massage. We had to wait 45 minutes for this but it was well worth it. The masseuse really know what they are doing and even though you're in a crowded room with others getting massages, there is a peace in the room or the massages are so good and you're so tired, it's easy to zone out. Definite try if you're into massages.

Great students. After visiting the temple, we stayed 1 more day to visit WatPho Thai Traditional Massage School. The students were really well trained to behave and really done a good job. They gave us 1 hour totally relaxing after a week of activities. Thanks so much and good luck.
Massages!. I had many foot massages when in Thailand, often in little parlours that were clean and always good but Wat Pho is the king of all foot massages, really worth those few extra Baht...

Pricier than a lot of other places but still good. The good thing about this place is that, even though it's more expensive than something you can get in the centre or on a beach, you know that it will be good, it's kind of a guarantee.I've had some brilliant massages in other places much cheaper (cheapest 100bht I think), but you're never really sure when you go in whether it will be that goodWe had this massage at Wat Pho as the first massage of the trip, after that we tried cheaper places but it was a nice experience and in wonderful grounds
Thai Massage Okay - Had a one hour rest from walking!. Really good to have a Thai massage - often as cost is only 300 or 400 BAT --about $10 US for one hour!

MASSAGE~~~. If you looking for the real traditional massage instead of those lousy poor massage, please go to this Massage center for the real, authentic and impressive massage, highly recommended that!!!

One of the best thai massage I have ever had!!. Go to reserve your massage before visiting Wat Pho temple, because sometimes there are a lot of people. Everybody is very well prepared to make massage and we relaxed and enjoyed a lot

Smelly and not relaxing at all. We couldnt believe somewhere so famous about massage could be so bad. The place is smelly, everyone has massage together, no privacy, massage is very painful and even I try to explain it hurts they dont listen. I do not recommend.

Good. After visiting the reclining buddha this is a great place to stop of to relax, the massage here is both good firm relaxing and cheap...the workers here are just training but all the ones I have experianced seem to be very good.
Painfull. It was a good massage, but quite short, expensive and really painfull. But this is just my opinion and I am not particulary fan of Traditional thai massage.

Prepare for Some Pain. My student had the strongest hands on the planet. It hurt so good. Prices are higher than I remember and a tip appeared to be mandatory. The traditional herb pack was a "no have" option. Booo. Still worth it, though.

Good 1st massage, Bad 2nd massage. I think you either rate this good or bad depending on your pain levels. The 1st time I went, the lady was bit softer and I felt so relaxed and fell asleep. Thai massage is so different to Swedish where they press more on your points and they can tell what health issues you have. The 2nd time I went, I had to tell this lady to be more less gentle, oh my word every movement she did I was in pain!! So I was not relaxed at all. But she must have did something good cos the knots in my back were gone next day!!  Entry fee to the Wat Pho is 100 baht and then you pay about 450 baht for 1 hr but you have option for 30 mins too.

Did nothing for me. I thought this was going to be a great massage for a bargain price but actually was a pretty average massage (actually below average because it did nothing for me) and it wasn't even that cheap. I saw places on the street much cheaper and I went to Healthland (which is a proper nice spa type establishment) for basicly the same price.

Relax...relax...I fell asleep!. Really wonderful oil foot and leg massage....attendants were very sensitive to our needs/wants and it was so relaxing that I fell asleep...watch out if you are traveling with someone who will take your picture! LOL

Great deal on massage. This place has a number of students who massage a constant flow of both locals and tourists, and as the 'master' walks around checking their work, you get a really great massage for 100 baht an hour... and they really work on you.After you finish there wander around the Temple complex's and and take in the stunning Reclining Buddha with incredible artworks everywhere, and great food available... then shoot across the river and take in another Temple complex and the Royal Palace... just beautiful... a must see for all visitors to Bangkok... but do respect their traditions, this is a very Buddhist country, that's why it is known as "the land of smiles"... the people are so gentle, open-hearted, and very generous, especially if you at least try to speak a little of their language... try the guided-tour and learn about the ancient artisans who created these incredible masterpieces... I love this place so much I would move here in a blink if I didn't have a son back home... maybe in the future if things get out of hand... every western female should visit Thailand and learn what a real woman is like, they have none of the bad-attitude that is so prevalent among western women, and they really know how to treat a man...

McDonald's of the Massage places :). We had a very good massage here after visiting the 'Reclyning Buddha'. Cool that we did'nt have to wait and change dress for the massage. The service itself was better than expected.
fantastic. Don't miss. must do, worth every penny. I suggest you book the massage before starting the tour of the complex so you don't have to wait.
Good massage. While my friend enjoyed his massage, I did not enjoy my massage at Wat Pho Massage School as much as my friend did his...
Great massage experience. I loved the massage school. I had two massages here. I started with a foot massage and then had a Thai massage. Great prices and a great atmosphere.

Good massage for little money. When visiting Wat Pho, it is good to stop to relax and cooldown in the clean and airconditioned massage school. We did the half your Thai massage with our 1 year old son with us. The massage was allright, i have had better, but then again we also had to pay attention to our son. And in compare to the price it was good value.
excellent!. i have had massages here several times in the past. this most recent time i actually had a shoulder injury that was hurting. after half an hour massage it has been markedly improved!

Awesome surprise. We stopped here for a foot rub! It was well worth it and will refresh you from the aches and pains of sight-seeing in the heat of Bangkok.This is totally legitimate if you were unsure - this is a very old training school and many, many massage practitioners around Thailand will have studied here. Well worth it, take the time to do this you won't regret it.

Really awful. Don't waste your money here. It is not clean, not relaxing and the masseuses are not experienced. There are many amazing places for massage in Thailand - this is not one of them - just a trap for tourists and overpriced AND VERY BUSY!!!

traditional thai massage. in the same compound as the temple of the reclining Buddha, this one's a popular attraction too. Visitors choose between thai traditional massage and thai foot massage and massage time period between half hour to 1 full hour. both the massages are very refreshing and revitalizing. I could see that this place was so busy, it is very popular. Do take out time to visit, as you get to see both the reclining buddha and get the best thai massage that you can get, and that too pretty inexpensive.
This is where Thai massage started. They run people through here for foot massages or body massages. They line up the chairs and the beds and just go in order of arrival. A little painful, but good.

Go and try it!. If this is your first trip to Thailand and you're nervous about Thai massage, go to the school here to see and experience it, then book a session back at your hotel! It's great, and you'll be wanting more.

Get unknoted. We were there at the end of September. this is our second trip to WatPo Massage school. The trip was specially planned so that we could have 5 days of consecutive massage to get the body going. we stayed nearby in Baandinso so we could walk there and back every day.We were very fortunate to get two sisters who knew what was wrong with us. So they spent a good deal of effort in squeezing and moving the affected area.I had a bothering back and carpal tunnel syndrome in both arms. IT is FIXED!!I also noticed my wife neck which is an old injury is much better. Her overall skin tone was better and those little cellulite dimpled that appear later in life disappeared.We had An and Ao. They were good!!
Nice learning experience. Very proffessional, well coordinated thai massage courses. The staff is very friendly, obviously learning experience is quite limited for a 5 day course.

More expensive than most for less service. You will find traditional thai massage all over the city. I had thai massage almost every day and each experience was far superior to the one that I received at the Wat Pho massage school.

Overrun. Had the best massage in Thailand there, now its seems really overrun by tourists from all over the world. Maybe better and more relaxing in the morning. Just check how busy they are.
One of my friends took a 3 weeks course there and she was very happy with what she learned and the certificate she got..

NOT a tourists' stop, but an enthusiast's stop. Unimpressive store-front location in a neighborhood near the Wat that will have the insecure wondering. Get a massage if you like, but go there mostly to sign up for a multi-day class! Inside the place is clean, efficient and populated with the world's best teachers of Traditional Thai Massage, Traditional Thai Medicine, Thai reflexology and even Organic Chemistry. Don't visit if you're not serious!

The best massage in Bangkok. Sometimes, we wait for a long time (20 minutes!) and it is a little bit more expensive but it really a treatment and to have a massage in an historical palce, it's rare in bangkok! Enjoy
