Ok. This felt a bit like a battery hen farm of a massage place, tightly packed and operating a meat counter-esque ticket system it wasn't really a relaxing experience. It's also quite a bit more expensive than the majority of places. The massage was good but the experience not so much.

Awesome, but remember- it is a school.. I had heard from locals that it is the best place to get a massage in Bangkok. However, the quality of the massage varies depending on the student, and the title of "best massage place" is certainly one that is highly contested. Verdicct: if you're here, definitely go for it, but if you're on the other end of the city, just get a 5 dollar massage over there.

Really good foot massage. We stopped there during our visit to the palace, on a very hot and humid day, after walking for many hours. Me and my wife had an excellent foot massage for 30 min. Very relaxing, sitting in a very comfortable chair in a cool room, and the masseur was very well trained. We came out of the Massage School with full batteries to continue walking in bangkok.
Best massage we had. After a good few hours of sightseeing an hour of Thai Massage was just what we needed. We had a few during our stay in Bangkok but this one beat them all.

Slightly overrated, questionable hygiene practice. If you go to Wat Pho, a massage given by the students of the massage school is almost a must... or so tell you most tourist guides. By Thai standards, the massage you get there is not really cheap and the quality of the massage is really a matter of luck, depending of the skills and expertise of the student you get. Although you get clean clothes and sheet, the masseur/euse will start with your feet first and do the rest of your body later. In other words, any germs nesting in your feet after the long walks in and around Wat Pho will surely find their way to almost every other part of your body and there are no showers there for your to clean up afterwards. You can find many respectable and professional massage spas in Bangkok that will offer you a much more professional and hygienic massage for the same amount or a 100-200 Baht more...

on 5 to 10 I flight air asia from Hat yai to Bkk and to see friend and son who study there i visit there place often. good for your healthy and not expenceip many foriegner like to visit at laest one time to try Thai traditional massage

Not so Bad!. Not so good place for massage and not better than other massage centers in Bangkok, but the rate of this massage school is affordable. Mint massage in Thai style is so cool. After massage I feel very fresh and cool.

Beyond my expectations. Since this was a massage school I wasn't really expecting much. Was I ever surprised. I had a one hour foot massage that was the best I've ever had and I get massage twice a month, even when I travel. The massage therapists did not speak English although the front desk personnel spoke very good English. Including tip, it cost me 500 baht (or about 16 US dollars) for a massage that would have cost me $30.00 at home not including the tip. The massage therapist was very professional. The massage went from just below the knees to the entire foot. It was a very welcome indulgence after walking all around the Grand Palace complex.

crackling bones. i was thinking that this massage school with reasonable price would give just an average service. Boy, i was in for a surprise. the therapist was excellent. the pressure was just right. my bones cracked in the right places. it was a bliss despite 50 tourists around. prices start at Thb 280. try this massage school first before you try other spas in thailand. its look may not be fancy as other hotel spas but it definitely offered the best thai massage.

Experience the flavor of Thai Massage. This was a very unusual experience for a first timer like me. 20 people lined up on mats all getting massage from students. It was great. I got an excellent massage, very cheap. They give you loose clothing to put on. You change behind a curtain!

Impressive buddha and temple murals. I visited Bangkok this time after studying Thai painting. Wat Pho has some of the best Ratanakosin (Bangkok) period murals around. The Buddha and the mother of pearl addorning its feet are not to be missed too.

Real traditional Thai massage.. good place to experience Thai massage with very reasonable price. This place has a very long history. It is considered the first university of Thailand. Some people may like to have a fancy spa in an expensive hotel, but here is the one you should not miss. Put this in your program and you won't be disappointed...

nothing better but come in the late morning. a great spot for a really good Thai massage, take as long as you can because you will LOVE It... a "mass area" of treatment so it is not very private but well worth the wait and get there early!

Best massage I ever had. It may well be that your experience here is all about the luck of the draw. My experience was fabulous. My masseuse bent me this way and that way, and the experience was a bit painful for the first fifteen minutes, and afterwards I could just feel my entire body start to relax in a way that I had never experienced. Having had some pretty poor massages in Thailand and Cambodia, I felt like I'd hit the jackpot. But going by other posters' experiences,, your mileage may vary.
A must do. the best massage we had in thailand - they really know what their doing. My massage was a little rough with some pressure points, but a must do especially after a long flight.

inside reclining buddha. Went to visit the Royal Palace next door then went into wat Pho to see the Reclining Buddha which had 20 baht entrance fee.My feet were aching walking so tried the Wat Pho Thai Tradintional massage school.I like the foot massage that I went the next 2 days for other treatments :)
Very rejuvenating. Well worth every Baht spent and definitely recomended. Be prepared for a queue and a waiting time of 30 to 40 minutes.

Traditional Thai Massage. The Wat Pho Thai massage school has a clinic at the Wat Pho temple and is definitely worth trying. It costs a little more than in places outside of Bangkok but is a fantastic massage and the ladies are all very skilled at what they do. Highly recommended. I think it was 400 baht for 1 hour - where I spent 200 baht in south Thailand (although I was told by a local that 200 was comparatively expensive).

Great way to get a "feel" for Thai Massage. If you've never had a Thai massage before, this is a great introduction. You are in a large room with everyone else and you remain in your (sweaty) street clothes. The students do a great job working out the kinks while you cool off under the fans. After you've had a massage here, you'll be hooked on Thai massage. Affordable!

Just take some photos of the temple. I recommend you come to see the temple because its really good but dont bother with the massage, I thought it would be the best massage but it was just very painful and wasnt cheap (I have paid half the price for better massage in nicer places around Bangkok).
Wat Pho. When you visit the reclined big Buddha is a mast to stop at the Wat Pho traditional massage place located inside the monastery :) suggest you only foot massage !

Dammit, now just any old foot massage won't do.. I had no idea that the institution was on the premises of the Reclining Buddha. I was walking alone over at the back and stumble upon it. Not sure of just what to expect, I safely choose the 30 minute session. But boy oh boy.. this was what I was really looking for. A massage with no pinches or punches, the kind that really takes you to bliss. I regret not having gone back or not chosing the longer session. At the time, I thought I’d get done with the Grand Palace and do another long session before I got home, but I was so pooped by that tour and the walk to and from the Grand Palace that I just turned right to the pier and took a boat back home.

Cheap style but not cheap price!. If you want a cheap massage, you wont get it here, prices are higher than most of the other places I saw around, but its certainly not expensive and I wouldnt mind paying the price (or even paying a lot more) if it was worth it.The problem for me is that I thought this was the home of Thai massage so I would get an amazing massage but actually it was nothing special at all, could feel my therapist getting at my bones more that my muscles!......of the 3 mates who I went with, one said his massage was absolutely fantastic and he felt like a new man, one said it just hurt (a lot!) and didn't feel good and the other one said it was ok, so I guess it depends on the masseuse you are allocated with, a bit random really
On the terrain of Wat Pho, original massages. It a massage school.. They all have good practices. It worth a try, don't take to short time. A goood traditional Thai massage should take 2 hours.

This is a real massage. If you have ever dreamed of a real massage this is the real thing.Forget all you have read or been told, 2 hours here and a real traditional Thai massage takes massage to another level.No where else in the world is equal to a massage here.

The BEST True Thai massage !!. This is the home of the best masseurs in Thailand. Anyone who was trained here will be a very experienced and highly qualified masseur. This is TRUE Thai massage....not butterflies landing all over you but rather a Hummer hitting you. Brilliant. If you are new to Thai massage, ask the staff to massage softly.
Been there done that, won't go again. my lady said she didn't even learn there. It was a good massage, but you could get the same out on the street for less.

Great massage. The massage is good and somewhat inexpensive. Because everyone removes their shoes and Bangkok is very humid, you may want to get your massage near a window or doorway. Nonetheless, it’s good.
your in good hands.... i like because its neat and relaxing. i dislike because its a high priced massage. Its too far to go for a massage.

Not that impressed. Had read the reviews and was looking forward for a massage here. Got a nice Thai massage for 30 min paying 260 thb. The massage was good, although I was looking at strangers in the beds beside me. The NeXT days, I got foot massage different Places in the MBK market and since a foot massage includes most of your body besides lower back. These massages was actual better than at Wat Pho, although I would expect a higher quality at Wat Pho since it's the famous one.

the original and still the best. this place is key to the origins and traditons of the world famous Thai massage . It is set within the grounds of the Kings Palace and is surrounded by ancient buildings and Temples . The massage you get here can come with herbs , oil or normal . If you are interested in learning to do Thai massage then this is the place to learn . The Instructors are first class and you will be issued with a certificate at the end of your course .
cheap and nice massage. simple but clean place. no fancy decoration but good massage. very for money. the branch we went very near to BTS station. convenient :)

authentic Thai massage. If you don't mind waiting and having a massage in a public space - then you'll really enjoy this authentic Thai massage experience. They also have a school if you want to learn how to massage after experiencing this revitalizing massage. There's a lot of bending and stretching which may be uncomfortable at times but overall a great massage.
Excellent Thai massage. Very good value- felt fab afterwards. Cost was minimal. Very relaxing and you feel you are getting value for money. Particularly relaxing setting and invigourating

Great place for a massage!. My husband and I each had two great massages here during our 6 day stay in Bangkok. Nice cool, relaxing place to have a massage. They have many people available to give massages and our wait time was very short.

Have a look, only. By all means come to have a look, it is an interesting place but don't have a massage here. It has become more of an overpriced tourist trap than a place to get a decent cheap Thai massage (like it used to be).

Better to go to a recognized Massage centre. As there are ever so many massage centres in bangkok,it is confusing to select the right one.This centre is reasonably priced and conveniently located close to the main road and BTS station Phrom Pong.Appointment on telephone is possible and the place is quite clean and disciplined.

A good place for a traditional Thai massage. This is not a spa massage, but a cheap foot or thai massage. If you have never experienced one before, come here and try the foot massage. You'll be surprised what a few dollars and an hour can bring in terms of relaxation. Go here for your first and then you can experience the ones on the street at $10 a pop.
1st thai massage. this was my 1st experience of a thai massage and I wish I had gone for an hour and not just 30 minutes.

Fabulous experience. If you are going to spend a few weeks in Bangkok, the course is definitely a fabulous experience. I did it years ago and had a great time both learning proper technique and appreciation of how to both give and get a Thai massage. Don't go expecting a great deal of theoretical content - it is definitely a 'hands-on' course. But what better a place to do so than in the traditional school of a several hundred year old Thai monastery!

You get what you pay for. The saying "you get what you pay for" is very relevant here because although the price is admittedly very low so are the service levels and decor. Having a Thai massage is an important part of a trip to Bangkok but I don't think this is the best place to do it.

Dirty. This is the world famous massage school where apparently many Thai therapists from around the world learn their trade... ok maybe... but as a place to come for a relaxing massage, this is just not up to scratch. Not even clean.

the famous thai massage school. you can get thai massage everywhere in BKK, often cheaper then in war pho. but it is the "original" thai massage and the combination of a visit of the wat and the beautiful buddha and a massage is unbeatable

Shabby. I understand they are not pretending to be a luxury hotel spa or anything but they could at least keep the place a bit cleaner and give it a lick of paint. All felt a bit prehistoric to me and the massage wasnt even that great. Thai massage is great but go somewhere a bit more modern, they will have just as good massage, or better, and the whole experience will be much better.

Nice way to finish a day of sightseeing. This is a massage experience of efficiency, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. You take a number and wait 20 minutes to an hour for your massage appointment. I had a foot massage, and it was great. Keep in mind that a foot massage still includes some neck and upper body massage!

So relaxing. We went here during our visit to Wat po, they offer thai body massage and foot. first you need to register and they will tell you the waiting time(usually 15-30 minutes) just wait in front otherwise you will miss their call.
Massage is amazing and its one of the best i had.
Great Place for Thai massage. i had a great time for Thai massage in this place highly recommend traditional thai massage. Dont miss it after long walk visiting The Grand Palace.

Best Massage in Bangkok. Definitely worth the money. However I'd recommend you go in and get your ticket first and then go around and come back as there's a wait time of about 30 minutes to an hour. Worth every Bhat!

THE VERY BEST. Set in Wat PO grounds this is the best massage school.We can tell after many years of visiting Thailand if someone has trained there.Be prepared to wait there is usualy a long line waiting

Good Value. Going in it struck me as a bit of a massage factory but still the quality was good. Even though there were many people I still felt relaxed and calm. Bonus: the oil that they use makes the place smell amazing.

OK Massage, Worth a Visit. This is kind of a must do if you visit the temple. It's a bit strange - communal rooms for massages after you change into huge loose-fitting pants. But it's a fairly benign introduction to Thai massage - which can include a lot of stretching. Overall, the massages that my spouse and I got were good, not great, but no complaints at 400 baht for an hour. I found that my massage therapist spent an inordinate amount of time on my feet/legs, and little time on everything else which I would have preferred.

Not for anyone with pain receptors. Like others, I would agree it was an intensely painful experience. I had to convince myself it was doing me good. But it's a Thai massage, developed for Thai people. Not for Westerners, my comparatively more muscly legs were in agony with all the poking and prodding. Suitable however for anyone with an impairment that stops them feeling pain.However my mum, a yoga and health fad enthusiast really enjoyed it.You feel relaxed at the end because you're relieved it's over. It is an unimissable experience, yes, but one I won't be repeating.
Don't miss it. wait at the end of day for massage and enjoy the moment where the temple is closed and the massage school still open, nobody around temple and a very beautiful light !

Great massage. In the grounds of the Wat in which lies the reclining Buddha. Also there are Fortune Tellers in the Sala in the grounds. You pay for your massage at the counter, get a number and wait to be called. Take a bottle of water there's a lot to see and you may have to wait ten minutes to be called. Wear clothes that are easy to discard as they give you fishermen's pants and top for your massage.

Heaven on Earth. If you want to get the BEST Thai massage experience, this is the place to go. Don't believe Thai massage services on the street. They give you nothing but pain. But in Wat Pho, the massagers do it like a kind of sacred ritual, they even pray before massaging, something you won't find in the street massagers. And you'll feel really really good after the massage.

Massages good & inexpensive. The massages by students were well done and very inexpensive but be aware that you will be on a mat lying right next to someone. If you require privacy you may want to either ask for som especial consideration or choose another place.

Very good massage. You have to go inside the temple and pay the entrance fee of 100 baht if you want to get a massage. If you already saw the temple then this could be an inconvenience. Make sure to add this to your itinerary if you go see the Wat Pho temple. After a few hours of walking around to see the numerous buddha's, having a foot massage or body massage is a welcome relief. Massage therapists are very good and they give good value to your money.

Great if you're happy to put the work in. I did a 1 week Thai massage course and really enjoyed it. I still practice on friends sometimes. However, it's important that you understand that practicing Thai massage is really hard work - I had aching legs every day of the course. I think it is good value for money as each day you are there about 8.30-3pm ish. It is nearly all learning by rote and actual practice, with very little theory; whilst this can be a bit frustrating massage is such a physical thing and should always involve more practice than theory.

Hell on earth but worth it. I did the 3 day course here to learn traditional Thai massage and have to say that it is one of the hardest experiences of my life. You are kneeling down for almost 8 hours a day giving the other class mates massages and occassionally getting massages yourself. I have never had so many aches and pains but must say that the feeling when you complete the course is very satisfying.

Wonderful!. The place was a quiet oasis during a scalding hot visit to the wonderful Wat Pho. The students who gave the massages are polite and caring. The cost was about 240 for a great 30 minute Thai massage inside an air conditioned building.
the only massage to get. this is what you ask for when anyone offers you a massage. try this first and then you will know what you should get from then on
Signature massage with Thai tradition style. Good price and service .Relax after finish course

Hands on experience in an ancient building. My 13 year old son and I had a half hour Thai massage and we both loved it. Fantastic value for money (250 Baht or c£5) considering you are in a historic building and it was great that you could have the half hour experience if you either don't have much time or if like us, some of the family weren't interested. In fact my other son (aged 11) said afterwards that he regretted not giving it a go. We were there at about lunch time in July and didn't have to queue at all although it may be different at more busy times of the year.

A wonderful treat after a hot tour of the temple. Such a little gem in this beautiful temple. After touring the site, it is such a welcome surprise to be able to enter a cool, dimly lit room and receive an amazing (and cheap!) massage! I always go for my feet which take a beating during sight-seeing!

For the atmosphere. Had a Thai-style and foot press at the Wat in the morning, then a back and shoulder press, later in the evening at their school in Sukhumvit Soi 39.Its dearer at the Wat but you can't beat the atmosphere - nothing compares to being massaged within the compound of a magnificent temple. The massage itself was not bad.The massage at the school in town was more private as they have rooms and hence more restive in that sense. Cheaper and more comfortable. Your choice really - atmosphere or privacy. Both will leave you feeling really relaxed after. (But mind that it you're not used to oriental foot massages, it can be painful)

Going to Wat Po for a Massage? Go Early. The massage school at Wat Po fills up quickly so make this the first stop on your touring day. The massage you will get is great but standing around in the hot and humid sun is not.

The real deal. This is where anyone who is anyone in Thai massage will have trained at some point. This is the totally authentic version of traditional Thai massage, not for the faint hearted, granted, but you can ask them to be gentle, if you're new to Thai massage.

Wow. This is so needed after a long day in the sun, walking around the amazing Wat Pho. Considering that these people are trained so well, the price is great! Not expensive at all and even if it was... I would say it would be worth the money! My partner and I floated out afterwards! hehe! A great massage that soothed our aching bones.

Best authentic massage in town. If you want an authentic Thai massage, this is the place to go. In fact, this is where all the best masseurs are trained - they proudly display their certificates upon graduation. The massage is Thai and can be quite strong if your body can stand it. Please note, this is traditional massage, the only happy ending you will get is a big thank you from your muscles over the next few days!
Great massage but expensive. Great massage but quite expensive - 840B 2hrs. Also have to pay a small entry fee to Wat Pho to get to the massage school

Real Thai Massage. Though it is more expensive then you find on the streets it was definently worth the money ! They ask you where you have pain and do a great job trying to work those areas. it's real close to the Ferry stop and is definently worth it
Excellent. Clean and experienced therapists. Very good value.

This is where it all began. This is like the origin of Thai massage. These ladies will kick your butt and stretch you out. This is a must try, there are cheaper places to go but you should go once for sure. I should note that its still not that expensive. I think like 15 or 20 bucks compared to 6 bucks somewhere else. Or you can pay 150 bucks to go to Mandarin Oriental Massage where a lot of people are trained from here.
Massage is great!. Prices are also good. 260 Baht for 30 min massage.

Two hours of heaven. For us, a two hour massage at Wat Pho is part of every day we spend in Bangkok. From the river express boat, it's a five-minute walk. The rates are a bit higher than some of the cheapest in Bangkok, but it's the difference between working with true professionals and getting a hit or miss (admittedly sometimes wonderful) massage. We haven't used their out call service, but certainly intend to on our next visit.
nice experience. people who like well being should try the massage center

Must-do every Bangkok trip. Well-worth the wait (and it can be long, over an hour!) this is the best massage in a simple, busy, professional, non-spa type setting. Unbelievably relaxing and yet strenuous. These people know what they are doing and don't "pamper" you. They are professionals and can read a body, knowing just where to work on your aging muscles. Quiet murmur of conversation, ceiling fans, bit of traditional music, friendly and serious. This really is the most restorative thing you can do in Bangkok.
Line up then lie down. A new way to be massaged since you are all lying inone big space, but once they start to stretch and knead it is a great experiance. definately worth the wait
Great place to learn massage.... I've visited Wat Pho Thai, i've found it great place to learn ancient massage techniques along with modern modifications.

Very good!. They are always busy, and I guess thats testament to how good they are. We had to wait a bit, and its best to get there first, register your name, and then go visit the temple while you wait.The staff are helpful, and I guess the experience depends to a degree on the person you get - I was very happy with mine, felt really relaxed after it. The prices are a bit higher than what you can get from the smalle private shops elsewhere.

Amazing massage. I had a wonderful massage here in Wat Pho Thai Traditional Massage School! I had a 1h foot massage and enjoyed every minute of it. the therapist was attentive, listened to my preferences, skillful and competent in administering the masage.

Excellent end to visit to Wat Pho. This massage school was mentioned in the Lonely Planet. A great end to our visit to Wat Pho.We had a one hour massage in a large room. Whilst there were no partitions it was relaxing and peaceful. Very professional.

A novelty. Read about this massage school in guide books, so just had to check it out. It's one big room with no privacy to speak about. But the overall atmosphere was relaxing and service professional. My mom and I had each a 30-minute foot reflexology. It's a different set of techniques using a wooden stick, so was quite a novelty. But compare to a similar massage salon, this place is not cheap - 280 baht for the 30 minutes. It's also quite popular as many tourists tend to stop here.
Excellent. Super relaxing. I had been looking forward to it, and it did not disappoint. Would love to return.
Relaxing. Very good Thai massage in the Wat Pho Massage School

very special and traditional. Do not miss this traditional and genuine massage center.....
They also have weekly massage courses....
Well worth the visit. Very reasonably priced, clean & professional. Wish we had booked an hour instead of the 30min foot massage. Very relaxing.
Reasonable. Reasonably priced and solid massages right on site at Wat Pho.

A great way to rejuvinate from sightseeing. After touring the palace, markets, temples this is what will revive you for the rest of the day. Greater to end the day. The staff are trained, skilled, very professional. Massages are done in large public area so its quite comfortable.
Excellent teaching!. I learnt thai massage and thai foot massage here and found the teachers to be so helpful and patient. Shame my massage partner was a bit heavy handed!!!!
Great Introduction to Thai Massage. This is a good place to get a cheap massage in a group setting. Great jet lag cure.

If you never try Thai Traditional Massage you not be reach Thailand!!!. This temple is the first school in Thailand, but now a day very famous in Thai Traditional Massage school, foreigner could take a short course for learning Massage as well. If u be here don't miss to try Thai Massage

Nice place to take a break. The students here offer a nice massage, Traditional Thai massage is more like accu-pressure -- there is no rubbing of muscles, only pressing. The beds are pretty close together, so you might be just a foot or so away from a complete stranger. The students can apply a lot of force -- some of the people in my group had mild bruises after. If it's too busy and full of tourists, ask about the massage school's second location right across the street.

Amazing.. But only if you like pain.. Had a 1hr massage here. Was not the cheapest around and I'm sure many other places provide just as good Thai massages for significantly less but I wanted to try one at the place where it all began. Was definitely worth it. I'm still scratching my head at how such a little lady could inflict so much pain! If you don't like painful massages stay away.. otherwise I would highly recommend.

Best massage ever!. If you haven't tried Thai massage you are missing out!! It's not a scary as it seems. Just know that the massage is performed in a room with many other people in it (you are clothed, of course) but if you are really shy about trying to relax with 12 other people around you it might not be for you. Can't beat the price, I think it was something like $10 USD for a 20 minute massage - I felt like a new person after and was able to walk around without pain for the rest of my trip in Thailand!

2 Birds 1 Stone. I wanted to get Thai massage and also get a skill to use for friends an family. I took a Thai massage course at the Sukhumvit location. This location mainly caters to Japanese students (which made it a lot of fun) but the teachers also speak English. It is a block from the Phong Pong BTS station which makes it very easy to get to. The price is higher than the location near the temple but the teachers are sent from the temple school to the Sukhumvit location - so same high quality staff. If you are in Sukhumvit are I recommend this choice.

You can get your certificate of Thai massage here or just get a massage. You can go here to get a massage or learn how to massage. A typical course will run 30 hours, but if you arrange it with the school, you can do five six-hour days to get your basic certificate of Thai massage. When I got my certificate years ago, it was 7000 baht for foreigners. I did not inquire about the price the last time I was there. The air con was not as cool as I would have liked it to be when I was learning Thai massage. I also found the teaching area to be a bit crowded but still reasonable. The people giving the massages are the students who are studying beyond just the basic certificate. This style of massage tends to be different than the massage shops you find around Bangkok and you thankfully don't need to worry about being offered special services beyond just a regular masage.
A real massage!. Great place for a massage that doesn't need a happy ending.

Fun relaxation.... This is the perfect way to cap a visit to the gorgeous Wat Pho temple. The full body massages can be a bit "rigourous" for many people, but the foot/leg massage is a perfect respite from touring. After 2 weeks of traveling, it was a wonderful and welcome treat for my travel wary feet and legs. If I hadn't been pressed for time, I would have had a second massage.

Hard work in your holidays ;-). We had already done a Thai Massage Course in 2007 and now we added the Foot Massage Course. It's fun to learn something useful in a very traditional surrounding next to Wat Pho Temple with people from all over the world. It takes you 5 days (9-12, 13-16) and you have to pass an official exam - but hey, you're proud of the effort and your brain will be grateful for some new stimulation, not to speak of your family and friends at home!

Painful, walked out limping. I got a one hour massage. It looked busy when I walked in and got a number. I was with a couple friends who didn't want to get a massage. I asked them how long and I thought they said one hour. I went out to tell my friends how long, and we thought we would go look at the temple and come back. I went back in and suddenly they were calling my number. I was pulled to a changing room and put on Thai pants for my massage. I got back out and my friend waved at my from the lobby. The massage started abruptly. No questions asked about contraindications, or areas to focus on. After about 5 minutes the pressure was too much for me, and I told her it was too hard. She said yes it is deep, relax. I thought maybe it was lost in translation, so I asked a couple other ways, to lighten the pressure, less hard, but each time she just told me to "relax". I am a massage therapist, and I could feel my muscles tighten up all around where she was working. Completely the opposite of what I wanted! Afterwards I feel as if I had been stabbed with a broomstick, with my lower back having a knot that wasn't there before the massage. Maybe I just got a bad student, but I wasn't satisfied with my massage to say the least!

Ssorry but everyone want to do massage on you. all diffeent experience. The old have experience but the shakes, so no. The younger are inexperienced and do 10 a penny. I would rather have one in England. Very dissapointing

THE Only place. I had been suffering from sciatica pain for 2.5 years. The most renowned medical staff in Geneva, Switzerland had not been able to help and never mentioned the word "sciatica"... Surely due to Insurance purposes... Anyway, I found the best people here at Watpo, kind, understanding and so ever helpful. I am so much better after a few sessions, I cannot thank them enough, especially Bird who I have been allocated for my first massage. I kept that same person all the way. He carefully listened to me and did his best! I thank God for giving me all this! There is no money on earth worth your Health :D

Home of Thai Massage. Wat Pho is considered teh home of Thai massage, in that this is the most recognized massage training centre in Thailand. Even when you are on the borders of northern Thailand, near Burma, or around the Pai region, most massage centres will have the Wat Pho training certificates, showing they've learned from the best. My concierge driver from Thailand International Tours always takes me here when I am in Bangkok. Calm, serenity of the temple mixed in with a hard Thai massage is the perfect stress buster!! Amazing temple, quality massage in one visit..
Best 14 dollars ever. A 275 year old massage schools knows what they are doing. A strong farm woman made my aches and pains go away. This is a must do in Thailand.

Wow. I was walking on clouds after having a massage in this temple complex. They have a massage school for Thai students who wish to take up this art. You can have a tradition Thai massage or a more relaxing one if you don't fancy getting pulled about.
amazing massage!!. This is where it all began! LOVED this massage, you can NOT miss this! The real Thai massage!!
for a learner. being a keen learner i learned alot about a massage and how to mold a person while you are giving him massage, they also teach seductive sort of techniques.

Best massages in Bangkok. Every time we visit Bangkok our first stop is Wat Po massage school. Go to the school outside the walls of the wat which is air-conditioned and there is very rarely a queue. Superb massages at reasonable prices. I hour is good but 2 hours and you will be walking on air

The best foot massage. After a long, hot day of walking in the temples and the palace, we all had a foot massage here (including my 6 and 9 yrs old)...heavenly experience, do not forget to drop by after visiting Wat Pho

The best place to get a massage in Thailand. Those who are looking for the best place to get a massage, and if you have time, here is the place for you. All of the masseuses and masseurs who gained the certificate from the massage school in the temple are waiting for you. They are the most professional. It costs maximum $30 for 2 hours - it is a lot cheaper if compare to what you do at home. This is one of the ten must do things in Thailand.

Not the ideal massage. If you enjoy being in a room with at least 10 other tourists then you may enjoy this massage. It was about double what we paid for other massage places and the masseur was too strong. I was in pain the next day. There was also approximately a one hour wait for the traditional thai massage. If you are looking for a relaxing experience give this place a miss.
Getting a Thai massage here is a must. The original and the best. Still good value and the students are very well trained.

Famous but lacking organisation and communication. Taxis find it tricky to locate this place so ensure you get the address. The building is not even at the temple. The reception is in one building and the other classes scattered in various other buildings. Staff's command of English poor. Communication lacking. I turned up one day for a 9am start only to be told that class would start at 1pm!! No one told me this the day before. Staff would follow strictly ie: even if all are ready before 1pm (after lunch), class would not start till right on 1pm, so we had to just lie down and rest till 1pm. Even when everything's done, class would not finish till exactly on the dot - not a second before or after. Classes lack theory. Whatever theory you have is minimal and in broken English. Classes not in good condition. Fine for the price you pay and just for an "extra" add on to what you already know but should not be used as the backbone of your training for a professional career.

Excellent massage by skilled students - great price. What a nice break after a long day of sightseeing in the heat. The location is a bit hard to find - you have to walk down a small alley on an unmarked street. But, once you get there, they take you to a nice, quiet room with air conditioning. My boyfriend and I were able to lay on beds right next to each other, and got massages at the same time.You can get a one-hour thai massage for about $300 Bhat. The masseuses definitely know what they are doing and did a great job. It's not a fancy place at all - but they are all highly skilled. And, much cleaner than some of the cheaper massage places on the street.
Relaxing. This is where the art of Thai massage is learned. There is nothing better than the relaxing feeling after a good Thai massage.

Excellent way to cool off! Amazing
massage!. Great location, efficent therapists. Could
not fault this place! The 30 min thai massage was amazing!! 30 min foot massage was great for our tired feet. Professional therapists, clean school, sheets, towels etc. Loved it!

Just... excellent!. Tried the thai massage for the first time here and was just... excellent! Stringly reccomend it to finish a great day walking around the grand palace and surrounding Wats... really amazing!

The best place for Thai Massage in Thailand.. I have tried a few places for traditional massage in Thailand but none is as good as the one at Wat Pho. Of course, the price is higher than other places but I think it is worth it. The only other place that can match Wat Pho's quality would be Health Land.

Massage for the all family. For several years the all family including two small children aged 8 and 4, have had massage at the massage school of this beautiful temple in Bangkok. The staff is very good, well trained and professional. The massage therefore excellent. You get to be close to other people while getting a massage, but after the first seconds of despair, you get use to it . The vicinity to strangers although might seem occured does not bother you at all. Try the foot massage and get an additional one of not less then one hour. Leave a tip if they are good. They deserve it. Massage there are very affordable! Specially compared to any western price.

good massage at wat pho. tried it, a bit more expensive but it did not hurt. i like thai massage as it relaxes me being more rough...but this one was rough without hurting at all and it streched my muscles well. i recommend.

Great Massage. Excellent massage at an affordable price. The best way to unwind after a long day of travel. For females who worry if the massage will be too painful, don't worry. They do have female masseurs who will massage gently.
The best!. Simply the best massage you will get in Thailand. The atmosphere makes it all the better.

Only if you like very hard massage. Be careful ! This is a school, so people that massage you here are not - yet - professionals. The massages can be very hard and even hurt. So be very clear when you ask for your massage to be soft.It's not a "regular" place for massage. So I would recommend, if this is your first experience, to go to a regular spa. You will enjoy it more.

Take time out for a massage. The home of Thai massage in Thailand, Wat Po school has trained some of the mest Thai massage therapists in Thailand, and now around the world.Take a couple of hours to enjoy a massage here after you have visited The Grand Palace, Wat Phra Kaeo and Wat Po. Chill out and enjoy!

Hectic environment, great massage.. Not exactly an intimate setting, you're lying right next to other patrons and masseuses may be talking to one another.
That said, it's a great massage and it's quite cool to have it done right on the temple grounds. At the very least, it's worth the hour of your time and 500 baht.
World's best massage school. Recognized worldwide as the best place to learn medical massage, or enjoy it as a customer. Also on the UNESCO list as a "Memory of The World".
Excellent massage. Make sure you have enough time whilst visiting Wat Pho to enjoy either a foot or full body traditional massage.

Very Good. You don't have to wait,there are à lot of masseurs, and they do a great job. It's very clean and spotless.
Juist relax and enjoy
excellent after a long haul flight. communal room, but one of the best massages I had in Thailand.
relaxing massage. An oasis of calm and tranquility in a hot, busy tourist attraction. The foot massage was excellent value and so good.

First Massage. This was my first massage experience ever. It was nice, in a peaceful, clean place. It was "respectfully" accomplished if that makes sense, and the price was exceptional. My expectations were perhaps a little high based on reviews, and no prior massage. I would say that if you are visiting Wat Pho itself, and have the time - do it. If you a pushed for time, perhaps another place would be fine.

Loved it. This is the premier place in Thailand to have a massage --- very old and prestigious school. I only had an hour foot massage, but it was wonderful from beginning to end. When you're in Bangkok --- you've GOT to do this and the Wat Pho location is the best!!!! They offer different kinds of massage, etc.

Interesting and painful experience.... OK so when I heard that masseuses were trained at Wat Pho, I just had to try. Being a woman not yet familiar with Bangkok, it's a safe first option to get a traditional Thai massage without having to worry about the infamous happy ends...;-)Prices were high but very acceptable for a European tourist wallet's budget. After a short wait I was greeted by my -male- masseuse (they don't care too much about this unless you state it I think). The massage is done fully clothed and if you're wearing a skirt like I did, you'll get pants to cover up.The beds on which massages were performed were a little worn out, and it was busy in the room - don't expect any privacy.The massage itself was fascinating; for me it was very painful, but boy they do know to crack you in places you never thought it was possible! It's not suitable for those who want to relax, but if you've been walking around with an aching body and happen to find yourself at Wat Pho...consider it.
Great Value & Service. Good price, good service, very calming and relaxing - recommended

Worth every Bath!. This was a pricier foot massage but even though it was only supposed to be for 30 minutes, it ended up being more like 45! The woman who worked on my feet was amazing for her size and have a very gentle but FIRM touch. I could've had two more after she was done it was so invigorating.

Wat Pho. My favourite place to take visitors to Bangkok. A very unusual temple with some spectacular and unusual stupas etc. Would have given an excellent but last few times I've been they are doing renovations with little regard to visitors.

1st massage for me. First time i had a Thai massage and this was money well spent.
The place is worth tracking down as its away from the madness of Bangkok.
Cost 450bht, did not have to hang around long. Lasted for 1 hour and came out feeling 2 feet taller.
Highly recommended

Bit overpriced, but professional and with a deservedly good reputation. Sure you can get a 100THB for an hour foot, neck and shoulder massage in Bangkok, but you have to go a bit out of town to look for it. The Wat Po Massage School has a good reputation, and they do a good job. Staff are attentive, and the place is popular. How can you resist after walking around Wat Po, and knowing that you'll probably be walking around the Grand Palace the rest of the day! Blissful relaxation in the middle of a busy day! Go in and check them out.
A must do in Bangkok. Awesome!!!!!! A must. Wish I could do this every day.

Try the Thai herbal massage. Tip: go for the 1 hour option with the warm Thai herbs treatment for 520 baht; is worth it, not only because you are experienceing the massage at the 'serene' grounds of a temple complex, but also because of the smell of this warm herbal 'stamping'. It's definately something different from all the other massages. My experience here is that the staff is well trained and very dedicated to do their work, whether you go for the foot massage, the 'regular' one or the herbal one. If you want to avoid waiting times, try to be there around closing time 4.30-5.00 pm or early in the morning (8.30-10.00).

The most effective Thai massage. I am a connoseur of massage... I go to Thailand often enough, mainly for Thai food and Thai massage. I lost count of how many places I tried for Thai traditional massage. I went to Wat Pho for experience, I wanted to compare them with an average massage parlour in BKK or Chiang Mai. And they ARE different! I booked a half an hour session only (because of limited time and cost - they are not cheap...) but this half hour session was more effective than an hour and a half at a high street parlour. Took a lot of pains away, for a few days at least.
nice. nice but many students are there to give you massage.....

The real thing in Nuad Thai. This is the source for professional Thai massage ("nuad thai"). The monks do the honours and this can be a little intense for first timers unused to the quite hard/deep tissue style typical of Thai massage. There is no privacy as you lie on matts directly next to other attendees.

not to be missed. a massage here is guaranteed to be worth your while. The lady who i saw fixed my frozen shoulder which no-one in australia was able to do. She worked wonders on the first visit so i went back almost every day over my 2 wk stay in bangkok. She obviously knew her anatomy very very well and i felt totally comfortable in her hands. Truly amazing. Do not miss a massage her if you are in Bangkok.

Thai massage school. Interesting school to visit but sadly too many of Thailands massage girls have never been to this school and too many learn on the "street" by watching other none qualified girls do clueless massages. Sadly, I have tried Thai massages so many times across Thailand and every time find the massages way too rough, leaving me sore for days. grossly overrated in my opinion, no matter how cheap DON'T BOTHER unless you like the pain! Love Thailand and its people but their "massages" are not part of the love I have.
good massage. Get a massage! I had just 30 min and doubted if doing it or not for the time...well, take my advise and DO IT! It´s great and you will fell FANTASTIC

Best massage of our lives!!. Our hotel arranged for two ladies from the school of Wat Pho to come to our hotel and give my husband and I a massage in our room. For an hour massage we paid around $100 (US Dollars) for both of us. It was the best massage of our lives!! Highly, highly recommend.

Move to New Place. when i visited that place,the tour guide told us,that they have a new renovated one:)near by,but the main one was still in the heart of the temples:) you should go there for a massage,that's truly the right place to experience thai culture and relax abit
A must. Get a massage! I had just 30 min and doubted if doing it or not for the time...well, take my advise and DO IT! It´s great and you will fell FANTASTIC

Top quality massage not only for tourist. We went to visit sleeping Bhudda statue and browing around we meet primary massage school in Bangkok. This is "mentor" massage school and if you stay few days you can attend a daily training to learn how to make "original" thai massage. Just fro yr bnefits Thai people have the habit to get foot massage almost evry where, but if they have time and money enough they get also a full body nassage and here is one of best place to get it. There is a prize to pay (waiting list of 1 hour or more, it depends what time of the day you get there) but beleive ne it's great and well spent money at reasonable price , compare the hotel massage or other Fitness centre and SPA mainly fro tourism. If i can advise you don't miss it.
Excellent massage!. Excellent massages! Even if they are busy they give you a ticket to come back later! So relaxing!
Excellent. Defintely better massage than most places on the street.. I have been told there is a branch of this school on a side street that has air conditioning and rarely has a line.

Massage. It's a school, so a lot of the practitioners are not that great. On the other hand, it's cheap. But when you can get a massage anywhere for 200 baht (six dollars), who needs to go all the way to Wat Pho?
Feet massage, a must!. My second time in Bangkok and second feet massage! Amazing :))
amazing. Giant reclining Bhudda has to be seen to be believed. Massage in the top Thai School of Massage is a must
authentic thai massage. you can find a cheap authentic thai massage here, they know how to put pressure to you at the same time you can relax after a long walk

nice. my wife had the "traditional Thia massage" and it was alot of pulling and pushing. She did not like. I had the foot massage and the women worked on my feet and legs for an hour and charged me less then $10 american dollars or 250 bht. Nice, very relaxing
best foot massage. I had the best one hour foot massage ever! I recommend that everyone choose a massage, and all the professionals here seem well trained and very good.

Perfect place for your first Thai massage.. Get a massage before you tour the grounds and see the giant reclining Buddha. This is one of the official schools teaching the art and science of Thai massage. Well worth the trip and effort.

A great experience for most. We went by here but because I already had Thai spa appts at our hotel, we did not experience the actual massage school- what I did love was the area where there were historical images of the Tha massage training in the stone of the buiding...this is where Thais would come and learn the skill!
Great temple and massage. Wonderful temple and if interested you can learn Thai Traditional Massage or just have one :)

Cracked in places I didn't know existed!. My first Thai massage was in the US and I really wasn't a fan. My second Thai massage was here and I am hooked!I was worried the massage was going to be sketchy and in a hot, sticky room. Could't be further from the truth.The main room had an hour wait so we were escorted to an alternate location across the street where we had incredible massages in a cool, clean room. They give you Thai massage pants which were a bit tricky to secure, but were comfortable. The room wasn't private and there were about 6 other people getting massages with no curtains or dividers. Not a big deal since no one is naked.The massage is more expensive than a lot of places outside, but is still a steal at ~420 baht or around $14 USD. I had massages just about every day of the trip and this was among the best.

Well worth the wait. Cheap and good. The massage here at the school is excellent. The setup is all open planned so you may end up getting a massage with a complete stranger next to you. Get pulled pushed and stretched into a multitude of positions.

The authentic Thai massage. If you go to Naples, have the original pizza. If you go to Morocco, the original tagine. In Thailand, experience the original Thai massage without the flaky extras at the home of this healing artform. The therapists know exactly what they are doing and provide their therapy in a calm, peaceful surroundings. Not to be missed.

Straight forward and very good..!. We got turned on to this place while visiting Wat Pho Temple... They offered massages services at a small facility within the temple grounds... They were extremely busy and suggested we go to their school less than a 5 minute walk away... One of their staff was nice enough to walk us there... When we got there we opted for a 1 hour hot herbal massage... Their was nothing fancy about the place... We went to a room where there were about 10 other people in different stages of massages... The girls we had were both very professional and asked questions about any problems we might have medically of physically... I mentioned a nerve problem in my lower back and she soon got to work... It was obvious during the massage that she payed special attention to this area and it surely showed when I was finished with my massage... Probably the best straight forward massage I have ever had and would suggest it to anyone... Couldn't think of a better way to relax after sightseeing in the Wat Pho area... They even have a small shop where you can purchase different types of massage oils... If you are looking for a massage with "extra services" you are looking in the wrong place..!
Great cheap massages. The students give great inexpensive massages. Nice place to visit.

It's no better than many other places. I guess you think you are going to get something extra special as Wat Pho is the massage schoo but in reality the massage experience is no better here than in many other places in Bangkok and it's rather more expensive than a typiclal Thai place but competative with western hotels for pricing.
Imperdible. It is great to get a massage one hour with herbs, very good and relaxant!
Amazing history. The history of this place is fascinating. When people think of Thai massage, this is what they should really think about. I highly recommend taking the time to get a message here.
You should Go. If any other masseur at Bangkok bother you, you must come to Wat Pho for being well

Not as sure.... OK, all reviews here are raving about the massage, so it's probably me who is getting this wrong, but I did not get as good a feeling as I had in sexy massages, something was missing...Just kidding!Just kidding, of course but, I am serious about not being totally convinced, maybe I was just unlucky but the young guy who massaged me (very professional) seemed at times to go through the motions.Lots of details were not taken care of, not a lot of pressure sometimes, I wasn't asked whether I had any pain points, I got a quick drink as I was walking out.The place was crammed with tourists, so it was not quiet, I felt it was a bit overrated.Certainly the location is great, right within the compound. Price was higher than elsewhere (520Baht for 1hr herbal). You get there rather sweaty and have no chance to recover, or was a bit, straight into the hands of the masseur..When I left I wasn't feeling that kind of relaxation feeling that I had after other massages.Would I go back? Yes, because it's so cheap I certainly would do it, but given a choice I'd rather to it in an airconditioned environment, with soft zen music, rather than screaming tourists, in a place where I am given a vest, some privacy and the ability to wash up before the massage, and ideally with an older masseur or masseuse, who is more likely to know what she is doing... sorry to go against the majority view here...
Okay. AN okay massage, but may not be as extraordinary as others.Students learning.
very relaxing. More expensive than other equally good massages around the city, but definitely worth the fee--especially after a nice walk around the palace.
where it all began. it's worth at least once getting a massage where it all began - not the best ambiance, but the massages are first rate
dont miss it!. for 420 bahts you can destress for an hour. it took us only few minutes to look for the massge school

Fantastic for your Health!!!. Most relaxation with this traditional Thai Massage from Wat Pho Thai Massage School, totally relief any painful out from your body.
I need it on a weekly basis to boost up the energy in my body..

excellent, best massage ever. this temple is brautiful and a university centre of thailand since 19th century. worth visiting, especially highly recommended the massage by the masseur who preserve the traditional thai massage and medicine.
best massage we have ever had
ask for 1h, it is worth
The temple, not the massage. I would never go back to wat pho because an addmission charge is levied on foreigners. Although I have Thai driving licenses and live in Thailand I would have to pay.

Best massage ever. We visited the temple of the reclining Buddha, but we were more interested in the massage school, as the people who get their degree there work in the same premise. We had our best foot massage ever and we'd have liked to try other kinds of massage, but the waiting list was too long...

Cheap Traditional Thai massage and treatments. You can get massages from students here at very cheap prices as they are practising to gain hours and experience. Try it for the traditional culture and atmosphere. I've trained here for Thai Massage, Herbal Compress and will be back this March for Infant Massage.

Was Even better then i remember.... Took a 10 days course , more then 20 years ago..But this time only 1/2 an hour Break massage . The Massage , as expected was exellent, and the faccillities were upgraded to a very nice aircondition huge hall with nice atmosphere. There was no waiting , and the price was almost the same as i remember....
Best massage in Thailand. Very good massage and highly professional. I went 3 times

Relaxation. This is a great way to start the day or end it. Also the school has a place across the street that is not as crowded and a little grungier but has masseuses that are trained by the same people.

Fab. I'd read about the massage school in a guidebook and wasn't disappointed.
It is almost exactly as I'd expected and the massage was great.
Very traditional and atmospheric wee place.
Definitely recommended.

Excellent massage in the usual crowded place. If you are looking for authentic Thai Massages this is the place if you don't mind feeling a little crowded. Service is as always very friendly with the Thai Smile.

Best Thai Massage. I've had a few Thai Massages and some of them feel more like punishment and even dangerous to your joints and skeleton. However, Wat Pho is the home of Thai massage where anyone who wants to practice seriously has to qualify. They actually ask you if you have any injuries before they start! Thoroughly enjoyed. More expensive than street Thai massage, but worth it.

The best massage ever. I suggest while visiting the What Pho themple to visit the Wat Pho Traditional Massage School. This place both provides courses for those that would learn to give Thai Massage and also provide massage for those that only want to enjoy some relax receiving it. I suggest both the activities as the School is probably the best one, and also receiving massage in this place is a to-do experience.

Great Experience. Besides being a wonderful temple, the traditional Thai massage in the complex, is a great experience and inexpensive. This is where the traditional Thai massage was first taught. There is a very convenient ferry to Wat Arun, which is also well worth a visit.

I go to the Wat Pho school of massage on Soi 36. Cheap and excellent massages.. I have some favorite woman that I request. They know my body and know what to work on. The staff at the front desk are not friendly but don't let them discourage you. The massages, all of them, from the foot massage to the Thai massage are excellent. The place is not stylish but the massages are the best.
good massage - professional. I've been there 4 times and have always had a good massage. Worth a nice break in your tours of Grand Palace and Wat Pho
Used to be good. but has now become a bit of tourist trap, and the quality of the massage has gone down. Save the trip - you are better going to any legal and local places
great massages. Great thai massages for super cheap. Dont miss it. its a great break from the walking/site-seeing.
Don't miss!. wonderful people who work there. I did not like the pink pajama looking clothes they gave me to wear. I am not too fond of pink of anything. Well worth the wait and money!
A little different!. Excellent, some stunning buildings and a little different than most temples.

Thai Massage at Wat Pho temple in Bangkok. My first of three trips to Thailand dates back to 2001 shortly after the 9/11 tragedy.I was one of a small number of Americans in Thailand as the continued terrorist threat loomed large. I stayed at a modest hotel called Vienthai in Bangkok. The location was ideal and I found myself walking everywhere. Shortly after midnight I found myself at a temple straining in the near pitch blackness of the night to see what turned out to be kids playing basketball. There must have been a school on the grounds with a basketball court because the sounds of pivoting sneakers and the dribbling of a ball were unmistakable, I now realized I had walked perhaps 12 hours or so since arriving at 4:30am the previous morning .The following morning I was beset with foot strain, remnants of travel fatigue and the shock of 9/11 wore on me.When asking the hotel concierge of sorts how I might spend the day considering my weary state, he suggested I take a Tuk-Tuk (three wheeled open air taxi) to Wat Phra Kao and Wat Pho temples. He explained of their tranquil surroundings being good for me and suggested I allow myself to experience a Healing Traditional Thai massage. What a great suggestion he made as that was my first foot massage experience. How many times I wish I could rewind the clock and find a Thai massage practitioner following many long hikes in the Sierra Nevadas of Northern California. I knew nothing of reflexology, pressure points, deep tissue work (therapeutic massage). Up until this point my healers were Orthopedic surgeons, chiropractors and traditional western M.D.’s., massage and deep tissue therapy were completely foreign to me.My speedy recovery, renewed energy and unfailing feet for the remainder of my 3 week Thailand adventure I owe a debt of thanks to the youthful Thai massage practitioner who with great humility and respect treated me. On my 2nd and 3rd travel adventures to Thailand I never failed to seek out Thai masseuses/therapists especially those specializing in deep tissue work and feet massage. They were often found at the local day spa or the hotel. I went as often as time would allow given the active travel itinerary. It was becoming very apparent that massages were not a once in a lifetime luxury as they may be perceived here in the US , but rather a necessity for our maintaining optimum health. Now a decade later I find myself fortunate to have found an exceptional Therapeutic Thai massage therapist in Sedona, Arizona where I reside. The place is called Sedona Royal Thai Massage. Her total focus, attention and skill set have allowed me the greatest relief / recovery from both the myriad of sports related injuries I have suffered along with the spine, back, and neck repercussions from 4 serious car accidents in the Us spanning three plus decades. I never cease to be amazed that her work can erase the damage caused so years ago.

Great Foot Massage after sightseeing. Right next door to the Reclining Buddha. Great place for authentic Thai or foot massage. Big room with lots of chairs - really enjoyed the foot massage after a tiring day sightseeing. More like accupressure - painful at times but felt really good in the end !

Very high quality massage. Had my first massage here and it was great. Very professional staff and a comfortable environment. I've since come to learn that great massage can be had in BKK for a little less money, it's still a great deal and a good way to unwind after touring Reclining Buddha (Wat Pho), which is also a must-see!

I have visited this school many times to refresh and update my skills. They have always treated me with dignity and respect. It is the oldest and largest Thai massage school with many international students. I was fortunate to be taught by one of the founder Lamyong and her son Pravaet who are the true master of this healing art that truly benefit the whole humanity. I am very sad that one of my favorite teacher had just passed Suraphone...You will be greatly missed.

The Original and Best Thai Massage. why go anywhere else when you can get a massage at the epicenter of Thai massage. This is where the best come to train and perfect the art of the massage. Don't you deserve the best?

Save your money. The actual college is hard to find and the staff were not friendly or helpful at all. They are not flexible when it comes to learning skills and despite having credentials you must complete the full course - a way to maximise profit. The practitioners are touting for business within the complex Wat Pho - and they were quite good. Since they were students I expected either more value for my money or more depth in knowledge of medical science. One good thing - no sexual favours available or offered! That was good!

Great massage. This was a welcome respite as we were bone tired from flying and sightseeing. It was a first rate thai massage in a group environment. A little more expensive than most thai massage places, but you can't beat it for quality and convenience.
Hot, crowded and not so clean.. There are so many places to get a nice Thai massage in a cool, calm environment but this is not one of them.

For the traditionnal experience. Located in the Wat Pho courtyard, in the middle of temples and Buddhas.A big room with dozens of massage bed, the smell of the traditional massage herbs.A nice experience if you like massages and can't afford a spa.
Relief after bike riding. Lovley after a day of bike riding. This is a lovely place for a massage and the staff are well trained.

Thai Massage Training @ Wat Po. I have thai massage class at Wat Po Massage School. I was booked from www.thaimassagetraining.net Everything was excellent ! (great accommodations and round trip transfer to hotel and school everyday also great day trip on weekend). We bought only $ 833 each package (6 nights/7days). We registered for 4 courses. And It was serprise me. We recived one gift voucher massage class from this company. then we choosed Ascetic self-stretching (Rue-Si Datton) Course - 5 Hours. These are great class and services by this company and Wat Po Massage School. Next year, we would love to take class from this Wat Po again and Service from this company.- Massage Courses are very nice instructors and excellent classes.- Accommodation Room is very clean- Breakfast is good- Transfers to school is on times. (very nice driver)- Trips on weekend was great! as Floating market or snorkeling in Phuket.P.S. If anyone is intersting to take massage class. I recommened this company. their website is www.thaimassagetraining.net

Great massage. Very professional massage place. Cool airconditioned place with nice scent in the air. The massage was top notch and a good price. Look out because we had been recommended it and saw a sign at the main gate which turned out to be another place which takes you over the road and up a side street. Go for wat pho traditional massage - it's the real deal!

So-so. I was so used to the deep-tissue of the Javanese massage, so I didn't find the massage from this place so magical. To be brutally honest, I found that the place was so overrated for getting a weak massage from a pro. The massage did not cure my fatigue nor did it recharged my depleting energy. However, I found that the air-conditioned massage school an oasis after walking half-day in the heat.

Wow - it hurts!. I was determined to have my first massage at the school. Being a massage student myself I understand the importance of practising on models. I had a 30 minute treatment whilst my husband waited with our guide in the air conditioned reception. I was taken to a large room with rows of beds and invited to lie down. The masseur ( a young man) was very firm and at times brought tears to my eyes. I stopped him a couple of times to ask for lighter movements especially in my legs which were still a little swollen from the flight and the walking I had done. Really this was my fault as I had not read much about Traditional Thai massage. After my massage my legs felt amazing, my back was a little sore - was it worth it- definitely!

Hurt so good!. After 1 1/2 weeks of traveling, my feet and back were killing me. I opted for a 30 min massage because I didn't think my painful, sore muscles could handle torture for an hour. I was right. He did a great job, places were painful but yet I felt relief when I left. You are given a small cup of tea afterwards. Prices are phenomenal, wait time was about 30 minutes.

Heaven and Hell. No nonsense, deep tissue, aggressive massage, but with great finesse. It was an amazing experience. We each had the 1 hour foot and leg massage, followed by the 1 hour back, shoulder, neck and head massage. We both felt like rubber dolls after we left, but not without moments of downright pain. They are extremely talented at applying the right pressure, but this massage is not for the timid!!

Highly recommend for traveller. I had experienced the Traditional Thai Massage and Foot Massage in Wat Pho several times. Most of the massue is very good there. Highly recommend for those who loves the body stretch, deep pressure massage! The Foot Massage is very relaxing :)

Wat Po, Caveat Emptor. Be advised that these massages are the screaming-in-pain type. My first time will definitely be my last time. Remember, these masseurs are students-in-training. Think "dental school" or "beauty school," and then you'll be prepared to take what they give you.

get pulled. Inexpensive legit Thai massage. After a long day of walking tours, stop in here for a massage. Especially foot massage. The traditional Thai body massage is NOT like western massage (swedish or deep tissue) and is more of a kneeding and pulling type so I went for foot massages all the way. Foot massage is 350 Baht for 50 minutes.

Don't go....unless you are masochist. I have received and studied much Thai massage and the Wat Pho massage was s huge disappointment. The guy who massaged me would press until it was hurting and then add a little roll at the end just to amplify the pain. I went with a girl who not only had the very painful massage but more than once there was inappropriate touching. I love Thai massage but sadly this place is a disgrace. Go to Chiang Mai if you want a decent Thai massage.

I'd pass on the massage. Go there, take a photo of the temple and teh reclining Buddha and leave. Not unless you are interested in being prodded and poked painfully in front of many other strangers undergoing the same torturous ritual. I was so dissapointed. It is a massage factory!

Traditional but lacking. I had a massage here last week, it was fairly early in the day and was quiet but something seemed to be lacking, maybe it was just that it felt like you were on a factory line. It was just rather too clinical. I have had a lot better traditional Thai massages. At 360 Baht it is quite expensive for local standards.Having said that it's interesting to see the environment and later in the day if you want a relaxing as opposed to forceful and potentially uncomfortable massage it will be just fine for you.

Traditional Thai massage. I highly recommend getting a traditional thai massage at wat pho. It's not luxurious, in fact it's rather clinical, but what an experience indeed.From changing into the smocks to being manipulated 8 inches away from the French woman laying next to me. Wat Pho is around the corner from the Grand Palace. Once inside Wat Pho it's rather difficult to find, but it's worth the search. If you go in from the main entrance, to the right is the reclining buddha (inside a structure you'll have to take off your shoes). if you go to the left, and all the way to the end of the grounds, you will hit a wall. Don't hit it. :) Turn right and you will see bungalos and when you see euphoric looking people outside sipping water, you're there.

Hard work and very fun. I had a brilliant time learning thai massage at Wat Po. I paid 8,000THB, which is the normal price, and was constantly surrounded by teachers. There was always at least 1 teacher per 4 students. Their english isn't brilliant for the most part, but it doesn't matter as what you're learning is very practical and tactile. When english was needed, there was always an english speaking teacher availalble. It is hard work, as you give massage about half the time you're there at least and that's 4hrs a day. One hour for lunch and then another 4 hours in the afternoon. The canteen is excellent, 40THB and everyone is also very friendly. You get rice, vegetables, meat, dessert,...I was sad to leave at the end of the course, and will return for part 2. Definitely worth attending, but only if you are genuinely interested in giving thai massage. Otherwise, like some people on my course, you will get bored very quickly.

screen your teacher before enrollment. In January 2007 I traveled to Bangkok and enrolled in Wat Pho's massage school. Their website and all travel books stated the tuition was 7000BHT. When I arrived it had jumped to 8500BHT. They refused to honor the advertised price. I enrolled anyway. 30 hours of massage lesson - not bad (US$280) though huge by Thai standars. My instructor showed up 40 minutes late the first day, and then spent another 40 minutes talking about himself and his teaching history, but worst, I was told my class would be taught in English, but it was split 1/2 Thai, 1/2 English. So half the time was spent translating back and forth from one to the other. Questions were never translated unless I requested. I asked for a new class. I was told when I returned the next day I would have one (one day out of 5 lost). Next I was given a teacher that took cell phone calls, invited friends in from outside the class to work on them while he should have been teaching us, and finally, when I was giving this instructor a massage he fell asleep! On the last day, he noticed I was having pain in my lower back. He offered to correct it, and yanked on me in a way that actually slipped a disk in my back. I have had 4 chiropractic sessions since returning to the US and it is still not healed. Finally, at my final test, I was quite embarassed because the reviewer kept correcting me and told me I should know these simple steps (I didnt becasue my teacher never told me). I filed a complaint with the dean, but he was so nervous he escorted me out of his office and gave me to a student for a free massage. For a slipped disk?I do know however, that the teacher next to me was excellent and actually advised me as much as my own. So, pick and choose wisely. Its my honest belief they got in guidebooks, are making alot of money, and living off past reviews. Their big price jump and unwillingness to act on my behalf tells me loud and clear it is more about money than student learning at this point. I would look elsewhere or at least get in writing absolutely everything before you start. Perhaps observe your teacher teaching prior if possible. Mine was a 45+ yr old man with a large face mole. Do pass on him.

Joint cracking fun!. Having been to the palace on a few previous visits to Bangkok and never had the time to get a massage, on my last visit I decided to take the plunge. The massage school is very popular and you may have to wait 20-30mins, depending on the time of day. The students have amazing energy - massaging like crazy all day. It's not a private experience, and is rather energetic, completely different to a Swedish massage, for example, but not as painful as some remedial massages I have had. They make your body do things you didn't think possible - the most memorable point for me was definitely hearing every vertabra crack one by one! Afterwards you are rewarded with a cold drink. Apart from the standard Thai massage, foot massages are also available.

Spa for tourists. I have been to Health Land 5 times, over a year as it is located near the place I stay. The premises and the rooms are well maintained and kept clean. I have had reasonably good massages there, however it is just a matter of chance that you are allocated to an experienced masseuse or not. Of late, the place has become too commercial, catering to group of tourists from Asia, who are herded by tour operators. The waiting period is long and the procedure for booking is cumbersome. If you are waiting in the lobby, you have to be lucky to be served some water by the scores of staff who are wandering around without much purpose. Overall the place gives you an impression that you are not welcome or rather the onus is on you to get the superlative service....My last visit was the worst experience ever in Thailand. The masseuse was a lady in 50's, quiet healthy that she couldn't sit properly on the floor beside the mattress for doing the massage. She was disinterested from the beginning and was doing a very soft massage, rather was using her knees to just push instead of a proper Thai massage. She started telling that business had been poor in the current situation, hinting towards good tips. After 10minutes she started doing the massage with single hand and kept on scratching her shoulder with her other hand. Then she opened some sachet and poured the contents to her mouth and started chewing. After about 45 minutes she seemed tired and asked me if she can watch television while massaging. At this point, I requested her to stop the massage and said that I would leave. On the way back, I conveyed my displeasure as a complaint to one of the ladies in the uniform at the reception. The response was a 'sorry' and she wrote my name on a pocket book. When one is willing to pay more than the usual rates in Bangkok for a clean space and a massage from an expert, why take a chance at a tourist trap !
Massage spa asoke. Heard about the review is good but disappointed in service. Took the 2 hour massage Thai $550 baht but not so good. Tipping at least $100 baht. Unable

Value for money, comfortable place.
