We came without reservation and immediately welcomed by a sales lady.We took the Thai massage since this is what we saw the most valuable service from them.We were asked to wait for 10 minutes then we were called and ushered by our masseur to the waiting room. There were a change slippers and when we got to our room, there were change pants and shirt.The massage itself was good, however a bit disappointed that the masseur didn't check with us whether the pressure was enough or not.Overall it was a nice experience.

Its like a 5 star!. Have been visiting this place frequently over the past few years and they are still neat clean and offer good massages, esp body masages, like thai massage. For foot massages better try other places, their's is a bit generic without the accupressure etc

First visit to Health land Asoke. I like the foot reflexology at Health Land Asoke. We walked in at about 6.30pm and had to,wait only about 10minutes for them to arrange the masseurs. Given a pair of pants to change. The reclining chair was extremely comfortable. After the short few minutes of neck and shoulder massage at the end, I felt so relieved from my aches. I really enjoyed the experience.

Horrible experience . The masseuse I was assigned to was rude and rough. I would never return to this branch. The two hour massage was one of the worst I've had. Lots of Chit chat between masseuse as we got the couple room. Didn't even ask which type of oil we preferred, instead poured heaps of it on TOP of our heads to start of the massage. Hair pulling was rough and head massage equaled to head banging on the beginning

Legit Thai Massage!. It was the nearest nice massage spa to my hotel in Asoke. When I arrived, the lobby looked so classy & wide. I went to the desk & they asked my name for the priority list. I sat at their big comfy couch while waiting. When my name was called, I walked downstairs and was accompanied by my massage therapist, she was around 40-50 years old I think. She took my shoes & gave me new slippers. We went inside the elevator, and was brought up to a private room with a sliding door. I was told to change clothes & then she started the massage. I had 2-hour Thai massage that time. The therapist was really good and experienced. My bones were cracking but in a good way haha. She always ask me if the pressure was okay. I changed clothes after the massage, then she told me to tip her. I was satisfied so I gave her 100ThB. Then we went to the elevator again and went downstairs. She then gave me a tea to drink & returned my shoes.

Great inexpensive spa. I always use the Asoke branch of this spa group. Very large complex within walking distance of Sukhumvit Rd. Offers foot massages, Thai body massages, aromatic oil massage...all at very inexpensive pricesVery clean and efficient operation- you do need to call ahead for appointments as they are very popular and book up quickly.

Goto place for afforable massage in a classy venue. Once we touched down, we quickly gave the branch a call to book a 2hr thai massage that evening. Located near asoke BTS, it is the best place for getting a affordable massage in a classy building. My masseuse was good but understand that one of my friends got a not too good one. So I guess it depends on luck.

Good choice for Spa and massage . This is a big spa and massage therapy place and price is very reasonable compare other well known spa shop in Bangkok. Like a hotel lobby for checking in. Massage room is more or less the same. The massage lady is very good. But too many custoers made the lobby a little bit noise. Not give a quite and warm welcome like other medium spa shop. Mostly I gave 10% tips for different spa or massage but minimum 100b . Try this one by call booking is ok. No need prepaid . But give them a notice if no show.

Best Thai Massage with 5 star facilities. This was my third visit to Health Land. Earlier I visited their place at Pattaya. This place was also very spacious and neat with very good facilities. I had taken a traditional Thai Massage of 2 hours. The experience was too good. In fact I fell into sleep for time. The massage was very much relaxing. The masseuse was experienced and made me relax. They also sell their own brand of beauty products at a discounted price here. I tried some of them and are good.

Very professional massage centre. We made our reservation 2 days in advance to avoid the disappointment as heard that the massage center always fully booked and crowded.It was really a good massage experience here and we enjoyed it so much. Felt so relaxed and comfortable.The room was clean and comfortable. The massage lady's skills was good and professional.Price is a bit expensive if compare to normal massage center outside but it was a good experience to try it once a while.

Amazing experience. I felt soooo relaxed after the 1.5hrs massage in Health Land Spa. The place was clean. The ambiance was peaceful. I got my own massage room with a shower. The lady asked me few times if the pressure is OK for me.It is a bit more expensive compared to the other saloons on the streets, however it's worth the money.You need to call in advance to make a booking as it is one of the best massage places in Bangkok and it is usually fully booked. We were told by one of our Thai friends that this is where the local people go for a clean and professional massage.They have few locations in Bangkok.

Mr. A fan no more- We went two days in a row and certain things about their process was more noticeable. A pushy sales guy and his demeanor was especially annoying; how terrible of Health Land to make him such a big part of the customer experience. He stands in front of cashier. Apparently he is there to push customers to commit to something, even if it means offering misleading information, then changing the topic of discussion to choosing one of two options he provides. He only wanted to talk about two different massages with two different wait times for just those two massages, "25 minutes or one hour wait." We told him we wanted deep tissue. Then we further explained we wanted more pressure. We choose his recommended massage with a 25 minute wait; it was at most reflexology, very light touch; I'm still knotted up . His English speaking ability is good, why not use this skill to actually consult, not lie and push? He was just as pushy on day one. He's not there to help you select what's good for you. We felt like he's there to keep the lines moving.

Excellent Massage on excellent premises. This place looks great, they advertise it is as a clinic, and it feels good to get to a classy environment with all modern amenities. All the masseuses are middle aged and not a single on is good looking which means that they were all chosen for their expertise.Reception staff speaks decent English so it was easy to communicate. I had a session of foot massage , head massage and traditional Thai massage. Very much recommended.The place is always full of Japanese tourists and they certainly know what good massage is. You do nto have to book in advance, but it is wise to do so if you want to ensure that you do not wait during busy times.

Best value 💵 and the very best Thai massage . 850 Baht for 2 hours Thai massage with hot herbal compress in private room. They might not have the bells and whistles, and no mango sticky rice after, but the massage was top notch the therapist clicked every joint and I felt like a new man after! Highly recommended

Great price and great service! . I tried the full body Thai massage, foot massage and oil massage. All were great! It is clean and the service has remained consistent over he many years I have been a customer!
Great massage!. Extremely affordable and great full body massage. Professional staff and clean facilities. Recommended to book an appointment in advance via telephone.

Disappointing expensive service. This place is too commercialized. It's always crowded with bus load of tourist. The 3 masseurs, for my parents and myself, kept chatting and giggling in Thai while working on our Thai traditional massages. The skill applied were mediocre and way overprice. We had experienced better skill from those smaller shops by the road sides. 3 other family members who gone with aromatherapy massage had similar experiences. It not worth paying more than 2000bath for the aromatherapy massage.On existing the premises, all the 3 masseurs who attending to my parents and me requested for tips. I think this is totally unprofessional, although I usually give tips for a good massage.I don't think I'll be returning to this place or any if its branches.

Lousy Foot Massage. We called to book 2hrs in advance and still business was so good we had limited slots for full body massage. So i settled for the foot massage and it must be one of the lousiest i had. The therapist was a young lady and it was minimal communication. She missed all the basic pressure points and focused way too much on the shin. I lived with ugly bruises all over the shin the next few days. No skills to speak of. Waste of my time and should have tried another spa.

Juzer Gabajiwala . Went for a Thai massage and it was truly amazing. Surprised to find it quite cheap compared to what is offered outside. A must visit for those who want a genuine massage with no "hanky panky" business. Very short walk of 5-7 mins from Robinsons on Asoke
Terrible staff attitude. The staff don't even look at you and not even want to explain the package they are offering. We all the way to there and have made the reservation. Poor experience
Good massage, average service. Went in for an oil massage. The front office is a bit too terse for my liking, bordering rude. The massage however, was quite good and relaxing.

Book if you want full body massage. Advisable to book if you want a full body massage which is 2 hours. If you just want a 1 hours foot and back massage, advisable to go before 5pm or in the morning. Definitely avoid peak hours like evening. LONG queue! Standard of massage is quite consistent. More importantly, clean and hygienic place. Doesn't appear dodgy. Near to Asoke BTS Station. 7 mins walk from the station.

First time having a massage. It was my first massage so I do not have any benchmark to compare this experience. But the place is very clean. It was really relaxing. It was a little more expensive than the other prices I saw on the streets, but this place is really professional.

Very professional . I was surprised about how big the place was! It was very professional . I had the standard 2 hour Thai massage and it was very cheap for what it was at 550 baht. I most definitely recommended.

A rare unpleasant service.... On Monday, 12/09/2016, around 9:30ish pm. I invited my family to have a foot massage in this place.I was not feeling quite well that time. That was the first time we went to have foot massage in the evening. Usually, we go there afternoon or around 7:00ish pm the latest.Usually, we are satisfied of their service. For some unfortunate reason, the service we had that night was quite poor, not as what we have expected, at least. The masseuses were quite not energetic anymore. 1 of them was already in a bad mood. I do not know what has happened. We were just thinking that maybe, they are already tired since it was quite too late already.

No Service. Recently when we were there for massage, the masseurs out rightly asked us for tips after the massage even before we changed our clothes. We thought we heard wrongly but they waited for us outside and even counted the money in front of us! It's appalling! On a separate occasion, we made a booking with them and as we were running late, we called to inform. The operator reply was that it's ok.Upon reaching about 5 min late, the customer service told us that our booking is cancelled! (No apology or alternate solution was given)Even when we told her that we made a call and the "customer service officer" reply was :"late means late"I guess they have been getting too many business and service is no longer their priority: MONEY is.Even though it is considerably cheap, I will not return for such stuck-up service.

A good place for relaxing massage . We went there for Thai massage. It's just 550 Thb for 2 hours of Thai message. The staff there are very friendly and massage are very comfortable. Place is relaxing and clean.
Health Land rocks . Best place in Bangkok to get any kind of massage! Ask for Saeng, #187 and get the best Thai massage of your life!! I can also highly recommend the foot reflexology.

ReasonablyGood Message. For the 950 bath 90 minutes. I think they offer reasonably good message. I took the aromatherapy message. The place is nice and clean. Lack of little details in the service for this price range. For example I did not get to choose the fragrance of the aromatherapy. Body lotion was not offered at the completion of the aromatherapy message. Pandan tea was offered at the completion. Of course tip is expected, I think 10% from the price is plenty.
great, clean massage. very nice professional spa with prices beating those small massage shops. clean and nice. 2hr Thai massage costs 550 Baht. highly recommended

Good and consistent foot massage.... Healthland has several branches in Bangkok and in some major cities around Thailand. Have been coming for their facials (they use Jurlique) and foot massages. I recently tried their branch is Asoke and I'm impressed by their consistency in service delivery. Their facilities are clean and relaxing but their bigger value proposition is their people whom are well trained. My foot massage was most enjoyable - I was able to sleep through most of it and woke up well rested and rejuvenated. Their prices are very competitive, too and can rival the street corner parlors scattered all over the city.

The clock lies. Visited for a Thai massage shortly before leaving Bangkok to loosen up some muscles after days of walking. Was very disappointed with the experience - the lady who massaged me didn't seem to know what she was doing - she was massaging me all over the place (e.g. head, feet, arm, leg, arm, feet, back, leg). I've had quite a few Thai massages in my day and I know they tend to follow a specific pattern. I also layed flat through most of the massage and wasn't really twisted or put into any unsual positions to get those knots out.Further, I noticed that the massage started at 6pm by my phone and finished at 8pm by the clock in my room. By when I got changed and got escorted back downstairs - it was only 7.45pm by my watch - meaning I lost at least 20 minutes of massage time. The ladies are also very expectant of tips - she kept looking at me until I handed some notes to her and she then proceeded to count them - with no decorum. Further, one lady I shared a lift with proceeded to squeeze her spots using the lift mirror - disgusting. They should really learn about customer service.

Below average; except u are new or just want cheap massage in bangkok. First time trying out this massage centre. The receptionists were polite. Front hall was luxury. However, it was different when u start entering the place. We have ordered traditional thai massage for 2 hours.The thai masseuses were non-stop chit chatting throughout the whole session. They were not professional, have NO energy and NO proper skill to do the traditional massage like other places that we have tried before.. Time were also cut shorter at least 15 mins. It might be a good trial for those who never or seldom do thai massage. Might be cheap but for me, is a waste of time and money.

Clean, trusted and affordable thai massage. Slightly more expensive than the thai massage shops along the streets, as this is more for tourists than locals. However, one can be assured of the cleanliness, reliability and quality of the massage here. Do remember to call in or get your hotel staff to call in to book a slot before heading down, as it can get very busy and walk-ins may not be guaranteed a slot. There are many rooms and multiple storeys available. You can request for a twin room if going with your partner or just have 2 of you. A regular thai massage is about 500 bhat for 2 hours. Other options such as aroma therapy or facial or herbal body spa are available but much more expensive. Most people opt for thai massage (full body) or foot massage here. Getting here is easy, best way to get here would be by taxi/uber from your hotel, or you can also walk from Asoke station, about 5-10 min walk.

Good atmosphere but massage can be a bit painful. We visited Health Land in Asok after reading good reviews online. We opted for the foot massage (1h) which cost 350 THB each. We did not book in advance and just turned up in the late afternoon and only had to wait 10mins. The reason behind the short wait is because its a pretty big place with many masseuses employed there. You might need to book in advance for body massage. We were led to a darkened and quiet room which gave off a relaxing vibe. We all had a good experience on the whole, but two of us found the massage a little more painful, I guess it depends on the masseuse. I told my masseuse to go a bit more soft and she replied "soft soft" and after this the experience was much better, with a good amount of firmness and only a little pain. The foot massage included feet, hands, arms and shoulders. They do crack your fingers and toes but it wasn't painful. They do put a lot of pressure on the shoulders which I found painful so I asked her to go a bit softer. Overall it was a relaxing experience and they gave us tea afterwards. The only bad thing was that the masseuse asked quite assertively for tips afterwards.

EXCELLENT NO-NONSENSE AND NO-SURPRISE (EXCEPT FOR A GOOD ONE) MASSAGE FACTORY. You can experience very good massages practically everywhere in Thailand but most of the time it is, as we say in our idiom, "You and your luck! ". My first concern in massage parlours is cleanliness, followed equally by professionalism and honesty. In addition to offering a very decent and spotless environment and being very reasonable when it comes to tariffs (unlike silly priced so-called "luxury" spas) , appointments are always respected (never was the victim of any mistake in the past ten years), masseuses (as a man, I prefer ladies for thai massage) are considerate, gentle and accomodating: I agree that they are not all up to the same professional standard and the management should really be more selective. Very difficult if not impossible to secure the same masseuse for a next session (why is it so?). But, unless you are living in Thailand and have your next door parlour with a particular practitioner you are used to and who knows exactly how to deal with your specific requirement (if any) Healthland (Asok, Ekamai, Sathorn etc... and elsewhere in the country) is your safest and best bet. If (like me) you are a regular visitor to Thailand and prefer the original 2-hours thai massage, best in the world, I advise you to buy the 10 coupons booklet (valid one year) which offers a sensible reduction on the normal fare.

Terrible "Thai" massage. I used to be a regular here, especially for the foot massage. Yesterday I came for the Thai massage and it was a total disaster. The first masseur came and after 5 minutes i asked to change, as she had no clue about what she was doing. The second masseur came and it was the same, ABSOLUTELY NO IDEA ABOUT THAI MASSAGE! After 8 years coming to this place, unfortunately it was my last time here. I tried to explain to the lady that Thai massage it is not supposed to be rubbing, she was supposed to do acupressure. She did not understand or did not want to change. She was using the elbow in areas which was not supposed to. All my friends kept telling me since long time that this brunch is the worst and it does not care about the customers, but i did not want to listen. What a great place used to be, unbelievable how horrible the service it is nowadays. The building still nice and clean, but the "software" is no longer there...

Shocking service. I phoned to book a Therapeutic massage for 2 for 7.30pm, we got there on time then the rude older staff member (manager?) just motioned us where to go, not even saying anything. We had to pay before getting a massage which we did. So were at the waiting area for a while then I checked to see what was going on, then another staff member said we hadn't paid yet! So I show her the receipt then go back to the waiting area. Nothing happens so I go to reception again and they start discussing something, our appointment was somehow put down for 7pm at which point I said I clearly stated 7.30 over the phone then she says we can take the more expensive Thai massage. I was expecting some kind of courtesy discount for their absolute mess of a service but got none so we just got the refund and left. Terrible.
Service is declining . Their receptionist is impatient to answer a question, just hurry up to push you make a decision. Massage therapist techniques is beyond expectations. Will not visit again.

Manager destroyed an otherwise great experience. The place lived up to its reputation - including a great masseuse. Unfortunately, the Manager of the Asoke location created an embarrassing scene in front of the staff. Needs to learn more professionalism. he is Young guy so likely this experience will help him to improve.

Great Value. When people hear Thai Massage they often think of three things. 1. Cheap hole in the wall 2. risqué shady, or 3. over the top and overpriced. Health Land is none of these. The facility is extremely clean and hygienic, the staff are professional and catering to exactly what you need but the price is extremely reasonable. For just 550 THB I got a two hour traditional thai massage. Of course, if your looking for a cheap foot rub, then there are other places to go. If you're looking for some hot lady in her 20s then, of course, there are many places to go. Or, if you're looking for a place that will wrap you in the oil of some rare sea creature then there are other places to go... but you'll certainly pay for it.Health Land Asoke was exactly what I needed. A clean place with good staff and a great value. I will go back again for sure.

Great value. I noticed others have downgraded this place--but I thought it was terrific. For 350 B I got what turned out to be a 75 minute foot reflexology treatment. Sure you're in a dark gigantic room with others getting treatment. No music. No ambience. But a wonderfully relaxing foot massage that included a lot of leg work, and a tiny bit of arm, neck, shoulder and back work. Going back tomorrow to try Thai massage for 2 hours and 550 B!

Clean place, professional staff. Place was clean and masseur professional, however the massage was quite painful, and I like strong massage usually! Staff at the reception was not very friendly, didn't pay much attention to us.

Worst massage ever!!!!. On the recommendation of our concierge At Sofitel, I went for a 2 hours traditional Thai massage at Healthland. The massage was so bad, the old massuese probably in her late sixties was so unprofessional (switched on and started watching telly the moment she started the treatment) and so useless that I left in less than 30 minutes. Didn't wanna waste my time any longer! What a bad experience- worst massage ever! I would rate it sub zero!!!

Service has gone down. I used to patronise this establishment but have decided to stop after my last visit. It has become so commercialised that personalised service is practically non existent. Step into this place and you will understand how a cattle feels when being brought into a slaughterhouse. What made it worse is that lots of China tourists have learned of this brand name and you can see a lot of them visiting Health Land all the time. They are loud, rude and inconsiderate! You can forget about having a good and relaxing experience at Health Land anymore.

Great Value for Money!!. Be sure to get the 2 hours Thai VIP meeting. The current price is at THB 550. Very clean, offers change of clothes but for those who does not want to change, it's ok, just let them know.

Herbal massage gone wrong . I have been a returning customer at this outlet. N a really bad experience this time round. Booked for herbal massage but waited for 35min only to realize that I have to wait even longer as the masseuse who knows how to do hot compress is not available. Asked to replace with oil massage n was told not available. Bad service for not organizing appointments and resources adequately. And for not informing customer over the delay made things worse. Had a huge pool of redundant staff standing at the counter chatting away, totally unproductive. This outlet takes the fact that they are reputable for massage services n they can compromise of service timeliness. Sorry to say that time is money to everyone. By not keeping to the appointment slot is a breakdown in service. I think d level of service quality has deteriorated over the years. The service staff at the counter did not even make an apology. Will not recommend this health land outlet. Stay away at all costs.

Feels like Heaven. It was the best experience I've had in massage therapy. I went with my friends and although they require a booking, we didn't make one. We were lucky enough to be received, because it was around 8.00 o'clock in the evening and they were very busy. The experience was magical! It was also cheap and the masseuses knew what they were doing. That's why I went again the next day!

You get what you pay for. It's much alike fast food on steroids. The checkin at reception is harried and curt with no regard for initiating first timers. A mix of serenity coupled with such service just confounds the psyche. A 3 hour service ended 30 mins earlier. During the session the masseuse curtailed treatment for the one of us that fell asleep. Edges of the facial orifice for the table were torn and tattered. On the plus side, it was cheap and very clean. I'm not recommending this place as I was made to feel free like a bothersome first timer who should have known better, and the fact that I was cheated of the service time I paid for. Many staff have this inner tense aura that just conflicts with the purpose of a visit there.

No longer good. Place is still big, nice and clean (have you ever seen massage parlours with lifts?) but masseurs have gone from mediocre to terrible!The masseurs talk amongst themselves during the massage and obviously cannot multitask = no proper system of massaging. I couldn't believe I was actually relived the massage ended WAY LESSER than 2 hours but to make matters worse, they had the cheek to demand for tips!!! Should have given them just 1 baht to let them know how bad the massage was! Never coming back nor any of their branches!

Value for money. Been twice and have on both occasions had some issues with the masseuse - asked to have the foot massage gentle but the lady kept pressing very hard that I got foot cramps (twice) during the session. Overall feel is very commercialized and you don't get that personal relaxed atmosphere - feels more like a hotel when they call your name while you wait in a waiting area with other tourists. However, it is good value for money and they do sell local products. It's also a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Sukhumvit shopping and if you have a few hours to spare.
Best Palce to have Thai Massage. Excellent place.Very god hygiene.Well trained staff.Affordable prices.They have centres all over Bangkok.Have excellent choice on type of massage offered.

Best massage and great experience . I was here with my friend in this outlet 3 times while in Bangkok. Since I had upper back and neck problem, I got the Therapeutic massage and it was good. The next 2 days, I tried the Thai herbal massage for 2 hours and it was really good too. The second time, the masseuse did so fast and ended the massage less 20 minutes. A little disappointed with that. But overall was good. Highly recommend you to try the message here if you're around Terminal 21 area (Asok bts). Prepare small change for tips.

Huge place somewhat outside with very good massage (Thai massage can hurt a bit :-))). Was taken there by a business partner with the office really close. Very big and very organised place. We came in with no appointment and had a reasonable 5 minute waiting time2 hr Thai massage was extremely pleasant although the theraapist was pretty tough on my sore legs with very little mercy. Was really 'on fire' for some tie afterwards, but can clearly recommend this place

Decent massage centre. I came to Healthland twice in a row.The first I did a 2hrs thai massage. My masseur seemed new - as she was guided by another masseur what to do. The massage certainly didn't turn out satisfactory, as I realized that she tend to massage the left and right side of the body differently. But my husband did enjoy his massage alot. So we came back again on the 2nd day. And I tried the thai herb compress this time round. My masseur was so much better this time. She is really experienced and I enjoyed the first hour of thai massage thoroughly. The second hour was using the herb compress; which was too hot for my liking. But I wouldn't fault anyone of course.I did not make reservations for both my visits. I guess it is luck whether you get a good masseur or not. But overall, this is still a good place to go at affordable rates.

Cheat duration massage. Recommend from tripadvisor, I tried to come there. Receptionist is ok and well manage for each guest. But as mentioned by few of reviewer about cheating time is proven. The technique msg is creative and effective for muscle relieve. But the power is bit low so I cant feel the pressure.I order 2 hours thai massage and start (see clock in the room) 13.15pm. And finished at 14.45pm and I loose 30mins massage! OMGIf waiting time & break time of therapist is include, then this spa intent to cheating their all customer with corrupt the time.Be carefull!Better try another spa that honest to you.

5 Star massage spa in the heart of Bangkok. I live in Bangkok and know my massage options because Bangkok has the most/best massages in the world, and the cheapest. For your average one hour foot massage it will cost you 300 baht. (approx.$10). In the USA, it would cost you at least 2,280 baht ($65). Now, having said that, yesterday I finally had the chance to visit a well known massage institution here in Bangkok; Health Land Health Spa. Head and shoulders (pun intended) above the "average" spa experience here. You pay a premium for this, but well worth it. I had the aromatherapy body massage at 950 baht ( $27) for 90 minutes. Though it was more than 3 times what I usually pay, but it was 3 times a better spa experience. Well worth. I think they pick the best of the best massage therapists in Thailand for their staff. If you ever happen to be in Bangkok for one reason or another, you must stop here for a complete relaxing experience. Check the web site for all services and prices. They also have a nice store there selling all spa related products such as soaps and lotions. Now having a sale of 2 for 1.

Health is Wealth. An excellent place for relaxation.Staff members are extremely skillful.It seems the place is very popular as it's very crowdy. But management doing very good job here.Entire place is clean and hygienic.Love to visit this place again.Most reccomend place for relaxation in BKK.

Relaxing . I received the 2 hour Traditional Thai Massage for 550 Baht. My massage was in a private room and my masseuse spoke a little English. The massage room was clean, quiet and comfortable. I was so relaxed during my massage that I fell asleep ! I enjoyed my massage and I will return there if my travel plans take me back to Bangkok. Oh yeah! The tea at the end of my service was tasty!

Not bad. Their Thai body massage is worth a try!. There are many massage in Bangkok and would recommend Health Land if you wanted to get some consistent in service, skills and longer operating hours. For the price of 550Bht you get 2 hours of body massage. However, I strongly recommend another place beside Wat Yannawa temple (Promwachirayan Institute) where they served as Chinese-Thai wellness center. Do avoid weekend morning since the place is full of local.

Traditional Thai Massage. The place was clean though very crowded, however, waited less than 10mins despite having no booking.The receptionist were emotionless and as some reviewers have mentioned almost like a factory. They did try to up sell to the spa treatments.However, once your name is called you are led away by your masseuse. From this point on, the experience was very good and had an excellent 2hour traditional Thai massage (550 Baht). Would definitely go back

Too comercialised. We walked to Health Land from Terminal 21, about 10mins. The grounds looked nice, and they have shop that sells their spa products. When we entered, oh mind, the place is so crowded with foreigners, especially my fellow Asians. One guy was complaining over the phone that the place was fully booked. Indeed, it was fully booked as we too did not manage to get a slot. However, we managed to get a foot reflexology by waiting 20mins.When our turn came, our names were called out and the masseuse brought us to a holding area to change into slippers, and then led us to the foot massage area.I had a shock, there were perhaps 40 massage chairs there, fully occupied. Though the room was dim, but we could hear some chairs screeching away in need of oil. My real concern came when I realized that I had 30mins of foot massage, another 15mins of shoulder and head, and then it was over! It was supposed to be a 1 hour massage. I figured that our 1 hour massage included the time to sit down to change our shoes and going back to pick up our shoes n hot drinks. The ambience is clean and nice, but I'm there for a massage, so I did feel shortchanged. Would I go there again? No, I would explore other places. This place is just too commercialized.

A Good Session. It is definitely not those high end joints but it does get your massage fix efficiently. Had a 1 hour foot massage and I would say it was a good experience. Would go back again if I visit Bangkok.

Clean and cheap!. Some people may not be amused by how they run the place, which other reviewers state as "factory-ish" but we were fine with it. It wasn't very noisy except at the lobby area where visitors were waiting their turn. Inside it was quiet, we had a great foot massage and were able to rest. And most importantly, you cant get a 300 baht foot massage for an hour in a clean facility in Malaysia. Worth it!

Massage indulgence. We're a family of 4, with 2 children.Booked 2 massages, aromatherapy massage and thai herbal compress for 2 hrs each adults.We were brought to different rooms with personal masseur in personal room with bath room.Kids tagged along with one child to one adult and rested at the chair that was available.Good and relaxing massage with relaxing music.Spent 2400 THB for 2 adults 2 hra each, worth it!

Super massage. Every time I visit Bangkok I make sure I visit here for a massage. An excellent facility, as very clean, people speak English, and they are on time with appointments. I get the body polish, followed by the aromatherapy massage. Nice shower facilities in the small quaint rooms. Last visit my husband and I went together which was a fun experience. Coming from the USA, I find the prices to be very reasonable. I now have a favorite therapist who I am able to request. Nice reception area with glasses of ice water available, and a cup of hot tea at the end. One of my favorite things to do in Bangkok.

Don't go there its a trap!. Today was not a great experience. Way too many people, factory is the word to represent this place...even the "receptionist" is calling the guest with a microphone! My therapist did not even look at me, no smile, no connection. Massage was OK but nothing fancy - i had better in street day spa. Therapists were talking loudly outside of the room. Not at all relaxing.
Great and reasonably priced Thai massage. I've been to this place a lot! I really like the way they treat and look after you. Two hour massage is perfect. Staff are always friendly and polite!

Good deal for a traditional Thai massage. I went to Health Land for the very first time after many years not having a Thai massage and it was marvellous! The 2-hour massage just costed 550 Baht! The environment of the spa is nice and spacious. And the masseuse was really professional.Reminder:1. You can make prior reservations for all other body massages except Thai massage. (cos it is so cheap!)2. Please specify whether you like stronger or gentle massage before you go into the treatment room. By doing so there is a better chance you get the "right" masseuse for yourself.

Overpriced massage factory !!!. I know many Asian people like group tour, but I think this type of group tour would not be desirable in massage. It looks like a factory or big sauna, it means the size of this massage shop is so huge.Price is also quite expensive, even for basic Thai massage.I definitely recommend to avoid this kind of massage shops as their staffs would be easily tired by the tide of tourlists. Why not seek so many hidden gems in Bangkok?Of course, those who have Thai massage experience at the first time in their lives would not notice this issue.

Very good foot massage. I signed up for a 2-hour "foot reflexology" session for 600 Bht ($17) and it was great. The lady who worked on me did about an hour on my feet, another half hour on my legs, and then another half hour on my neck, shoulders, arms, and scalp. The only reason I wouldn't rate this place 5 stars is that the room you're taken to for foot massages doesn't have the nicest ambience, but this is a minor point. Overall I'd highly recommend it.

Mind & Body refreshment. Health Land is very near from my residence. I had visited HEALTH LAND few times earlier. One of my friend was there with us. We decided to visit. We prior booked and reached in time. My friend was damn impressed as it was good against his perceived image. We were taken to rooms for massage. Rooms were clean.Message was fantastic, and it was really refteshment to mind and body.Great experience,

Total Relaxation. You have to make reservations for the body massage. So for the first time, I tried the Aromatherapy body massage for 950 Bht ($28) for 90 minutes. The elevator and hallway was dimly lit and in the treatment room it was clean and fresh smelling with a shower in the corner of the room. I had rotator cuff surgery 5 months before and made sure I let them know before they started.They made me take a shower before starting the massage. Ninety minutes goes by so fast. The massage itself was what I really needed, it felt so relaxing that I would recommend it.After, you are brought downstairs and given hot tea

Almost Total relax . As a visitor in Bangkok you must try one of fantastic massage and treatment. I staying in moevenpivk and they assist me with the booking and transportation to the nearest spa health land. Once you are there the first impression is to be in the Lobby of a very busy hotel and almost the sounds of a train station with the staff calling your name with a microphone. not the spa feeling you expect. But the staff is very well organized. The massage package have a good price and you can see it also from the local crowed around you. after taking and dark elevator and going through a dark corridor I finally reached my treatment room. The lady was kind and once the massage start you forget all the rest. It was well done and 45 usd to be pampered for 2 hours I think it is really worth it.

Subjective massage experience. The traditional Thai massage there is held in a more upper class environment. The quality of the massage depends on the masseuse you get, which some r good, a few are questionable. Overall, a decent place to get a massage therapy with a slightly higher cost.

Romantic. I went twice to Healthland at Asoke because it was so good. My partner and I went to treat ourselves, and when we left if left like we were walking on clouds. The service is wonderful and attentive, providing us with slippers and barley tea when the massage was done. We had the 2 hour aromatherapy massage and they were thorough and accommodating, especially because I was paranoid about previous back troubles. The atmosphere is sublime, dimly lit and sensual. Purple walls, bamboo and pebbles, the venue itself is like an oasis. Highly recommend!

Reasonable priced massage. Walking distance from Asoke BTS, near Terminal 21. 3rd time here and wanted to write a review. The service is average and the quality of the masseuse really depends on the person you get. I've had good massages where I felt relaxed after that but my latest massage was only average. The young masseuse did not manage to get my kinks out of the spots that I wanted and I could feel alot of elbows rather than kneading.For $550 baht for a 2 hr thai massage, I find it reasonable. The place is clean and the ac is cold in the massage room. Recommended to make an appointment before going down as it can get really busy and the wait could be long. Service at reception could be improved on.

Very good massage.. Been here countless time. Come here for a relaxing massage after all the eating and shopping. Nice and clean, value for money. The reception area like a 5 star hotel. Recommend to book in advance.

One of the best . Second visit. No frills spa. The traditional Thai with hot herb ball is the one to go for, add the foot massage and you will come away stretched and aligned. Be warned, traditional Thai massage is not relaxing! But well worth the 'pain'.
Didn't wait long. Massage was good.. The place was huge. The masseuse took care of my shoes, the whole 2hr was really good. very comprehensive. very positive experience by Health Land Spa.

half of job. What massage? you get is two hours away from the Bangkok heat with some one talking all time. From 1 to 10. The place is 7.massage is 3. I paid 50ba more and I got a real Thai massage from other chain. I try the basic 500 and 1100 upscale service.

One of the best experience. absolutely loved this place, fairly priced, great service, awesome atmosphere friendly staff, might need to wait a while if is crowded... thats how great it is. but its more popular amongst Asian, including Thai
It's ok. Pricy but alright. Many choices in bkk...for the price they charge, I guess you can find somewhere better. It was alright but no surprise.

how to explain.... I came first for an aroma therapy massage. The guy who "welcomes" you is polite but not friendly and has no time to liste to you. He told me it's fully booked until the next day, I choose a foot massage 1 hour, nice clean and quiete collective room, very good massage.I came again for an aroma, one week later. --> fully booked for the next 4 hours (as they say), but for the customer right behind me, the same front desk staff ask for a 30 mins of waiting only, for the same program! yes, I'm not thai, but I can speak and understand thai enough for this case. Third time: never again for sure. I used to go to "health land Bangna" branch many times before, never had this kind of unfair case there.

It just keeps getting worse. I used to come here every time I came to Bangkok since 7 years ago. For the past 3 years, the quality of massage and service has been from bad to very bad to absolutely terrible! Each time I came over the past 3 years, I kept thinking maybe I got a bad masseur. But after 3 years of bad experiences, it pretty much confirms the extremely bad value for money we get from this place. The Thai massage my husband and I got last night was totally lousy. I finished the 2-hour massage with a bad stiff neck. During the 2 hours, the masseur was definitely not giving me a Thai massage and I believe she has no idea what she was doing. Nothing she did resembled any Thai massage. Zero technique applied, just random use of elbows and rubbing here and there. And each time she thinks I fell asleep, she will actually stop massaging and was just chatting away with her colleague. When my husband fell asleep, his masseur actually left the room during the 2-hour massage (in the middle of the massage) and let him sleep while she disappeared for a good 10 mins. What a rip-off! We thought "Ok, maybe the Thai massage is bad so let's try the foot massage." Well, today's foot massage was even worse. It felt like they spent an hour slowly applying oil on my legs and feet. I would not call it a massage at all. A total waste of time and money.We bought the vouchers 8 mths ago and decided to burn the value of the last two vouchers cause it is a waste of time to come back to Health Land ever again. Used to be good many years ago but now a tourist trap. That's why you won't see any Thais coming in here now. Not to mention the reception people are really rude!Pay a little more and try other spas in Bangkok. You will definitely get better value for your money. This place is a rip-off for unsuspecting tourist who just don't know better.

Lousy service. Used to be there whenever in BKK, but their service is getting worse and the reception staff are very rude and unfriendly. Not likely to visit again as there are so many are better choice around.

My first Healthland experience. Decided to give it a try after reading the reviews. Located at a nice complex by itself, Healthland Asoke is walking distance from terminal 21. The lobby is FULL of people waiting to for their names to be called. We waited for about 20mins (we were quoted 30 mins wait) before our names were called over the PA system. I Guess to make it more efficient, that's the best way. But it kills the spa mood cos I felt like I'm in an airport. We were then brought to change our footwear and brought up to our room where we changed out into the attired given. The Therapists came and started massaging. It did bother me in the beginning cos they were talking between themselves but I fell asleep soon after. I did notice the sliding door was not fully closed throughout the massage so I do hear the movements along the corridor. I had the traditional Thai massage and Hot compress treatment. While the massage was good, the Hot compress treatment differs from the one I tried in Indonesia. The therapist did pound the compress on my body at first, after which she rubbed it against my skin like a scrub. I'm not sure if that's the way to do it but whatever.

Good experience and relaxing . I went two times health land Asok with my hubby. Location is ok, Asok BTS station take exit 1. Service is good and staff is nice. 2nd massage,It's take 40mins to wait but there is nice waiting area for us. Overall great experience!
Relaxing . Good oil massage. Very clean and friendly staff. Pricey comparedvto the street side massage parlors but worth it for the cleanliness. Will come back

Probably the best massage I ever got. I have been living in BKK for 4 months now and I'm addicted to "foot massages". So I have been trying to find the best place in town and I have finally found it. HealthLand! I have been there twice already and will going back. At first it seems like a massage factory but when they massaging it's whole other world. You enter, tell them what kind of massage you'd like, you pay and then wait patiently for them to call your name. You then enter a dark room and sit on those "lazy boy' kind of chairs. Try not to fall asleep so you enjoy the whole experience. Will definitely go back again, and again.

Poor massage!. My hubby and I did an one hr foot massage and we didn't enjoyed the massage. They were just passing their time n don't really bother to give you a good massage. Strokes were weak. It's a tourist trap place and would not recommend anyone to this place.

Worse and worse. recently the service really getting worse and worse. The horrible attitude of reception firstly, we ask if we need to wait, the reception said no need to wait, which actually we wait 30 minutes; then we bought 90 minutes aroma, but they only provide 80 minutes, this 80 mins including our shower time. if we mention the attitude they might say they don't speak English, but the attitude was there, we are not stupid!

Nice massage . Visited here Thursday after doing a bit of research... About a 10 min walk from Asoke sky train ... Take exit 3, follow the busy road up left, pass hotel furama xclusive, then you will see a sign for it, turn left, walk 2 mins along the road and it's on right.. Nice big place, waited 5 mins for my masseuse, was busy. She took me to 4 th floor, private room, has shower, thank goodness as was so hot outside... Masseuse very pleasant, did a good job. I had 2 hr oil massage. Ambience of room nice too.. Cost 1800 baht. Only think I didn't like was toward end of massage masseuse whispers in my ear, you give me tip.. Although I did and intended too, thought inappropriate for somewhere like health land..

Horrified & terrible aroma massage. This was the my 1st time at Healthland (Asoke) & I would like to share a very terrible & horrified experience I had when I booked (in advance) for a 1.5hours aroma massage on Sat 23 Apr at 5pm. I had to wait for another 30mins before I was being led to a room to begin my massage. Once I started my massage (facedown), I felt clawing & scratching on my back & down my legs. My heart went ok, this would be 1 of the poor massages that I had experienced before (in other places) so I might as well take a nap & get done with. But it did not end there, I felt something warm & wet sprinkling down my back, legs & body thru-out the massage even though the lady had both hands on my body the entire time. I felt uncomfortable & would lift my head to see what was going on, but everytime I lifted my head up, the therapist would stop thus I was unable to catch anything. I suspected that she spitted at me because I could smell saliva on me but I gave her the benefit of doubt.I was getting terrified & I wanted to see what she was really doing to me so I started to compare as she did my right leg first then to my left. That's when I stopped the whole massage & send her away & also got her to send someone from the front desk or manager up to my room. I wrapped myself with a towel & did not shower as I wanted to show the evidence (not much aroma oil on my body & scratches, because if there's more oil than saliva maybe the scratches on my back will be minimal) to someone in charge. 1 guest relation in charge came up & I told her what had happened, then she went & got another guest relation (Joy) together with the masseur into the room. I explained the whole situation to them & they told me they would refund me the baht$950 which I had paid. I was very upset because its not about the $$, because my back had scratch marks (raw) & saliva which meant I might get any diseases from the masseur. But they explained that there was no complaint from other customers about her & she had 4 years of experience & if she did not know how to do proper massage, she would not have passed the test. I told them maybe the masseur was feeling very stressed or had any mental health issues that we were not aware of or other unknown reasons. (No disputes or unkind remarks exchanged between me & the masseur prior) The masseur even showed us her short fingernails & told me she could not have made the scratches on my body & maybe she's suffering from cold & cough thus her fluids dripped onto my body (if that's the case, she was too near for comfort) but what I felt was not normal sneezing or coughing but her blowing her saliva onto my body the entire massage which I had with her.The guest relations brought up some medication for my scratches (alcohol) after I took a shower & they apologised & refunded me. Now that I am back in Singapore, I called up my doc as I am very scared that the masseur might pass any diseases to me & was informed that an accurate medical report can only be done 2-3 months. I have 2 kids & expressing my breastmilk too because of this incident which there was not any disputes or misunderstandings prior the massage session now I am unable to provide my breastmilk to my child, I am avoiding close contacts with my family members as I am not sure of anything yet. I pray hard that the masseur did not borne any ill intentions to me, both myself & her will be ok. To summarize my experience with Health Land Asoke on 23 Apr'16 :Service : poor & not very helpful guest relation (especially Joy because of her attitude, not sure if its because of the language barrier) Price : Not worthMassage skills : TerribleExperience : Horrified

(Almost) Instant Gratification . A visit to Health Land is a must and always completes my BKK visit. I have tried both the body and feet massages, and they rid you totally of the fatigue experienced after endless kilometers of shopping and lugging the purchases. Certainly the best reward for the tired mind and body!

Buyers beware: Take the traditional services instead of the packages . I went to health land without doing prior research (my oversight). When we arrived, the reception brought us to the posters showing all the packages, we thought that those were all that they had as the establishment looks quite upmarket. However, after reading back at the reviews, I felt cheated when I understood that there are much cheaper options of traditional Thai massage at around 500 baht for a 2 hours massage, a far cry from 2700 that we paid per person. The points below are for the package of 2 hours of oil upper body massage + head massage + oil dripping therapy. + Relaxing warm oil dripping therapy on the forehead, I almost fell asleep. + Experienced back massage masseur, good amount of strength applied + Not much waiting time required for walk in+/- Staff not very fluent in English, only know very few basic words- Not transparent in their full selection of services - Expensive package prices - No after massage snacks for package (given the high price and comparing to other establishments) - 1 hour 40 to 50min instead of full 2 hours

Good Massage. Location is near to Terminal 21 and within walking distance. Place is extremely packed so our friends who recommended this venue placed a reservation via phone. Their counter staff can converse in english so its not an issue. We opt for the full body massage for 2 hours. And i would say its pretty good.Downside is that there arnt enough toilets

If out of other options. + Very nice interior+ good price and accesibility- mediocre Thai massage at best- staff kept chatting through the massage- my masseuse spent most of the 2 hrs working the legs, barely touched the shoulders- friend ended up with bruises
Good massage!. My wife and I had the 2 hour massage. The place is clean and hygienic. Thai massage was good. Very good value as we paid USD 20 (including tip) each for the 2 hour massage.

Nice ambience but that's it. Walking in from the outside, it looked like a 5 star hotel!However the massage itself (ie reason why you're there) was poor at best and woeful in certain aspects.The lady spent at least 1.25 hrs working on my leg! Barely anything on the back or shoulders.We had a 2hr session Thai massage - for me, I could barely feel a thing and worse thing is that there are many other massage places in Asok that offers a better service.

Experienced 2 different levels. First time I went there for 90 minutes hot oil massage $1,500B. The therapist (No. 123 must appoint her ) was soooo good... The best experienced I have ever had ( better than Angsana ). After that I immediately made another appointment with her for the next day 2 hours. Next day the reception told me she was sick and went home early so she would assign me another therapist which I requested as good as like No123. In the end I was very disappointed by the Super JUNIOR therapist.

Best massage you will ever experience . This place is so good and professional ,Had an awesome Thai massage for 2hrs.Clean and hygiene place and staff here are well behaved and professional. I will definitely visit again and again.

Foot massage with friends . Found this place walking from terminal 21 to my hotel Pullman grand. On the first look it looked more like a 5 start hotel standing 9 to 10 floors tall. With a huge car parking and around 150 cars parked at the parking area.We finally walked in to see a long line of people already waiting. After paying for the service we had to wait for a good 15 to 20 minutes. We were taken to the 7th floor, the ambience was perfect and the staff were very professional. Most economic and the best professional service.Will recommend it to everyone. Prior appointment is not really necessary as you can easily get your turn with a maximum wait of 15 to 20 minutes.

Very Satisfying & relaxing. Booked for Aromatherapy of 950 baht for an hour and half was very good, professional services throughout right from reception to the masseuse. Nice & clean environment. However, a word of caution that you must pre-book in advance as this is a very popular spa. Their Thai Massage of two hours at 550 baht was also very good.

Paid for 2 hours, barely got 1 hour 40min. This is huge complex that looks like a hotel. The service was professional, massage was ok and the masseuse was polite and friendly, but the main put off was that we paid for a 2 hour massage but it was only barely just about 1 hour 40 minutes, including the washing of our feet. My husband and I were in separate rooms and we both had the same experience so it seems to be their standard practice. We waited 10 to 15 minutes in the lobby at the beginning for the masseuses and it seemed that must have counted towards the so-called 2 hours service. Felt cheated, and having gone to several massages in different parts of the world, this was the first time we came across this. Very disappointing. Will definitely not be returning.

Be warned: Watch out for Bait and Switch tactics. I made a reservation for massage that was listed on the website, and I verified the price over the phone.Upon reaching, the staff insisted (rubbish) that the massage is only available if booked 3 days in advance and the minimum option is to go for one of the premium services. We turned around and walked out the door. It was a complete waste of time and a pathetic attempt at upselling. Be warned - this is a tourist trap with bait and switch tactics wrapped in premium appearances.

Excellent foot massage with professional touch. Thanks to my local Thai friend's recommendation , took her advice to try this establishment . Excellent overall experience . There are so many options of massage offer including ajurveda oil massage !

Thai massage . Waited 40 mins because mixed up with another guest with same name & masseuses finished 15mins before 2hrs, paid 2hrs but only gets 90 mins service due need to change slipper, take lift up to room, finished with 1.45pm when massage starts 12pm.

Satisfied customer, every time. The masseur attended to me was very experience. Its easy to reach this place via BTS and the the establishment is very clean. Very satisfied with the service. Value for money.

A must go~. Must go whenever I am in Bangkok. I usually spent 2 hrs on their traditional Thai massage (THB550.-). Better make a reservation before you go to avoid long queue. There is a new counter between the reception and the entrance selling their products (hand cream, body butter, body scrub etc). Not aware they had their own products before. I realized it was not cheap compared with those famous Thai brand after I spent the money there. Ha!

Great ambience and massage. Came here for 2-hr Traditional Thai massage and aromatherapy massage. Both are great. Do take note to make reservation in advance if possible to avoid waiting. This place opens from 9am till 11pm to cater to all customers. Just go over the counter and tell the staff the service you want. They can provide private room for you and your friend too.

Don't understand the negatives. During our long stay in Bangkok, we have visited this place numerous of times for a aroma massage. We were never really disappointed and most of the times very satisfied. YES, the place can have a little bit of the “fastfood chain” feelings but rest assured that as soon as your therapist has taken you to the massage room, all is very relaxed, clean and the massage are very well and professionally performed.Only downside might be the fact the most of the therapist don’t look very open and happy at first sight. Most of them a little distant as well. Majority does not speak English very well.After a few massage we were asked if we would not like to have a specific therapist. We both mentioned one for the next appointment and this seemed arranged. But upon arrival we both we advised the therapist was not there!!!! This was kind of odd and disappointing. What’s the use of asking and booking a specific therapist if, at the requested time and date, they are not available?

Therapeutic Massage- THE BEST!. I've been living in Bangkok for 7 years and have never heard nor tried Therapeutic massage. Ive seen this first time at Health land. oh boy.. this is a true game changer! the best massage I have ever experienced.. you will feel relieved from sore muscles. recommended if you have pains, i think this is more clinical style of massage than strokes. its pressure point to the achy muscles, on your lower back, feet, shoulder, etc. Look for Khun Jitti, he is the only white haired man in there and he is amazing!!!! Healthland is by itself a relaxing place, clean and good therapist, plus very reasonably priced at 350baht per hour ($10)!

Well pleased. I visited here today to undertake my first massage in Thailand. I chose the theraputic followed by a foot massage - 650bht in total. I have nothing as a benchmark but I was very happy with both. The theraputic massage was quite intense but it certainly iron out the achy back & neck. I feel a little bruised now. The foot was just as good. Reclined in a comfy armchair in a darkend lot room & a blanket to wrap up in. The lady was very thorough & I felt great and ready for the day ahead. 2 nice cups of tea aswell after each session. I went at 9.30am and there were only a few of us there. It was a walk-in appointment.

One great massage, one terrible massage. I came here because it's in the guidebooks and was walking distance from my hotel.My first massage here was great. It was a one-hour therapeutic massage for 350 baht. The therapist used mostly Thai massage techniques, and I was very happy with the experience. She was very focused in her work, and she applied just the right amount of pressure. The next day I came back for a two-hour Thai massage. The massage therapist was horrible -- gruff, abrupt, kept mumbling things to me in broken English and when I would respond in English she would tell me that she doesn't speak English. Why then did she keep mumbling in English the whole time? The experience was not relaxing. I felt as if she did not know what she was doing or did not care. In fact, it was clear within the first few minutes I was not going to like it. I should have walked back to the front desk to demand a different therapist, but I didn't. That is my regret. At 550 baht (~$15), it's not about the money but the time/opportunity cost. I could have had a much better massage in half the time (in fact I did the previous day).Healthland is the fast food version of a massage parlor. They literally serve dozens of customers at a time, so they have dozens of therapists, who clearly have varying degrees of interest and work quality. Because of the uneven quality I can't recommend Healthland.

A good massage option. A traditional 2 hour Thai massage cost only TBH550 (US$16). I had massages over 2 days. My first massage was average, maybe it was the end of the day and the masseuse was tired. For my second massage, I was close to crying as the masseuse knitted out the stubborn knots in my shoulder and back. I believe she got out my decade old knots. It hurt but I felt lighter for several days after.I was not overtly asked to tip, but I think tipping is expected. And really,for the price you pay for a private room and the massage, it is not much to ask.The Asoke branch is easily located. Alight at Asoke BTS station. Look for directions to the Terminal 21 shopping mall. Walk alongside left of the mall, cross a small lane and you will find Health Land which occupies an entire building,

Divine. OMG, divine. My wife and I both had the best massages of our lives here. Ninety minutes of skilled massage in a wonderfully relaxing environment. If you wish (we did), they’ll put you side by side in the same room and two masseuses will work on you together. Prices vary, but relative to what you’d pay back home it’s cheap (our 90 minute sessions - traditional Ayuravedic oil massage - cost us 2,000 Baht each, or less than sixty bucks). All of the masseuses here are trained and certified - which is very different from a lot of the other (innumerable) massage shops in the city. The woman who massaged me clearly knew which parts of my body needed particular attention, and while some of the process was not comfortable, I felt so much better afterwards.Treat yourself!
Thai massage . Big, clean, efficient - book in advance. Very good personal treatment - some speek english - no problem to ask for hard or not to hard massage. Lots of different types of massage.

Serenity in a bustling city!. Having pounded the streets of Bangkok for 2 days we felt it was time to be pampered and pampered we were.There are so many massage venues to choose from it can be difficult to narrow it down, although the men amongst us may have been less concerned ;-)I researched a venue that had an excellent reputation for professionalism, cleanliness and value for money. Health Land has an extensive choice of massages, from a simple yet firm Thai massage to more pampering options. My only observation regarding the menu is the busy reception staff didn't seem that keen to explain the difference to you, shame. Otherwise the place ticked all the boxes, clean, massage staff were friendly and professional. We all left feeling refreshed and relaxed. I would suggest booking is essential.

A must to try thai massage. I went there 1st time of this trip to do foot massage 300 baht in the evening, the Auntie who did massage me she's skillful but looks like she hurry to go home. However, she never miss to wait for the tip when we finish. Next day I went there again to do foot and Thai massage. The foot massage person was a guy and look like he's trainee or maybe new staff because I didn't feel relax at all. I felt like he don't know how to do foot massage. After I finish foot massage, I did Thai massage with an old auntie and it's really worth! 550 for 2 hrs. I feel relax until fell asleep. People will think Thai massage will be pain, but it's not! Just only some part they've to bend your back only and it's not too pain. However, Thai massage is a must to try coz after finish I feel more relax than foot massage. After you finish massage they'll for you (to tip) at the left side. Normal rate for TIP massager is 40-100 baht. If you give 20 baht or never tip, they'll look at you with angry face.

Relaxing made more relaxing. We two friends visited Health Land at Asok. Till time, I never had any experience of Thai massage. We booked in advance and entered Health Land. Enterence is like a good hotel, we were welcomed well.I opted for 2 hours Thai Traditional massage. Rooms were clean, massager was english speaking.Massage was extremely, body become light.In all it was very good experience. Health Land had maintained the standard.

Good massage tainted by bad service. I was here with a family of 6 and we opted for different massages. Half of us did aromatherapy body massage while my dad did 2hr Thai body massage and my mom and youngest sister did foot massage. The massage was really good as I'm someone who really enjoys Swedish, Balinese style massage. For those who like deep tissue massage, please give this a miss as you will think the masseuse lacks strength but that's how the style works. I absolutely enjoyed the 90min massage.What happened after, made the experience extremely unpleasant. At the end of the massage, the masseuse said, "tip tip, 100 baht". And before she walked out of the room, again she said "tip, tip 100 baht". Firstly, I think tips should not be made mandatory and I think it is almost rude to demand for a certain amount of tip. As I walked out, again she said "tip, tip 100 baht.". I was ready to give a 40-60 baht tip but to have her constantly demand for a 100 baht tip made me extremely unwilling to give her any tip at all. At the start of the massage, my masseuse asked me if it was my first time at Health Land Spa and perhaps this was why she thought I could be taken advantage of.At this point, I was pretty turned off but as it's my first time there I thought perhaps that's standard practice so I decided to check with my sister. I was all changed and walking towards my sis when I saw her passing her masseuse tip only to have her masseuse say "no good" to her tip (claiming that it is insufficient) and insisted that she needs to give 100 baht. Now, that is just plain rude. Who rejects a tip? I told my sister not to give any tip, and for me to clarify with the Guest Relations Manager. If they say that tipping of 100 baht is mandatory, I will be more than happy to give 100 baht. In a place where massage costs 190 baht onwards, I think it is very unbecoming of their staff to demand for a tip of 100 baht. I spoke to two Guest Relations Managers who assured me that this was not standard practice and they were very apologetic. They also highlighted that they will speak to their staff. All in all, good massage but due to the way it ended, it left a very distasteful feeling for me. Word of precaution: If your masseuse demands for a 100 baht tip, know that you have the prerogative to give a tip of any amount you deem fit.

Cheap and smart. This is the most famous massage place in Bangkok and we had to try because our friends always recommend, its look like high-class hotel more than massage shop. The price is so cheap for good massage service in such a smart place.
Total Bliss!. The body massage was literally head to toe, every inch ofyour body was being treated. Very good value for money. Highly recommend this after a long day sightseeing/shopping.

Textbook Thai Massage. Sleepy masseuse.. The massage technique here is standard textbook style. Nothing more nothing less. My masseuse nearly dozed off a few times and her pressure slacked when she dozed off ever so often even though my massage was 10am to 12 pm! Fine for tourists and the uninitiated. For those who have travelled around and gotten massaged often, this place is pretty be ho-hum.

Best Thai massage I ever had (well, from a sample of four). My second Healthland and fourth Thai massage experience, and clearly the best. The Healthland chain seems to cater mainly to locals and expats, so thankfully only few tourists around and the place is run very efficiently without losing the relaxing vibe.

Standard massage . Read the positive reviews and decided to try this place out since it was the nearest one with good reviews. Place and masseur did not disappoint, except for the dreadfully long wait of 1 hour before the 2 hours Thai massage I opted for. Those who wish to go there during weekends, may wanna make an advanced booking to save time. The 2 hours Thai massage was 550 baht. Value for money I'd say. Masseur was good. Managed to bring out one of my sore spots which I asked not to further aggravate. All in all, this place is deserving of the good reviews so far.

Very good and bad. The reason I say very good and very bad depends on who's the massage therapist. My therapist was excellent, her name was Oil, and she was expert and attentive, a real professional. The therapist my wife received was a novice and she left feeling worse than she came. The supervisor responded and got another therapist to fix her, but sad that they have such novices at this place.

Great traditional thai massage.. My wife and I went directly from the airport to Health land. We got 120 minutes of traditional thai massage and it was so nice. The best thai massage I have ever had, The stiffness from the long flight was blown away. We got the massage together and the ladies providing the service were very nice and funny! Thanks

Great Pregnancy therapeutic massage. I am 5.5 months pregnant and most places in Bangkok refuse to give me a massage.I initially wanted a foot massage but after telling them I am pregnant, they advise i should have a therapeutic massage only.The massage was done in a separate area from the thai massage.The masseuse was very professional,they made me lie on my sides and did pressure point massage no oil. They pin pointed all the areas where i was sore.This was a different type than what i have hd previously but felt so much better after the 2 hours massage. Great place with no fuss for massage, do not expect spa luxury as this is not a hotel spa.

Great Thai Massage. The location is great as it is a quick walk from the Asoke BTS stop. There is a great many option for different massages and treatments. I was there for one thing and one thing only. A good, hard, Thai massage.I registered for a 2hr Thai massage. 550baht. Amazing!My shoulders and back were a big mix of knots when I arrived. During the massage, there was a point where I actually had to say "jep!". It seems my masseuse had the strength and skill to deliver a massage up to my standards. When I left, my body felt like rubber. All the knots were gone. I could feel my shoulders were sore. And, I knew it would be sore for a few days. Ultimately, this is well worth the experience. You end up feeling so much better.I would recommend though, if you are a frequent massage fan, do leave yourself a few days after a hard Thai massage. You will be very sensitive to the touch.

Best foot massage in Bangkok. I can vouch for foot massage. The atmosphere, the music, the setting, the super confie sofa seats and most of all for the massage. Every time we go here we fall asleep and feel like re-born when we wake up. 300 for an hour foot but we recommend 2 hours for the full head-back-shoulder as well!Highly recommended!

Good place for Thai massage. 550baht for a 2hr Thai massage on a Tue afternoon. Big clean place in a convenient location, good and fast service, wide array of massages and spa packages to choose from.

Good for relax. It is like a supermarket of massage, it has, I think over a hundred technicians there. But the technique of the technician varies, if you really like massage and you go massage always, choose a technician of muscle type or if you are a male, choose a male technician. Because I went there three times during my stay in Bangkok, I noticed that one of the technicians who was not strong enough to massage me well, no enough strength. By the way, you better to make appointment before you go. One more thing is that, it seems that all the technicians used to receive tips because many tourist there. Just to the conclusion, the price is reasonable.

Legit Massage. I was dubious at first, starting price 1500 baht went for a 2 hour at 2000 baht and I have to say it was the best massage I've had in Bangkok. Reason is that cheaper places are still great for foot massage but full body they just don't provide a true therapeutic massage. Cheaper places are more relaxing if you like light touching, but a western man 6ft plus with muscles I need a strong massage. The place is very professional, very classy and definitely worth the price for service and ambiance. I walked out knowing that I don't need another massage as the lady worked all my knots and having just been to Mount Everest I was pretty tight.

First Thai Massage with my daughter. I have been going for different essential oil massages including hot stone to relieve aches & pain. Very pleased with Thai Massage here which is very much like getting a physiotherapy session but with every joint & lymph nodes worked on. Difference between Thai Massage & full body aroma therapy massage is your are fully clothed and there is no oil used during the massage. The masseur hands are gentle & effective in removing all my aches. My girl who is trying massage for the first time even fell asleep in between the massage. Needless to say she had a good time and felt rested. Health Land Asoke charge 550 Baht per person. They are fully packed and you do need to make reservation before hand. I asked my hotel concierge to help with the reservation. Tried my luck upon arriving to check if I can have other massages & they are all full including facials etc. They request you to make payment before the massage. As there is no tax or service charge in the bill, I tip them after the massage. They deserve it. Highly recommended if you need a good massage without frills.

A Wonderful Find. Visited Health Land for the first time yesterday and was so impressed with the quality of the (therapeutic) massage I received, that I got another one today along with one of the best foot massages I've had in the 20 years I've been visiting Thailand. The place is clean, inexpensive and has a very professional staff. I'll return when I am in Bangkok next month.
Value for money. The 2 hr Thai massage was good and value for money. This branch is also a 10 min walk from Terminal 21, which is quite convenient.

Had best and worst massage. I went twice to get a massage at this location. First time, got an hour scrub and 1.5 hours aromatic massage and it was simply the best massage I ever got. On my second visit, I only had 1.5 hours aromatic massage and it was a disaster. The girl was really not up to it and was really doing it mechanically. She hurt me many time and was just telling me that it was because I was not relax. How could I be relaxed when she was repeatedly hurting me?So I am a little bit mixed about the review. Guess it really depends on which lady you get.Told the manager after this and she only told me ''Sorry"... Guess it tell it all. This has become a cash money for tourist I rekon...

Awesome Massage "factory" spa!. This place operates like a massage factory. So many attendants and rooms. They are very busy all the time so i suggest making an appt in advance or you will probably wait for an hr. The massage itself was really good!!! 500baht for 2 hrs of thai massage.This was my second time at healthland and would def recommend paying a visit here. Their gift shop was also amazing with great products.

Glamour. 5 star clinically correct lavish multi storey spar centre. Formal and precision for those that desire insulation. The basics are available with reflexology from 250bt on the ground floor but it's fashioned for upmarket.

Great massage . I had the 2 hour Thai massage and the masseuse did a wonderful job. Language skills were limited, but that was just a part of the cultural experience and didn't cause too much confusion. After the massage all my lower back pain and knee trouble was gone and hasn't returned since. This was so worth the money spent.

The best place for a Therapeutic massage. This place is great!
