You may need to book in advance as even though i was able to be seen straight away on the first 2 days i showed up at my leisure, they were fully booked (accept for a 8pm) on the 3rd day when i was trying to make a booking time on day 2. I couldn't make that time and so went to "The Touch" instead which is another excellent place close by with the same prices for traditional massages.Healthlands has some pretty hefty prices for the packages though the treatments are a bargain.There are plenty of good places doing traditional massages at 300B for 1hour, 550B for 2 hours though i haven't seen a place which offers such good value for the Therapeutic massage which is 350B for the hour. I had a 1 hour session the first day and then went back for a 2 hour session the next. I found it to be most like a physio session and so a fantastic place to go to if you have a bad back or other body aches.I was worried the woman would get too tired for the 2 hour session but she never came close to slowing down. I just told them the area's of my body i would like them to focus on and they got to work. As most physio sessions in Australia are only 30 minutes, having someone work on your pain points for 1-2 hours gives you a much better outcome. If you don't care about having your feet, legs, hands arms and head massaged, but want your back rejuvenated, the Therapeutic massage is the one to get and this is the place to get it!Thanks Healthland

My place to rejuvenate !! . My visit to Bangkok is incomplete unless I visit Health Land. I have been visiting health land for at least 5 years now. Earlier I use to visit Health Land at Sathorn but post opening of Heath Land at Asok, I have shifted to HL Asok more for traveling convenience .... Earlier they use to provide only Aroma, Thai, Foot etc massages. But since last 3 odd years, they have also started Ayurvedic therapy also and it's just out standing. This time I tried Abhyang Ayurvedic massage, a lady with No. 333 was just extraordinary and the whole experience was simply great. I would highly recommend to everyone to visit Health Land whenever you are in Bangkok.

Needs improvement. It was a totally different experience from my previous visit some years back. The massage was so so, did not even have time to nap, the massage attendants wereGiggling. Needs improvement guys.

Terrific Thai Massage. Having visited Bangkok for three days in early December it was well worth a visit to Health Land in Asoke, wherein I had a traditional Thai, massage for two hours at 500 Baht it was money well spent. I would definitely visit Health Land and recommend it for its 5 star service offered throughout your visit with exceptionally professional staff and the massages are first class, a highlight of my time in not only Bangkok but also Thailand

Excellent Traditional Thai Massage. Great traditional Thai Massage! Two hours for 550 Thai Baht which is an amazing deal. The facility is clean and relaxing. Beware if you don't enjoy an intense massage then this particular massage may not be for you. These ladies may be small but they have hands of steel! Great experience!

Therapeutic Massage is good!. Here is no welcome tea and cool towel.(You can drink an iced water by yourself.) Maybe this shop decides on target to group tourists. But therapeutic massage is good. If you want to take a massage, it will be necessary to book before.

Another visit to Health Land, will visit again. Health Land was recommended by my Thailand colleagues and this is the 3rd time I went. This time I brought along a few friends who happen to be on holiday in Bangkok as well. For foot massage, just walk in and should be able to get your queue pretty fast. For body massage, there may be some wait. Good to book in advance to avoid disappointment. Overall, it's value for money. Place is nice and clean. Will come again next trip to BKK.

Good value for Money. We were recommended to this place by our Hotel and we cannot remember which location we went to as the Hotel Concierge explained this to the cab driver. The place was huge and there were a lot of customers and staff. We chose the basic Thai Massage package for 2 hours at THB500. Not sure about the pricing at other places though. The place was clean and nice and we enjoyed our massage. Wanted to go back to the place but went to another massage place next to the hotel and that turned out to be better albeit a little more expensive.
Awesome. The best massage I have ever had. I would recommend the thai massage. It is a whole new expreience. The facility and ant the personnel are clean and very helpful

Value for money. We were impressed by the layout of the building. We were welcomed by highly organized system. There was a staff who could answer your queries, pamphlets to look at the services. And you simply walk to a big counter to place your service order.There was an announcer to call out your name when it is your turn. This will be broadcast even when you are the toilet.We ordered a spa service for couple. The ladies were professional. The room was comfortable. There was shower corner too. We felt recharged after the spa.It was very value for money for the service.It is not difficult to find but not exactly easy to find if you do not find out about the orientation. Do locate the position of the place first.

Clean Place, Good service. though they have around 8 branches in Bangkok, The one on Soi 21 is what I always visit. Its a clean place and good therapists. Try the Thai massage. Book in advance as they are really busy during the weekends and holidays. As they are open from 9 am to mid night, its a perfect place for me.

Almost perfect. Stayed at Grande Central T21 and by chance stumbled into this place. Housed in a rather large compound. Well organized. Went twice. Once for foot reflexology massage - taken to a dimly lit place with around 30-35 chairs. For bahts 300 a steal. Returned next day (you need a booking) for the Thai massage 2 hours at 500 bahts. Now whilst they don't expect a tip for the foot thingy, you have to tip the ones that do the Thai massage. I won't say its the best Thai massage I ever had but at this price, WOW

Don't bother going!. I was really looking forward to my visit here today. I opted for the back massage for those that have a bad back, and cost B2700 for 150mins....I wish I hadn't bothered. The first thing they do when you arrive is not smile, then they take your money!!! I then went to my room with my masseur and had a 2hr massage. All i got was a normal oily body massage, I thought she was about to break my back at times, bearing in mind this massage was supposed to be for someone who has a bad back! It was awful, I wish I had gone to a street massage place I passed on the way and paid B300, it would have been better.....
Best foot massage ever. This is one of my fav massage places in the world. Great value great massage in a very luxurious soothing environment. Wish they could open a branch in Singapore.

superb massage experience with excellent price. We decided to give this a try on our first day in Bangkok. We are very impressed with its lobby and how they operate the business. the rooms where we were assigned for our massage provided us with comfort and privacy. Masseurs were also very friendly and skillful. And most importantly, cheapest rate for thai massage we have come across so far.. THB500 for 2 hours. Will definitely visit here again next round.

Good masssage, bad after taste. It was my first time here. I was quite amazed that the place looks very professional and spacious. Four of us took the 2-hour Thai massage for THB 500 each. The room and the massage was very good, and worth the price. However, the closing experience was bad. As soon as the massage was finished, the masseuse told us "give us tip ah..". I planned to give them some tip anyway, but for them to ask for it upfront actually raised our eyebrows. So after changing our cloth, we gave THB 50 each, only to be surprised that they asked for THB 100 tip each. All 4 of us (separately) got the same request. This part really ruined the overall experience. And apparently I saw many other reviews that share similar concern.

Disappointing. We came to Health Land Asoke with high expectations. Relatives had told us they had heard this was where the locals come. I doubt it. From the very first step in the door, you'll get the idea. Health Land is a large chain operation that houses outlets in several places in Bangkok, as well as Pattaya. It shows. While the facility is very neat and clean, it's also very impersonal. I felt like I was on an assembly line. We each had a two hour traditional massage (500 baht). The massage therapists were decent, but we've had much better. Payment is made in advance, which is a little unusual. Tipping is not only expected, it's demanded, which is amazingly unusual. All in all, it's not an experience we'll be repeating. Bangkok has plenty of "mom and pop" massages places that give much more attentive service at the same or lower prices. Go to those instead of the Wal Mart of Thai massage.By the way, if the locals come here, they must come by way of tourist shuttles, because we saw a lot in the parking area.

Foot Reflexology. I was there a while ago. I was asked to wait for half an hour as it was crowded tonight. I waited for 45 minutes and thought they must have forgotten my appointment. I went to the counter to enquire. I received a very cold answer as they have indeed forgotten my appointment. No apology given and asked me to wait for another 10 minutes. I understand their arrogant attitude because they will still survive and do very well even without a customer like me. I asked for a refund and left. I'm actually amazed that there were so many staff at the counter but all were care less about providing good customer service that night. Hai... not the Thailand friendly service I expect to receive. I will not go back again.

Clean but inconsistent massage skill. Went there twice with 3 other friends, Thai massage for 2 hours costs 500baht. Would be good if they can offer 1hour Thai massage instead of 2 hours. Service standard is inconsistent, depending on the therapist you get. And some are quite unprofessional, sub standard. There's also good ones though, depends on your luck I guess. Place is clean and efficient. Please book in advance, it was crowded on a Thursday afternoon. Foot massage is walk in though.

This IS The "REAL DEAL". Health Land is a massage school that has several locations in Bangkok. You can easily check their website for their menu and locations nearest to you. I feel like it's 10 Times better than the walk in places on the street. If you want serious massage do check out this school. I've heard that the Asoke location can get rather crowded, but since I'm in a hotel a only 2 blocks away I have concierge make me a reservation as soon as I wake. Usually only 2 or 3 hours in advance. 2 hour Thai massage was only 500 baht and it was GREAT, so I went back the next week and discovered a girl that I wanted to keep so I took her #349 (Thai names are hard to remember but hers is Narin. The 2nd time I went I could barely make it there my back hurt so bad. I was in serious pain and stiffness. The Thai massage is a regular routine but this girl Narin #349 addressed the problem I was having and then got back to the routine of course. I really appreciated that, because I was in such bad shape that she really had to work hard, and that she did. I tipped her well and asked for her the following week. She was happy to see me again. This time I chose the Thail HERBAL massage ( 800 baht ) which was one hour of massage and then one hour of hot herbal sachet stuffed with Thai herbs and steamed in a crock pot steamer, being carefully rubbed all over my aching joints and muscles. I wasn't expecting it to be "all that" and my skin is very sensitive to hot rocks so I was a bit afraid of to much heat, but IT WAS GREAT, and again SHE WAS GREAT. I really needed it as this week my legs were in bad shape. I will be doing it again next week. The place is very clean, very zen, pleasant and professional. The Thai herbs smell strong as soon as you get to that floor, but I'm very used to that smell as I use herbs frequently. I "loved" it. It's not a stinky smell just very earthy. They have about 8 floors I think and enough students to handle a daily flow of traffic. They also have a shop where they sell lotions, soaps, spa goods, etc. I was so happy I found this place and was about to try a different massage girl but as long as I go to this location I will stay faithful to Narin. She walked on my back and other parts of my body using her entire body weight to work stamp out my knots. And she was not a small Thai girl but at least 140 lbs. I can't wait to go again next Wednesday.
Nice Spa. The place is nice and clean. We were just surprised that most of the attendants are old. We still enjoyed the experience.

nice place and clean. As recommend by the hotel and I quite satisfied on my first visit, I visited Health Land Spa twice during my 4 days trip. Room is clean and cozy. Price is pretty affordable - 950B for 1.5 hour for aroma massage, 850b for 1 hour for scrub, 300b for 1 hour foot massage. The massage quality is very depends on the therapist that you get, i had the aroma massage both visits- the 1st time was petty fine but 2nd time was a bit disappointed.

One of my worst spa experience . Thought this was a chain that can provide quality service but was deeply disappointed. First when I entered the reception, it's noisy and crowded. Service was not attentive at all, close to self service. After paying in advance (quite uncommon in Bangkok), my name was called thru a microphone. I felt like waiting for a table for afternoon half price dim sum. The massager was totally unprofessional. I could tell by knowing her using her elbow throughout, which actually hurt, I had to stop her a few times. The experience was not pleasant at all. Let alone the serenity you expect from a spa.

Clean & Cozy. Nice, clean and spacious. The price is about the same with other smaller (shoplot size) massage houses nearby. However, they display only very luxury massage packages in their menu around the register counter, and make confuse that those are the only available services. Check online what other standard massage options available, which at much reasonable price. It's a very busy place, hence up front reservation is recommended. Mostly visited by foreign visitors only. The massage quality is okey, depends on the therapist that you get.

commercialised. very commercialised. when I asked for price list was only shown menu with massages 2000b and above. this place still provides value for money and hygienic massages (2hr 500baht (thai) & 1hr 300baht (foot)), not the best (quite touristy in fact) and masseurs expect tip. it feels like masseurs "just go through the motion" to past time... quality has dipped since the last I came, feb2015.

Pleasant Experience. Visited Health Land Spa twice during my 4 days trip as it was highly recommended by friends. You do not have to book prior to your visit and it is pretty affordable. Rooms (massage area) is clean and have a TV so that you can enjoy during the massage.Since there are many masseuses, do expect that they provide professional massages differently. I wasn't quite satisfied on my first visit but my second was perfect.You do not have to take a Taxi to Health Land. Take the BTS Skytrain to Asoke, walk on Sukhumvit 19 Alley beside Terminal 21 and you will reach Health Land within 5mins.

Thai Massage with good price. Thai Massage can be found everywhere in Bangkok, but this one is affordable (Thai Massage 500 baht per 2 hours). I was having menses that time and I took foot massage (600 baht per 2 hours), the service is great and relaxing

Beware of SCAM, they will only show you the expensive treatments. I stayed close by and decided to visit Health Land after I saw a good review in Lonely Planet. When I arrived on a Saturday it was busy but not too much so. A friendly lady helped me choose a 90 minute Ayurveda massage for 1500 Baht (by far the most expensive massage I had so far in South east Asia) from a menu on a board. Only afterwards when checking out reviews on TripAdvisor I found out that there are other massages that are cheaper (950 Baht for a 90 minute oil massage). When I inquired after my (very average) massage and found a leaflet showing the other massages they told me they are not available right now. An obvious lie, the lady saying that actually looked uncomfortable having to say that. I think that's so poor and really sad. I can't believe the place is so busy. If you still want to go I would recommend checking out their menu and prices online beforehand and insist on the chosen option. Then you can have a nice experience - the place looks nice enough, very large, clean with nice rooms. Just don't expect your masseuse to speak any english and to be treated with respect as a foreigner and not an ATM.

The best option to relax. Beautiful place and environment! Even during weekends when their agenda is very full you can get a massage walk-in. Amazing professionals and structure. Do not miss the opportunity while in Bangkok. Good value for the service.

2 hour massage = 1hr 45 minutes. Paid for a 2 hour massage with a friend but ended up being 1:45. We complained but ask we got was a sorry. The massage itself was very mediocre with very light pressure and the masseuse not speaking English.
Foot Reflex. Nice place and clean.Generally alright. Except we have to walk along the streets rather dim. Feel a bit not safe.

Great massage. I decided to give this a shot after trying several massage places in Bangkok. I had the Abyanga massage (oil) which was great. Very relaxing and not a deep tissue but was a nice way to relax for 2 hours at a reasonable price.

Enjoying the pro massage. i went there everytime when i visited Bangkok staying at Suhkumvit. The masseurs are all professional in their skills and quite standardized in techniques. Prices are similar to many other places offering massages in Bangkok. They also have the Ayurvedic treatments which i haven't tried. Very busy during the weekends and highly recommend to book for especially body massages if you're going during the weekends.

Management of HealthLand should read this review!. I visited Healthland for many times,this recent trip i visited there realized one thing really "spolit" the image of Healthland,no matter foot massage,thai traditional massage or other packages(accept Therapeutic Massage),after services,the massage lady all queue up there,at first i feel they just nice to customer to say goodbye,but finally one massage lady approach to me ask for tips,i think tips should not ask from customer,it is depends on the customer willing to pay or not!This is not a good feel for customer! What i suggest Healthland Management to improve this is they may have service charge from their package price when the customers make the payment,then the massage lady no need to stand there to wait for tips.

traditional thai massage. Clean ant tidy traditional thai massage. They use oil and special aromatic liquids. There is a shower in room, you must have a quick shower before massage. They give you a transparent underwear even if you are male. Inside the room there is an relaxing odour. Lights are not bright. After an hour massage they treat you with a local sweet drink. all was nice.
Massage . Great prize for 2 h massage - 500 Bahts ! You are invited to a room where are 2 beds and you have a massage of all your body. Amazing great place - recommend it totally.

High cp Thai massage. Located near Asoke bts station just about 6 mins walking from station
2hr Thai massage only at 500 Baht ...high value for money. Highly recommended

Affordable professional Thai massage in contmeproary Thai environment. I have read through the reviews for Healthland here on Trip Advisor. I can't quite figure out why people are so unhappy. This is a great place to get a Thai massage, a facial or a western massage at a very affordable price in clean surroundings with nice little details like a cup of tea when you finish. Cost is 500 baht for a 2 hour massage, less than $15. Sometimes I tip, sometimes I don't, and really have I given a 100Baht tip. Make reservations for the weekend. Usual travel advice says go where the locals go. This is where the locals go. It's about 10 minutes from the Asoke sky train station, so it's easy to get to.
Unforgettable experience!. Go there for a 4 hand Massage! It is an un forgettable experience! It is like heaven on earth. Make an appointment at a day before you go.

Not worth the hype. You are advised to pre-book before visiting Health Land. Spacious and very commercialized. You need to make full payment before entering the massage rooms. I would say that the Traditional Thai massage is not really authentic but quite relaxing. Worth a try but probably will not return. AND one bad point is they demand a 100Baht tips!!

Good Ayuverdic massages. I went for 2 types on 6 Oct and 8 Oct.I learnt that they were actually trained under Indian doctor who was stationed there for 2 years. Room ambience and setting were good.Therapists were differently dressed and it seemed to differentiate the higher or different kinds of massage.Overall, I enjoyed the massages.

Felt like a brand new person!. To most Singaporeans, Healthland is one of the most recommended places to go for massages. They have a couple of other outlets around BKK. I have been to this one in Asoke and another one in Sathorn (walking distance from W hotel). It costs 500 baht for 2 heavenly hours. Skills wise, it really varies. I have gone on occasions where I felt like a piece of bread dough being kneaded in the right places and at some other times I felt like I was just being caressed. But still, at that price, I don't ask for too much. Please do your bookings early. They are very crowded over weekends! Don't forget to bring a 100 baht tip as well. They will demand it from you after the massage. And yes, the word is demand. For better service, you may want to choose another popular place, Urban Retreat. Slightly more pricey, but better service.

Probably not worth a second visit. I would have given 2 stars if not for the attentiveness of the masseuses, although there were bad points about the massage too. I shall start on the good points first. Looking at others' reviews, we were pretty lucky as we managed to book for a slot an hour before our appointment. Even though it seems like they lost our booking details, they still managed to slot us in and probably there were not many guests that day, we didn't wait long for our turn. The air con does make some noises now and then but not really bother me. Upon hearing me sniffing, 1 masseuse adjusted the air con temp and another took tissue for me, which impressed me. It was a small action but they could have just ignored me. The massage was indeed less than 2 hours, but maybe about 1 hr 50 mins? To me, I'm okay about it. However, the massage was a disappointment. Of all massages I have gone before, this has to be the worst in my opinion. It may not necessarily be a bad massage, but it was painful. I think our masseuses had either too much strength or they are testing our tolerance level. Even after I told my masseuse it was painful at one point, I'm not sure if she understood me because all she said was "too hard" -.- Even so, she still used a lot strength. She kept mentioning to me that my thigh is too hard, my shoulders are "too hard". But the way she mentioned wasn't just like commenting or what because she mentioned like at least 5 times!? Pretty annoyed at this point. And it sounded more like a complaint to me. So if you exercise often, and have stiff shoulders, don't come here and risk getting this masseuse. And she used so much strength that I left with painful calves. Not even funny The massage was not relaxing at all.We have concluded that it is most likely our first and last trip to Health Land. I have gone to smaller places with cheaper prices and left much more satisfied than here. Health Land is too over rated.

Not authentic Thai massage. Trying to avoid massage with extra services I and my mum visited this spa today. I had a 2 hour Thai massage but it was definitely not a "Thai massage" most of the time the lady was kneading with her hands and fingers, absolutely nothing to do with some authentic Thai massage that I experienced before. It was more like a friend who watched some massage tutorial on YouTube and gave me a massage which I would appreciate but definitely not professional. My mum had a aromatic oil massage and she had a better experience. So I guess it's by luck whether you get a good therapist or not.

Tries to scam you - BEWARE. Booked massage for 17.30 on a weekday afternoon. Arrive on time, head to counter to pay, the female manager with the help of the cashier presents me with a bill of 1500 baht. Having been to Ekkamai Healthland before (which I think is a great place by the way and ran very professionally) I recognize the price for an oil massage is 950 baht, NOT 1500. I ask the staff about this and they explain the extra charge is for an expensive specific type of oil I ordered while booking the massage - I NEVER DID SUCH THING. They, specifically the young-ish lady manager standing on front of the reception greeting guests, tried to blatantly scam me 550 baht hoping I was a tourist who wouldnt notice the difference in the price. No apologies, no discounts offered to make up for their error - absolutely abysmal customer service. BEWARE!I was extremely unhappy at this point but figured Ill just get a massage since Im already here. After that, unfortunately Healthland Asoke keeps disappointing. After waiting 20 minutes, a staff comes and says "10 minutes more, we are having some problems"- never specified what kind of problems. My turn is finally called after 50 minutes (!!!) of waiting - I have never seen this in any of the high-end spas in Bangkok before. An absolute disgrace for customer service I would not recommend for anyone.Also, the rooms were built of granite or another material that made them extremely uncomfortably cold. I was freezing after taking a shower, NOT a nice experience. At the front desk there was an Asian lady in the counter complaining loudly how she had spent an hour waiting in a towel - apparently her therapist never arrived and nobody ever came to inform her about it! Seems like I wasnt the only one having issues with their terrible service.Absolute disgrace to customer service, stay away.

Second time experience ~ not to my expectation. Last time I went there with my sister with a wonderful experience and would highly recommend to every friend and relative of mine. On recent visit, the staff had been away for at least five minutes without reason and her massage skills was not quite to the standard. It was ended up the same time as my husband, i.e. some parts of the facial massage have been missing. Hope the managment do some improvements to the staff training and revive the high standard as before.
Great massage. Thai traditional massage is something you must experience. Really worth going while in Thailand. Also the price isn't bad at all.

Bargain massage. This place is huge for a massage place - you have 8 floors there - accessible by lift. A 1-hr foot massage is 500 baht, a 2-hour Thai body massage is 500 baht so this is really good value. The place is clean but the only thing is you might not get the full hours - more like 1 hr 45 mins. They will expect you to tip as well.  Book early if you want a decent but cheap place to go.
Absolute necessity!!!. Absolutely brilliant and never before experience. Never knew traditional Thai massage would be an out of the world experience. Would love to get more of the massage.

Mass market. Expected a lot more based on past experience years ago. It has become a mass market touristy placeVery commercialised operation. You first pay, then wait in a huge lobby for your name to be called over PA system. No zen or relaxing feel whatsoever. The staircase was decorated with candles, but only few were lit. The treatment room was somewhat worn our, gaps in the wooden laminate floor, the massage bed was oily. The masseuse was a little rough, for example threw and pulled the towel instead of gently laying it on and lifting it from the body; both masseuse were talking between themselves and did not bother to whisper, the aircon was very noisy and blowing strong wind, but was switched off upon request. Towards the end, when we were the last guests, the masseuse opened the door and left it open while we were still having our massage. Since the music had stopped (probably centrally controlled), we could hear the cleaners chatting and the lift door opening and closing.The massage itself was OK-ish, nothing special.We had much better massages in BKK and would not come back.

Great Place to Relax. This is always a great place to unwind and relax. The pricing here is very reasonable given the fact that the place is very clean and beautifully renovated. The service by the masseuse is fantastic. This is the place to go for massage in Bangkok!!

Nothing special. We didn't make a reservation in advance, leaving the only choice of foot massage for 1 hour. We actually had the "foot" for 40 minutes and 10 minutes for touching on arms, shoulders, and head. 10 minutes were missing :) And the foot part is just average.

Fantastic Spa. Probably the biggest Spa in Bangkok. The building is huge and nicely done up interiors. The spa rooms are clean with experienced masseuse. There are multiple packages to choose from and to a surprise prices are very reasonable in fact you may fine some of the treatments lesser priced then some of the less prominent spas.It is highly recommended and reservation would save from the disappointment of not having you massage planned.

Masseur left scratch marks all over my partner's body and a mark on his forehead which didnt go off even after 2 days. Few years back I came here for a massage and enjoyed myself thoroughly. Went back with my friends and partner for a full body massage. Me and my partner both did aromatherapy massage which cost 950 baht for 1.5hrs. Mine went pretty well and I enjoyed myself thoroughly. However, my partner's masseur had long fingernail which scratch and cut him. After the massage, his back was filled with scratch marks and there was even a patch/ mark on his forehead that didnt go off even after many days.

Not value for money!. The lady that attended to us was very abrupt and literally forced us to make a on-the-spot decision. Her English was quite bad as she spoke too quickly and we couldn't understand half of what she was trying to tell us. In the end, we paid THB2700 / SGD110 each for the 150 mins Back Pain Treatment. The package included Abyanga - Special Back Pain Treatment - Shower - Refreshments. The whole back massage treatment lasted for 110mins? I suppose the extra 40mins are for us to shower ourselves :( The refreshments never appeared. For the price I paid, I expected much better masseurs, better trained as well to alleviate my back pain, although I have to admit the surroundings and ambience were very nice.I would not recommend this place to anyone unless they are the picky kind that wants a clean, luxurious spa-like experience. Even so, you could probably get the same treatment at your own hotel spa without having to travel out.I had much better massages for THB200 at the many shops that can be found all around Bangkok, if you are not fussy about the ambience and the iffy chairs and cushions. I felt ripped-off at Healthland. I will not return.

No frills massage, value for money. Clean, comfortable location, efficient service. We went there several times, only on one occasion one of the masseurs 'politely' asked for tips before it even finished.

Weird Massage Factory. I always heard great things about healthland and my husband and I finally went on our anniversary. what a strange experience. (FYI i have had over 80 thai massages.) the lobby was crowded and noisy. we paid for our foot massages and we were asked to sit down and few mins later a PA screamed out our names. we were taken to 'locker room' style area and our shoes were whisked away, we were led into a dark room with over 60 other people getting foot massages. everytime a massage finished another human replaced them and were frantically massaged. I felt very bad for the masseuse. I have no idea how many massages each masseuse gave that day. The room itself was quiet and the seats were very comfortable, the massage itself was ok. i dont think i will ever go back for one, i think i will stick with my thai massage down the soi.
perfect. clean ,professional ,positive attitude with guest please try oil treatment ,or thai massage i really want to go back soon

Horrible reception service, disrespectful treatment. Have visited this place a couple of times. Knowing that this is more like a factory spa rather than a personal spa, I know that I cannot expect a personal, warm approach. But that's OK if you know this and you purely come for the treatment. But this time was just horrible. I enquired some info and the lady boy hostess at the reception desk was unbelievably rude. I could not believe how I was treated by her. Not surprisingly, I walked out and will not come back here again. Management should take actions against this.

Great Massage. Been there twice during my stay there. I staying at Siam and this place is much better than massage shops near my hotel. Well train staff for massage and best quality of massage i can ever get. But not sure it is culture or what, after massage / spa, everyone awaiting for tips. That is making people to feel obligated. Front desk lady is rude. She is the one standing and asking for what type we want all. She can speak little English and as a front desk, should be more polite. Anyway I will come back here fort massage.

Great Price for Great Environment. You will not find a better high class environment for a massage.Of course being a chain, the quality can differ but relatively well managed and well trained masseurs.Only gripe is that it is extremely crowded and bookings are a must.

Massage in a factory like enviroment. Massage and Thailand go together like eggs and ham. We tried Health Land based on numerous reviews. If you're looking for a nice, quiet, relaxing, zen like experience, this may not be for you. If on the other hand, you're looking for a quick in and out massage with minimal fuss, this is your place.

Average Thai Massage with good ambience. My second visit here. First visit was great last year with 1 hour foot massage. This visit was average as after 2 hours of Thai massage, my body doesn't seems to get relief from its ache. As such, I'll skip Thai Massage here in future.

Tourist trap - Horrible experience!!. I made my reservation 2 days in advance for a thai massage / 2 hours (me and my boyfriend) and it was confirmed for 7:30pm.From the outside, the venue is quite imponent and once you enter inside the ambiance matches a spa environment (it was a weekday though). We paid in advance and we had to wait in the main room until our names got called. Then, two ladies escorted us to another floor where our massage room was. It was clean and we had to put on their massage clothes. We only started the massage at 8:00pm and throughout its duration the two ladies didn't stop chitchatting (luckily it was in thai, unknown language for us, otherwise we would have hate it!). For our surprise the massage was finished by 9:30pm! Hence, at the end, the masseusses (or should I say "random and clueless old ladies lacking experience"?) begged for tipping - especifically asking for 100thb and not giving us the chance to judge and offer what we thought was correct based on the service. We actually ended up not having any change (only 500 and 100thb) and the ladies started complaining and got mad! We had to apologize for not having any change - ridiculous! Never in my life I experienced something like this, especially working in tourism / hospitality as well for years.When the ladies escorted us on the way to the main room, they completely changed their attitude with us, by being rude. I specifically asked to speak to the manager to let them know about the inccident (the fact that we paid for a 2 hours massage and got 1h30 each, not even mentioning the rest - tips, attitude, professionalism, etc). The spa guest relations came and apologize, referring that the staff would be punished for that and that they were sorry again. I told them that I didn't want the staff to be punished but instead to be compensated in some way with either a price discount or even more time for free (yes, I gave them the chance to come back!). Their only answer was that they would accept my reservation for a foot massage next time since they normally don't accept them. Incredible - thank you so much for the kindness - not! We just left angry and in the next day, as a test, I called them to check if they had time to process and if they were going to compensated us in any way. Not surprisingly, they had no clue of the process, no one answer properly and they just said again "sorry mam, sorry mam".Actually, I tried to write this review asap in order to share my bad experience, avoiding that others step into this place! On a side note, I tried other massage places in the area and they were all good /more authentic and slightly cheaper.

Quality Assured. health land is well known among the locals and tourists, be sure to book your slot way in advance (I recommend 3days). the prices are reasonable (in fact almost the same as those shops along the streets), and most importantly, service is good and massage is excellent... I'd come again and again! you'll be satisfied :)

Good, Bad & Extremely Popular. Having been to this branch of Health Land five times so far this year, I think the quality and service-mindedness of its masseuses varies. Some will ask how you want your Thai massage and at the end never beg for anything. Others are keener in pushing for tips. Since most customers are foreign, the staff didn’t realise I was Thai and, when I pulled a 100-baht bill out of my pocket in the lift, joked about getting the “red-coloured bank.” Similarly I heard from one Japanese client that his masseuse complaint after giving her 50 baht. Yet, given its convenient urban locations, Health Land’s treatments and packages still offer good value for money. For example, 120-min Thai massage costs only 500 baht (free for SCB First credit card holders). If you prefer the peace and quiet, try to visit on weekday morning. On Saturday/Sunday the atmosphere is as hectic as public hospitals’. Even if you've made a reservation, you may be kept waiting for up to 20 minutes. At the weekend the toilets normally run out of tissue papers, yet another indication of Health Land’s popularity.

Worth of money!. Went this shop 3 times during our 5 days visit in BKK.
The 2 times Thai Massage were 50/50, one was excellent, one was just so-so.
We were impressed by the "Rejuvenate Me" package, we both fell asleep "unconciously" during the Shiro Dhara session, it's just relaxing!

Gave it a second chance. After having a Thai massage (2hr), which was good for me but my BF was not impressed, we decided to give it another chance the next day. We tried the foot reflexology(1hr) and were extremely disappointed. The masseuses were clueless in foot reflexology. They both were run of the mill, off the street older ladies with no actual idea of what they were doing except rubbing your feet, lower legs and knee area. It was done in a huge room with 30+ reclining chairs and most were full, thus very noisy. We also had a customer who was sleeping and snoring so loudly it was disturbing. I think he had sleep apnea. After 45 minutes of rubbing and no pressure points touched in our feet, they both left and we sat for 3-5 minutes wondering what was going on and if the massage was over. When they returned, the foot reflexology became an arm and shoulder shove, moving into a seated on a stool shoulder massage(digging elbows into our necks and backs) and in no way relaxing... My BF said, he was happy the torture was over in the end... We are both seasoned travelers and have had many massages through out the world, I have even gone through a Thai massage course and this might have been the worst massage we have experienced. To top it off, the large room was like a freezer in temperature and though they gave me a blanket, the lady doing my BF didn't even offer him one... instead he used a towel to try to keep warm....

Relax..... & Enjoy!!!!!. JUST WOW... They have very well trained staffs for the treatments. this place is very famous you will have to have a reservation for your preferred treatment. It is not costly, if you are there in Asoke for couple of days I would recommend you to go there daily to relax and enjoy.Please request the reception to allot a person who speaks/understands English to give you the massage treatment. I had difficulties in explaining to my allotted staff. And please do tip them if you liked the treatments.

Train station. I went to several spas and Health Land has an excellent reputation, my friends living in BKK recommended to me. I went to two locations and twice was disappointed. It feels like a factory, guests are called by microphone when they are up for the massage, massage rooms are very small and lots of noise from the hallway. price is ok but I will not go back, there are better spas around.

Will not come back again. The environment n all the software is nice n impressive~ but the massage itself is just barely pass. Before and after massage got not much big different~ i think any massage place can better than that. For 250b per hr, u can find everywhere in Asoke. I am fine the massagers leave early(suppose a 2 hrs massage, it stared at 9:05Pm and finished at 9:40pm) provided the price is low n they should be very tired... But the left in the middle of the massage without saying a word is not acceptable... At least should say go toilet or go wash hand etc to let us know what they r doing... The service is bad!! When i and my hubby is talking as my hubby not enjoy the massage so he want chat with me to enjoy the 2 ppl time... Yet the 2 massagers talk by themselves together... Again, i do not mind they talk... But we were talking.... So we stop talking n let them chat... The experience isnt good at all!

Great value for money. Hubby and I go for regular Massage and Foot Reflexology in our homeland and when travelling. At Health Land Asoke, we had the Traditional Thai Massage on one day, and Therapeutic Massage and Foot Reflexology on another day. Health Land provided great value for money for its interior design, cleanliness, and masseur skill! Highly recommended!

Excellent massages . There are a mixture of reviews for Health Land but myself and my friend had two excellent massages and a very good experience there. Maybe we were lucky, but it was very quiet when we went-we had already booked so only waited five minutes and were seen by very friendly staff. I had the two hour Thai massage for 500THB and my friend had the Aromatherapy massage for 950THB for 90 minutes and both were truly excellent. We have had a lot of massages between us and I trained in Thai massage in Thailand so we feel qualified to say that! We were not pestered for tips, as many people have written, and both tipped generously. The facilities are spotless. I hope you have the same great experience as me!
Worth a try. Recommended by a Thai friend. Had a 2 hour traditional Thai massage. It was good and relaxing. Highly recommended. A short 10mins+ walk from BTS Sukhumvit or Asok MRT stations.

Good & Clean Environment Thai Massage. 15 mins walking distance from Asoke BTS....Good, clean and comfortable environment. Service is very systematic....I like their clean white sheet and Orchid flower placed on the pillow for the body massage room. As for foot massage, the mass chairs in a huge dark room which is comfortable enough for me. Hot pandan drink will be served after the massages. On the whole, it's a relaxing experience...been there many times when I frequent Bangkok. If you go in a group, it's good to make reservation first and buy their package which will save you about Bhat1,000 and valid for 1 year.

Lovely thai massage. If you're looking for a cheap traditional thai massage, this is the place to be. My boyfriend and I were lucky to have a friend recommend this place to us and found this along with Divana as our top choices for massages. If you're looking for ambiance, Divana is a little pricy and more worth if for environment. However, Health land is more geared toward giving you the direct massage without the expensive price. I would definitely recommend booking an appointment as this place gets pretty pack, normal wait time would be between 1-2 hours. I would also opt out of the facial unless you face is dry or sunburn like mines, as their facial is more geared toward applying products toward your face.

Good massage. I came here twice, first attempt booking fully booked so I try the foot massage. It was not too bad. I book a full body massage on the following day late afternoon. The 2 hrs massage really help to release the tight and stiff should and my back.

Better then street palor yet not really a spa. Very mass public feel when getting your service provided.The process of paying till massage till go off is very clockwise operation with little interaction. it a no-frill massage joint, for truely luxury service and ambiences, BHAWA Spa is my choice.

Absolutely lovely Thai massage. We were lucky enough to be taken here by a friend who is Thai. Though you can easily walk in at any time and get a treatment without speaking Thai as the staff seemed to have some level of English and the spa menu is in EnglishWe opted for the 2 hour Thai massage for 500 Baht. Absolutely divine! You are given a set of clothes - fishermans pants and top to wear for the massage (no oil is used - just pressure/massage). The two hours flew by and before we knew it were done. Highly recommend to anyone travelling to Bangkok.

MacSpa - production-line massage but value for money and meet your needs. Healthland Asoke is about 5 mins walk from Asoke BTS Station if you walk on the small lane between Westin and Terminal 21. Easy access to BTS makes it popular and busy even on weekdays. Went on Monday afternoon and it was crowded but not cramped as they have a large waiting area at the reception. Tried both the traditional massage and Ayurvedic treatments. A 1-hour therapeutic massage costs THB 350. The massage is firm and pressure is good. This is one of the better Thai massage I had in Bangkok, I would go back again for the traditional thai massage. However, the Shirodara (Indian Head Massage) which costs THB 2,000 is a waste of time and money. The head massage was just mediocre and the warm oil dripping on the forehead is not exactly soothing. Would give this a miss.Didn't have any issue with masseur harrasing me for tips as both masseurs left me alone after serving tea. Would recommend Healthland if you are looking for quality massage at a reasonable price in a clean environment.

Great Massage with no pressures of "Extras". I have had many Massages in Thailand and this would have to be within the top 5. When I get a massage I want a real massage and this place provided. We had the 2 hour Thai massage and I managed to fall asleep at one point. We are going back each trip as there are many locations to choose from

not a relaxing experience. as terrible as Estrella Spa at Anantara. Going to health land is as stressful as going to a trading floor. From registration to getting your massage, one moves along as if in a tour group. It is busy, noisy and huge and most importantly, the massage is lousy. The possible consolation is that it is not sleazy, unlike some spas such as Estrella Spa at Ananatara, which is very expensive and provided sexual services. Don't go there, they do not refund your money when you protest against the integrity of the spa.

Too commercialised!. We booked this place for 9 persons the day before. We arrived 10 minutes late and had to wait for the next available slots which tuned out to be a 40 minutes wait! Once we got to the room, the Thai massage was average and the masseur was hinting of tips towards the end. I don't mind giving some tips but would not like people to expect for it. My other friends had mixed feedback, some poor and some were good. So, overall it was a bit too commercialised for me and would not come back again.

Best value spa in bangkok. A very large spa. Great at everything: interior, design, staff, quality, service, etc. Try Thai traditional body massage for 2 hrs (don't remember the price but it's quite cheap as market price). Just one thing, after you finish, staff will ask for tips. I just hate the way they repeat their words "Tip for me! Tip for me" around my head.
Good massage! . This place is organised, room is clean and professional massage. We paid THB 500 for 2 hours traditional Thai massage. If only the masseur can put on a smile will be perfect!

Poor service of massage & tips demanding staff. This massage centre used to our preference, but after this visit we would say we won't go back this centre anymore. We are 3 for massage services, 2 for traditional thai massage & 1 for foot massage. We feel the quality of massage had dropped, no energy at all during the massage treatment. After we ended our massage n the staff were standing there to wait for tips. To us, tips are given at our willingness. But they standing there n asking us to give them the tip & still unhappy with the tips amount we have. Most terrible is when my hb n mother were completed the treatment at the same time, my hb did not have small notes n gave a 100baht note to share among 2 & then walk out. The most unpleasant feeling is they still chase out n asking extra 1 more tips n said that we must give 1 more tips because they are 2 people. We are really dissapointed with their massage quality n also tips demanding attitude. They provided poor massage service n quality n asking more tips. No doubt the massage price at this centre is cheaper than lot of huge massage centre. But with this kind of quality n demanding tips staff, I rather choose to pay more to go other massage centre.

Overall good massage but lacking the personal touch. It is advisable that you book your massage in advance because this place is always packed with people. The place is huge and is run like a factory. You are basically ushered from place to place and told what to do. Service staff lack the personal touch. Prices seem to have increased over the years.To be fair, the place is very clean, with nice ambience and personal shower facilities in each massage room. The masseuse i had was professional and good and i enjoyed that she took care of the details during the massage.

Aromatherapy Body Massage. As usual we will visit Healthland at least once every time we were in Bangkok. It has become like a clinic/hospital operation, not so much for relaxation anymore. THB950 for 90mins, a little steep compare to those along any road and area you can walk-in.Have tried at Sathorn branch in our previous trip and this time at Asoke. The therapist's skills were equally good. A good place for tourists who wants a clean and nice massage during their trips. Best to book in advance...

Cheap Foot Massage in a Classy Environment - All Other Treatments Costs a Bomb. The foot massage is value for money, considering that the environment is classy and setup like a proper health centre. Treatments will cost you about the same you get from a 5-star hotel, which is why I wouldn't recommend it.

Great Foot Massage. I have been coming here for a number of years, and I am always happy with what I get it. Reasonable priced and consistent massage. The ladies are strong and do their job well.They are not engaging, but I come here looking for a good massage, not to make any friend or expecting a super service. At the end they always wait to say "goodbye", and I always tip about 50thb.I will keep coming back.

Pretty embarrassing. A massage here costs around double what you will pay on average for the same massage anywhere else in Bangkok. I get the impression they are very much geared towards wealthy Chinese mainland tourists. As a westerner or a Thai you can be expected to be felt a bit "second class". You are largely paying for the very clean surrounds, linen & little extra touches. The massage was good (my fourth & my last). I have tried this place a few times as I keep hearing good reviews. I would add that the air conditioner was dripping on me for most of the massage, which was unhygienic & annoying.At the end of my massage ( twin room with my wife) I thanked the staff & was about to give a small tip, as I always do, they both said TIP TIP TIP, you give Tip! And put their hands out. I felt this was confronting and rude. I tipped anyway 50THB each, not a big tip but still not bad since I had already paid $1900THB for us to have a massage, they both gave me a disgusted look & said " MORE TIP" I felt humiliated & like they thought I was ungrateful, my wife was embarrassed & we both left immediately. Sorry health land you really upset me, I won't be coming back & as air crew for a major airline who frequent your spa I will be sharing my experience with my colleagues, many of which go to your spa every day.

the macdonalds of massage centres. it's a bit like a fast food resturant where you tell the cashier what massage service you want and then wait to get called, ushered to change into slippers, be brought up to your little room to change into standard issue tops and fisherman pants and get your 2hrs thai massage done. No frills, pretty good standards although you may get the feeling that the massage lady may be just going through the motions. but the place is clean and decent (no dodgy offers or extras!) and just like at macdonalds, there is a benchmark standard and you know what you get. the massage ladies will then stand along the stairs to bid you goodbye and this will be your cue to give them a tip. dont be too cheap with a 20bht tip - she did after all kneaded all your knots and pains away for the last 2 hrs.

depending on your luck. Went to healthland spa as its near to my hotel (the one nearest to chong nongsi BTS) without checking much on the reviews.We were there earlier than scheduled but after waiting for close to 10 minutes my husband decided to go to the toilet since we have waited so long and no response. After like 30 second or so one of the therapist came to me say go in now. I said no wait for my husband. She stood there with a super black face and after for like less than 1 minute wait she called up to me to call my husband with a very rude gesture and black face. I called my husband and when he came out the therapist then speaks to the other therapist in thai and they both continued on.The massage was ok depending on your luck. The lady that i've got managed to cure my long term back pain and thats it.(If not for her i would rate the spa as 1) My husband's therapist just did a so so job with a lot of shortcuts. We ended up earlier than 2 hours as they take in the waiting time (if they delay the start time do check as they follow strictly to your appt time no matter what time you start). The worst of all is that both me and my husband felt terrible pain and ache soon after the massage as they never massaged the lower back . It literally felt like the whole massage and ache went to that area? I wouldn't recommend anyone to go there if possible. Although price may be kinda attractive, with the lack of skills and terrible check in experience i would not go there again.Oh ya the main turn off was the girls waiting for tips straight after our massage!!!

Health land therapeutic massage. If you have medical problems, dont expect this place to provide a trained professional. They have what they call therapeutic massage. I went in the room and showed the lady a drawing of the area needs attention. She spoke no English, i speak little thai and it was not good. She started by digging her thumbs into my neck mussel, which caused a shock like pain straight to the back of my head. I explained to her not to use her thumbs. The she tried to use her hands as i suggested, it was like she didn't ununderstand about spine nerve damage. I told her to stop, walked back to the waiting area and the front desk walked over to me, gave me my money and said sorry. As far as thai, foot or oil massage goes, i think no problem, but not a health clinic at all.

Bad attitude and terrible service . The place seems nice and grand from the outside but inside it is filled with black and sour faces. The masseurs are rude and unfriendly. A group of us chose the aromatherapy massage which was supposed to last 1.5 hours but it only lasted about an hour or so. Anyone who has experienced REAL massage would know that their skills are terrible. One of them even tried to chase us out by saying "okay finish finish" when we were drinking our teas whilst putting on our shoes. Another one shouted "tip my friend, tip my friend" which was just a huge turn off. This spa is purely for tourists and we will never return again. The management needs to do something about their staff. What a shame!

Cheap and definitely worth the money . It's a definite place to come whenever I visit bangkok. Their locals visit here as well since the prices for basic services like foot massage are very similar to those small shops along Siam or Pratunam area. It will be difficult to get a cab if you ended your session late at night; you could take the bts which is about 7 mins walk along the quiet lane. Booking can be made via phone but if you do not want to spend overseas calling charges, you can just walk in and wait at the main lobby. The wait is usually around 30 mins but the place is so cosy that you won't mind the wait.

Very bad service. Had a booking for Thai massage. Came in and was greeted with super unfriendly attitude at the front desk! No smiles, unwilling answers, take it or leave it attitude! Will never come again. Nothing special anyway & pricier den other massage place. Strongly do not recommend.

If you prefer the Disneyland/McDonald's version of a spa. Against my better judgement, I didn't walk out of Health Land Asoke as soon as I walked in the door. This place is HUGE and does not feel or look like a place you'd want to unwind and relax in, as a spa should be. The lobby looks like the entrance to a luxury hotel and it was filled with tourists. That should have been the red flag to leave immediately but this was within walking distance from my hotel and I really wanted a foot massage since they had no openings for a thai massage and could take me immediately without an appt.I went to the front desk (literally looked like a hotel reception desk with all these women in suits behind the counter) and asked for a foot massage. I was told it would be a 30 minute wait. She hands me a receipt and tells me to go pay the cashier (I can't stand places that make you pay before the services are even rendered but given the amount of people coming in and out, I could see why they want pre-payment). I wait in their noisy lobby (high ceilings, poor acoustics, lots of people = loud, loud, loud). Wait for my name to get called and if you don't hear it, don't worry, they'll announce your name over the LOUDSPEAKER. Really? The only place I've heard your name or number being called over the loudspeaker is at a fast food restaurant.I proceed to follow the lady to the foot massage room which is essentially a huge room (about 60 chairs) filled with leather loungers. Given the amount of people in the room getting foot massages, it wasn't so loud but the most distracting was the noise coming from the hallways as you heard people getting shuffled/herded like cattle to their treatments by their therapists.The massage itself was good and for the price 300THB it was a good deal, however, a random place on the street would probably been quieter and cheaper.As others mentioned, the staff linger around you as you're sipping the tea they give you, waiting for a tip.Given the number of massage places in Bangkok, skip this location (not sure if all the Health Land's are like this) and find a place that is truly a spa and not a factory.

Amazing massage at a great price point!. All I can say is that I want to spend hours and hours and hours at this spa. The Thai massage is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. The spa is clean, the staff are very friendly, and I've never not thoroughly enjoyed a service there. My group walked in and were all shown to our massage rooms within 30 minutes time. I can't wait to go back again!

Tips demanding staff. I visited the massage parlor with my family this may. Environment is so so, the message is okay though. However the experience was destroyed by the staff demanding for tips at the end of the session. As it was the last day of our trip we don't have much thai baht left, we decided to give them our small change. They are not satisfied and gave us that ridiculous look when we pass them the tips. Prepare to give them tips 500 baht or more else they will give you that degrading look. Don't bring your friends there if they don't like to pay huge amount of tips.

Very disappointing and felt haressed. Been to Healthland Asoke for many years and I'd realised in the recent years, the service and quality has dwindled tremendously. Firstly, the masseuses were happily chatting during the massage period. Secondly, we paid for 2 hrs of massage but received only 1hr 45mins of massage. Thirdly, despite prices of Thai massage going upwards (350 THB), the masseuses keep haressing us for a 100THB tip. And it was from almost finishing the massaging to walking us to lobby area to bringing us our slippers. It was really annoying and a huge turn off. Lastly, the massage felt like it had dropped hugely in standard. The massage didn't feel like it opened any part of my body despite that being described as it's objective. Think this would be my last time visiting them sadly. Now it's time to find my new favourite massage place.

Talkative uncaring therapists "cattle market". I have visited Healthland several times and the last 2 times I have been very disappointed. On my previous visit I thought maybe they were just having a bad day so I did not complain. This time I can see the service has really gone down. We were 3 persons for a Thai massage with herbal balls. We were herded to the appropriate massage room by 3 therapists. They chatted the whole time amongst themselves. As I have been visiting Thailand for the past 20 years at least 2 or 3 times a year I know what a good Thai massage is like. In the past I have had good Thai massages at Healthland but I now feel that this branch has now become a cattle market. Myself and my 2 friends all had a different massage ending with the herbal balls being being scrapped and bashed upon us in an uncaring manner. Needless to say on my next journey to Thailand I will not be returning to this branch of Healthland

My go-to place in Bangkok for spa treatments!. Bangkok has a lot of options for spas (from stand-alone shops to five-star hotels which I will treat myself to once in a while), but Health Land in Asoke is my go-to place for spa treatments on a regular basis as it is good quality and reasonably priced. Their aromatherapy massage, body scrub and foot massage are all winners for me. The staff are friendly and experienced. Would recommend to anyone looking for spa treatments.

Best authentic thai massage . Having tried both the Thai massage at Divana Massage and Health Land, I must say that it's not an easy decision to choose between. Here's my verdict:Divana Massage is amazing if you are seeking for a relaxing ambiance. I got the couple Siamese massage with my girlfriend and was truly amazed with their service. We were greeted with Thai herbal tea and was asked how we liked our massage; soft or medium. We chose medium. We were directed to our own private room to change. The room is clean and has a great decor. The music was relaxing and our masseuses were polite and accommodating.Now on to the massage, the massage was *drum roll* okay. I felt that was it softer than expected. It could be because I'm a guy so I didn't feel much pressure. After the massage, Divana treated us with mango and sticky rice.Now onto health land. I tried to book an appointment with health land over the phone and can agree with past tripadvisor's reviews, they're a bit rude and rushy. I decided to give them a try anyway. My girlfriend and I made an appointment but were late due to the sheer madness that is called bangkok traffic. Upon checking in, they told us that our appointments were no longer valid because we were 20 minutes late. They asked us to wait along with several other people for an hour. We both chose the Thai massage and were directed to our own room.How was it? It was long, amazing and painful. If you can take the pain and are looking to get rid of all of your knots, health land is it! In addition, it's only 500 baht for two hours !Health Land:Cleanliness: 8/10Customer service: 6/10Ambiance: 6/10Thai massage: 9/10Pain: 8/10Price: super affordable DivanaCleanliness: 9/10Customer service: 9/10Ambiance: 9/10Thai massage: 6/10Pain: 2/10Price: upscaleOverall, I liked health land a lot more. If you don't mind not having all of the bells and whistles but can take the pain and want all of your knots removed, health land is it. In contrast, if you are seeking for exceptional service and have never had a Thai massage before, Divana is the place to go since Thai massages could be quite painful.

Pay 2 Hours and get 1:30. The place is big, like a Hotel. we didn't have reservation so we waited for 45 minutes with a lot of people, like a hospital reception, any magazine in English, they could offer a tea, but they are so cold... You pay before the massage.The room is ok, with a TV.who wants a TV turned on during the massage? Anyway we tried to find some channel with relaxing music and a dim light.The massage was ok, I did in other places for the half of price. Another thing that makes me crazy, why the masseurs don't stop talking and laughing all the time. It's not professional.My masseur took a break for 5 minutes and come back. we had 1:30 massage and we payed for 2. We left without complain, because it's a lost of energy.

Out of this world!!!!. 2 hour Thai Massage for 500 THB is INCREDIBLE. The service at this place is out of this world. You can pamaper yourself for hours and hours and yet want more. These folks have a massive patronage so good luck with a reservation but do call them uo to check since they arent very flexible about timmings. Once there their selection of SO MANY massages and the sheer sinze of that place will blow your mind. The therapists are really nice and needless to say they do a brilliant job. it is not one of theose shady Bangkok massage parlors but infact more of a holistic healing institution. Great Experience

Cheap and Adequate Massage. After hearing rave reviews from friends, I decided to try out the massage with friends. The overall experience was adequate at best. The only reason why I would be back would be the price. I paid THB$500 for a 2hr traditional Thai massage. It is strongly recommended that you call to make a reservation beforehand as there are a lot of walk-in customers. There are many branches across Bangkok and this is the only one that is near a BTS station. The nearest station is BTS Asok. From there it is about 300m or 10mins walk behind Terminal 21 mall. The spa centre is a sprawling 8-storey building with a huge reception. Like one commented, the welcome staff service is cold and unfriendly. I was quizzed whether I had made a booking and upon confirmation immediately requested that I make payment. We were asked to wait at the lobby and they will announce your turn over the PA system, after which your masseur would change your footwear and lead you to the lift.As it is a traditional Thai massage we were asked to changed into robes but sadly there were no changing rooms available for the ladies which I find the amenities wanting. The masseurs were skilled but they started chatting and laughing throughout the entire 2hrs which I found irritating as it meant the experience wasn't tranquil or serene. Pockets of silence was punctured by the sound of the air-conditioning which would be better if they and played some soothing music on the speakers instead. As with some massage centres, my biggest gripe is the absence of a head-hole when I'm lying face down. This causes me to turn my head to the side and inherently causes my neck to be strained, thus further ruining the supposedly relaxing experience of a massage. All in all I would try out other massage places and would only pop by if I happen to pass by a Health Land centre instead of actively seeking out one.

Quality no longer like before... I first visited Healthland many years ago and find that their service has dropped tremendously. Booked a traditional thai massage at Asoke branch and the masseuse's face was as dark as the night skies outside and her strength is average at best. I know it's work as usual for them but come on...this is the service sector and creating positive impressions (by smiling) are important. Two days later I called to make a reservation and despite repeating the thai massage I wanted, the tone of the lady who answered the phone was downright rude "what you want what you want? You want massage but what type you want?" When she finally got it she replied "don't have place don't have...no more. You cannot massage today." No apologies nothing...not even a goodbye when the call ended. Their business have grown over the years but unfortunately their service went the other way. It happens to companies that got too big and take their customers for granted - Healthland is a good example. Try the smaller chains and you may be pleasantly surprised.

Value for money but Out of the way. Very good service for the price we pay. For traditional thai massage, 500 baht for 2 hours. It's relatively cheap compared to many other massage places out there. Health Land at Asoke looks very established and organised. We booked our 7pm slot in the morning. Make sure you call and make booking in advance and never walk in to avoid disappointment. Arriving at Health Land 15 minutes before the appointment, there were already a lot of people sitting in the spacious lobby waiting for their massages. We paid at the counter, then waited for the receptionist to call our name. Two massage ladies came to pick us up from the lobby and brought us to the room. Although it's a 2 hour session, we started at 7.15pm (taking lift, changing clothes), and ended at 9pm promptly. During the massage, the lady did occasionally go out for toilet break and wash her hands before massaging my head. So they didn't give me the full 2 hour services. However, massage was good, and I fell asleep half way, got woken up by the television light which was turned on by the massage lady.

Pay for 2 hours, get 90 minutes (then a hot-ton of stress for querying it). KEEP YOUR EYE ON THE CLOCK.. My friend and I had a very disappointing experience after booking a 2-hr Thai massage. The premises were nice-looking but the service left a lot to be desired. Our joint 6.30 rub down didn't end up starting until 6.45 (me) and 6.50 (my friend). The quality of my massage was OK, but not great - I got the sense she couldn't be bothered - and my friend's masseuse pretty much ignored him throughout (no mean feat during this kind of one-on-one interaction)!An hour or so in, both masseuses took an impromptu 5-10 minute break. After the next phase of the treatment - a head massage - we were being goodbyed to at 8.25.We reported our lost 25/30 mins to the reception staff and the de-relaxation began: the woman in charge made us wait 20 mins while our complaint was disputed in front of us and the masseuses shot us dirty looks. Eventually - finally! - a heated discussion in the lobby won us the right proportion of our 1000THB back.Realxing? No! Every other massage we've had in Thailand has been better - even in the cheaper places - and thankfully came without all the hassle attached. Maybe you'll be luckier than we were, but I'd probably advise anyone to avoid the risk and try elsewhere.

Good therapethique massage, but welcom auality should be improved. We come here since years twice each time we come to Bangkok.You never failled in your massage and price are OK.Place is very clean and nice.The main weak point is the welcome when we arrive, very cold, direct, no smile.You should really improve this

Always a relaxing way to get rid of your aching body after a tiring trip in Bangkok. Been here a couple of times whenever I am in Bangkok. As usual, people waiting to get their body tune up. Opt for aroma massage but no slot available; nothing new to me. Went for hot oil massage instead, BAHT 1,500 for 90 mins. The whole session was good and sweet. Body well shaped up and feeling great.This is a certainly a place not to be missed when you are in Bangkok.

First Choice of Thai Massage Shop. One of the Best in thailand... Every Trip i landed to bangkok. i will head down for good Thai massage and foot massage.. the place is clean and staff is good and helpful.. the skill of the massage is good. remember to phone them for advance booking for the time slot. if you walk in. there no chance getting massage expect foot massage.. Cheers

Rude staff. I live in Bangkok and Healthland (Asok) has been my go-to place for massages for the past year, but recently, I've started to notice that the service there is not that great. I usually book appointments first thing in the morning because it leaves the rest of the day to do something else. I've never been late for an appointment, but the check-in takes forever. That wouldn't be a problem because I like to relax before a massage, but I've noticed that the masseuse considers the "waiting" time as "massage" time and I get cheated out of 20, sometimes 30 minutes of massage. For example, if you book a two-hour massage starting at 9am, and you don't actually hit the massage mat until 9:30 because of the check-in delay, they WILL end the massage at 11am, so you are essentially missing out on 30 minutes worth of massage time. Last week, I took my mom to Healthland as a treat. In our case, we booked a Thai massage first thing in the morning when the place opened at 9am. Every time I book a massage, the receptionist who receives my call warns me that I MUST be on time, which is why I am never late. We arrived around 8:45am and the place was open, but only one person (the only one who can speak English fluently) was shuffling around at the reception area getting the place ready. This has been the case during all my visits and I’ve noticed that the lady gets upset when you approach her too early. This time, she was already taking care of someone, so I got in line to claim my reservation. The lady was nice this time and when two other ladies showed up behind the counter, she told me to pay for the service upfront. So I went up to one of them to try to pay and was told curtly that I had to wait…..but the lady just said that I had to pay…..I’ve also noticed that masseuses and other receptionists were showing up to work after 9:00, thus delaying the check-in process even more. By the time we were directed upstairs to the massage area, it was already 9:17. I told my mother to hurry up and change because every minute counts. My mom, who doesn’t know the Thai custom of non-confrontation, went up to one of the masseuses and told her that it was already 20 past the hour. The masseuse took offense and started to yell at my mother: “What do you mean it’s 20 past the hour?!” “Don’t you think I can read the clock?!” “What do you think I’m going to do?!!” I was pretty shocked that she reacted that way considering that the Thais are very unassuming people. Perhaps my mother shouldn’t have said anything, but the bottom line is that we are the customers and that attitude was uncalled for. The masseuse took the blanket and instead of covering my mom up with it, she dropped it on her. She then proceeded to complain about us in Thai to the other masseuse. The next two hours were spent uncomfortably and we didn’t enjoy our massage. We did get the full two-hour massage this time, thanks to my mother. Hindsight, I probably should have requested a different masseuse for my mother. Healthland churns customers like water and they don’t stop to think about how they are treating us. At the end of the massage, the masseuses usually have their hands out for tips which I think is very presumptuous. I’m starting to think that I need to find another spa that treats customers with respect.

Terrible experiences in Foot Massage. We visited the location yesterday nite, Mar 22, 2015. I and wife have a 2 hour Thai massage and 1 hour Foot massage. We enjoyed the Thai massage, but the foot massage was the very bad experiences for both me and my wife.The foot massage staff did a very poor job in massaging my wife's feet and we called in the manager, Mr. Zee, for a replacement, but was not given a replacement after 20 minutes waiting. We ended up with the same person after 20 minutes waiting for the replacement. The masseur came back again did a lousy job and did it for only another 20 minutes which brought the total time in less than 40 minutes. My wife waited 20 minutes and finished at the same time when the one did for me finished. Also both of them never do the typical 15 minutes final stretching & massage hand, shoulder after the foot massage. They basically just announce it finished after the foot massage.We asked the Manager and he confirmed that they were supposedly to do the massage of the hand, shoulder, head for 15 minutes after they did the foot massage. THEY DID NOT.I asked for the refund of the foot massage since we were not satisfied with the services, but Mr. Zee claimed the register had been closed. Again, we were disappointed with the manager's incapability of taking care of the situation.

Professional massage in Sukhumvit. Have visited many spas in the Sukhumvit area, with Health Land providing some of the most professional service. This facility much more resembles a clinic than the many independent massage parlors which are everywhere. Appointments can be made by telephone. Staff are very accommodating, and the actual massage was excellent. 500b for 2 hours is very affordable given the quality of the facility.

lucky me this time. Health land is a must for me whenever i visit Bangkok due to its good price & environment. Have bad experience before as the therapist keep asking me for more tips. But it hasn't happened during this trip. Frankly, i feel the therapist in Health land overall is more friendly & professional than whose in those high brand nearby. i must visit Health land again.
