Best SPA in Bangkok. We've been there during our BKK layover and tryed the medical massage. The experience was great & i will recommend it 100%. I like the SPA atmosphere very much, everything looks pretty nice.Prices are in the regular Thai Massage range (200 THB / 2 hrs).

Turned off by Bad receptionists. We wanted to find a reputable place for night massage so we walked in to make an enquiry, hoping there's available slots for massage as we did not make any reservation. There were about 5-6 ladies at the counter. The lobby was spacious and quiet. We approached the counter and asked the 1st lady we met what time are they closing? No answer from her and I repeat my question and still no answer. The ladies were talking among themselves in Thai. Alright, I moved on to 2nd lady to ask same question, thinking maybe the 1st person don't understand English. The 2nd lady looked at us like we are some kind of aliens n looked around to see if her colleagues can help her answer my simple question. Ok I moved on to 3rd lady and she answered me in a stuckup manner 'We close at 12am and our appt slots are full.' Disappointed with their stuckup poor customer service. Even those small massage shops can provide a humble and friendly service at a reasonable cost.

Amazing foot massage. This place is the best for a foot massage. For just 300 baht you get an hour of bliss. The massage place is very professional. From the moment you arrive until you leave it feels like a tranquil bliss. The perfect place to get away from the heat and the hecticness of Bangkok. It's worth the 5 min walk from the BTS to get here, don't be tempted to stop at a closer massage place as it just won't be as good!They do numerous treatments here, but I think you should book in advance as they always seem to be really busy.It is so clean, and there is AC. Best way to spend an hour.

Demanded for tips??!!!. We went there after recommendation from friend. Place is clean and air conditioned..huge compound though. We didn't make a reservation and was told that no slots for massages for two. So us opted for the one hour foot reflexology for around 600 baht for two. Was guided to a huge dimmed room where other customers were getting a foot massage as well. Quiet and relaxing environment.Massage was ok but then the lady went too hard on my legs and had to tell her to be softer. At the end of the day I had bruises on my legs. After the massage we were guided out to a seating area where we were served some warm sweet tea.. When we were bout the leave, walking up the stairs, the ladies that massaged us got their hands out and demanded for tips. We were rather shocked but gave them 100baht each. The gesture was rude and we were quite turned off. Initially we thought of returning the next day for a full body massage but we canceled the idea.Maybe it was just the ladies but it ruined the overall experience.

Massage was great, overall experience not so much. Upon entering the space, it feels much more like a disorganized festival than an actual massage place.The staff at the front counter were very rude and did not make me feel comfortable at all.Considering I have spent 3 months a year every year for the past decade in Thailand, this was a surprisingly negative experience for me.I was early for my appointment, however they made me wait until after m appointment was originally scheduled for before starting it. Usually i wouldn't care, but that day i had a tight timeline, so it set a frustrated mood for the massage.They also make you pay BEFORE the massage, which i think is a little odd as it doesn't afford the opportunity to judge the tip based on the actual quality of the massage. ( if you're paying with credit card).Any other spa in Bangkok allows you to pay at the completion of the massage.In anycase, the actual massage was quite good...however given the experience at the reception- i don't think i would visit this place again.

amazing 2hours thai massage. If you want to make sure you have a real Thai massage, you can go there. it's very professional, super clean and beautiful but prices are good (2 hours thai massage for 500 baths in March 2015). They also have a full offer of other massages but i didn't test them.

Value for money. We tried to ring the place on Saturday night but no one answered the phone. The next day, we asked the reception for recommendation and she helped us to make reservation for Thai massage.2 hours of kneading. Was painful but bearable but worth it. The body feels good. Many locals and foreigners patronize this place. Not the sleazy and uncomfortable one that I have experienced many years before.

Try another branch to check on quality and services. Good Massage nice ambient and not so many tour group so masseur are nicer and did not demand for tips. I think only Sathorn branch have this issue of demanding tips. My suggest to have good experience, maybe to avoid Sathorn branch.

Healthland Spa Standards Dropped. This is the 3rd time I've visited Healthland spa over the last 3 years and standards have definitely dropped. Run like a factory, with little focus on customer service. Found "Foot Haven" opposite Number 1 spa much better. Went there twice. Hot stone massage is incredible. Located opposite Platinum Mall.

When in Bangkok, get a massage. Health Land was, originally, recommended to us by a Thai friend and my husband loved his massage a few years back at the original location. This time, we tried the Asoke location as it was close to our hotel. I have to admit to a little trepidation based on the reviews. But, our experience was nothing short of stellar.We just walked in and only had a short wait for a masseuse to get a Thai massage. Very nice and relaxing, though I do prefer oil massages to the dry ones. So, back we went the next day to get aromatherapy massages. Unless you really, really like Thai massages, I'd recommend the aromatherapy. They also do Indian Ayurveda based treatments if you're so inclined.We didn't feel pressured to give a tip. The masseuses are so attentive and the massages so good that we ended up tipping well.So, why only 4-stars? Well, that's because the walls are thin and we had some noise floating in from the corridors. But overall, a good experience, great value for money and one we'd be glad to repeat.

Great massage but.... I tried this location after being persuaded that this branch is the real deal. My gf and I thought the service and Thai massage was great. They really know how to 'feel' and press your pressure points with precision. Not many masseuse can do that.I will definitely go back but will look for the same staff that attended to us. This place is really huge and I doubt every staff can produce the same massage quality I have experienced.

Budget Pampering. 500 baht for 2 hour massage in a private room. The facilities were quite nice, the massage was good and the tea after was enjoyable. Just be prepared for some guilt tripping after they finish when they ask for a tip. Otherwise, this place is great. NOTE: I didn't have customer service problems as I see other reviewers have. Though I came with a Thai friend who handled all communication, so maybe that's why.

Just what the trip needed. During my five days in bangkok, the wife and I had walked and shopped. We also went for foot massages where we could find one. So on the last day, my friend recommended me to head over to health land. We called to make appointment so to make sure that we do not get disappointed. The massage was mind blowing, we had the Thai Massage for 2 hours and it was the best 2 hours of Bangkok we had. The health land spa had a great lobby reception and great service provided. The price is reasonable for the service and massage. Not disappointment and will defitnetly come again.

Excellent massage to release my knee pain after Chatuchak shopping. After a long haul shopping at Chatuchak weekend market. Taken their foot massage for 300bath/1 hour. The lady masseur skills is superb which helped me to release my knee pain after long walk at Chatuchak market. The lady deserve very much for high tipping.

Good massage but.... This is a Huge spa in the Asoke area. The waiting hall was full of people. The place is clean and the staff is professional. The massage was very good and I liked it very much. Anyway In my opinion for the same Price or even less you can find something better in bangkok!!!

Great welcome to Bangkok!. We went here on the first night thst we arrived and we're glad we did. Since it was so close to the New Year, there were relatively few staff available so we opted for the foot massage. They don't take bookings and so we decided to wait - about 20 minutes in their comfortable lobby - after which we received wonderful and relaxing foot treatments (which also included a bit of head/neck/shoulder/arm work. Amazing value to say the least! If you're in the neighbourhood (Asoke), check them out!

Thai versus Foot Massage, a different experience.. We've been going here for foot massages. Its around the corner from where we live. Initially we were very happy with the quality of the massages. Our only misgiving was that the large room where the massages are given was often very cold. Recently the quality of the foot massages has gone seriously downhill to where we're unlikely to return for a foot massage. HOWEVER, we had started to have Thai massages and we've been very happy with these, and will continue going here but probably only for Thai massages. They only have one option for a Thai massage and its for two hours. One wears Thai pyjamas ( no oil), and is massaged and stretched on a mattress placed on the floor. There are private rooms for singles and double rooms for couples. The double rooms do engender some talking between the therapists which is a distraction. Its generally not a lot, but even a total or five minutes spread over two hours can disturb the peace and quiet. A Thai massage costs 500 Baht, which is about $17 for the two hours. They sell books of ten for 4000 Baht. A foot massage ( one hour) is 300 Baht. Bottom line. We would rate them 2 stars for foot massage and 4.5 stars for Thal massage.

Heavily booked. The massage service was heavily booked so advanced booking is necessary. The waiting hall was full of people waiting and there was not enough seats around. The price is cheap compared with those in some hotels and the massage is acceptable. Perhaps it is better to pay more to get rid of the waiting. Also, a word of caution: if Thai massage is not too familiar to you beacuse there are a lot of stretching and twisting of the body, make sure that the exercise is not too much beyond your tolerance as it may hurt you.

okay. The massage was satisfactory. We made a reservation and arrived 15 minutes ahead of time. We were ushered to our room within 10 minutes, so that was good. The reception/waiting area was crowded with people waiting their turn, making it more akin to a hospital waiting area than a relaxing spa. But overall, it was okay, as my masseuse was good.

Service sucks!. Called to make reservation. Requested timing not available hence I asked for available timing. They offered 8:30pm which I confirmed. Then they put me on hold. When they return to the call, they then tell me appt not available and asked to change to 6pm. How do one get an appt here at this place?

must say it used to be better . came here 3 years ago and it was pretty relaxing and normal. went again today (after failing to get a booking over the weekend) on a Monday afternoon and god was it crowded. it looked like they took in a tour group or something?! or did they not. we arrived early before our appointment and there is no flexibility for you to sit and choose the type of massage u like or ask more about their current promotions. you need to stick with the type u choose when u called because everything else is fully booked. no flexibility at all. then you are quickly shoved into your massage room and it starts quickly. it looks like a mini hotel with 8 storeys and each massage room has a room number to it. doesn't fill as relaxing and tranquil as it feels like the masseur is jz trying to be as efficient as possible. massage was okay and definitely above average but definitely not wow. it's good for a quick, clean, affordable, no frills above average massage if you just want to be kneaded.

You've gotta love Thailand. Thailand is a wonderful place with friendly people and great massage places. Health Land is definitely a place I would love to come back to. Great massage, inexpensive and friendly smiling masseuses. A good idea to make a reservation since the place is very busy.

getting crazy busy nowadays. more n more tourists r frequenting this chain of massage locations. tried the 1 in pattaya 1st n den this one in asoke. best to call ahead for a reservation as it is next to impossible to walk in n get a massage nowadays unless it is the slow season. decent massages, prices are kept going up unfortunately, used to be 350 bht now up to 500 bht for a thai massage 1 hour. still cheap by Western standards. decent clean fairly attentive service

Average massage - base on luck on who you get. We walked in without prior appointment in the morning, to the Asoke branch. At the reception there seems to be some hard selling. At 10am, we were told there is no more rooms for 2 person for aromatherapy massage so my husband and i ended up in separate rooms as i refuse to give in to those over 2 hour massages while my husband opted for 150min back massage. Quality is average and very much bad dependent on the masseur (as in no quality control). It is very much based on luck. Would not recommend if you are used to having decent massages.

GREAT SERVICE AND COZY PLACE!. It is located near our place since bangkok is actually famous for Spa and massage you will actually see a salon or spa just next to eact other. So after searching and looking for a decent one we found this near our place. At the entrance it seems like a luxury one, but they have different massage that will fit also for your budget. We had their traditional thai massage for 2hrs paying only 500BHT. We enjoy it and also their place such a relaxing environment and a hot green tea after the massage is a plus!

Very Relaxing And Professional Massage. Now of course you can always find cheaper massages in Thailand, of which they on occasion can be decent as well but the variability is often high so it can be crapshoot on what you actually get.This joint however, recommended by our hotel staff, hit the spot for us. We did the 90' thai oil massage and were not displeased. I have probably had 100+ thai massages and would say this one ranked in top 4 or 5 for quality of massage and relaxation factor.The not quite there was i thought price was a bit high and the front desk could have been more hospitable upon arrival. I would definitely consider returning if i was ever in area again.

Best Spa Experience. This place was recommended by my friends. There are various SPA packages available, from 45 mins up to 3days spa packages. I opted for a 90 mins aromatherapy massage. It was great to have a relaxing time after a long day of shopping.The place is huge, rooms are clean and comfy , and professional masseuse.will definitely be back :)

Relaxing Aroma Massage. We bought 2 coupons from forum so I enjoyed the price at THB 750/1.5 hrs aroma massage (original is THB 950/1.5 hrs.)We made booking at 9:00 p.m. When we arrived, we still had to wait for more than 20 mins in order to get into the room. The room is clean and comfortable. It has bathroom and washroom. The masseuses are very good and professional. We felt relaxed.Worth to try.

Great Thai and Aroma Massage. I go to the Healthland branch on Ekamai (Sukhumvit 63) frequently and recommend it for a good Thai massage or aroma massage. They have other spa packages also but I've not tried them. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The masseuses are very good and professional and you can tell them if you'd like it hard or gentle or have any particular aches or pains that need soothing. You can usually just turn up and get a massage quite quickly or it's possible to call ahead and book if it's a busy time like weekend afternoons.

Fantastic Massage!. Wonderful 2 hour traditional Thai massage in a lovely spa setting for 500 BHT! I walked in at 7 pm after a long day of exploring Bangkok and was getting my massage within 10 minutes from an expert massage therapist.

Was in heaven for 2 hours. What would I say if I felt I'm relaxing in heaven, got appointment late, tons of thanks to staff for allowing us. Got 2 hours thai massage.. Wonderful it was. Good price for the service, ambiance and their response. I wish anyone wants real good thai massage, please do visit. Make sure you book your timing. Must go place in Bangkok.

Great Service, Great Prices, No Regrets. We went there twice - on the evening of our first day we were so sore from all the walking, and had the thai traditional massage with hot herbal press. WOW all our aches simply melted away. On another night, we had the oil massage. Same miracle! These ladies know their stuff!Its so popular that you might need to wait awhile for your session. But it is worth it! Price wise, very value for money for the quality you receive!

Rudest reception ever experienced in Thailand. I usually go to other massage places, but as many friends suggested me this one, I decided to give it a try. I tried to go two or three times during the summer and the fall without a reservation, and I was always told that it was fully booked for the Thai massage, so I needed to pick up a much more expensive package. Of course, I didn't, as the price were unacceptable by a Thai standard.Then yesterday, as I was with a friend, we decided to make a reservation for today. We were told that the reservation would be cancelled if we arrived 10 minutes late. We arrived 6 minutes late, but the girl at the reception told us that our reservation had already been cancelled. We showed her our phones, where the clock showed that we were 6 minute late (actually, one more minute has passed during queuing and the conversation with the reception). With her finger she pointed at a clock they keep at the reservation, and she told us that their clock shows that we were already 10 minute late. We picked up the very clock that she pointed at, and it showed exactly the same time of our phones, meaning that not even by their clock we were late.She wouldn't listen to any reason and she called her manager who only kept saying " you don't have to be irritated, and your booking has been canceled because probably another clock shows that you are 10 minute late".Then another top manager appeared and offered us to "revive" our booking, but we were so angry by that behavior that we refused and left.I've been spending most of my time in Thailand since the 90s, I have been living in Bangkok for more than one year now and previously I lived in Chiang Mai; I never experienced such a horrible service in any other place in the country (and I'm not talking only of massage places).You can get a good massage at the same or a better price in many other places around, so I don't think you need to go to this place just to be cheated by their inept reception staff.

Great service, competitive pricing. Went twice for foot and thai massage. The branch at Asoke is quite impressive; a beautiful white building on its own. Masseurs are friendly, helpful and attentive. Lots of different packages to choose from. Walking distance (10mins) from Asoke BTS. Would visit again when in the area.

Good Thai Massage!. Me and my friend was rejected when we went there without a reservation.So we made a reservation for the 2nd nite.To get to HealthLand Asoke, stop at BTS Asoke, exit 1. Go to the alley between Terminal 21 and Westin hotel. At the crossroad, go to the right. Healthland will be at the left side of the road.If travel by taxi it will be anything between 80 to 100B.The lobby was big and look like a hotel lobby it come with free wifi. We was brought to our room by the staff using lift.It was very impressive with a lift built in the building.Then we enjoy our 2hr massage.ZZZZZZZZZZzzzz...........

Comfortable Thai Massage. I reserved a thai massage during my first night in Bangkok. Reservation was for my last night in Bangkok. To get to HealthLand Asoke, stop at BTS Asoke, exit 1. Go to the alley between Terminal 21 and Westin hotel. At the crossroad, go to the right. Healthland will be at the left side of the road.The lobby is quite big with free wifi. I went with my sister, luckily our masseurs were not chatty. Maybe because we fell asleep during the massage so we were not aware. I feel refresh after the massage and definitely will go back if I have a chance.

Rude Reception staff. I have been here several times. Each time the reception is pretty rude and impolite. In any case, if you can get pass this boorish person, the general experience is satisfactory. Depending on the masseurs, you can have a good experience and quality massage. Healthland has expanded quite a bit, perhaps the good business may have affected the service quality.

Above average, one hour queue without reservation . Was here for a good thai massage in the day, came without reservation on a Saturday noon so had to wait for an hour. Massage was ok but the ambience is excellent.

Good quality but bad service. Me and my friend came to Health Land since we felt that we were very tired and need massage to continue our other busy days in Bangkok. We arrived at 8 pm and the only service available was foot relaxation. It took 30 minutes to wait for us to be serviced. I got a male masseur, forget to ask his name, and gave me a very excellent quality of massage. My feet, back, and neck were relaxed and not feeling tired anymore. My friend got a female masseur but he said that he did not get an excellent quality one. Plus, when my friend gave 50 baht tips to the masseur, she asked 50 baht more directly. What a terrible attitude he faced!

Satisfactory Spa Service but Masseuse asked for more tips. Heard a lot about this Spa Centre and wanted to try out their service. We came on a weekday in the late afternoon. There were 4 of us and we did not make any reservation. A lady at the counter said not a problem. We chose the Thai massage for 2 hours which cost 500 baht per person and paid at the counter. The lobby was huge and service was very prompt. After waited for about 15 minutes, we were showed to go to the lower level to change our shoes. Then the 4 masseuses brought us up to a room which had 4 mattresses on 8th floor. We changed into their robes and they started the session.Everything was satisfactory even though the masseuses chatted among themselves. It was until one of the masseuse started to chat with my mum in halting Mandarin. She mentioned that their boss only pay each masseuse 100 baht per session and asked for more tips. We gave 200 baht as tips but this Chinese speaking masseuse said it was not enough for 4 of them. She wanted 100 baht for each masseuse. We gave them another 100 baht more.Their facilities and overall service were quite satisfactory and in fact the building itself looked grand and impressive but the tips portion really turned me off.

You get what you pay for. The 2 hours isn't exactly 2 hours of Massage. From the time they greet you, take you up stairs, do the massage, let you change, take you back down and give you tea. . .thats the 2 hours.Massage are just okay. I've had lots of Thai massages and the person worked on my legs a lot.They talk with each other if you go in with another person, so it's not that relaxing.Still I tip because I'm programed to do that as an American, but if this was in the US I wouldn't have tipped so much by %. Its true that they are just a factory because they have a lot of throughput.If your hard up for a massage then for 500 bhat its not a bad deal.

A factory -- they don't care. We went for a couples massage, which I wouldn't recommend because it allowed our masseuses to socialize on and off throughout, and loudly. It was kind of like listening to your aunties natter on and getting a half-assed massage at the same time. The deal is good -- 500 baht for two hours (Thai massage is only two hours, nothing shorter) but the masseuses ended 15 minutes early and then asked for tips. They seemed like nice folks but come on. Go somewhere smaller where someone might actually pretend to care about giving you a proper massage.

Enjoyable traditional Thai Massage. Tips: Do make a phone reservation prior to visiting the place as you may end up turning back without a massage.Having heard of all the raving reviews about Health Land Spa, my boyfriend and his parents headed down to the branch in Asoke after having our appointment pre-booked the week before via phone reservation. We had the traditional thai massage and i must say that this is the FIRST time ever, that i felt that Thai Massage is so comfortable. The previous Thai massages that i had done in other places gave me so much pain and discomfort that i thought Thai Massages is supposed to be that painful. The lady who massaged for me was skillful and gentle.The massge lasted for 2 hours and i felt that it was more than enough to relax our tensed muscles after 3 days of walking. It was good overall.

Careless and rough service. We came to here because of it's famous reputation, but I think it's overrated. This was my 3rd experience during this trip. Compared to previous 2 experiences, I think this was the worest one. I chose foot massage at this place. The person who served me seemed in a rush, and she treated me in a rude, careless, and rough way. I even don't think I was treated as a customer!There are a lot of good massage place near Asok station, and I think I will never come back again.
Prepare to wait for nothing!. This place is ridiculous. They are so concerned with only money that they neglect customer service. Don't waste your time or money on this scam.

A nice place to visit after long hour of shopping. A nice cozy place for massage. However, do need to make advance booking at the place is so popular that at times, there won't be any available slot for walk in customer.

Quality massage. The location is a little off the main road. About 5-10 mnts walk from terminal 21 / asok bts. It's a big establishment with a building on its own. Most of the packages are 2 hours or longer. Pricing is reasonable. It's very popular that you have to wait if you do not make a reservation. Will visit again.

Reminds me of ShengZheng. If you are looking for a cozy comfy place for massage, this is NOT the place. The ambience and service remind me of those massage centres in ShengZheng, China. The way it operates resembled a fast food chain.Masseurs are professional and use their best effort, but don't expect they will treat you with tenderness. No, I'm not coming back. This is not the type of spa I would go in BKK.

Consistent and Clean. I've been here 4 times so far for the 90minutes aroma massage and haven't been disappointed yet. Massage staff are friendly and professional. Front desk staff however can sometimes be friendly or seem a bit cold, I guess from the volume of customers they get per day. Really should call in advance should you like to get a massage here.So if you are looking for a clean relaxing and professional massage this would be the place to go with reasonable prices.

It’s nice to be kneaded. One of the many reasons I love Bangkok and Thailand in general, is being able to afford luxury spa treatments. We choose 2 hours Thai massage for 500baht. We had an awesome 2 hour cracking and twisting session. The masseurs were experience and they really do have strength!. It is advisable to call to make a reservation 1-2 days ahead. We saw a lot of walk in customers left the place without even securing a session. After the treatment we were taken back to the “shoe benches” and given hot cups of Thai tea.Overall, it was a great experience, but I kind of dislike the PJs... it makes me feel like a sick people in the mental hospital lol.

Production line massage. One of the saddest places on earth is the departure terminal at Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok. I have experienced this melancholy several times when, after checking in, passing through immigration and then security, it hits you all at once: you are leaving this wonderful piece of the planet. Gone are the great food and the traditional Thai massages.From the outside Health Land looks like a retro mansion and inside it’s a little like Grand Central Station. The moment I walked in, it was far from a tranquil environment. Though well decorated, I felt like I was in a factory production line. Until you get to your treatment room, you’re just a number (or rather name). They’ll call your name (through a microphone) and you’ll be escorted from the waiting room to an area with benches where you’ll exchange your shoes for slippers and greet your therapist. Then you’ll be led to the elevator and on to your room. I felt like I was going for a ride in a theme park.The staff at the reception desk may not be the friendliest welcome team around but once you get are enjoying your Thai massage you will soon forget about this.The massage was amazing! I’ve been to other places where they just hurt you. The masseur here uses her hands, arms, elbows, knees and feet apply firm, rhythmic pressure to various parts of the body along with the masseuese taking a casual stroll up and down the length of the back. My lower back got more attention as I’d requested and the pain significantly reduced. She is a true Thai massage master. She’s strong and has big thick arms and hands. She was built for giving massages. Thank GOD for her.The price is really worth what you get!!!! THB500 for 2hoursThe omnipresent “new age spa music” and the generic herbal scent wafting the air might seem clichéd, but what Health Land lacks in personalized service, they make up for in value for money. This is the true truth as I say it as it is…(www.perfyi.wordpress.com)

Great massages, admin less than perfect.. To be honest, I've only had one bad massage here out of ten, but the lady who mentioned they need quality control is correc,t as there are bad practices here in terms of shortened massage time compared to advertised and late starting for bookings. You have to be gently firm with the managers before you go for the massage if you are called late and more often than not they will tell the masseuse to extend time. On the upside, the quality& consistency here really is better. Yes, at local shops you get more time and it can be cheaper (or even more expensive at the boutique salons), but these ladies are well trained in anatomy and physiology whilst many of the street salons make it up as they go along. Bsd training and practice is more likely to cripple you than anything. Yes, you can strike lucky on the street, but equally you can come out wrecked.. So, some quick words of advice to the traveller:1. if possible use a referral from another traveller to a specific masseuse who has a good rep whether in health land, or anywhere else, 2. If you find a good masseuse who suits you stick with them (you can request specific masseuse in HL too.3. NEVER go with an acutely bad back as if something has changed recently, this is your back telling you something is wrong and Thai massage can make it worse.Go to a physio, chiro or osteopath and get a proper fix.Mild discomfort is ok with Thai massage however and long term muscle spasm, such as old sporting injuries can really gain good sustained relief. 4. If you do have a long a long term problem, go no more frequently than every 48 hours to allow recovery and if you are prepared to do 3, or more sessions it will just get better and better. Finally, tip the ladies folks, especially if they have done a good job. This goes a long way towards their income and the quality of your future massages. Remember, they earn only 130 Bhat from each 2 hour massage, so tips make the difference from subsistence living. 50 baht will do, but 100 is better and they will remember.......

Clean and professional.. Professional and well managed, this chain of 9 massage spas is located around the city of Bangkok. The ambience is calming and soothing and the masseurs are quite good. The massage rooms are clean and comfortable. Ask your hotel to make a reservation for your massage as otherwise you may at times have a long wait (sometimes even an hour) if you directly walk in. A 1.5 hour aromatherapy massage costs 850THB. A 2 hour Thai massage costs 500 THB.

Not too bad. Based on the recommendation from my wife's supervisor, we decided to give this place a try (both of us being massage lovers). We did try to make a appointment the night before but it was fully booked. So a tip for the readers here is to book early lest disappointment.Nevertheless, we decided to try our luck anyway since we are in the vincinity to shop at Terminal 21. To go Healthland, walk along Sukhumvit 19 road (which is the road between Terminal 21 and Westin Grande Sukhumvit Bangkok) and turn right at the first major cross-junction. It took us about roughly 15mins of walk.Indeed, it was a wise choice to try our luck by going there. We were lucky enough to be given 2 slots of 2hrs thai massage for each person almost immediately as apparently there was a no-show.Generally, my wife and I liked the massage. Price was reasonable in our opinions. Clean place overall. Masseurs made a bit of small talk at the beginning and end of the massage. The whole building was pretty huge with 7 levels I think, and the open carpark in front of Healthland was quite big as well.As we were done and left Healthland, it rained heavily. Luckily we have a small umbrella in our sling bag. However, it was not enough as by the time we walked back to the Asok BTS station, we were both rather drenched. Sukhumvit 19 road is rather low lying and it floods at some parts of the road. So if you are planning a visit there, it never hurts to play safe by arming yourself with a brolly.On the whole, I and my wife are happy with this experience and would recommend readers over here to pay it a visit for a massage at least once or twice during your Bangkok stay.

Nice environment but way too costly for the skills. I had a 90 min aromatherapy oil massage for 850baht, thought I was paying for120mins which would still be reasonable. I found it so expensive I did not tip the massue. My boyfriend called to ask for 120min and they did not clarify there's only 90 min for oil. I wouldn't have booked if I knew it's this expensive.The place was good and clean - I had a private room with a shower and bed with a hole to pop my face through. This is important so you don't get a neckache after the session. Some cheaper places don't offer such beds. Aircon can be adjusted.The skill was so so. She used strength and was attentive when I asked her to press my neck more. But one requires experience to know how and where to press and not merely using strength. If you just want strength and not fussy with skill, I guess it's alright. I'm too pampered by my skilful massue back home. And in Bangkok, I've had better at good and cheaper places. So I won't go again. Not recommended unless you think paying for ambience is important.

Only choose Thai massage. This is some 7 floor of bliss, the sPA is spread in 7 floor with every kind of therapy, i have chosen thai massage foot massage and other treatment in my six days stay, the prices are reasonable and also the masseurs are good, you need to tell them very clearly what you want them to do or don't. ITS A GOOD EXPERIENCE AND I WILL RATE THEM VERY GOOD ITS VALUE FOR MONEY COMPARE TO OTHER SPAS IN VICINITY IF YOU ARE ONLY GOING FOR MASSAGE.

Complete rejuvenation, Very Professional, Clean and Quality Set Up. I was strongly recommended by a friend to not leave Bangkok without a visit to this place for the 2 hour Traditional Thai Massage @ 500 Baht. And I did just that on the day I was flying back and am so glad for it. The place was conveniently located from our hotel, Novotel on Ploenchet Road - just two stops away by the BTS Sky Train right from the front of our hotel. Walk into Soi 19 and take the first right turn into Soi 21 and you find this huge building on your left. Walking into the large reception area, there was a sense of quiet tranquility and a very efficient staff there ensured that within 5 mins I was escorted by this tiny Thai lady to a room on the 7th floor. It helped that I had made a prior appointment or else the wait may be more. The whole ambience was quiet, peaceful, with muted lights.I was a bit sceptical and worried initially as there was a language problem. I didn't understand Thai and she had very limited knowledge of English and I was worried about her triggering off some pains as I have some back and shoulder issues. I didn't know how to explain her my concerns. Somehow with gestures etc I communicated with her and we kept laughing at our communicating styles but she ended up giving me the best massage of my life. She applied just the right pressure and knew instinctively where all I was hurting and worked away on my muscles. By the end of it I felt like a completely new person - my pains had reduced considerably and I literally skipped out of that place. I just wish I had visited earlier, I would have probably included it as a daily regime for 3 days of my stay in Bangkok. I did end up tipping the masseuse additionally for the wonderful massage she gave. It does take a lot of physical effort on their part.The session ended with a refreshing herbal tea that added to the whole experience.Definitely a must do for any future trips to Bangkok.

Recommended. Generally, the services provided was good. The skills of the masseur were good. As we had prior booking, we did not need to wait long before our turn. The suite of massage packages available was reasonable.P/s: Encouraged visitors to make advance booking to avoid long wait.

Disappointed. I'm at a loss how to start this review. I found this place from blogs and was well recommended. I was having two hour Thai massage but felt wrong after 30 minutes. I referred to Trip Advisor just then and found out reviews were quite controversal. I was on unlucky side and couldn't finish it, got out 30 minutes earlier after a few time's pain and the rest no feeling. They really need a quality control.

Tourist Trap - really dishonest practice. Went into this fairly new outlet having been to other branches in previous trips to Bangkok. Little did I know how badly the visit would turn out. Went to the counter, asked for a one and half hour massage. Paid up, went into the room and had a shower. Masseuse came in after a while. Started the massage. Not too bad, but nothing to shout about by Thailand's standards. Strange thing was that the masseuse stood up and told me that she was done after 50min. I looked at the clock - there was at least still a good half hour to go. Since she'd already gone out, I got dressed and went to the counter to ask if I had ordered the one hour massage by mistake.Counter receptionist told me that no, I'd ordered the one and half hour massage. They also insisted that the time began from when I took a shower. That was ridiculous - it barely lasted 5 min. They then ignored me when I asked to speak to the manager. As it was, all of them started ignoring me and pretended to be busy. I then asked to see the time slips and took out my receipt to show other customers. That's when they got panicky and asked the bouncers to escort me out. Worst rip-off experience ever.

Great Massage. We visited Health Land on our way to the airport for a massage and were amazed at the great value of their services. We both had a 90 minute relaxation massage and it was incredible! The facilities are so clean and the staff are very professional. This was one of the nicest spas I've ever visited and I would definitely recommended treating yourself to a massage here!

Intentionally ripping off customers. I was really excited about going to health land today, and the ambiance seemed quite nice. I showed up early for my 5:30, 2 hour massage, but was not called until 5:40, and the masseuse told me to "sleep" whilst I waited for her (to do who knows what), when she finally came back later the massage was already starting 20 minutes late. The massage was not very good. Small local places are much better, and my back hurts worse than it did before I had a massage! Half way through the massage, she left the room for 15 minutes, and finally came back to finish at 7:20! All in all, the massage was about an hour and 15 minutes, and after reading other people's reviews, I see that they are INTENTIONALLY giving less than what you pay for. Not like your complaints have much credibility with them as you have to pay before your massage.

Rejuvenation. The spa is set in its own property of an 8 level white colonial building. The services range between Thai-Indian Ayuvedic treatments. Staff are well trained and polite. The ambiance was soothing. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Masseur was thorough and attentive.

Excellent clean and quality establishment.... I am a big fan of Healthland and have been to most of them in Bangkok.Lovely decor clean rooms and it's nice to get a shower before,and after, staff very attentive, I go for,the aroma massage which is very soothing and relaxing.Cannot fault the place,well worth a visit.

Oasis and value for money. Best of the "value-for-money" category I'd been to. Very clean, beautiful and well managed despite the high volume. We were lucky our masseuses were warmed up to us quickly, perhaps because my friend knew a little Thai. I didn't expect luxury but was surprised to see how well appointed the lobby/waiting area was. The range of service was wide and I like how you don't have to share a room if you are a couple/foursome. Not sure what happens if you are alone. Only tried the thai massage (2 hours but they finished in 1 hr 45 mins) and thai massage with hot compress. My masseuse complied to my requests so I am happy. I'd gone to luxury day spas + walk in "cheap" shops but by far this is the best compromise in terms of value and service. Recommended if you don't want to spend too much but just need a good serviceable massage where you don't feel like cattle or ripped off.

Industrialized feel to massage experience. Average massage.. The infrastructure is impressive, the facilities are clean and modern, but I got the feeling of being part of an assembly line, get me in and out fast. The masseuse never smiled and was very cold. The aromatherapy massage was average to above average. I also did the scrub which I would not recommend. Overall the experience was OK, I suppose you have to visit once just so you say you went, but I probably won't return, there are too many other good spas in Bangkok o visit this place again.

Good service, great place, spacious and relaxing. This place is well located near the Terminal 21 and is well kept and the service is reasonably priced. You could opt for the 500B massage but it is never publicised. They would usually promote the 2000B ones which costs a lot more. There are like many storeys to this massage centre. It feels like a hotel! The thai massage was not too bad, the service is pretty good. I went back there a second time for foot massage. However, beware of the waiting times if you were to opt for the cheaper massage (more than an hour!), it seems the 2000B ones would have shorter waiting time says the manager herself.

The best massage in Thailand. The place is very well located, well kept and reasonably priced. I went for an aroma therapy massage, I waited for 5 minutes and then was taken up stairs to a very clean room with a professional masseuse. I had a very relaxed massage, the best I had in Thailand. No monkey business like other massage parlors in Thailand.

Great massage place to visit after a long tiring day. Located very close to MRT and BTS Asoke, Healthland is a great place to visit after a long day. I recommend purchasing 10-coupon booklet for a private room (4000 THB/10 times). If you just want to relax, Traditional Thai massage for 2 hours should do, just advise the therapist how you like your massage. They understand basic English terms ( stronger, softer...) But those who experience severe neck, shoulder and back pain like me, i highly recommend Ayurveda Massage. The therapist is well trained and qualified so really know what she is doing. after 2-3 hours of this massage, i feel so light and very relaxed. You can use the coupon for this type of massage as well. Advance booking for this place is highly recommended so you won't have to go thru the long boring wait. The facility is very clean and spacious but could be packed with massage goers esp on weekends.

If hell is like this, I'll take it!. The previous reviewer who calls it Hell Land is out of line. Yes, there is a factory assembly line feel to Healthland, but quality/price there is nothing to complain about. If you want special pampering, go up-market. If you want amore erlthy ecpericne there are plenty of places for that. I live in Bangkok,have my regular masseur at Heathland Asoke and am completely satisfied. It is what it is.

Hell Land!. Entering into Health Land's vast lobby, I felt like I was in Dante's Inferno, hence the title of my review. The vast space was filled with anxious spa-goers; it felt like being in the boarding area of a very bad airport.Never mind that I had had booked ahead; 30 minutes went by before I was paged and summoned into an elevator to my assigned massage room. The massage itself was mediocre, and I'm being kind. The masseur clearly couldn't care less. Why anyone would bother with Health Land is beyond me. I get much better massages at a fraction of Health Land's prices pretty much anywhere in Bangkok. My advice: Stay away!

Ahhh...the ultimate Thai massage. You're greeted by a very efficient receptionist that speaks English. You're provided infused ice cold water while you wait for your professionally trained Thai massage therapist in a very zen setting. You're then gently whisked away into a different room where you're provided slippers. Your massage therapist takes you to your private room where you receive the ultimate pulling, pushing, stretching, cracking, rubbing, rolling, twisting experience. Two hours of utter bliss. I'd say priceless but really, it's crazy inexpensive. For two hours, plus tip, I paid about $25 US.

Good Thai Massage in Sukhumvit, Bangkok. When in Bangkok I try not to miss opportunity to experience 90 minute aroma massage at Health Land Asoke. Cost 850 Baht.Tip: ask your hotel to make booking. It will save you time and avoid Health Land hostess attempts to upsell other expensive treatments.

Excellent facilities, service and prices. A must do visit for any trip to Bangkok. I am not into beauty treatments honestly (LOL) but I have to say the whole experience here at Health land was excellent.the facilities are very very impressive, spotlessly clean, modern relaxing and very high quality.The location is basically in the soi directly behind Terminal 21 shopping mall, easy to find and to get to via the BTS or MRT transport systems in Bangkok.You feel almost instantly relaxed on arrival at the facility...cool décor, furniture and lovely air conditioned relief from the heat outside.they have so many different treatments. My partner wanted to go and had god knows what but it seems covered her from head to toe ha ha ha.I had a classic Thai massage lasting two hours and it was fantastic. lovely private rooms with soft music, simply furnished and purposely relaxing and calming.The masseur was very professional and explained everything i needed to do very well and clearly.if waiting for someone, there are magazines and a large section of waiting area. easily pass away the time while the other half is pampered to within an inch of her life...i chose a massage rather than just wait...but up to you of course.the prices are extremely good and far lower than most hotel spa's yet just as luxurious in my view. it has a contemporary feel about it all and you are taken each step of the way by various attentive staff on hand to assist you.I am sure we will be back there again as my partner has not stopped raving about it since :0)

Wonderful thai massage. With the help of the hotel staff, my sister and I could reserve for 2-hr thai massage the next day. Phone first to secure booking if otherwise they may not offer a time for you.The place is clean, the environment is comfortable. For two of us, we could have our own room and the price is as competitive as 500 bahts per person. The most important thing is that we could gain full retreat from the therapies.

Efficient, a bit sterile. gets the job done at a good price. Health Land Asoke is, as other reviewers point out very well situated in Sukumvit. I walked there from the Sofitel in less than fifteen minutes. This review reflects a total of two massages I've had at Health Land Asoke over the past year. Overall, for an efficient, clean, and decent massage in concert with location (I like staying in Sukumvit), Health Land is a solid option.  For 500baht/2 hr Thai massage you get an organized, clean, up to date large facility. On both occasions the organization of the place has left me impressed. So much that one could say its even a bit sterile and cold. Payment is upfront as you enter. The surroundings are pleasant and modern so if there is waiting involved, your senses won't be irritated. After they call you (or your party by name) its up/down some elevators to stop off to collect sandals. The massage room set up is rather basic. The tv set in the room seemed well out of place though. Change in the gown in the massage room and its go time. I can't really rate the massage other than to say you have to try a Thai massage at least once. The female masseuses (there were two of us in our party) barely spoke english. But with some universal signals we were underway. This review isn't about THai massage, but needless to say there are some moments of dire pain and some moments I found myself easily nodding off to sleep.  At the conclusion of the massage, I felt it was in a bit of bad taste for my masseuse to remind me she needed a tip. Of course, I was going to tip, and I do want to pause and think about things through a cultural prism. So here goes, Health Land could do their workers and clients a favor and better communicate about how tipping should be addressed. Clearly, these hard workers deserve something for their effort, but going about it in a professional and consistent manner would be nicer.  Post-massage is another magic elevator ride to a room where shoes are collected and a sweet tea is served. As you've already paid to enter, this ends the Health Land experience. From a cash burn perspective, the value is fantastic. Health Land is professional and organized, maybe a bit too much so. There is an assembly line feel to it all, but having made that assessment, I've only done Thai massage there so I don't what lies behind other doors but literally and metaphorically. Enjoy the experience and do have your hotel concierge book the appointment on your behalf. It's just easier since this is not a 5 Star Hotel spa and the level of english is naturally going to vary a bit.....

Relaxing and cheap. Getting a massage can be very relaxing, and in this venue it really was. It was actually so good that we went twice in our 5 day trip to Bangkok in our honey moon.We first got a Thai massage and 2 days later a relaxing massage; the former was good to get to know the traditional side but the relaxing was just great.This place is clean, relaxing and I believe the price/value is very good.

Tired after shopping?. If you're tired after a day's shopping, Health Land Spa & Massage at Asoke will be the best place for you to chill out. They offer various types of massage and Spa programs at a reasonable price. If you are a Massage Lover like me, you can also buy a booklet of 10 coupons at a reduced rate of THB4000 instead of THB5000 for a Thai Massage Program. Each session lasts for 2 hours. The place is clean, spacious and easy on the eye, not like other Massage Parlors which gives a sleazy feeling and atmosphere.Take either a taxi or take the BTS to Asok Station and walk about 10 mins. to the Spa.I do recommend to make a reservation to avoid disappointment!

Must go place. Located near by Asoke BTS. Just walk 10-15 minutes from the alley next to terminal 21 mall.The place is very nice, super clean and big building. It was a great experience here. I had a traditional thai massage. It cost around 500 baht for 2 hours.Recommended place.

Good Massage. The massage place is 15mins walk from Asoke BTS.We went there last trip and decided to visit again this trip.We went for two days this trip. First day for herbal compress package which is thai massage followed by herbal compress. A unique experience.The second day we went for body scrub, oil massage and facial. Enjoyed the body scrub and oil massage but the facial is a bit dissapointing. There was no extraction, just normal cleaning and soft massage of the face.Be sure to make reservation few days before the massage. We made reservation and got ourself a couple room.

Great Thai Massage. This place is a must when visiting Bangkok, me and my boyfriend had a traditional thai massage treatment, 1 and a half hour for about $10 each, amazing value for money. It was quite intense but relaxing, we felt amazing afterwords. The place is very modern and clean.

Inexpensive massage in a big complex. Walked here from Four Points by Sheraton Bangkok; 7 minutes' walk, just round the corner from Terminal 21. It is a huge building - you can't miss it. If you want to have a massage, be sure to make a reservation, especially weekends and public holidays, as they tend to be fully booked. Thai massage is only Baht500 for 2 hours and reflexology is only Baht280 for an hour. I tried the Thai massage as I did not have time for reflexology (well, next trip!). The masseuse was experienced and pleasant. The manager (male) could do with a smile, at the reception but overall it was a pleasant experience.

very consistent good. I have been to Bangkok many trips over at least 10 years. I my opinion, best things Thai has to offer, if you are minimalist, are foods, massage, culture and people. Not necessary in that order. Thus, I have experienced many massages, at various times, in various cities, and at various place. From very local places to high end spas. Health Land has been consistently good. They do very good job for a fair price. Very professional, clean, smoothly administered. If one look for pampering treatment, at 3-5 times the price, there are plenty to choose from as well, stand alone Spas and some are at 5stars hotels.

Bad, Terrible, unprofessional!!!. Horrible service and terrible experience!!! So very disappointed. So bad I don't even know where to start from. The masseurs are not friendly at all they seem unhappy and treat people rude. The place is huge and the service is not personalize either. They treat customer as cows.... The managers are extremely rude as well. It is better to pay a little more than expose yourself to this.... I do not recommend this place. Do not come here!

Huge outfit and reasonable price. The Healthland is a huge outfit offering massages, scrubs, etc, We asked the hotel to make a reservation and was on time for our appointment, We were informed that only private rooms was available so we had a 2 person in the room. Throughout the therapy, both the therapists were chatting and gave us a 'weak' massage. As we could not communicate in Thai ..had to gesture for them to be quiet. After the un relaxing massage - we headed to the ground floor and the therapists waited for tips. It was an awkward moment and we feel compelled to give some tips.

Cheating, time skimmers - 2 Hour massage lasting 1hr 30mins. The title says it all. I have bought a book of 10 coupons from here. Every single time I go for Thai massage I'm short changed approximately 30mins (representing 100 baht of time each time). Having been 6 times previously, that's 600 baht this company has stollen from me indirectly. If someone reached their hand into your wallet and took 600 baht you'd go crazy, but apparently I'm supposed to literally lay there and get fleeced!Even including time whilst your shoes and stored away, you are shown to the room, go to the bathroom and get dressed and undressed I'm usually back in reception 1h 30mins to 1hr 1h 45mins if you are very lucky. I have had six sessions at various times of the day and different days and it's always the same.I've even pointed this to staff afterwards to be given "sorry sir, thanks for telling us". Last time I mentioned it beforehand and yet I still come out early. This place does this for every treatment. It's a total rip-off.In a typical Thai massage shop, you would pay on the way out. I've always had the full time every other place. This place, however, takes your payment on the way in. There is a dedicated member of staff who will patronise you on the way out when you complain.I have a few more coupons to use up and then I will never go to *any* health land again!Nobody likes skimming, cheating, lying businesses so I hope other tourists and locals who read this boycott this place.

Schmerz, Betteln, Unangenehm - Pain, Begging, Displeasing. my female thai massage therapeut at healhland seemed to be insane/crazy - grabbed my necklace, called me sexy,laughed without any reason - made me more than uncomfortable! after 30 minutes of 2 hour massage she turned on the tv!!! watched some trash thai sitcom and was not concentrating on givin me a healthy massage - she butchered me! at the end she begged for 100 bath tip and i was givin her already 10% tip before! she was overweight and asked for money for food.... i ate for 75 bath a day so this made me more then upset! healthland must pay them and treat them very bad! i am used to strong thai massages... next time i go to my thai therapist in germany who learned at wat pho in bangkok!she will heal me when i am back! - the place was clean for that i give 1 star!

awesome relaxing massage!. they have several branches in bangkok, but decided to come to the Asoke branch. Huge 3storey facility, they have a hotel like lounge where they will call for your name once ready. one of the most value for money cheap massage places you can find with wonderful friendly service.do remember to call & book reservation atleast 2-3days in advance to get a slot, i tried their traditional thai massage & came back again 2nd day for the herbal ball massage. both very relaxing, truly enjoyed it

Decent massage at affordable prices. Recommended by friends, Made reservations by phone but they did not have it when we reached. Heard that this happens, so good to double check on your part. Fortunately, they could accommodate us. The place looks grand and nice, abt 10 mins walk from Asoke BTS. Prices can be found on their website. Had a strong masseuse for Thai massage. Feels good, worth trying.

5 star look for Spa and Massage. We book a 1 and 1/2hr aromatic oil massage. The massage last only 1 hr 10mins, me and my wife was told to change, as oil was applied we thought of getting a quick shower , not even given 2 min, the staff keep knocking on the door to hurry us. Overall the massage was good.We tried to book something similar the next day (as our group was 8pax), there was only 4 vacant slot so we decided to do a walk in for foot massage. The foot massage is really disappointing, pressure point was not even press but more like tickling.

Foot Massage - just a okay. Our usual trip to Bangkok is never complete without a trip to Health Land for our massages but this time as we were there for a rather short weekend, we went over for a foot massage instead, and quite frankly, they are better with their massages.So do go for the massages but opt out of the foot massage.
Wonderful Experience. My husband and I visited last week. We each enjoyed 1 hour foot massage followed by 2 hour Thai massage. Total bill INCLUDING tip $54!If in Bangkok, you should go!

Wonderful massage. Chose the 2 hour Thai maasage which was cheap at 500Bt. The service was wonderful and the massage was outstanding. I loved the ambience and did not hesitate to give a tip of 100Bt. Would highly recommend.

Beware of getting cheated. Heard so many positive reviews so I came here with my friends. We booked at 6 but was early. I remember getting into the treatment room and looked at the clock which said 5:50. Anyway my massage ended at 7:05. Confused I went to ask and confirm about my treatment. They pretty much said I was lying because the tag given to the masseuse said 5:30! I said there was no way because we had paid and had to sit and wait for our services and we had arrived at 5:30! Anyway truly disappointed as I had high expectations and I couldn't believe the mgr pretty much insinuated that I was a liar. Plus they were all avoiding me and were all talking about me in Thai before she actually came by to talk to me! That's pretty rude to do in front of your customers face when all I was expecting was just an apology of some sort! I won't be recommending this spa to anyone.

Royalty massage treatment + extremely affordable prices!. Went in June 2013 and was brought there by Thai friends, the main lobby of the place is beautiful with a touch of class. Clean and family style massage and most of the staff can understand simple English. Place might look really expensive but they are really affordable. Can literally compare the classiness of the place with Banyan Tree Spa standard but at a much lower fraction of price. MUST GO!

Health Land Spa & Massage - Asoke. we walked in not knowing what to expect. The place is huge and has many floors. We had a two hour Thai massage. These ladies pack a good punch! Well worth to get this massage. You can request a lighter pressure if preferred. You change into a loose pant and shirt. The rooms are open and quiet. The mattress you lay is pretty comfortable. They start with the feet then legs, back, shoulder, head and a good stretch at the end. Loved it!

Clean, reliable, and no funny business. Finding a clean, reliable massage in Bangkok can be tricky. We were looking for one with no funny business...a traditional 2 hour thai massage. Health Land delivered. Check in process is professional. The pant-suit clad woman who runs the front desk has a bit of an attitude, but she runs a tight ship. She'll roll her eyes at you if you have questions, but that's not a deal breaker. Pricing is incredibly reasonable. While it might be a little higher ($12 instead of $10) than some of the other places on the street, you're paying for things like air conditioning, cleanliness, etc. Wait times are pretty accurate. Rarely have I been asked to wait longer than 10 minutes there. Clothes provided were clean and freshly washed. Bed linens appeared to be, as well. Masseuse was professionally attired. English isn't their strong suit usually, but you can communicate clearly when you need to. While the quality of the massage there can vary from "good" to "amazing," I've never had a "bad" one. I had one woman put an undue amount of pressure on my spine (not my erectors, but the vertebrae) which was painful. I said "Mai!" showed her where to avoid with my finger and a head shake, and she complied. If you're looking for a shorter, more targeted option, go for a 1 hour therapeutic massage. They'll work on whatever muscle group is troubling you.

Two Hour Thai Massage. Amazing.. I must have gotten lucky, because my two hour thai massage was unbelievable. I walked in and tried to make an appointment for later in the afternoon, but was told they were pretty booked up, but that there was opening right away due to a cancellation. The room was clean, the massage was strong and amazing - and best of all, it was BHT 500. I guess that's expensive by thai standards, but I wish I could have gone every day. Definitely recommended.

Luck plays a part. Been to healthland Asoke and Sathon branch for a few times and I will say the standards of the massage varies each time. The masseur is the ultimate factor for what you going to get.My last visit to Asoke branch which turn out to be a total nightmare. I book a 2 hour herbal treatment massage and felt like being beatup throughout the treatment. I was being handle very roughly and the masseur had absolutely no technique but brute strength. I made a complaint to the reception but was told there was nothing they can do as I remorsefully went through the whole session. My lesson is, after 10 mins of your massage and you feel the standards is bad, ask for a replacement immediately. Being nice will just get you a frustrating and painful massage experience.Not the best in town to go for. Go only it is really near where you stay, otherwise save the trouble.

Standard of massage varies!. My 2nd visit at this branch. Was satisfied the first time round (4 months ago) and so decided to visit again during this trip.This time round, the massage I had was mediocre and left the place disappointed.We had a couple room and the two masseurs were busy chatting during the session. The lights were not dim till I asked for it.My wife was satisfied with her masseur who was also the quieter of the two. Mine was the chatty one and kept on talking to the other. My massage felt like going through the motion without putting in much effort.May still visit the place again until I find a better option.

Did not disappoint. A thai friend booked 2 hour thai massage sessions for us at 500 baht per pax! Apparently walk-ins are quite difficult to get slots as this is a popular place! I wouldnt be surprised as this place looks really expensive/classy but the pricing is actually competitive with street massage palour pricesVery clean and nice environment! i even fell asleep during the massage! I would definitely come back

Waste of time. I firstly like to say that the massage are at a high standard ,but that is where it stops . I can't complain about the service because there is none ,I have been to this place 8 days in a row and was only able to get a massage once. Now I know people will say you should book but I have gone there from 10am to 4.30pm , over the past 8days and I might add I was not expecting a massage straight away but when they tell you they are book out four times at 10am in the morning what can you say may be they just don't what our business .so my advice to anyone would be not to go there I have never been told by any ofter business that 7 out of the 8 days you go there at 10am in the morning that they are book out last time I ever visit health land Asoke

incredible terrible. We booked the Thai massage at 9:22 in the morning for 19:30. When we came to the Asoke branch the lady from the reception told us there do not have our booking and we may called the wrong branch, after I verified my phone record the same lady said they do not have my reservation, what can they do. It is the first time we experienced such terrible services after so many countries we have been and so many reservations we have made. At least you can say sorry for the time and money we waste because of your mistake.

unimpressed. I've been coming here a few times for Thai massage and have been happy with the price and the quality of the service. Unfortunately, because of their popularity, it's been difficult to get a time slot available for a thai massage. This particular time they had a time slot open for a foot massage and I wasn't too impressed with the overall experience. For one thing it was incredibly loud outside; must have been many Chinese tourists. The constant noise outside simply detracted from the overall experience. The actual foot massage was just ok; nothing to right home about. For this reason, I feel that I'm being very generous by giving this place an average rating at best.

NOT HONEST!. My family and I first visited Health Land in June 2013. We asked for the Aromatherapy Massage. A staff told us it was not available and persuaded us to take a more expensive package. As we were considering her suggestion, another staff offered her help. When we told her that we wanted the Aromatherapy Massage, she said ok and arranged it immediately! We were puzzled why that massage suddenly became available but didn't question them.We were there again recently (Dec 2013) and experienced a similar situation but with a less happy ending. This time our hotel booked the Aromatherapy Massage in advance for us but when we arrived at Health Land, we were again told that it was not available and were recommended a more expensive package. We tried our luck with another staff and she said ok. Unfortunately, the 1st staff intervened in Thai language and then the other staff changed her words and said the Aromatherapy Massage was not available. We refused to take any other packages. When we complained to the hotel staff who booked the massage for us, he called Health Land and they insisted that our booking was for Thai Massage and not Aromatherapy Massage!Although the massage at Healthland was not bad, we are completely put off by their lack of integrity and doubt that we would go there again. We went to Let's Relax Spa instead and they are very good.

Excellent. Massages are cheap every where in Thailand, so value for money really comes down to the quality of the massage. I did the traditional Thai massage, which was excellent. The masseuse I got was strong and firm, and she wasn't afraid to use that strength. Felt very loose and supple at the end of it. Great experience.

Excellent Thai Traditional Spa - Value for money. Located just off Sukhumvit road, you come across this stand alone building. The spa has large waiting area which is very relaxed, soothing and professionally managed. At the reception you have to choose your service and pay for the same, there is usallay a 10 - 20 minute waiting specially during weekends and the staff tells you at the time of choosing the treatment. The front office wasnot very helpful if you have queries as they were far too busy attending to all customers but there is some literature in English that gives you the brief of the treatment. The treatment is done in professional, hygenic, soothing rooms. It is great value for money if you compare it with a hotel spa but the advantage in hotels is that you can ask for some massages by the pool or in the comfort of you room. While I had a great experience on two ocassions, I reckon the quality of masseuse can perhaps make or break your experience. It is a normal practice to tip 50 t0 100 baht depending on the treatment time and your expertise of the masseuse.

Value for money massage! Recommended. Pros: place looks really good and professional, gives you a relaxed atmosphere. We went for the 60m foot massage for 280baht which was decent enough. Cons: masseurs were literally loitering conspicuously around after the massage for you to tip them. Well, at least they didn't ask for it blatantly and we did. Some advised reservations are a must before coming, but the reception told us to walk in if we wanted a leg massage. So don't need to call if you only want the leg massage!

Depends on your masseuse/masseur. Like most places, your experience will depend on who you get. I haven't been to the other Health Land locations, but I was very impressed by the facility. For the price, the facility is beyond expectation. I went twice during my stopover in Bangkok. Both times I opted for a 2-hour Thai massage. My first experience was very enjoyable. My second experience was painful, not unbearable but uncomfortable for sure (and I usually like it to be deep). My advice is to try it and hope for a good masseuse/masseur. At the very least, you can enjoy the comforts of the facility.

Inexperienced Masseur Bad For Your Health!. My woman masseur was really inexperienced and was so rough on me that my neck and legs hurt a week later. Thai massage is meant to be deep and penetrating, but not brutal! The next day I went to the Grand Millenium "Antidote Spa" MUCH better...and much more expensive (Healthland = 450 Baht, Antidote = 3K Baht). My verdict Antidote was worth the price for a lovely all in experience

Great traditional Thai massage. Wanted a real traditional thai massage to fix my muscles and was recommended to health land... was amazed when got there, thought it would some little wooden hut but its more like 5-star hotel, lobby was really impressive... did 2 hours thai traditional massage and it was super cheap and really good... painful but as the therapist told me "NO PAIN NO GAIN!"

Bad Service ... Super unprofessional and Lazy massage. This is my 5th time and it will be my last time going to Healthland Asoke. I was booked a 2 hour traditional massage and at first all was well but when the massage was done it was clearly unprofessionally delivered. I was massage over an hour on my legs and she keep pressing here and there and not moving to any other areas. I thought ok find time to move on to another area and again more pressing here and there .. nothing at all like what a thai massage suppose to be. Is only when I told her off that she say in a half hearted manner and with a unfriendly stare that : ok ok i do i do... what an unprofessional massage I am getting.when the massage was finished... the usual standing there and waiting for her tip as it is a must. just to satisfy her i gave her a 50 baht and you could see a very unsatisfied face.. gee.. i was wondering why am I tipping her in the first place. I will never go over here for a massage again.. is inconsistent and would have to depend on your luck if you will be blessing with a good massage. I have to stress.. this is my fifth visit and my last visit the massage was professional and great.. but for this trip it was super unprofessional..anyway this will be that last time me going to healthland. I think the little non sleazy parlors do a much better job

disappointing. Funny how other reviewers have commented that this is a massage mill. That was exactly my impression when I walked into this spa. The place looked very nice & modern with beautiful ambient lighting. When I walked in, I immediately saw some menu boards but it didn't look like the menu I saw on the website or a normal massage menu. Most of the stuff there were in a foreign language & didn't sound Thai. So I went up to the counter & told them I wanted a massage. The same menu were on the counter - nothing else. The woman asked me if I wanted an oil massage and I did wanted an aromatherapy massage, so I said yes, and she pointed to the menu board & recommended a 90-min massage (some foreign name that started with an A). I paid THB 1,200 for it. On hindsight, I should've asked if they had an aromatherapy massage & insisted on it. The treatment room was also nicely lit, but the bed still felt slightly oily, which felt icky. The music was also rather strange - slow classical music with low crashing waves (Schumann isn't exactly relaxing for me) and then instrumental jazz. I like the fact that the room has a small shower cubicle so I could immediately wash the icky oil off. My masseuse was very courteous, but perhaps not very skilled. It was a shallow massage, using a synthetic-smelling oil. She also wanted to mix the oil with some spices and put it on my head but I declined. Afterwards she told me the massage I had was an Indian/Ayurvedic massage. I still tipped her because I felt it wasn't her fault that I didn't enjoy that particular type of massage. I would not recommend Health Land to anyone. Even the little (non-sleazy) parlors on Soi 11 were more satisfying & more honest than this.

If you aren't happy with Healthland, you're too hard to please. I visited health land 3 times over 1 week during my recent visit to Bangkok & tried 3 different types of massage treatments. The foot massage is the same price as what is charged on the streets, but it is cleaner and more professionally delivered. The thai therapeutic massage is not for the faint- hearted as the intent is to really get into the muscles & joints so practice your deep breathing before signing up for this one. For a relaxing treat try the body scrub & aromatherapy massage. 2.5 hours of pampering for a little over $50.00 AUD, what a bargain! Yes, the staff are hoping for a tip but really guys- surely they deserve a little something extra given the average incomes that they earn. It is a busy centre so the front office staff are very business like & professional. Some may not like that but I had no problem with it. The centre is clean and spacious. It smelt fresh and inviting every time I walked in.

Good, Clean and Refreshing. Unlike the many stories of massage parlors giving extra services, this chain is great for families and even kids to go. I usually take their 2 hour traditional Thai Full Body massage. The pricing is competitive for the basic packages and pricey for the complicated and more intense ones. I've not tried the latter though. They are housed in a property of their own so no fear of sudden price change and it is way easier to locate than those in the malls.

A Thai Massage Factory. 2MovingTheChi were looking to experience a good Thai massage while in Bangkok. There are numerous vendors along the streets offering Thai massage so we decided to ask the concierge at the hotel. The concierge recommended we go to Health Land.Health Land is in a white, impressive, 8 story building. We ended up liking our first therapeutic massage and returned for two other services.Health Land is a massage factory. Lots of people use Health Land for their services. We do not speak Thai but they have English speaking staff to help you along and an English services menu. Pick your service, pay, and you are on your way after a short wait.You can’t go wrong with Health Land for a clean, safe environment but realize, as in all massage practice, your experience will only be as good as your therapist. And in a factory, a good therapist is the luck of the draw.2MovingTheChi.com have been traveling since April. Starting in the U.S. and now in the northern part of Thailand. For a more detailed review and additional photos, visit 2MovingTheChi.com.

Shortchanged.. and was not let off without leaving a tip. I should have suspected something was amidst from the start. Guess I was too desperate for a massage. When I called several hours earlier to place a reservation, the spa was only willing to take me for a 2.5 hour massage and will not allow me to choose a shorter 90 minutes massage. This should be like ringing warning bells that this is a place out to fleece it's customers to the end.The massage was only for 1 hour 45 minutes - way short of 2.5 hours I paid .. (it cost me a whopping THB2500 per pax). Once you are done, the masseuse was straight up in asking for a tip - and even demanded to see how much money I had in my wallet.On my previous visits to Bangkok, I usually frequented other spas - but this was the first time I was so blatantly shortchanged - and extorted for a tip! I am never coming back to this branch of Healthland!

Good Massage - Good Value. My Thai business representative recommended this place for a legitimate massage.
