There are plenty of places in Bangkok to get a "happy ending" massage that is more about the ending and less about the massage. I read the reviews before heading to the massage. Since they were mixed, I was concerned whether I was really making the right decision. I was very pleasantly surprised by all aspects of the experience. My local representative recommended going in the early afternoon to avoid the evening crowd. This seemed to be a good strategy. I had no prior appointment but was able to be seen in about 10 minutes. The reception staff was courteous. My masseuse was very professional. She asked if I how hard I wanted the massage and on what areas I wanted her to concentrate. Let me give one piece of advice. Hard means hard. I told her I wanted the massage to be between medium and hard, and she complied. At times, it was a bit too much pressure. Nevertheless, I left feeling refreshed, and the next day I felt even better. The massage was the equivalent of US$20. It was worth every penny, and I would do it again.

Good massage but disappointed with the rest. We heard that healthland was the best place to go to for a massage in Bangkok. The massage proved to be good but the toilets were filthy due to a big tour group landing there at the same time, and the staff at the reception were not helpful at all. We were quite disappointed and would not want to go back there.

Good value for quality you get. I come here every time I visit Bangkok. It is one block behind Asoke BTS station. You can reach there via either Soi 19 or Soi 21. It is housed in a big Thai mansion. The place is clean and the prices are very competitive. For THB280 you get one hour foot massage. Other small, sleazy set ups will charge THB350 and this place is clean and spacious. I also like Aromatherapy - for 1.5 hrs, THB850. You can a room to yourself with shower facility. This place is very popular so make sure you make a reservation before hand. However, no bookings for foot massage so first come first serve! I guess it's due to its popularity. Highly recommend!

Worth the price. The massage is pretty affordable THB 500 for a 120 mins (which boils down to 100 mins) massage. The masseurs do an okay job. It's a big establishment and lots of rooms. Getting an appointment wasn't tough. However, expect not a very friendly treatment at the counter.. But the price they charge and given that its a clean massage place, it's ok to bear it for 2 mins!

Good value for money. Nice decor & good prices. Always our favourite place to relax every time we come to Bangkok. We like aroma massage very much but we found that Thai massage is also very good this time. Highly recommend this place!

Pompous Staff. We walked in and were about to book 2 spa packages, until one impolite and rather pompous man interrupted us as if we were a nuisance and asked us if we "needed help", then laughed at us and walked away. This was a really unusual way to treat customers about to pay 1,800 baht. The staff need to be replaced.

THE BEST SPA IN BANGKOK. The Healthland chain of spas are known for their top-notch service and fantastic environment but the Asok branch is, in my opinion, the best one. It's less busy than the branch in Sathorn and it provides specialized Indian Abayanga massages and treatment which is very good. Try the facial treatments - the spa uses Jurlique products so you can be assured of good quality facial products,A must go for all Bangkok visitors

Rude rude rude!. Health Land was our Plan C, after hearing so many mixed reviews. Both our chosen Lets Relax branches either had fully booked or an appointment 5hours later. We walked in and was straightface greeted by a tall dramatic looking hostess. After quickly browsing their offerings we politely asked "excuse me..." yet noone was interested. After 8 mins a very old abrupt hostess led us to the male cashier and said "what do u want". We booked in for pressure points massage and reflexology which she indicated were available immediatley but aromatherapy has to be waited on. Funny how we paid and hung around akwardly for a further 16mins before someone called on a tannoy to escort us to a therapist room. Massage was standard. Nothing negative to say. But the reception is enough to anger anyone! Stick to Let's Relax for better service, similar pricing, and positive energy staff!!!

Poor hospitality. Facility is new and elegant - maybe, low lighting makes such impression -.Considerinng it, though price seems to be competitive, as for me, it was not .Massage, staff's attitutde was not good - no smilling face there-Hope more hospitality.

An ok experiance. Nothing really special.. i have been to a lot of massage shops for value and seversl spas for luxurey. Heslthland somehow is trying to create a sort of balance between value and luxury..Pros.Fair spa outlook and decoreHuge center with english speaking receptionist.ConsVery corporate Very busyPoor massage by the therapist. But maybe its just my luckNot value for money.

Cant beat it for value. As a spa addict living in Bangkok I know the spas pretty well. Cant beat Health land for value for money -this place is charging about 50% less than the othe spas in the same category. I keep coming back for more even I discover new spas all the time.

Factory feel, rude reception, not very clean, mediocre massage. I hardly write reviews, but this experience motivated me, I almost write this as a warning.What others have said is true - the place is enormous, you are just being put through a massage mill. The most noticeable receptionist is already mentioned (tall, mohawked) and seems almost consciously impolite, which of course doesn't help first impressions. Note if you are late for your appointment they cancel it immediately and then some other poor sod waiting on standby grabs your spot. We had the aromatherapy massage. It always depends who you get but our masseuses were both poor-mediocre, imprecise, inconsistent, bored. It was one of the least enjoyable massages I have had... it's definitely not a place we'll return to. We have a lot of experience with Thai massages having had many long stays in Bangkok. This was in every aspect a disappointing experience, and the worst for bad attitude and low skill. We did not feel very refreshed afterward, we were just glad to leave.When I was lying facedown on the massage table, I saw a cockroach crawl past on the floor. Bugs are common in Bangkok of course, but this did not improve the "ambience". The place is generally poorly lit and dark - dark walls, dark brown bathrooms, dark floors. It gives a feeling this hides the dirt ...We know people who make Bangkok their home, and we only discovered later that we chose badly when we walked into this spa. This is a place for local Thai who can handle rough Thai massage better perhaps, and for (mainly Asian) tourists who don't know any better place.

Enjoyable session. As others have rightly pointed out, it is recommended to make an appointment before you head down here for a massage. The place is flooded with guests who hanged around waiting for a slot or cancellation. I made a booking via phonecall a week prior to my arrival.Healthland Asoke is a 10 minutes walk from ASOKE BTS. For us, we took the easiest way - a cab from Pratnum. It has a luxurious and zen layout throughout the whole building and looked very classy. The front counter staff was a bit unfriendly perhaps due to the number of guests hoovering her counter. I told them i had an prior appointment and asked to sit down and wait. Shortly they called out my name via a speaker (haha).I was brought to the waiting lounge for my slippers. The place was huge. My treatment room was on 8th floor and there are almost 20 rooms on each floor. Our therapists are very skillful. The private rooms are clean and nicely appointed. They didn't talk much but ok to me. Dont expect to sleep during the treatment as they were practically cranking your bones every single minute but i felt so refreshed after the whole treatment. I wish i have time for another session.Baht $500 for a 2 hours treatment totally worth it. Highly recommended! Will come again.

Fixed what nobody else could. Yes, the taller lady receptionist/greeter with the fauxhawk/tattoo is a bit short. But you spend a total of a few minutes max talking to her, so who cares? It's about the massage.I've had back and hip pain for about four years now. I've seen probably two dozen doctors (including the top orthopods in the area), physical therapists, massage therapists, and even chiropractors and acupuncturists in that time in an attempt to get to the root of the problem and fix it. Outside of the temporary relief granted by a cortisone shot, nothing has even put a dent in the pain.I was wrapping up a three week trip in Thailand where I had been to massage shops nearly every day. Sometimes I'd get a Thai massage, sometimes an oil massage, and plenty of them were great. But again, none of them ever relieved the pain for more than a couple of hours. So, on my way back out of the country, I booked an appointment at Healthland Asoke for their back pain relief package, which was about 2.5 hours long and cost a little over 2,000 baht. That's a bit more expensive than your standard massage shop, but they offered up a few more services and it's still not all that much (most hour massages here in the states will cost you more than that). Plus the private rooms here are very nice and well-appointed.The masseuse didn't speak much English, but she's Thai, so that's on me and not her. But she was pleasant enough. The massage itself was very nice and thorough. I had never experienced a hot herbal compress before, but I enjoyed it. The masseuse left the room after the massage and allowed me to shower in the room's private shower, which was very nice as I had herbal residue all over me. I still couldn't get it all off in one shot. She escorted me back upstairs, gave me a tea, and seemed genuinely appreciative of her tip.But in the end, the five star rating is due to the fact that this massage alone, unlike the hordes of specialists I've seen in the last four years, cured my hip pain 100%. The back pain is still there, but I can't discount the importance of no longer hobbling along or being unable to participate in in sports due to a bum hip. It's only been a month, but even a month of relief is more than I've ever seen before and well worth the five stars and 2,000 (or so) baht.

good enjoyable massage. luxurious yet affordable, in fact cheap for 500baht 2hrs thai massage. 3 therapists who served us were quite well-skilled, one of them was 59yrs old lady, and my friend who was served by her praised that her skill was amazing. Really have to make reservations beforehand as we tried walking in the first time, they did not entertain us. So we made appt for th next day on the spot. Front counter staff service not too great though, should improve to fit the luxurious feel.
Invigorating. Daddy : First experienced, good work out, enjoyed !Mommy : Enjoyed the experienced as always. Son: First experienced, was relaxing that he fell asleep.

A great found and surprise!. My friend and I planned to go to Terminal 21's Let's Relax when it is fully booked, we have thought about this big spa property which we have passed for 2 days. We gave it a try of the 4 hands massage, it is amazing and fxxking good!! I instantly recommended it to another who is going to Bangkok next week :)

Just put up with the negatives. Positives: Good location, walking distance (about 8-10mins) from BTS Asoke. Open till late. Cheap. Good thai massage. Foot massage (hit and miss sometimes). Accept walk in on weekdays. Lovely free tea after your treatment. Negative: Reception are not always friendly (especially the guy who is the cashier). Massage ladies always hanging around for your tip and grumble openly in front of you if they think you give them too little. foot massage very cheap but the ladies are also doing it halfheartedly.Conclusion: This place isn't the top recommended place in TripAdvisor. people who usually willing to go either had a good experience before or after the cheap price. So go support them if you are willing to accept the shortcomings otherwise don't go (and complain later) since you already know what standards they have from reading all the reviews.

How is it possible?.... ...can't work out how it can be so cheap here - 2 hours massage for 500 baht and the place is like a super luxury spa - the lobby was like a 5-star hotel lobby and everything was new and perfect - really impressive place and massage was perfect - how it can be this cheap I dont know

Wow. We were surprised when we arrived and saw the building which was very impressive - more like a luxury hotel or grand museum than a massage center. Luckily the prices are very cheap - we did the Thai traditional massage which is stretching massage no oil - it was strong and very good - recommend it for anyone who wants to try proper Thai massage without go to the seedy places.

Need to improve customer service. Similar to what others have reported, the lady (receptionist?) who takes the massage "order" is not the most friendliest person. I had a lady who was fairly tattooed underneath her uniform who gave an aura of self-importance ... zero politeness and not much service attitude. Not sure if it's directly related to the fact I'm Asian male who came in with my Thai lady friend or because I came in my short pants and slippers. I almost walked about because of this lady.I had a therapeutic massage from a guy that was actually very good. No complaints about the massage. However, I gave him fairly good tip (200 baht+) but he didn't seem very appreciative (no thank you or wai). My female companion got the foot massage. She said the lady was very old and she felt bad for her. She said her massage was so-so.I like the concept of Health Land (and it's actually not that easy to find good massage places in Sukhumvit area). I think I will try their Ekamai location next time to see if the service is better.

Good but painful massage. Massage was refreshing but I guess the masseur could not estimate the strength to use. You have to tell them to go softer as usually they will use their full body weight on you.

Terrible therapist!. Went to have body massage last Saturday as this was our second visit to Health Land Spa & Massage. We chose the 1.5 hours Aromatheraphy massage and was told by the receptionist that only 1.5hours Hot Oil Massage is available. Fine, as we did not have reservation in advance, we were fine to settle with Hot Oil Massage which was obviously more expensive than aromatherapy massage. I guess this is their front desk strategy in getting more revenue. During my last visit in February, i was told the same thing. I do not mind paying more if service rendered was good quality like my last visit.I had the worst experience visiting Health Land Spa in Asoke this time. I had the worst and unprofessional therapist. When asked for more pressure as she was merely touching my back, she simply elbowed on my back with her whole weight on me.Instead of strokes, she scratched my back with her nails!!!I was very disspointed with the worst therapist!!! I do not even want to look at her after the service!!!My first visit in February was a bliss. After this recent visit, i will never visit Health Land in Asoke again. Not recomended with the price tag and extremely bad service!!

Great but Can Improve on Customer Service. We had a bit of commotion on the front desk. The lady was a bit stern or sounded a bit harsh. But the massage sessions we experienced were great. Do try to call and do a booking prior arriving (especially on weekends as it might be full).
Must try. Among others spa and massage, this is the most valuable one. Great environment, great treatment, reasonable prices. They serve service not fancy interior. Service is excellent.

Not enough tips? not enough time. In Apr.21. My wife and I walked into here, just because I saw it on 4squre and though it was worth to try. The fact is I am totally wrong.We found seats ourselves, and no one to ask us, then I went to the front desk and found someone willing to talk with me(1st mistake). I wanted to book 1.5h aromatherapy body massage for my wife and 2h Thai Massage for myself. One staff suggest me to add a half hour for my wife, I accepted, so the price came from 850+500 to 1200+500. I thought it's fair, but forgot to tell my wife the change, I thought them could take care of us.(2nd mistake)For my part, I felt good, and after treatment paid 100 tips.But my wife just came out earlier than me, I did not ask the detail until we got back to hotel(3rd mistake)She told me that the girl had asked her" do you know how much you pay? how much tips do you want to pay" and had suggested 150 at least. My wife felt unhappy and didn't agree. After the treatment, she paid 100 anyway. The point is the treatment was only lasted 1.5h in fact. I paid 350 for nothing and got a unhappy ending.So my suggestion is to avoid mistakes, just leave far away this massage.

Extremely Rude Receptionist. I had to cancel my booking because the receptionist gave me such a terrible impression. I went in with my farang boyfriend. I know what a lot of people think when it comes to Thai girlfriend and farang boyfriend relationship but they have no rights to judge us or anyone. We picked our massage course and walked up to the reception where I was given a look of disgust by their extremely rude receptionist. No hello or what can I help you standard greetings whatsoever. Besides that she spoke with me with menace in her voice. No "please", no "ka". Let alone a friendly, hospitable smile. I feel really insulted by this receptionist. After we left, I told my boyfriend about the situation and decided to cancel the booking. When I called, I made a comment about the receptionist. The officer who took the call didn't even say sorry. You'd better be careful no matter what your customers are like or appear to be like, you're in no position to judge anyone. They pay you money to perform your service, NOT BEG for freebies. If this receptionist is sick of her job and aims her awful attitude toward the company's customers, I think she should quit or deserve a sack.

Beware Greedy & Poor Skill Masseuse Asking For Much More Tips. I brought my 2 friends to Health Land Asoke on 22/04/13. It is their first visit. They took the couple room & after their aroma massage my friend told me their masseuses asked for 200baht tips from them & my friends being kind actually gave it to them although their massage skill is not that good. I feedback to the manager on duty but she don't really bother. Asked me back which masseuse. How would we know their staff name? Really waste time talking to that manager.Their service standard is so poor & their director would never know how their staff performance as no email to feedback at all.I would never recommend to any of my friends anymore. For those who like to visit them just a reminder their massage time u paid will start to countdown from the moment they called your name at waiting area to walking to room to shower to massage to dressing up to back at waiting area. Wish u all good luck never to meet those greedy masseuses !

Too busy for their own good. When you do well as a business, you should keep it up, not let it fall. Health land has become increasingly popular over the years, but the service continues to fall rapidly. Wait time if over 45 min is fairly common and when they say 45 min, it could even be 1.5 hr without informing you. Terribly disappointing it bas become over the years and the massage is really not any better than a side shop on the street. Ive given up with health land. There are plenty of much better massages and SERVICE to be found. Healthland is now on the downfall.

Worth for the price. the service i received is just worth the price, and never expect the price of a proper massage centre can be so affordable. is good for those who are looking for good massage with affordable price, but not those on the street, will recommend this. The environment is so clean and quiet, and you're not allow to talk during the massage, as you'll be disturbing others. With such silent and clean environment, how can you don't nap and recharge yourself?!

Not The Best. Just very disappointed. This is like an massage you get off the street massage shops which there are hundreds all over Bangkok, but this one is just done up nicely into a nice big building. The massages were poor, the service were poor, but the ambiance was okay. Not something I'd recommend. You'd much better be off with going to regular ones along the streets for more authentic experiences. Don't be fooled by the 'brand'.

Excellent Body Massage at very affordable price. Very posh looking & clean place, good ambiance too.500 baht for 2 hours Traditional Thai Massage. Service staffs are very professional, good pressure and make your body feel refresh every time.Have tried Traditional Thai, Thai Herbal Compress & Aromatherapy Body Massage (one of the best)Only minus point is, counter staffs doesn't put on a smile.15 minutes walk from the nearest MRT.

Terrible proud people. Terrible experience. If you don't need our business,don't be bothered at all then. Lousy attitude service staff whom rolled eye at us while we decide if we want to take ur only available most expensive package. No welcome, no thanks, nothing at all. Well done!

Amazing Massage. So far been in Bangkok for more then a week we actually found out this spa called Health Land was much a better place to go for a good massage.Their service and massage was amazing compared to some others we've been to.

Best Thai Massage!!. By far the best Thai Massage I've had. Very posh looking place, a bungalow on its own. Price is reasonable - 500bath for 2 hours of Thai Massage. Very professional, good pressure and they definitely know what they're doing. Went in about 3.30pm, when I came out the place was packed with people already. Good value for money!

Great massage at really good price. There are quite a few HealthLand spas branches in Bangkok but we visited the one at Asoke as it was the nearest to our hotel. It's about 10 mins walk from Asoke BTS Station / Sukumvit subway station.For 500 baht, you enjoy a 2 hr traditional Thai massage which I think is really good value for money. I also tried the aromatherapy massage which I thought paled in comparison.  The place is well run and very clean. The masseurs are professional and friendly. As its popular with both locals and tourists, you should book the day before to ensure a slot (can ask your hotel concierge for help to book). Will most definitely return to HealthLand during my next visit to Bangkok.

Best Thai massage of all my visits since 1998. Unlike other recent reviews, my experience of Thai massage (yesterday) was much better than hundreds of massages I have had. I suppose it depends on who you get since Health Land is so big, with so many masseuse. I like the location of this HL. It is only couple of blocks from Asoke BTS. HL reception area is large, plenty of waiting areas, clean and fairly quiet. I walke-in, rather than pre-booked, at around 11:30 am. There were several customers prior to me, so the waiting was roughly 45 min. My husband was hesitant, but I wanted to wait in order to try out at this location since my usual massage location (since 1998) is now out of business. Note: while I was waiting, I noticed there were as many Thai customers (young and old) as foreign customers. At about 45 minutes, my name was called. I followed a young lady (about 30-40s) to the massage room on the 7th floor. The room had 2 mats, but I was the only customer in the room. The room was cleanly furnished, including runner on mat & orchid on pillow. There was a TV in room but it not turned on. Room temperature was comfortable. Mat was firm but not too firm. The room and surrounding hallway was very quiet, in general, except for one time when what sounded like a group of customers being led to their rooms. My masseuse was very good, slowly worked over my body. Some of my mussle groups were brought to my attention, I did not even know I had. My 2-hour session was exactly 115 minutes from the time I laid down on the mat until I sat up, getting ready to get dressed. I noticed the time, as I noticed my masseuse was looking at the clock (in the room) when she asked my to lie down on my back. As far as costs, the cost for Thai massage is very comparable to other locations (400-500 Bt, even at Wat Po it would cost more if admission fees takken into account).All in all, I had very good Thai massage. I cannot say for other services. I definitely will be back for another Thai massage session in 2 days time.

Overrated. Health land is over rated. The masseurs pretend to massage you while she watches television in the massage room. Unprofessional and totally dishonest service This coupled with rude receptionists that 'greets' every single unexpected tourists

Not worth the money. My mother and I went to this spa on the 8th of March thinking that it would be a great experience as it is quite big and always seems to be busy. We booked our appointment for a facial and aromatherapy massage for 8pm - to which we were told to be on time, however they made us wait 15 minutes before being led in to take off our shoes. The massage beds are incredibly uncomfortable and the 'aromatherapy' massage we both received was absolutely horrible. There was no pressure at all so it felt quite uncomfortable to be gently rubbed up and down. I have had many aromatherapy massages before (including in Bangkok) and they have all been great. Then the facial - which made me feel incredibly claustrophobic. The lady was constantly rubbing around my nostrils (sounds funny I know) but the cream was getting in my nose and I couldn't breathe then when I tried to breathe through my mouth cream somehow miraculously got in there too!The other thing that was disappointing was the fact that we had paid for a 90 minute massage and 60 minutes facial. We walked out fully dressed at 10:30! They didn't have smiles on their faces and they were just waiting there for a tip - to which they began b****ing when they didn't get one.My advice would be to go down the road to Sukhumvit Soy 19 to Lotus massage (close to a 7eleven) they are cheaper and much better value for money! They girls always have smiles on their faces and I always walk out feeling better - not worse - than when I walked in.

Nice oil massage but a little overpriced. Went there with my husband for body scrub and oil massage. Paid a total of 3200THB for the 2.5hrs. We book earlier so we got a couple room and have to wait only 10 mins. Nice massage,nice building but I think the package a bit overpriced. Should have try the Thai massage instead.

The best place for a relaxing and removing your body pain. Great place to relax your body and worth every penny clean no need to have a massage on the road side shops if you really want to experience the thai tradition u should go to this place and take a massage for 2 hrs if your in Thailand for long period then at least twice b'coz this kind of you will not get in your country and at this price

Thai Traditional Massage. Please do not miss Thai Traditional Massage at Health Land Spa & Massage. Please made booking in advance before visit because it always fully book. The massage is so great the staff are very well trained and very professional. It really valued for money only 500 bahts for 2 hours. The ambiance is so good and clean. It is very high standard massage place. We will definitely come back when visit Bangkok.

Way over rated.. Feels like a 'spa factory'. Went to Healthland spa with my wife for a 1.5 hr aromatherapy massage. (Heard so much about this place so decided that we should try it for ourselves!)We were amazed by the size of this spa. It resembled a hotel! 8 storeys high with a big reception lobby! I thought the spa was within a hotel but I was wrong! It's a 8 storey building dedicated to spa!!We didn't make any reservations but got a slot nonetheless. There were probably about 50 people waiting in the reception area.. Waiting for their names to be called and for the therapist to lead them to the rooms. I felt very 'industrialized' and didn't feel very pampered (as I normally would when I visit other spas).we waited for about 15 mins and our names were finally called. We were brought to the 7th floor and both my wife and myself were led to different rooms.. No couple room apparently. The room was nice and clean. there was nice music piped in as well. Once inside i was asked to take a shower. About 15 mins later, the therapist returned to the room and started the massage. The massage, was really averaged at best. It felt as if the therapist was going thru motion.. She was probably tired having done many others before me and so wasn't putting a lot of strength into the massage as well. My wife later commented the same for her therapist. Within an hour, the massage ended! We later realized that the 1.5hrs included waiting time and showering time!!! For the price we paid, 850baht each, we felt we could have done better in the many other spa centers available around BkK. We have been to some nice smaller spas that charged 400 baht for one full hr massage and came out feeling more rejuvenated then this!Will I return to Health land? Probably never.. I think it's been way over rated and will explore some other smaller but more personal spa centers in future.

Very professional yet inexpensive.. My girlfriend and I got a 2 hour Thai massage for 500 baht each. The spa itself is highly modern and comfortable. We were told there would be an hour wait but only ended up waiting about 30 minutes. A very relaxing experience.
Nice. A high standard massage place to go, provide a wide range of therapies, from foot massage to Indian ayuvedic oil massage. The ambiance is good

Great value, pleasant setting. Agree with some other reviewers, that the check in staff can be a little too efficient and don't come across as warm and welcoming, but after you check in, it's a great experience. I booked a couples aroma message for my wife and I. We were taken to a nice room (clean, nicely lit, perfect temperature, classical music playing), with dual showers in the room. The massages were very nice - more relaxing than the traditional thai massage, exactly what we needed. They are very respective of your privacy, only uncovering one body part at a time, so we felt very comfortable. After the massage we were given some flavourful tea. It was a very good deal, getting an entire private room and 2 massages for under 2000 baht. We just moved to Bangkok and will return again.

What a Bargin. My partner and i were wondering the streets as you do when you ar eon a holiday and stumbled accross this place. They had a special 500 Baht per person for 2 hours. Now i dont care if it wasnt for an entire 2 exact hours because it was relaxing, worth the price, and we got to have our treatment in the same room. Its a huge place, we took a lift up a few floors and there were lots of people having treatments.They make you feel welcome, its just behind Terminal 21, its cheap enough, its cleaner than alot of those smaller ones (which you are not entirely sure what you're gonna get).When your in BKK try it out

Reservation? Excuses!!. The Health Land Spa chain in Bangkok is like a factory massage service. Better than your average street corner massage shops and not as expensive as the high end specialty spas. I have used them many times and generally get pretty good messages. As with any spa, it all depends on the massage person you get, doesn't matter if it is high end or on the street. I was at Health Land Asoke yesterday with a friend. We both got massages, mine was one of the best I've had, theirs was one of the worst they had ever had. I was the lucky one. When I find a good therapist, I always find out their name and go back and see them specifically. So of course I booked another 2 hour massage for today as yesterday's therapist was so good.Got to my appointment and was informed they did not have my reservation and the therapist was not working today. I confirmed with reception 3 times yesterday as I don't trust.The worse part is the receptionist I talked to today just kept coming up with excuses for their mistake without taking blame for their error and saying sorry. They simply don't understand what a reservation is and how to deal with a problem.If they would right away have said sorry for our mistake and tried to make some effort that would have been acceptable.Giving continuous lame excuses is not the answer to please customers and get return business...

Airport terminal in lobby, but otherwise good. RECOMMENDED: This is a very nice & large spa/massage facility (7 floors if you can believe). Very nice interior and clearly polished. The lobby is nice, but it's busy and the staff seem a bit unfriendly. However, the prices were reasonable and we gave it a try. After 'departing' the lounge, the remainder of the facility is quite peaceful and nice. Good quality massages and overall good experience.If you're in the Asok area, this should be an easy walk (10 minute walk from BTS station)Overall, recommended.
Good service with afforable pricing. Massage is great and the room is very clean!We will definitely visited there everytime when we are in Bangkok.

Business is too good.... Called to book, didn't want to trot 8 friends there and end up some not being massaged. As mentioned above, the receptionist was not helpful, didn't bother to assist and was curt on the line. Nevertheless, ended up there a day later. Nice building, clean and fair pricing. But what a "cattle station" it was at the reception. The staff at the reception were "politely arrogant" and the massage was just ordinary, perhaps too tired from the constant flow of customers. Anyway, tried to book for another set of 9 friends for a after dinner massage, and I got the "....try your luck later" treatment.The other smaller massage shops may not have the ambience of a spa but they do a good job and appreciate your visit. This place is just too commercialised and arrogant as their business is too good...

Is this right?. I feel that Health Land is dishonest and unprofessional, but tell me if I am wrong. I booked a 2 hour aromatherapy massage. This costs 1200 bahts. They told me to come at 12 noon. I arrived at 11:59am. It took them a while to find my booking and by the time they billed me, it was 12:07pm (see photo). I was then asked to take a seat whilst the therapist is called. She arrived about 10 minutes later, at which point they called my name on the loudspeaker. She told me to follow her to the back of the reception area whee she took my shoes and gave me a pair of in-house slippers to put on. We waited for the lift that brought us up to one of the many floors, stopping once for another customer to get off. When we arrived at my massage room, I asked to use the toilet and was directed to the toilets at the left of the far end of the corridor. When I got back to the room, the therapist asked me to take a shower before the massage. After the shower, I finally lay on the bed. Around 30 minutes had passed since payment of the bill to now. It was around 12:30pm. I would have thought that my 2 hour massage starts starts now, but I was wrong. The massage finished at 2pm. When I checked with the therapist, she insisted that we started at 12:05pm! She said she finished 5 mins earlier to give me time to get dressed!!! This was the time on the clock in the room when I had finished getting dressed (see picture). I decided to take the matter to the reception. There, they admitted that there was something wrong with the timing, but that they would not refund me the balance. They asked me to come back again and they would give me 15 minutes extra to compensate. They also said that the clock starts to tick from the time I arrive - therefore the compensation of 15 mins and not 30 mins if I come back for another treatment! Not their fault if they were late to find me booking, late to bill me, made me wait for the therapist to arrive, etc. I said that I was leaving the next day and could not come back. Even if I came back, I would want a different therapist as this one had not impressed me. They said that both was not possible. I don't know if this is how massage places operate in Bangkok, especially big, popular ones, but I am quite disappointed with how unprofessional they are, very surprising given how big and well-known they are with many branches across the city.

Not a 100% reliable, but all in all pretty good. First went to Health Land two years ago (different location), this time had 3 massages during the last week of December. Would not recommend Foot Reflexology, even though it is fairly reasonably priced at 280 Baht per hour. They don't actually work on your foot very hard, it is more of a leg massage, plus a little bit of arms and shoulders. We found Traditional Thai Massage at 450 Baht for 2 hours still the best deal. The masseuses were competent, and they had a feeling for the needs of your body. Also tried the Abhyanga-Shirodara-Package, which was really excellent, but at 2600 Baht for 2.5 hrs is not the best value for money Bangkok has to offer. Paid 2600 in advance, made an appointment, went there the next day only to find out that they could not do it and had to reschedule. Two days later it finally worked. Also went there on 12/31 for a Thai Massage, when they sent us right home, because they would only accept customers with a valid appointment. Conclusion: the quality is good, but you need patience.

It depends on what you are looking for?. I was interested in a Traditional Thai Massage. Many Thais go to Health Land. Where the locals go is where you are probably going to get the most authentic and reasonably priced massage. But first you have to like a Thai Massage. I enjoy a hard massage. This is by far the hardest whole body massage I have ever experienced. But it was different and I enjoyed it. You can choose from a a variety of massages. I chose the 2 hour Traditional Thai Massage for 450 bhat. I felt fine afterward. It was like going to the gym and working out. But some people will want a softer massage. To each his own.
Kind. Easy to find this place and the staffs are kind. Place is quite big but the price is cheaper than I expected.

It's hit or miss. Did not know what to expect when I walked in the door. The entrance and ambience while waiting was very pleasant and inviting. Although the exterior of the building looked like it may be a very pricey place, prices ended up being very competitive to elsewhere in Bangkok. My first massage was amazing! Wow! The masseuse respected my requests for a gentler massage around my neck. When I got back to my hotel I was so relaxed and restful I missed dinner and slept through the entire night.Second massage 2 days later was the complete opposite. The masseuse treated me like I was a peace of meat. She was rough, aggressive and uncaring. I couldn't wait to finish. I ended up with a sore neck for 3 days. In both cases they were Thai massages. A Thai massage should be given with compassion, joy and love. From my experience it was a hit or miss in this factory like setting.

Good cheap massage. We love Health land - its so cheap but still feels like a high-quality establishment. The lobby is more like a 4/5 star hotel and the staff are really professional. Rooms are a bit small and drab but at least its better than the awful places around Bangkok that charge same price for massage together in a room with lots of strangers.

Super classy spa for a super low price. This is what is good about Thailand - classy place with great service but also very affordable (actually SUPER CHEAP) - definitely the place to come for a good massage in a good venue in Bangkok.

i feel like a cow here T...T. This place is right on the most busy junction of Bangkok, it's a short motorbike taxi ride from Asoke MRT station and BTS...no wonder so000000... many people in this massage parlar when i arrived. i was surprised that i could get the massage service when i inquriy about the Ayurvedic Massage from the receptionist, the price was cheap and i decided to give it a try...for a little indulge to myself again I order foot massage and Ayurvedic Massage 2.5 hours......my first one hour went first to follow one woman to the changing room then follow another woman to the foot massage room (shop) with an old lady to give me fooot massage in the very large room full of people, getting massage and carry buckets everywhere....the room was bright yellow light and too noisy, i wished it could be over soon....then another woman guide to upstair to a little massage bed to recieve another treatment. i waited for someone to give me massage for 10minute, then finally he arrived and give me the kind of Ayurveidic Masage which was to me like a Thai Massage, sooo...he confirmed that he gave me true Ayurevedic Massage with no oil...just finger and pincing me...i didn not sleep, the massage was shorter than the order,, but hey ok they were to busy to care..and who i could agrue with or make trouble since there i was at lost in health land and i could not find my way out....so finally it was over and someone bring me to changing room, then i find the way to the lobby again to pay bills.i try to explain my disappoint about Ayurvedic Massage recieved, but i was like more talking to a wall...so i just cry in my heart pay (1800+250=2050THB) i couldnt tell anybody about my experience here becuase i was so ashamed. but i hope if any body went to healthland and feel more or less human about this place, it's normal. it's very busy place where people come to a ordinary general massage, you are joking if you are looking for wellness and wellbeing here, becasue there is nothing personal, and they dont have the staff to promote AYUVEDIC, or even care.

Lowered standard due to crowd. Location: It is 5 min from Sukhomvit MRT exit 1 (getting out, go straight, walk past Furama hotel and turn left at next soi), everyday the crowd is BIG. Used to go to Ekkamai (which also gathers a crowd in the weekend), this time decided to try Asoke branch because it was closer to public transportation. Massage: tried aromatherapy on 2 different days, which was good, until tried other massage places. Strength can be adjusted, if you tell them beforehand and choose your masseur, but it's a very subjective thing. IF you are first timer to Bangkok, this is good introduction place, price for value and safeness (non-sleazy). Environment and massage rooms: relaxed and clean, saw the cleaning ladies hard at work. No "safe" to lock stuff, but carry your own bag and pack-in valuables, should be fine. NOW the consReception, reception, reception... hmmm, bookings can be messy and misplaced, that I can live with, cause it's too large of a crowd. However, the lady in charge looked like people owe her money at all times, which gives a very bad feeling before you get the massage.

Go if you like to be treated like cattle. If anyone from the Spa mgmt is reading this, you can reference this review back to a 7pm appt for 2 people at the Asoke branch under Mr Tan. Appointments are hard to come by and after getting a time slot the previous evening, i called again a couple of hrs before my scheduled time just to re-confirm the appt. I did not want to go all the way down only to find they cocked it up. Reservation staff was gruff and curt over the line and told me that the appt was still on for 7pm and i am supposed to arrive 10 mins before the timing. If i'm late, booking will be cancelled. Before i could reply ok, the phone was put down. Great Start!Took a taxi down. The building facade and lobby was way nicer than i expected it to be. Kudos on that. Once inside, i was once again treated to the same curt and gruff service by the front counter staff. Took my name and quickly told me to pay 900 baht for 2 pax Thai massage. No issues on the price. After that, was pointed to the couches and told to wait. As i am waiting, the lobby is full of customers. Customers are both arriving and leaving. Your name is then announced over a PA system when your masseuses are ready. You can imagine the noise since i already mentioned that theres so many customers. I am then ushered to a holding area, given slippers to change into and then made to follow masseuses to wait for 2 lifts to bring us up to our room. As we wait for the lifts, there are 4 other couples standing around us. Once lift arrives, we are then ushered into it and packed as many of us as the lift can take. At this stage, images of cattle herding springs right to mind.Rooms are clean and the actual massage was ok. Nothing mind-blowing but ok. That being said, masseuses are genuinely nice and caring.Overall experience was negative enough for me to not want to go back. Bottom line is that despite the physical place being really nice looking, i came to a massage spa to relax. If you have gruff and curt front line staff coupled with loud PA system announcements before i start my massages, then the massages better be fantastic enough to calm me down and make me want to go through all that again in a return visit. The problem is that the massages are extremely ordinary. You will find a similar standard at 90% of the mid range massage outlets in Bangkok. Which begs the question: Do i need to put myself through all this service rubbish? Verdict: Health Land Spa - Victim of its own success? Most definitely!

Better Solo Massages than Couple Massages. Health Land was recommended to us and we wanted something legit. We decided on a couples massage so we had a room to ourselves to be worked on. I was surprisingly underwhelmed by my massage, while my husband said it was really good. He was grinning from ear to ear, but then he never had a massage before so he had nothing to compare to. It is a very cheap massage 2hrs for 450 Baht aka $15USD. I don’t think I would complain because it was cheap for a reason.  We came back a second time, but this time I opted for a body polish and aromatherapy and my husband continued on his merry way with the traditional Thai massage. We went our separate ways, our own rooms, and I thoroughly enjoyed my session because of the individualized attention. My husband told me later the woman worked harder on his body than last time.  In the end, I think the massages are really good and at a really great price. I believe the couple massage was unsatisfying because they were trying to sync the timing between the us rather than focus on what the body really needs.

Not authentic Thai massage at a very reasonable price. The spa house is clean and spacious but the quality of massage is average. Even though their traditional Thai massage is 2 hours, the therapists are not providing the full scope of traditional Thai massage. This would be good for tourist who adventure Thai massage initially. But not for people who is looking for truely authentic Thai massage.

Consistent but commercialized. Health Land is one of the cleanest and most consistent spa and massage I have ever experienced, even the prices stay quite steady. I had the aromatherapy and Thai herbal massage which are both very good. What I missed is the more personal and hospitable service at the reception and unhurried style which a spa should have.Most Health Lands are very crowded and noisy these days, sometimes the customers come in bus loads. The final touche of a hot tea after the massage has also been compromised with luke warm normal tea on uncomfortable benches.That said, you would still need to make a reservation as they are always full, more so if you want a couple or family of 4 (max) room. Our family had so much fun massaging together in the same room.Btw, I learnt from the masseurs that they are paid 50-80 Baht per massage (depending on the type and duration of the massage). They can only take a maximum of 6 sessions because they would be so tired after that. So please remember to tip them generously if you are happy with their services.

Great massage by well trained massagists. We went to Health Land Asoke, after a friend's recommendation. We had such a great experience there that we repeated a second time a couple of days later. We had a traditional thai massage, and the masseuses were really good and at a very reasonable price (around 12 € for a 2h massage). They spoke very bad english but that was not a problem to communicate with them (the language of signs is international). I had a problem on one shoulder and the masseuse was very careful when giving the massage not to exert any force on that part. Me and my wife came out very relaxed and full of energy.

Poor service. Never will go again. WE bought coupons for this spa and indeed very poor service with the frontdesk staff, The staff has very bad attitude which is not very welcoming. We will never go back again and Please be reminded that dont buy any coupon as you will never be able to use it.

1 hour foot massage in 45 minutes. In addition to being brief, this was not as forceful or soothing as the foot massages I've had in northern Thailand and the beaches down south. And the little back/neck rub at the end was just plain painful. A factory feel to this place. About 30 La-Z-Boys arrayed in a big hall. Kinda weird. I heard the dude across the room snoring.

4 Star Spa at 2 Star Prices. I've been visiting Bangkok for many years but this is the first time I've heard of Health Land. Two friends recommended it this time and browsing through their website, we were intrigued. On our first attempt on a Saturday night, they were booked solid so we made reservations for the next evening. From the outside, it is impressive. Inside, it is busy. No tranquil atmosphere. If there was any spa music playing, it was drowned out by the loud voices of customers (mostly tourists) hanging around the main lobby. I chose the 2-hour Traditional Thai Massage and my companions had the 90-minute Oil Massage. Without much pomp and circumstance, we were ushered up in an elevator to the 8/F, into a clean room. My massage was exceptional and I was unkinked, as I hoped to be. My companions were also raving about their treatments. For the price, we were satisfied customers. This is a great place to get a good massage but not the right place if you are looking for pampering and tranquility.

OK experience for first Thai Massage. Our hotel listed Health Land as one of their recommended spas. They called and made reservations for us. The lobby was nice and impressive. Unfortunately, we had to wait 25 minutes to be seen even though we had reservations.This was our first time getting a Thai Massage and we didn't know what to expect. Yeah, I couldn't help but laugh when my 60 year old therapist contorted my body. She also choked me a few times, lol.I didn't like how our therapists watched tv DURING the massage. I mean, I know 2 hours is a long time, but damn. This wasn't a relaxing visit by any means, but I must say, we did feel great the next day.Overall, just an OK average experience. I can't complain much since the 2 hour Thai massage was only 450 baht per person.

Health land. If you see an Health Land spa and massage STOP (in Bkk there are at list 6 branches and 1 in Pattaya) ask before for a soft, hard or relax massage as per your need ! Open from 9 to 24 is the right place for a thai traditional or foot massage !!

2 hour thai massage with herbal compress!. I had a 2 hour Thai massage with herbal compress, and it was great. Very clean, very relaxing ambiance in the spa. They were professional. If I was in Bangkok for longer, I would have gone every day.

Excellent experience. Had a fantastic 250baht/60mins foot massage here. My masseuse had skillful hands and seemed to know exactly what she was doing. The centre was also impressive. It was very big, clean and modern looking. Only thing I didn't like was the freezing temperatures in the massive foot reflexology hall and the place being over-booked (we had to sit around for half an hour to get an available slot for our foot reflex). For some reason, the facial prices here are pretty ridiculous ($1500-$3000 baht). Stick to the awesome value for money foot massages here (which includes a short back and shoulder massage at the end of the session)

Perfect foot massage. How many hours we are on our feet daily? Yet we hardly take care them. Last week I just have a chance to treat myself with foot massage. The therapist started with long stroke, featherlike touch then proceeded to pressure points. It was very relaxing and also a treatment for ached muscles. I love the soothing music, cleanliness of the spa and & fresh air. I have been to other spas. They are double price of Health Land but less quality. For early bird like me they open at 9 am. Priceless experience.

good massage session.. I was scared of having bad experience in this parlor. glad it was good. Well, it does not have the spa like ambiance, it feels very commercialized shop. People going in and out. But all that didn't matter. cause i had a very good aroma (oil) massage. 800 bhat for two hrs. which was great value. They really worked my back good, i felt all relaxed and stress free. We had to make a reservation first, and we went late. so it was cancelled. we had to make new reservation. this was during a weekday. so it seems they are pretty busy all day long. they didn't have locker for my stuff. which is not nice, as i like my stuff to be in safe during my massage sessions.

Probably one of the best value for money. Had a massage there, not only the building looks impressive but the masseur we had myself and my friends were amazing...they treated our should and legs pain so we could be fresh again for sport...And this is very cheap, same as the crappy parlor all around asoke.A therapeutic 1hour massage will cost you 300baht. For 1000 you will have a 2 hour treat of oil massage, thai massage...As said in the title, great value for money!

Looks impressive but actually quite normal. The building, reception and massage rooms all look very impressive but the massage itself was only just above average. It was clean and not sleazy so look somewhere else if you are looking for anything but massage. Booked a 2 hour full body massage it ended much earlier. I guess they started the countdown timer the moment you left the reception and not when the masseur started. Would try somewhere else the next time.

Too busy. I tried to go here because I wanted to try a cheap spa, and my friend said this is a high quality spa with good prices. I must say the reception area is very impressive, maybe the reception area is bigger than most spas. Health Land is actually the same size like a hotel, and actually it is bigger than some hotels. The problem is that they are very very busy. When I went there, there were at least 30 people waiting in the reception area and they told me the next space for treatment was in 4 hours. I asked if I could make a booking for the evening but they told me they dont except bookings for the evening which I found a bit strange. I was going to try and book for another day but after checking my schedule the receptionist started chatting with another group and seemed to just ignore me and even though there were lots of reception people around, none of them asked me if I needed help. I gave up and went somewhere else.
AWesomely good. Reasonable price, professional service, clean, efficient, easy access from Asoke BTS station. Best massage place ever!
Painful foot massage. The masseuse should not have caused so much pain during my foot massage. I asked to take it easy, and she did improve.
2 hours Thai Massage. The location is very central. The whole environment is very clean and relax. The massage was good and value for money

Great massage experience. I did a thai traditional massage before but this was my first time doing it in Bangkok. Upon recommendation, 4 of us entered the grand entrance of Healthland Asoke.Receptionist service was extremely busy as it was a Fri night and we went without booking. We waited for 15 mins and was accompanied by our friendly masseurs to the room.The room was huge, clean and comfortable. Experience was made wonderful with friendly staff always with smiles. A 2h massage passed quickly and yes, we do feel refreshed to end off a whole day of shopping! Price was reasonable and yes, I highly recommend Healthland Asoke to everyone to BKK!Tips:Please get the address written in Thai by your hotel staff and then show itto taxi driver.Must book before hand if you are going on a weekend as it will be fully booked almost for all kinds of massage. Walk-in usually will lead to disappointment :(
Great Atmosphere. Great place for massage. The building is class of its own, and first time visitor will not believe it's a massage parlour. Price is decent too.

Neat, classy and located in many places. It is really classy, clean, large facility with various rooms and good service. If you are unable to come to this place in Asoke, they have many branches (at least six) located in many part of Bangkok. I think the prices are a little bit expensive but not that expensive when compared with other ordinary massage places. Two hour Thai massage is about 500 baht. It is better to make an appointment to avoid waiting. It offers a various range of services such as Thai massage, oil massage, foot massage etc. They have also package deal but looks to me expensive. It is up to the standard and you get the best value for your money.
Good Ambience, but pricey. Good 5-star ambience, but 450B for a 2-hr traditional Thai massage + a compulsory 100B tip is considered pricey to me.

Thai massage in a clean environment. Two hour Thai massage for 450 baht. This is a large facility with many rooms. But it is also popular so you will probably need to wait. We arrived at seven pm and were given s 1.5 hr wait time which proved to be accurate. You pay before the treatment. For the treatment you are given clothes to change into and then while lying in a thin mattress in the flood you are stretched, pulled, pressed and kneaded for the next two hours. It is quite the experience for someone who had never had Thai massage before. You are given a small cup with a refreshing drink after its all done. Very nice. In my experience the massage wasn't do much relaxing and such during the actual treatment but definitely felt revived and energized after. I was nervous I would be really sore the next day but wasn't. A couple of the other people I went with said their backs were somewhat sore the following day though.

Professional, clean & inexpensive. I love this place so much that I went there twice a week during my last visit to Bangkok. I love how you can take a shower in the massage room. Get an aromatherapy massage. Then, take a shower again to wash off excess oil. That leaves your skin smooth and your body & mind ready for the day/afternoon/night! All the staff are professional. I can usually get in right away. No reservation required. But it is always recommended to make a reservation during peak hours. Traffic could be hectic around this area. Easy way to get there (without being stuck in traffic) is to take either the BTS or MRT to Asoke station. Then, walk to the Soi (small street) behind Terminal 21. It's only a 5-minute walk if that. Their prices are pretty inexpensive compared to what you get. Next time I want to try a body scrub & aromatherapy massage combo!

Value for money. It's cheap, it's clean, it's good. It offers a simple range of service - thai massage, or oil massage or foot massage. It's certainly tourist standard and hygenic so very value for money vs other high end upmarket spas which can be over priced even by tourist standards. Buy a coupon of 10 if you are with a group of friends, so it's even cheaper.

Good place to use. This is a good place to use; you will get value for money. You can go there with confidence knowing that although this may not be a very fancy and opulent spa the service is dependable and the people polite and nice.

Don't leave Bangkok without your massage at Health Land Asoke. Health Land offers affordable massage and spa treatments.I guess the reason is that it is a chain which you may not request for the same masseuse if you like her service.Thus, I guess that you have to pray that the masseuse assigned to you is good at the service you require.Health Land Asoke is the newer branch under this chain.To my knowledge, Health Land branches are all located in colonial-looking houses.The rooms are cosy, clean and you may adjust the air-con temperature as well as the piped-in music accordingly to your preference.Prices range from 750THB for a 2hr Thai Massage with hot compress to THB875 for a 90min Aromatherapy Massage and the list goes on.Appointment, made a day or two earlier, is strongly recommended.Also, if you like the service rendered, do offer a tip as a token of your appreciation.Don't leave Bangkok without your massage (at Health Land Asoke)!

Good relaxing massage. Booked the 1.5 hours aromatherapy massage which is basically an oil massage. Cost 850 baht per person which is not the cheapest by Bangkok standards but it was well worth the money. The massage hit the right spots and put me in a relaxed state of mind. Together with my husband, we had a double room with attached shower. We were told to take a shower before the massage.Overall, it was very clean and rather posh - when you arrive, you register at a hotel-like reception area! The only downside is, it does feel like a massage factory with lots of people and masseuses going in and out. Both our masseuses waited around after they served us tea at the end of the massage and after we gave them each a small tip, they disappeared in a jiffy. Wow.

The best Bangkok has to offer !. Health Land offers a totally rejuvenating experience in massage therapy. Set in a purpose built building in the heart of Bangkok's CBD, Sukhumvit area, Health Land offers a variety of massage therapy from the humble foot reflexology to complex rejuvenation packages. I opted for what the Thais are famous for, the traditional Thai massage of course! The venue is nothing short off 6 star. Clean, classy and most of all professional. 2 hour session cost me 450 Baht. The setting itself is worth double the value !! Masseuses are well trained and delivered an awesome 2 hour cracking and twisting session for me. I left feeling great ! It was money well spent !! The only problem with this place is the availability. The economical rate coupled with the royal treatment makes it almost impossible to secure a session if you walk-in. I suggest that you make at least a day's booking in advance in order not to be disappointed. If there was a top 5 things to do in Bangkok, the Health Land Thai massage is definitely on top of the list !!

Value for money, Highly recommended. We booked a 2hr thai massage at the Asoke branch and it’s really cheap. We arrived 15mins earlier and the building is very grand. After ‘check in’, we waited for our turn at their big waiting lounge. The interior is grand looking too with 5 star kind of furnishing. Our masseuses led us to our private room for our massage at lvl8. The massage was good and they served us coconut tea after our massage.
Nice massage. It was very packed and we waited for 30 minutes. Had a full body massage and foot massage. It is very cheap
Be at least 15 mins early.. They are mostly packed. Advance booking for sure. If you can't be at least 15 mins early, better not go as it would be cancelled for next client.

Good value. This hotel is popular with tourist for cost effectiveness. The environment is clean, well appointed and good value.As this is a chain, exclusivity is not expected but expected level of service is not to disappoint.Asoke is supposed to be a small branch, but it is HUGE. like a massage factory.Just the next street perpendicular to Sukhumvit MRT/Asoke BTS.

Good massage in a clean place. I booked a two-hour Thai massage at Health Land (make reservations, they are quite busy) for 450 Baht, which is a great price. The place was recommended to me by Thai co-workers who go there themselves. Health Land is located in a colonial looking mansion and is organized very professionally. The massage was very good and thorough as my masseuse seemed to be very experienced abd the massage room was clean. The only downturn was that my masseuse turned on the TV after 1 hour of massage to watch some Thai TV show. She did turn it off after I asked her to, but it seemed inappropriate to watch a noisy show while trying to make a customer relax.
Great Thai Massage. Great Thai Massage for an amazing price.A beautiful place, we have been there twice for a 2 hours Thai massage! Best massage I have ever done!
Heaven on earth. 2 hour Thai massage for $15 USD. Fabulous! Very nice facility, clean, professional. Highly recommend on arrival in Bangkok.
Worth every penny!!!. Very nice place, great atmosphere and decoration. More likely a five start hotel, good service and professional. It costs only 400 for 2 hr. Thai massage. Highly recommend!!!
Excellent!!. One of the best traditional thai massages I had in BKK. Best part is... it wasnt too expensive.

Good for a midday break if you're in the area. Visited the Asoke branch with my partner in the middle of a weekday. We were attended to promptly and only had to wait about 5 mins for our room and masseuse to be allocated. The ladies who carried out our aroma oil massage were efficient and polite, and the technique they applied was fairly good and even. We were also quite impressed with the set-up of the couple's room - large and comfortable; air-conditioned without being too cold; the shower area was also large enough for two persons to use, without having to wait for each other. Overall, it was a positive experience, and not bad for a first-time Health Land customer. However, our experience at the Sathorn branch the very next day left a lot to be desired (you can look up my review for that outlet). Based on other reviews here, it seems that the quality of massage at Health Land is a bit hit and miss, and based a lot on which masseuse you're assigned, so adjust your expectations accordingly. As such, I would only recommend that you try this chain out if you happen to be near an outlet and have some time to kill.

Relaxing treat for the tired feet. Bangkok’s heat and high humidity cause my feet and legs to swell. When my legs are killing me I go to the Health Land Asoke, just 10-15 mins by foot from the Terminal 21 and Asoke BTS. Luckily foot massage does not require the prior booking. Upon arrival I am always nicely greeted by the supervisor who fills out the order slip, accepts the payment and kindly asks me to take a seat in the lobby. Usually it takes 5 mins for my name to be called out, but in case if there is a queue, then the supervisor will advise the approximately waiting time. The foot massage costs 250 Bahts (~6 EUR or 8 USD) and lasts 60 mins.When my name is called out I meet my masseur, usually a lady, but I have seen also men working there. She greets me with a bow and escorts to the basement to change my shoes for comfortable slippers and my skirt to cotton pants. The massage room is big enough to accommodate quite many clients. In Health Land the massage room is thoughtfully designed to turn the open space massage experience into the discrete and private care. The lamps produce a very warm soft light. The shadowy interior, the luxurious chair and the calm, relaxing music helps to breathe easily and take the most of time-out. Before massage the masseur washes my feet, and then she helps me to get more comfortable in the chair. My arms and body covered by towels for even better, deeper relaxation. The masseur uses essential oil and begins to massage from the feet up to the knees, and upper legs. She gently and strongly presses the points, she rubs my legs to better the blood circulation, she heavenly massage each and every toe of my foot. The sensational feelings I experience are very intense and relaxing. At the end the masseur massages my arms, hands, back, shoulders and head. The treatment ends with a cup of deliciously brewed chrysanthemum tea. After 60 mins of such a wonderful care I feel great, my feet are barely touching the ground because I am flying. My mind, body and soul are rejuvenated. My husband and sons say that I even look 10 years younger. This is a fantastic value for money – for 250 Bahts I get rid of tension, fatigue, pain, aches and swollenness. Before leaving I tip the masseur (between 40-60 Bahts), because thanks to her little, strong and magical hands my tired feet get the relaxing treat.

They treat you like they don't want you there !!!. The customer service person made a mockery of the term "customer" and "service".Because we did not fully understand her Thai accented English she showed disapproval by shaking her head, rolling her eyes and making us feel really silly.We know that their prices are good and that that they are always busy but if they really did not welcome our business then don't engage with us at all.
Great Thai massage. Liked there massage was very refreshing ,very reasonable price did two hour massage paid only 450 baht.It was very clean and lobby was very impressive . Will visit again.

Foot Reflexology is real good after long shopping. Health Land Spa has many type of services: Aromatherapy Body Massage,Traditional Thai Massage, Therapeutic Massage, Foot Reflexology, Body Polish, Facial Treatment. Recommend for advance reservation especially during evening and weekend as there are lots of customer otherwise you might have to wait at the lobby for an hour.I had 1 hour foot reflexology (@250 THB) after a long shopping day from Jatuchak market (Weekend market). It feel really good as you can relax your feet and mind. I even slept during the massage.The environment is nice. they open light music in the area which help me relaxing my mind.If you go in a big group, you can buy a voucher at 3,000 THB which value for 10 times of 2hrs Thai massage (value 4,500 THB).

One of the biggest spa's in Bangkok and Thailand. Health Land has several branches across Bangkok and even one in Pattaya.They are always located in very big, colonial-looking buildings. The massage has most of the times been okay, however, there are so many different masseuses working there, that the quality of the massage depends strongly on the masseuse you get each time. So once you've got a good one, try to ask for her number or name, then you can book her next time you go there.The large number of masseuses is only a reflection of the size of the spa. The buildings are huge with several floors. But because it's so huge, you don't really get the relaxed, private, zen feeling. To me it feels actually more like being in a hospital then a spa. Upon arrival you have to chose the therapy you want and there is not always staff to explain the different items on the menu. No problem if you are a local and come there many times, but for first time visitors a bit frustrating. Usually they give you a flyer and you have to choose from that.After choosing and paying, you have to wait until a masseuse is available. This usually takes 10-20minutes. There is a large waiting room with sofa's and some magazines and water.Once in the room, it gets a bit more zen, with nice, clean rooms. Nothing fancy design-wise, just typical spa room with a shower.I usually take either aroma therapy or Thai massage. Price for 1h30 aroma therapy is 850THB. The price for 2hrs Thai massage is 450THB.If you just want a quick massage, without the feeling zen and relaxing atmosphere, Health Land is ok at a reasonable value for money.However, for a real total, relaxing spa experience, there are better alternatives, which not make you feel like a number and with a much more personal approach.

Not a spa... Just a factory. I went to the Asoke branch today with my girlfriend. I found the atmosphere was terrible. It was huge, it was packed and people were just being processed like on a plant production line without much care. Our room was nice and clean but very noisy. Our masseuses just below average. I would not recommend this place.

Relaxing experience. The message is very good and relaxing. It really recharged my extreme tired body. Oasis service does concern your own preference. I still miss their service after going back home. I cannot have the same experience here at home town. Certainly will come back next time while travelling to Bangkok

Wonderful always. It's my third time visit there and the oil massage is definitely wonderful as usual,and they still offer the promotion price for 90 min around 2,000 thb. I went to the one at sukhumvit soi 31 by taxi, it's a little bit deep into the lane if you are not sure about the location pls call the receptionist and let them tell the driver. Usually a free shuttle bus is available between BTS phrongphrom station and oasis, make sure you book it on the phone with the receptionist forehead and if they can't arrange you the shuttle bus then they will pay for the taxi fee( just between phrongphrom station and oasis).

90 minutes of bliss.. Our hotel suggested this spa and I am so glad they did! Pick-up and drop-off service was provided in a comfy SUV. The welcome drink and towel were refreshing, and the fruits and tea after the services were a nice touch. Of course, the massage itself was AMAZING! I feel terrible because I don't recall the name of my masseuse, but she was just wonderful. I was so relaxed for the rest of the day.

It was a bad experience. Spa by itself seems to be very nice, thought we were late evening and didn't see the full place and decoration. From the subway or nearby hotels they offer car to get u there. I ordered aromatherapy spa for 1,5 hours and we asked experienced therapist. Unfortunately the girl was not attentive at all, she didn't bring any pain relief, she didnt pay attention to the places I asked during massage (( she stepped by her knee or ankle on my ear(!), she draw out some hair (!) - it was one of the worst experiences of massage in my life. Be attentive what specialist will make massage for you.

Impeccable, Wonderful, Enjoyable. We had "Paradise of Oasis" treatment. It's incredibly amazing. We heartily recommend visitors to enjoy the the ultimate Thai treatment. You totally deserve the indulgence and pampering moment after exhausting working life. The greatest part is, the price is affordable and reasonable!
relaxing to the max. Excellent service, great massage and lovely ambiance. If you want a more top end spa, go to Oasis Spa. It is a delight in the hussle and bustle of Bangkok.
Great treatment and service.. It was a great treatment and service. I will try other treatment again next time and introduce Oasis Spa to others.

Good spa, good service. I would like to go oasis spa for body treatment if I go for holiday in Bangkok. This is the third time I went there. I love the service, the massage in here! It makes me feel really relax and enjoyable! Must go if u want to have a spa in Bangkok! Suggestion : U can take the free shuttle from the BTS station to oasis spa since it is a little far.

Great spa in bangkok. I have enjoyed several top spa in bangkok, I found that Oasis is the best among them.Good and clean area, polite and refined staff, skillful and talented masseuse which make me feel totally relax throughout the body which make me go here every time for every trip.
2nd Visit to Oasia Spa. This is our second visit within 5 months. The service is perfect and I would recommend to people who would like a good message and Spa.

Revisit of Oasis Spa. This is our second visit since March 2016. As usual the service is good and the touch is just right.We have had Oasis Pampering programme. I would highly recommend Oasis Spa to those who love SPA or message. Worth giving it a try.

Very nice service. Free transportation between BTS station and the Spa was provided. The driver was very nice and polite. The staffs at the Spa were all very friendly and helpful. The massage room was cozy and of course, the massage was really nice. Highly recommended!

just relax.... I had a very good experience (many bad before as well) with them. My choice was gold lana massage with four hands for 2 hours. afterwards I felt like I am light as a fur and felt amazing. Very clean, very experienced therapists. and a good location as well. Prices are normal I must say but don't expect a very cheap price as well. They deserve what they ask
Great service. accommodated to our request though we've mistakenly booked at the wrong branch. Great service staff.

A Spa that I'll definitely Return. Great customer service and car pick up. Professionally trained therapists with attentive service. Stylish and clean deco. The best spa experience I have. Will definitely return.

Excellent Service. Visited this place as my wife who is pregnant is in need of a prenatal massage. I did not gp for the massage. There is a nice waiting area(room) for you to enjoy free wifi and tea/water. The staffs here are all well versed in English so communication is not a problem. Staffs here are all pleasant and helpful. Waiting area has a charging outlets for your handphone, and they even lent you their chargers! Worth the trip here even though it is probably 20minutes away from Asok BTS. Travellers should take a cab down.

Beautiful place where you can get great massage. Visited with my wife, it was a bit of walk from BTS station, but still very pretty place for a Spa in a city centre.Massage and overall service was very pleasant as well.

No Male Therapists?!. I had a special 4.5 hour package last year as a gift from my friend - I know this was expensive and I really appreciated the generosity and the thought of being pampered for half a day.Although the location is good, relaxing and tranquil, I was surprised that they do not offer Male Therapists. For such an expensive and "professional" spa, they only have female.The lady was very sweet and she did do a good job. But I just do not like to be touched by a lady as I feel uncomfortable - this is not sexist or sexual, its just a personal preference to have a male therapist.I was really surprised that my friend got me ANOTHER package as a gift - being one year later, I was hoping they had got some male therapists. On their websites FAQ it even says "Do you have male therapists" as one of the FAQ's, so as a frequent request one would assume that this company would invest in a male therapist to float between the two locations in Bangkok - But no, they have ONE male therapist in Phuket only?!With 1,000's of massage spa's on Bangkok alone that 99% offer a male therapist, its very disappointing that this place cannot do the same, however its not a problem as I will go to a competitor that can cater for my request instead.

Really nice spa.... We took the 90 min warm oil massage with a promotion price of THB1,699++ each. The shop in Sukhumvit 31 was really nice and relaxing. Everything was really good and we were very satisfied with the treatment. The therapists were experienced and the service was excellent overall. Highly recommended and we'll come back for sure!!
Good for Relax. We wait 40 minutes because the previous customer have not finished. They apology for this and give a gift to us.
