Great experience!. From the moment you enter until you leave the spa you're really well looked after. Staff there are extremely pleasant, friendly and professional. Would definitely recommend this place and would definitely recommend.

Gorgeous and serene setting. We had a couples massage in a spacious room which was clean, comfortable and peaceful. The outdoor showers are a treat!The treatment itself was wonderful! The ladies take great care to make sure the massage is the right pressure and that you are comfortable. All the staff are exceedingly professional and warm.I suggest enjoying a cool drink by the decorative pool before leaving.Also note there is a shuttle to trains, both lines are easily accessible.

everybody so kind :D. Before i went to bangkok, i searched Oasis Spa.When I was arrive at the shop, all of the member very very kind : )and massage also great !in my opnion.. the price a little bit expansive... :DIf i have a trip agian, I'll revisit :)

Just wonderful and relaxing experience- my 3rd visit. I have visited Oasis Spa now 3 times- in 2009,2010 and again this year. It is a beautiful setting. The staff are excellent, very polite and make you feel very welcome. I enjoyed the 2.5 hour oasis pampering package- a honey and sesame scrub, swedish oil massage and a facial (my skin felt incredible afterwards) I love how the shower you take after the scrub is outside! They organise a car to drive you where you want to go later which is also great. It is very very good value for money. I always recommend Oasis spa to friends who are visiting and will continue to do so. I'll be back!

Nice environment but not a must go. My guy and I tried the 4 hours Oasis Experience at THB5,700++ with THB500 discount each. I can say it is money worth as it includes couple of things, steam, bath, 4 hands massage, scrub, body wrab and facial.What goes wrong is the 4 hands massage, the pressure is different between the left and right side, it will keep your brain busy thinking that's a bad choice taking the 4 hands massage.One slight matter is the room or the products didn't carry spa smell, a medium helps to relax. When you take a deep breath, you can only get a normal air smell.Oversall it is a so so experience, I didnt have the urge for my next visit.

Special Experience - Shirodhara Massage. This is my first time to do the Shirodhara Massage and Oasis spa give me a good experience for that. Dripping of warm oil on the forehead and a thorough scalp massage, really relaxing. If Ayurveda Package become to 2.5 - 3hours is better.

The best massage that I have ever had!!. The environment was a relaxing one. The rhythm for both ladies who helped me was very consistent and match with each other. It was indeed an unforgettable experience.

Authentic Experience. Oasis Spa in Bangkok is one of the most authentic places for health and wellness treatments and massages. This spa is a bit on the expensive side, but the experience is totally worth it. The ambiance, quality of staff is excellent and also this spa provides an exhaustive range of treatments. As per my experience the 120 mins authentic Thai massage is a must try.
Oil Massage. Definitely one of the best spas I've ever visited! I would highly reccomend Oasis Spa to everyone who visits Bangkok!

Unexpected experience in Oasis. I’m a frequent visitor from Hong Kong to Thailand and have so many experiences in different spa in Bangkok. I truly receive an unexpected experience from Oasis in my trip in June 2016, specially the tender and mindful treatment from the masseuse. Definitely I will visit Oasis again during my next vacation to Thailand.

Serene Oasis in the middle of a big city. When in Bangkok and you want a superb spa experience, a visit to Oasis Spa at Soi 31 Sukhumvit is highly recommended. Wide range of treatments to suit everyone. Extremely polite and courteous staff, who will guide the first timer well on what to choose. The therapists are highly trained and equally courteous. But the management should really invest in teaching them English as well, as they only speak a few stock sentences of English and if you wish to convey something to them beyond the regimen, it is next to impossible
Amazing experience. absolutely loved getting pampered at OASIS spa last week. The staff were absolutely delightful and helpful

Exceptional massage, beautiful facilities, and a great value. My wife and I enjoyed massages at the Oasis Spa on a recent visit to Bangkok. Both of our massages were exceptional. The spa was very clean and well decorated, the staff was extremely attentive, and the services exceeded our expectations in every way. With so many spas to choose from, it's often difficult to differentiate one spa from another. The Oasis Spa stands well above the competition. Schedule an appointment on your next visit to Bangkok. You will not be disappointed!
Very good!. Amazing experience- great service from arrival to departure and beautiful location. Not cheap but great value all things considered
awesome!. We just had an amazing massage with coconuts and mango.Fantastic time :-) now it's super smooth skin. We definitely go back again!

fabulous retreat from the city. Oasis was exactly that, an Oasis, from the moment the driver picked me up at the BTS station it was wonderful. The staff was so polite and made my relaxation their priority. I did the Oasis Experience and booked it on line for a discounted price. The 25% wasn't available but morning appointments still get 20% off for booking on line and 10% for afternoon appointments. The spa itself is lovely, you have your own treatment room and the same therapist stayed with me for the entire 4 hours, another therapist came in for the 4 hands massage. The therapists seemed very knowledgeable and they were very good at asking if everything was to my liking. I would highly recommend this spa and it was very reasonably priced. I want to try their second location before I leave Bangkok just so I can experience it again.

Great value. I went here for a couples massage today with my wife. It was terrific. I had a 2.5 hour package for the same price as what I paid for yesterday for 1 hour at the Mandarin Oriental. The massage was 2.5 times longer and I had a whole body scrub and facial thrown in. The facilities were just as nice - a little out of the way, but well worth it. Online I think you can save 20% but I booked it through the concierge.

Heaven!. Was in Bangkok on holiday with friends. My friend found this spa after much research. We both booked in for the Oasis Experience - 4hours of bliss.We each got a private room with outdoor bathroom which included a huge round soaking tub, rain shower and steam room.Best spa treatment I have ever had. Treatment included Thai steam, exfoliation, red clay body wrap, aromatherapy bath, 2 therapist massage and facial. Afterwards the spa booked us a private car to go back to our hotel. Wonderfully refreshing and relaxing. Highly recommend.

Amazing experience. This was my first time to Bangkok and the oasis spa was recommended by my hotel. I booked a four hour half day experience that included a steam, exfoliating treatment,mud wrap, milk, four hand massage, and facial.The spot arrange for my transportation from my hotel and from the moment I arrived on site met with the most gracious service imaginable and this till my departure.The service was extraordinary and the treatments were amazing. My every need was attended to from fruit during my milk bath to ice water during my steam. The entire experience was simply bliss. I would recommend this to anyone

Great facility -beautiful rooms . Visited the Oasis #31 which was a beautiful and serene property. We were greeted at the door and they even reimbursed our taxi fare cost from JW Marriott. We received ginger tea and a cold towel while they went over what treatments we had scheduled. The rooms were nice-a semi-outdoor shower and toilet. I had the King Oasis treatment ( 2 hours ) and it was FABULOUS! Highly suggest that you book online as they provide a nice discount ifyou book between certain hours. Didn't realize this but they are also in other Thailand cities like Phuket, Pattaya and Chiang Mai. Great SPA!!

Blissful n relaxing!!!. The search for the best massage experience was finally over ...having tried so many places in Hong Kong ,Bali n Krabi..this was it !! The therapist were well trained. We opted for 2.5hrs package and from the beginning till the end it was surreal! Definitely worth it!!

Heaven for 4 hours!. I can't rave highly enough about Oasis Spa, I spent 4 hours there on the weekend having the best time. From the initial greeting from a charming young man who was just lovely, right through to the end when a car took me to my next destination, it was a total treat. I had a 20 minute herbal steam sauna to start, then a body scrub, a body wrap, a spa bath, a 4 handed massage, and a facial. Wow, I was so impressed with the whole thing. It was very good value for 4 hours, I would never get that in Australia. Go, you will love it.

A truly relaxing experience. From the booking until the after massage tea, everything was absolutely perfect.Personalized welcome with a nice tea, short interview about types of massages we like, and health condition, contributed to make us very comfortable.The treatment room was absolutely perfect, clean, fresh, and we were provided with all necessary amenities. The treatment itself lasted two hours, during which we were feeling quite relaxed.Overall, a great experience, with high quality service that make us forget about the bill. Highly recommended.
Luxury spa !!. I visited this spa many times and always feel relax.Everything is great, I definitely recommend this spa to anyone!!
Day at the spa. Perfect day to spend in Bangkok massageThis place is amazing so many rooms people are very friendly massage was great great selections to have

Acceptable . I asked my hotel for the most famous massage so in Bangkok and they recommend oasis massage for me , the place takes me from Siam about 20 minutes by taxi with my wife , it's very clean and very classy and the decoration is very nice but the massage you find like it in all Bangkok , the price for both of us for 90 minutes coast 200 dollar witch is very expensive

Treat yourself . I don't have a lot of experience with spas - the odd massage or facial every other year or so - so decided to treat myself to the 4 hour paradise of oasis package while taking a long weekend in bangkok. So glad I did! It was amazing from the lemongrass steam to the cucumber infused facial at the end. Property was serene and room was simple but clean and and inviting. I left feeling refreshed and pampered and would highly recommend to anyone. Cost was totally reasonable - especially if you are used to prices in the west.

Best spa in BKK. Very clean and beautiful view, kind people make me my day! A little bit pricy than other spa places, but it is worth every single Baht. Definitely wanna visit again if I visit Bangkok again. :)

best 2 hours in Asia. My husband and I have just returned from a 2 hour massage - King of Oasis and Queen of Oasis....we now feel like a King and Queen! This is not our first time to The Oasis Spa in Bangkok, and it certainly will not be our last. The atmosphere is beautiful, calm and relaxing. From the moment you arrive, you know that this is not just a run of the mill experience. Firstly, you are presented with chilled hand towels to refresh yourself, followed by a lovely cup of chilled tea, served in beautiful china cups. Then, you fill out a very detailed health form, so that the therapists can treat you accordingly. The receptionist spoke very good english and, as we had already filled out the forms with specific information; for instance, my husband has arthritis in his hands and so he requested that "his hands not be touched"; she did not forget and she never touched his hands. We then changed into the packaged intimates and went onto the massage tables, which were covered in clean, white, cotton linens, as well as some orchid blossoms. Both of our masseuses, understood and spoke some english, and regularly asked if the pressure was ok for us. After our massages, we took showers (we chose to shower together, as the shower in the double massage room is extremely large and had dual controls and shower heads). There is a wardrobe to store your clothes and bags during your treatment, and another lockable safe to store your valuables.We then filled out our assessment of our treatment and enjoyed another cup of tea, this time, hot tea, and again, served in beautiful china cups.You would be hard pressed to find a better and more luxurious spa treatment, not just in Bangkok, but virtually anywhere in the world....indulge yourself - you deserve it!

If you only have one day in Bangkok..... ... spend a few hours here. Enjoy gracious Thai culture and tradition while you also enjoy a massage or other treatment from a skilled professional. Lovely site, scrupulously clean, this may just be the best spa in Bangkok. Recommended for luxury travelers and also budget travelers ready for a bit of a splurge. My feet are still talking, reverently, about the reflexology massage and I will be returning to this tranquil refuge every time I am lucky enough to be in Thailand. Reachable by taxi.
Quality. Great environment with nice & professional services. It is worthy to spend time there. Will visit it againg.

refresh and relax. nice atmosphere, good quality and fair price. the staff greet and briefly explained the booked treatment before escort us to the room. the room is nicely decorated and each room is with an outdoor shower. the staff is very professional and you can really relax there. car can be arrange for send off after treatment for free.
Very relaxing massage. Went there 2 times during my visit in Bangkok. Although the rooms were a little bit old, the technique of the therapist were well.
Real refresh. The oasis spa was the most enjoyable place for me during my bangkok trip. I will definitely visit it again.

Great spa!. Booked oasis pampering for me and my companion. Excellent service and the massage treatment was great! They offer pick up service from phrom pong bts. Booked on line for extra discount. Always a pleasure to wind down and relax at this spa!

Best Spa 👌. An excellent & relaxing spa atmosphere in Bangkok city. Staff are all friendly & well mannered . I enjoyed 3 continuously visits & absolutely being pampered with their 5 star service from beginning to end. I extremely enjoyed the spa service n will definitely come back again when I m in Bangkok.

Great but expensive. This shop serves the great massage. But the price is double. Anyway this shop has a best facility and professional staff. If you are at Phrom Phong or Asok BTS Staion, you can use the shuttle of Oasis Spa. So you must check it available.

Free shuttle to hotel after spa. I tried a 4 hand massage (one hour) with my mother. We both very enjoy the treatment. The massagists are so professional and all staffs are well-trained. They treat every customers as VIPs with very friendly smile and professional services. The environment itself is enjoyable. We have been arranged to a private room with bathroom and bathtub but we didn't use it because of limitation of time. The oil used on my body smells very good and is not very oily after the spa. The price is high but worths, online payment has discount. I will recommend to my friends.

Beautiful Spa!. Everything about this spa is what people say. It's in the middle of the city, but nice and quiet and relaxing. The staff is polite, helpful, and professional. I did not have an appointment and I was seen right away. The spa is what one would see at a luxury hotel or resort. Inside the massage room is an area to shower outside. So relaxing and wonderful! Of all the massages I had in Bangkok, I would say this one was just okay. For instance, every other masseuse knew about my back pain without me having to say anything, and they concentrated on that area. However, my masseuse didn't seem aware and kept asking, "which area?" It was okay, just different from the other places. All in all, I got a great two-hour spa service for 2K Baht (expensive spa prices), but I enjoyed myself greatly and I would go back if I have the chance.

Excellent. Staff are friendly and experience. They all look the part and play the part. The SPA is so good and the standard of service are even much better than the 5 star hotel. I would highly recommend the OASIS SPA to my friends and spread the words around.

Nightmare at oasis spa. I visited oasis spa sukhumvit 31 in anticipation for the massage. Facilities are great, but massage was really horrible. I chose 'shirodhara massage' which uses warm oil. Masseuse poured a few drops of oil onto my forehead continuously, and it was too hot! I told to the masseuse more than 2 times, but she just said "sorry" to me and the oil was still hot. After all I felt like I'm almost burned, so stopped the massage, and got out of the room. The staff says "Few customers reacted like you. Originally this massage uses warm oil. Your skin is sensetive." Oasis spa keep saying their massage hasn't any problem! I escaped from the spa and searched everywhere to buy burn oinment. So impressive experience in oasis spa, and never visit there again. What a nightmare. Highly unrecommended!
Just Excellent!. how can I explain how I love that place! so exotic and kindly service. If I go to bangkok, absolutely I go to Oasis spa!
Great spa experience. Excellent service, very good facilities, overall a very good experience. I would recommend it to everyone.

Lovely Spa!. Beautiful spa. Wonderful and friendly service. They will make you feel welcome and pampered. My boyfriend and I got the hot oil aromatherapy massage and it was so relaxing. If you are looking to unwind while in Bangkok, definitely come here. You won't be disappointed.
Another unseen Bangkok. Feeling great after a long flight from the US. Both atmosphere and the spa experience were wonderful. I will definitely go back again before my flight back home.
The IT spa experience. A 7 star spa in all aspects. You feel the hospitality from the moment you enter till you leave. Highly recommend. Will be a Bangkok ritual.
Joy. Excellent!! Terrific place ,wonderful circumstance, and perfect service and spa massage. I'll go there next time when I travel in Bangkok.

A Luxurious Spa Day. We went to the Oasis Spa on a recommendation from our hotel, we had been to some of the budget massage places but wanted to try a luxury spa. The entire experience was top notch beginning as soon as we walked in the door. Everything smelled fresh and wonderful, we were given cool towels and delicious beverages while we filled out the very thorough paperwork. We had a couples room which was elegant and clean, it was upstairs and we walked through a lovely courtyard to get there. Our entire treatment lasted around 3 hours and was the most relaxing experience and everything was very professional. This seems to be a very popular spa, there even appeared to be a celebrity of someone of royalty there that day, or perhaps a photo shoot of some sort as there were what looked to be security and cameras all around. The spa was an excellent choice and I would certainly recommend it and go back myself.

A sublime experience. I have been to many spas around the world and this has got to be one of the absolute favorites. From the moment you enter the spa, you feel a sense of relaxation. The reception is simple and elegant with light music in the background. A delicious cup of mint green tea is served on a tray with a stunning orchid...ok I'm giving away far too much detail...you have to experience this for yourself. I had the hot oil head massage and a full body massage. Two hours of complete relaxation and pampering. The attention to detail in the spa is astounding. The outdoor shower amongst green foliage continues to tantalize the sense. Delicious essence of shower gel and shampoo. There's a little box with all the simple grooming amenities you would need which I just loved...and your masseuse brings you a hair dryer. Fabulous!!!!!

Nice memory from the Oasis. It was really great even it was expensive a little.I went to the Oasis before leaving Bangkok so I was almost exhausted from my business trip for 5 days. However, I relaxed and enjoyed spa program. All staffs are kind and tried to make me feel good.I hope to go to the Oasis soon!

Look no further for the best massage in Bangkok. My partner and I went to The Oasis Spa today and from the moment we walked in everything was fabulous - very professional. We had the 2.5hr Oasis Pampering package and it was divine. A body scrub with cereal and honey which was amazing, relaxing hot oil massage and incredible cucumber facial. I have been to my fair share of spas in Asia and I have to say this spa was up there with the best. The staff all speak English very well. We were offered a free shuttle to the BTS after our treatment which is great because it is quite a walk! Cannot recommend this place high enough!
Fantastic. Beautiful place, friendly staff, excellent professional masseuse.I loved it... unforgettable experience

Delightful, VIP treatment. The ladies at Oasis Spa have maximized comfort and relaxation with gorgeous, clean and spacious rooms complete with outdoor showers! Range of selection for every taste. Excellent service.

Relaxing Afternoon. Very good reception, detail description. I can only afford the cheapest one (I am a poor guy), but it is so good. Private Room with washroom, professional massage, nice environment, Next time save more money and enjoy once again.

Perfect beginning and ending of our visit. Went the first day of our visit to Bangkok and the long flight was immediately forgotten. Went the last day and the long flight home was that much easier. Friendly welcome. Quiet, serene and very clean premises. Personalised massage (even for someone with lots of back problems) that was more restful than sleep. Accept their offer and let yourself be picked up at, and taken back to, the skytrain station. The distance is walkable, but the chauffered card just adds to the pampering experience.

A great treatment. I booked the Oasis experience in advance for the next morning after I arrive to Bangkok. This series package includes of treatments in a private area which included everything necessary - a steam room, shower, hot tub, and massage tables.My visit started from a steam followed by a scrub, hot tub, massage and facial. The four hands massage was the best part of the visit but the rest was worth the money as well. The staff was welcoming from start to finish and also provided me a ride to the nearest BTS station.

great time. Always a great time going there. visited them twice till now. friendly and experienced staff. maintain a good hygiene. the best thing that they accept bbx and bartercard so anyone has bbx or bartercard its a great place to use them in bangkok. they also pick u up from hotel and drop you back.
Great experience!!. overall is very good, start from security, receptionists, then impressive with king of oasis treatment until end. I"d recommend to couples.
Ubuntu nu. Really relaxation and good experience of massage. Very high quality. Perfect and Excellent service mind.
Calm, relaxing, ambient and clean!. Bought the "Oasis pampering" package for friends of mine who were on their honeymoon. They were super happy and pleased with everything.

One of the best Spa experience!. 4 of us booked our 2-hour treatments online 2 days ago for 8pm (they close 10pm). unfortunately there was car bomb at that night and we were stuck in the traffic and ended up arriving the spa 9:15pm.The staff made fast arrangements and was so nice that they offered us a 1.5 hours treatment, which means an overtime of 1 hour for their staff! The environment is peaceful. The rooms are clean and comfortable with a well maintained outdoor shower area/toilet. Staff are polite with good skills. We had a good evening and will definitely come back.
very recommendable. Exotic, serene and beautiful facility they have. The most important thing is the massage therapist was so kind and skilled.
excellent service. excellent everything. and very organized routine. the two staff with me and my friend can almost sync their start and end time for each step! perfect!

De-stress, and unwind at Oasis. We took a full day package which included a hair spa, body scrub, body wrap, signature massage, and a Thai facial. We spent around 7 hours in the spa, 6 of which were spent on various treatments, We were also served a light lunch, and endless cups of herbal tea. The spa management was very courteous and helpful. They also gave our friend who was celebrating her birthday a gift - three of their yummy body lotions. The masseuse was professional and experienced. The rooms were clean and private. Overall, a relaxing, indulgent experience.
Great Spa & Great Service. The Oasis Spa at BANGKOK is a great spa with beautiful ambiance & set up located right in the heart of Bangkok.I would recommend this Spa to visitors.

Flawless spa experience. Having visited many spas in BKK I must say this is one of my favorite. Beautiful garden and treatment rooms, very professional service, and a great massage. Simply perfect. You truly feel like in an oasis in bkk.
Excellent Massage. My second visit to the Oasis Spa. Lovely service. Staff are very courteous and attentive (as always). Love it! Will be back again soon,
Unforgettable Spa experience. Excellent! All of things are really GOOD! Service and environment are really good! I must come back to Oasis spa when i go to Thailand!

all that glitters..... I had a great spa experience when I visited two years ago and have been looking forward to revisiting the Oasis during this brief visit to Bangkok. A friend came with me full of anticipation for a beautiful and deeply relaxing afternoon. We booked the longest massage on the menu - five hours. We felt tired, jet lagged and very much in need of a peaceful time. At the beginning all was as I remembered and as it should be - forms filled and lovely tea presented... but I felt things went pear-shaped the moment we were shown to our room. Coming in from the heat outside we were instructed to get in to the steam room and stay there for 30 minutes - then followed a complicated series of procedures including a scrub, a wrap, five showers in chilly water and a bath. This sounds fine but we were left for long periods of time and every procedure felt it was being conducted in a perfunctory and half-hearted way. When we were told to get into the bath the women said they'd be back in 30 min... having been already left for various periods of time and feeling waterlogged, I said 'that's too long' as 10min in the bath would be quite sufficient. But we weren't the ones calling the shots. At the end of that period of 30 min we were told to have another shower - crazy. Finally, three hours after we'd arrived, the massage began and aspects of it were good but there were several unexplained absences from the room and pauses and I felt the masseuse couldn't really be bothered with what she was doing which is a terrible thing to feel when one is paying $757NZD for two. As nothing was prepared prior to our entrance to the room, there seemed to be constant laundering and running of taps right behind my head. We both sensed our masseuses watching the clock waiting until they could leave and get on with their day. Something weird happened to my foot during the massage and I found I could hardly put any weight on it when I stepped down from the massage table. It was excruciating. No attention was paid to my discomfort. We paid, left and felt bewildered.

Relaxing day. Good atmosphere and service. Free transport going to BTS after treatment. Make sure you book the car during your reservation or you'll keep sweating when you go to there on foot, espectially in a hot summer day.

Great Looks, Poor Value. Like many other things in Bangkok, paying top dollar does not always ensure top quality. This lovely spa hits all the right notes as to image: beautiful garden, very clean, well decorated rooms, friendly staff. The website is stellar. The location is good. The other Tripadvisor reviews are very convincing. Where it is massively disappointing- and I say that only because you can get exceptional massages in Bangkok for a fraction of the price- is in the actual SPA treatments, which should really be the star of the show. I had the Lanna experience and had a mediocre scrub, a less than average massage and a poor facial. Not once was I asked what skin type I have or what aromatherapy oils I prefer. However, I was reminded about 5 or 6 times that I must change treatment rooms because I presume one of the steam rooms was out of order and there were other people wanting the same treatment. Maybe I just got the trainee, but it does jar. The polyester satin robes I would lose, very fast. An honest opinion? I would say save your money, go and have an out of this world massage at Wat Po. Then again, if you adore open air showers, rituals, prettily arranged towels and free fruit skewers, this is the place for you.

First time in Bangkok, excellent massage experience!. My partner's Mother treated me to a 4-hand massage here for my birthday. I've never been massaged by 2 people at once, and it was an amazing experience. I also got to share the massage room with my partner (we are a gay male couple and were treated wonderfully) while he got his massage. The spa was very clean. The staff was professional and courteous. I loved the tea and infused-washcloths before our treatments, and the tea afterwards. You can easily get cheaper massages at the numerous storefronts everywhere in Bangkok, but if you want a true spa experience, I highly recommend this place.

Much needed relaxation!. Anyone looking for a great spa experience should consider the Oasis Spa at Sukhumvit 31. I had a Thai Massage and coffee body scrub and both were fabulously relaxing. The spa staff are very kind and professional, paying great attention to detail. Upon arrival, I was greeted with some lovely ginger tea and the same after my treatments concluded. The spa has such a nice relaxing atmosphere, my only regret is that I didn't stay longer! Will definitely be back next my next time in Bangkok.

safe choice for massage. Visited Oasis spa to try the Lanna Secrets package that goes for 2 hours. Took a taxi to go there but the driver was suffering to find a right location though I provided an address. Perhaps you'd better to ask the spa about their pick-up service. In my case I used it to return to my hotel in Sukhumbit area and it was free. Not sure how far they cover, though. Regarding massage I was satisfied with both the skill of the therapist and the environment of the room. All required facilities were rightly prepared in the room and everything was clean. You can enjoy 20% discount if you book online for the morning time massage. Check their website.

A wonderful afternoon spa experience in Bangkok. I was impressed by the quality of the massage that I received at the Bangkok Oasis Spa. I asked for the strong massage and it was just perfect to relax my stressed body. it is an excellent Spa that I highly recommend.

Serene atmosphere and relaxing environment. The Oasis massage was wonderful and Judy, my masseuse, was excellent. I particularly enjoyed the changes in the aromas used throughout the massage as it added to sensory enjoyment. The outside grounds are beautiful and the rooms are very 'spa like' and comfortable. The only reason that I did not rate it 5 stars is because several of the spa's buildings lost power while I was there and they could not process my credit card for payment. They drove me to an ATM so that I could withdraw money to pay (which I did not mind at all) but they did not offer to reimburse me for the very high ATM fee that I incurred. If I could rate the spa a 4.5, I would!
Perfect spa in city. Nice house with gardens great staff and service affordable rates and amazing treatments all very professionnal Love it and coming there at every visit in bangkok

Pure bliss. My friend and I booked the 4 hr Paradise of Oasis package and it was such a treat. We had our own private room with an outdoor shower and a steam room to the side. Only thing a bit odd was that the toilet had no door! The body scrub and wrap was well timed and very soothing. Really appreciated the break halfway through with tea and fruits. Massage and facial was also really relaxing. Our therapists were attentive and we left feeling blissful.Must also say that the service at Oasis Spa is fantastic, the pick up from BTS station was really efficient. When their driver got stuck in traffic they arranged a taxi for us after our treatment which we didn't expect at all. Will definitely visit again next time I'm in Bangkok!

Relaxing and Luxurious. My friend and I booked a four hour long spa package that included a steam bath, full body scrub, mud clay wrap, oil massage, and facial. It also provided complimentary beverages and assorted fruits during our stay. A very professional, clean, luxurious establishment that is incredibly affordable and enjoyable. Would highly recommend Oasis Spa to any of my friends passing through Bangkok.

The 4 Hands Difference!. ~Many of us wanted to book the Oasis because we'd heard so much about this fantastic spa in Bangkok, YAY I got this confirmed thru their internet reservations and fuss free online prepayment gateway :)~Travelling down Thanon Sukhumvit, till you turn right at 31, you go down quite a long way before make a right to Soi 64, but when you arrive, the scene is one of clean scenic tanquility... I really like clean above all~The Oasis Four Hands Massage is absolutely such an experience to take in from the welcome at the door till you get to the room the anticipation builds up. I was a bit shocked at first then relieved because I thought there wasn't any shower from I stood till I realize OMG it was a full outdoor rain shower. Then I thought to myself why was the bath towel so far away inside the air-conditioned room till I noticed the towel was actually right there at eye level next to the rain shower. Just 1 BIG Thing the Shower Gel has some gold specks in every pump soooo cool!~Once I lie down and they started to lay their hands on from end to end the coordination ....I cannot help feeling these folks really got their technique together ...simply an amazing massage. Now if they get an 8 hands I'll take that x2~My next one Aromatherapy Hot Oil Massage just ain't no comparison, it was tres fantstique but after the 4 hands setup, there is no way anything comparesI only wished I'd arranged for a half day instead of just 2 hours!8 STARS

You can be Royal .... With no doubt you can live a Royal Experience for some hours at the Oasis Spa-Bangkok. - The place is all about service. - The staff are so humble and yet professional. - Refined environment and relaxing atmosphere.- Hygiene is well taken care of.- 4 hours treatment is worth every cent, and the 4 hands massage is spectacular. Go treat yourself .. feel Royal... We live only once.
Great place and great treatment!. It was my first time and I'll be back! My treatment lasted something like 4 hours and it was really woth it.

Very good therapist & hospitality. Therapist is very nice, polite and expert. Privacy massage room with beautiful music for good relaxation. Signature Massage, Queen of Oasis is really for female retreat. Must try! http://www.oasisspa.net/therapie/signature/
Relaxing. The place is beautiful and all staffs are professional and nice...we booked a 4hrs treatment and enjoy every moments... We would definitely visit again

lovely retreat. This was a great spa. The grounds are very peaceful and pretty. The treatment rooms were large and well designed. Loved the outdoor bathroom/shower. The reception staff were pleasant and attentive. When I return to Thailand, I will definitely visit Oasis Spa!

Nisa. Its a very beautiful place and great service staff which is suit for relaxing with a lots of spa menu options. This is best place to recommend to high class people. The place is clean, good smell and peaceful. Overall good and worthiness price :-)

I could have stayed forever. I was recommended by a Swiss/Thai friend who books his mother in every time she's in Bangkok .. I turned up very early 9.15am not wanting to risk the traffic (they open at 10am) the staff where fantastic welcomed me in and serve a lovely light tea.. I selected the hair and massage package 2.5hrs of bliss.. Lovely large rooms with outdoor showers.. Requested to shower first and wear their supplied disposable underwear. The head/hair massage was amazing I could have fallen into a warm deep sleep.. The a full body scrub.. Requested to shower again and welcomed back to a full aromatherapy massage! Wonderful! Approximately $160AUD and I figure it would have cost $400+ in Oz. Better yet they dropped me off at my hotel .. Book today!!
Deep relaxation. I was with a massage heal daily fatigue .I decided to Oasis Spa to see the many reviews, but was able to experience as evaluation.Thank you so much!

One of my favourite spas in Bangkok. The Oasis Spa in Bangkok is great. Still going strong after many years, it is an excellent place to get great spa treatments. Located in the city, easily accessibly by BTS (beat the Sukhumvit traffic), Oasis Spa offers two venues providing classic therapies to relieve you of the stress accumulated from the hustle & bustle of Bangkok! Friendly, professional and well trained therapists deliver excellent treatments. The rooms are well laid out, the products are superb and the costs are reasonable. Most highly recommended!!!

Awesome Experience!. I don't go to spas often and wanted to treat myself after 3 months of traveling on a budget in Thailand. It was my returning home present to myself. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. The staff was friendly and conscious of my needs. I had trouble when booking, but they were very helpful in getting the issue resolved. The staff was always one step ahead of me taking care of all my needs. I will definitely be back!

Good spa bad service. I have been the member of oasis spa for over the year . I found that it is so hard even for the member to get the booking. Yesterday, i am lucky enough to get the booking at 4pm so we arrived on time. We had to wait nearly 30 minutes for the staff to prepare after we selected our treatment packages.however, we have to leave at 6 pm for our appointed . So, we asked the stuff to change it for 1 and a half hour instead. At the end of treatment, we still charged at full price of 2 hours and the treatment is not even last 1 and half hour ,real disappointment!!!

Relaxing indulgence. Bangkok Oasis Spa is set in an elegant, old house amongst lush tropical gardens, not far from the Phrom Phong BTS station. I made my booking online and found the website to be easy to use and a very efficient way of choosing, booking and paying for my treatments. The staff were friendly, polite and professional and I enjoyed an body scrub followed by a hot oil aromatherapy massage. The ambience and service could not be faulted - highly recommended!

Excellent spa. I have visited many in Bangkok and surely this is one of the best. The service is wonderful. It's a bit far from bts phrong pong station. So they picked me up from the station. I had the king of Oasis package which was great along with aroma steam. The ambience was great.

Best Spa in Thailand. I visited The Bangkok Oasis Spa on Soi 31 and thoroughly enjoyed The Paradise of Oasis, four hour package. I enjoyed the Thai Herbal Steam treatment then a Body Scrub, Clay Body Wrap ,Aromatherapy Hot Oil Massage and finally a Thai Facial. I felt transformed and relaxed and would highly recommend this high quality venue and experience. The staff are very attenticve and welcoming and the Spa is beautifully decorates with a soothing ambience. Refreshments of tea and fruit were provided .I will definitely return.
Great serveice !!!!. All staff very nice and good of serveice for all customer who is come even some guest just waiting , They also good take care

Wonderful experience - strongly recommended. The Spa is truly A + and the staff is super polite, professional and caring.It is a true SPA for a great relaxation under charming hosts and the prices are reasonable too.I wish them huge success.

Very depends on massager. Me and my sister made a reservation before 2 weeks of time through Oasis Spa website and get 20% discount.We selected Oasis Pampering which includes 2.30 hrs of body scrub, full body oil massage and face pampering. Both of us faces are pretty sensitive, so we got more time spend in scrub and oil massage instead of face pampering.The massage room was traditional and clean, quite atmosphere with meditation music and has got private outdoor shower space. The out door shower space was too hot. We were in sweat after shower. For me massage was very satisfied, but my sister said her massager didn't put any pressure, just rub with oil for whole hours. She tried to ask more pressure, but the massager didn't speak English.Overall, not good value of money. I recommended Oasis Spa for people who likes luxury atmosphere and high customer service, but not recommended for people who expects for the greatest massage.

My second time to the spa. I have came to bangkok more than 4 times.. Tried at least 3 spas/massage every time I'm here. Oasis spa is the only spa I have visited twice, I simply love the atmosphere, the massage and cleanliness! Recommend to book online with discount. They can give u a ride back if u are going to somewhere close, maybe the BTS station if needed. I had a great experience here and I will sure to come again!

If you'e looking for an experience. If you're looking for a good massage in Bangkok, there are many places you can go and pay a lot less than what you would at the Oasis. However, if you're after an experience, this place should be on your list. I've been to Bangkok several times before and gone to other establishments in this price range, but none of them provided the same caliber of experience.It's important to note that there are two Bangkok locations. The one I visited had a quiet but sophisticated garden atmosphere. The décor had a simple elegance to it that I quite liked, and the private treatment rooms were very comfortable. With individual entries situated around the garden, it feels like a private cabaña. Perhaps this is what makes it feel so exclusive. At the back of my treatment room was an area with a shower, sauna, and toilet; this space was walled off but not fully roofed in so you could have the pleasure of showering under the sun while maintaining privacy. Their treatment products are from the KIN line and seemed just fine. I booked a Hair Spa Package treatment, and I have to say that my hair felt a lot better afterward (and I've been giving it far too much sun in the last couple of weeks). The head massage that came with this treatment was superb -- I caught myself falling asleep multiple times, but the body scrub and full body massage included in the package were also wonderful. I should note that at the time I made my booking Oasis had a deal running with a 20% discount for booking via their website -- I don't know if that's a regular thing or a current special. Also note that a service charge is included in the bill. Free pick up from and drop off to Phrom Phong BTS station via van is available. Every member of the staff from the shuttle driver to reception to the masseuse were delightful, warm and welcoming but very professional.When I visit Bangkok, I try to squeeze in as many massages as possible, though most of these are at much smaller places where the treatments tend to be in the 200 - 400 baht range. However, I always make time for one special package at a place where I really feel pampered. I've had lovely experiences at different places around the city, but it's hard to imagine going anywhere else now when I'm looking for something extra with my treatments.

Impeccable experience!. My partner and I spent a whole day being treated like kings. The staff are very attentive and sees to your every need in a kind and caring manner. The ladies are friendly, courteous and well trained in their profession. Expert masseuse with a gentle touch - not once even a hint of being hurt (and I did chose the "hard" option). Well worth the visit. Outstanding day spa.

Paradise . Hi everyone ,I went to paradise and had a wonderful time, your Company provide like a paradise environments ,high quality and high services for me .The Spa Therapist provides high quality and professional for me. I saw her non-stop sweat. She done excellent treatments for me.When I do my treatment hear some real birds, just like in the middle of nature.They help me took some beautiful photos. when I travelling to Bangkok next time. I must come on Sukhumvit 31 again and request her and I will high suggestions to all my friends to visit Oasis Spa.
soft Hand business for the tourist mind. its a amazing for the traveller,For first time any visitor, should know the details and Rate per hour other way U should may not be satisfied.

Will ruin all other massages. First off, the staff couldnt be more friendly and helpful. Absolutely blew my mind with which courtesy every staff member treats you. And then I could probably write a long review about the Four Hands Massage I took but I will only say one thing... two hands will never be enough again.
excellent get-away!. It was relaxing and an excellent way to get away from the city! Technique was great and I really enjoyed every minute of it.

A little slice of heaven. My friend and I each got a 2-hour package. Hers was traditional and quite rigorous. Mine was for the head, back, shoulders, and feet but seemed to cover every part of my body except my stomach. We both came away relaxed and happy and ready to go out into the Bangkok world of election protests and traffic. The ambience is lovely; the welcome beverage was welcome. A courtesy van picked us up at our Sky Train exit and returned us to the same place. We were extremely pleased with the entire experience.

Best spa ever!. I'm Thai and I've tried different range of spas. This one is the best in my experience regarding ambience, service and professional massage. The only con is the location (far from main road). It's worth a try!
Really comfortable time. Thank you so much for all kind staffs! We have an amazing time in our spa. I want to go to next time in Bangkok trip.

premium spa. Everything about this spa experience was premium. The staff are very courteous. The facility is premium. The ambiance is premium. The smell throughout the lobby and massage room was fantastic. I felt like royalty during the treatment and massage. It is a great way to take a break from Bangkok while in the city. They gave me a courtesy ride back to the BTS station afterward. That is premium service.
not worth it. I couldn't feel as good as their high charge , Bangkok has a lot of better choice. Maybe their environment is better than others.

Our first Thai massage experience – FAB!. It is our very first Thai massage experience (my husband has never tried any full body massage at all). We really wanted to try different things but we were also afraid a very traditional Thai massage would hurt a lot. So we have chosen Oasis Spa because it offers a package called Lanna Style which includes a mix of Thai massage, herbal compress and aromatherapy oil massage, basically, a bit of everything.Upon arrival, we immediately checked with the staff if the Thai massage in the package would be very strong, and were assured that it would just be enough to warm our body up. The welcoming tea was hot and soothing, with a hint of ginger as I remembered. The interior looks gorgeous, feels like a classy spa parlour (yes to us the environment and cleanliness count). We had a very quiet room for ourselves. Beneath the holes of the massage beds (where our heads were resting) there were 2 pots of water with lovely floating flowers. Incense or oil were burnt and a calming melody was being played throughout our session, together with the warm and skilled hands of the masseurs both my husband and I were sent to heaven.I also love the attention to little details here and there, such as clean and dry towels kept being replaced everything after we took showers. The pots of flowers beneath the beds (as mentioned), etc. Both our masseurs were very attentive. I took one star off because the outdoor toilet and bathtub aren't very clean or well maintained. They are charming as they are outdoor but this may cause them much quicker wear and tear. There are cracks in the bathtub and the toilet seat was yellowish. Again I think this may be because of the weather.When we were being rubbed like 2 pieces of happy bread dough we felt like we were floating in the air, between the border of consciousness and unconsciousness. This surreal feeling continued even after we left the spa. We slept really well that night. Would recommend this to my friend and other travellers.

Fabulous Escape. I was given a voucher to Oasis as a gift...and have been back every month since! Excellent for a private escape, or to go as a group for a spa day! Check the website for current promotions, always some great offers.

I had a great time at Oasis Spa!. I like to play golf in Bangkok, I also have experienced many different Spas after golf games for relaxing my body. I was told of Oasis by friends. I booked a three hour package at their Sukhumvit 31 premises on Sept. 24 afternoon. I was offered tea and while the details of my package were explained to us. When my room was ready, I was escorted there and introduced to Navee and New, our masseuses. The treatment was all that it was described, and more: the Body Scrub and the Thai Herbal Hot Compress Massage left us relaxed and rejuvenated. The treatment was conducted in a serene and respectful manner, with each masseuse making sure that I was comfortable and relaxed. There was no feeling that we being rushed , the whole experience was very worthwhile. I was treated to wonderful customer service by all the staff at Oasis Spa and I will certainly return

perfect hideaway. Visited in September 2013..My experience was great.Oasis Spa is a great place to go and indulge yourself. I found it very relaxing,...staffs were welcoming and not so pushing to sell away…I could tell that my comfort was a priority there. My 2 Hours massage was very profession and strong…I recommend if you are looking for a spa…this is a place...con: it's hiding in the major traffic junction, so can be difficult to get there during rush hours...

Highly recommended !!. As regular visitors to Thailand and Bangkok, we have experienced many different day spas, but were told of Oasis by friends. My wife and I booked a three and a half hour couples package at their Sukhumvit 31 premises. Even though we were early for our appointment, we were made welcome at reception. We were offered tea and, later, fruit, while the details of our package were explained to us. When our room was ready, we were escorted there and introduced to Navee and New, our masseuses. The treatment was all that it was described, and more: the Body Scrub, the Aromatherapy Hot Oil Massage, the Thai Herbal Hot Compress Massage and the Thai Facial left us relaxed and rejuvenated. The treatment was conducted in a serene and respectful manner, with each masseuse making sure that both my wife and I were comfortable and relaxed. There was no feeling that we being rushed and, in fact, time seemed to stand still. We were surprised, and sorry, when it ended. The whole experience was very worthwhile. When it was over, we were offered transportation back to our hotel and there was no objection to our request to take us to a nearby Thai Restaurant instead. We were treated to wonderful customer service by all the staff at Oasis Spa. We have no hesitation in recommending Oasis Spa and we will certainly return.
The most great spa I ever try it bangkok. The location is not easy to find but it make me unexpected. Really good experience and sure will come again!

This place is fantastic!!! (Totally worth coming). I came here with & through the introduction and arrangement of my colleagues, when I got there it was like, wow...the building/decorations/atmosphere is fantastic, so soothing and serene. We arranged a pick up just outside of a BTS station and was brought inside, we were surprised to find a staff who could speak Mandarin(our native language-so we immediately felt more at ease) , as we stepped inside there's a relaxing smell (message oil and incense I suppose)The people there were kind, service was great and it was quiet all around, I felt very calm and secluded. We chose a 2 hour programme with Thai herbs (hot on the skin but comfortable!) Most of my colleagues fell asleep and I just barely managed to stay awake during the programme, the smell and everything was just perfect!Only that I'm personally more sensitive, I feel that some touches were a bit sore/too hard for me, but I thought it probably would be more effective that way so I went with it all the way. I suggest people who don't like it that hard/don't message often, can tell them to go softer when messaging -actually they give you a form to fill out before they start, one of the questions being "how would you like your message, soft, normal or extra hard"- and I chose normal. I will recommend a person sensitive to touch like me, to choose the "soft".They're a bit different from what I had in Cambodia but quite similar. Compared to what I experienced elsewhere, the level of the message, I would say first class (so says my colleague), but the message itself might not necessarily the best I had, what really took the cake was the atmosphere and the setting(the hot Thai herbs too- I really LOVED that) This place is not a message house with lost of people lying in a row so just the atmosphere was way better.And I really like this tea they gave you before and after your message. One was sweet and cool and the other hot and warming. I actually wished that I could stay there the whole day and relax when I finished the programme. They also sell their message products there, which looked really nice and tempting, but I don't really know how to use it if I bought it home, and things like those are usually not cheap(by experience), so I didn't even check the price. But people who are interested should really stop and take a look if you're not in a hurry to leave! (Some of my colleagues bought things, and one of them who was interested but didn't buy-forgot why, maybe coz we were leaving- and was quite regretful afterwards) Really recommend it.

A true Oasis in the city. The Oasis spa at Sukhumvit 31 is a true oasis in the city. It's a beautiful, modern mid century renovated home surrounded by well manicured lawns and mature trees. Hard to believe it's right in the heart of busy Sukhumvit road. The spa tucked deep in the the street, so it's nice and quiet. We had arranged the pick up at Prom Prong station and the driver was there waiting. We booked a couple spa package, four hours of "Paradise of Oasis" and that was a wonderful and relaxing experience. Booked it on line for the morning session and got a 30% discount. The staff are courteous, polite and professional. The experience was phenomenal! We are looking forward to go back to Oasis spa again.

Great spa in Bangkok. I had the paradise of oasis package about 4 hours it was very very nice program.When I arrived the staff gave me some welcome drink it made from Thai herbs.The Treatment's room was clean and beautiful with Thai style (Lanna style).The therapist very very efficient. Good recommend.

A true oasis at great value. The spa is located amidst a super-busy area but it was so secluded that it exuded tranquility the minute I arrived in the driveway. The service was top-notch from the beginning to the end. The most exquisite character of this spa is the private shower and toilet outdoor, in the back of the spacious treatment room. I wonder, where else can one get a classy, pampering 4-hours spa package for under USD 150? I could have got the package for just about USD 100, had I booked directly on their Website, however.

Great spa. I treid the Oasis Pampering and it was a great! The treatment itself is fabulous and the facilities are very good. The place is pretty, relaxing, clean. I love the showers outside. If I had to say anything "negative" is that the lady who did my treatment was not as friendly. But that is IF I had a complain and I really dont. I will be coming back to Oasis Spa soon!

Great Staff, Relaxing Premises, Quality Product. The day before I left the Big Mango, I decided to shout myself a good treatment. I had a body scrub, followed by a massage and a facial. The room where the treatment was done is across a space from the main building. It is very stylish and has a shower (really good one) just outside the room with concrete stepping stones and pebbles. Jan, the lady who treated me really knew what it was all about. I felt calm and clean when we finished.

Not as good as expected. I tried the new Siam treatment because they offered 50% discount. However I was allergy to the balm used in the treatment, resulting redness and itchy all over my back all night after the treatment and my skin was sticky too. What an unpleasant experience. Would try some other spas next time.
Excellent Spa. We loved the time spent here, just so relaxing, clean and peaceful just like the people here. Once you finish you will feel another person, more relaxed physically and mentally.
Nice to relax. we come her to relax and we love this relaxing spa staff so friendly and so clean place to come and we enjoy here too much
Good spa. My Wife and I had good time in Oasis Spa. The service is excellent, the room is clean and neat, and also the shuttle service is outstanding. Highly recommended

Great oasis in Bangkok. What makes this place special is the atmosphere. It is tranquil and is a well run facility with nice music, running water and massage rooms. The massages are very good, and good value for money. The products they use for the aroma massage smell fabulous and you will surely buy something from their small product offering before you leave (although they were a bit pricey, but worth it). The whole experience from start to finish is geared at making you relax and it works!
Great way to unwind!. Glad we came! Cosy, therapeutic ambience, soothing but firm massage were just what we needed after our day long shopping. You won't regret coming here.

Great Massage experience but Non User-friendly Set ups. This spa has been frequented by many of my friends visiting from abroad although I have never tried it. One of my visitors wanted to try 4-hand massage and this is one of the only few places offering it. We booked online (although I live here) and settled with the early bird promotion at 30% discount having our massages at 10 am in the morning. The service from the reception to our masseurs has been very good. The facility looked spaceous and it is tranquil although it is located on Sukhumvit 31. My gf and I shared a couple's room and it was nicely decorated in Thai style. My masseurs doing the 4-hand were in sync with each other from movement to pressure applied through the body. Incredible. This was better than the one I had a year ago at another spa. The 2 hr. massage also included a hair treatment and foot massage. The foot massage was good. The hair spa was enjoyable but I did not enjoy having my hair and scalp wet wrapped in a towel for 2 hours. The hair spa also included a 15 min or so facial. The least enjoyable part was the after massage shower. The massage was outdoor (and so is the toilet), and the sink and mirror and hair dryer etc are all located outdoor by the shower. It is very inconvenient because it is impossible for two of us to get ready at the same time. So I had to shower first, then wait for my gf to shower, changed back to my street clothes indoor, then go outside to dry my hair. They should have had the vanity set inside the room. There is no mirror inside the room. What if it rains? It is very dangerous havineg a hair dry on top of the sink. They did not provide us with any face cream etc and our face felt so dry after the facial. The lack of personal touch in the arrangement really threw us off. I think if they can improve this set up, they can help retain more customers!

Fantastic Massage. I loved the whole Oasis experience. The setting is lovely and serene and the staff welcomes you warmly with the spa menu and tea. Our group of 3 people all had different massages and packages and we loved all of it. I had the aromatherapy massage and it was wonderful. The strokes were hard enough to be effective, but smooth enough to be relaxing. The therapists are very well trained and discreet. I'll be back! This spa is in a completely different category than the inexpensive Thai massages available in Bangkok.

Excellent !!. HiI found Oasis Spa truly exceptional.The best thing was the warmth of the receptionist, therapist. Everyone greeted with a smile on their face. Truly an international spa experience. Everything was perfect, the calmness and quietness of the place.The bath was very refreshing, and would like to appreciate on how organised the therapist "Selena" was. Well decorated, definitely 100% value.I appreciate the fact that Oasis reimbursed my taxi expense even, this was something which was outstanding. I have never experienced such professional treatment.Wish you a great way ahead.Thanks Oasis for a lovely day spent.

Terrible massage. Oasis spa has great facility but the massage was terrible.Our family took king&queen massage, which were Oasis spa's signature massage.Massage was terrible; it seemed the masseurs did not know what they were doing.they gave us no choice of the oil though it was a hot oil massage, led my brother to have severe allergic reaction. Moreover, much of the allergic symptom appeared during the massage, such as rash, difficulty in breathing, the masseurs did not do anything.It is 3900THB++ for the king massage, and the same price for the queen massage, totally waist of our money and time.

A place to avoid. A lot of theatre for nothing. Bad massage and staff which does not understand english at all. My wife was for two hours shivering in a stream of cold AC air, ill the next day. Her askings for putting off the AC weren't heard. I wanted a strong massage, but didn't get it at all. There are many serious and much better massage places in BKK for much less money to pay. You pay for the nice surrounding here, not for the massage quality.

Beautiful and Relaxing. We have visited the Oasis Spa in Bangkok on our second night there, and we I\m really satisfied with the service. The Staff was so friendly and helpful.The massage we received was very relaxing and skillful. The whole atmosphere just invited to let go and relax. For this price we would never get a similar service in Hongkong. If you are in Bangkok and get the chance, i suggest you try it.

my Wife loved it. we are the first Time in Thailand and my Wife´s first Run was into that Spa - she was treated very well and polite, the Service was very helpfull, a nice Atmosphere in all Facilities and th Treatmnt was professional

Beautiful place. I had inform the spa via email for pickup and nobody follow up. I had drop another mail and there is no reply. I decide to shop at the nearby Terminal 21 and took a tuk tuk there. As the rest menation, location can be a little difficult to find. Look out for Euro hotel, keep going straight & lookout on the left side there is a small sighage of the spa then turn in. Once i reach The spa it is beautiful,location is serene. Service is good all smile and greet at all time. At the back of mind I wonder is that they only thing they can do. I tried the body wrap, no heat blanket. Will give it a missed not worth the money. Just spreading of the mask on your body.The Thai massage is better however I will not said it is the best. It is acceptable. Overall I will said the experience is good as the spa is beautiful and staffs are all smile. However do not expect reply from them via email.
nice. nice place to get spa and to chill out, very good massage and very nice atmosphere

Oasis in BKK offering the best spa treamtments ever!. As the name of the store says what it is the place is located in the central bangkok, sukhumvit soi 31 but the place is very peaceful and quiet, surrounded by coconut and tropical trees in a big yard with very very friendly and polite staffs who welcomed us outside with Wai when we arrived there by a car! It is the oasis in BKK with relaxing and warm (like home away from home) atmosphere. I went with my partner and chose Oasis Pampering which includes 1 hour body scrub, 1 hour aroma oil massage 30 min facial and head massage, etc. The couple room that we were escorted to had a Jacuzzi and shower. We both very much enjoyed it and were satisfied with quality and service, literally everything so we would definitely recommend this spa to anybody who is looking for a first class spa treatment in the central BKK,Don't miss it!

Good massage but not the stepping!. Very good Thai Massage! The price is quite reasonable and the staff really did a good job! but the stepping on your body is really hurt. Luckily she was able to understand my body language! Will try Thai Massage but not the stepping next time.

So Relaxing. It is worth every penny to get pampered. My wife, our friend, and I went to the Oasis Spa in Bangkok. Talk about relaxing! The smells and sound automatically put in in a peaceful place. Couple that with the wonderful staff, the small details such as flowers, showers, and tea--well you have a little slice of heaven tucked away in an unassuming neighborhood! Every vacation should have a moment of zen and this was it for us!

The worst spa experience in my life. An empty room with just 2 beds, no scene and no music, no bathroom but were asked to take shower in an open area (one control stand with 2 shower heads for a couple to shower together!!!) The so called "therapists" just put and spread the oil on our body and not massage. To end up the spa, it was their so called "facial", the woman put small pieces of paper to fill up our face, the feeling just puzzle your face with left over mask (cut out from guest with small face), of course there was no massage. Then the last thing was to wake you up with an ice cold towel, put on the neck. My god, that's totally unacceptable. No wonder they requested the guests to pay the whole bill before taking the service, otherwise, I don't think people will stay there and especially we, a group of 4 persons were in two different rooms which we cann't communicate with each other. It's so embrassing and such a shame to bring my friends there to try their 1st spa experience. Really cannot understand why and how can the magazines could recommend this spa to tourists, it is such a big shame to the famous Thai massage professionalism.
Excellent service. It's nice place to visit. Excellent with Thai massage, it's nice place for relaxing. The price is good

They stood me up, so gutted!. After a very nice experience at Oasis Spa in Chiang Mai I decided to have go at Bkk. Although they offer pick up service and my hotel wasn't really that far away, they 'advised' me to take tge BTS. I asked them to pick me up from there, which they never did. It was raining cats and dogs but I was determined to go there (it was my last night in Thailand and I so wanted a last massage) and armed with their brochure and map in hand tried walking there. What a frustrating experience, no-one had ever heard of it (including 3 taxi drivers) and that map didn't nake sense. After the most horrible half hour I simply gave up and went back to my hotel (Vie Hotel) and went to the Spa there, which happened to be one of the best massages ever. So things happen for a reason. However I am so gutted with the spa for standing me up and not even bothering to call me to apologise or explain. Never again!

Wonderful upmarket massage experience. We took SilQ Hotel’s recommendation and had massages at the upmarket Oasis Spa. It was located in a large walled compound with a large central building with treatment rooms off in a separate building. Waterfalls and lovely treatment rooms, and an excellent and very relaxing Thai massage. The price was high, but the quality and surroundings were worth it for us.

Awesome experience and as a MAN, proud enough to admit it. There are tons and tons of massage places in Bangkok just off the street for $10 but this is a unique experience where you will spend more than that for such a unique experience such as this. I did the "King of Oasis" treatment (2 hours) mainly tailored for men for strong muscle massage, hot compresses/oil along muscles. I am always amazed at the professional trained Thai women being so small that they are so very strong and powerful. I am 220 lbs at 6"2' and after 20 minutes of massaging my wife, I get tired. These Thai women must have the Energizer Bunny for a relative because they are just as strong and powerful as when they start as 2 min before the 2 hours is up.I'm not a pansy or "metro sexual" guy at all and my job is very physical and testosterone filled but in all the materials that they use for the building and rooms and how the grounds are kept really sets the mood for the place. I wish I had a beach house somewhere in the world exactly like this place. I am amazed at how each room has been set up right down to the quality of the linens. You are guided to your private room and the masseuse waits quietly outside the door. There is an in room bathroom for you to quickly tidy up and shower down (this is Thailand with 300% humidity, people sweat even walking to this place :) You ready yourself on the table and call her in. The Thai women are fantastic in knowing every muscle and how to work it gently to the most relaxed state. When ever I go to Bangkok, I schedule my flight in 1 day early and book my 2 hour appt. via the internet. Reception speaks 5 languages. I think next time I will book for when I arrive and when I leave a week later. It is far too long between visits and I deserve this. This place is true class.

Great grounds and service but mediocre massage for a high price. With so many massage options in Thailand you are not short on choices. I decided to try a high end spa after having many of the routine 10 dollar streetside massages throughout my 3 month stay in Asia. I have to say that the experience was a sore dissapointment. The grounds and service in this place are stellar but the massage was a joke. It was like I paid someone to rub oil on me for 2 hours. I did not feel massaged at the end of the stay. When I complained at the end of the session the person told me I had chosen the wrong massage! Clearly the person I was assigned to was brand new and inexperienced. Not what I was expecting. When I pay top dollar I want someone fully trained and experienced. I would stick with the cheaper massages. At least you are only out 10 bucks if it is not good.

Oasis Spa Bangkok. I was introduced to this spa by an online spa review "magazine" of Bangkok as Oasis Spa came highly recommended (it's won the tourism board award it seems). True enough, it was a pleasant experience and this is as good as any city spa can get. It was an oasis in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Absolutely beautiful grounds. And it's popular with the local rich as well who drove in with their beemers and mercedes. Always a good sign. It was one of those splurge trips. As there're a few of us, and since I was paying, I did try to negotiate for a better deal. And you should too. Got to speak to the manager beforehand, and I was offered a 15% discount off the package price. Else, the reception will offer the customary 500baht discount , regardless of the service you chose and we were having one of the most expensive 4hr spa packages!.I chose the Lanna Explorer which included their King of Oasis signature massage done in the privacy of an exclusive room with an attached open-air shower and bath. The masseuse was attentive and skilled. Had I not been doing Thai massage regularly back home, i would have been totally wowed by the massage skills, but since I'm used to this kind of massage, there're certain parts where it could have been better, while other parts were good. It finished with a refreshing honey/cucumber facial and a head massage. Would I come back again? Maybe for the 1.5hr massage instead of the spa package. But then I am very tempted to try other spas as well, just to compare.

Fabulously relaxing. Booked on line and got 50% discount for a full spa package.... was definitely worth it. I have had a serious of operations and they were very gentle when treating this area. They were lovely....Very respectful, professional people, who created the perfect spa atmosphere. Both my partner and I left feeling rejuvenated! Would definitely go back!

Snores from the man enjoying the foot massage say it all!. Spent a blissful 5 hours here recently with a spa package including choices of body scrub, wrap, facial as well as milk treatment and massag, with an additional manicure and pedicure book online and get 50% off plus another 20% off additional treatments. Quality of the facility, friendliness and professionalism of the staff was great, particularlt Bum my therapist. Man purrs from the gentleman having the foot massage also say it al! Great value, especially if you book in advance online. One thing to clarify if you want your nails painted as part of your treatment that is extra!

Excellent!. I and hubby tried the 1 hour royal thai massage. We both think it was excellent, the therapists are both friendly, communicate well in english and experienced. It was very relaxing and therapeutic. The spa has a very relaxing ambience. Everything about my experience is rated excellent, from online reservation, reception, and the massage itself. It was one of the highlights of my trip.I will definitely recommend the spa to everyone going to Bangkok and will visit again if I have the opportunity to go to Bangkok once again.

Best spa experience with reasonable price. The interior of the spa is warm and cozy. Very comfortable once you stepped in, greeted by friendly receptionist. I took the full spa package which is about 4 hrs. Head to toe pampering done by Hong (if I don't get it wrong). Very experienced and friendly services. I'll definitely come again in my next visit to BKK!

Loved it!!. My husband and I got a 4 hour spa treatment here at a fraction of the price of what it would cost back home in the U.S., mainly due to the fact that they had a 50% off promo at the time!It was heavenly and we felt so pampered and relaxed after the whole experience. The staff was super sweet and really took care of us. Loved all of the yummy smelling products they used and the massage was great! Would definitely come back here again next time I'm in Bangkok!
Excellent! . Dropped in on a rainy afternoon and was able to enjoy a wonderful foot reflexology massage in a nice, tranquil space. Perfect occasion to wind down from Bangkok city.

Clean room, skillful masseurs. Easy to find location at sukhumvit main road. I had 2 hours Swedish massage nd my husband had aromatherapy massage. The facility is clean and looks relatively new. Our couple massage room is big and massage table is comfortable. Massage was great and it's value for money. Masseurs seems experienced and well-trained. Ps: there is a discount if you book your reservation online.

Amazing spa in this amazing city. My wife and I visited the Dahra Spa on Sukhumvit for the second time in a year for a series of four two hour massages. It was even better the second time around. From the moment you step inside there is a wonderful serenity from the chaotic but brilliant city outside. The massage rooms themselves are in fantastic condition with each one having its own private shower,and washbasin, dimmable lighting, serene music and a lovely private large room rather than being crammed in together. The best thing of all though is the quality of the staff. whilst you choose the style of massage you want, it is brilliant that the therapists without prompting will vary the massage to suit the individual, and work on any areas that they identify need to be worked on. each of our four massages were slightly different as a result, which inexperienced therapists you find in many of the Bangkok spa's are not skilled enough to do.so good were the therapists that Katty who looked after my wife in in her wordlwide top three, and Ya who looked after me is in my top two!The one thing that you may need to know is how to get there if you are not staying close by. We stayed a few miles away but used the skytrain to get there which is super easy. If you are coming from the direction of Siam (the main shopping area) on the skytrain, just go to the Assok station and exit to be on the opposite side of the road from Terminal 21, (the superb shopping mall adjoining this station). Then walk in the same direction as the train was travelling for about 250m, and you will find the Dahra spa.It might sound a bit complicated, but this spa has not got all the rave reviews for nothing, and it really is easy to find. already planning our next trip back it is so good!!

Lovely. Initially we only booked for a basic manicure and pedicure (couple) but having arrived, we upgraded our options to what essentially ended up to be a marathon 5 hour spa treatment. The service was top notch, there was no rush, and service was tailored to our individual needs. Although booked for 4 hours all in all it took 5. Can improve by offering choices over oils and fragrances used for massages and privacy during foot massage.

Great experience. This facility has good staff and offers great service.One of us took a Royal Thai massage and the other person chose a Head, Neck and Shoulder massage.Since we booked online, we got 20% discount.The facility is pretty new and well maintained.After reaching there, we were asked if we can wait for an hour, as the previous customer was late. So we went and came back. However they gave another 10% discount for this inconvenience.They gave a warm welcome and a welcome drink.The staff knew what they were doing and did a very good job.Great place to choose if you want to relax.

Wonderful afternoon. Decided to try Dahra Spa for a Thai massage, based on reviews and location, near my hotel. Excellent choice!! Classic, clean, friendly, exactly what I was looking for. A two hour Thai massage, almost put me to sleep, left me feeling wonderful and refreshed. Highly recommend Dahra Spa.
can we have the best of both worlds?. these are the kind of places you are actually paying for lush ambience but the quality of skill is really average. Sadly No return effect for me.

Excellent Spa in Sukhumvit. I have tried many spas in Bangkok and a friend recommended this to me When she knew I would be staying in a hotel in Sukhumvit area. Dahra has to be the one of the best I've tried and I've since gone back at least 4 times since Feb this year.
