The services were the very very well done with a variety to choose from. Couples will love having their treatments together at the same time. This is a 5 star spa not to be missed.

Totally over-rated. I come to Bangkok often, and know for 250 baht in the right place you can get a good foot massage. I paid 1050 at divana and don't mind high prices if the quality matches - it was no where near. It was average even for a 250 baht shophouses, though the room was nice. Lack of air con at cool enough temperature and music from some batte scene hardly helped.

wonderful spa experience. My wife and I enjoyed our spa package here immensely. The spa is close to the Asok BTS station (actually closer than I expected from the map) and easy to find. The garden is a beautiful entry to the small reception area and the welcoming cold towel is great after the muggy Bangkok climate. The receptionist helped us pick out a package (Spa Sensational for 2650 THB per person) and showed us four choices for the body scrub and four choices for the massage oil. We also filled out a small sheet detailing which areas of the body we wanted the masseuse to focus on and which areas we wanted her to avoid during the massage, how hard we wanted the massage to be, etc.We did wait a bit but that was because we were early so our treatment started exactly on time. The treatment room was very nice and well laid out with a seating area for the foot soak, two beds, two urn-like baths (which we didn't use for our program), and a shower, a toilet (both behind glass doors). Outside the window was a water feature and the whole atmosphere was extremely relaxing and luxurious. The treatments were great, unhurried, thorough, professional, discreet. And the therapists followed our focus/avoid directions well. I enjoyed both the scrub and the massage very much. My only complaint (and this is small) is that the shower in the couples treatment room only allows for one person to shower at time, so it delays things a bit. And the silicone probably needs to be redone. But we never felt like we were being rushed. The spa products in the bathroom are quite nice (we didn't purchase any).Fruit and tea were served while our bill was being prepared. Overall we felt like this was a good value. Spas at high-end hotels in Bangkok easily charge double or triple for the same experience and while it may not be the cheapest option in the city, it's not too bad for a once-in-a vacation spa day. Or maybe twice (I think I want to go back later this week) . :-)

Expensive but The Best service. More expensive fee than the average fee of the other spa & massages in Bangkok city, but If you want to receive very comfortable service than I strongly recommend this.

Satisfactory experience. Advanced booking is recommended. Last booking time was 9pm. We had anti-stress massage. The service was good. It would be better if the towel used for massage were hotter. The atmosphere and space was serene.

Very nice experience and beautiful spa. I agree with others that it's by far the best spa and massage in Bangkok. The staff was very nice, the massage therapists were very good. The ambiance was excellent and a welcome refuge from the chaos of Bangkok. Yes, it's pricier than going somewhere along the street, but it's a major bargain for what it is. Be sure to bring your confirmation with you. They also have very nice products to buy if you want to bring home some aromatherapy items.

Nice ambience...satisfactory spa. Divana has three outlets & we chose this one as it is near to our hotel. Advance booking is recommended as we were just lucky to get an evening spa on the actual day (there are construction works opposite the spa, we avoid the day session in anticipation of the noise).From the moment we stepped in, we liked it; the ambience it exudes & the service staff are nice. We were served drinks & cold towel upon arrival. Our spa Exotique treatment was not extraordinary but we did doze off at some point. Post spa, we were served drinks & tropical fruits. We wouldn't mind revisiting this spa should we stay in this area too in the future.
Great escape. My wife and I visited Divana for our anniversary. We both had a 3 hr spa/massage package. It was a very good experience and we both felt rejuvenated.

Not a happy experience. Location is not difficult to find and about 10 mins walk from BTS station. Skills of therapists are ok but not impressive. Since my friend and I shared the same room, we took shower and bath separately. But then they tried to charge us extra 400B and said we should both use the shower only. Once we used the bath they would charge as milk bath which price is 800B and now they have already given us discount to 400B. I'd be happy to pay that if I noticed that in advanced but there's no notice in the room or from the staff and we insisted not paying 400B for a bath with water only. They eventually 'waive' the 400B otherwise I would really think it's a fraud spa.

One of the best massage experiences of my life!. Yesterday I turned thirty and my fiancé bought me an amazing massage package at Divana. From the moment I walked in I was treated with the best service. The lovely ladies at the front desk were extremely helpful in helping me decide the best massage package for me and the masseuse was outstanding. The interior and exterior are a slice of paradise right off of Sukhumvit on soi 25. I have had 100's of massages all around the world and honestly this was one of the best I've ever had! If you want the best ask for the masseuse NOO pronounced "new" she was excellent. I wanted the best for my thirtieth birthday and Divana exceeded all expectations!

Little piece of heaven. We arrived for a 3 hour appointment at Divana, just off busy the busy mai drag of Sukhumvit. Lovely surroundings and a warm welcome from the staff. I would thoroughly recommend Divana for a chance to chill out and totally relax. I went with friends but would happily go there on my own. The rooms were lovely and the staff knew what they were doing. Was walking on air.

Worth every cent!. The spa is located at the end of Soi 25, hidden behind the gate is a haven! Walk through the garden path to the main house and be pampered with the spa treatment!Went there with my husband, it was our first time. We often visit another spa when in Bangkok but I thought we should given other spas a try as well. We were not disappointed.The reception was warm although we only made it to the appointment one hour later than the scheduled time. We called in advance to inform them that we were delayed. We were unable to try out the treatments we booked initially but the receptionists kindly offered to customized our treatments.Husband and I did different treatments but were able to share the same room. The therapists were skillful yet discreet. We felt refreshed and relaxed after the spa!After the treatment, fruits and tea were served to us at the reception area while our bill was being prepared. A good range of products was available for browsing and trying. The staff was not pushy about sales but was knowledgeable about the products.Will definitely be returning here on our next visit!

Overrated. I visited this place with my husband for the 2 hours package of Siamese massage and milk bath. I would say that receptionist could mess up this gorgeous place. I booked via phone and gave all details, but when I arrived, theres nothing ready, I have to wait almost an hour. The first receptionist,(who answered my call),could not give clear reasons for separated rooms for milk bath and left me irritated. Anyway, the second receptionist came with better manner and offered some discount for additional charge of the twin-bath room. Therapists have done exellent job with polite manner. Place is clean with very fancy stunning ambience. Prices are quite high compares what I overall experienced. I would suggest this place for only experiencing, but not regular visit.

looks good, smells good, but there's a question of value. Thai house (tick), scented and merchandised (tick), exquisitely marketed (tick)....I get the suspicion that the day that I had planned a special spa day for my lovely friend on the one weekend in Bangkok she was available to attend such a frivolous affair was the one weekend this establishment could not: a) have enough staff on hand and, b) deliver on it's marketing promises. This is the land of the spa. If you are one of those establishments claiming to be high-end then everything has to be on-song, all the time. If not then it would seem that the establishment is trading on naive tourists and a long outdated reputation. I am not going to pass judgement but I will say that my long awaited visit to this establishment was a disappointing experience and even when I (against all my instincts) tried to advise management that the service received was well below expectations all I received was the comforting knowledge that the therapist would be told I was 'not happy'. So, yes, I tipped generously after that. I hope you have a better experience than I did.

All good until... I have heard many a good comment from this Spa . My husband and I happen to spot it on our way to Emporium Mall.We went in to have a look and was pleasantly surprised - a little oasis amidst all the noise. We made an appointment and went back about an hour later. I very clearly mentioned twice that I did not want a hard massage. The massage was average bordering on BAD!My neck ached for two days afterwards.After the massage as I was signing the bill a highly irritating pale little man wad SO insistent on a tip for the staff . I would have given a tip anyway but he kept saying tip, tip, tip even before I could sign.Incredibly rude.He did not bother to ask if we were happy with the massage - he just wanted a tip.Will I recommend this place ? NO Will I return ? Definately NOT.

This place lives up to it's reputation.. I went to Divana Spa yesterday, and am going back on Sunday. It was so good I felt like I was on some kind of cosmic drug. The woman who treated me got into every muscle, like she designed my anatomical blueprints. I could barely move afterwards. Not from pain, but from being so relaxed. I nearly walked into Sukhumvit traffic. The place itself is very tranquil too. An oasis from the hustle of Bangkok. Go there.

Best Spa in the central location. アソーク駅から徒歩５分程度のローケーション周りは建設工事だらけですが店にはいると別世界です。緑豊かな庭と広々とした店内。冷え性なのでクーラーは弱めにと言えばちゃんとやってくれますし、スチームやホットバス完備でマッサージ技術も高いです。コスパもいいし、人気があるのは納得です。Best location. It is easy to access even in the middle of shopping time.Nice decor of garden and rooms. I liked the sweet corn tea served upon check-in andduring spa.I am very satisfied with the hospitality of staff and the skills of massage.Definitely I will come back again !

Vibrant location, excellent service. After getting of the Skytrain at Asoke Station, I barely could believe that this was a location that could offer me what I wanted - a relaxing afternoon, with the Harmony Spa program. In the heart of Bangkok, I was flabbergasted that this could be true. A calm, green and cosy area in a sidestreet of the busy Sukhumvit road, made it an ultimate relaxing experience. Prices are somewhat steep, conpared to local massage places, but offer unbeatable value. I particularly liked the body scrub, and the stress facial treatment, and would definetely recommend this to my Dutch fellows nd come back once my Divana products are finished!

Massage was awesome!. This place is actually quite near to terminal 21 and is quite accessible by asok bts or sukumvit mrt. I find the atmosphere very good and although its quite expensive versus what the other places charge, i think its worth it. The massage was simply awesome! Perfect!

Fantastic Massage. Divana Massage & Spa is located on Soi 25 Sukhumvit, which is within 15 minutes from Asok BTS station and when you walk inside, you won't believe you are very close to the hustle and bustle Soi Sukhumvit, the building is so peaceful and offer the very right spa retreat atmosphere.I've made reservation beforehand, so that I didn't need to spend much time on selecting the packages, but I can still choose my favourite body scrub and aroma oil for the massage. After around 10 minutes the room was ready, the massagers are very nice and their technique was excellent!It was a fantastic spa experience, I am coming back again for sure!

Nice environment yet awful service, won't suggest to anyone. There's no doubt that the environment is excellent, and you'd feel relaxed once stepping into the garden and the house of it, yet once I entered the room, the impression was completely altered. Before we arrived, we've reserved a couple room to have the treatment, once we stepped into the room, the receptionist told us the duration of the treatment, and emphasized that once he stepped out the room, they would start counting the time. Well, maybe it's normal as he just simply stated things clear, but as a customer, I felt a bit odd as he seemed pushing us to go on more quickly. The air conditioner was pretty cold, and right on the top of our beds, I was frozen. The skill of massaging of the therapists was ok, yet it can't compensate the hard feeling. They made me have a shower with my partner under one shower, with them outside a semi transparent door witnessing. It's so awkward and making us embarrassed. I guess they should have left the room when we were having a shower instead of standing outside the bathroom to see the naked us. And after finishing the shower, we laid on the bed to continue the massage, at the same time, one of the therapists went washing the shower room. That's so weird as the receptionist counted the time so tightly and precisely, then why they used our treatment time to do cleansing jobs?Once finishing the treatment, we went back to the reception, and it's 15 mins to go before they closed. I asked them for the price list of those spa products. They showed me with a bad manner, so I asked if I could still buy something or they were going to close. Since then, they ignored the questions I raised about the products, especially the senior one. Sigh I paid for relaxing, yet they made me feel bad and irrespective.Truly the products are nice and the environment is good, however, I won't be back to any of the branch, and would suggest my friends not to go.

Beautiful house but massage just ok.. We went there for body and foot massage in April. Very nice environment and nice mango sticky rice after massage.However, massage we had was so so, especially the foot massage. It's not as good as those cheaper massage. We lay down instead of sat on a comfy chair for foot massage. They used some kind of stone to sweep on yr foot. Cannot feel the tension at all. For body, we did not feel have the enjoyable experience as we do normally.

Great Spa Experience. I took the Detoxifying Myth and the experience was really good. Professional therapist with good care of me and I came out really refreshed and feeling great. Good deal of privacy and room decor matches with the spa tier, and air-con noise was minimal. Welcome tea could be less sweet but I'm ok with that and the mango sticky rice after the spa would delight a lot of people as well.

Just average. We went for the 5 hours spa package and ended up somewhat disappointed with the experience. The facility itself was nicely decorated and staffs are friendly. However the treatment itself and and skill of the massuists were nothing but average. They were constantly hushing us to make sure we were ahead of schedule, "you have 15 minutes shower" "10 minutes ma'am", we did not feel relaxed. The actual massage time was quite short, and the massuists burnt us several times with hot stones. However the fruits, tea, and light meals they served were very nice. Nice ambiance too. So to sum it up, if you want a good, authentic, recovering massage treatment, go somewhere else where they have real professional massuists. If you just want a nicely decorated place with nice ambience and music, you can give this one a try.

Not as good as it used to be. Divana Massage & Spa used to be my favourite. But this time I was really disappointed.Location: 4.5/5It is about 5 to 10 mins' walk from the Asok BTS station, and is quite easy to find. Just keep walking with Terminal 21 on your left and turn left when you see the "glass house". Can also do shopping before and/or after spa at Terminal 21, a new shopping mall right next to the BTS station.Ambience: 5/5The moment you walk in, you're in another world. It makes you relax instantly. They give you a tasty welcome drink, which is very soothing especially after the walk from the BTS station, and every person that walks in is attended to by the receptionists without delay. Inside, there are aromatic candles all around and there are even flowers inside the sink! And they use their own products too, which is great.Massage: 2.5/5This is where it all went downhill. I chose the 3-hour Spa Elegance package, a total of 3550 baht + tax, and it was totally not worth the price that I paid for. I'm not sure if it was the masseuse or the package itself, but it was definitely not a pleasant experience.My package consisted of:1. A foot scrub that lasted about 5 minutes which was done halfheartedly. The masseuse flopped my feet around.2. A herbal steam that lasted way more than its prescribed 15 minutes. The temperature was 37 degrees Celsius and it felt hot and uncomfortable.3. A body scrub that was not bad. In fact, their olive oil scrub was good.4. An aromatherapy massage that was way too forceful. I chose "medium pressure" when the receptionist asked me, but first thing the masseuse did was to kneel on my back. (Yes, she climbed onto the bed and put the weight of her whole body onto my back.) And her hands were stiff and rigid and it felt like she was just slamming pressure into my body. I had to tell her repeatedly that it was "too strong" and "softer please", but it still felt uncomfortable.5. A rose petal bath that lasted for more than half an hour. I think it was dirty because I later developed rashes and spots over both of my lower legs and my upper arms that night.Overall I was quite disappointed and will not return (at least not to this branch) next time.

Would definitely come back. Everything was good. Service and price. I took the 150mins spa exotique and was fabulous. Will definitely be back to try their 4hr spa.Only con is that after the scrub, the therapist was doing preparing the massage bed for our next procedure. And the bath area is only separated by a translucent curtain. Will appreciate if the curtain is non seen thru so that will not make our shower awkward. Also we discover that there is a 20% discount if we printed a coupon on their website. We ask them to help us print but hey are not willing. Not too bad in the end we still get 10% off but got to pay in cash only.

Paradise in the heart of Bangkok. Conveniently located within 5-min walk from Asok BTS skytrain station, Divana Spa is simply paradise right smack in the heart of Bangkok. The spa is clean and beautifully decorated to make you feel relaxed from the moment you step in. We took the 3-hour Spa Elegance package which was a fantastic experience. Massage therapists were professional and attentive. Highly recommended for a value-for-money, clean and relaxing spa experience!

Highly recommend this spa. We asked our concierge at the Holiday Inn Bangkok Silom about how to get to the Divana Spa as described here in Trip Advisor. The location with all these fabulous reviews is over an hour from our hotel, but there is another location for Divana and it is in Silom district and only two blocks for our hotel. At two p.m. we walked over there to inquire about a reservation for that afternoon. From the moment we entered the door, we felt welcomed as an old friend. The facility is immaculate, the service incredibly attentive and accommodating. We were served a beverage while we reviewed the list of services and told to return at five p.m. for our side by side 100 minutes Thai massage. The massage we each received was excellent. While we settled the bill, we were served a bowl of fresh fruit and lemongrass tea. The cost was $50 each and worth every penny. I hope to return on our next visit to Bangkok.

Wonderful. Easy to find n walk from Surasak BTS and just blocks away from Eastin Grand hotel Sathorn where I am staying. Therapist punctured well at muscles and worked very well over my body. Like: garden feel; over 30msq therapy pavilion with private shower n toilet; gentle attitude of staff n hard puncture of therapist; seclusion in evening with insects chirping to accompany spa music; soft n thick cotton towelDont like: slippery tiles in shower room dangerous for oily feetNo need to spend extra on Mandara spa etc; service level very high in Divana Srivieng spa. Excellent sleep afterwards.

Awesome place. Spa treatments are excellent, the staff is lovely and the place is a heaven in the centre of Bangkok madness. A bit more expensive than the average in Bangkok but every baths is worth it.

Good Spa with excellent service and reasonable price. I have tried the 3-hour Spa Elegance and it was completely amazing given the price. No rush throughout the treatment and considerable time spared for each part. The spa lady is professional and nice. The massage was good, the environment was relaxing. Would recommend to friends but please make your reservation well in advance cos they are quite full most of the time. Also check out promotions discount online.
A super nice spa centre. Really love all the services / staff there! Very enjoyable experience that travellers to Bangkok must try!

First and won't be last trip to this spa. This is my first trip to Divana. I love the authentic Thai style of this establishment. I like the setup of this spa, as it feels like a sanctuary in the middle of the city. They offer you a nice cold lemon grass tea to freshen up before your massage and a warm one with a small fruit plate after the treatment. Staff are friendly & polite and are willing to help. I felt very comfortable being at Divana.

Paradise in the middle of busy Bangkok. I traveled to Bangkok from September 7th through the 13th, 2012. I stayed on Sukhumit between Asoke BTS and Nana BTS. The area is well known for its Night life but it is little known for the many luxurious day spas located within walking distance in area. During my stay, I visited 5 day spas, Hapa Sap, Urbean Retreat, MySpa, Lavana, and Divana. I’ve chosen Half day or Full Day package (3 to 5 hours). All the spas offered more or less similar treatment and all of them were excellent. However, I would place Divana above the others for its ambient. Divana have created a paradise in the middle of busy Bangkok. Once you step into Divana door, it feels like you stepped in paradise. The first thing I encountered is a lovely garden where I was welcomed by a smiling receptionist that led to the reception area. The reception area is full of tranquility and great smell with comfortable seating. I was offered cold welcome drink and refreshing towel. After selecting treatment package and answering few questions, I was led to my treatment room which was located at the end of magnificent corrode. The treatment room is well decorated, very relaxing and Zen. It had shower, toilet, double beds and double path tubs overlooking bond with water falling from vertical garden creating a truly calming atmosphere. I was offered desert and cold drink half way through the treatment. After finishing my treatment, I was moved to comfortable room and offered organic meal, desert, cold drink and herbal tea. All the spas I visited offered wonderful spa treatments. However, Divana went further and created truly relaxing ambient.

Wonderful atmosphere. It may be more expensive than other SPA, but the environment is excellent, staff are friendly and professional! Totally worth it! Strongly recommend!!Remember to make reservation in advance.

Very good experience. I've been here few times, the last one this afternoon. If you're not familiar come the first time by taxi. Reception sometimes messy, but they are nice and gentle. Staff doing massagge is simply great, that's the reason why I am a repeted customer here. I always choose aroma therapy, if you are western people - as I am - go for soft or middle massagge. All rooms are tidy and very clean. Products to buy are good as well but you can easily find even in Siam Paragon.

Wanted to Love It. Each time I come to Bangkok - I hope and pray that I can find somewhere that I love as much as the transformative experiences that I have have at the hotel that I stay at - the Conrad (at a lower price). Each time, however, I have come away disappointed - and often needing to be "fixed" by a massage back at the Conrad. Sadly, this was no exception. I will also preface my review by saying - have you ever wanted to end a massage early? Just get up and leave ... If you know the feeling - then you will be able to relate to my review.I really wanted to love my massage experience here ... But was honestly underwhelmed. The spa itself was about a ten minute walk from BTS. Not overwhelming - or necessarily difficult to find - but simply not an ideal preamble to a luxurious spa experience. I would not recommend that a lady walk out from this spa alone at night time ... By the way. If you go solo (or even in a small group) arrange to be picked up by a taxi on your way home.Even know the spa is down a somewhat gritty alley downtown, the grounds are lush and lovely ... And somewhat reminiscent of visiting the Jim Thompson complex (somewhat). When I arrived at the spa, however, the attendants seemed flustered and a bit unorganized (and not just with me - kind of in general). Its not that the staff wasnt welcoming - but they just dont seem to have the level of training that some spas ensure in their staff. You don't feel the immediate calming scerenity. The two treatments that I thought I had booked on their web were somehow not booked correctly - so they had to scramble to get me a room - or so it seemed. I waited about 20 minutes beyond my reservation for the room. Not a big deal by itself. Make sure that if you want multiple services that you either call directly. The waiting room itself was at times cramped and jostled as customers came and went. The treatment rooms were nice - however and mine had a lovely view. Again thugh, compared to the spa suites at the Conrad - sorry. Tough comparison. The most important thing is always the skill and technique of the masseuse herself. Although pleasant enough in manner (and she was very nice) - her true massage techniques were simply below what I would have expected for a spa of this caliber (and WAY below the Conrad). I am not unfamiliar with Thai massage - by the way - as my regular masseuse in LA is Thai - but there were points in the massage where i simply had to tell the masseuse to stop - because her elbows in my back felt like knives. I also opted for the stone massage there (which i usually love) and at times - the stones were literally scalding. I have to admit - once more - i was kind of dumbfounded that this could even happen at spa ... It just seemed so "Spa 101". I was actally kind of stunned. As with many reviews on the Trip Advisor site - the level of competency of the masseuse can vary - and probably can make or break the experience. The best spas - however - seem to draw consistency from their technicians - which can be a huge differentiator when you open your pocketbook to make a spa decision. When they give you your bill, the do give you a lovely dragon fruit snack and hot tea - very nice touch! They also present you with a slip for feedback - which is a conscientious thing to do. Sadly, I lay here this morning with an aching back - and once more can't wait to book an appointment to "fix" My ouch-ies. Lesson learned. Sometimes when you only have a short period of time - stick with the tried and true. In the end - it really would have been less expensive. Sorry Divana ... I won't be back.

Wonderful ambiance, great massage. I had the best massage experience in my life. The garden of this boutique spa is lovely, inside is full of tranquility and great smell. They welcome you with a nice smile and also follow you to the door when you are leaving. It is a bit pricey but you definitely get what you paid for. I highly recommend this spa.

great treatment - shame about the construction noise. We visited three spas on this trip to Bangkok. Divana was the final stop. We made our appointment ahead of time via email. I recommend this especially if you go at a busy time. After the bad experience at Spa #2 – I was really hoping to leave the country on a better note. This is also a well situated spa – not far from Asoke off of Sukumvit. The facilities were quite nice and as always – the staff were very welcoming. I loved the welcome drink and snack (mango!). I did a massage and facial. Therapist was excellent. MY ONLY BIG complaint was that the initial treatment room was over a loud demolition/construction site. So the first part of the treatment was NOT at all relaxing or spa-like. I finally asked to be moved rooms and the staff were great about handling the situation. If you go to this spa- insist on a room in the back away from the street/construction sight - mention this when you making your reservation, when you confirm and once again when you arrive! I will definitely consider Divana for the next trip- but will be sure to remember to make sure that I have a different room.

great massage!. we decided to give it a try after reading the reviews here. and am glad we did! we almost gave up - i made a reservation via email for Tue but they replied to say only 11am-2pm or 7pm-9pm slots were available. so i chose the 11am slot and didn't hear from them. so i emailed them again and they told me there's only the 7pm slot left! i was quite irritated coz' i had replied earlier. and so in the end, i decided to call them to make a reservation. we finally got a slot on Thurs. and we were not sure where it was - we were at Emporium and were told to take the sky train to Asok and walk there. the walk was abt 15-20 mins and thankfully, we found the place without a hitch. and it was nice to be served a cold drink considering it was pretty warm. and the whole place smells nice coz' of the aromatherapy oil they use. and we got a couple room.and before we started, a staff asked us if we prefer light, medium or strong pressure, and if we have any injury, any area we want them to focus on for the massage etc. i thought that was pretty professional. we opted for the 210mins' aromatherapy session and it was really good. the therapists were petite but wow, they sure packed a punch! hubby was very pleased with his therapist coz he said she really exerted strong pressure for the 2 hrs' session which was pretty challenging. mine was quite good too that i fell asleep after 10mins. and the room is clean and smells good too. and they served us dragon fruit and bananas after the session. it was a good experience, am sure I will be back but will opt for a longer session.
I become a fans. Great value for service, professional masseuse, beautiful garden. If you've never been to a Divana Spa, start with this one, you won't regret.

Super Value Spa. Made a reservation via their website. (Glad i did that as i saw people walking in without able to get a slot)The counter service staffs are very attentive and amiable. My hubby and i were given a nice cold drink when we arrived, a cold towel to freshen ourselves up. We were being asked a few questions on our preferences during/for massage being having the therapists are being introduced to us.The couple room that we had is clean and cosy.We had Massage- Massage Lover : 3 hrs spa with scrub, aromatherapy massage and thai herbal compress. The service was unbelievable! Before having us to wash off the scrub, the therapists actually run the water to make sure the temperature is right for us! After scrub, before the massage begin, they even serve us a hot tea with a little snack.Only complaint that i have here, my therapist's skill is so inconsistent!!! she can go so fast and effortless at one moment, then become slow and hard in her pressure the next min, and it just kept changing. She is a very nice lady who try to ensure that the temperature in the room is ok for me etc.... but her skill is just so disturbing that i didnt enjoy the massage at all (especially when i saw my hubby who was enjoying himself so much with the skilled therapist just beside) He totally love his session so much and i am just so jealous.However the overall experience is still good and i will definitely go back if i have the chance (and make sure i dont get the same therapist again).

Good and worth for money. Want to book the shop at Sukhumvit but fully booked.So we booked another one at Silom called Divana virtual spa. My bf and I tried aroma massage (120 mins). Clean and spacious treatment room, therapist is professional and nice, reception is very details to describe the treatment details. Don't forget to print out coupon to enjoy 10-15% off. We spend around 2000B per person and I would said this service this price is worth for it.
Superb. One of the best Spa I've ever been. Professional, friendly, nice environment.

Tranquility in Busy Bangkok. Just a stone's throw from the new Terminal 21 and Asoke BTS, Divana spa is tucked away in an unassuming corner. When you walk into the premises, you feel like you are entering a mini-forest with various water features. Needless to say, it was very calming compared to the incessant honking you endure while walking down the main road to get there. A brief summary:This is a place the girls will like - clean, calming, nice decor, nice smells upon entering the waiting area, pleasant demeanour from all staffVery warm service from start to finish, really great. My gf and I were very impressed. Really enjoyed the welcome drink - pandan leaf drink of some sort, also they gave us refreshing mangoes after the massage, they offered an alternative when they heard my gf was allergic to mangoes.Rooms were very clean, nicely decorated and spacious as well (there was a shower, tub and toilet in the room)I had a cough while doing my massage and the masseuse stopped to get me a drink to soothe my throat, thought that was very thoughtful of herIf you are looking to relax and spoil your missus, this is a great place to visit. Be careful as Divana has a few locations, be sure to check the address beforehand.

Very professional and one more to Recommend. Always good experience at this Diviana SPA, until discovered another homy one, Siri Giriya Spa. The overall quality is equivalent but treatments are more pure by herbs and most important are heartworking therapists, warm welcoming receptionist and very reasonable rates. Now only stick on Siri Giriya Spa as first priority.

well worth every cent. Booked a 4 ½ hr Ayurvedic Rose quartz signature package for B$5005 or app A$150 (after discount coupon which you can download from website) for a truly indulgent experience. Located at soi 25, a 5 min walk from Asok BTS, the spa exudes a rustic charm with its timber flooring. While I also enjoy the different spas located within hotels, this one offers value for money especially if you are after packages which last 3 hours or longer. With the money saved, one can even take a taxi to soi 25. As the packages can be very popular, its best to use the reservation system and book ahead to avoid disappointment. Be warned, the experience is highly addictive and its not unusual to find one self wanting to return for another session.

Very relaxing and zen. This branch is the massage spa located at Soi 25. Walking distance from Asoke BTS. Very professional and clean. Sure I paid more than the mainstream in Bangkok but I still feel value for money. Spa exotique day spa was heavenly.

A wonderful indulgence. Two and a half hours of skin scrubbing and massage in a clean and professional establishment for 2,950 bht. BLISS!Don't be put off by the surrounding streets. And so easy to get to via sky train.

Relaxing spa but bad customer service. Two months ago I booked a 5 hour spa for June 11th by phone but their reception desk screwed up my reservation and missed my reservation (FYI , I also did a reconfirmation by email after the phone reservation). By the time I arrived Divana Massage and Spa, the front desk said bookings were full and transferred me to another branch. The quality of reception desk service should be improved as this is just turning customers away. It was a heart breaking experience and they did not even want to admit that it was their fault to screw up customers' reservations.

Wish I could come back here again and again. My best friend lives in Bangkok and she recommended this spa when we came to visit. We kept hearing about $5 massages off the street, but she said this place was worth the money (which honestly, it wasn't that much at all!). It was one of the most amazing and nicest spas I've ever been to!We came in and they sat us down with a cold drink and the menu. We decided to get a 90 minute couple's massage. After we made our decision, they came and asked us which oils we wanted and where we wanted more focus on and where to avoid. Then when our room was ready, they brought us in to change and had us sit down in chairs in the room. In front of us was a bowl of water with flower petals in it. The ladies then came in and put our feet in the bowls and did a slight scrub/massage to them before we climbed into the beds for the massage. And the massage....it was WONDERFUL! The girl noticed how tense I was on my left upper back and she worked hard on it! It felt incredible! My husband very much enjoyed his as well!After the massage, they left the room so we could shower, change, and get ready. They brought us back to the front room where they treated us with lemongrass tea and mango! The staff is incredibly nice and so efficient. I wished we had more time to have had a second experience! And I wish there were more like these out in the States!On a side note, we did end up doing a $12 dollar massage....it wasn't worth it...

Amazing spa experience everytime!. This day spa in the heart of BKK is perfection!! I've been going here since around 2002 or 2003. We go to BKK every couple of years to visit my family (I'm originally from Thailand) and go to Divana at least twice each trip. The setting of the place is gorgeous and the spa rooms are divine! They serve you Pandan tea and fresh fruit when you arrive and sometimes during your spa program if it's an especially long one (3+ hrs). The staffs are always very attentive and courteous. The products used (scrubs etc.) are freshly prepared and locally sourced. The spa programs are amazing. The price tag is very reasonable if you compare to what you can get in the US. You definitely get way more for you money. My only reservation is that the massage skill of the spa technicians are not spectacular .... probably average. If you want REAL massages (i.e. if you have some real back problems you need fixing) you'll need to go to some other more massage specialized places like Health Land. But for scrubs & wraps & facials Divana is great! They also have a little spa food restaurant attached but I've yet to eat there. And in recent years Divana has opened up 2 other day spa locations around central BKK as well. (See their website)

Scrub and massage . Fantastic spa! Infinity spa is clean and stylish with fantastic service. The staff are friendly helpful and thorough. The scrub and massage I received was just as I'd asked it to be concentrating on problem areas. Thank you! Will definitely be back next time.

Jet lag package!!!. I recently had the pleasure to try the triple service Jetlag package offered at this spa,and did not regret it! My masseuse was Kaew! She is an asset to the spa! Very professional conduct, with really good hands! I recommend this spa ! Price is a bit high but considering the quality of service and the spotless hygienic standard, it's good value for money!

Best spa in town! . This is the place to go if you're looking for a total relaxation and be pampered like a king / queen. Reservation process is really simple, did mine via whatsapp (look for their mobile number on the homepage) and it was answered within seconds! The ambience is modern and fun! The receptionists are friendly and attentive; speak good English too! Our masseuses are excellent and professional. You will never go wrong with this spa!

Best spa in the area. Excelente massage and very good service! The spa is super clean and with a good decoration that make a very appropriate ambient for a spa. I think I've tried all the spas around the area but this is my favorite. Been there several times and never got disappointed. It's a bit more expensive the the others.

Planet of peace & harmony . After a long flight and stressful day at work I just needed somehow to restart my body and mind. From the moment you step inside Infinity Spa, magic happens! Very elegant, modern, spacious but intimate place make you feel comfortable and relaxed. Many small details and meditation music make you feel like you're on another planet. I need to say a BIG thank you to Spa Concierge team- Gigi, Richard and Sunisa for being so professional, approachable and hospitable. They explained to me every detail about their massage's treatments. I choose Relax-atheraphy for 2 hours. The lady who made my day was definitely therapist Kat! She was high professional, discreet, warm and gentle to me. Since I have back pain, she was very careful so I did not feel afraid 'in her hands'. I would highly recommend this place as a one of those places that you want to come back again and again. I am just very sorry I don't have more days in Bangkok to try all treatments they have. It is like a 'private oasis of peace'. This world is very fast, people don't have time to actually live. So, take a moment and spoiled yourself in Infinity Spa! I will repeat it for sure.

World Class Spa Experience. Having worked in and managed a number of Spas and Salons at the higher end of the industry, I can say that without a doubt this is the best Spa in Bangkok.From the moment I walked in, to the moment I walked out I felt welcome and relaxed.Bee and Lucky hosted my partner and I and their service was second to none.The Spa Manager (and all other staff) was outstandingly professional, welcoming and attentive.Highly recommend this Spa for anyone who is seeking outstanding service in a clean and welcoming environment!Thank you Infinity Spa, we will be back!

Serene experience for all the senses. This spa is wonderful! From the moment I entered I felt welcome and appreciated. The reception staff explained the available services and the masseusse who worked on me, Sara, was attentive and very thorough. I could feel my muscles relax and my stress disappear. The air was sweet and the music was perfect. I would definitely return for another treatment when I visit Thailand in the future. I have been to spas in the US, Taiwan and Singapore. Infinity Spa is at the top of the list with the best ones. Thank you.

Great discovery. Recommended by a friend, also looked up on them on tripadvisor before booking. They have online booking which is convenient to reserve or cancel. I had relaxing spa for 90 minutes. It felt totally relaxed after a long trip. The store has comtempary and modern style decor that is very different to others. The staffs are very polite and have smiles from their heart. I loved this spa and immediately booked another one for the next day. This is a great place and I would love to recommend to everyone who would like to have a great Thai massage in Bangkok.

Great Spa in Bangkok. Booked online after seeing Tripadvisor reviews. Both of us had the InfinityAroma massage, a combination of Thai and aromatherapy massage. Wonderful experience. Would highly recommend. Lovely peaceful spa experience. Lovely modern space.

Good service and nice decor . This spa has nice modern design in the reception area. Service was friendly and masseurs are skilled. We had a good massage there. The design inside the massage rooms was very minimal though, completely different from the nice design at reception. But hey, you'll have your eyes closed most of the time anyway.

Best Spa in Bangkok. I'm an Emirates Crew, and I've been to many places for Massage, By far this is the best place in Bangkok, staff are very friendly and helpful, Especially David who even booked us a table in a restaurant...!

Relaxing experience. We walked in for Infinity Spa and were very courteously welcomed. They explained us the different types of treatments and what kind of oils would be used and their benefits. We chose the Infinity Signature for 90 mins which was a combination of Thai and aromatherapy and very relaxing experience. They took from us before what areas we wanted more concentration on and worked on those well. Post the massage we got chamomile tea and mango and sticky rice dessert :) Definitely worth a try ...
Perfect Spa. Best spa we found in BKK, even if it's a bit pricy. It is worth the money and a great expirence. Very professionel and serious.

Unforgettable experience!!!. It was my first Thai massage ever and I just wanted to have it done good. And Infinity Spa was perfect choice. I expected a simple service like these which you can see through glass doors in many places in Bangkok. But not there. Professional front desk (perfect English!!), welcome drink and a towel to clean the face, very good introduction of really huge offer and THE massage itself in private room. My masseur Lucky did fantastic job and thanks to it I know I will be returning to this place as often as I can. And one very important remark: do not compare prices with other massage shops. It simply doesn't make sense - just try Infinity's service and you will know why.

Unique Experience. This place was a sanctuary away from the frenetic streets of Bangkok. Did research early on and had no doubt in my mind that I had to pay this place a visit.Apart from being designed so beautifully, my therapist Cherry was very kind and absolutely professional. I immensely enjoyed my massage even though I had to dash off straight to the airport.Found the negative reviews to be hilarious. Complaints about size? It was perfect. Complaints about price, do your research and visit their website. Plan on returning my next trip to indulge in their 3 hour treatment.

Amazing. During my trip to Thailand I have been to this spa three times and every time it was truly amazing. I have had the revive facial, a head, back and shoulder massage and the infinity aroma treatment. I would absolutely recommend to do these treatments, they make you feel perfectly relaxed and ready to take on Thailand! Additionally the interior is very stylish and modern, quite difference from other spas where they would have a more traditional Thai interior, this makes Infinity stand out. The staff were absolutely amazing, I felt at ease and completely relaxed. Also, big fan of the oils that they use during the treatment. All in all, I can only recommend the Infinity Spa! Absolute must-go when in Bangkok!

Amazingly professional service!!!. I travel around the world and come to Bangkok pretty often and i always go to Infinity Spa as they pass trough a very intense training to deliver the best and most satisfying massage i ever had. I AM A FEMALE , i am 29 and i never made massage with a male and to be honest never expected that Lucky (thats the guys name) would be even better than any other female i had a pleasure to do an Infinity spa massage which is a mix of Thai and Swedish with aroma theraphy oils....Was absolutly amazing and is worth it every penny that to spend on it

Excellent. Really happy with everything with these guys. Olivia, the woman at the front desk. Was super friendly and efficient. Not pushy at all. Her english was perfect. We sat for a second with a welcome drink and face towel. And then off to an excellent two hour massage. Everything was great. Very clean, very relaxed, very good massage.

Totally the best!. The concierge at The Peninsula hotel recommended this spa to me. Have been here in Bangkok on business for 2 weeks and just had my fourth!! treatment. The place is immaculate clean and the staff speaks fluently English. My masseur Lucky was just amazing. And this is coming from someone who's getting massages weekly back home in Los Angeles. I can't speak highly enough of this place. Please go and visit and experience it for yourself. If you're looking for "more then the massage" this is the wrong place. No funny business going I here. Enjoy this place.

Disappointing. The spa is VERY modern looking. The treatment rooms feel like a capsule in a spaceship. Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly and the booking confirmed. We were seated and offered a Thai herbal tea and cold towel. We had selected a relaxation treatment but the hostess suggested their signature treatment...a combination of Thai and Aromatherapy. We were led upstairs where our feet were washed and then up three flights of stairs to the capsule. The treatment was all elbows and finger tips. At the end of it, I felt like I needed a massage. Not good. Perhaps we should have stuck with the relaxation massage but figured their signature would be good. Very disappointed especially after the trip advisor reviews were so complimentary.

Wish I could give 10 stars. I cannot recommend Infinity Spa highly enough. I was looking forward to it all week while I was sweating it out and running my body ragged trying to absorb as much of the city as possible, and it did not disappoint. I booked online, which seems to be a reliable process. I arrived half an hour early but did not have to wait; they immediately served me with a welcome drink and discussed with me which scrub / oils I preferred. I booked a mani/pedi spa which took place simultaneously; about an hour in total. Both ladies were highly professional and I was struck by the cleanliness of everything - the floors, the curtains all the towels and equipment that was used. I nearly fell asleep during the manicure, after which I was served mango sticky rice and tea. I then had the body scrub and massage, which was the best I have ever had. The masseuse, Sara, was highly intuitive and once again everything was clean and professional. I highly recommend the body scrub, particularly if walking in off the hot sticky street, because then after showering you are clean and ready for your massage. I chose the detox (lemongrass) oil and the lovely scent of it really added to the experience. I did my best to stay awake to really get the most out of it, but I did fall asleep at one point - despite the firm pressure I asked for. Sara really eased the tension out of a couple of painful places (who knew the inside of the shin could hurt that much) but what really cinched it for me was when, after mussing up my hair during the head massage, she had been me sit up and combed and braided it for me, which was somehow incredibly touching and made me feel special and cared for, not just as a client receiving a service. Some people I travelled with were surprised to find out how much I spent, as the novelty of an incredibly cheap massage in Thailand was what they were after; however as something I do so rarely I really wanted the best possible experience, and it was still a fraction of the cost the same service would be in Australia. I spent four hours at Infinity Spa and didn't want to leave. If I am ever back in Bangkok I will definitely return. Recommendation: if walking there, bring a fresh change of clothes, as you won't want to put your sweaty things back on after being so clean and having the lovely oil on your skin, which dries cleanly on without having to be removed.

Great Experience. My husband and I booked a couples massage. It was a very luxurious experience at an affordable price. The massage therapists were very skilled. The staff was welcoming and professional. Would definitely go back!

Detox Combo - a true remedy!!. I went there for the first time and was expecting an ordinary Thai massage. I was greeted by a very friendly Kikky who introduced me to different types of the scrub, aroma oils offering little samples for me to try and choose according to my needs. Then I spoke with Richard who made sure I am looked after and feel comfortable, all in a very professional manner. The real experience began when I have been taken upstairs by a lovely therapist Tarn. The scrub, followed by the massage and facial was an amazing experience. I could drift away thanks to relaxing, oriental music and soothing scents of the products applied on my body. Tarn made sure that I am comfortable at all times. I highly recommend this place ! Not to mention a sticky mango rice and a herbal tea served afterwards! Thank you!
Amazing experience. Thank you so much for two relaxing hours at the Infinity Spa. Really felt like a princess-everyone did an amazing job.

a non forgetable message.. . i 've been to many spas.. in my own country and as a traveller... sometimes when they knew u are a turist..they just won't pay mych attention to your satisfaction, but it wasn't the same in Infinity spa... they do care about there customer.. a very cool,clean rooms,with professional and friendly saff,who would do their best to help you get relaxed. i tried theri relaxing aroma message and basic foot message. and both were wonderful..they also had the manicure and pedicure servic which were great too.

Perfect relaxation. My girlfriend found this place on Tripadvisor. So she arrange the booking for us.We change the booking time from 3pm to 1.30 pm cos we don't want to keep shopping anymore. So we called to change the meeting and everything run smooth.First check in is okay. it look clean and nice design (my girlfriend love the shade very much). The nice lady was there to explain us everything (i'm sorry that i didn't ask her name).Next, they introduce us to meet our Therapy which i wish i could marry herShe WAS THE BEST THERAPY I EVER HAD!. all the pain from my shoulder are totally gone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and i feel like i was reborn!!I couldn't remember if her name was Laja or similar I end up keep them 5$ tip!!!!!!!!!! I wish to go back to Bangkok just for that!See you next time!Bunnie&Oilvia

No place like Infinity. This is definitely the best spa in town! They keep improving their service and giving me more reasons to come back!!! The ambiance, the staff, the products, the attention to details, everything in this place is close to perfection. I make sure to visit Infinity everytime I'm in Bangkok!

Fabulous Gem in Silom. Great start to a Saturday morning.. The mani n pedi n foot rubs were fabulous.. The staff are amazing n they also provide male masseurs for massages. Defo on my regular list in Bkk!

Amazing spa !!. Yesterday my mum and I visited the fantastic welcoming and warm team at Infinity Spa. We were totally spoilt for 3 hours as we indulged in their jetlag special. The gorgeous Olivia talked us through the products and we got to choose our scrubs and oils. The very clean and relaxing rooms made us feel totally relaxed within minutes. Thank you to Tanya who's massage was amazing. And thank you to Joy who met us upon completing our treatment with her amazing green tea and mango rice, what a delight ! The added bonus of having an uber booked back to our hotel completed our super experience at Infinty Spa.

So so. I went there a week ago.When you come in, a very nice girl explains to you everything you need in order to choose your correct treatment and the right oil and so. You feel you are in a good place.The prices were higher than in other places but I thought, I am in Thailand, still ok because it should be at least better than in other places.I was surprised because my therapist was a man. I have nothing particular against this, but after choosing so many small detail things, I wasn't asked about this. The truth is that I am not used to be touched by other men. Honestly, this is the first time this happened to me. The massage was to me very average. And felt unconfortable all the time the massage lasted. So, my experience was not as good as I expected.

Not worth to visit. After a long flight we arrived in Bangkok and went to this spa. I had foot massage for 1 hour. The spa was very clean and so were the therapists. But the massage was too firm. Anyway, the prices were above the average. There are by far better spas like Body tune and Dahra where you pay less and still get very good service and ambiance.

One of the best spa in bangkok. You will feel relax once your step into the spa. The environment is modern and relaxing. The staff members are friendly and nice. The massage is totally worth the price. The massage oil is superb that it will be absorbed into your skin quickly so you will not have to greasy feeling.

Nice place, average massage, above average price. Knew in advance was a bit more expensive than other similar places in Bangkok but initial impressions were good as its nicely decorated place. However the massage was not so good compared to others we tried in Bangkok before. Seemed the therapist was maybe tired because we visited in the evening.
great massage. great place and massage, a bit more expensive than other places, but very professional stuff.very close to labua hotel,

Not just your average spa in Bangkok . This was defiantly an experience. As I come to Bangkok quite a lot I have heard great things about this spa but never had a chance to visit... Today I did, and it was worth it. Firstly it's not like ur average low end spa like most of the places floating around the city. As soon as u walk in you greeted by well spoken hosts who go through the product and spa menu with you. Not leaving you in your own to flick through a book with pictures off the internet but in a book. My Battery in my Phn we dead and they were happy to charge it for me while I went for my treatment .They make their body scrubs in house and have amazing body oils I chose lemongrass and grapefruit. The interior is so modern and bright. The disposable underwear was one of my favourites thing.they were amazing quality and didn't make you feel like a baby wearing a nappy. Linens were clean, music and ambience was relaxing and staff were respectful to privacy. After the massage they brought a hot towel, a cup of tea and wait for it ....MANGO STICKY RICE it was the perfect way to wen my 2 hours of complete indulgence and relaxation and a very affordable price will defiantly be back and can't wait till I do

Fantastic Spa in Bangkok. For an almost 10 hours layover at Bangkok I wanted to treat myself to a spa instead of running around the city and so I researched for one that suits my taste and so I've chosen Infinity Spa. First, I emailed for a few questions and right away I received a response complete with directions from the airport and which train to take. I highly appreciate that as I easily found the spa.When I arrived, I was welcomed by lovely receptionists, very warm and friendly. A few minutes of briefing and getting to know what customers want during the course of the treatment is a great way to start together with a welcome drink. One main reason why I chose Infinity Spa because of its modern tranquil design, if I want to see wood carvings and golden buddhas I'd visit the temple instead. The treatment room is very clean, comfortable, simple yet tastefully designed.The focus is on the treatments they offer and products used. I chose a 90-minute relax-atherapy massage with the detox oil and a green tea body scrub. The therapist, Tanya, is absolutely amazing! As I am very used to massages, I asked for specific pressures on different parts of my body, and she nailed it during the entire 90-minute massage. She is very experienced and well trained and very polite. I enjoyed every minute of my 2 hours treatment at Infinity Spa.After the treatment, I was served with lovely hot tea and local delicacy. The lovely ladies at the reception suggested a very nice Thai restaurant for my dinner and even went out to show me the direction. This place is simply amazing - service, treatment and comfort. Dont look elsewhere, this is the Spa you need to try and I will book my next holiday to Bangkok just so I can get my treatment at Infinity Spa and try the 3 hour package. Big thanks to the team who put this spa together. It was a wonderful experience.

Amazing staff!. All staff were amazingly friendly, warm, and kind! The spa is well kept and very clean. The treatments were amazing! The massage was very relaxing and the masseuse was very attentive to my needs as well as the amount of pressure she applied. The manicure and pedicure are perhaps the best I've ever had! The staff were all so wonderful and had the cutest English ever! I recommend spending time here after the hustle and bustle of sight seeing!
Overwhelming and magnificent choice. After few days journeyed around Bangkok, that Spa is fabulous choice in order to relax and unwind. Enjoy your day and enlightenment of Buddha.

Absolutely Amazing!. Not only is the establishment very clean and well run, the services are absolutely a delight! Strongly recommended! We had issues with our Uber driver finding the location so they not only ensured our appointment was kept, at the conclusion they had a driver waiting for us and personally escorted us to the vehicle. We will be telling everyone how absolutely amazing this business is!

Total nirvana. I visited the spa for the first time during very tough period at work. I tried their signiture aroma massage. I was really able to relax, let go all my thoughts and reached the state of nirvana. Once I got home I slept like a baby, what didnt happen for very long time. Last time, I tried the infinity detox package and I loved it as well. I was afraid that I will be bored as it takes 3hours, however I enjoyed it sooo much. The staff is very professional, they even remember my name, I love their oils and small complimentary gestures like mango sticky rice after the massage. Thanks to infinity spa I found the place, where I can find my inner peace again. Keep up good work ka:)

Five star experience. Booked a 3 hour Jet Lag Package for myself and my husband had an Infinity Massage and Foot Massage. From the minute we walked in the door we were treated like royalty. My husbands therapist, Lucky, was so strong and my husband enjoyed every minute of his firm massage. My therapist, Thanya, was small but so strong! Both therapists were excellent and I would highly recommend either. The treatments were both luxurious and relaxing and everything you would want and expect from a spa such as this. Absolutely amazing.

Good service and hospitality . Searched for quite a number of reviews and found this place to be very good. Service and hospitality is excellent. Staff even offered and booked a cab from this place to my hotel. Massages and pedicure was very good.

Truly Amazing, Loved this Spa. Visited many spas in Bangkok. Usually did not comment as the spa experience was not totally enjoyable even visiting the best spas listed in Tripadvisor. This time, the experience at Infinity Spa was amazing and really deserves the good comment.The spa is spotlessly clean, partly due to the white interior decoration. We tried the signature Infinity Aroma massage + body scrub. Just as its description in website, a perfect combination of Thai massage and Aromatherapy. Stronger massage than other spa - strong on your tired body but does not hurt. Don't trust some spa owners that Thai massage is painful. Experienced therapists should feel your body. Your muscles would respond to their actions and the therapists would know the pressure applied is too strong or good for you. The only not so good comment is that the treatment room is small. The body scrub we picked is too fine for men.Truly enjoyable spa experience.

Very nice environment but bad treatment...... I just had a birthday trip to Bangkok for 4 days over the last weekend. I am a big fan of massage and undoubtedly a frequent traveller to Bangkok because of this. Since I only stayed for 4D3N this time I carefully picked 3 Spa to go with my wife and Infinity was the first one I visited, after surfing into TA website before the trip (as this one was almost on the top of the list with quite reasonable price). My first impression of Infinity Spa was really good - nice, clean and relaxing environment, friendly staffs, warm greetings, caring service......until I get into the major bit of my visit, the massage. I online booked the "Infinity Thai" package (2 hours massage plus herbal ball) well in advance and were assigned 2 young therapists, where we totally disappointed about the treatment that we received. The therapists were very inexperienced and frankly speaking totally not up to general standard. They seemed not really know the basic massage techniques. As usual, I was communicated clearly with the receptionist before my treatment that I preferred focus on shoulder and waist and avoid left ankle which I got slightly sprained lately. She also checked the form that I filled out and double confirmed my request verbally. However these requests seemed to be totally ignored afterwards. The therapist has spent quite some time kneading on my back (here and there without any strategy) but not much on my shoulder and waist. Besides she gave pressure to my sore ankle as usual until I told her to stop. When applying herbal ball she seemed not aware she needed to keep on moving without stopping at any particular area of my skin because of the heat. However she missed to do that and I needed to tell her when I felt overheat. Afterwards I also checked with my wife about her treatment and she has similar comments with her therapist.Honestly I have been to many spas in Bangkok and but talking about treatment this was really a bad experience. Luckily I got very good massages on the following days in other spa which doesn't spoil my birthday trip.

Design or boutique spa. After reading on TA, I choose the number 1 rated spa. But foremost because of the design, completely different then the traditional spas. Although I was a little late, after I called them they moved the treatment in time, which was not necessary but they did. After talking to the taxi driver he was able to drop me on the spot. And yes I like the multi story spa. Nice details on the building and clever functioning of lot of things. I did the Detoxifying package - 3 hours and all was perfect. They took the time to explain all choices of different products and run true the whole package in detail. Very good therapist and she understood firm-hard massage. All was a nice experience. When in Bangkok I will be back for sure. Can recommend to everybody. Thanks for the birthday cake very attentive. I think this is my first excellent 5 stars on TA!!!

Impeccable service . I was about 30 minutes late for my appointment as I got lost trying to get to the spa from BTS station. The spa is near to Holiday Inn Silom. The staff was kind to let me keep my 2 hour treatment time slot. The therapist, Cherry, was skillful and efficient. I felt so relaxed after the massage. The mango rice and tea at the end of the spa was a nice treat. Definitely 1 of the best spa I have ever been to. Thanks for the great service and massage.

Amazing. I didnt have very high expectations, but I was totally overwhelmed by this spa!!! Its perfect from the moment you enter it as the friendly staff are smiling, welcoming you and makes you feel special. Furthermore you get the feeling of inner peace by the delicious taste in interior and music. The sweet woman who gave me Infinity's signature massage took very well care of me and was very professional! I tried massage several times in Bangkok and its easy to understand why Infinity is BEST.

Best massage on our trip. Just go. Seriously. We always want more pressure than what we get, but this place delivered the best and strongest massage ever (they of course ask you what pressure you want before you start). Felt reborn, and regretted that we only went for the 90 minutes!:)

MASSAGE TO CHANGE YOUR LIFE.. If you don't come to infinity spa while you're in Bangkok, you're doing it wrong. My boyfriend and I had an incredible experience when we went for their signature massage. Not only was it the best massage I've ever had, they were incredibly professional, welcoming, and even served us mango sticky rice afterwards. On top of that, they helped ensure we had a safe, reasonably priced ride home. Highest recommendation. This place is the best.

Very relaxing. . After walking around Bangkok all day it was the perfect way to finish off the day. The massage was amazing and the service was great. You do need to book though as it is always busy with tourists, especially on weekends.

So good I went twice!. This place is exactly what the doctor ordered! I went the first day I arrived in Bangkok since I have been traveling for a while now and needed a good massage to relax me. This place is what I needed and I ended up go my back the night before I left. Everything about this place is wonderful! The staff is the best staff ever. They were so kind and sweet and they helped me arrange a reservation for dinner as well as teach me some Thai on my first night. Both of my masseuses were amazing, you can't go wrong there. And of course the place has a beautiful ambience. Trust me you can't go wrong here!

Amazing Spa!. The quality of the service and the ambiance is amazing. They use great quality products and their therapists are really skillful. It so worth travelling there even if you are not in Silom area. I cant wait to visit!

Exactly what i wanted !. I found the spa from trip advisor . It was 3 min from lebua hotel. Very lovely .clean . Relaxing place with kind ,polite ,informative staff. I chose 90 min massage with energizer oil and Miss cherry came to do the massage. I am medical doctor , and i knew that cherry is doing massage on every single muscle of my body . Most relaxing moments of my life . I chose firm massage and it was really very firm .it was so nice that i asked cherry to continue to 120 min . At end they served mango and sticky rice . I think this was the best massage i have ever had and i will definitely come to cherry in my next visit of bangkok .

What a Place . Upon our arrival to Bangkok Thailand, we suffered from jet lag and heat exhibition. Our daughter whose teaching in Bangkok suggested we get a massage. Of course this was self serving on her part. We took her up on her suggestion.

Charming staff, excellent service. My hubby and I have gone for a pedi mani at this spa. First we thought the place looks a bit sterile with the decor, a bit on the cold side but then we were welcome by a lovely receptionist, who was very helpful in settling us in. The pedi and mani was also great, we had 2 nail technician and both of them were super nice, fun chats and one was even trying to feed me mango sticky rice as my polish was still wet! They have also done a great job for both of us, especially my hubby has a cardboard thick sole, they managed to got them all smooth and silky. Thumbs up!

Best mani pedi in 3 months. I seldom write reviews, but this place was so exceptional, we have to leave a big thank you!! I was here with my girlfriend, we both got mani and pedi, she got a massage and I got a facial. First if all, the place is squeaky clean and beautiful. The staff are very professional and finally the treatments were the best in all of Asia - I have been traveling for a while- let me tell you the price is well worth it!! I have actually NEVER gotten a mani this precise! They used OPI shellack on me for no additional cost.

Friendly staff. We found this place on the net, since another spa we were recomended was booked for our last day in Bangkok. Our experience was great, the staff went out of their way to make sure we were happy and enjoyed our experience. They even helped us with Uber to get back to the hotel. Thanks.

Excellent in every way. I've done my time in Spas all over Bangkok, not to mention South-East Asia and this place tops the list.The atmosphere is the best I've seen yet: clean, air conditioned, good colour scheme. In addition, the greeters/reception girls speak perfect English and the masseuses's English is pretty good too! It makes a difference when you have someone's hands all over you and you worry that your comments of too hard or too soft might be misinterpreted.I went for the signature massage and it was lovely and just what I needed after a 2-hour wait+traffic jam journey from my meeting. I would definitely recommend it to anyone in Bangkok who is looking for a pampering experience!Also, the mango sticky rice at the end of the session is delish!

Perfect!. Arrived today in BKK and after deciding to take it easier on day 1 found this gem. I went ahead without a reservation and they were able to accommodate me. Friendly, helpful and overall just wonderful experience. Will hopefully make it there again before I leave!

VERY PROFESSIONAL AND PLEASANT:. Wonderfully helpful and relaxed staff who went out of their way to relax and take care. Its location is a little obscure but, worth the trip.Booking was easy and professional and, on arrival - everything was as it should be. For those looking for some quality pampering, this certainly fits the bill.

Massage. A great place. So clean and tidy with lovely staff. We went 3 times whilst in Bangkok for a week! We tried another large spa near by that was popular but it was awful and seedy in comparison. Don't bother going to any other spa in Bangkok - this place is awesome and just what you need.

Perfection!!!. To review this spa is a must(I was not paid a dime to quote a word)....infinity is continuity,Benji the owner himself briefed us my wife and I about his spa.A passionate person who truly respects his Guests and offer him the best experience;in regards to product and personnel equally.the concept of the decor is hospital color bluish green the color of purity and cleanness a healing institute...it's a definite come back .

Worth It!! . Spent my last night in Bangkok in this Spa for at least 3 hours, and I wouldn't want it any other way. Found out about it in TripAdvisor, and definitely the reviews speak for themselves. I fell asleep through most of it, and was only woken up as I had almost finished the treatment. Never realized 3 hours could go by so fast.

Great service . So friendly and so nice. We showed up with no reservations and they were able to accommodate us. They apologized that the couples room was not available, but my wife and I were getting different treatments anyway, so that was not an issue for us. My wife had the 2 hour oil massage and I had a 90 minute oil massage followed by a manicure and pedicure. All of our treatments were great and all the therapists were wonderful. You are also started with a foot wash and rub before all treatments and given slippers to wear around inside. As we were leaving we had called an Uber to pick us up and Richard the manager quickly rushed over and offered to call the driver as the drivers frequently miss the turn in to the spa. As expected the driver had passed the turn but was able to quickly turn around for us. Overall a great experience. Prices were a bit higher than other spas but definitely worth it for the extra service and cleanliness.

We didn't want to leave. Not only are the employees helpful and so kind, the massages are amazing, and the design/ decor is clean and relaxing! We had a 30min body scrub, 2 hour Swidish massage, followed by a 1 hour facial. My only complaint... I can't move in and live in this place... Will be coming back EVERYTIME I'm in Bangkok!!

100%Relax . I enjoyed the infinity signature massage and it was extremely good. Thanks to Cherry, her hands made my body overcome the jetlag and the muscle pain.Ambience is very clean and people are very helpful and professional. I will definitely come back

Amazing Spa . The spa is situated at Silom street and easily access via road or BTS. Booking is highly recommended as the spa really famous by visitors. They are properly managed and the assistance will guide you to the best package that suit your need. The spa is clean and the staff is of highly professional. You can choose female or male masseur and the aromatheraphy oil. Its worth to visit and will surely visit again

5+ star spas in bangkok. This place is really cooool place. After 90 mins of massage totally relaxed. A must comeback to place. Really loved this place from the time you walk in. Cool water to cool you down. Then it's amazing place.

Awesome spa experience. Love love love this place! We went twice during our 5 days in Bangkok and had we found it sooner, we would have gone more :) The customer service is awesome, the massages amazing, and next time we are in Bangkok this will be our first stop for sure!

Perfect Spa Experience. My wife and I dropped in without an appointment and were treated like VIPs from the moment we arrived. I can assure you this establishment is professional and respectful to the highest standards. The owners are a lovely couple who were both present and quite friendly. Clean and modern appointments throughout the facility including staff who were all wearing tidy (and conservative) uniforms. Each treatment option was explained including a sample of each scrub/aroma/oil available to try. We both opted for body scrub and relax-a-therapy massage which were lovely. They even had adjoining rooms (each with private shower) so that my wife and I could enjoy the experience together. Will definitely go back.

Impressed! Very slick and modern, unlike any other Spa I've been to in S.E.A.. Visited Infinity spa last week and I left very impressed. As soon as you walk in you are warmly welcomed by all the staff. They sit you down and serve you with well presented refreshments while they explain and recommend which massages and services they provide and what would be best for you(as we were walk-in customers). They had very good knowledge of all their treatments and products they provide. The atmosphere and whole ambiance of the spa is extremely relaxing. Modern, simplistic and clean, very easy on the eyes, you can see they have put a lot of time & thought into every little detail..to the furniture,the lighting, to the music. Tip top.My two friends and myself had all chosen the same 60 minute head,neck and back massage and the only issue was...it wasn't long enough! Very relaxing massage, oils were good, not like those synthetic oils you are given where you feel like you need to shower straight away. They use quality products here. We all thought the masseuses knew exactly what they were doing, the 60minutes whizzed by and then at the end, they served us more refreshments...lovely scented hot towels, hot tea, and even mango sticky rice. Definitely will be back, and next time will not make the same mistake of only getting the 60minutes!

Basically a religious experience.... Not usually one to review but after the WONDERFUL warm welcome, incredible customer service and the best massage of my life, infinity spa has been by far the highlight of my trip to Bangkok and I can't recommend it highly enough.
