After Shopping Massage. True to say it is all old traditional massage. Very rustic and nostalgia both in the interior as well as the ambience. But superb massage.. Will visit again.

Great Experience. We visited this shop in 2007, we couldn't forget the Thai massage experience there. We went to Thailand again so we had no hesitation to try this shop again. The massage therapists didn't disappoint us - one lady and one man. After first try their skills, we decided to book them throughout our visit. However, the man was on vacation so my hubby had no choice but to try another one. We went to this shop 3 times in our 5-day trip. The service is good. Whenever I sent them e-mail to make reservation, I got immediate feedback.We will be back!
Bad vibes. this is not the place to go for a relaxing massage. The staff all looked unhappy. The receptionist couldn't have looked less interested if she tried. I couldn't wait to leave.

Mediocre foot massage. This massage studio was near our hotel so decided to give it a try since it looked like a personable kind of place with it being a traditional Thai house and its small size. The prices are reasonable. I wanted a body massage but when I was told it would be on a mattress on the floor like a Thai massage, I decided to just take a safe option and go for a foot massage since my feet and legs were tired anyway. They have only two massage chairs which are fairly small compared to other places in Bangkok. So the seating itself wasn't very comfortable to start with. They also had a portable AC/fan which didn't provide enough cooling. The massage itself was more painful than relaxing. The masseuse didn't speak very good English but even with my sign language and face expression of pain - the message didn't get through. In the end, I didn't leave feeling any better than when I arrived.

Great massage. Recommended to try this spot by friends and they were certainly right. We visited with another couple and had a mix of Thai, aromatic oil and body scrub treatments.Everybody in our party enjoyed the experience. The premises were clean, staff friendly and efficient with shower facilities available if required.Definitely recommend this massage based on our visit and an easy walk from our hotel (Banyan Tree).

Brusque, efficient and I kept going back for more. I love getting massages wherever I travel and this place had a charm of its own. It's amusingly brusque in its service and the two therapists I had were both quite good. I'd recommend it.

Very good massage. I tried the foot massage very good. The place is very close to silom, but it is in a small house out of noises amd very relaxing.
I do raccomend for who is between sathorn and silom areas

good price and good massage. They offer good massage technique and with good price.
However, if you do thai massage, remember to ask for "bau bau"--> means softer in thai
because the therapists are magically strong

Still one of the best massage afterall in BKK. I frequently visited Ruen-Nuad for Thai Massage for the past two years. It has been one of my top favourite massage spot in Thailand. I have experienced something dishonest (tried to confuse me on the balance of money that I paid) during my last trip in Bangkok in June. I thought to give Health Land a try on my recent trip and I have to agree that Ruen-Nuad is still one of the best. Although this is not a high class and customer service orientated spa but this will be the right place if you are looking for some serious deep tissue massage. I have to admit that the reception is bossy and unfriendly but I will definitely return again in my next BKK trip.

Love It! My Must-go Each Time!. Advanced bookings a must! Reflexology not so good n not worth paying for. Street shops may be better. But Thai massage and oil massages are good with shower facilities. Tips are expected for all masseurs. Terribly loudly ones, I will never give. But if it's satisfactory, market rate is 100bht. Not so good but tolerable, 50bht should be okay. Like the ambience and therapists r properly skilled. Been visiting since they opened 10 years ago..

Nice massage but unwelcoming. I recently popped in here while my daughter was staying at BNH Hospital - it's immediately across the road so very convenient.As other reviewers have mentioned, the reception is very perfunctory and a little frosty. Your belongings are put in a locker at reception while you have your massage so you may not want to have any valuables with you when you visit.My massage was great and the masseuse worked through all the tricky spots on my back.At the end of my massage, I realised the masseuse was waiting for a tip. I wasn't expecting this and only had 20 baht in small notes. I thanked her warmly and gave her the money I had. She then turned to other staff and pulled a face to indicate she wasn't happy with the tip. I left feeling very embarrassed.So I guess if you do visit, you may be lucky and get a great massage, but not a warm welcome. And be prepared to leave a more generous tip than I did.

Dishonest...worst experience ever. This was my 2nd visit to Ruen-Nuad. The 1st experience was above average but the 2nd one was the worst ever. I just came back from Ruen-Nuad Massage Studio literally 2 hours backed. I found the reception lady (around 50s) was dishonest as she tried to confused me between 500 and 50 bath. I paid 1000 bath for 1 hour thai massage (payment will be collected before treatment at Ruen-Nuad). Was kinda rush afte4 i arrived as i am the last customder. I am sure about this as I only brought 2000 bath in my pocket as the hotel I am staying is just 500 meters from the massage studio. Well, nothing to be discussed about since I only realized after I walked back to my hotel. I will definitely take this as an experience not to visit this massage studio again. Healthland has much more better environment and skill, cheaper price and the most importantly, the ethical of doing business.

JUST AVERAGE. I visited Ruen Nuad in April for an aromatherapy massage. The place is conveniently located just off Convent Road behind the Naj restaurant. It is in an old Thai house, quite pittoresque. But this is the only really positive side of Ruen Nuad. I was greeted by the receptionist in a short and curt way, not at all thai style. The massage room was basic but clean. The massage was rather rough and tough, not your usual aromatherapy massage. For value of money you will find far better places in Bangkok. Spend a couple of hundred Baht more and treat yourself to a really good massage.

my must-go place in bangkok. ruen nuad is a two-floor villa locating in the convent road, perfect getaway from the noise and hustle of silom road and patpong market. There are not that many rooms in the studio, which means the masseuses have more time and concerntration on a guest. I always choose to do the aroma therapy, which is a perfect way to end a hot day in bangkok. And the price is reasonable, 850THB for 90mins Aroma therapy and 1150THB for 2 hours. You can choose the aroma oil you like, rose, lavender, lemongrass, relaxing, energy… The masseuses here are well-trained and quite professional. Tell them you like it to be softer or harder, it depends on how much pressure your body can take. Don't forget to tip them after the session. And never forget to make a reservation before you come, since its business is booming. The free wifi connection there is poor. Just forget about ur cell phone, and enjoy a good relax. Never do massage when you are full, rather do it starve. BTW, there are a lot of good resranrants nearby, such as Banana Leafs, Bua…you can have a good bite after a good massage. The nearest BTS station is Salang dang. Ask the locals where is the convent road, and the studio is in the courtyard opposite to the BHN hospital. Try it and hope you like it as i do.

Spa behind the cooking school. At the end of the lovely old architecture, greenery infused lane of the Naj 'campus', is a small-ish spa with some of the best massages in Bangkok. For 850 Baht I had 1 1/2 hour Aromatherapy Massage which was expertly done in a clean and comfortable setting. It's not super posh, but the woman had strong, experienced hands and I felt well worked over and relaxed when she was done.

Disappointed. Period.. Visited here literally 5 hours ago with my husband - yes, we are visiting here for our honeymoon. We choose 60mins thai massage. Even though I asked the owner when I was making a booking about a month ago and today onsite for the best massuse, I don't think she assigned 'the one' to me unfortunately. My massuse kept chit chatting to her colleagues who were giving massage to the customers next/ opposite to my room and also checked the clock very often. No good!Also, as it was my husband's very first Thai massage in his life I wanted to give him a good first impression but it seems like 'mission failed' as he did not enjoyed that mush either. I went to Thann spa at Graysorn, actually it was the day I arrived in bangkok, and it was WAY better. Of course the price at Thann is about 5.5 times more expensive but I learned again that you get what you pay for. Never back here again....and I strongly recommend you other 'better' places like Thann if you fancy some special experience!

mixed feelings!. visited this joint in 3 consecutive days during my visit in bangkok in late Dec 2013:Day 1: i booked myself for a traditional thai massage while partner had a aromatic oil massage. we booked ourselves for a 90-min session and i told my partner that this joint seems to be a must-visit given the raving reviews on tripadvisor. we were not disappointed at all on our first visit though we felt that the receptionist was very cold, unfriendly and unwilling to provide a simple service. however, we were assigned two solid masseuse and i truly had one of the best massages ever! she focused so well on the tight knots on my shoulders and neck. i am one customer who always prefers a masseuse that has a pair of strong hands, so this particular masseuse assigned to me did a great great job! partner enjoyed his very much too. also, we were given a private room with air condition and ensuite bath room. i am not sure if the receptionist charged us 100 baht per person on the use of private room. even if she did, the money spent was worth it.day 2: thinking that each masseuse must be skillful and strong, we returned with high hopes. ah, we met the very cold service provider again and this made me and my partner realized that given the types of service we encountered in bangkok so far, thailand is no longer a land of smiles.this time, my partner chose the traditional thai massage as well as i did. the moment i met my masseuse, i knew very well this session would be a very very bad one. she did not look energetic and literally dragging her feet when she walked. it is not difficult to judge a person in the service line with her body language. throughout my session, the very gentle masseuse merely stroke my skin, pound lightly on my thighs and back and there was not a time i felt any good pain from stroking the right knot or releasing any tension. such a disappointment from the high standard i experience the previous day. my partner was equally disappointment with his masseuse.day 3: giving it a final try on our last day. we had enough body massage over the past two days and since we just had our breakfast, we thought of trying the foot massage at Ruen Nuad. We were the first customers at10am. Staff who saw us did not bother to smile at us. when one of the managers attended to us, her service is more profound and friendly than the lady we met the previous two days. i also requested a masseuse with strong hands but was utterly disappointed. i had a lady assigned to me while a male masseuse for my partner. the male masseuse is well built but according to my partner, the masseuse strength was that of a young kid even though partner requested stronger rubs. i was not impressed with my masseuse either. i guess in thailand, they are recognized for their thai massage and not foot, so let's just choose what they are good in. one very common behavior of all masseuse is that they will wait for you to finish collecting your stuff from the locker and as they ushered you out of the door, they were hoping to receive a tip from you. Would i return? perhaps and it would be a gamble of luck to be assigned a good masseuse. and this time, i would ask for her name. alternatively, there is always a Healthland to rely on.

Total Let Down. Wow! All I have to say is wow, because I was not expecting that. I read all these top reviews and went there with my wife with high hopes. I wonder if these prominent reviews had brought them a growth, now that they are unable to maintain the same service. It’s a hit or miss, here is what happened:I made an advance reservation for me and my wife at 4pm. We got there right on time, and then I was told they only have a (male) masseur for me. They did not indicate that to me at the time of the booking. However I had few tight spots in my shoulder and neck, so I was really looking forward to have it taken cared, so uncomfortably went ahead. My wife got a masseuse for her oil massage. This guy either did not understand a word I said or pretended like he did not, because I showed him my neck and shoulders, pointed the tight spots, yet he spent 90 minutes working on my legs! I had no idea he took 90 minutes as I did not keep track of time, but realized it when he only spend 10 minutes on my shoulders and told me the times up. What a disappointment, I went back to my hotel and got another 1-hour head and shoulder massage. On the other hand my wife said it was one of the best massages she got in her life. She was extremely satisfied with her masseuse and still talks about it. You take your own risk and go there, because it's a hit or miss. I sensed a bit of arrogance at the front desk, may be it is because now that they have been featured on CNN Travel ect. Also there were lot of return customers, may be they just give special treatment for those, and give us, the new customers, second class treatment. I don't know, whatever it is, I would not go back there, instead stay in the hotel and go back to the masseuse at my hotel, which is convenient and delivers what they advertise for my money.

good price, great basic thai massage. I have been here on several different trips to Bangkok and have always had a great massage. I have had both a foot massage and a traditional thai massage, and would recommend either. The thai massage is in a small room with a mattress on the floor and the foot massage is in a shared room with multiple chairs, so it definitely is no frills, but the therapists are great. As mentioned in other reviews, not all of them speak English, but I have not had a problem communicating my preferred strength of massage. I will definitely return on my next trip to Bangkok.It can be a bit hard to find. it is located back from the street across from the BNH hospital.

Highly recommended for traditional Thai massage. Since 2005, my wife and I are regular customers at Ruen Nuad, located in a cozy traditional house opposite BNH hospital. No fancy stuff here, but the real deal at very good rates. We normally opt for the traditional Thai massage or the foot massage. As most of the therapists are not very fluent in English, it is best to explain your preferences (soft, medium or hard pressure, focus on back or shoulders, no twisting etc...) to the staff at the reception.

1st time was a charm here!. This was recommended by a friend here and it was amazing. Its a hidden gem in the middle of the city. If you are expecting a glamorous setting, then this is the wrong place for you. If you just want a great, traditional massage, then this will be perfect for you. Around 800 baht for 60 minutes, which I found to be one of the least expensive places. Although I have had only a few massages in my life, I believe it to be of high quality. (I ate a nearby "Eat Me" restaurant and I'd definitely recommend that place as well).

Traditional massage at its best. Ruen-Naud offers traditional massage ..... and they are very good at it. This is not the place to go if you are after a pampering massage with great smelling oil and the soft sound of music or water. But if you are looking for a solid fuss-free traditional massage, then this is most definitely the place to go. The masseurs have great hands, and they have an uncanny way to know where are your sore muscles even without you having to tell them. I have sensitive calfs, and in the past have experienced cramps in the hands of many less experienced masseurs. At Ruen-Naud, the masseurs held my calfs firm and proceeded with firm strong strokes at my calfs ..... no cramps, and my calfs felt so relaxed thereafter. We have a heavenly 1.5 hrs oil massage.Most definitely will visit again in my next Bangkok trip, this time for 2 hours :)

Great massage, tranquil atmosphere, excellent value. My wife and I dropped in one afternoon and were quickly taken care of by the smiling host. She assigned us masseuses, a guy for me, and a woman for my wife, who took us for a great massage. The building it's in is an anachronism for the neighborhood of Silom—an old-style Thai house among office buildings. A very peaceful escape from the street. Massages are great value and we'd definitely return.One word of caution: the name sounds a lot like "Renewed" when said by Thai people, so if someone recommends Renewed Massage, they mean Ruen-Nuad. Thank them for recommending a good place, then hurry here.

Good traditional Thai massage wrapped in a basic package. We went there without any reservation after reading some review at the CNN and happened to stay at Silom. A 5 minutes walk from Sala-Daeng BTS and it was right across BNH Hospital. We never tried any Thai massage before and our first experience was spent well in Ruen-Nuad. The masseur are very skillfull and knows how to work the arms and hands in the right pressure to our muscles. We tried for the 1 hour Thai Massage for 350 B and regret why we did not taking the 1.5 hour or the Spa package instead. The place was very basic, as in wooden floor and matress lying on the floor, but the sheet was clean and tidy. No specific aromatherapy, music and ambience for relaxation as you would expect in high rated spa, but the simplicity just catched my attention. The bathroom is clean and again very basic. We were given a clothes in humongous size during the massage. After the massage we were given a special herb but unfortunately below our standards (as we come from the country of very strong and delicious herbal drinks- Java). The receptionist were very straightforward in making us select the package without having to explain each packet. Probably language barrier.

Pleasant & Relaxing Massage. I read several other reviews and Ruen-Nuad is definitely not value for money. It is priced exactly the same as the countless other massage places in BKK. But it is cheaper than in more developed countries.This is a very nice massage place. The masseuses are skilled and know exactly what to do to work out the kinks and issues in your body. It is basic in its delivery. For example, it is not luxurious as you my see in some of the higher-priced places but the massage you get is no worse which is the reason I will come back again and again.Make sure to call for reservations on all days of the week although they do accept walk-ins if they have availability.

Therapeutic massage. If you are looking for masseurs who are only keen to knead out all the kinks in your body, look no further. This is the place to go in Silom. I have chronic neck pain and an hour session here relieved the pain much better compared to 5 sessions of Chinese massage (certified) I have back home.

Basic but good. Hubby had the 1.5-hour Thai massage at 500bht and while I went for the 1.5-hour Aromatherapy oil massage at 850bht. The whole set up is very basic. Wooden house with wooden floor boards. Bathroom in private room again simply decorated (mosaic tiles) but very clean. Massage was on a mattress set on the floor. Therapist was very good. Really knew where the kinks were and expertly massaged them out. Five stars for massage, three stars for the rest (no tea served, receptionist could do with some EQ training, pay upfront so you can't ask for [partial] refund if disappointed). Would recommend just for the massage alone.Directly opposite BHS Hospital. Set away from the road.A good review of the place: http://www.mycitybangkok.com/ruen-nuad-massage-studio-bangkok.html

Authentic massage.. In Thailand is very easy to find massages places, they are everywhere. So, it's easy to have fake and bad massage. I found this place looking for :" where to find authentic massages in Bangkok" and it is a place where I can really could experienced a real massage. The place is cozy and cute, in a wood house. It's clean and quiet. The middle-age lady that worked on me really knew what to do, and she had good technic, very professional.The prices are very honest.I strongly recommend the place.

Excellent massage at a value for money price. My wife and I had come here in May 2013 at the recommendation of a Thai colleague. We made an appointment for a 2 hr Aroma massage and got to Ruen-Nuad after walking about 10 minutes along Convent Road from the Sala Deng Skytrain station. (It's located opposite BNH hospital for those who prefer to take a taxi.) We were shown to a couple's room which also had an adjoining outdoor private shower area. After the shower, the massage took up the rest of the 2 hours. Both masseurs were skilful and we enjoyed the experience. Total cost was less than US$100. Don't expect very fancy surroundings like at the Oriental Spa though - the facilities are a little rustic but it's fine for the price. We will return in future.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G.. I've visited this massage studio twice, and it has been fantastic both times. Unlike many of the mediocre massages you can get in BKK, the masseurs at Ruen-Nuads know their stuff. Traditional Thai massages can be a little more intense than the Swedish massages we're used to in the west, but I always leave feeling like a relaxed puddle of goo. Fantastic!

Authentic massage and went twice in 3 days!. I hurt my back recently and has been seeing a Chiropractic doctor since 1 month ago. While I was planning my itinerary, I dare not do anything to my back, as I was very fearful about the crackling of my backbone! I asked around for recommendations, and so I found this studio. I took up the scrub with trad. massage at first and fell in love with it. The rice scrub smoothed my skin thoroughly and the massage session was simply assuring. The lady who massaged me used adequate strength, and avoid the crackling on my back.3 of us felt so relaxed after the 1.5 hours session. We went on the day after, and had other therapists working on us. I told the lady in simple english, about the fall i had on my back. She then used Tiger Balm to massage on me. I felt so much better, less-stressed back, that I could continue on my shopping spree. I strongly recommend this.

We both loved it and rebooked again for 2 days later!. We had a very nice experience here and sorry to hear that others didn't. We both had a 2 hour aroma massage for Thb 1150. You pay first and then choose the oil you want; there was Energising, Lavender, Mint, Relaxing but we went for Lemongrass. You lock your belongings away and then are shown to your room which is clean and basic. A mattress on the floor, basic bathroom attached with a shower and toilet + shampoo and body wash. Shower first, the 1.5 hours of deep tissue body massage. Brilliant. Then they get you a cup of herbal tea and start the head massage and final back massage for the remaining 30 mins. After a full 2 hour massage you can shower again (I quite liked the lemongrass oil on me for a bit longer) then it is all over. I tipped around 15-20% as I was that pleased. TIP: you will be pretty much naked for this massage save a few towels placed over you. If you are uncomfortable at all, you should request a male or female masseur as you see fit. I wouldn't recommend keeping any underwear on though as they pull, stretch and knead the full length of your back to your buttocks. Also be sure to request a couples room if you want it done with a partner as they won't book this as standard. Afterwards you will feel relaxed and we were tender but still wanted to have one 48 hour later before we left. Great.

TERRIBLE!! Not worth any single penny. I booked over the phone for 2-hrs of Thai Massage after checking the review on the TA because my usual massage place, Health Land is fully booked for the whole day. I noticed some of the negative review but think it was worth a try and expecting not much can go wrong for a simple Thai massage.I booked for 5pm appointment and notified them that I would be coming late and re-booked for 515pm instead. All went well, and I arrived at 515 pm. It was 3 guests in front of me and I must wait, around 10 mins, not a big deal. As it was very hot outside and after a long walk, I decied to take shower first, They informed that Thai Massage not include shower and it will be 20 baht extra. I didn't mind to pay and took 10 mins of shower. So basically the massage was started at 535 pm.The session itself wasn't so bad, but around 7 pm, the masseuse was keep looking at the small clock and looks confused. She informed me that my massage should already finish by 635pm!! I was so suprise as I booked for 2-hrs massage. I explained to her but she didn't speak english well so she showed me the small note/receipt from the reception showing that I started at 1635 (435pm) and should finish at 1835 (635pm) !!!I asked her to check with the reception again and advising her that i came at 515pm and the actual time should be 535 pm instead of 435 pm. So she went to see the reception and been advised that the person already change shift and gone home. But it seems she has everything settled and start massage again. Around 715pm, she stopped the massage and said already finish. Now I was becoming really upset and again explaining to her that I started at 535 pm , so I should be entitled for at least another 20 mins, not including the amount she must left me to check with the reception.She seemed didn't understand what I was saying so I was asking the manager came to see me. She left me in the room for around 5 mins. Honestly I didn't feel a mood for a relaxing massage anymore, Everything just left me in a very bad mood and experience. So I changed my cloth and ready to went out. I went down to the reception/cashier and found 2 new ladies attending the desk. They were saying that my reservation was for 515 pm and that was why the massage stop at 715 pm. I explained to her again that it was a mistake and the actual massage was started at 535 pm and the time on the small note was supposed to be 1735 instead of 1635.I asked for my 1 hour of money back so they returned me 100 baht. (2 hrs session cost 600 baht and 1.5 hrs cost 500 baht).I left the facility upset and not refreshed! This place is definitely not worth any single penny. Health Land is much much better and even cheaper than this.Please save your money and do find some better option in Bangkok. There are so many much more over there.

Very Good Massage at Affordable Prices. Don't expect much service (greet / smile / thank ) from the receptionist, who collects full payment before your treatment starts. The value you get from this place is when the actual massage starts...wooo...7th heaven. We had the aromatherapy treatment at the couples room and both my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the massage. Think we paid something like THB800 per person for 90 mins. Highly recommended ! Just take a taxi to the BNH hospital main entrance, and you will find this place just acros the 2 lane road directly infront. Better still, after the massage, treat yourselves to good food at Secret Garden or Bann Kanitha which are within walking distance.

Fantastic!. I only visited once. But, it was a pleasant experience ... shame I don't live in BKK or I would be there at least once a week.The place is very nice and conveniently located and the people working there are very welcoming.I really enjoyed my 1hr Thai massage and the friend of mine I went with really enjoyed his 1hr Oil Massage.Highly recommended!

Very Relaxing. My son & I had an hour long massage here last Friday before we were due to fly home on Friday night. As I had a bad back for a couple of days I found the massage helped and got rid of the pain that I had been having. It was very relaxing and the service was good. It cost 350B each for the hour. As we didn't have a booking we were asked if a male would be ok this was fine for both my Son and myself.

In Decline....... I used to live in Bangkok and was a Ruen Nuad regular for over 4 years. It used to be small and friendly. I just returned on a short visit to Bangkok and had a very unprofessional and un-relaxing experience. It now appears the place is too busy, and its systems can't cope. It no longer has what made it a great place. I see other reviews here confirm it's now a bit "hit and miss" which s such a shame. I was about 45 mins into a 90 min massage when the woman from the front desk/reception burst into my private room telling my masseur he had a booking and dragged him away (note that they take the fee upfront so I agree, he had a booking, ME!!) There was no communication with me. She'd brought a replacement masseur who looked a bit confused and dumbfounded. I tried to give it a go for 10 mins but the whole relaxing vibe had been destroyed by the intrusion, the style was different, he didn't know what had been done or not done etc so I excused myself and left. I've never had such an unprofessional experience at a spa in my travels. If the small, friendly local place is no longer small and friendly then you might as well go to a Healthland or similar - larger, but more professional than that. If you expect your private room to be private and your massage to be uninterrupted give some other place a go.

Same massage but higher price :(. 1 hour Thai massage is 350b. But normally silom area price is 250/hour. So this shop is more expensive by 100b.For me, there is no reason to pay more for the same service.And some building is under construction next to the shop.It makes quite noisy...

Great massage. Family of 5 had the 1 hour Thai massage. The setting was very peaceful, clean and tidy. All of us enjoyed the experience and would recommend it, especially if you are new to Thai massage. Can be easily combined with food and shopping markets nearby.

Unclean - hit and miss with masseurs 2.5/5.0. My wife and i decided to try a massage each due to the TA reviews and we were only a 5 minute walk away (staying at the metropolitan) - as well as the price (compared to the metropolitan). On our way we 'bumped' into an elderly Thai man who said the massage places around were not very clean. Well for me that was the overall feeling. There were no pillow cases on the pillows (i needed to ask for 2 towels to cover - the 1st one being dirty) and the beds did not seem very clean either. I found it very hard to relax due to it feeling dirty. The massage man i had was good but seemed to be in a bad mood and it was all over within 45 min or so (i had requested a 1 hour massage). The other issue i had was there was some construction noise next door which didn't assist in relaxing. On the other hand my wife had a very good masseur (Nid) and she had a much better space in a room with an outside shower out the door. She found it quite good, but also felt it could be cleaner. Overall i wouldn't return.

Excellent traditional Thai massage. I was feeling apprehensive about trying this place based on some of the reviews I read, but both my visits over a three-day period were very positive.I dropped in without an appointment on a busy Saturday but I still only had to wait five minutes for a massage. The woman at the front desk was friendly and helpful. I chose the 1 1/2 hour traditional Thai massage instead of the two-hour because I wasn't sure how much I would like it. My therapist, Pom, was amazing. She told me she had 24 years of experience and it was one of the best massages I've ever had. Her English was basic but we were able to communicate well; she was very sensitive to my needs and checked frequently to make sure everything was OK. She really worked out the knots in my body, which sometimes hurt, but I like a really strong, intense massage.I booked with Pom again a second time for two hours a couple of days later. This was at 10am on a Monday and I was the only client there for most of that time, so if you want a very quiet, peaceful experience, first thing in the morning on a weekday would be a good time to come. I was still a bit sore from the previous massage two days before and she added Tiger Balm and oil to the massage and backed off the intensity a bit on the sore spots to make me more comfortable.Pom told me she does not recommend the one-hour traditional Thai massage since it is too rushed, so if you are starting out, you could try the 1 1/2 hour massage to see if you like it. If you know you don't like an intense massage, the oil massage may be a better way to go.

awesome. been in bkk numerous times and they are consistently good. don't expect the full meal deal. this is basic, but they provide a great massage. it is a hole in the wall but clean, fresh and very attentive. if u are expecting a high end experience, try to Sukhothai spa or the Mandarin Oriental. But if u need someone to work on those sore tired shopping muscles at a very reasonable price, this is it.

Not very soothing. It's probably luck of the draw, but the massage therapist I drew just left me feeling sore, and not in a good way. I had the 2-hour traditional Thai massage for 600 Baht. It was performed in an open cubicle and I could hear other clients talking on their cell phones even though there was a sign telling them not to. I actually had much better massages at mom and pop storefronts in the neighborhood by my riverside hotel.

Ok. Went here with my bf after having read the positve reviews here on Tripadvisor. We both went with the 90 min Thai massage. We got to share a "booth", which was nice. However, the massage wasn't all that. It wasnt bad, but not spectacular either. The masseuses hardly spoke one word of English which made it hard to communicate, but other than that they were all smiles and very polite.

Awesome Massage, Best I Had So Far!. I'm an Indonesian with javanese blood. I know massage since young. Fall in love with it's surrounding and a cute building.For 700 baht, I got amazing 1 hour oil massage. Pa Tum is my massause and she is really good. It is a serious massgae and she doesn't talk as much as other massause in other place.Definitely recomend my friends and families when they visit Bangkok!
SUPER PROFESSIONAL MASSAGE. I love the atmosphere in Ruen-Nuad Massage Studio, just like doing massage at home, very cozy. I had a 2 HR Traditional Thai Massage, its the best one I've ever tried!!!

Hit or miss. Overrated. I've been twice and gotten Thai massages from 2 different ladies. The first one was good, with only a slight issue. My therapist (a very young girl) had very rough spots on her hands. I don't know whether from calluses or warts. The massage was a little painful at times but relaxing overall. The place was clean and with no frills. My second time was horrible. I got the 90 min thai massage. It hurt during and after. The therapist had no idea what she was doing. Put pressure in the wrong places. This was 24 hrs ago. I am still in extreme pain and cannot move my neck and shoulders. If this was the US, I would sue them or at least request my money back.

Great Massages and Value for Money in Silom/Sathorn. I have been a regular customer here over the years, the place to go for real deep tissue aromatherapy massage, The therapists are all well trained and go that extra mile when they find a knotted muscle, rather than just going through the motions. The setting is in a lovely rustic wooden house in a peaceful compound. For the aromatherapy message I recommend 90 minutes and requesting a private room. One of them has a great little outdoor shower down a spiral staircase.I have also experienced massages at hotel spas but what I found with most of them is that you pay 3 times more for a similar massage, just in fancy surrounds.They lose one star as the place is showing its age a bit and sometimes the music doesn't work.

Couldn't have asked for more. If you're looking for a no frills, easy peasy, no nonsense, well-priced, excellent massage, Ruen Nuad is about as good as it gets. I always ask for a 'great' masseur and till now, haven't been disppointed (I've been there about a dozen times). This time in particular, I went with a lingering pain in my left arm and neck. It'd been bothering me for about two weeks and I was pretty eager to sort it out. I booked in for 2 hours and got ready for some heavy duty massaging. LIttle did I know the masseuse would start off gently then start to press on parts of my shoulder, back, neck and leg that became painful. She explained that they were all related and that she'd have to slowly work it all out. Slowly but surely, after some pretty accurate acupressuring (if that's a word), I emerged feeling lighter and taller than when I went in. I was told that my arm was just a small portion of the tense muscle that resulted from months, maybe years of poor computer-front posture. Ruen Nuad will be a quarterly outing even though I live in another country. I recommend everyone do at least 90 minutes because 60 minuters don't let you get into the crook of the problem and you have to wrap up. Also ask for a rolled up towel under your ankles when you're facing down otherwise your legs get a bit painful after a while. Drink the tea at the end - it's good and good for you.

Killer massage, very good prices.. This place is awesome for a massage. My wife and I got the hour and a half Thai massage without oil. It was 500 bhat, that's about $17 USD!!!How can you beat that??They start with a Footwash and then they have you get dressed in some scrub type clothing. They take you to private curtained off areas with nice music playing and a fan going to keep you nice and cool. Halfway through they bring you a cup of tea which was very good And start on your back. I also work on your scalp and face.I like the fact that it was very peaceful and masseuse did not talk a lot,in less it was see if everything was okay.I highly recommend this place it is awesome for the price, even if it costed more.It's very easy to get to on the skytrain and MRT. Sala Daemg stop not Silom.We use the trip adviser app to help locate it using GPS it took us to a place about a block before the massage studio. But close enough enjoy!

Exceptional. While I wasn't sure what to expect with a Thai massage, I was absolutely delighted by the experience. The masseuse was exceptional and the experience was unbelievable. Will absolutely repeat and recommend. Great value, clean and professional spa.

The best most legit massage. You think Bangkok and massage and all sorts of things come to mind ....they here is Ruen Nuadon Convent Road easily accessible from Silom Road close to Sathorn. Every taxi motor cycle tuk tuk guy knows Convent Rd. Equally easy walk from Silom Station at BTS about 3 minutes.This place is fabulous ... Not overly obvious by the curt mannerisms of the women at the front door who you pay first. Whatever you want they do well, and I have been here probably 20 times including today and of all the places in this city this is my fave for massage or body scrubs etc.Not cheap but heck we are talking joke money ...2 hr Thai massage for $20. Sure u can fund for less but the masseuses here whether male or female really know their stuff. I walked in today sore and tired and left feeling great. The masseuses really try to make sure that they work out what ails and I am yet to have anything but the best of experiences. And I sometimes want to hate it after the brusque manners at entrance but within minutes all is forgiven. I only have one remaining comment .... TIP WELL. Wages suck in BKK and the tips are what makes the difference as otherwise it all goes to management. Next door is Sense of Nails and whatever I said about Ruen Nuad applies equally to Sense of Nails.

Best massage of my life. Seriously, best massage ever. Do you know that feeling when a masseur hits the right spot? That was every moment with my masseur at Ruen-Nuad! She was an older women, so I'm guessing it was her experience that helped her find each part of my body that needed correcting and coaxing. The atmosphere is organic but clean — the best of both worlds. I felt like I was getting both luxury and authenticity. I wish I had opted for the 2-hour massage!

The best massage in Bangkok. Are you craving a top notch Thai massage in an authentic setting? Do you want to avoid a glitzy setting, inflated prices, or a potential happy-ending solicitation? This is the spot.It's on Convent Road, which is easy to get to, a 7 minute walk from Sala Daeng BTS station. The setting is a pleasant Asian building with communal spaces for massage (mattresses separated by drapes) as well as private rooms.Definitely opt for a 45 minute body scrub (600 Baht, $20 US), followed by a 2 hour Thai massage (600 Baht, $20 US). This three hour, $40 experience will leave your skin silky smooth and your muscles fully well stretched. All you stress will float away. Come in the late afternoon so as to escape the summer downpours. When you leave, you will be feeling amazing, your body will be limber and your will taste even more delicious than it normally would.Most of the massage therapists here are top notch, but not all. Make sure you tell the front desk ladies that you are in need of a quality therapist! My favorite is Ken. If you do not like the massage style or intensity, be sure to speak up. I have gotten a dozen massages here, and only one was less than fully satisfying.Skip the foot massage option, it's not as good as Chinese foot massage. The Thai massage and body scrubs are amazing. The chrysanthemum tea post massage is heavenly. Booking ahead is recommended but when I don't, I've never had to wait longer than 15 minutes.

World Class. After a few days walking shopping visit, we are so tired and last day we looking for spa/massage.And we found Ruen-Nuad Massage Studio. Excellent massage. Very cottage style outlook.Price from 350baht ++

Excellent & professional massage. This is the best massage i've ever had. I had a prior reservation and went with my wife. They offered me the menu and i chose the Aromatic massage. They had variety of oils and I got to chose what i wanted. I was also offered a safety locker to keep my belongings. the masseurs were very polite and did a great job. This place is located near by to my hotel "Montien". So i did not have tough time finding it. Located in a small street in the end of the convent road (south). everybody knows this place.

Fine. I had an ok experience here but I think some of the other reviews are exaggerated somewhat. Although it is in a nice big house off the street, the room was not really private so I could hear over therapists and customers. The massage was ok but I could get an ok massage for less in one of those massage parlours. I think the main advantage of this place compared to those small shops on the street, is that you know there is no funny business going on here, which is quite reassuring.

I Prefer to Rate it Good Than Very Good. If there were "Good" between "Very Good" and "Adverage", I would choose Good instead, but anyway, this is my review:I went there twice the first 2 days of my holiday in Bangkok. Totally based on the reviews on guide books and some photos. We were glad to see the house after a little walk from the BTS station (not too far though). As you know it's a wooden house, nothing spectacular nor tacky. As for the massage, I had oil massage twice, the first time was by a younger masseur who was ok, not bad, but it was more like he did his job and back to the staff room relaxing. The 2nd time was done by another guy, he did a better job, he seemed to be more experienced and paid more attention.By the way, there's a juice bar at the stuido, can have a little smoothie or tea, but the smoothies are totally limited of what they have in the freezer, don't rely on the menu. Oh, and the mid-age lady (with mid length straight hair) who made the drinks for us (wonder if she was one of the owners), she wasn't friendly at all, seemed a bit up-tight. I had to constantly smile at her to finally get a smile back. The thing I like about Ruen-Nuad is that they're more laid back and causal, but then if you're looking for posh and perfect looking places, it shouldn't be your choice. In terms of the quality of the massage, I guess it could be varied, so, better remember the name of the goods ones!

Relaxing massage off the beaten track in the middle of Bangkok. Went three times. They were relaxing Thai and Oil massages in a secluded quiet street just off of Convent Street. The place is as calming and serene as ever.

Fool me once.... I thought I did enough research before deciding to head to Ruen Nuad for a massage, reading as many reviews and "best massage in bangkok" recommendations as I could. As a guy who enjoys legit massages (not that there's anything wrong with those who enjoy happy endings), I was a bit weary of the vibe I got from the countless massage studios you pass on the streets of Bangkok, and it seemed that 80%+ of the massage places also offer "additional services". I ended up choosing Ruen Nuad because it was conveniently located near my hotel (Le Meridien on Surawong).I did NOT enjoy the experience. Upon entering, I was met with by two Thai women at a reception desk. I did not have a reservation, and they immediately said it was not a problem. They quickly summoned a masseuse from behind a curtain, and I signed up to do a 2hr oil massage. She escorted me upstairs to a room and asked if I needed to shower. Sure, a quick rinse to clean the Bangkok sweat off would be a good idea, I thought. It literally look me 2min to rinse but the girl was nowhere to be found for another 10min.Once we got started, I was immediately disappointed that I didn't request a man. In the US, I tend to ask for male masseuses because they were stronger, though I've had a handful of excellent female masseuses as well. I could barely feel her working on my back, despite making two requests for her to use more strength. We had some small talk over the course of the massage, which I could done without. At one point I asked her how long she had to train before becoming a masseuse, and she replied "2wks for the oil massage, and maybe 3-4wks for the Thai massage." This confirmed that I was literally in the hands of an expert!While the massage itself was lackluster, I've always considered a bad massage better than no massage, so I decided against saying anything further. There could be worse things than having someone rub oil on you for two hours. But towards the end of the massage, what really annoyed me was the fact that we ended about 15min early. It seemed that the massage time started as soon as I was escorted and asked if I needed to shower, including the time she was MIA for 10min!! While I still didn't say anything (why bother, if I'm not going back again), I decided against tipping her and smiled politely as I left, thanking her for her service. Originally, I was planning to go back the next day for a Thai massage, but instead decided to head to another place called Thann Sanctuary. (Considerably higher priced, but worth the cost and I didn't get cheated there.)

A quaint and restful oasis in the heart of Bangkok.. Quiet and restful. Ruen Nuad is my favourite massage studio in Bangkok. A must-do since my first trip to Bangkok nearly ten years ago. Therapists are consistently good. Email to make reservations.

Comfortable and effective. Massage studio is set in a charming old house. Private room is small and dark, but comfortable and quiet. Masseuse didn't seem to speak English so communication was a bit difficult at times, but overall, she got the job done and applied the right amount of strength throughout the two hours. Oil used for the massage was pleasant without being too overpowering. The ladies that manage the front desk (I think they're the owners) come off a little terse, but I think it has to do more with their inability to speak much English to make friendly conversation.

Massage 600 bht. I liked this massage studio as it was traditional and did not seem so "manufactured" like some other massage "super centers" the massage was very good traditional Thai, the studio was clean and very professional.

Comfortable and clean. The building looks pretty nice, different from most of the massage places around. The massage was good. Tea was also served near or at the end. I had the Thai massage there twice and had a different masseuse. The first was a hit and the second a miss. Would come back again for the ambiance. Quieter than most places (you have your own little room), yet not as pricey.
Great value. Went first with friends and then alone a few days later, so had two different masseuses and both were great. Nice ambiance, good massages and affordable prices.

I'll go again if there's nothing better... I heard rave reviews from my friends about this place. So I gave it a try when I visited Bangkok recently. Not entirely visible from the street. There's no prominent sign to indicate the entrance of the studio. I went with my gut and walked straight towards the old-looking house at the end of the lane. The lady at the desk was busy talking on the phone. She wasn't exactly rude but she's not very friendly either. Tersely, she asked if I want male or female and pointed me towards an area with lockers saying, "You can put your things in the locker if you want.". All these happened without her moving from her comfortable seat.I was led up by my therapist who spoke monosyllables sparingly. I figured that I needed to disrobe and shower. The room was spacious (it's a massage room for couples) and no hangers or hooks in sight to hang my clothes. The massage itself was kinda mixed. Sometimes, it felt good. At other times, it felt painful and uncomfortable. Most of the time, I didn't felt relaxed at all. It was quite a relief for me when the massage ended. The only positive thing that I can remember from this experience was the sound of falling water (it was raining). After the massage, I collected my belongings and have a look around the spa. Apparently, they sell some aromatherapy oils but the bottles looked dusty and sad. The lady I met earlier was replaced by another lady who doesn't looked very friendly. She made no move to ask about my massage or enquire if I wish to purchase the oils. In the end, I left the house and finally heard the lady speak, "Thank you for coming.". Would I return for more? Most probably not. I know of one or two massage places that offer a better holistic experience. Frankly, I was disappointed especially after hearing so much good things about Ruen Nuad from my friends through word of mouth.

Best massage of my life!. After a lot of research - my husband and I stumbled upon this little gem right near our hotel in the Central Business area of Bangkok. It was walkable from the Metropolitan and we loved it! Very simple, serene little boutique - the staff was lovely and very caring. They take you to a very simple little room with a wood floor and just a mat. For 2 hours at around $25-$30 that is a heck of a better deal than anything you can get in the States! We loved those 2 hours and it was one of the best things we did in Bangkok.

Simply Great !!. Simply great !! Simply means simple, haha.If it is just a good traditional thai massage is what you are looking for, then Ruen Nuad is the place. The place is very simple and bare, but clean.My partner and me took a body scrub and an oil massage for 2 hours and it cost Bht 1,400.The ladies are mature and experienced.Would certainly visit there again.There is also a nice looking Thai restaurant on campus, but we were already booked for my all-time favourite Baan Kanitha ( also reviewed by me ) and hence gave it a miss.Enjoy !!

Nice building, good staff, but choose your selection wisely. 4 stars for my massage. I had a hot oil, in an upstairs room (shower down the hall), from a female masseuse. The massage was good- I thought I was getting a thai massage, but was fine with the outcome. They make you tea too which is a lovely touch. The building is nice and more traditional which is why I chose it. So many of the spa's in town look very sterile- this is not one of them. The rest of my family were downstairs. I told the receptionist to have the masseuses go easy on my 3 teens ( I have had several real thai massages, which sometimes is not for the faint of heart). They all 3 complained (and still do to this day...) that they were barely touched during their massage after my request. My husband had a shared room with my daughter. Her stories about his massage are pretty funny... (he had a traditional thai massage) which according to her involved lots of grunting/contortion on his part). He liked his massage, but will be visiting the upstairs rooms next time. Next time we are there with the family, I will recommend the full treatment and let them fend for themselves. :)
Really nice. The staff is very professionalIt is a an old wooden building with very nice details and nice atmosphereHe massage was great and at a fair price

simple but good. This is a simple massage place that has gained a good reputation over the years for its quality massage. The Thai massage is excellent here and its good value for money. Don't expect too much in terms of spa-like ambiance although it is clean and efficiently run. Worth a visit if you're looking for a good massage.

Great price and location - but BEWARE the men!. I originally found out about Ruen-nuad in the ANZWG Bangkok guide, and enjoyed their reliable massages and beautiful facilities three times before one somewhat startling experience. The first time, they asked me if a male masseuse was okay, and I said yes, as I've had them in the past. He was an older gentleman, very respectful and a great masseuse. On my last visit, however, they asked me the same question, and I said yes, and ended up with a younger man who was completely unprofessional. He wore heavy rings and a watch during the massage, didn't seem to be a real massage therapist or else was a complete newbie, and crossed the line more than a couple of times. It was embarrassing and quite a disappointment as Ruen-Nuad in all other respects is a gem. I'd still recommend it (at least for the female massage therapists), but be forewarned!

I've found. Upon hearing the praises of my friends who frequent this place, I decided to give it a try. I made an appointment for a weekday afternoon to ensure that there was no crowd. With the directions given by my pals, I had no difficulty locating it in a small cul-de-sac off Soi Convent.The old teak house is in fair condition, air-conditioned and smelt of aroma oils. Just the right ambience for me.I picked a two-hour lemongrass oil massage (Baht 1150 or USD28) and the masseur gave me one of the best two-hour sessions I ever had. He never slacked for a minute and that's something.Given the price, it was definitely better value than what I had at the Oriental Hotel Spa. Of course, the private room at Ruen-Nuad cannot compare with the luxury of the Oriental. But it was good enough for me, especially it was quiet and had an attached bathroom.On my next trip to Krungthep, I will definitely make another visit or two.

Very noisy, and average massage - not recommended. I went there for a 60 min facial (detox) and a 60 min aroma massage. I went with my friend and we had a room separated by doors in the middle. The room was very noisy from footsteps upstairs to the extent that it woke me up after I fell asleep during my facial. I asked to move, they said they had no other rooms available, and when I insisted on moving they moved me upstairs - but failed to tell me it was not a private room, but with an open roof connected with a couple of other massage rooms. In the end it was also noisy with doors slamming and people talking on the corridors. The massage itself was good, and so was the facial, but definitely would not go back again. We made a complaint at the end and were told that there are VIP rooms upstairs but was full today, and that next time it could be arranged. With plenty of other excellent massage places in Bangkok, there will not be a next time for me in this place.

Amazing, clean, 90-minute massage for $14. Loved this place so much that we went back 3 times. Receptionist (who also answers the phone) speaks great English, they have a wide range of treatments and extremely skilled therapists. My wife and I were able to get massages in the same room each time and they even have a shower if you're getting an oil massage. Can't recommend this place highly enough.

Best thai massage, clean and professional place, safe location. Nice wooden house in the same compound as a restaurant. Very good thai massage.. Better than a couple of others I had. Also very clean and professional.

Nice house. I do not understand why all the guide recommend it. Its one of them in an old wooden house but you may get massage in a semi private room where you can hear really well next door and do not concentrate. The price is reasonable but the massage really depends on the luck you have to get the right person even if you ask for the best. Anyway its close to my home but I would not go across the city to go there. If you really have a pain there are better location such as Health Land on Sathorn but avoid the week end.

Great value and ambiance. I sought out this massage studio on the advice of the Nancy Chandler map. I had an hour and a half Thai massage at Ruen-Nuad and loved it! It was only 500 Baht for the session - a super value!A quick foot bath was first and then I followed the petite Thai lady to a little room that had about six little massage areas. The areas were all sectioned off with walls and ratan curtains. She left me alone to change into the shirt and pants that were provided. I left all my belongings in the area with us. Then the massage started - she was a powerful petite lady!! She used her hands, feet, knees, elbows and body during the massage. She watched my expressions to know if she should soften up. It was a great experience - I'm not going to lie - it was painful but then again all my massages at home are! The Thai massage was certainly an experience - highly recommended. The massage ended with green tea.The ambiance in the spa was fantastic. It was very quiet and clean.

VERY nice experience. First, as one reviewer noted, you really do keep walking until you think you've passed the location and they, suddenly, it's there. For future reference, if you've turned left onto Convent Street, keep walking until you get to the hospital (I've forgotten the name.) which is on your left. Ruen-Nuad is opposite the hospital and in the same compound as the Naj restaurant. Walk all the way back.I booked an hour-long Thai massage and an hour-long oil massage. The woman that did the massages was EXCELLENT. She completely worked me over with the Thai massage. Yes, it hurts, but then it feels great. The oil massage was great. The combination of the two was quite nice.

I came back from BKK last Sunday.tried.... I came back from BKK last Sunday.tried several places & must say Ruen Nuad was a mindblowing experience.Both hubby and I were fantasizing over how we can be at RN in our sleep-no joke!it was that gd.We went on a rainy day,walking in from Saladaeng BTS to 42 convent Rd. we walked like what seemed forever and thought"Did we walk in the right direction" but bingo..we saw the beautiful Henri Matisse lime green logo and knew we were there.Ruen Nuad was tucked behind a rather posh restaurant.it had a rather charming entrance that's at once unpretentious and inviting.The owner we met was part of a female duo who is at once no nonsense yet warm and systematic on her approach.we were immediately put at ease when we felt her profound knowledge of massage.we had opted for the 850 baht in house specialty oil massage. We were given a choice of oils to choose(i chose energizing,my hubby relaxing- both of which had subtle notes of aromatherapy infused) i loved the oils-They smell and feel just right when glided on. Not rancid and with enough of an aromatherapy punch.(I digress:at Healthland wattana branch,I couldn't even choose my oils even when it's stated I can choose from lavender,ylang ylang and an anti cellulite bkend as stated from the brochure. They replied curtly"we already choose lavender for you" - wow so much for democracy*and service*- mayb I went at 10.30 and there were closing at 12 but still?! Then don't print that in the brochure if you dont intend to let your customers make choices.Digression aside, Ruen Nuad's masseurs really hit the right spots literally.They pummel,knead and coax ur achy muscles into sheer submission. at the risk of sounding overly sensual, we have never felt a massage so sublime. From the oils to the therapists' dextrous handwork-the unyielding muscles finally succumb to the slow and steady crescendo that the therapists orchestrate. We were heady from such pleasant detoxification yet thoroughly relaxed,falling into a deep slumber,only to be awoken gently when the massage was over. The therapist didn't just mindlessly probe and press. They effortlessly located the right achy spots,never once pressing on bones, releasing only achy areas that were built up with lactic acid.never has been a massage so spot on- we were amazed and awed beyond words.One thing though: since we turned up w/o bookings,the room upstairs was probably occupied and so we had the older room downstairs-We could hear the creaky wooden floors when people walked upstairs. So for those not attuned to said rustic quirks, book in advance for the room upstairs.We wished we could hv remembered our therapists' names.We already plan to head back to Ruen Nuad next year and encounter sheer bliss again.

Unprofessional. This establishment has several positive reviews,Tripadviser,Nancy Chandler maps etc;and it was on the strength of these that I decided to go there even though it involved a 40 minute trek across town.I went there on 3rd April in the evening to suss it out,and booked for the following morning at 11.15.While there I asked to see the facilities as I wanted some privacy and not the All-in-a row type place which can exist.They reluctantly let me go upstairs and I crept about so as not to disturb anyone having viewed what appeared to be small cell-like room with curtains at the entrance.The place is an old Thai house and this I feel is half of its initial attraction.The next day I paid for a one hour Thai massage at 350TB(an oil massge is 700TB),altho the Reception tried to persuade me to have a 2 hour one(dread the thought!!)and was shown upstairs where my feet were washed and I was shown into a bare cubicle that had a thin mat on the floor,a wooden box(to put your handbag on??) and a hook on the wall to hang your clothes.There was also the usual cotton top and pants to change into.The lady that did the massage had no idea and in my opinion no formal training in Thai massage.She squeezed and pushed parts of me in no particular order and one side of the body being treated differently from the rest.She also jabbed her elbow into the base of my spine which was painful(I had already told the Receptionist I had a lower back problem)After we were half way through and when I realised it was not going to improve I asked her to stop.While getting dressed I saw that there had been another staff member sitting crossed legged on the floor outside the cubicle as if she was monitoring the session.I went down stairs and complained to the Receptionist and she spoke to the masseuse.I don't know what was said,but they refunded the fee in full.I have had Thai massages before,have also trained in Nuad Bo-rarn Thai massge myself,and am a complementary practioner,so I do know when a treatment is correctly(and safely) administered.Was I unlucky,definitely!But staff have to be trained and monitored and you can't let loose inexperienced staff treat paying customers as guinea pigs.Having an interesting(but basic) premises is just not enough.The massages I have had at Wat po were fine.Also the ones in "Massage in Garden" Rumbutri Street in the Banglampoo area of Bangkok.This year the oil massage was only 280TB,the tables are raised and have face holes,there are towelling robes,shower facilities and the massage takes place in opaque "tents" situted in a green garden.Very good value and I had a girl who did a good but gentle massage.

When you find it, you'll love it. We found this place on trip advisor and decided to try it out. It was only a ten minute walk from our hotel (Dusit Thani) and at least we knew from other reviews that we were guaranteed a professional service.If you're walking from Silom, chances are you'll do exactly what we did - you walk for five minutes until you think you've missed it - then you find it!. If you're walking from Silom you'll pass a hospital on the left hand side - the Ruen Nuad is on the right and tucked back off the road behind what looked like a pretty classy restaurant.Prices were really reasonable and the studio was clean. I would recommend.
A small wooden house offering superior massage services. This is the best Thai massage shop I've found in Bangkok . I was so excited with my friend after finished the massage. It's so excellent.

best massage in BKK. Ruen-Nuad Massage Studio is tucked away in a little corner of Silom...but once you find it, you'll be glad you did. Located in a charming restored wooden house, the atmosphere is intimate and relaxing. They offer traditional Thai massages, foot massages, oil massages and a range of facial treatments. The prices aren't dirt cheap but they are very reasonable for the services provided (traditional Thai massage is 350 baht for an hour). Each massage room is separated by a bamboo curtain and the massage therapists are professional - you don't need to worry about getting a surprise ending (you never know in this city). After your massage, you can enjoy a fresh fruit drink at the juice bar. The whole experience is wonderful.

Truly amazing experience. I was renommened to try a float and it was truly an amazing experience. The place/ the facilities was clean and modern. The staff was nice and friendly and gave an excellent explanation before the float. There was zero gravity, it was very calming, it was quiet, all stress left the body and it was good meditation for body and soul. I floated for 1 hour but could have done it longer. You have to try it - it was amazing ! Thank you

Amazing float. I have been wanting to try a float for years and finally booked it. I went in hoping it would be amazing and left feeling inspired to get to work on creative projects. The staff did a great job explaining what to expect and how to get the most out of the experience. My first hour felt like 10 minutes! The second trip I opted for 1.5 hours and was just as pleased. Hoping to incorporate floats into my creative routine! Must try for anyone with ideas floating around the mind...

worthwhile experience to relax. i tried this as it sounded different and interesting. it surely was. floating on top of a salt water bath isolated in ambient light or darkness is very calming, soothing and relaxing. fries the mind of stress. recommended. i did 1 hour but could have done longer.

Delightful strange way to escape and go to a very special place. I loved that first experience and I do feel that I have to go again a certain number of times before enjoying to its full potential the floating experience.

Perfect cure for jet lag. Having travelled for over 18 hours and with little sleep, we entered Theta Float Centre still feeling tired and lethargic. The staff were amazing at explaining the experience as we were newbies to floating. By the end of it we both felt rejuvenated and refreshed and ready to begin our holiday. We booked another session before we head back home to the UK. Thank you Annile and your team.

Excellent first time float experience! . My husband and I tried "floating" for the first time today and had a truly amazing time! The explanation by the staff at the beginning was superb and made us feel comfortable; the facilities were clean and modern; and the owner was very friendly and helpful. We definitely recommend Theta for new and advanced "floaters" as it offers a peaceful, temporary respite from the daily grind and is truly relaxing.

Can't wait for our next float!. Annile welcomed us and explained all the details of what to expect for our first float. It made us even more excited and when we took the first float, all anxiety disappeared. We are looking forward to find a float center in Chicago and continue floating. Happy that Thailand is the start to our journey!

Boosted my creativity and problem solving . Was feeling a bit stressed and restless due to projects at work. Have floated before but not at a time when I felt like this. Went for a float midweek one evening after work, had a 90 minute session. Came out feeling relaxed and slept well which I kind of expected. However the next day surprised me how I seemed to have so much mental clarity while facing my projects again in the office. I smashed through my work like a master. Nice to know the float centre is there next time I need a bit of extra creativity.

Great experience. My first time experience, I think it's better to pick the room instead of the pod( less claustrophobic). The staff are friendly and detailed explaining the procedures. I took a 45 min session, it feels like 30 min, I guess I slept for 10 min. During the float , I can totally relax my muscle, doing medication. I don't have any problem floating just my belly felt a bit cold. After the float ,I feel my aching neck pain was better and the fingers didn't wrinkle after 45 min soaking in water. It was relaxing and great experience, it costs 1950B per session. After the session, you ll be served the butterfly pea blue tea and granola snack.

FLOAT TO ESCAPE. If you have floated before or your very first time,I highly recommend taking the time to go to Theta State, location is very convenient.Theta State offered everything I needed to feel at ease during my Float, excellent service and staff, the float tank/pod was the same as I have experienced in Hong Kong and Australia, really amazing facilities.

Wow!! You have to try it! . I was in Bangkok for my birthday last month and when I searched tripadvisor for things to do.. Theta State float centre came up as top 10 and I now know why!! Its amazingly fascinating and unique! This was my first ever encounter and experience to float. Soo many words to use to explain the experience .. but wow for me it was moving and uplifting. You have to try it but with a open mind! I had a warm welcome throughout the entire experience, I was offered delicious hot teas and crumptious snack (I now regret buying a bag!!). Annile was really friendly and passionate about the float centre. The rooms itself were clean, and the room after your session is so relaxing and peaceful. Can not fault anything!Thankyou once again Annile, I loved it and will never forget my experience! I apologise for my late review! Hope you are well and you continue with your success!
Great people, great experience. . I can't say much more than it was a great experience. Shannon was very friendly and knowledgeable. Give Theta a try.

Unique experience . Having floated a lot in the Dead Sea I thought that this would be something very similar. But it wasn't. Though you do float due to the salt. The experience of a quiet and surrounding adds additional layer to experience.

VERY relaxing, gotta go back for another visit.. Last week I went to Theta State Float Center which is near the Rama IV end of Sukhumvit Soi 24 in the same building as Carl's Jr. The staff was very nice, explained everything and then got me right into a room (the pods were booked). After a quick shower I climbed into the warm water and turned off the light. I never did fully fall asleep but did enjoy the relaxing hour in complete darkness, complete silence (aside from the tinnitus ringing in my ears) and the 'weightlessness' of floating in the salty water. After about twenty minutes I made use of the neck pillow so my big head would be a bit more inline with the rest of my body. You pretty much float in the middle of the tank and just relax. It's not as easy to relax as you think. I was sitting there thinking,"Man! Am I always this tensed up?" I've gotta say, it was such an unusual sensation having no other sensations that I don't think I got the full benefit of it and will be going back again soon. From what I've heard and read after some sessions you can get into the tank and get right into the relaxation mode. We'll see how the next visit goes. If you've never done it, I'd recommend trying it at least once, if only to say that you've done it. You don't need to bring anything, just show up and float au natural.

Amazing experience. This is one of the most amazing experiences which you can have in Bangkok. Although I had read about floating and get good idea before I go , but experiencing it in real is different. Their staff is very nice and friendly, the place decorations and lightening give you relaxing feeling even before floating. After taking shower you get in the floating tank and adjust yourself laying on the water surface, after few minutes you will be in another world. It is something like meditation , you feel as if you are laying on the air, very relaxed, your mind is clear, don't want this state of relaxation to end. My only mistake is that I booked for one hour floating but I think it should be at least 90 minutes. For sure i'll be back to the center more than once when I visit Bangkok again.

Unique holiday experience. My husband and I were ready to slow down as part of our Thailand trip, especially being amongst the hustle and bustle of Bangkok and the opportunity to experience what it was like to go in a float tank came up. We were given lots of information prior to the experience by Annile and felt confident in undertaking the adventure. Being in the tank was an opportunity to totally take time out and regroup/ reflect and when I got out I felt refreshed and energised. It was a great me time activity and I would consider doing it again in my home town.

Awesome place. Pure relax. Super nice and friendly. I am very happy that I found it. Was just a drop in visit, no reservation , but good that they had a spot for me (was heavy rain outside, otherwise I would not be so lucky I guess) Will be back for sure

A great first float experience.. I've been wanting to try floating for a while so luckily I found a place in Bangkok while I'm here.Matt/Sommart explained everything beforehand (with a quick 2 minute video) and it was off to float. After a quick shower, you get in a small pod for a hour, floating in complete silence. For me, my experience felt as if I was floating in space. After my mind stopped racing, I felt very relaxed and at ease. It was the longest I've been in a meditative state. Getting out you feel so relaxed and clear headed.The float center is a good 15 minute walk from the Phrong Phong station. The traffic on the street is bad, so it might be faster walking.I wish I was in Bangkok a little longer to float! I'll be back once I'm here again.

Thank you so much!. It was an awesome experience! You definitely got me to floating.Really good for meditation! Felt so happy in there.And thanks again to the owner and the great staff for the great hint to the beach at koh phangan. Loved it today! Hope to see you soon again.And don't forget: At 10 am take the back entrance of the mall because the other shops open a bit later.

An experience like none other!. I wasn't sure what to expect when walking into Theta State, but Annile and the rest of the staff put my mind at ease while explaining the ins and outs of floating. It is truly an experience like none other. I was able to completely relax and go into a deeply meditative state much faster than during my usual meditation. I highly recommend for anyone working on a creative project, going through a major life transition, or simply looking for something interesting and healthy to do in Bangkok!

Very Relaxing and a Unique Experience. It was my husband's and my first time floating, and we went for our anniversary. We did a 90 minute float. We thought it was a great experience for price, and both felt very relaxed during and after! Definitely never done anything like it before, but it is very good for thinking through problems in a secluded environment, or forgetting your problems all together. Highly recommend trying it!

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G - AT FIRST: SCARED - AFTER: IT RELAXED :). At first I was a little bit scared to float for 60mins in a "small" floating tank.Only me, salt water and silence!But as the relaxing music started for the first 10 minutes (after the first 10 minutes there is only silence in the tank) I began to relax.I wasn't sleeping while the floating session, but I relaxed so much and felt so good after it.No idea why i was scared before!It was a great session and I recommend it to you, if you are scared before like me!You can reach the Floating center very easy from the Phrom Phong BTS Station.After the float I can recommend you VEGAN FOOD at the Veganerie Cafe (not far away) and a relaxing walk at the Benyasiri Park, before driving back home/to the hotel from the BTS Station Phrom Phong.Thanks Theta Floating Center - it was a very great experience and not the last float. :)

One Amazing Hour @ Theta Floating Center Bangkok. I had an amazing experience at the Theta Floating Center in Bangkok.The staff was evry friendly and answered all my questions.I felt so light and free like never before, while the 60min floating.Before and after the floating I got a cup of great BLUE tee. :)For me it was a special experience and definetly not the last floating there!60 Minutes only you inside the floating capsule!Do it and feel better like never before!Have a nice day there!Daniel from germany!
Great Experience!. It's my first time floating here at Theta State and it was amazing and very relaxing. Staff was really friendly and nice. I will definitely come back!

Great experience for meditation and relaxation . As a first-time floater, I was happy to have chosen a super clean facility with warm, informative service. Floating was a nice supplement to my normal meditation routine, and left me deeply relaxed. Will definitely return for additional sessions!
Sensory Deprivation in Bangkok. Floating in sensory deprivation made my whole body relax my whole muscles eas relief the tension. It was very nice experience in Bangkok.

Great Experience. I first experienced a Sensory Deprivation Tank about 9 years ago.
