I was told about it, and after doing extensive research tried it out for myself, like I said 9 years ago in California. Since then I have been doing it off and on. Not only is it an extremely enjoyable experience that leaves you feeling absolutely refreshed, its also incredibly healthy for your mind and your body. Theta State Float Center offered a very professional, yet relaxed and nonchalant experience of floating. They provide everything you need to feel at home and everything is really clean and smells good. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the owners are usually around and more than willing to chat about your experience or just about life in general. They are also very flexible and offer a wide range of different packages, which bring the cost of floating down significantly if you would like to be a member and go more regularly, which I highly recommend to take full advantage of all the health benefits. Overall, I have gone 4 times and plan to get a monthly membership soon. The facilities, the staff, the price and the over all experience were all excellent in my opinion.

Float. Who would have thought I would have gone to Bangkok to find myself? Thank you SO MUCH for allowing me to experience first hand, the benefits of floating. The state of feeling so relaxed mentally, is something I rarely experience and has encouraged me to take up meditation / floating as a regular feature of my life when I return to Melbourne.

A gift to yourself. Thank you Theta Float Center for creating a clean and calm space at which guests can gift themselves an hour of solitude and tranquility. I really enjoyed my first float experience and will definitely be returning for more floats during my next visit to Bangkok. Theta is perfectly located and easy to find. The owners really take care to provided all the information you need to know prior to your float and are genuinely concerned with your experience. HIGHLY recommended as a unique and special experience. Can not wait to get back!

Super Relax!!!. Cant imagine how floating can help a lot, but Damn!! It was AMAZING and SUPER relax. My whole body just floated in Zero-Gravity, I felt like I am on the space ;) Looking for my second float next week!! Love it, Like it.

Interesting experience. Went today the 2nd time in 6 months and I liked it almost more than 1st time. And that was good already.
I can highly recommend to try it and see how it feels for you.
It is good to calm down and relax from all the stress.

Relaxing experience - very pleasant . First of all - the place is really clean with knowledgable staff and gives a welcome impression all around
Floating experience was new to me - I felt deeply relaxed after this and will definitely try it again !

Never expect it to be this good! . Was quite skeptical about this whole floating thing when I was planning the trip. As the top 2 spas are floating centers and my husband doesn't like traditional massage, I decided to give it a try.The location is not so convenient as we took BTS and we needed to walk for 15 mins. As BTS is nothing cheap anyway, I would suggest to take cab instead. The receptionist explained to us clearly what to expect so we were quite at ease. We did have a bit worry that we might have claustrophobia of being "trapped" in the tank, but since we were the one to decide whether or not to close the tank, we were totally fine. I never expected myself could really relax while floating on water, but surprisingly I fell asleep!! By the time I woke up the waking music was already on (don't know for how long) so I had to rush to have shower and dry hair. As I have long hair, I didn't know how much time I have to dry hair so it gave me some stress. :p will be great if they could inform me how my much time I have to finish off. In sum, it was an interesting and fantastic experience as we had never tried floating before. In terms of pricing, you just can't compare it with other normal body massages; after all they are totally different. I've seen other travellers commenting on how relaxing their bodies are after floating, but honestly I didn't really feel much. :) maybe I was not so tired to start with

Waste of money, unless you believe in the science of floating. This floating center's target group are tourists who are looking for new experiences (my impression). I was one of those tourists. The website is exceptionally well made and I was immediately convinced that this is something I have to try out (have never been floating before). I had really high expectations which were unfortunately not met. Before you go there ask yourself if you really want to spend so much money for an experience which is not much different or more relaxing than lying on your bed.Unless you are a spiritual person you most likely will find the experience of floating rather boring. I was lying there and was bored to death. Unless you sleep in there (cheaper to sleep on your 5 star hotel bed) time will pass super slow. A lot of people actually write that they sleep in there and felt super refreshed afterwards. Well that's the consequence of sleeping, but not necessarily of floating. The staff is all really friendly and cool. No complaints here. Everything very clean and organized. You can tell that it's run by western managers/owners with very good business sense. Kudos to you! This experience left unfortunately quite a bad after taste for me. I cannot stop thinking that I got tricked by a very good business concept focusing on making money. If you believe in floating please go ahead and book with Theta. They will not disappoint you. However if you just look for new things to do in Bangkok then I can promise you that you might have much more fun and relaxing time spending this huge some of money (for Thailand standard) on countless other possible amusements in Bangkok.

Intuition. When i was a kid every time after a flight,i remember a voice in my head telling me to fill the bathtub with water and float in.It was my intuition talking to me.This voice faded over the years because we all lose touch with our inner self over time.But during my visit to the float center all this childhood memories came back to me and i realized that this is what your body-mind and soul really need especially after a tiring long flight.

I love this place!. I didn't really know what to expect the first time I tried a float, but I was hooked straightaway and have been coming back ever since. The experience is extremely relaxing and is a little different every time. When I go into it worn-out or sleep deprived, I'll fall into super relaxing sleep in the room and emerge totally refreshed. Other times I find my mind free to wander: I've been able to revisit memories in stunning detail, or visualize plans and ideas with incredible clarity. Sometimes the experience is dreamlike and transcendent. It's beautiful every time and has becoming an important element of my weekly routine -- a fantastic wind-down after a long day, but also a great way to unlock creativity before sitting down to a session of writing or other work. A lot of my best ideas hit me during floats; it's even better than the shower! I really can't recommend it enough. Go into it with an open mind and no expectations. Try a little meditation in there. It's an experience like no other. And the staff are super sweet and helpful, and full of useful tips and tweaks: use the neck pillow or don't, play relaxing music at the beginning or don't, etc. They made my first time an easy and natural experience, and since have been present and perceptive, ready to chat if I want to process thoughts from the float, or to leave me to chill out by myself if I just want to sit and think over a cup of tea afterwards. It's a mellow, welcoming, delightful place. Definitely worth a try if you've never floated!

Deep & Restful Good night Sleep!. I was on my last few days in BK and decided to try something different. Read a lot of good stuff about the floating spas. Went to Theta State Float Center, took the BTS, call the center to confirm the station to get off and then a quick 20bhat (80cents) motor bike ride… really fun! Got to Avenue Mall, and Theta State Float Center is really nice! They take the time to explain the process, provide you tea, shows you around the floating room etc.The floating room has the dressing and shower room all for yourself. The place was sooo clean!! Since it was my first time- I really had to learn to quiet my mind :) the relaxing music during the beggining and ending in the float pod was so relaxing but after the music I felt it's too quiet. The team explained it's normal when new with the floating experience. I felt very relax after and all that salt really gave me a wonderful good night sleep.I can't wait to continue floating pods back in california. I'm so glad I had my first experience in Thetat State it was a cool, relaxing visit! :)

Great and unique experience. Precious time to be alone with no disturbances in Bangkok! I've heard about this place before and gave a visit once in May. It's good for relieving muscular tension. After that, I go there at least once a month. Not sure if it helps about insomnia because I never experience it before. But it surely makes me more relaxed and calm in daily life.
Great. It was a great experience. The staff were very polite and friendly. The premises were very clean. It was very relaxing and enjoyable!

Clean, calming and inviting!. A very clean facility with friendly, informative staff. Went on the off chance that they had availability and they managed to squeeze me in. I think if I were to go again I would book in advance. After an informative chat from the member of staff, I was at ease with the process and had a fantastic experience in the pod. It was calming and rejuvenating and seemed to soothe both my muscles and my mind. Will definitely visit again.
And now for something completely different..... An experience not be missed. An amazing place that will give you the opportunity to try something new and revealing. Very nice indeed!

Relax and chill in the heart of Bangkok. Living in Bangkok with all the sounds, lights, and distractions, I jumped at the opportunity to have them blocked out for an hour. It was an experience as soon I walked in. Modern, comfortable reception, nice tea and an explanation by Annille about the benefits and what to expect. Once I started floating in the warm, buoyant water it took my mind some time to adjust, but it was extremely comfortable and the hour went by very quickly. I came out feeling relaxed and peaceful, and reluctant to step outside into the hectic Bangkok life. I hear it only gets better the more you do it, so I will be back for sure.

Back pain relief! Superb experience, I will be going back for sure.. I just finished my first float and I don't often think to write reviews right away, but this one certainly warranted it.From years of playing competitive sports and mountain biking, I've developed the "back of a 70-year-old" (I'm 30 now). I found this out after an MRI from my doctor, not just me saying so. I had a really tough workout yesterday and could feel the painful spasms in my back flaring up all morning. The usual Thai massage does nothing for my back and on occasion makes it worse. Luckily, someone recommended this to me so I thought I'd give it a shot.Within ten minutes of floating, I could feel my spine relaxing and I suddenly heard and felt an audible pop (more like a thud) in my back. Almost like a chiropractic adjustment lol. Within another 20 minutes, my back had completely relaxed. I'm sitting here writing this now and I can't get over how loose my back feels. it's incredible. Before the float just bending down to tie my shoes was difficult now it feels great.The entire experience was really great. Annile the owner, was super nice to talk to and the entire place has a great vibe.With this, you certainly get out what you put in. It was a super weird sensation just floating with no light, no sound, and only your thoughts. But it's like you can finally stop being distracted and put some real thought into what you need to think about. At times I would completely zone out and meditate then other times I would be thinking incredibly hard about random things.After it was said and done it was like I needed a minute to gather my thoughts and shift back into reality.I highly recommended it. Go in with an open mind and just shut the world off for an hour. And if you have back pain... even better!

Awesome place. This is fore-sure for meditators.The experience is amazing.I took a slot for 90 minutes and was just in a trans most of the time.You find yourself nowhere, neither on earth, nor in space.I suggest, People who are not used to meditation should not try lengthy hours, 60 minutes slot is good enough.

A unique experience!. I had never tried floating before and decided to give it a shot while I was in Bangkok. It was a very relaxing session and a good change from the usual massage. To me, feeling mentally re-engergized was more satisfying than the physical relaxation and the feeling of weightlessness. The centre itself is very well managed - you feel the positivity and energy the moment you step inside..everything right from the decor to the quality of toiletries is spot on!Would definitely visit again the next time I'm in Bangkok.

Great Set and Setting. Very awesome float center, perfect for first time floaters. My girlfriend and I visited Theta state for our first float and could not be happier with the experience. When you first step through the door, you'll meet Matt a super warm guy from Thailand who gives you blue tea and talks to you about the experience. Everything is well explained and very easy. The session is completely private so theres a couple of things you have to have to remember as you won't be disturbed once your session starts (unless you call for assistance).1. Start with a Quick 5 min shower 2. Dry your face3. Cover up any cuts with vaseline (provided). The high salt content can sting if you have any cuts or if the water gets in your eyes. For this reason it's recommended that you don't shave for at least a few hours beforehand.4. Put ear plugs in (optional)5. Turn off the room lights6. Get into the pod and close it.7. When the float starts music will play for 5 mins to help you get accustomed to the setting.8. Once you feel comfortable turn off the light in the pod9. Enjoy the wonders of sensory deprivation and being off the grid10. Once the float session is about to conclude the music will play again for 5 mins11. Once the music stops carefully step out of the pod and take a shower. Be careful to get your bearings when you step because the salt will make your whole body pretty slippery.The whole session including tea was about 1 hour and 45 mins. The staff are extremely helpful and Matt does a great job at guiding you through the process if you've never floated before. All the staff are also avid floaters themselves. We also had the chance to meet the owner Annile who started the center. Annile has a great passion and enthusiasm for floating and you can tell a lot of thought has gone into creating a "set and setting" that is just right. The center has a very warm friendly feel with a chilled out vibe thats perfect for floating. The facilities are modern and well placed making getting in and out of the pod, showering and drying yourself off easy and comfortable.All in all a very nicely put together float spot and experience with great people behind the business. highly recommend!

Very relaxing. It was my first time experience in my life. I really enjoy the feeling that float on espom water. After 60min session I had a good sleep in whole week. I will try again if I visit bangkok.

FLOAT AWAY.. Wow!!! What a magical experience.. My partner and I have always found that travellers as a whole are very open minded. If that fits your description or you'd like to start becoming a little more open minded and inquire a little deeper into yourself than this is for you! Firstly you walk in to this super chill little mall, Theta is on the bottom floor and right away you can tell the environment is super conducive for relaxation. You're greeted by a really lovely Thai guy named Matt. From there he walks and talks you through the whole experience. All the while you just sit there sipping on blue herbal tea. Great start.As for the pods (or rooms) I'm not going to say too much. Everyone's experience is different but it doesn't matter if you're a chilled out traveller or a pepped up business exec this is something that could really help I mean who doesn't want to feel what 0 gravity feels like for an hour or more as you just sit there and float away.
The world you would only see here. A first class ambience with an out of the world experience...yep that's what I felt. I think it can only be felt cannot be said!
my first time experience. my first time experience was very relaxing and liked it very much...please do experience it at least once and i am sure that you will like it :D

Definitely Worth a Visit. It was the first time that I've ever been to a float centre and I would definitely recommend it to others. It's an experience like no other and I felt completely de-stressed and relaxed after. The staff are super friendly and explain everything to you. It's easy to find, about a 10 minute walk from Phrom Phong BTS.

Interesting Experience 有趣的體驗. About 18mins away from bts station, but not really hard to find it, it is located at a shopping mall ground floor.I made a reservation online and just inform the owner your full name and he will help you arrange a room then.This is my boyfriend's and my first float, owner explained clearly before we go into our own float pod. Reminder for all visitors, please listen to what the owner tell you, try to think deeply and keep relaxing as you can during floating❤️Step1: go to toilet Step 2 : go to your own room and take a shower Step 3 : dry your skinStep 4: turn off the room lightStep 5: go into float pod and close itStep 6: slide down, listen music and try to adopt the environment Step 7 : turn off the music and light if u feel okayStep 8: just relax and think Step 9: music comes up means time is up and get off the float pod and go to bathTime went much faster than what i expect (i joined 60-min floating). Same as the owner said that floating gave me time to think and review myself alone. In conclusion, this is a interesting experience even though it is a little bit expensive, but it is worth to make a try!The owner also told us that hong kong has floating centre also, but it is much more expensive than this one

a very good experience . searched from website, and found that it is close to out hotel, so we spent a trip at there. this is the 1st time we hv been there and also first time to try float in such relaxing way.instructor explained clearly before we started, and the feeling was good when i was floating.

Great experience unless . The floating massage very great experience. The staff were very helpful and explain everything as my first visit to this kind of massage. I like the place design and decorations. And the facility they provided. And the hospitality of the staff.  The main things I dislike in the place is the noisy because of old building which destroy my whole massage session, because this massage mainly focus on quit and relaxing.
Awesome!. I've been to Theta State twice now and its fantastic. Complete relaxation! And they have friendly staff as well. Definitely worth checking out!

The noise just floats away.... I'm in Bangkok traveling with my wife and two young children and the float is just what I needed to calm my frazzled nerves after 24 hours of flight time from LA with a 4 and 6 year old. The expert staff were courteous and friendly and explained everything I needed to know about my first float. It took me a little while to get comfortable and figure out what was going on. But after about 10 minutes I was able to get out of my head and cut out all the chatter of daily life. It was glorious. I would highly recommend it for anyone who's just traveled across the world to Bangkok. It really helped ease my jet lag. I will definitely hit the float chamber again on my way back through Bangkok in a couple of weeks. Thanks Theta State!

2nd Visit. This was my second visit. The first visit was fabulous and I had tried the pod. This time I tried the floating room which was equally nice - but made the mistake of having a large mug of coffee first. This made it difficult to relax. So don't do that. Will come again next time I'm in Bangkok - minus the coffee.

Wow! So great- need to go again. I am SO glad I did this! My husband wanted to try it but I was skeptical that I would be bored but went along anyway- turns out I wish I had even more time! We were warmly greeted and explained everything. As soon as went into the pod I felt so relaxed. We did 60 minutes and they flew by! I can't even describe how calm and happy I felt after, It was refreshing! I have tried yoga and meditation but they just didn't do anything for me- this was the complete opposite. I wish I was still in Bangkok so I could go back!

This makes me feel so good, it's worth another review!. I've been here several times last year and I was amazed by the experience, but then I had a longer break because I was out of town. I came back recently and was happily surprised that the Float Center had worked out some very attractive promotions. This led me to try to float for a few consecutive days and I must say I'm quite excited about the positive impact it has had on my mind and body so far. I haven't been so relaxed and at the same time so mentally sharp in daily life for ages.A big thanks and thumbs up to Theta State Float Center, this positive review is well deserved.Strongly recommended!

Total relaxation. . What a great experience, have never been so relaxed. It was our first time to use a flotation tank, I was glad we went for the 90 minutes as it took a little while to adjust to the darkness and floating. Once I was comfortable it was an amazing feeling and felt like I was surrounded by complete nothingness, which in today's hectic world is unheard of. Highly recommend this experience and just wish we had a centre where I live as I would be a regular customer for sure!!

Floating....on Top. my first floating experience, i really enjoyed it. The place is very nice,very helpful and friendly stuff. they give a good introduction before your float. i highly recommend this place. its a good idea to take the 3 for 2 package for first-timers.will come back next time i am in bangkok.
Must Try. First experience with sensory deprivation and it was great. Definitely worth the time to try. Owner is a great guy and a lot of help. Will be going back again

Love this place!. I've been floating at home in San Diego for 2 years now, but until recently, never floated at any other centers other than the ones near my house. When I flew to Bangkok a few weeks ago, I was happy when I discovered there was a float center near my hotel. The float truly helped ease the jetlag from the long flight and adjust to the time change. Annile and his staff were extremely accommodating, and the center is beautiful. I will definitely be back!

Awesome experience. For something a little different...check this place out. I have bad lower back pain but while floating in the capsule i felt no pain at all just completley relaxed. Definatley worth a try especially for athletes or people with joint pain

Jet lag defeated!. Having already enjoyed several Theta floats, I sought to overcome jet lag by heading for a flight just 7 hours after a 13 hour journey to Bangkok from the UK. After a night spent in an aeroplane seat, feeling somewhat weary and not sure what time my body thought it really was, I found that an hour floating at the Theta State Float Centre was completely re-energising. It took away that 'don't know how I feel' feeling, and just helped me to completely unwind. It even helped me to get over the 6 hour time difference and feel human once again. I would recommend it to anyone. I'll be back!

Unbelievable first experience!. I visited Theta State Float Center during my short stay in Bangkok and was taken aback by the experience. I did a 2 hour float and left the session feeling completely relaxed. Aside from the float itself, the ambiance, facility, and employees were all very hospitable and made my time enjoyable. I would highly recommend!

going deep. I have been practicing mindfulness meditation for several years now and have always struggled with being physically comfortable enough to stay in a meditative state. I'll get into the zone for a couple minutes and then my muscles will start cramping, my posture will start to go, and so on.I had my first floating experience at Theta State and was amazed at how deep I could get into my breathing exercises. After, what I imagine was, 15 or so minutes figuring out how to float comfortably I felt completely relaxed, almost weightless, and got into a euphoric trance, completely focused on my breathing and the weightless feeling of my body, until the end of the session. I can only hope to one day be able to achieve this same level of meditative focus during my sessions at home.The facilities are very modern and comfortable, and the staff were very kind and welcoming. I felt like they really wanted me to have a good experience.I went with my friend, an experienced floater, and my girlfriend, another first timer like myself. She fell asleep almost instantly (lol, but pretty standard for her) but also spoke positively about the experience.The best part though was the feeling of stepping back outside into the sun after the float, feeling completely relaxed, happy, and energized. It is kind of hard to describe... it felt like my mind was more open to everything around me and I could appreciate everyday things that otherwise wouldn't have entered my thought process.
Most relaxing experience ever!. I did a 1.5 hour float and I'm officially hooked. I cannot recommend this place enough. Great owner, good vibe and the best way to unwind I've found yet. Amazing!
Amazing experience. Everyone has to float! Most relaxing experience ever. So many health benefits. I loved it and encourage everyone to try

Wonderful way to relax and reflect. Me and my girl friends wanted to try something different but still relaxing and pampering so we chose Theta State Float Center for a first float experience after reading the reviews here. The staff were welcoming and knowledgeable in preparing us for the float. The environment was relaxing and the actual float takes a bit of getting used to at first but it's really a great way to really switch off from the world. Skin and hair feels great after the float too! A real plus was that they have 2 floatrooms and 2 float pods so that up to 4 people can book their float at the same time.

Beautiful. Full stop!!. Beautiful staff, beautiful centre and just a wonderful experience all round. For the first timers out there, just go for it, you have nothing to lose and everything to gain. I have floated many times before, I'm always a little apprehensive when floating somewhere new but Theta State Float Centre certainly didn't disappoint. I floated for the first time in a float room today and loved it, the extra space was really nice. The centre is lovely an clean and everything you could need for a perfect float is provided there for you. Would definitely float here again!

Wonderful Experience- A must visit if visiting Bangkok. It was a wonderful experience to float for the first time, and one feels extremely relieved after the float.Truly amazing. Furthermore, the staff at the center was really helpful to all my queries regarding my session. I would recommend you to truly try it out , and am sure you wont be left disappointed,

Pure bliss 🖖🏻🖖🏻🖖🏻🖖🏻🖖🏻🖖🏻😘. You have to try this , it is amazing , top notch management and out of this world experience ..... If you are a swimmer or have any wish for space exploration... This is as close u get to floating in zero gravity !!!
Awesome experience. Highly recommend it :) So professional. So clean. Take some time out of your busy life to just unplug from technology and rest and relax.

Great cure for jet lag and city blues. i have been floating for a few years and I cant recommend it enough. Theta state has the perfect environment for a fully relaxing session. Pro tip go next door for a massage first, it makes the first 20min in the tank so much easier ;)

Relaxing. It was a nice and relaxing experience to try out floating. I did 60 min , but i wish i booked a 90 min session instead, because it ended alittle bit to quickly - I wanted to relax in the water longer.The staff is nice and helpful.

Interstellar. Located within easy reach of public transport I found myself at the front desk of the float centre. The layout of the reception is incredibly welcoming, this of course includes the decor, the delicious tea, the soothing music and no less the extremely friendly and knowledgable recpetionist - who was able to explain with ease and professionalism the floating experience.The floating itself was surreal and surpassed any of my pre-determined expectations. It is difficult to explain the floating experience, other than to say that it was like pressing pause on life, alebit for one hour. You could feel yourself unwinding from the daily stresses that exist both in the body and the mind. I often draw comparsions between similair things when I go to a new restaurant or maybe read a new book for example, however there is no other experience that I have had that I can compare to this one. The only word that I can think of, with the help of an online dictionary, to describe the floating is phantasmagorical.The only downside is that I have to go to Bangkok to be able to float again.

Feeling completely free, an amazing journey inward~. Such a perfect Saturday evening before our dinner date on a slow Saturday evening. I chose to float in the high ceiling float room instead of the modern-looking pod. Here are the steps to my journey inwards..~ Naked face, naked body, free from cell phone & boyfriend (he was in another room floating in the pod)~ Showered with the organic shower gel provided in the private room~ Put the earplugs in, also provided~ Stepped in the float room~ Imprinted my entire body in the water... completely let go of everything.. just like in the final relaxation pose of yoga~ With darkness and deep breathing, I felt and actually heard my breathe, heard myself clearly.. there goes my journey inwards.. to learn more about my inner state.Totally love the experience!So when I got connected to my inner self, I found out my wounds and my light, so just be aware is already great! LOVE LOVE LOVE =)

Amazing experience!. Heard about float spa and always wanted to try out. The online booking was smooth process and the environment was tranquil. I chose the chamber room and the staff explained to me in great details with much patience. It was such a peaceful and comfortable experience that I will definitely go back again.

Surprisingly relaxing. What a great experience! I really thought I would not last 90 minutes floating in the dark...I did. First the staff sat with us and explained how the experience would/should go. This were extremely helpful and made the floating experience very enjoyable. Will definitely do this again!

Very relaxing. There are 2 options - 1 room and 2 tanks.. So max 3 people at any one time. There is a changing room next to the floating bit. get naked. get inside. float in darknes. switch off and dream or sleep for 45 mins. get woken up by music, lights come back on, out you get. Get dressed, Pay the reception 2,000 Baht and feel a load less stressed. Brilliant for those wanting to relax, relieve aches and de-stress. Rubbish if you are poor, claustrophobic and find it hard to keep still.
Love it😊. really like it so much, before floating my leg is very pain because of walking to much, now I leg was no more pain and very relaxing

A fantastic place to creates, restores, or enhances well-being. Lately I have had a few challenges in a few areas of my life that led to an overactive mind, anxiety and disrupted sleep. Following a friend's suggestion, I have tried the Theta State Float Center on Soi 24. It was an excellent hour spent completely isolated , ,realizing my mind at work, and the impermanence of thought that gives birth to emotion. The session had a very calming effect, and I have experienced a healing long sleep later that evening. I highly recommend it.

Unlike anything I've ever experienced in my life. As per the title of the brief review, the Theta State Float experience is unlike anything I've ever experienced in my life. Opted for the 2 hour experience, which to be honest was probably a bit long for my first time but I don't regret it. Zoned out for a while, but then I went into a deep state of reflection. Not sure if that's what's supposed to happen but I liked it. Fingers crossed floating pods will make their way to Yangon shortly.Ps. I'd also recommend purchasing a bottle of Siam Botanical body rub. It's provided in the changing room, so it's possible to try before you buy.

Very relaxing and interesting experience in a friendly environment. We went to Theta State Float Center for our very first floating experience, and did not regret trying it.We received plenty of information by email right after confirming our booking already, including some videos that showed what the experience would be like. I'm a bit of an over-planner so this was great for me, knowing what to expect.The team was very friendly as we got there and took plenty of time to explain to us how everything worked and making sure we were comfortable. The floating experience itself was great! We chose the pods as we felt that was the more "authentic" floating experience. I generally have a hard time relaxing and shutting of my mind but felt that floating on water actually helped. I enjoyed feeling the warm water around me and even moving around a bit from one side to the other in slow motion - it felt like floating in space.Afterwards, we sat in the lounge on one of their sofas and had some tea and a complimentary energy snack, which was a great way to settle back into the real world after our hour of floating.I highly recommend this place, especially if you've never tried floating before. They really do provide everything you need (loved their shampoo!) and make sure you're comfortable and enjoying your time there. It was a great introduction to floating and next time we're in Bangkok, I'd like to go again!
Wow. The most amazing time, had a very busy few weeks finally got some "me" time. Last minute appointment. Everyone should go after a long week or a long haul flight!

Unbelievable Total Mind & Body Experience . This is a must do for anyone needing a total body & mind relaxation. Clean, healthy, environment. Staff are very informative and friendly. Thank you for a awesome experience.
Peace and Tranquility. It has been my first time and has been an awesome experience. If you are in meditating zone and want some time for yourself, this is the place to come.

Number one spa ever Theta State !!!. It was my first time and it was wonderful. I cannot believe I fell asleep even I was nervous at the beginning. Time pass so quickly, I wish music could play all the whole time. Definitely coming back here.

Amazing Experience. Just completed my first float ever and it was truly an amazing experience. It's hard to believe how relaxing it can be once you're completely cut off from the rest of the world. Most surprising was how quickly the time went. The staff here is very friendly and accommodating and the facilities are clean and well maintained. Highly recommend.

A great place of peace and deep relaxation in the centre of Bangkok. My dear friend brought me to the float centre saying that I have to experience it. And I didn't regret, it was truly a great experience. For me as a high energy person it was a great way to slow down and relax. The session was going for on hour and after 15 minutes of me thinking that I was relaxed I felt that my body started to melt and deeply surrendering into relaxation. I was in the state between being awake and asleep. The non gravity effect of high salt content in the water made me feel if I'm floating in space.After session I was so relaxed that had to take a nap in the middle of the day even though it's not my regular thing, and that night I also went to bed early. I felt fresh and new next day, well rested and energized:)Definitely recommend to everyone to at list try it , and if you feel excessive stress in your body several sessions will make a huge difference in your well being.The centre itself is already a beautiful experience, friendly and caring staff is adorable. They will take a great care of you and make you feel safe and comfortable.
Let go . Floating at the Theta State Float Center was an amazing experience and I was recommend it for everyone. Let go and experience a higher state of consciousness and immense relaxation

Amazingly relaxing experience!. Very positive experience. I was completely shut off from the world of business and tension while I was floating. The center and the floating dorm was very clean, and quiet. Matt was unbelievably friendly and very informative. Would definitely go back again.

What a relaxing time.. When I first tried,I was like...Are you sure that this could get me away from straightening? But! It does made me feel so good and relaxing which I truly recommend it in deed.I will definitely comes again and again.

A much needed "reset". I had a very relaxing and invigorating time at Theta. The staff was friendly, knowledgable and accommodating. It was my first time in a flotation tank and they made sure it was an enjoyable one. I did it beginning of the weekend, which turned out to be perfect, since I could catch up on a lot of rest during the weekend. It's like a switch was flipped and I felt the need to rest after weeks of being busy and only getting mediocre sleep. By Sunday I was feeling like my energy levels incurred a major reset. Very impressed with this and I plan to do it again as soon as possible. Unfortunately I won't be back in BK for a while and I can only hope my next visit will be at a similarly perfect place.

A wonderful experience one should not miss. I had a wonderful experience floating. The Center is very clean and have a very relax atmosphere. The staff (Matt) was very friendly and explained me in details about the benefit of floating and the procedures about how to float. There are two options to choose from float in a pod or in a room. As this is my first time I chose the room as the space is a bit larger when you float. Soft music was played for the first 15 minutes of the float to help you relax. After that, for me my mind just start drifting. It was amazing how the whole one hour went by, I were in a stage between fully asleep and consciousness. I felt so peaceful after the float and I felt like I have almost drifted to the edge of the universe, lol. I chose the 60 mins package, should had opted for the 90 mins instead. If you are after something special for your body and mind this is definitely the place for you. But please beware u might get addicted.

Very nice experience - Wife loved it. Fun and interesting experience. We did both the pod and the room for floats. Wife has had problems sleeping and after doing the float, she slept like the dead that night. Very relaxing. It's true what they, the time does go by faster. I'd like to give it another go, but this time in the room. The pod was a lot of fun but a bit too muggy for me. I think the room would be a better fit for me. The staff are very attentive and they did a great job.

A relaxing massage. Forget body chemistry. According to spa therapists and skincare with Theta State I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to "float" and escape. It was almost like waking up from a nice massage. For the staff polite,friendly and explains everything, and the facilities are very nice, offering modern and very clean Theta State Float Center is a brand new spa conveniently in Bangkok trendy Sukhumvit area.You must try it.

Superb and well service spa activities. This was the most fabulous experience I have ever been to spa. I enjoyed the luxury & wonderful place, clean & decorating room and staffs are warm welcoming which was memorable. Staff also are very expertise and friendly. I felt relaxing and fresh after being treatment. I would recommend to visit this place.

Somkane naksut. Will be back again' it just wonderful experience I feel fresh and my body is recharge again. I love the quiet and peaceful inside there make my brain clear and more energy for my new writing projects.

Float your mind. I've had my first float at the Theta State Float Center and it was a marvelous experience! The staff is very helpful and friendly making your first float a breeze. If you are into meditation it's like a booster to that and the overall feeling is amazing. In the beginning you might feel a bit nervous but just let it go, breath in and allow your mind to shut off. Another plus for the Center is its location, just walking distance from the Phrong Pong BTS Station (doable in a little bit more than 10 minutes or 2 with a MotorBike, if it's too hot outside). If you are looking for an out-of-the box relaxing & spa activity in Bangkok, look no further, you'll be thankfull that you've done it!

Great experience. Theta State provides everything they promise with professionalism and kindness. The facilities were clean and sleek. I noticed that right after I left the room, it was being cleaned for who might be the next guest. I went for my first float and ended up purchasing the buy two get one float deal. It was a very cool experience, but my own adjustment time didn't allow me to get the full experience, which is why I want to go back.The two women at the front desk were very friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. I felt comfortable and welcomed. Well done, ladies.I would be happy to give five stars if the prices are lowered or a bigger variety of packages are offered. For example, adiscounted 10 float package. For someone who wants to attend regularly, it can be very expensive. Overall, I highly recommend people to try floating if they are interested in meditation, relaxation, mind mapping, etc. This is the place to go for your first time.

Floating in bangkok. I recently visited this place it was the best experience i had. If you want to get away from hustle bustle traffic of bangkok for 1 hr or so this is the place . Floating in pod just enter with no expectations and just let your body do the rest. You feel weightless, deep relaxation and perfect for backaches and muscle tensions. Spend some time for yourself and your body will thank you for it

Fantastic Experience. I went in without any expectation. I was a bit nervous about my first time experience in the float tank but the staffs were so helpful and super kind. They treated us like friends of theirs. They explained to us of each steps and answered all of our questions with the passion. The environment was superb, very friendly and clean. I came outside and the boss was waiting hear about my experience in there. I did not just have a great experience but I have also made a new friend too. We couldn't stop talking about it. Went home with a smile and I will come back again for sure! Highly recommend!

First Float!. This was my first float tank experience, and I was definitely nervous. Annile and team were wonderful - they sat down and explained what to expect and gave some great tips on getting the most of the experience. The Float itself was super unique and an amazing experience. The Theta State facility is very nice and clean, and the staff are amazing. We sat and drank tea and talked about the experience for quite some time after I had finished. Overall, amazing experience. I definitely will go back.

Superb staff, the best float experience. Annile and the team were absolutely fantastic, it was my first experience in a float tank and they made it very easy. I initially was nervous but they did everything required to make sure I would benefit from it - and I completely did. I would thoroughly recommend everybody does this float tank, I feel completely rejuvenated. Thank you guys!!

Second Float Experience. I went for my second float yesterday and really enjoyed the experience. On my first float It took me a while to overcome some feelings of anxiety about the experience, but focusing on my breathing helped me to relax and enjoy myself. The second float was really enjoyable; i new what to expect and I was able to get something out of the experience. I would highly recommend this an interesting, introspective experience. Anneil (spelling!) was very helpful and made my partner and I feel very welcome.

I'll be back ! . Was abit nervous as a first time floater. Fantastic experience.. Very relaxing and had a great sleep that night. Woke up the next day with zero aches and pains. Super friendly staff and boss. Also the float center was very clean. Highly recommend !

Fantastic Atmosphere and Experience. Annile and his staff were incredibly accommodating and friendly. The float tanks and rooms were also beautiful and clean. I recommend this place to anyone seeking a solid float experience. I would give Theta State 10 stars if I were able to do so. Great experience!

First time "floater". Really enjoyed the experience - left relaxed and would definitely do it again! Theta was clean and well-thought facilities --- from the private room to use before and after floating session to the lounge area. It was nice to but relax in their lounge with a drink after the session, talking to other clients & the owners.

It was fun and relaxing!. I have never tried anything like this and really liked it! I definitely felt more relaxed and full of energy afterwards!!! Everything was explained before hand and although I was a little bit nervous of being in the pitch dark it wasn't an issue at all once I actually got in. There was a light in the pod that I could turn on at anytime and the music at the beginning really helped calm me down. I really liked it!

A not to be missed experience!. If you are new to zero gravity floating, boy are you in for a treat. I loved my first session so much (it was such a brilliant & romantic gift - thanks to my inspired husband!) we went ahead and booked another 4 sessions on the spot. Theta State is so chilled, it has two waiting areas, there is a fab exchange between folk as you are getting ready, and each room is totally private, soundproofed, well kitted out, everything you need. Just bring yourself! And get ready to unwind! Since my first experience here, I've been sharing with friends and family, and highly recommend to everyone wanting to enhance creativity, decrease stress, and curious to see just how far the body can learn to relax. Spread the word! Those in the know...float!Jessica Pelham

Just don't think twice. Go try it! . Amazing experience! The no-gravity and non-sensorial feeling helped me to get into deep relaxation. After the experience my body was very light and I was in a very good humor. Just don't think twice. Go try it!

Truly Moving. This is something you have to try! It is very safe and comfortable, but will be something you will remember forever. The staff explains everything, and the facilities are very nice, very clean, and very well maintained. There is even a guitar for you to noodle on in the waiting room. They have both pods and rooms to float it. You must try it.

Highly Recommended. I had a wonderful experience at Theta Float Center which was of course due to the amazing effects of totally relaxing in the Epsom Salt tub, but also it had a lot to do with the overall atmosphere at the Theta studio. I so appreciated the warmth I recieved upon arrival and the time that Annile and staff took to throughly explain things to me. Thank you guys! The float itself was highly rejuvenating and afterwards I felt calm and content. This is an experience that is hard to put into words, but one that I feel all must try. The experience of feeling fully boyant floating in the water was simply blissful. Please give it a try for yourself and you'll see what I mean. I went for 60 minutes, but next time I will certainly go for 90 minutes so that I can fully absorb the benefits of being in the "theta-state" of mind. Thanks again, A+ experience!

Simply AMAZING!. This is the new place in Bangkok to go for at least one hour of complete Mindfullness, inner peace, and not least relaxation! When you flow on top of the smoothest salt water in the world, in the dark and just complete silent, you find a peace, I have never experienced before. The staff is so friendly, speaks perfectly English, and is very helpful. The place itself iss clean and well kept as expected. A truly hidden gem in Bangkok. Get rid of jet lag, stress or any tension. I highly recommend this place!m

Life Enhancement. Relax and let go. Recharge your mind and body in one session. A unique and rejuvenating experience provided to you in a clean, professional environment. Top notch staff under the guidance of exceptional leadership.

Float and Escape. I woke up feeling like a new person! I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to "float" and escape. It was almost like waking up from a nice massage. An hour felt like 5 minutes. I'm definitely going to add floating to my routine.Annile is also a great host who will keep you entertained while you're ready for the room or the pod!

Always a Treat. I've been to Theta State Float 4 times already and it's true it gets better every time. Having said that, I must say I really enjoyed the experience from the very first visit. Shutting down your senses for an hour lets you enter a very deep relaxed state that is very hard to achieve in your normal environment. For me, getting into this state got easier the more I practiced.If you're into meditation, this kind of setting lets you get into a deep meditative state very easily, much faster than you can do in your normal environment. Even if you're not into meditation, you'll certainly feel it's benefits. You leave the pod/room perfectly relaxed, like you've just had a great massage. Careful, you may have a hard time falling asleep after!The equipment is top-notch, making it probably some of the best-value floats out there. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable, making sure you're fully prepared for your float. You'll be served tea and a small granola snack, which is absolutely delicious.If you live in Bangkok, make floating your habit with some of their packages to get an ever better deal than the standard price (as cheap as $35 per float). If you're just visiting Bangkok while traveling, do yourself a favor, skip the shopping malls and tourist traps, and treat yourself to an experience you won't forget.
Quite an experience!. Highly recommended, especially for those interested in meditation and altered states of consciousness - Excellent facilities, friendly staff and central location!
First time floating. This place is done right. Great place fpr forst time floaters. Friendly and helpful staff, soothing atmosphere n clean facilities. Cheers!

Great Way To Unwind. I often come to Thailand for family or business and this is the second trip I have enjoyed floating at the Theta Float Centre. I found the experience a great way to overcome jet lag and general fatigue that Bangkok can hit you with. More so the deep dream like state i went into felt healing and also uplifting. Putting me in a better calm mood and giving me a great night sleep afterwards.The centre here is fantastic, which begins with attentive and engaged staff. I have tried both the pods and float rooms which you can choose between, I suggest try both to see which works best for you. For me it's the rooms, they just get me into a deeper state of relaxation.Theta Float Centre is on my must do now each time I'm in Thailand and I will be introducing family and friends also as we are all in need of de-stress and relaxation these days..!

First timer.... ...always wanted to float to find out what the fuzz is about and went to them.Very friendly and helpful staff and and very clean and cozy small place, an oasis to relax.Floating itself was interesting (it works!) and relaxing, but I guess it take few more times to fully enjoy it as I was busy adjusting to the environment and not fully relaxing the first time.I will be back.

Floating in BKK. We have just come back from the Theta State Float Center where we went to spend an hour relaxing our minds and bodies. It was an amazingly wonderful experience. The environment, with two pods, two rooms and a lovely sitting room was conceived exquisitely and with much for thought. It is clean and comfortable. The staff are caring and considerate. Since a float tank can be a challenging experience one is cautioned with all the necessary information to allow one to give oneself completely to the experience ... Which of course is awesomely beneficial. We loved it and thank you guys for offering such a great relaxing experience.
Very relaxing experience. Professional staff, modern & clean ambience, reasonable priced and relaxing experience like no other. I like!

Thoughts from an floater in Lilly's lineage. There is a reasonable chance that i have floated more hours over the past 15 years than everyone else who's left a review so far put together, and after a number of visits here, I can say that Theta State hits the important notes right. Their tanks are high-quality, clean and well-maintained, and all the facilities - from the two lounges (pre-float and post-float), to the private rooms with closet, mirrored dressing area and shower, to the silicone christmas tree earplugs, inside-tank towel and neck pillow (for those who haven't learnt to relax into the sometimes-uncomfortable tension-releases yet) - demonstrate a level of attention to detail that can make all the difference in such a minimal environment. This is a great place for new and experienced floaters alike, and its central location makes it an easy visit for travellers who want to take a short skytrain trip to get off the beaten path.Some points worth pointing out:- If you have a bit of extra time to spare before your float, use it to acquaint yourself with the books and artwork on display in the lounges, as they are there for a reason.- The tank temperatures are adjustable to one decimal place ('C), and if you know your individual preference and tell the staff in advance, they can pre-set it for you. Otherwise, just stick with the default temp.- Use the earplugs not just to keep the salt out of your ears but to block out outside noise and tune in to your body's natural sounds and tones, so that they synchronise with your bodily vibrations, which may also start getting louder as everything else fades away. If the internal sounds and the sensations synch up before you tune out completely, you can start going out-of-body or into wake-induced lucid dreams, which may or may not be what you're looking for.- Go in with more curiosity than expectation, or at least as much.

Not for me. Well run facility - modern equipment, very clean, polite staff, etc. The actual experience did nothing for me. My shoulders remained tense even when floating and I finished after 40 minutes. But, I'm glad I tried it and my companion enjoyed her float.

2nd visit was even more rewarding than the first.. This was my second trip to Theta State Float Center. I cannot express how wonderful the experience was. The first visit (60 minutes) was amazing. The second visit (90 minutes) was perfection. Must add this to the list if you ever have the chance to.

Unforgettable Experience - Highly Recommended!. I have been wanting to try floating for some time and finally got around to doing it. Wow, what an incredible experience. It really put my mind and body at ease on a whole new level, unlike anything I have ever experienced before. The place is very clean with a nice atmosphere and very knowledgeable staff. Looking forward to doing this on a regular basis.

Destressed!. I had an incredibly stressfull day and went in just about ready to explode. It's usual for me, as I am normally a very calm person just to give even greater context to this! Short story after the float I felt a great sense of peace and slept very well that night. I am sure that I would of had a much better experience if I had gone in less stressed, as it took me a good while to settle. Till next time!

Great Experience - Recommended. Two great benefits for me (1) strong muscle relaxation like a very very good massage (2) calming of your mind similar to meditation.
Location is very nice, staff very friendly and professional.
Will come again :)

Amazing. I had never done a float before, and did not really know what to expect, but I was blown away. My wife and I both did a 1 hour float in the pods, which were much larger than I had anticipated. It was one of the most relaxing experiences I have ever had. Total sensory deprivation, and completely relaxing. They also have float rooms that are larger in case claustrophobia is an issue. Very friendly, and professional staff. Highly recommended

Pure Bliss & Relaxation. The most incredible thing you can do for recovery, relaxation and rejuvenation. Had done a couple floats back in Canada, all in pods. Loving the float rooms here, the lights option and the music at the start and finish are amazing! Also the tea and snack at the end, in the super comfy lounge area are a nice touch! My cup of tea for sure! Staff is super friendly, kind and accommodating. Fantastic atmosphere and design here, would recommend to anyone and everyone! I'll be back!

Best Floating Experience Ever!. Theta State floating is incredible. I love to float and have been doing it for many years now. So when I arrived at Theta State today, I was surprised to discover the best float tanks I had ever been in. It was state of the art and floating was pure bliss. Add to that the helpful staff, great facilities, cleanliness, wonderful books and resources, delicious teas and after float treat and you have a winning combination that exceeded all my previous float experiences around the world. The owners, Annile and Joy were there to assist and support my needs as well as share floating tales and background to really add to the visit. They are both very helpful in every way and know Thailand well, so can help with general questions beyond floating. If you have never floated or love to float, Theta State is the place to go. I will be visiting again and again.

Not my cup of tea. Visited in the evening of late Mar 2015. Had to avoid Mon as they do not open. Responsive to emails. The name of the staff who attended to us in emails & in person when we visited was Joy. Friendly & professional. Cosy environment. The procedures & rules stated in the website are all fully applicable. Before the floatation therapy, we had to bathe. I was so impressed by the rich lavender smell of the shower gel & shampoo that I bought them after the session. Its stated in the website on discounts for first-timers like us, and we requested for it when it was initially not offered to us.A crux was as such I was uncomfortable lying on my back in the salt water for a long period & realised it's important to have some special form of support for my strained neck. The cushion provided didn't really work. More importantly, I was unable to relax in complete darkness due to a creepy psychological feeling. I started to panic when the salt water got into my eye, which irritated my eye, and I couldn't locate the switch or towel! I almost slipped due to the wet floor & this was when I was still desperately trying to locate the switch. Managed to find it eventually & decided to end the session early. My friend found the session okay though so I guess it doesn't work for everyone. Its another good learning experience about myself.

For Skeptics - please read.. Skeptical with just about anything, I went with no expectations. What happened in that one hour was amazing. Skipping with the amenities which was as advertised and more, the weightlessness meant I could fully let go - this is something that does not happen in my profession. Into the first 20 minutes, my thoughts went randomly on mundane issues until the music stopped, I then went into the dreamlike state. I found many "ah-hah" moments about myself, about my health, about happiest moments of my life - moments I had forgotten, kept locked away, that even my RAM was unable to find until this reflective hour. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants their subconscious raised to awareness. I emerged an hour later a happier soul - now what could be better than that? Thanks to the team, I have truly found an oasis in Bangkok.
Relaxing atmosphere. During the first visit they say you seldom experience something special. So it was. But the center itself is great. Very relaxing atmosphere.

Great experience. I visited Theta State float center in December 2015 and decided to buy the intro package (pay for 2 floats and get the third free.) I met the owner as well who explained the benefits to me and we had a good chat. The staff were very professional and very friendly. The facility is super clean and easy to get to as well.I did a 60 minute float and I have to say that for people who are interested in meditation, skilled relaxation, etc. it is an excellent experience as it helps attain a state of deep relaxation. I felt very relaxed when I finished the session and it is something I would like to do a few times a month. Whatever it takes to elevate my well-being, bring it!

"Incredible Meditation". They say the quickest way to change your behaviour is to change your surroundings, and if you have EVER wanted to try any form of meditation... well, this damn thing is going to force you to meditate, whether you like it or not. But this is more than just meditation. This is akin to an out-of-body experience, if your mind is open and you've had some practice calming yourself through traditional forms of meditation.First things first - Mat (?) at the front desk was extremely helpful. He gave me a 20% discount because the music didn't work (I know, I thought he was crazy too, but I wasn't going to argue). He calmly explained the music signals when the meditation is about to begin, and when it's about to end, but my meditation would start and stop with a sound of a pump. He explained everything in thorough detail - the science, the way the meditation calms your brain and brings feelings of happiness, the way the salt makes you float - everything I had read beforehand was repeated as per verbatim. It was comforting to know I was in the hands of someone who cared about the experience.One thing to note: I was prepared for this float. I listened to podcasts on people floating and I do meditation on a regular basis, so I have some idea on how to calm my mind through breathing exercises.When Mat brought me into the capsule room, he told me the normal brouhaha (take a shower, don't put your face in the capsule water or the salt will irritate your eyes like hell, there's fresh water to wipe your face in case this happens). He left me alone, I stripped naked, showered, put in some earplugs and commenced the float.The beginning of the float was bizarre, to say the least. My mind was simply deprived of every sense except for the feeling of the water against my skin. It didn't really know what to do. After about 10 minutes, I noticed pain in various parts of my body, and most noticeably around my neck area. It was quite intense, but not in an unendurable way. More like a - "hey this part of your body needs to heal, and we're going to do this now" kind of way. Throughout this part, I simply did my breathing exercises.About halfway through, something started happening in my field of vision. Green and white misty swirls started to cloud my vision. It was strange, the best way I can describe it is that it looked very much like music visualization software you would get from itunes of windows media player. The minute I tried to focus on it, the swirls went away. I started focusing on my breathing again, and the colours came back. It was incredible, and I truly forgot everything at this moment. I was just... in the moment.When the float was over. I stood up and at this point salt water entered my eyes. How did it feel? Think of a squirrel clawing his way into your eyes, thinking your pupils were chestnuts. I ran to the shower and rinsed off. I spoke to the owner's girlfriend, who was very kind and said that my float is a rare one - where the experience is more than just simple meditation. An experience like my own tends to happen after 2 or 3 floats for most people. Mat confirmed this as well. They took a photo of me (with my permission) and gave me some amazing blue tea. I wish I stayed in BKK longer to experience theta float again. They have an increasingly popular service, but more importantly, they care about their clients and truly value float meditation as something that can enrich your life.And that neck pain? Yeah that went away.

Very relaxing and wonderful!. I enjoyed my experience at Theta State Float Center. I took myself and my husband for a session. My husband was very apprehensive but he ended up loving it. The staff are great at answering any questions you may have. The center is clean and spotless. You can choose to go into a pod that is in a room by itself or you can go into a room that has multiple pods so you are not alone. Me and my husband went into the rooms where we were by ourselves. The water is full of Epsom salts so you float without touching the bottom even though the water is only about 10 - 12 inches deep. There is soft music playing, it only plays for the first few minutes or so. You can keep the lights on if you want; it's all totally up to your own comfort level. When you are alone with no intruding stimuli, you will start to have thoughts that might surprise you. I ended up thinking of a book I'd like to write. It was a little bizarre. Afterward, you get dressed and they will have tea waiting for you. You can sit and relax for as long as you need before moving on. I have bought multiple sessions for my very stressed out husband. I know he will enjoy them!

Absolutely amazing, highly recommended . After seeing so many positive reviews about floating I decided to give a try and just got out from it. I have to say that this experience is unbelievable and worth every money. Everything is true what has been written about it. The staff is really helpful and nice, the initial 10 minutes is a bit strange but then it kicks off and the ultimate relaxation starts. Highly, highly recommended to everybody!

Maybe I'm just picky. My wife and I came here because the reviews were so good. It was our first time at a floating center and I wish I could say I enjoyed it. We got there 30 minutes early and were allowed to sit down and use the wifi, which was very nice of them. When our time came about, everything was kindly explained and the service was nice, which makes me feel bad about the two stars.When the experience began, we were in seperate rooms and had to take off all of our clothes and put them in a closet. No lock of any kind. I trusted the staff and didn't say anything, but it did make me a bit nervous and, since I was there to relax, it wasn't a good start. They should give you a key to the closet and somewhere to hang it in the room, just to help put your mind at ease. Anyways, I sucked up my apprehension, took a shower and got into my salt bath room. I followed all the directions and lay down and tried to relax. The thing is, I'm a very light sleeper and noises distract me. They advertised the room as sound proof, but it wasn't. I kept hearing a faint thumping, like that of someone opening and shutting a door or pipes making noises in the wall. It bugged me so much that I actually sat up and opened the door to my room to check if anyone was looking through my stuff in the outer room. No one was, but the noises persisted. After opening the door, I ended up getting salt water in my eyes, not too enjoyable. I followed their directions and sprayed the fresh water and used the clean towel. When I hung it back up, it must have hung into the salt water, for when I used it again it didn't help much. Still determined to try and enjoy my experience, I blocked out the slight pain left in my eyes from the salt water and lay back down. I kept the door to the small room closed, for the staff had said it might get cold if I opened it. I soon found that the air was very dry and that it was a bit hard to breath because of this. When i cracked the door, it felt better, but I shut it because the staff recommneded against it. My wife kept hers open and enjoyed the fresher air. I wish I had done the same.Overall, I found floating on salt water to be interesting, but didn't enjoy my experience. When I told the staff about the noise, she defended the place saying it was in an old building and that when they built the place the ceiling between the first and second floor wasn't so good. I have no idea if others have mentioned similar things, but it seemed like at least one other had. The rooms shouldn't be advertised as sound proof. Maybe the pods are.

Floating - a new spa experience . Stumbled upon Theta State Floating Centre as we were searching for a good spa on TripAdvisor. Didn't know what "floating" meant, or what it offers.Our first impression was "Clean and professionally managed". The staff was kind enough to walk us through the concept of "floating" and advise on how best to maximise the experience.As a first timer, I would recommend the 60min (instead of 90mins as recommended by many) just to get yourself comfortable and accustomed to the weightlessness and the solitary. For those who do not know what to expect, 60mins may feel like forever in a confined space. The staff was very professional and made sure she did a thorough survey and gotten our feedbacks on the experience.Would definitely recommend friends to try it out. I am planning to give it a second try the next time I come to Bangkok.

Must for self talk and peace. This was my first experience and the best till now . One Hour with yourself is what you will get , the staff is simply super , very informative and cooperative . Its a must for all who need to unwind .

Complete relaxation after a long flight or a stressful work week. I've been interesting in floating (sensory deprivation) for a few years but I never got around to trying it until a recent trip to Bangkok. A friend I have that lives in Bangkok referred me to Theta State Float Centre. The staff was friendly and knowledgable and prepared me how to optimize the experience. The centre was clean, well kept, and had a welcoming vibe. I recommend the float room as its more spacious than the pod. The float starts with some relaxing music as you adjust to the feeling and then its complete silence. The are no distractions from your senses so you can completely disconnect from whatever stresses you have. I walked out with that feeling when you trying something really interesting for the first time and very relaxed. I was told the second float is even better and I will be back to float again before I leave Bangkok!

Highly Recommend . When my girlfriend first recommended that we take time from our vacation to try this I was skeptical. I'm so glad I listened to her! This really is an incredible experience, and the people at Theta are fantastic. My only wish was that we did the 90 minutes instead of only 60. It's so relaxing that I wish it lasted longer!

Best way to cure jet lag!! . What a wonderful way to ease into the crazy city of Bangkok and relief from 17+ hours on a plane from the U.S.! The spa is clean, peaceful and the people are super friendly! The tea and granola balls they give you while you're there was a nice touch. They also take a Polaroid (if you allow them to) to add to their wall! Also a nice touch! We floated in two of the rooms, but next time I'll try the pods. They also had everything you need to leave straight from there to see the sites! (Hairdryer, gel, brushes, even contact solution). I could not recommend this place more! Thank you again for a great float!!

Superb experience -- relaxing float, caring staffs, and spotless facility!!!!!. When choosing a float center, you can't go wrong with Theta State. The center is impressive, with beautiful interior and lighting and the quietness of a spa center. Everything is clean and spotless; the floating pod is very pretty to boot!The staffs are professional and they genuinely care about your experience. Tea is served before and after the float, and there's a living room to sit back and relax for as long as you want. Inside the room you will find everything that you need, including new earplugs, clean towels, vaseline to cover cuts from the salt water, the dressing table. The float itself was very relaxing, as I drifted into sleep and woke up refreshed from the noises of the world. Needless to say, I slept peacefully during those nights that I floated. I am a regular now; I float regularly at this center. Highly recommended!!

5 Star Experience. Everything about The Theta State Float Center was 5 Star service. I would recommend this to any and everyone. Even if it doesn't end up being your "thing" I believe everyone should try it at least once. My friend and I were 30 minutes late for our appointment even though we left plenty of time (Bangkok taxis / out of town visitors not a good mix for directions) The people at the Float Center were so accommodating. I was afraid we were going to miss our appointment but they made us feel relaxed and welcome regardless of our tardiness.Floating was a great way to decompress mentally and physically. The benefits of the epsom salt on your body are endless. I stay pretty physically active with yoga and other cross training methods and the salt baths are great for your recovery. The husband and wife owners are clearly passionate and well-versed in all of these benefits and are very excited to share their knowledge. It's so refreshing to see this passion in business owners. The experience and the customer service are what sold me on stopping in here again the next time I'm in Bangkok.The owner couple even chatted me up about my next stop in Chiang Mai and places I should go off the beaten path. FYI- I found Ristr8to! #EastVillageVibes :)Kob Khun Ka for a groovy experience!! -Christine
Amazing!. Floating was such a relaxing experience. I plan to go back regularly. It was such a nice relaxing place, the staff was great and gave great instruction. Wonderful!

Best float tank center I've been to! A+++. As an experienced global floater from San Francisco to Montreal, Theta State Float Center is now my favorite float center in the world. They were recently mentioned on Joe Rogan's podcast and for good reason. It is the best in BKK, and located right in the heart of Phrom Phong. The overall reviews here speaks for itself (of course minus the once in a blue moon demanding and unreasonable customer as expected). Neil, Joy, and the team have really done a fantastic job to create a great floating experience from start to finish. They actually care about your experience, and it's all in the details. Each and every tank here is kept in immaculate clean condition, the rooms are well prepped, and the customer experience is top notch from start to finish. I love floating here so much that it is my favorite gift to purchase for visiting friends from out of town! If you've never floated before or even if you've some experience, I highly recommend Theta State to everyone!

First time floating - great experience. Never tried a float tank before but really happy I did. The Theta State Float Center was a great place with a really friendly and helpful staff that was 100% focused on making my first float a great journey. Thanks a lot - will be back!

Another great way to relax!. Located in Sukhumvit area, this place is like a little oasis that you can escape from the busy environment and spend an hour with just yourself. For the first time visitor, you might feel a little strange, don't know what to do. Here's a little tip, do not forget to wear the ear plug, it can help you to reach the calmness easily, no water will tickle your ears. The first fifteen minutes without your mobile might be a torture time, but believe me, you'll be ok without it for an hour. Just relax and let yourself float freely. Close your eyes and either meditate or you can just take a nap. There will be music playing 5 mins when the session starts and again before the session ends. So don't worry, you'll be waking up freshly in time. I had experienced a lighter body after a session of floating, the tired muscle got an hour break and it felt relax after the float.For those who are afraid of the narrow space, i would recommend the room type, high ceiling will make u feel more relax. For those who are afraid of the dark, you can keep the dim light on and you'll be just fine.Overall experience is great, facilities is well located, nice and friendly staffs. Love it here!!!

This place is great!!!. I had never done a float before and was excited to try it. The place is spotless and the staff couldn't be more friendly and accomodating--right down to talking to my cab driver when I got lost. Definitely worth a visit. And ask for Shannon. She was super sweet!!!

A Perfect Opportunity to "Disconnect". I had heard about floating in the US a few yeas ago, and was pleasantly surprised to a see a float center open up in Bangkok! My first experience was even better than I hoped it would be. Theta State has really cool facilities that offer a much needed break in my high-paced, hectic lifestyle of noise, notifications and responsibility. For 1-2 hours, you can just leave it all behind, and that's the perfect amount of time to do it! I left feeling completely relaxed and revitalized. Perfect for a solo trip, a date, or friends/family!

A new experience of spa. We have tried many different spa in past but this one is totally different to new to us. The staff explained to us in very detail what to expect and how to enjoy.We had to shower before step in the pod, once I stepped in and whole body lied flat, immediately floated up , followed music to relax and enjoy the unique feeling. For the first 5 mins my shoulder a bit tense but after for awhile , all the feeling , stress and even time all gone . I just could feel I surrounded by warm water in all dark environment ( you can turn light on or off) , totally isolated to the world outside which is very different with any other spa , it really help your mind relax. Unlike normal spa, there's no people to massage you, you don't feel anything of your muscles but just relax . It's pretty similar with sleep on a water bed, just you can't sleep side way and feel absolutely isolated. My husband shared his experience with me which is very different. He first 10 mins kept bouncing two sides as he is big, once he made any movement in water then the current pushed him to other side, took him some time to use to but soon could enjoy.
