After 1 hour section, I actually felt not long enough as you easily lost time track inside, I felt my whole body pretty light. I usually experience my muscle pain after over pressure during massage but not this time. It's a easy and special way to let whole body muscle relax and rest for 1 hour. I will do it again next time .

Perfect Calm and Comfort in Bangkok. I originally discovered floating about a year ago while on holiday in Thailand when I first visited the good people of Theta State. I've since been to several other float centers throughout the United States and I can truly say that Theta State is still the best experience I've had floating. Returning back to Bangkok meant returning there for certain. As before, the experience was top-notch from beginning to end. The staff is warm, friendly, professional, and accommodating which makes for a welcome and comfortable vibe. The atmosphere and facilities are clean, tasteful, and even homey feeling; it's obvious that they haven't missed a single detail in providing for a relaxing experience. Their float tanks will take you as far as your mind is able to go. I did a two-hour float this time around which took me far, far away from the hectic buzz of Bangkok. There's no better way to relax while in Thailand than having a float at Theta State. I highly recommend it to all.

Excellent first experience. This was my first float and such an amazing one! The staff were really professional, friendly and knowledgeable. The float center and the pod/rooms were super clean (this is a big deal coming from a person with OCD tendencies). You have access to the things that you might need before and after the float; which is really helpful...I chose the room for my float and really enjoyed the experience. Having the light and music on for the first 10-15 min was really helpful. After that it took me a few more minutes to get used to the dark and the silence. This pleasant experience got me hooked.....I would highly suggest this to anyone.

One of a kind experience. I first heard about floating when a friend sent some information about a new type of therapy in a spa. So off I went reading about it and found out the many apparent benefits it gives to the mind, body and probably spiritually too. And I finally had the chance to experience it on my most recent trip to Bangkok. The centre is located a 10-min walk from Phrom Phong BTS station in Sukhumvit area. On arrival, I was greeted by the staff and had to fill up a questionnaire. Mac explained briefly about floating, in a calm and patient manner. I also had the chance to talk to the owner, Annile Alexander, who shared his own experience in floating. He put me at ease with his sharings. I was glad to know that I'll be floating in clean water at the very least. Oh, and the place was clean, calming and tranquil. The pre-float experience was definitely good. Mac ushered me to my room and after explaining the dos and don'ts I was left to do what I came for. I am somewhat aquaphobic and initially I struggled to relax and just float. I also made sure I could easily push open the door to the chamber, locate the water spray and small towel just in case I really needed them. So after testing that everything was working fine I finally shut the door and floated. I probably didn't get the "meditational" benefits but my stiff shoulders and knee aches were gone, enabling me to enjoy in good spirit, the rest of my one-week learning journey in Bangkok. I definitely recommend everyone to try this at least once. I am already planning my next float, and I want the "Pod" the next round. Thank you.

Flotation first timer. An excellent first experience of total suspension in Epsom Salt water, ULTIMATE Tranquility, I tried the pod but there are also rooms which I may checkout on my next visit,the staff were highly knowledgable and welcoming and totally focussed on MY Experience not overtly punting for tips like many Spa or Massage staff in Thailand. I totally recommend this experience was also informed of a Flotation Centre in London which I am sure to checkout.

Interesting, but depending on your preference. Basically what they offer is letting you to lie down in a tub filled with salty water which makes you float. No massage involved and charges around 2,000bhat (60usd) for 60min. Maybe an interesting experience if you're a fan of emptying your mind doing nothing but lying in a calm dark place for over an hour, but not sure it's worth that money.

Mind and body spa. In today's hectic world it's hard to find a time and way to truly relax both the mind and the body. In my opinion, Theta State Float Center does both at the same time. I was apprehensive and even thought I might be claustrophobic but once I got into the warm water and hear the music once I float, it's easy to turn the lights off and allow myself. to float in the dark. There is no agenda, no feeds to check, no calls to be taken. It's a complete shutdown from the world in a very pleasant way. I will definitely be back.

Amazing Experience with Excellent Service. Theta State Float Center provided a great floating experience and environment. Service was perfect, the pods/rooms were clean, and these contributed to the floating experience. The host (sorry mate, I forgot your name!) took the time to patiently explain the experience and gave a quick tour of the center. My friends and I were late to our appointment due to heavy traffic but the staff was extremely accommodating. Anyone visiting the city should definitely make a trip down for some mind and body relaxation!

Deeply relaxing and unique experience. In a city renown for its massage and wellbeing offerings, Theta State float centre is offering something entirely unique. Amazing even !This was my first float and it’s very impressive. Once i’d adjusted to the buoyancy of my body in the water and the very cool sense of weightlessness, i could feel my body deeply relaxing, gradually dialing down the nervous system and the body’s tension. Falling deeper and deeper into relaxation i just drifted. Literally and metaphorically. It’s almost impossible to describe, you really have to experience it. The staff here are super friendly and the place really clean.It’s also located in a very central part of the city and really easy to get to.Seriously, i would highly recommend this to anyone. Sure go have a massage at any of the spa’s or massage places in Bankok, but this is unquestionably like nothing you've experienced before.

Very good experience. It's a nice place to float in the water. I was sleeping when I floated. It was really relaxing. And operator are lovey husband and wife, they are very friendly. I recommend you come here that relaxing your brain, not only relaxing your body.

I've never felt so relaxed!. What an amazing experience! We had heard from a few people about the benefits of a float tank, so we figured we would give it a try. WOW! At Theta State Float Center the staff were amazing and greeted us with honey tea. They then thoroughly explained what the experience would be like which was honest and informative. The float itself was relaxing and comfortable - I really enjoyed just floating for an hour. I didn't think about work, I didn't worry about life - I just chilled! I can say I haven't had the opportunity to do that in a long time. When it was over I felt more relaxed than ever - even better than a massage! We used the pods but there is a larger room for those less comfortable with small spaces and the dark - so there is an option for everyone. We highly recommend this experience and can't wait to go back

Awesome experience . This was definitely an experience to remember! The feeling is very surreal and like nothing I've ever experienced. It is something everyone should try at least once. The lady who was running everything was extremely nice and welcoming as well as very well spoken, she explained everything in detail very clearly which helped make it even more enjoyable

relaxing and euphoric. I had the chance to visit while I was in Bangkok this past week and am so happy I did. I was warmly welcomed by friendly staff who introduced me to the floating concept and prepared me for what was to come. While I waited my turn, the owner came in and seemed to know everyone who was there. He was very friendly and excited for me to try it. The experience is truly unique and super special. I was able to fully let go and relax and came out feeling as if I was still floating and I definitely felt the affects of all the dopamine that was released into my brain. My knee pain was gone and I felt very happy and satisfied with my experience. I highly recommend it to all.

Theta State Float Center in Bangkok. Sent from my iPadJust had my first floating "experience!" Once the new age music started playing, signaling that I was coming to the end of my session, I wasn't ready for it to end!I'd given my son a floating session for his birthday and because he came home so excited about it, I thought I would try it myself! Due to my fear of claustrophobia, I chose to go into the floating room, as opposed to to the floating capsule. I was impressed by the fact that the water is recycled three times between patrons and sanitized by ultra violet light -- a very clean environment! All floaters are expected to shower and shampoo their hair before they enter the water. A neck pillow was available for those who require extra neck support and a yummy healthy treat was served, along with a cup of hot tea at the end of the session. I loved the opportunity of being able to get away from it all and caught myself drifting off into a deep sleep several times! The session began with new age music and ended with more of the same. I felt totally relaxed and ready to face the outside world once the session had come to an end...just wish it could have gone on for longer!A clean private room was provided, equipped with a vanity, blow dryer, ear plugs, towel, natural shampoo, conditioner, liquid soap and body lotion. The highlight of my experience was having the opportunity to speak to Annile Alexander, the owner, who was exceptionally warm, open and enthusiastic and spent plenty of time with me, describing what I could expect from my first floating experience! It is great to know that there is a place like this available in Bangkok where you can take a break from it all -- I'll be back!

Meditation made simply... effective.. Love this place! Really nice people who own and run the float centre. Very clean and welcoming environment. Everything is done to relax you even before you get in the tank. As a new floater, I was kind of nervous about the idea of getting into the tank but also rather full of hope for some kind of great mystical revelation. Only when I really just let go of my fears and my expectations and was able to get to a peaceful (dare I say blissful) state of just being cool with what is. Through this is a gateway to creating connection to whatever imagery/vision has relevance for the individual floater. At least that was my experience. For anyone interested in meditation made simple, try floating. Also the experience lasts far beyond the tank, you carry this relaxed attitude out of the pod with you and the streets of Bangkok seem a little less crazy than before, energy and spirits are lifted high, even work is a pleasure. Yes. Really! Oh and I love the little granola balls and blue (lilac) tea they give you its a lovely little bonus treat at the end.

Better than your everyday spa experience. A wonderful experience that has left me relaxed and calm for hours afterwards. Although the floating sensation and the concept of being alone with yourself takes some time to get used to, it's truly wonderful once you let go and allow yourself to just 'be' in the flotation pod. Highly recommended!

Very professional and clean.. Highly recommended. The staff are very professional, attentive and friendly. Very relaxing experience for me. I used the float pillow as my next could not get comfortable. I found that the relaxation stayed with me all day and had the best night's sleep I have had in a long time.

Amazing Experience. When I went in, everything was very comfortable and calming. I was debriefed and taught on what I should do and not do. The experience was... I can't really put it into words. Floating was a little confusing for me to get used to at first, but once I got used to it - it was easy. I don't know if I felt asleep, but I was able to get a lot of thinking done. Weirdly, I also had various visions too. Like they say, everyone's experience is different. It felt like it was only 15 minutes, when in fact I floated for 90 minutes. I felt extremely relaxed afterwards, and I got to talk about my experience after my float with the owner. Funny thing is - I was lost for words that I had to sit down to collect myself. I really do recommend this for everyone - especially those who are always working and are doing things non stop like me. Thank you. Will surely visit again when I'm there.

Unreal!. Unreal! Just unreal in the most literal sense. An alternate state of reality, a nothingness that encompasses a lack of sensory that enables the most thought provoking and clear mindedness that everyone should perceive. The float experience to me was a mix between Meditation and a Spa Treatment. Relaxation in every sense that leaves you in a consistent bliss. A must see when travelling to Bangkok and a must experience while living in the busy city. It is becoming one of my favourite ways of relaxing, the THETA STATE.

clear the mind!. great experience, amazing way to clear your mind, or simply allow yourself to listen to your thoughts without distractions. great location as well plus super friendly welcoming staff!

Rebalance. I first learned about isolation tanks when I read about psychological experiments on consciousness and perception. So when I tried it for the first time at Theta State, I was expecting some sort of isolation experience but was surprised to realize how floating has so much more to offer than just sensory deprivation.First, the entire vibe of the Theta State Float Center is so relaxing and comfortable. The owners and the staff are incredibly warm and accommodating and the center itself is very quiet and peaceful.After floating for one hour, I felt surprisingly refreshed and rebalanced. I think beyond just the meditative effects, which are great for restoring your mental energy, the benefit of floating is in the water, which is loaded with minerals and set at a temperature in tune with your body's homeostasis. Much like the Dead Sea, floating can actually promote your skin's natural water balance and replenish your body's energy cycle, so not only is it relaxing but also rejuvenating. My first visit was so amazing that it convinced me to start floating as part of a healthy routine for my mind and my body. Now I recommend this place to all of my friends and even bought my boyfriend a package for a birthday present!

Really, must try to believe!. It's been said before, one might even say it's cliche, but you really have to visit Theta State and float for yourself. At the very least, you're going to get an hour or so of respite from the grinding human condition by suspending your body and ridding yourself of the torment of gravity - that, alone, is worth it. But, if you give yourself a couple floats (or, maybe you're lucky and it happens during the first one), you'll start to reap the innumerable benefits to your mental health as you drift into a transcendental state where your body fades away and your stream of consciousness flows into the nether. Oh, and the staff? Top-notch hospitality and very, very well-informed. Like that big shoe company says: Just do it.

Peaceful, relaxing and energising!. I was looking into Sensory Deprivation before Theta State was established and was thrilled when a close friend mentioned there was a floatation centre in Bangkok's Prime location, Sukhumvit 24. As a meditation practitioner, floating was something I had been highly curious about. I have floated 5 times now and the experience of floating gets better each time. I highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for deep relaxation of mind and body. The staff at Theta are friendly and personable. The Lounge area for before and after the float is a great place to chill, read and recollect your thoughts. They provide you with complimentary tea and a healthy snack is available if you're hungry.All in all... a wonderful, one of a kind experience with a great value for money!

A must experience. This place was just awesome. They accommodated me on short notice as I was not sure to book for one or two people. The reception was just great and they made us feel very comfortable and easy. We chose separate options. The pod and the floating room and it was both very comfortable and private.The benefits were just phenomenal. From a physical to mental , spiritual and emotionally and can only rate this place 100 percent awesome. I used the pod for 90 mins and my wife the room for 60 mins and they Co ordinated our time so well that it didn't even feel like we had to wait for each other.I could possibly go on and on about this place but it is the place where you will have your own unique experiences but nothing short of at least having an experience that you will remember for the rest of your life. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the environment is just so calm and serene .They also have a snack after your session that I had to get me a pack of.A must do again and the balance this brought into our lives, after just one session or float are just beyond words.keep it up guys and I think I want to own a centre like this in South Africa

Energising Experience!!!. This was my first time to float and it allowed my mind and body to re-energise. When you first enter the water the buoyancy is surprising but you soon get used to it. It was a great experience and I will be going back again.

Must go visit!!!. Besides the actual float experience (which is existential, spiritual, and downright wonderful), what really stood out to me was everything else. The rooms are filled with a quiet sense of serenity that gets your ready for the float experience. The staff is extremely inviting and personable. The lounge area is both comforting and alive with conversation and music. I flew in from the States, tired after a long flight, and to me, this is a must-experience place. My friend that I traveled with, went in twice. I highly recommend this place!!

A quiet sanctuary in the city. Floating is a great way to enter a deep meditative states and escape the business of Bangkok. Somehow I can always get deeper in the tank than through my regular meditation. An hour goes by very fast and afterwards I always feel fresh and rested. Theta State has friendly staff and offers a private and quiet environment. Outside the tank there's a peaceful waiting room where you can contemplate your experience and sip tea before you re-enter the busy real world. Highly recommended!

Exploring consciousness. Wonderful staff, clean, and safe. Floating in zero gravity created a disconnect from my body, allowing my mind to explore altered states of inner perception, mentally digest happenings from my life, and towards the end transcend thought altogether. Insightful and blissful. Highly reccommended!

Sound of silence. A float center is an island where the mind can withdraw from the business it goes through during the day, and body and skin massaged by the warm saline solution. My feeling is that salts highly contribute in the benefit.So it is great place to soothe one's body and recharge battery. The staff of theta state is available for all needs or quizzing regarding the experience and delicious flower tea is given at the end of the session for our transition time from their womb back to the world of our outer senses .For best experience avoid to load your stomach before your visit and plan quiet time to give some momentum to the weightlessness you will experience then.

Don't expect it to be the best experience of your life, but it could be.... The location is easy to locate and access. The space is inviting and has a pleasant, calming energy. Personal attention is given to describe expectations in detail and answer questions on your first visit. Even when busy, clients do not feel rushed or invisible.Every amenity is considered from the welcome tea when you arrive, to the organic body soap and shampoo, and a relaxation area with another warm tea and small energy snack upon completion of the float. The float itself is where the magic happens. Or not. At an absolute minimum (and this is a HUGE benefit in itself), your body will receive the healing benefits of floating in epsom salt, which eases muscle tension and stress. After 10 minutes floating, I was able to experience a complete absence of pain after living with chronic pain for over 8 months. This was an absolute delight and a relief and an emotional release.Being alone with yourself, in the quiet and the dark, floating in what feels like suspended animation can be a balm or an irritant based on all the factors that make up your life. I experienced a wide range of thoughts and feelings while floating. I could label some as "good" and some as "bad" but really they are neither. I was at peace and then I was agitated. I was calm and then I was emotional. I felt nothingness and then emptiness and then Oneness and then I was irritated. It has taken a couple of days to find words for my experience and, honestly, they are still incomplete. BUT, I've already booked my next float.My best recommendation is to approach your first float, and every float thereafter, without expectation on how it "should" or "will" be and allow yourself to be surprised by whatever transpires. Rather than force a particular goal, simply be in a state of open curiosity and then settle into it and label it as "just what you needed" in this moment.The staff is professional, supportive, kind and courteous in every way.

Great place to float. I went here for my first float. I am glad I went here the owner was very nice. I was planning to float for 60 minutes. The owner recommended I float for 90 minutes when I asked his recommendation. I followed his advice and am glad I did. I highly recommend going to this place.

Relaxing and Peaceful. Great location and friendly staff. Would highly recommend anyone interested in self reflection, human optimisation - or someone who just wants a break from the hecticness of Bangkok.
Super relaxing!. Very relaxing - took me about half the session to relax then I could've stayed in there for three more hours! Staff are great! Highly recommend for some down time.
Best float center in Bangkok. Really really enjoyed my experience at Theta State. I've floated at a number a places and this will definitely be my new spot. I highly recommend it

Uttterly Peaceful. It's a little bit confronting at first, just you and your mind/ awareness in a very unusual environment (until you get used to it), but then the utter relaxation and peace overcomes any reservations. It's a place to enjoy the richness of your Being. The real benefits seem to kick in a few hours later: mellowness, feeling that problems have diminished in significance, that there is a dimension to life that is precious but easily overlooked. Theta State is a friendly upmarket place with knowledgeable staff to guide and inspire. Costs are good compared to Western countries, feel lucky to have a place here in Bangkok. If you like meditation/ spas / exploring creativity this is right up your soi!

Refreshing and energizing + yummy snack treat after!. Was my first time, really enjoyed it. Very clean place, nice smelling organic shampoos in the shower, all well explained. Soft towels!I was surprised I didn't feel tired after doing a float after whole day of work and hour of running, so it's a good way to recharge during a lunch break.An hour felt a bit too long for me, but it was just a first try, will do again!

Relaxing experience. The owner of the spa was so helpful, telling us exactly what to expect, which really helped (ie. advised to avoid touching face etc). The float was very relaxing and afterwards myself and my partner felt rejuvenated and refreshed. They have everything you need to make the experience as comfortable as possible. We will be returning.

Absolute must for those on a spiritual journey!. Firstly... the staff... wow!upon walking in i was very warmly welcomed by all staff. The facility has a very mellow soothing vibe, with a lounge area to sit and have a briefing before you do your float.The owner was very chill and easy going! i could tell he loved what he did and was very passionate about the multiple benefits of floating. Seeing that kind of passion makes a huge difference, especially in making you feel comfortable when its your first time floating.I sat down with the owner who did a bit of a needs analysis with me to gauge what i was hoping to achieve, and ensured i was fully comfortable with the process. The float itself was a completely profound experience! i did a 90 minute session, however i completely lost touch with the concepts of space and time! after settling in, i felt myself sitting in a state of awareness, witnessing my mind and body react to having my senses deprived. All that i can say, is that if youre reading this, and youre into topics and concepts such as consciousness, the universe, psychedelics.. you know where im heading with it.. THIS IS A MUST! Take this review as a sign to do it! Afterwards, i sat in the lounge area where you kind of.. resettle into the real world!I had an amazing chat with the staff about the experience, it was so cool to see them genuinely interested in what i had to say.Overall.. my words just wont do it justice. You HAVE to experience it for yourself.

The Perfect Escape. The staff at Theta made me feel so comfortable and prepared in advance of my first float ever. The float was relaxing, peaceful, meditative and so enjoyable. The facilities are top notch spa (I especially love the free snack + tea post-float) and I walked away feeling rejuvenated. I would highly recommend to anyone looking to de-stress!

I was truly relaxed and so was my baby!. Having researched into the benefits of floating when pregnant (especially in the 2nd and 3rd trimester) I must say the experience went well above and beyond my expectations. I have put on 20kg so far during this pregnancy and my body is full of aches and pains (I am 30 weeks and I get little time to rest). While floating, I expected the baby to be very active, but was pleasantly surprised. Since there was no pressure from any side, the baby didn't feel the need to kick or roll around. It was the best rest I've had in several months. I would recommend floating to anyone, pregnant or not, for a time of physical and mental renewal. Add to this the truly phenomenal service and attention to detail from Joy and her team, I have already booked my next session. Thank you for a wonderful experience Theta State Float.

Relaxing and good spring bored to a lucid state. Took my a while to fully relax in this new environment but once there my mind became still and the lucid dreams began. I started with my eyes open and had a couple visuals of color and texture followed by some flashed of white.....hope my retinas aren't detaching!! I recommend the 90 minutes session as it took me nearly 60 minutes to still my mind and hit my lucid state. I really enjoyed it and will be going back.

Don't come with preconceptions. I just finished my introductory 3-float package, and I really enjoyed my second and third floats. It's not that the first float was bad, but I'd heard from friends who'd done this that it was a very trippy experience - that's not how it was for me at all, it was a more quiet, peaceful shutdown of the brain. So the second and third time I had a better idea of what to expect and it was great. But then I told my friend about it, and she came in expecting a sort of brain shutdown and instead had a bit of a trippy experience. So just come in with an open mind, every one is going to have their own experience in their own way. Either way, at the end of the float when you walk out, your body is going to feel incredibly relaxed, all the tension really melts away.

The Ideal Float. If you're in to floating you've probably been to your share of places that were maybe a bit amateur since floating is just starting to take off. Theta state is really doing everything right since they have both pods and rooms; the latter of which I prefer much more than pods for the air factor. Theta state has great staff and are run by a Thai and American couple that put a lot of effort in making their place upscale, inviting, and of course awesome to float in. They have specials where you buy 2 floats and get a third for free or you can just buy single floats if you're not in Bangkok that long. If you've never tried floating you probably can't find a better place for your first time than Theta State.

Would definitely recommend, brilliant experience! . Didn't really know what to expect but having been to Bangkok before so we'd seen the sights, we thought we'd try something different. We went into it with an open mind and were not disappointed. Go with it and you'll feel the benefits, both came out feeling refreshed and revitalised. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Take a trip here, well worth it.

60 mins is not enough!. This is a new kind of spa experience, where you get practically naked and float or lay in a sensory deprivation tank for 60, 90, 120 minutes. It's really blown up in Bangkok so I suggest booking far ahead in time. For all the ambience noise that punishes us everyday, this is like being back in the womb with pure quiet all around. I really wish I could have one of these closer to me in noisy, breakneck Korea!
great for athletes. Awesome service. So relaxing. As a professional athlete, this is a regular part of my recovery so I can get back at training even sooner.

Loved the attention to detail from the Staff members.. Some people might be skeptical about being in a confined space for an hour. But I thought that the way the staff explained everything step by step made me feel really comfortable and relaxed about it. In all, I had a really good time going to the float center and would definitely recommend it to those looking for a new and cool experience.

Wellness. Well let me saying I'm an experienced so the float tank was something I've been meaning to try for years and after my experience I wish I hadn't waited as long as I did. It was really one of the most relaxing more than massage but a bit expensive.

unique experience. I have been at the floating experience 2 days ago, I wanted to try this therapy way because some of my friends are adept of this venue. It was an amazing experience, I was feeling so relaxed after it. The venue is really cool, the staff gave me a warm welcome. I recommend to try this experience, the only bad point is that you should become addict :)

Amazing time out in hectic Bangkok!. My boyfriend booked an hour long float for the two of us. I had never been and from arriving into to the plush and calming lobby and greeted by Will we were excited. He showed us a short video, have us lovely green tea and explained what would happen. The place is very calm and soothing. We chose the pods as opposed to the rooms (preferred by claustrophobic people). The experience was unique. The water is filled with EpsomSalt and I floated happily and let my mind wander. I felt so refreshed and my skin felt amazing. We met the owner Neil when we were having our tea and healthy snack after who explained the business. I wold highly recommend a float and this will be my first of many!

New experience. Floating is a new and interesting experience. It is a good way to relax and de-stress.I am not sure if it is the same as going for spa/massage (and hence in the spa category in TripAdvisor). I have not conclusively felt floating also relieves muscle/joint pains as advertised.Price-wise, it is quite expensive compared to a good spa in Bangkok.
Great Experience . Serene, modern, clean environment. Professional staff. Met one of the owners: really great and passionate guy. Try to go for more than 1 float.

First floating experience with my wife. My wife and I wanted to go to a spa while in Thailand and float centers come up top in the TripAdvisor ratings. Since my wife and I have never done a float before, we thought it would be a novel idea to give it a try.It takes about 10-15mins walk from the Phrom Phong BTS. So remember to cater in some time for that so you can arrive at the center on time. On arrival, we were treated with a cup of herbal tea to calm ourselves down while the friendly staff explains to us what is float and what to expect. We were also shown a video of the whole process so we know what to do when we are in the room by ourselves.For the whole experience, you really do not need to bring anything along, except for your wallet of course. If not, how are you going to take BTS to the place. ;) Once in the pod room, you will be by yourself in full privacy. You must take a shower with their all natural shower gel and shampoo provided before stepping into the pod. It does have an aromatherapeutic effect. After the shower, I put on my ear plugs, off the room lights and start to float in the pod. The staff mentioned the it is impossible to drown in the pod due to the density of the epsom-salted water. So it gives me the confidence to just relax and let the water carry me. The staff mentioned this gives a zero-gravity experience like in space and the body muscle will be in a relaxed, natural position. While in this neutral position, I can feel some ache in the shoulder area. I guess my prolonged slouch in my chair staring at the computer might have contributed to the new "unnatural" position that my shoulder is not used to. So I guess I need to make effort to improve my sitting posture from now on.In the pod, you are all by yourself. You can either let all your thoughts go or you can reflect on things that is bugging you with no disturbance from your emails, text and whatsapp disrupting your thoughts. Your will know the session is going to end soon with music. At the end, the pod will announce your session has ended to cue you it is time to step out of the pod, You can shower again to get rid of the salt and use the hair gel and comb provided in the drawers.The float experience is a painless way of relaxation compared to a traditional massage. So I think you might like to give it a go at least to decide if float is for you. Finally, there are big shopping complex at Phrom Phong BTS. We spent half a day there shopping after the float. And we did not feel the soreness we typically felt at the end of the day after the long shopping walk. So the float helps. :)

A profound and euphoric experience. Everyone should try "floating" at least once. Your mileage will vary but my first experience was truly profound. It felt like five years of therapy in one hour. Just that float alone helped resolve my fears of death and looming anxiety. Eliminating the stimuli that bombards your senses can be a life changing.My advice to first time floaters: trying to force a powerful experience is like watching a pot boil. Don't force it. Just listen to your own breathing and still your mind. Your thoughts will come like an avalanche and just let them come and know them for what they are — little squirts of brain activity that don't mean much.One more tip: if you're squeamish about putting your head underwater, buy wax earplugs. They sell them at Boots under the title MUFFLES WAX plugs.
Amazing . Just great, second time is even better really relaxing and unique The staff is really friendly and the location is convinient Will definitely keep coming
First floating experience. We had a great experience floating in Bangkok. Everything was well explained and laid out. I felt so relaxed. Will definitely do again soon.

Good for your brain and body. I've been five times already and I'll continue to go back often. Floating seems to have many benefits for me including sports recovery, jet lag recovery, clearer thinking and improving focus. The staff is great, and the ambiance and environment are very comfortable and inviting. If you live in Bangkok, or are just here for a short trip, I highly recommend checking this place out.

I'm now a total believer. A good friend of mine had an experience here that he described as "life-changing" and insisted that I try it out as well. He wouldn't tell me any more details because he said I had to see it for myself and I had to go in without expectations. Even so, I was nervous going in, and worried I wouldn't have this intense transformative experience I was expecting.However, the experience was unlike anything I imagined and left me feeling better in ways that I still can't put into words. All I can say is, I was suffering extreme depression in the months leading up to it, as well as a major creative block, and after one hour in the tank (which flew by) it was as if a huge weight had been lifted off my shoulders. I was able to look with clarity at all the negative thinking that had been pulling me down, and see that it was false and unnecessary. I felt so much more balanced emotionally, and okay with everything. And along with that came a flood of new ideas and surge of creativity.I felt like it was a system reboot for my brain. The best part was that this feeling lasted a whole week. Of course after a while the "high" leveled out, but the truth of the insights I had from the experience has stayed with me. I plan to go back semi-regularly and would recommend it to anyone. It's worth every baht.

Very unique experience. A must try if you are into natural healing. It was absolutely relaxing and almost spiritual.I went into a regenerative and deeply satisfying sleep which was exactly what i needed after 2 consecutive nights of insomnia.Strongly recommended for those who leads a hectic life.

Simply Unreal and Amazing. Visited the Theta State Float Center on my last day in Bangkok. I wish I had visited sooner and did more visits. It was one the most relaxing experience that I have ever had. It was a great way to mentally and physically relax. I would highly recommend this place if you would like to get the ultimate relaxation experience. The Center is clean, soothing, calm. The staff is really inviting and caring. Hurry and run to this Spa to relax. This will be my first stop the next time I'm in Bangkok.

Surreal but wonderful, energising experience. Stumbled across Theta State online and was intrigued enough to give it a go. Have been a bit busy and worn out lately, so any excuse to relax sounded like a good idea to me!We booked in and were welcomed warmly by the super friendly owners on the day and offered tea and an overview on what to expect. Decided to go for the room instead of the capsule to avoid claustrophobia, in hindsight was a good idea. The whole process is well managed, the rooms are cleaned and have an air of a posh spa. The experience itself is interesting - bit disconcerting at first and takes a while to get comfortable, but eventually you reach the relaxing bit. I didn't drift off, but my mind definitely wandered and i felt very relaxed (apart from one or two slightly claustrophobic moments). Amazing to float so easily, it's even hard to push your hands below the surface. At the end my skin was all slimy (I guess form the salts) and I felt really energised, rather than sleepy. Was offered tea and healthy fruit balls and had a good chat with one of the owners, a lovely guy. A really worthwhile experience, will be back for sure.

A fantastic experience. Multifaceted and fascinating, floating was a great experience. From beginning to end you are made to feel extremely comfortable as everything is taken care of to ensure you have a good float session. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating and the float itself is relaxing, meditative and the time flies by - 90 minutes went by in a flash. Would definitely recommend for those who are into self reflection and introspection. Will definitely return next time I am in Bangkok.

superb alternative for traditional spa. Been to Bangkok for so many times, my wife and myself are spa lover. For this trip, we decided to try something different from traditional spa session. We Choose Theta State Float Center. It was a wonder and new experience for us. The staff will explain clearly what to expect and the benefit of this session. We went there during lunch time and entitle for 25% discount. Choose 90 min session using the pod. first 20 min is to get used to the dark and very quiet situation. after you had get used, your mind will be come so relax like you are in meditation form. you may get disoriented if you awake from your sleep but keep calm. After 90 min, i feel my body relaxed and stress free. it like i had done 1 hour of yoga and full body stretching. traditional massage satisfaction are subjective as depend on your masseur. This float can give you exact satisfaction each time if it suit you.
Really nice and relaxing. I was at Theta State Float Center and it was a great and relaxing experience for both me and my Son.

Most Relaxing Time Ever!. This was my first time I had ever floated, and it was so surreal! ... I felt so relaxed and was able to obtain a great deal of clarity to many unanswered questions that I had regarding my life.The centre is really fitted out nicely and the staff are amazing! They spent a great deal on the decor and providing a homely comfortable feeling.I highly recommend this place and definitely would visit again on my next travels back to Bangkok.

Amazing Experience. Floating was a really interesting experience. It took me forever to settle down, but once I did, it was incredibly relaxing. I thought the dark, enclosed space would make me uncomfortable, but not at all. When the music came on to tell me that the session was over, it seemed like only minutes had passed. And the sensation of the water on my skin was unlike anything I've ever known. I really enjoyed my "Float Pod" and my friend enjoyed her "Float Room" too. She chose the room over the pod because she is a little claustrophobic and the room is a slightly larger space with a higher ceiling. She has chronic back pain and said she had no pain while floating. I slept really well that night and the next morning I noticed that my skin felt surprisingly soft as well. I guess that is the result of the salt water? We tried the 60 minute session and I think I would like to try a 90 minute session next time.

Unwind, feel the good vibes for days. Go to Theta State if you're looking for a transformative experience that lasts longer than a visit to the spa - you'll feel calmer and blissed-out for days afterward. You may find answers to questions that have been prying you, resolve issues, find inspiration...the possibilities are endless in the float tank. My husband & I have done two 60-minute sessions in the pods and a 90-minute session in the rooms last night. The pros:Experience - beyond meditation, a must-try journey into your inner worldStaff - Annile, Joy and Matt are so friendly and welcoming. They embody the spirit of what goes on at a float center by being open, welcoming, genuine. Location - centrally located, easy to access from public transport or by car (parking is free)The con - I can't go every day! I'm 9 months' pregnant and floated for what may be the last time before baby arrives. It was a different experience from the first 2 times, but still enjoyable. Every time I've reached a pure, meditative space that is unlike anything I've felt during sitting meditation.

Blissfully Relaxing.. I have done about 10 floating sessions at the Theta State Float Center and after my 5th session I was convinced I had to get the 20 floats package.It is hard to explain the experience of floating in pitch dark room with absolutely no sound. Some people go into a meditative state. I have not reached that level yet but every time I come out of the floating chamber I feel extremely relaxed and very happy. Like a weight has been lifted off. Even if I fall asleep for 15 or 20 minutes in there, I feel like I have slept for hours. I guess the sleep quality I get in there is just much higher than what I normally get.Theta State is very casual and extremely inviting. Everyone there is so friendly - the staff as well as the other customers. The waiting room is a great area to just chill, have a chat, and have some tea before or after the float.I have the added bonus that Theta State is right next to my house so I go there as often as I can. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking to release anxiety and stress, relax, or just simply get some real rest.

Relaxing, restorative, and peaceful - I will definitely come back!. I did 2 floats in total and both experiences were immensely relaxing - both were 90min long and the time flies! The water is the same temp as your body, the music at the beginning and end of the float helps to calm/relax as you start and end your float. The rooms are clean, and the shower has great shampoo/conditioner/shower gel (all natural, and smells great) for you to wash off with afterwards and a nice body lotion too. I'm a little claustrophobic so I choose the float room and it was perfect! The light could be left on (a faint blue light) or turned off and I alternated between complete darkness and the faint blue light. Before and afterwards, a warm cup of tea is provided and a nice relaxing lounge area lets you reflect on the experience and chat with others, for as long as you want. Its cozy, relaxing, and helps ease you back into the outside world. I will definitely come back!

Floating Bliss. Vicki and I visited Theta State last night and wow, what an experience. We had never been to a floating centre before although we had both heard great things about the experience. For my part I found the experience extra sensory and with price to some degree. We booked the floating 'room' rather than a pod and if you've never been deprived of light, sound and touch before it's surreal. The venue is in a prime location and the owner is attentive and passionate. We would certainly recommend this to anyone intrigued by floating and Theta was a great way to go.

Relaxing experience, tasteful surroundings. It was the first time I tried floating and I liked it a lot. It is one of the most relaxing things I have ever done. Theta State is a new, tasteful and spotlessly clean venture. The people are very nice and take all the time necessary to explain and make you feel comfortable. There are two (enclosed) "pods" and two "rooms" with higher ceilings and more air.After the float, you can have tea and sit until you are again ready for the world outside. The best is their 3 for 2 offer.

Fantastic Experience, Wonderful People. After 6 floats, I'm convinced that the tank is a better/faster/deeper means of relaxation than other therapies like massage or acupuncture. The effects last well throughout the day. Sleep is better and yoga feels more joyful. I highly recommend 2 or 3 sessions to get the hang of it. The first try is fun, the second is a lesson in letting go, and by the third try, the body is conditioned to melt like hot butter as soon as you hit the water. I highly recommend Theta State: an excellent service run by kind and compassionate people. 5 Stars.
Great time . It was a very interesting experience. I felt so connected to my body like never before. Thanks for a wonderful float, lovely atmosphere, welcoming staffDefinately be back!!

Hot Stuff. In contrast of Bangkoks dirty city life, my girlfriend and I went for a spa session in Theta State and we were totally convinced from start to finish. The whole center, the spa products and the session itself was an amazing experience. We cannot wait to go again. Too bad they don't have it in Denmark though. Go if you get the chance.
Absolutely amazing. This is the best way to relax and enjoy the time for yourself. It's truly an amazing experience to some alone time. I recommend this to everyone.

An Incredible Experience!. I visited the float center for my first time last week and had an amazing experience. First off, George and Annile were extremely helpful in explaining the process and what to expect so I had no hiccups during my experience. They both know their stuff and are extremely professional. The float itself was extremely relaxing and a great stress reliever. I was told that you may get in and think after a few minutes that a whole hour is too much, but it flew by for me. For those of you that have meditated before it's a similar sense of relaxation, but it's amplified by the fact that you are floating in a zero gravity environment. I'll definitely do it again in the future. I live in Yangon and I really wish there was a center here because it's something that I would do on the regular. An experience not to be missed!

MUST TRY!. Amazing Experience!!!! The atmosphere is lovely, the service impeccable and the staff are super friendly. I found it very beneficial--physically, mentally, spiritually...so I'm hooked! ต้อง ลองเองค่ะ เพื่อน ๆ

An Out of This World Experience. Having read the amazing reviews of this place online, I couldn't help but visit. From the minute I stepped through the door, the cool ambiance and calmness struck me having been out and about in the madness of Bangkok. I hadn't floated before, so was relieved to have Annile educate me in a way I understood. Then I floated...OMG. I have achieved meditation once but this was a truly new experience, very hard to put into words. It was Nirvana and I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since. Thanks Theta state. See you again soon

Best way to refocus from a busy day of work. Before trying the isolation tank, I meditate quite frequently. The tank took it to another level, and made me much more focus. It clears my mind of all the noise and distraction around you. The staff at Theta State is also very kind and helpful. They are very informative which was very helpful when I started.

I have never felt so relaxed!. I first heard of sensory deprivation in a Dan Brown book (The Lost Symbol) and have been curious about it. At the time I found none in me region so I was left with a desire. During a trip to Thailand I found Theta on tripadvisor by chance and immediately booked a session. The place and people are very nice and calm. They guided me through the steps and made me very comfortable. I tried a POD for 90 minutes and absolutely loved it. I was completely relaxed. When I was pulled back by the music, it was clear how much is going on in your brain at any given moment. My mission now is to find a good one close by in Brazil...
Nice. Came with very high expectations from all the amazing comments on here. Was smaller place than expected but nice and pleasant staff. Floating was feel ok.

Best relaxation you can possibly do for yourself!. The float center is located convenient at Suk 24. Extremely nice and helpful staff, the center is very clean and comfortable.I started to float at Theta State a few month ago and since then I don't want to miss it anymore! Now, it became a great tool for me to clear my mind and relax my body from a stressful week. Always feel like new born, fresher, and more focused after each session! We all need to calm our minds and completely relax sometimes, and for me floating is the most effective way to do it! An amazing experience I want to recommend to everybody!

Great place run by great people. Everyone should try floating!. I was stoked when I first find out about Theta State because floating is something that Bangkok had been missing for a long time. As it turns out, not only does Theta State fill a big gap in that sense, it does it as well as anyone could hope for. It's one of those rare places where you feel like they've thought of everything, which makes it an ideal place for people who are new to floating. The first time I went, I received a thorough and helpful introduction to the float experience from the friendly staff. That made for an enjoyable float even as a first-timer. I've since been back to float more than ten times, and you always get something new out of it and feel calmer and more centered for several days afterwards. I like the nice little touches like top shelf local organic shower gels and shampoos, and a complimentary healthy snack and tea afterwards. Really just an exceptional place for enjoying the unique experience that is floating in an isolation tank.

2nd visit. Was just as good as our first! Brought my wife with me and we both had an amazing experience. The wife really enjoyed the atmosphere and the surreal feeling The staff and owner were really friendly and remembered us from our 1st visit. Can't wait to visit Bangkok again for our 3rd float!

What a great experience!. I live in Pattaya and came up to this center just to see if it could help improve my back pain. I have lived with chronic back pain for years that comes and goes but is always there, and after this float it was completely gone for a few days which I have never experienced before.......slept better than ever. I hope a few regular visits could really do some long term improvement.

Amazing relaxation spot in the heart of Bangkok. I went to Theta a bit randomly, looking for an alternative to the regular Thai massage and I was not disappointed: soundproof relaxation area which is quite of unique in Bangkok. A full body rejuvenation with sea salt. Ideally located on soi 24. The place is neat and clean. It's become one of my favorite week end treat but it's getting full already.

Amazing and very relaxing experience. Dear Theta State Float Center team,Last week on Tuesday I had finally time to check out your place. It was highly recommended from McKee Colsman and I can just say that everything he told me about it was true.First I was hesitant a bit because I never visit this kind of Spa experience before but from the moment I stepped into the Center I had a good and welcoming feeling. Joy the host welcomed me with a nice and genuine smile and gave me a nice introduction to the whole concept. I felt well informed before starting my first floating experience. I loved the delicious tea which was served before the session. I had a one hour session which passed by so fast because I have fallen in trance-like mode. The calming and relaxing music which is played the first ten minutes helps a lot. I felt like in different world. Lost in my thoughts and fully relaxed.After I left the room i felt really recovered and like I would have woken up from a long dream. Annile was waiting in the relaxing room with a big smile and asking me about my first experience which was really nice. The whole environment gives you the feeling that you are sitting with friends at home in your living room. He gave me some interesting facts about the whole process when you are floating and what is happening in your body. I had a wonderful time and felt recharged, ready to get back to my busy life. Thank you very much for that great experience and I will be definitely back!

A Stress-free oasis in Bangkok!. Floating really wasn't what I had expected. I was quite skeptical in the beginning as to how I would benefit from floating. Then I arrived at Theta State Float Center and was invited to sit and relax with a cup of chai before my float session. Theta float team was on stand by to give me a rather thorough run down of the benefits and what to expect. Then I was led to a float room to get cleaned up before getting into a float 'pod'. I then spent the next 5 mins contemplating about life in the quiet pod ..... and fell asleep for the next 55 minutes before I knew it! I'm booking for a float now for this weekend.I highly recommend Theta for people looking for quiet sessions to reflect on life or simply to get away from the Bangkok hectic!

A surprising welcome to a weekend in Thailand.. I had heard of this kind of therapy online and was anxious to experience it for myself and my girlfriend. The Center wasn't too hard to find, though we got slightly lost due to traffics redirection. Anyway, the Center was a place of tranquility with water trickling over the walls about the room. The people there were helpful and informative about the process. The float itself was a little strange at first. But when it felt right, I have never had such a relaxing experience before!It was my first time there, but I'd definitely come back to it again.Be warned though; don't plan to do anything exciting straight after. We did it early afternoon and both of us had trouble leaving the hotel as we felt too comfortable afterwards!

Absolutely fantastic. I heard about floating some interesting things and decided to try it myself during my last staying in Bangkok. Have you ever tried parachuting or meditation? That is exactly what will happen with your mind by floating. Deep delight of silence! You all deep into peace and quiet. Besides all the muscles release and the body come to feeling of lightness. Clean reboot! Absolutely the must!

The Epitome of Relaxation. I recently visited Thailand, and while in Bangkok, decided to try "Floating". I had heard good things about Floating from friends -- and good things about Theta State (thru TA), so decided to check it out. I don't usually write reviews, but had to in this case: I had such an amazing experience. This was my first float - on my continual journey for inner-peace, this experience was top-notch. after the float itself (which is crazy, but so cool), the staff was gentle and welcoming... especially for a 'first timer'. Not sure i'll be back (because not sure when I"ll be back in Thailand anytime soon: ) - but I will definitely look to 'float' back in the states.

One of the best float centers in the world.. I've been to 5 float centers on the east and west of coasts of the US, and Theta State is the best.Their staff was really nice. They have both the Dream Pod and the Ocean room floating tanks, which are the best in the world. I really can't enough great things about this center. You HAVE TO try it!

Deeper 3rd-Eye-Awakening Experience. Recently I've been giving away my energy and have no time to go within myself as deep as before, so I decided to give it a try and it was amazingly helping me in many ways:)

Fantastic for relaxation 👍. My experience at Theta State Float was brilliant. It's fantastic for relaxation,recovery and meditation. The location is easy to find and the staff are really friendly, welcoming and open. So in Love with this place!!

amazing and weird relaxing !!!. first time i heard about healing by floating in salt waterI didn't believe much but it's interesting to try it..60 minutes that i was in the machine. dark and uncomfortable to move my body..times gone very quickly and i wasn't sure that i fell asleep in the water but i think i did hahahaIt's weird feeling but not ached and feel relaxedthat night i had very very deep sleeping and good dreamAMAZING experience !!!

Great experience at Theta State Float Center. I recently enjoyed a float session at Theta State floaat center in Bangkok, Thailand. I am very active in many sports and the relief my body felt after just one hour floating in the silky salt water was amazing. I would tell anyone that is active to take the time to slow down and let your body recover by going through the float process. you come out feeling so relaxed and those small aches and pains are gone. Count me in as a strong believer in the benefits of 60 minutes of weightless floating to make the body whole again and ready for activity the next day. I will be back again this week and every week.

You must visit theta in Bkk. Fantastic float centre right near the emporium shopping centre really knowledgable and helpful staff very clean and comfortable id recommend floating at theta 100%I've been a regular float enthusiast for over 20 years and it's great that bangkok has got atop notch facility well done to the team at theta for getting this up and runningA perfect haven for weary travellersI'll be back in 2016Pete M

Better than a massage. This place was reccomended to me by a friend as an alternative to a massage for relaxation. Having had no knowledge of floatation tanks before I arrived the owner was extremely knowledgeable and showed a genuine love for the experience that he wanted to share with others. Fully explained the process and what to expect from the experience I opted for the 90 minute session, which turned out to be ideal for me as I really started to feel the benefits towards the latter end of the session. Totally relaxing, i am totally sold on the experience. There is a breakout room that you can relax in afterward and the owner was more than happy to sit with me and discuss how i found it once the session was over. I will be going back the next time I am in Bangkok. Really couldnt reccomend this experience enough

Fantastic floating experience!. My friend and I misjudged our time and arrived a few minutes late for our appointment, but the staff at the centre still accommodated us and treated us like royalty....from start to finish.The centre itself is spotless and hygienic. It was my first float and the experience itself was fantastic. I felt rejuvenated and full of energy after my hour float.Thank you to Annile and staff for an awesome experience. I can't wait for my next float!

Floating away. Floating is amazing in so many ways, doing more than one is definitely worth while! Amazing state-of-the-art facilities and lovely staff, you really couldnt ask for better. This is the place to be. I will be back for sure, see you guys again in the future!

Where did all my worries go?. Last night I went for my second 'float' session at the Theta State float center. I just love that place. First time I floated I used the POD and last night I tried the Float Room. I think I personally like the POD as you can stretch out more. However, it does not matter what you choose the feeling after floating is the same... all your cares go away, your body feels so light and when you leave the place its like you are walking on air. I have floated before at various places around the world but this is definitely the nicest. The staff and owners are lovely, they really make you feel at home. Nothing is too much trouble, the place is impeccably clean and has everything you need. If you have never tried this sensation then I would highly recommend it. Go with an open mind and just relax into it. The benefits are enormous.

The best place in Bangkok to get rid of all your stress. I work in Bangkok and often make long days. The stress makes it hard to sleep sometimes and the floating experience helps tremendously. After every float I sleep like a baby and my body feels completely relaxed. The tea they serve before and after is great too! Wonderful reception by the people who run that place. I can recommend it to anyone who just wants to try it once or as a regular experience for people who have stressful jobs.

amazing experience !!! try it to relax and meditate !!! 5stars *********. i tried the float center and it's really amazing. Floating in this cocoon make me so relax and relieve all my back pain after 1 hour.everyone should try this amazing activity.The staff is really nice and everything is really clean and quiet. Je conseil a tout le monde de faire cette experience

Unique Experience. Was a little sceptical at first of what I would get out of the hour long float. However having rather exhausted the wats and palaces of Bangkok and in need of somewhere to escape the heat my bf and I went to Theta. And we were very glad we did, neither of us are particularly into meditating or new - agey stuff and but the sensory deprivation was awesome. The whole session is lovely, Aneil one of the owners talked us through the proces over a complimentary cup of tea, you enter into your private room, and have a shower (with some lovely toiletries) and enter into the pod. It takes a while to adjust and it is a very very strange but I experienced awesome sensations and a dream like state. At the end you shower again and go to the lovely chill out room, have another free tea and a snack and discuss your experience. Never thought I'd get as much out of it as I did but I loved it. Go support a new business guys!

excellent oasis in hectic bangkok. Been wanting a float ever since seeing a few documentaries online and was pretty surprised and very pleased to hear of theta state in bangkok. I was immediately impressed by the warm welcome and chilled environment and the guys that run the place are superb and really know their stuff. The whole place is pristine and both styles of tank (pod and room) are other wordly. I went for the pod this time and will definitely try the other tank too next time. The experience was barely describable. ..All i can say is i would recommend this to anyone who wants to try something new and take their mind far away for a while..Must be the only place in Bangkok where you can truly shut off for a while. I'll be back on the next visit for sure!

So relaxing. This was my first time visiting a float centre so I was a little nervous and didn't know what to expect. But the staff were so welcoming and explained everything so well that I immediately felt at home. I can't remember the last time I felt so relaxed and I came out feeling like a new me! Thank you to everyone at Theta State!!

A much needed non sensory experience. Wow! Annile and his partner have created a wonderful place in a small space for all to share their love of 'floating'. The relation lounge is lovely with natural organic detox tea served and water. There is also yummy complimentary healthy snacks. It is nice to be able use this space to float back to reality and talk to others about your experience or just chill by yourself, the whole place feels and looks high quality. The service is personal and excellent with a pre float briefing and tour. The rooms with pods are perfect containing high quality Siam Botanical products to use. The pods are excellent, spacious, including light music on entry and exit, nice lighting and UV cleaning system. I have been twice, second time was better and I cannot wait for 3rd session. The pod allows you to go into a deep relaxation without the distraction of light, noise, smell and sound. It could be an exploration into inner space, a well needed rest or part of healing as it contains much needed magnesium in the salts. Great as part of a detox or cleanse. I have recommended to all my friends to try it :) Enjoy Natalie

Unlike anything I've experienced before!. i had never really heard of a float tank before but my friend introduced me to the owner of Theta State Float Centre and i thought id give it a go. IT WAS INCREDIBLE! the most amazing sensation i have ever felt, i assume its just what floating in space is like. It was so relaxing but also stimulating for the brain, i was reliving moments in my childhood that i hadn't thought about in 20 years. the place is so well laided out, very stylish and modern and the staff are so friendly and knowledgable. i only wish i had discovered this much sooner in my life and i will definitely be returning again. thank you guys so much.

Excellence!!. I went to Theta State because of my friend invited me. To be honest i didn't expect anything in the beginning but once I arrived inside i really like the decoration, the room is very clean and smell so good! it just like a dream that you are able to float above the water and very relaxing. I feel so good and all my stress was gone. so one of the best place to clear of your mind and you can really spend time with yourself! felt like new born after finished because my mind was so empty! lol - definitely will go back there again :)

So so good!. This was the first time i ever floated and even the whole concept was new to me but i was curious. The staff did a great job explaining all the benefits (there are so many!) and i went into it with an open mind. Wow! I slept for most of my time in the tank (never thought id sleep on water) and came out feeling incredibly relaxed, with the softest skin and a feeling that all was good. Its hard to explain it, you really just have to try it!Also, take your time after the float and hangout at the center for a bit, it's such a nice place to just be!

Float your troubles away. If youre looking for a place to relax and unplug from the stresses of daily life, the crew at float center can help with that. Annile was able to provide an in depth description of what one experiences both internally and externally, during and after a float. The vibe is very chill and the ambience is welcoming. Well be coming back our next visit to BKK, see you then- Cos

Amazing Experience! Highly recommended!!!. I've been there several times now and I have to say that I'm really hooked. After every session I feel extremely well and rejuvinated. The place is beautifully designed and it radiates relaxation, harmony and positive mood. The staff is extremly knowledgeable and friendly and I learned alot from them on the matter of floating. It is the best way I can think of for relieving the stress of daily life, especially in a busy city like Bangkok. Recreation for mind and body in an extremely exciting and fun way. An experience that doesn't come close to anything I knew before! A definite MUST to do in Bangkok! Don't miss!!!

Enriching Environment to De-stress and Unwind. Having heard about Floating and its many benefits I was eager to try it, so when the Theta State Float Centre opened I was booking my appointment as fast as I could. This environment is a haven in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok and serves not only as a setting for people to relax and unwind but also as a hub for bumping into people who you haven't seen in a while. During my last 5 visits I have happily bumped into people who I haven't seen for an extended period and spent some time to reconnect over the mood enhancing tea that is served. The team there are experts in their craft and guide you to ensure you have the best float experience possible, their friendly demeanor and active interest in floating serves to create a relaxed and professional environment that you can feel comfortable in. I am already booked to return again and I would advise you to book well in advance as they often get busy.

Best Float Centre In BKK !. Within the syncronistic flow of the universe myself and 5 other friends got to experience a float at Theta State Float Centre. Not only were they able to accommodate our large group, but also left us with such an inspirational experience on one of our last days in the city. I would highly recommend Theta State to locals of BKK, as well as passing travelers who are; either looking to try something new, deepen their meditative practice, or simple take advantage of the many relaxing health benefits this treatment offers. Peace & Love,from Canada ! -A

soothing and relaxing moment in a nice place. I visited Theta State Float Center in March 2015 during my five day stay in Bangkok, it was a new and pleasant experience for me. Will visit again, when I go to Bangkok next time. The staff member that guided me on the experience was SUPER friendly and pleasant to talk to.

Floating Therapy?. I heard about it not long ago and really got my intention. So when I found out there is floating center in Sukhumvit area. I didn't hesitate to try out. My first impression was the place is so lovely n friendly atmosphere. They helped me out for all information and the floating benefits. During floating, it's like some kind of meditation. Released yourself all your stress n tensions. At first I had so many thoughts about many things but finally I felt my peace, inner peace. It's a good place to try.

Relaxing Oasis in a Sea of Chaos..... Bangkok has never been my favorite city as I travel there about twice a year for business.....the noise, the people, the crowds....but on my last trip I had some downtime and was looking to relax a bit. Someone at my hotel recommend this spot....the best decision I made. Hip, clean and most importantly serene. Awesome people there as well, super knowledgeable. This will become a regular stop on all of my BKK visits.

Great people, great place. Theta spa is an amazing place! The owner is a really cool guy who is there to help you have a great float. He explains everything very well and answers all your questions. The facilities are top-notch. There are two types of rooms you can float in; one is a pod and the other is a room with a high roof for those who don't like small spaces. I had an amazing time and hope I get a chance to visit again!
Excellent place for relax. Had my first float experience today and it was one of the best decision i have made best way . I am so happy I tried this! loved the place and the staff .

Amazing experience top to bottom!. If you have never tried floating before, then you should definitely check out Theta State. I was in BKK for a short holiday and wanted to try something new. I came across Theta State online and I am glad I did! The facilities and staff were amazing and the float itself was a truly incredible experience. It took some time to settle into it and get a feel for it, but once I was able to let myself go the results were pretty amazing. I left the Theta State with an incredible feeling of calm and relaxation. From what I hear the experience just continues to get better as your experience with floating grows. I will definitely be revisiting the Theta State on my next trip to BKK. Hoping to find a similar facility here in Tokyo as well.

First time floaters. The staff was so happy, kind & very knowledgable, and were able to answer any questions we had. The space itself is beautiful, comfortable & had a very relaxing and calm atmosphere. I would go back for a float next visit to Bangkok without a doubt!

Staying healthy in Banngkok. Bangkok is a great city to live in - but it does mean your senses are being constantly bombarded - so to be able to spend time with minimal sensory impingement is a wonderful way to help the body and mind recover their inherent balance. Its deeply relaxing, as well as being a pleasant way to detox. It's had a very beneficial effect on my mood and energy levels. The Centre itself is great. Very thoughtfully done with care taken at every level from getting your own room and shower to the organic shampoos, conditioners, and creams. There is a choice of pod, or a room if you feel claustrophobic. Annile and Joy who run it and the other staff members are very welcoming, genuine and helpful. Creating a place of health ad healing is their number one concern. Both my husband and I go regularly.

Great for athletes. I've never floated before and I wanted to try it because I read on-line that it was great for muscle relaxation and also for doing creative visualization and intuition exercises. I'm a Taekwondo athlete and we do intense 2-3 hour training sessions. Often times my muscles get sore from the training so I went to the float center to see if it would help. After the 1 hour float session my muscles felt very relaxed and I felt energized. The epsom salts in the water is really good for helping muscles recover from soreness. As an athlete I do a lot of creative visualization and intuition exercises to prepare for competitions and improve my abilities. The float tank provides the PERFECT environment for really going in deep into the visualization and really experience your vision and getting in touch with your intuition / higher self.

Relaxing!. I've never floated before and wanted to try it for detoxification and meditation purposes. The first few minutes in the float room took a bit of getting used to but I settled quickly into the weightlessness and practically fell asleep. When I came out I wasn't sure if it was something I could do again but within hours I felt my skin was softer and supple and there was no tension left in my body. Wonderful. Think I am converted and will visit the floating centre in Singapore when I get home! The staff are super helpful and friendly and the centre is super clean with showers and all the amenities required to prepare you for the float.
The best place to unwind. Theta State is definitely a place for people to come and unwind and relax. The staff are friendly and service is great! Highly recommended for those long stressful days!
Must visit place!!!!. It was a great experience!!!Must do it!Owner Annie is a really friendly guy :) Used to have pain in my shoulders,but this morning feeling no pain.Slept really well

Left me feeling so refreshed. I've floated here around 5 times now and the experience seems to get better each time. It leaves me feeling refreshed and in a really good state of mind. Very friendly staff.

Exceeded my expectations in every way, an absolute MUST do if you are in Bangkok. First, I must confess that I am normally not interested in meditation or yoga or any type of relaxation techniques other than sitting on my couch and watching TV. However, when my girlfriend and I went to the Theta State Float Center (slightly reluctant) I was immediately charmed by the ambiance of the facility. The dim lights, the lounge area, the trickling water...it just creates a sense of warmth and belonging. The staff at TS goes beyond the call of duty to make everyone feel comfortable and relaxed. After sipping some (really good) tea and learning all about the benefits of floating, I stepped into what looked like a suspended animation pod from a cool sci-fi movie. Within 5 minutes, I was hooked. It really felt like I was experiencing the absence of all things, including stress. It's hard to explain but to put it simply, I was the most relaxed I have ever been. It's quite interesting how your creative thoughts manifest during the nothingness. A great experience from beginning to end. I really did not want it to end. Thank you Annile & Joy (the cute couple that runs it), you guys are wonderful. You have an excited new patron now :)

A must do in BKK.. My gf and I were there in Nov. Heard about this place through a mutual friendthat had a great experience. This place does not disappoint. Great vibe, music,interior artwork, etc. Facilities spotless. Super nice people. Ask forAnnile(sp?) or Joy....super cool couple.

An absolutely fantastic experience. Having just recently moved from Chiang Mai to the hustle and bustle of Bangkok I can't emphasize how happy I am to find Theta State Float Center conveniently located at 24th Avenue Mall just a bit off main Sukhumvit Road. There you can easily and comfortably get away from all the traffic and congestion of this massive city and isolate yourself in a tank filled with salt water and just have a quiet moment for yourself. Went with a couple of friends and my girlfriend and we all felt immensely relaxed and calm right after. It also removed a lot of the muscle pain I had built up from powerlifting exercises. Everything starting from a friendly greeting at the door and warm tea served before and after float was fantastic. The owner Annile is a top notch fella and I highly recommend visiting Theta State Float Center for everyone.
Theta State Harmony. My 4th floating experience and by far the best. Super clean, friendly, and harmonious. Do yourself a favor and start your trip in the right state of mind.
