Fantastic experience. Really great float experience. Super relaxing and comfortable environment. We were very happy we made time for this during our stay.

Sublime. I had a tremendous experience at Theta State Float Center. It felt like being suspended for an hour in that blissful state of mind right before you fall asleep. You can control your thoughts/dreams, but you aren't fully awake either. It's like instantly reaching a deep state of meditation. When I finished, I was totally refreshed (no grogginess) and felt an afterglow for 24 hours. I'll definitely do it again. Lastly, the venue is perfect: it's inside an upscale mini-mall on Sukhumvit Soi 24 (not far from Emporium), and it has comfortable lounges and really nice showers. Highly recommend.

Very deep relaxation. I tried my first float out of curiosity and it was surely above my expectation. I went into a very deep sleep during the float. After I wake up, my body was sooooo light and relax. The feeling continued lingered on my body overnight. I definitely recommend to try, especially if you like massage and meditation. It is a combination of both!!!

A well-designed oasis in the heart of Bangkok. I have floated several times in London and was delighted to find out that there is a new float centre in Bangkok now that I live here. At first I was a little surprised to see that the prices are the same as in London because compared to the cost of living here it seems a lot. However, having been here I can say it's definitely worth the money. The float centre is very well designed with a tranquil, stylish interior, much nicer than the one I used in London - it feels like a designer hotel! There are many thoughtful touches, like free tea on arrival and in the relaxation lounge afterwards, organic shower products in each room and even contact lense pots and solution as standard in the room in case required. Thank you for a great experience, Theta State!

Love this place. I'm glad I discovered this place. The ultimate stop for a maximum de-stress. Floated quite a few times now, and interestingly each time it's a slightly different experience, but always re-energising, and refreshing. The staff are also very well informed on the science of floating, and their knowledge has given me some new-found wisdom. As a result of my time at Theta state i've also purchased floats for my parents, as I wanted to introduce them to the experience of floating as well.

So relaxed!. Great and unique experience. I felt so relax, totally disconnected, de-stressed and re-boosted... Nice welcome and smile from the staff.This "floating" is definitely a must-try in Bangkok.

wonderful... We had a fabulous experience at Theta State Float Center. It was our first time floating. We both felt comfortable, Annile explained everything clearly. Afterward we were so relaxed, we drank tea and sat in the lobby and played guitars and sang. It was a lovely way to relax after running around Bangkok..

Floating in silent darkness. Yesterday, my girlfriend and I visited the Theta State float center on Sukhumvit Soi 24, next to the Davis Hotel. We knew what is was about, but neither of us had ever tried it. Entering, we were greeted by smiling staff and the surroundings were clean and comfortable. They have two types of environments to float in, a pod or a room. The room is bigger, but they are the same price and many prefer the pods. I tried the pod and my girlfriend tried the room. The pod was like an egg, filled with water loaded with epsom salts. I have used epsom salts when injured before, and the idea of soaking for an hour was a great one, promising recovery from stress and injuries. With all lights off and the water heavily salted, my body was very bouyant, and I felt I could relax comlpletely. Ear plugs kept both sounds and water out. People who have done it a few times say their brain can shut down, for complete relaxation, but probably due to the novelty of the experience, I kept thinking the whole time. Coming out, after a nice shower, I felt completely relaxed as I sipped on some tea with honey and talked to the owner and another customer. For those of you wishing for a novel experience and enjoy spas or meditation, I can recommend trying this. Just make sure not to get any of that salted water in your eyes, na. :-)

Relaxed!!. This is my first try on floatation. The place is very new and nice, people extremely friendly (even the customers too after the float ;) and the Pod is state-of-the-art.Very comfortable and relaxing experience! Will definitely try again next time I visit Bangkok!
Relaxing . The place is really nice and clean the staff are excellent !!Highly recommend for a relaxing day !!!The tea hot !!Doit just go and doit !!
great experience !. very very RELAXING. enjoyable and great service. high recomented. very convenient to get to. we will come back again.Prim.
Awesome experience. Floating was amazing, I actually slept and started dreaming. I was in deep sleep and felt relaxed. Cant wait to go there again.

experience zero gravity. I first heard about it through Joe Rogan a few years ago. Since then really wanted to try it, and now this amazing experience is averrable in down town bangkok on soi 24, just a short walk from the BTS stations.I came after a long day at work feeling tired and worn out. I didn't have too many expectations on arrival. I was made to feel welcome and comfortable by the professional staff. The float lab by itself is very well presented, and with it´s coziness that brings you in the right state of mind before you enter the of your choice. float pod or float room. I enjoyed the tank experience, it really relaxed me and I am leaving now with a clear head and well "just totally relaxed", yet energized as well. Beside that I also feel the benefits from the zero gravity experience, as my back and upper spine got a great "therapeutic relief treatment" been in that unique zero gravity environment. Over all enjoyed my experience. And recommend this establishment to anyone.
Super relaxing.. Super relaxing...it was my first time floating after heard about it in the US..really good and recommended for everyone.. friendly stuff.

A 360-Degree Mind, Body, and Spirit Improving Practice. Adding Floating to my wellness regimen could not have been a better idea.As an athlete, the physical benefits of the magnesium rich water trump any epsom salt treatment out there.As a meditation practitioner, I have not found another state that allows me to access the depths of my mind more easily than floating weightless in the quiet, still, darkness of a float tank or chamber.Nothing helps me clear my mind, allowing profound thoughts and ideas to enter them, more easily.In addition, the space - and the people who hold it for you - are amazing. Annile and Matt are very knowledgeable about floating, and are also very friendly and great for a chat before or after your float. Speaking of which, the atmosphere is perfect for unwinding before your float, and reflecting afterwards. They have dedicated space for both with some of the best tea I've ever tasted on tap, free of charge, as well as the best little healthy snacks I've come across for a very nominal fee.If you've never floated, this is the place to take the dive. You won't regret it.

Complete Relaxation!. After a friend recommended Theta State Float Center to me I decided to go check it out. I can honestly say the whole experience was great - from the friendly welcome, to the pre chill out honey tea, and then the float itself was everything and more than what I expected. You can really feel yourself entering a deep state of relaxation, combined with your muscles unwinding from daily stresses. It feels great for your mind and body.There's so many reasons I would recommend this to people. It's a unique experience in itself but you can really feel the numerous benefits it gives your body. To top it off the staff were great and it really added to the whole experience!

Awesome place, atmosphere and experience. Having a float center in the middle of Bangkok (Sukhumvit 24 - right next to Davis hotel) is just fantastic!The place is cozy and well planned - with an initial reception area where a cup of herbal tea and introduction (for newbees) take place. There are 4 state-of-the-art float pods/tanks with soothing medation music, lights Etc. I quickly switched all that of to truly get into the "theta state" where magic happens mentally and physically.Besides the obvious mental/meditational and rest benefits - I find a float fantastic for recuperation from sports injuries, office back pain, posture and many other benefits.My first float was a great experience - but the following have been even better - so trying at least 2-3 times is recommended.Highly recommended for all!

Unique health and wellness benefits. It's a fact that meditation yields serious health benefits, but I personally just don't have the patience or ability to successfully meditate. But throw me in Theta State's float chambers, and I'm there! It's as if I experienced a weekend meditation retreat on a serene mountaintop--all after just one hour in the heart of Bangkok! I leave completely de-stressed, energized, and just feel great for about 3 days later. If health and wellness are important to you, do NOT miss Theta State!

Pure and utter Euphoria!. My visit to Theta State Float Center would be my first floating experience...but certainly not my last.After a warm greeting at reception I was treated to a hot cup of tea while the procedure was explained to me in detail, eradicating any confusion or fear, particularly for those nervous in water. The center has the interior of a spa, which for me, makes a huge difference. It separates Theta State from the hundreds of Thai massage parlours that are available and portrays itself, and delivers, as the next level of relaxation.During my float I fell into a trance like state which allowed me to have the most fantastic dreams. Floating through space, conversations with deceased grandparents and an unexplainable sense of happiness were among my favourite. I woke up with a huge smile on my face, feeling like I'd slept for days and a feeling of pure delight at my new discovery.I cannot wait to return!

Escape into the void of yourself. After a grueling 24+ hours of travel to Bangkok, I needed to get myself straight ASAP since my time in country was so limited and I didn't want to waste it napping in my hotel. I had the cab take me straight from the airport to Theta State to fliat away my jet lag. What a fantastic experience! The place is beautiful and the staff is very kind and knowledgeable. My float was not only relaxing, but it was energizing and completely killed my jet lag too! What a great way to start your holiday in Thailand!

A unique experience.. Often in life, because of the distractions around us - sights, smells, sensations, sounds - we fail to notice our experience in the world. When we float, we are met with an opportunity to observe ourselves, as we withdraw from the world of external experiences to draw our awareness within. The way we respond to our experience, through this hour-long journey home to ourselves, helps us become aware of what needs changing in our life. Learning more about ourselves - our habitual responses and thought patterns - is necessary if we wish to continue evolving as humans. We all wish to continue evolving as humans and this is why floating is helpful.

I love Theta State!. I had my first float upon arriving in Bangkok at the start of a 6 back packing week trip. It was my second time floating ever and this experience was much better than my first (in which I didn't really "get" floating and found it boring.) First of all, the facilities at Theta are slick. They've clearly put a lot of time into interior design and over all atmosphere upon arriving. You feel like you've entered into super galactic relaxation spa of the future. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and passionate about what they do. They are there to serve you tea, answer any questions you have, or just leave you the hell alone if that's what you're feeling. The float tanks are rad. They have amazing round white pods (that make you feel like an alien hatching from an egg) and rooms with high ceilings (which are great if you're claustrophobic.) Of the two I recommend the rooms. There are LED lights in all tanks that you turn off yourself to begin your float. If you use the room you'll experience a fun effect where you can see your silhouette against the light on the ceiling. I could have played around in there like that all day.My first float at theta was great for fighting jet lag. I also felt myself “letting go” in a way that I couldn’t seem to my first time floating back home. I enjoyed my experience here so much that I did it again when I came back around at the very end of my trip. The night before I had very little sleep and a long exhausting bus ride. The float was a perfect opportunity to reflect on the past six weeks. When I got out I felt relaxed and rejuvenated, like I had gotten a full nights rest. If you’re traveling through Thailand, I highly recommend sandwiching your experience with Theta state like I did.

Great First Experience!. This was my first trip to the Theta State Float Center and overall had a great experience. The staff was incredibly friendly; after telling one of the owners this was my first time floating, he helped explain what I should do, informed me of all the benefits of floating and even gave me a small tour of the facilities. The environment was very relaxing, the float itself was an experience quite like nothing else. I will definitely be returning to Theta State for another float soon. Thanks, guys!
